reviews.review: Lovely path for running or walking. If travelling to Budapest, I highly recommend spending some time strolling along the excellent paths along the Danube - either on the Pest or Buda side. Spectacular views!

Boat trip is a must. Take a wonderful boat trip to see Budapest from antoher perspective. Take a special sighseeing boat with audioguide, or by a ticket to regular boat, taht is a part of city public transport system and enjoy the trip from open deck, sipping sweet lemonade.
A great boat ride. A visit to Budapest would be incomplete without a river cruise, passing by the many attractions, including the Parliament and the Universities, under multiple bridges.
River of many sights. With so much tourist and commercial activity, I wondered about the purity of the waters. Long ships must get rid of waste and it goes into the river.
great walk. a walk along the danube and you will see a lot of Budapest giving you time to take in the views and bridges and I recommend a dinner cruise at night

Great to stroll alongside. This is a very pretty river that stretches a long way, and in Budapest, separates Buda from Pest. I love crossing between the two parts of the city via the bridges, as you can normally get a pretty good view of both Buda and Pest, especially at night. Along the river is a good strolling spot. :)

A very nice ride at night. It is a very nice experience at night and also very affordable if you are in Budapest. It is a short ride. You can have drinks while enjoying the great view of the city lights of Buda and Pest. It is a most.

Fab boat trip. We used the hop on service for an hour and it's a great way to see the City and important monuments/buildings.
Very impressive city and the trip went smoothly. You can get snacks / coffee / beer on board.
Some really quality buildings to see and history to hear about on the trip.
Highly recommended.

nice place for walking. very nice for walking before sun set
I was walking while little rain falling down
enjoy view of old building

A nice walk by the Danube River. The Danube is very nice and you can find many bridges which you can cross from the Pest City to Buda city and vice-versa. While having a nice stroll along the Danube admire the splendid buildings such as the House of Parliament, the Chain Bridge, The shoes by the Danube, Elizabeth Bridge, Margaret bridge and many more interesting monuments. You can have a boat trip either during the day or during the night and see the splendid buildings by day and by night. You can enjoy an unforgettable dinner cruise with folklore music. You'll find many cruises beneath St Elizabeth Bridge at many of the dock such as Dock 7 and Dock 11. Don't forget to take a jacket and an umbrella with you because showers will be expected.
Beautiful. Make sure you view the Danube from Budapest at night. The lit up parliament building, Castle hill, the bridges are a sight to see.

Night time Boat trip on River. We had one of the night boat trips as part of our City Tourist Bus Tour ticket. The trip itself took just over an hour and took us right up to Margaret's Island and back down to the big indoor market before returning back to the boarding pier near Elisabeth Bridge. Great fun and the city and it's building are beautiful all lit up - lots of photo opportunities. Take a jacket or jumper though - it gets chilly.

April Romantic Viking Danube River Cruise in April 2017 cancelled. My wife had been shopping for this cruise for over a year. This Spring she booked the cruise for April 2017. We made final payment in September. The third week in October she was notified by email that the cruise had been cancelled. No Reason other than operational changes. They took our money and never sent notice until this week (October 18th 2016). They booked her on a different cruise, different date and the cruise was advertised for less money. After repeated calls and emails the lady that sent her the notice replied she was not answering any emails on this matter. Viking????? More Like Pirates, Glad we found them out before we left. Addition hotel nights (non-refundable) and air fares charged fees to cancel. Beware. Chose a reputable company,

Viking River Cruise - Romantic Danube. We took the cruise the first week of October. The staff on the ship was very friendly and helpful. The food was good. The included tours were very good. The optional tours were also very good but a little pricey. All the local tour guides are trained and very knowledgeable. One tour that could be done on your own is the BMW tour. The BMW plant is 8 kilometers out of town. Group tours are done by plant employees for 8 Euros per person. Viking only provides transportation and pays for the tour. Taking a cab to the BMW plant and doing the tour would be cheaper. The onboard entertainment in the evenings was a bit disappointing.The flights provided by Viking were not the best. They had two connecting flights each way. We were able to upgrade the flights to one connection by paying an extra $50 each. Overall the cruise was good and we are glad we went.
Big River . It's a big river, looks cool, haven't seen all of it as it's rather long, but it's nice in Budapest and is spanned by impressive bridges. Looks bigger and clearer than the Tyne!
Cruise the Danube . Highly recommend taking a quick cruise on the Danube. Great way to see the city and places like the parliament, bridges and both sides of the city.

Disappointment After Disappointment!. The plus: the staff aboard the Atla were wonderful! The negatives: being misled by Viking about arrival times & what & when we would be able to experience each port city.Our Viking voyage turned out to be a BIG disappointment!! At our first port, Erlangen, we discovered that through no fault of Viking, one of the locks along the Danube River was broken. This resulted in spending extra time in Nuremberg then playing “catch up” the rest of the cruise. The delays caused us to be bussed to 2 destinations, one which took a total of 5 hours! Altogether we were delayed in 4 ports. We were docked in Regensberg for a short time, only to be picked up there. We MISSED KREMS ALTOGETHER!! We did finally catch up, at the LAST PORT, BUDAPEST!! Viking was going to substitute Melk Abbey as one of our excursions, again disappointment, further delays caused us to miss it. Instead we were given a talk by the Program Director about growing up in her home country!! Melk Abbey vs someone telling us about their childhood, REALLY!!!We were looking forward to seeing the Wachau Valley. We anxiously anticipated seeing the beautiful Wachau Valley. Our Costco agent told us the best place to sit & view it which we planned to do. Viking said we would go through the Wachau Valley around 8:00 pm. We did, we passed through in the DARK not being able to see anything because another delay!!!Next was Vienna where we were to arrive in the evening to see a concert and had planned to explore it at night. Again, further delays, we arrived the next day though we did get to see the concert that day. We’ve read about the water levels affecting travel on the Danube causing passengers to be bussed to their destination & excursions. However, we never read in any brochures that we would sail through locks on the Danube. It would be appropriate for Viking to make that clear in their brochures & travel information that this could also be a problem.As Viking has experienced delays because of water levels, my suggestion is that they would have activities like art, dance, photography classes available for passengers while on the ship.Viking was not honest or realistic about the entire trip resulting in disappointment after disappointment! When we were given update information, we were constantly told by Adina, the Program Director, “when given lemons, we should turn them into lemonade”!!! We were treated like children. Also, they did NOT want any questions raised because as soon as they finished talking, though hands were raised, they closed the meeting! We paid $6,600 for our dream vacation that never happened & felt we were brushed off by Viking customer service.
Wed 19 October. Strolled along river early part of the evening - there are many excellent views of a wonderful city!!

River Tour!. When visiting Budapest it is a must do to tour along the river Danube. I recommend visiting during the day and at night - if you have to chose between them book the night tour every time, this city is breathtakingly beautiful at night and for me it is even more beautiful than Paris.

Cruising the Danube. We were embarking on a riverboat cruise which began in Budapest so we knew we would be seeing a lot of The Danube. If you aren't on a riverboat cruise, I'd suggest one of the many tour cruises available. On our first night on ship, our riverboat took us up and down the river to see Budapest at night and it is beautiful. The bridges and the buildings on the river all look so different and are all lit up for the river traffic!

View upriver toward the chain bridge. There are a number of bridges crossing the Danube and all offer different perspective of Budapests river precinct... Walk along the banks across over for views of the waterway and the beautiful buildings and statues along its shore

Stunning views of lit-up buildings on the banks of Danube. We took a Danube dinner cruise, which lasted about 2 hours. The view was absolutely stunning and memorable. All the bridges (particularly the chain bridge, liberty bridge) and the both historical (Parliament, Buda castle, Fisherman bastion) and the modern buildings were colourfully lit-up. Something a visitor to Budapest should never miss......

River cruise. Are you thinking of doing a river cruise? Well, we finally decided to do one. Overall, it is a wonderful experience, but some cautions. Unlike oceanic cruises, there are no medical facilities on board: a doctor may be called at port and you can obtain OTC meds from pharmacies by walking/taxi and hopefully speaking to English-speaking pharmacist. Both my husband/I came down with bad colds. Bad enough that we felt unable to undertake excursions which we had booked online. Viking did not allow us to cancel for refunds. That being said, accommodations and food were superb. It is an incredible experience to float thru historical sites and just take it in.

Perfect spot for walkings. All along the Danube bank in Budapest, perfect spot for a walk during summer/Autumn nights. My favorite part starts in front of the Hungarian parliament, and if you're brave enough I will recommended to finish your walk near Bálna Terasz
Boat trip . It's a very bad experience I don't recommend it for anyone It's a waste of money and time No guide to explain what you are watching

Margarit Island. I stayed in a hotel in the Margerit Island where cars or buses are not allowed. The area is 2.5 km long and about 500 meters wide. In the middle of the island there was a huge park where you enjoy a good walk with a musical fountain that is operated every now and then.

Such a nice feeling!. We had a daily cruise ticket for Danube and we decided to use it during day time. It was a sunny day and a bit warm. We sat outside and we saw all the famous and important buildings of Budapest. There was a lady descibing to us what we see and explaining how and when all these buildings were constructed. I suggest to have a tour, there are many companies in the docs and u can choose the best for u!

A must for early moring run!. We ran along the banks of the river every morning. There are pedestrian and cycle tracks along either side. Even though there is quite a lot of traffic - crossing the roads is no problem as the motorists are extremely considerate! The River is a must see for everyone - with reasonable boat trips, day and night.

CAREFUL WHAT YOU PAY FOR.. Having cruised the Rhine section of the Budapest to Amsterdam river cruise before, we were excited to have finally returned to do a tour from Prague to Amsterdam. We had used Avalon waterways for the Rhine cruise but timings on this trip had us try Scenic River Cruises. We had used Scenic many years ago and service and standards were fantastic. We were excited to use Scenic again. What a BIG MISTAKE!The Prague extension was very over priced and we had to endure a day long coach ride in a coach provided by a third party to Budapest. The seats in the coach were simply too small for me. I had to sit side-saddle. I have long legs and big feet but I am only 6' 2.5" tall. If only this was the issue. Our real problems were only about to begin. Shortly after boarding we were advised that another vessel had hit a lock and there might be some delays. Unfortunately there were massive delays. This was not Scenic's fault but it is what they did next that beggars belief. We were holed up in the small town of Komarno waiting for news. The first whole day we were offered a coach trip into Bratislava. Almost four hours on the same coach for about 1.45 hrs in town. The next offering was to pack up the whole of our luggage and coach to Vienna an ordeal that had those who accepted that required huge coach miles and an approximately 17 hour day. Another coach marathon was offered for Salzburg. Once we were able to sail, our ship simply sailed past all the wonderful towns and cities on the river. We took this cruise because we cannot abide coach travel for long distances for health reasons. Scenic could not CARE LESS. Scenic offered a small gesture of a discount on the next cruise for every passenger. Even though quite a few of us advised Scenic that we could not do the coach, they ignored us. They did not make any real effort to provide alternatives to the coach marathons. We were confined to the ship as it strove to return to schedule. Instead of spreading the remaining days of the cruise between all destinations, Scenic chose to ignore us completely. Further communications with Scenic have been rebounded by the usual corporate fire wall.To really add insult to injury, we did not recognise much at all in Scenic's offerings that justified the high premium price. We were not compensated for the included excursions that we missed. We were not compensated on a pro-rata basis for the extra amounts that we paid for a premium cabin. We flew business class so even our cost to participate was higher, flights booked through Scenic! NOTHING!The talk certainly does not match the walk. Huge claims about PERSONALISED service are simply not matched with actions. Things like a fully stocked and replenished mini bar are really a nonsense when all drinks are included anyway. The so called butler service was of absolutely no value to us. The food offered was quite un exceptional, even when a special request was made in advance at the specialty restaurant, it was totally ignored.We travel to enjoy the journey as well as the destinations, for us the decisions that Scenic River Cruises made turned an unfortunate incident into a complete disaster.

Stunning scenery, highly educational, culinary delight travelling on a River Cruise ship. Our small group of 6 very active seniors spent 8 days on a Uniworld River Cruise ship on the Danube from Budapest Hungary to Passau Germany. Highly recommended itinerary with fabulous local guides for cities such as Budapest, Bratislava, Salzburg, Linz, Vienna, Wachau Valley, Passau. This company knows how to broaden the experience for the varied interests and physical fitness of its guests at every stop. Worth looking into. This was our 3rd tour with this company. Not cheap but most memorable.
take the hop-on-hop off bus boat. take whatever boat you can to get out on the Danube River. It is gorgeous, as are the building you can see from the river
night cruise along the Danube. We booked a night cruise on the Danube, we saw some beautiful sights, all the main attractions lit up looked amazing, a sight not to be missed

Very picturesque . Budapest like a lot of European cities is built around the river.
Lots going on in the area and superb views

Great views of Budapest. The Danube is pretty much a river. What is has going for it is it goes through Budapest, Bradislava, Vienna etc. Through Budapest the views of the city are spectacular in the day but even more spectacular at night. Take a river sightseeing cruise. It is well worth it.

A Must visit in Budapest. Now if you in Budapest you just can't not see danube its like going to Paris and not visiting the Eiffel tower, i woukd even suggest dining on one of the many resturants in Danube during the evening its a lovely experience

What more can I say, it's the Danube!. Wow oh wow! What a beautiful river right through the heart of the city, with Buda on one side and Pest on the other. Walking across one of the bridges is a sheer delight. You will see great buildings of power and beauty on each side. Despite the fact that this is a large city, there are also surprisingly large green spaces along the river, and if you look further down it you will see forested areas. Tons of nice little cafes and bars line the riverbank serving tasteful and inexpensive food and drink, and they fit in perfectly with the scenery and surrounding architecture.

Lovely trip. Taking a trip on the river is a must.....you can see much more than you can from the bus trips and just walking around.....you pass the most beautiful buildings and monuments and also Margaret Island and of course pass under the famous bridges.....the on board commentary was very informative....drinks and snacks are available too
Blue Danube?. A busy waterway flowing through the capital, from expensive hotel boats to dirty tramps pushing cargo. maybe it is the blue Danube in Vienna.....

Fabulous Feature.. The Danube is the main draw card to Budapest, with so much happening on or near it. If you come to. Budapest, try and stay as close as possible to the river, as walking along the promenade, especially on the Pest side, is so nice.
Fantastic at night. A cruise along the Danube at night is magical. The buildings are illuminated and look like a fairy land.

Scenic River Cruise - on the Jasper - Trip of a Lifetime. We took Scenic Cruise's "Jasper" from Amsterdam to Budapest - a 15 day excursion. It was flawless in every facet. Staff was amazing. Ship was modern and spotless. Meals were outstanding. And, truly, their notion of "when you board, put your wallet away" was so true (other than special laundry and spa service which were VERY affordable). All rooms had a balcony that added a bit more space. The room amenities included wifi, music stations on TV when you couldn't stand CNN or BBC anymore (!), walking sticks for shore excursions, bathrobes, slippers, free mini-bar and snacks that were restocked daily, butler service for early morning coffee (or b'fast) and the shore excursions were amazing. and one could do them - or not. It was a "do as you wish" vacation. We took it all in as we may never pass through those amazing cities again - but down the Rhine, through canals, across the Danube (what direction were we going??) and lots and lots of locks which were utterly fascinating. each time off the ship encouraged use of listening devices to hear local guides - OR to tap into another program and do you own thing with a built-in GPS! OR get off the ship and hop on one of their e-bikes and explore on your own (again, with GPS) Great local entertainment in various ports - off and on the ship - NO complaints and we're already looking at where we want Scenic to take us next. Looking at Russia!

Evening cruise on the Danube.. We had a beautiful evening cruise on the Danube, with excellent weather and a full moon. It was great to see Budapest at night. The boat also featured a narrated video of the history of Budapest and one free drink.
Great way to get a different perspective on Budapest. There are numerous cruises you can do each offering a different perspective on the cities of Buda and Pest and some of its amazing architecture.
Started our river cruise from Budapest. Stayed 2 nights at the Chain Bridge Soffitel before embarking on our River Cruise to Neuremberg. Vibrant area with plenty of river trqaffic

A scenic boat ride along the Danube is a good way to see the skyline. the beat way to to see this part of the Danube is to take one of the many boat river cruises offered either by day or night .In winter I would suggest a late afternoon cruise and a night one in summer
Night trip. Worth a trip down the Danube at night to view Budapest lit up. Good commentary & a glass of wine/champagne made it a very pleasant trip
Good but cold. This was a lovely trip along the Danube with the guide explaining everything. But on the top deck it was a bit cold.

Emerald Dawn on the Danube. We traveled from Budapest to Nuremberg on the Emerald Dawn during the middle of Sept. What a fantastic trip! The stops and tours in each stop were excellent and well organized. The embarkation and debarkation of this riverboat is so nice and simple compared to the large ocean ships. The staff were all excellent, the ship was so clean and new. The highlights were: cruising through the Wachau Valley (the optional bike tour was also a highlight for my husband), the lunch at a local Slovakian families home, and the meals which were exceptional. Although we were delayed in getting into Nuremberg and this meant we landed about 30 min. from the city, the Cruise Director made sure that everyone got to where they needed to get to by quickly organizing new transportation options.

River Cruise. Did an eight day river cruise starting and finishing in Budapest which is a delightful city. The only negative was the lack of interesting scenery along the river, but plenty of trees !!

Lovely for a cruise by day but especially by night. My friends and l bought tickets on the Big B Bus which gave us 48 hours unlimited travel around the city plus a day and a night cruise on the Danube. At €25 this was amazing value and the cruises on the Danube were spectacular, especially at night. To be recommended.
Lovely Boat Trip. We went on a boat trip with the drinks option! 2 hours long and only cost 5,200 HUF. Really nice romantic night as went at 7pm! Worth a visit

Must do. The moonlight cruise with dinner was superbly done and reasonable value, all things considered. Food was excellent but watch what you are doing with the "free drinks" not all options are free. Turned out my large beer was extra albeit not explained at time!

Danube for "free". If U bought 24 or 72 hours public transport ticket U can use Danube river trains for free in working days. It's great option for sightseeing. There are two lines. The only problem is that there are public transport working with a schedule. So, check before stops, routes and times. U can find in internet. There are bars at ships but if U have own wine bottle there is not a problem...

Champagne Cruise. To best enjoy the Danube, wander down the shore and check out the various boat cruises. Most are around £10 per person and offer drinks with the ticket price, and will have audio tours. Many of the cruises also drop you off at Margitsziget Island and collect you later on as well. If the weather is good, sit on the open air top decks, otherwise inside is warmer but views are still as good.

Colossal river. Danube river is the longest river in European Union region, located in Central and Eastern Europe , rises in The Black Forest of Germany and flows through or along the borders of 10 countries - Aaustria, Slovakia, Hungary, Crotia, Serbia, Romania, Bulgaria, Moldova and Ukraine, before emptying into the black sea. Take a Budapest cruise , relax onboard elegantly and see the charming and exciting city at night, magnificent architecture, spectacular landscape. Just sit, dine, enjoy.
Not blue. Flowing through the centre of Budapest, the Danube is a good viewing platform for seeing the sights of Budapest.

River Trip Ok. Did a boat trip which was ok and was dropped off at Margaret Island. Had to wait on the Island over 2 hours before we could get a boat back we were bored after about 10 minutes, as not much to see.

Danube the heart of Budapest. The flowing Danube separates hilly Buda from the flat Pest .Watch the Danube cruises go by on a sunny day or visit the Margerit island ..a 2.5 km by 1.5 kms green cover with musical fountain

As good as it gets. What a magnificent river, what a magnificent short stretch between Margaret and Freedom Bridges. No where in the world is there a better display of lighted historical architecture than the night time Danube river cruise.

Christmas River Cruise. Christmas Markets! Budapest to Nuremberg to Prague on Ama Waterways. Wonderful markets all along the Danube. Melk Abbey a must see. Ama is top notch, good food and wine. Loved Nuremberg old town. Spent an extra 4 days in Prague which is an incredible city and has a wonderful Christmas Market. I've also cruised the Rhine during Christmas. Both rivers are very different. I preferred the Rhine for scenery and markets if I had to chose between the two. If you don't have to choose, do both!!
Boat tour. Love the public transport by water, we did this daily in Budapest during our stay. It feels like a holiday within a holiday.

Danube . Lovely to walk along during the day. You get to see so many beautiful buildings along the way. We did a night time river cruise which was great. I'd recommend doing this at the beginning of your trip as then you can plan in extra places to visit that you may not have known about

SMOOTH AS THE DANUBE RIVER ITSELF. Our Viking River cruise from Budapest to Nuremberg was as smooth as glass. From the minute we checked our bags in Dallas till we left the river boat 8 days later, Viking did a perfect job! Everything and every place was on time.... I consider it a first class experience all the way. When we arrived at out boat in Budapest our cabin was ready and in perfect order. We had a french balcony which was perfect for us. Our cabin was on the middle deck next to the reception desk. This location is most desirable because it was handy to the dinning room, stairs and just steps away fro the reception desk where you could always get quick and accurate answers to everthigs as well as be first in line to go on tours.,,,,Most handy!The food was very good..........some dishes were better than others. All presented nicely. The service staff was most efficient and very friendly to fill any special request.--Which they did for us on many occasions. Our cabin was well laid out, but small, as you would expect. You get the hang of how to use it by the second day. The bath was quite nice and shower bigger than you expect and very nice. We rarely use the big flat screen TV, but it was there. Fresh bottle water twice a day. Turned down service each evening.The included tours were ok. Only a surface introduction to each city. Extra cost tours were probably better and more culturally in depth. There was a balance between cruising the river and site seeing in the cities. The schedule seemed to very well planned. Wish for more time in the cities....It was our experience that Viking delivered on their advertisement of the Danube River cruise for us.
A must do a tour at night. I strongly recommend to do a night boat tour when it's dark. The city is nicer in the dark since all the important buildings are lighted.

Public transport trip a leisurely Danube experience. By the end of seven weeks in Europe we were exhausted. On our last day in Budapest we brought a river transport (think 'water taxi') ticket and sailed down the Danube then back up. It was so relaxing. The river is huge and the scenery is fairly ordinary, but it was just what we needed and it was nice chatting with other travelers along the way.

Boat trip. Took a boat trip along the Danube as part of our 'Big Bus Tours' ticket. Really beautiful and you can have something to eat and drink on the tour. There are lots of other boat trips doing tours here too.
Swindon on the Danube.. Brill' 90min tour on the Danube on a glorious day. Booked quayside and no problem getting aboard early to wait for time of trip.

Lots to see.. A wander alongside the Danube river is not to be missed, terrific views, all famous sights of Budapest to see, Parliament, castle, bridges. Selection of restaurants and bars.A boat trip whether short sail under the bridges or one with dinner is well worth it especially at nights, wrap up warm.

the heart and soul of the city. Winding its way between Buda and Pest it is the focal point of the city...not really blue but still where everyone goes at some point. Best viewed from the Castle district or from crossing on foot on the bridges.

Short cruise on the Danube.. We boarded the boat at the Elizabeth bridge for our trip along the Danube. It sailed along the Pest and Buda sides passing various places of interest en route. It stopped three times in all for people to spend more time in a specific place e.g. Margaret Island. Drinks and snacks could be purchased on board and there was a commentary when passing anywhere of interest. The only downside was the really loud, intrusive music inbetween the commentary which totally spoilt the lovely relaxing ambience of the river.

Centre of Budapest. We have seen Budapest both in day time and by night. Danube River which bisects the city into Buda and Pest played a very important part to Budapest particularly in the tourism aspect. River cruising along the river was highly recommended because you could have good views on both sides, taking photos and lishening to the briefing by local guides. There were many floating restaurants alongside the river apart from the beautiful structures alongside River Danube. Highly recommend to others on this tourist spot.
Amazing. To navigate through Danúbio and see both sides of Budapest city is a very nice and pleasant experience which you can have another point of view of the city. Loved The experience
A must is a cruise on the Danube. We did a dinner cruise at dusk and enjoyed the buffet, music and lights at night. A delightful evening.

Budapest by night. I gave this 4 stars because the view from the river was well worth it. We did a dinner cruise with the dueling pianos. The dinner was OK but the piano music, for 2 hours was too much. Just find a nice quiet cruise if possible.
Danube. There are planty possible cruises, doh there are expensive. The publicznych comunication card alows the trips line D12 D11 D13, definitly the cheap version

The heart of Budapest. The River Danube which splits Buda & Pest but also unites the city as well. Better than the Rhine more classic than the Nile. Superb day or night with magnificent views on either bank. Wonderful
Incredible Danube River!. Recently spent a long weekend in Budapest, a must is a walk via the Danube, there are plenty of bridges to cross over, great views, also looks amazing at night.

Beautiful Blue Danube!!. 6 of us from the states took a Viking Tour on the Romantic Blue Danube. A trip we shall always remember.We started in Nuremburg through Austria and ending in Budapest.The Danube is more green than blue, we were told due to limestone. But the Beautful Blue Danube made a better song!It is a slow "lazy" river. Each spot had it's own unique and beautiful view. It was enoyable at night, going the the locks and sitting on the top deck during the day. As well as, enjoying meals as the we cruised down the Danube on our boat.Just a wonderful way to enjoy several days of our summer. It is peacful, relaxing and restorative!!

Night time cruise is amazing!. We took a night time cruise on the Danube river. The views were amazing. The Buda Castle on the hill was lit up and very picturesque. The parliament building was completely lit up and there were seagulls circling above and from a distance they looked like fire flies over the complex. One of the most amazing sights I have ever seen. There a many unique buildings you pass along the way and many are lit up with multiple light schemes and patterns. Absolutely worth doing!!

great experience. We booked a 2hr drinks only cruise with live music. This was a good option as we had waiter service on the boat which meant that we didn't have to miss the lovely views along the river. The 3 musicians played a good selection of both popular and classical music
Wonderful to see and sail . We sailed up the Danube in a River boat and I have never had a better vacation with such spectacular views. Everyone should do this.

Who doesn't love a walk along the river?. The Danube dominates much of the scenery within Budapest. No matter which side you are on you will be able to navigate your way around Budda and Pest by the river. There are some wonderful views from the hills of the river and the lower level city and we were lucky enough that the weather was perfect whilst we were there making for some rather romantic sunsets over the bridges.
Cruise. Take the cruise on the river during night. All attractions of Budapest along river give beautiful view.

Cruise booked through hotel. We booked a cheap coffee and cruise via the hotel and met up out side St Stephens Bacillica very well organised but no tour guide on the boat you are left to is which is better for the experience, managed to order some goulash online also.

The Magic of the Danube. It is a must to take a boat trip on the Danube whilst in Budapest. The evening boat trips, in the dark , are something not to be missed and are quite magical with all the buildings beautifully lit up.

Low water level. Great idea.you land in center of town,no busing or waiting yTo see things,however if the water level is low,then you are in trouble.took a Danube cruise 2015 sept,water level low,change ships became a boat,bus tour

It's not about the river, it's about what's on either sides of it. River Cruise is a must!. While walking along the Danube, we saw the most beautiful sites.At night on the cruise, we saw such beautiful pieces of architecture lit up beautifully and that was breathtaking!

Let your "self" cruise on Danube along with stars. I was pretty reluctant as I had no idea about the night cruise but it proved fruitful rather then futile. You can see the city wearing the gown of lights, completely amazing experience it was.

Beautiful at night. Make sure you go on the river cruise at night it's a beautiful city at night all lit up.Get the ticket for the hop on hop off bus which you get the river cruise with it also, you can buy this for 2 days.
A night cruise is a must. We took a boat cruise at night on the Danube. The city lights are a must to be seen from the river. The bridges and buildings are lit up and highlighted.Very romantic.

Do a night river cruise! It's beautiful!. The Danube River is beautiful at night. All the buildings & bridges are lit up allowing for great pics. We did a cruise at dusk and once night hit everything was lit up and it can also be very romantic. The cruise we took gave complimentary water, soft drinks or wine.
Night Cruise. We did a night cruise by Eurama Travel Agency. It was beautiful to enjoy drinks on the deck while watching the lit up city.
Must see at night. This is beautiful!!!! We walked along the river and also took a boat tour during the day. I would also recommend it in the evening.
Best to be on it for the views. This is a busy commercial river. We used it for the tour boat and to see the views of the city from the river. The view OF the river from shore is blasé.

Not the Blue Danube but still amazing. A walk along the banks on either side of Buda or Pest is highly recommended, you'll take in magnificent views of Parliament, the Castle Hill, several monuments and many churches, Equally rewarding at night and on a cruise boat.

Don't hesitate - you must take a cruise. It's a non-brainer, so pick a boat for hourly sailings or spring for a lunch or dinner trip.
The recorded narration (English and German on our boat) is informative.

Lovely evening stroll.. We walked along the Danube and stopped off for drinks along the way, it really is a must whilst here it is so pretty and you get to see great views of the city by night. The twinkling light's make it so romantic for couples.
The Danube or Tuna. A slow moving river connecting many beautiful cities of Europe from west to east.Gives life and joy to all the cities.

You, your family and Danube: a wonderful love triangle!. Imagine walking along the river side of this beautiful river, under the stars, with your wife and kids. An experience I will never forget. The family binds together while admiring the beautiful building along the two sides of the river and the birds flying around it. Time seemed to have stopped...Highly recommended...

An unforgettable river cruise on the Danube. We booked an AMA river cruise on the Danube starting in Vilshofen, Germany and traveled through Germany, Austria, Slovakia, and ended in Budapest, Hungary. We cruised on the AMAViola, a new ship this year. Everything was top notch from the ship staff to the local tour guides. The people were knowledgable, friendly, and very professional. We thought the trip was very well planned from start to finish. We will never forget the sight of cruising into Durnstein and Melk, Austria. Cruising on the Danube at night in Budapest was spectacular! May I suggest the second and third week of September. The weather was perfect.

A cruise on the Danube is beautiful. We had an evening cruise on the Danube through the hop-on-hop-off people. Very pretty boat with plenty of people on it. An understandable automated loudspeaker system pointed out the sights on the left on the right in English and in German. We were all pleased with the boat ride in the family. But what is it with Europeans and smoking cigarettes?
Famous River. We did a 1-hour cruise in the late afternoon. It was exciting to be on the Danube and to see the buildings/attractions from a different perspective

Great views!!!. We took the one hour boat cruise on the Danube River. Make sure if you want to do this, night time is the best with everything lit up. The audio presentation was very good. If you don't do any regular tours, I would highly recommend this to learn a lot in a short period of time.
Brown not Blue. Lovely stretch of water with plenty of boats and ships. Great to look over and enjoy the action. Good reflections of bridges and buildings at night.
Lovely!. It's a lovely river! It's well worth taking a cruise on the river. It leads way to many of Budapests best attractions!

Night experience. We cruised by night that was an inclusion on our tour, unfortunately we didn't get a very long experience as our bus driver couldn't find the access so our tour was cut very short. But what we did see was worth it

Night Cruise worth the time. Most of the key buildings and bridges are lit at night. We took cruise as part of hop on/off bus (City Sightseeing). Other hop on/off companies have something similar. Boat was crowded, but able to enjoy the views . Recorded and broadcast information about the sights was marginally helpful.
a must for a visit. to Budapest. The views of Budapest are stunning from the water and the commentary helps to understand the city and its history.
Clean and blue!. Don't really know how to review a river… it was clean, wide and certainly blue! Do walk the Chain Bridge to see the river in all its glory!

Tauck Swiss Jewel River Cruise. First rate. Perfect in every aspect. Staff, food, wine, music, cabins, itinerary, tour directors, and guides. Easy to see why Tauck Danube River Cruised have been voted best for the last three years.
Go at night. Lovely to sit and watch the boats go by. The best way to see the river is to go on a cruise at night. The bridges and floodlit buildings are stunning.

View this from many points around the city; and do a boat ride. Clearly the city river revolves around the city so any visit to Budapest should include viewing the river, walking along its banks, and river cruises. A daylight rivercruise is a good way to orient yourself so that you can plan your various excursions. And an evening cruise is just stunning as the city and all the buildings are lit. There are many operators and it seems highly competitive so I cant suggest any particular operator. All the cruises we selected included commentary but whatever cruises you choose I suggest one that has individual headphones; we went on a few, some with headphones and one with commentary over loudspeaker: the one with commentary through loudspeakers was barely audible.

A Busy & scenic Waterway. We commenced our Danube cruise in Budapest with APT on the Amaverde and discovered that the Danube is a very scenic and busy river.We were able to view some of the magnificent buildings in Budapest that we had seen during our shore visit.There were many river cruise ships also there and we would encounter these from time to time further upstream. The Danube at this point is broad and from the upper deck of the cruise ship we had the opportunity for a good view of the impressive Parliament House and the Castle and Fisherman's Bastion.

Best Viewed at Night. We took a day trip from Vienna to see this beautiful river based on the reviews of family and other Trip Advisor travelers. Big mistake to drive - the roads are as narrow as sidewalks, cars were parked on the sidewalks making the narrow roads even worse, the traffic was heavy everywhere and parking is limited to only three hours; certainly not enough time to get out and explore the area. While the Danube is a very pretty bluish-green, it is best seen at night when all the lights from the city are lit up - either by taking a river cruise or by sitting on the stairs that lead down to the banks lining both sides of the river.Budapest itself is divided into two parts: Pest side is poor and dirty, Buda side is nicer but still dirty. We had a hard time finding people who spoke English. A few places will take euro but most want payment in HUF. Attractions and views on both sides are same as in other European cities.If you are venturing out to see this famous river, plan accordingly or you will be disappointed.
great. This was a great boat trip and enjoyed the ride and took loads of photos and it help that we had good weather.
A large polluted river. It looks much like any other large polluted river. It is pleasant to walk along the riverbanks, but the water isn't especially beautiful.

AMA waterways Danube. Just back from 14 day disaster . Ship was 50 hrs behind because of lock problem, so we were bused through first 5 days very rushed. Service excellent, food good wine very bad! Also everyone was sick and nothing mentioned as precautions. Had a balcony seldom used as you are tied up next to another boat all the time, it was a waste of money. I should also mention the age of the group very old!

Danube River Cruise. The river cruise is a must when visiting budapest. The normal price is 9 euros. we brought a 48hour city sightseeing tour which included 2 river cruises. I suggest taking the cruise late evening when the lights are lit up and the city looks more beautiful. The views of the parliament and chain bridge is truly stunning at night time from the cruise. Beer and other drinks are quite reasonable on the cruise.
Danube. The view of the Danube is most beautiful from Budapest. Take the No 2 tram and ride along the river. You will have great view of the Buda side plus parliament.

Cruise in the evening on the Danube. So glad we did this! One of our group suggested this and made the arrangements through our hotel. A quick taxi ride to the dock and we were on the water in no time. Your ticket includes audio (in 30 languages) about the river and history in Budapest plus a free welcome drink. This was a nice way to experience the river. The sites are lit up at night and are more beautiful then during the day...almost magical. The next day we enjoyed walking along the river, crossing at the Chain Bridge, and eating at one of the cafes along the river.

A must if you visit Budapest. We went on an evening dinner cruise. The food wasn't great but the scenery was fantastic. At night the buildings along side the Danube are lit up providing a spectacular view.
Beautiful and historic. It's lovely to take a walk along the river as the sun sets, just stunning. We walked along there on our last night in Budapest, what a beautiful memory to have.
Amazing!. The view here is amazing and there are a lot of cruises you could take, there is even a club on a ship!

The river that divides (and unites) Buda & Pest. My cruise (with Emerald) started in Budapest with the Emerald Dawn moored opposite the Parliament building, what a fabulous location. Sadly I didn't have too long in the city having arrived late on the Saturday & we sailed off after lunch on the Sunday. Would love to go back and explore it properly one day.

Surprise Cruise. We took the public ferry from Margaret Island to the Elisabeth bridge because the bus was not running. It was a most fun trip. Very few passengers, plenty of stops on both sides of the river affording best views and it was free for seniors.

Take a boat cruise. The Danube dividing Buda and Pest is quite a sight to see . Would recommend taking a boat cruise both during the day and at night . If you do the Hop On Hop Off bus tour , a day and night boat cruise is included . Actually these boat cruises are the best part of Hop On Hop Off bus tour .
Danube River. Heart and sole of Budapest. We took both a day and night River cruise and they were one of the highlights of our stay in Budapest.

Uniworld Enchanted Danube River cruise. We just returned from a cruise from Budapest, Hungary to Passau then a few additional days in Prague, Czech Republic. The river is calm and beautiful. The experience with Uniworld was first class all the way. The locks were damaged so our river experience was cut short. We were bussed to our destination cities and had to forego a couple of key stops. They were generous and professional throughout. Veronika was our tour and activities director. She was nothing short of amazing in the throws of hysteria with disgruntled passengers making all kinds of threats. I can't wait to take our next trip with Uniworld. I know it will be the best of all the river cruise companies.
A trip on the river. Very enjoyable and very relaxed. Always enjoy a boat trip. We did the trip very much on the spur of the moment. Drinks and commentary were provided in all languages.

The Danube at Budapest. The Danube is a lovely sight, especially when the bridges are lit at dusk. Many of the buildings are also lit, especially the Parliament building on the Pest side and the Castle and St. Matyas Church on the Buda side. Taking a river cruise is recommended, either by day or by night. The photo opportunities are endless. All-in-all Budapest is a great place to visit, especially if you like wonderful architecture.

pleasant afternoon sit down. We did a 1 hour sightseeing trip on the danube which cost approx £10 including a drink. We had a huge tourist boat from the main booking office with only 7 people on it, but that did not stop the staff from running a really pleasant trip which took us past castle, cathedral and parliament which afforded great views. Was a good way to sit and rest your feet after a long morning of sightseeing

Great food, Fantastic Nightime Views, Little Expensive ?. Booked (Viator) the evening buffet on board the River Cruise which at £80 for 2 may be considered a little expensive, but on the basis that we may never get this experience again...went for it. Thankfully we located the meeting point in advance which turned into a treasure hunt but was a great way to see the area around the Basilica and talk to lots of locals ! If we had been told to find the Theatre as you approach the Basilica it may have been a lot easier and quicker. However from then on, it was very well organised and we went as a large group onto the boat. You are led to your table and some couples had a table to their own, we shared with another couple, which can be a lottery, but was fine. Views at night are fantastic and made for some great photos. Food is buffet style and well presented and good quality and a chance to try local Hungarian dishes. Music was provided by a small group led by an amazing violinist who later worked their way around each table and did favourite requests. Very enjoyable evening and would recommend it if your budget allows.

Had to be there every day!. Walking along the Danube and taking in the lovely scenery and views of the city is an important part of a visit to Budapest. Please don't miss a night cruise down the river when all of the important buildings are illuminated in all of their glory. Hopefully you will be embarking on a riverboat cruise up the river to Prague on AMA as I was. Trip of a lifetime!
Stunning river.... Took a boat trip on the danube and was in awe of the river and surrounding scenery and architecture.

Travelmarvel! Couldn't wish for anymore.. I can whole heartedly recommend travelmarvel. They are a little less expensive than some of the other companies but you couldnt wish for better. The whole experience was wonderful.  The meals were 4 courses for lunch and dinner with unlimited wine and beer during meals. I often had the cocktail of the day before dinner which was only €4.50 for eg Pina Colada. The walking tours in each port were informative and very good. Really liked the tour in Nurenburg and climbed the Castle at Durstein. Loved the concert in Vienna but it was really a private concert just for our group. The wait staff and house maids were mainly from Eastern Europe and were amazing. Rooms were done twice a day (once a day would have done). We took the bicycles out twice and this was one of the reasons I chose Travel Marvel.The only thing that could have been better was the weather and that was my fault as our boat left 25th April and it was much too cold. I had imagined i would be sitting on top of boat as we cruised down the Rhine. In fact we had to stay inside and just run out for a quick photo due to the cold. You can see from inside the bar area. You must go June July August Sept.
Great night lights. Take a river cruise of the Danube in Budapest, feels like Christmas with all the beautiful buildings lit up!

really beautiful for a stroll, run or dining overlooking it. This river is beautiful and if you can try and get a bar or restaurant overlooking it. You can watch people walk and run past as well as the ships gliding past. It is even more beautiful at night. Not to be missed.
Can Not Be Missed. A dinner cruise on the Danube is not a treat that can be skipped. The view of both sides of the city are magnificent.
Big river. Big river = cruises Obviously you can rude up and down the river is you so wish.Best to see at night or dusk Princess are decent; olso depending on the season.

Breathtaking scenery. We sailed the Danube to Budapest as part of our cruise from Amsterdam. Beautiful scenery everywhere - vineyards perched high on the hill top terraces, medieval castles and cobble stoned villages. A fabulous way to see these parts of Europe.

Great sights. We spent a lot of time on the banks of the day be as we were at the sziget festival on sziget island. We hot the boat to the festival and bsck one day which was great as we got to see all the sights along the river by day and by night. The houses of parliament at night are a must see!

Not to be missed. one of the obvious site to visit when in Busapest,although river cruise is very popular these days, I would recommend solo walk during morning hours, its peaceful ,hence njooi the serenic ambience

River cruise down the Danube on Lord Byron. Excellent accommodation and catering with amazing views of Budapest at night. The week long cruise was care of Riviera Travel who we have travelled with before. They are excellent and have very good itineraries and the guides are first class. Would not hesitate to recommend the cruise or Riviera who are first class.

The Danube, Budapest's diamond. You will enjoy in Budapest every minute both along the river and on the river too. The bridges connect in harmony the two different part of the town, the hilly and more historical Buda and the flat and more vibrant Pest. But if you will enjoy both sides in the same time take a boat! A hidden suggestion: try the Dry Martini party boat! It's amazing!

Spectacular views of Budapest from a different angle. Head to the river and take a boat for different views of the city, a relaxing drink and the chance to visit a different part of Budapest. We headed to Margerit Island, and despite the diesel smells on the boat we had a terrific time, saw many great sites and had a lovely walk on the island.

Majestic. The river separates the "Buda" and "Pest" parts of the city. Large river about the size of the Ohio back in the states. It does not look very clean since it flows through densely populated areas. There are some very nice looking bridges that croos the rive and they are pedestrian friendly. There are also very nice walking paths, with benches to res and contemplate, on both sides of the river. The river looks even better at night when the bridges and boats are lit up.
Enjoyable river. Been on a one week Danube River Cruise. Very enjoyable river. Some areas have big city feel while others are very rural. Have not seen any industrial settings on the river.

A bit romantic. The Danube river goes trough many countries in Europe. Now it is not 'blue', but a bit dark. Anyway it is interesting to stay and watch it, specially from Buda hill and also from Pesta side. Perhaps will be nice to make a boat trip.

A very impressive river but its only a river. The Danube is without doubt a impressive large river but its just a river. Brown and fast following but there is always something going on it and around it and on it. Take it for what it is and then you can say you've don it....

Romanitic. If you are in Budapest, it does not matter if you are on the Pest side or the Buda side, the Danube is beautifully romantic. The water is moving very quickly. There are lots of boats. The scenes are relaxing, beautiful and magically. The Danube is a must see!
Run by the river. The Danube river is a long and wide one. There are a few bridges over it and running and cycling tracks.
Brown not blue Danube. Even although the river does not live up to it's name it is a lovely place to stroll along at any time of day.

"The Blue Danube". The piece of music, the blue danube gave me a very positive picture of the Danube river. I thought it was all utopian, blue, and beautiful. However, the water was grey and dull, and it completely ruined of my imagination of "The Blue Danube". We passed by the river quite a few times when we crossed the 2 sides of Budapest "Buda" and "Pest". Not the best place to visit if you've heard "The Blue Danube".

Danube of Budapest at Night is a Top 10. We where on a Uniworld Cruise and this ship went up and down a few times at night so we could take in the full Budapest at Night scene it is beautiful and one of the top 10 places to see at night in my opinion.

A boat trip to see the Danube. We bought tickets to see the Danube by boat. Well worth the trip and the Danube is much bluer in Budapest than in Vienna! A very enjoyable boat trip and you see the beauty of Budapest from both sides of the Danube. Don't miss out on a boat trip!
The Danube in afternoon sunshine.. We loved our river cruise sitting on the topmost part of the boat. The commentary was good. Refreshments were available.
Boat trip. As part of the bus tour it included a boat trip. The boat was ok the commentary was drowned out by the sound of the engine. Views great though

Viking Danube River cruise. Having turned 65, and never having taken a cruise, I was now obliged to do so. My wife and I chose eastern Europe, as we had not been there, and Viking, as it seemed to represent a good confluence of price and quality.We sailed on a one week cruise from Budapest to Passau, with a extra 3 days in Prague. The ship was the Vilhjam and we booked a Veranda Suite.OVERALL: Far exceeded expectations. ACCOMMODATIONS: Our room had a bedroom, small balcony, and a sitting area. The extra space - at extra cost - we thought was worth it, it gave us space to move around. A ship's single cabin is pretty tight. The ship itself was immaculate.FOOD: I had expect dinner buffet every night. Instead, we had a choice of light meals on one deck, which was essentially buffet, or waiter service in the main dining room, which most people opted for. The quality of the food was impressive: poached salmon, chateaubriand, pastas, steak, cheese plates, deserts, etc. During the week's voyage we did not experience "menu fatigue".STAFF: Obviously highly trained. Very efficient and friendly without being in your face. Viking knows its clients well [n.b., this is September, 95% of fellow passengers seemed to be north of 50, and 95% were from the US]. One could eat alone or sit with other folks. If you don't like to mix dinner and strangers, you need not be concerned. If you want to make life-long friends, the opportunity is also there. An example of efficiency: each morning when we returned from breakfast, our cabin was made up. It makes you wonder why many hotels insist on 4pm checkin.TOURS: Viking offers tours each day, some like the walking tour are both voluntary and included (i.e., free), others, like a Mozart/Strauss concert will cost extra. Regardless of tour Viking people are present. In fact from when your plane arrives, through the cruise, to getting departure boarding passes Viking has boots on the ground. My wife and I opted for a few short walking tours and otherwise explored on our own. Lastly, no hard sell on the fee-based tours.CITIES: Budapest was a delight and a gem of a city. At night it is lit up on both sides of the river. Bratislava a bit smaller but quite nice. Passau, Germany was an unexpected favorite. You can research the stops on your own. By the way you may also wonder if you can handle the three main languages spoken by the locals. Don't. Everyone speaks English, often better than the guys I work with. Every slogan T-shirt worn by passers-by was in English. And while having lunch in a Prague castle, Roy Orbison was being played in the background.ANY MINUS POINTS? Due to the popularity of river cruises, you won't be alone like Huck Finn rafting down the Mighty Miss. On a few mornings I opened the drapes to reveal another Viking ship moored, literally, two feet from by window. This is due to lack of docking space. But due to luck or good management, most of the time we had either a land or river view.Enjoy.
Danube by night is superbe. We left at 5pm '(September) and we stopped on Marageth's island (1,5 hour); on the way back, as the night did come, we say the parliament and the bridge's light. Unique !

Budapest from the water. After a bad experience with an attempted rip-off by a taxi (do NOT use Budapest taxis unless you're prepared to be ripped off or to argue with the driver) we decided to buy hop-on/hop-off bus tours. There are at least two such systems in operation. Sold by individual street sellers. Approx €24 per person. Not much to differentiate them apparently. The bus tours themselves were great but the best part was the inclusion of two boat tours per person. During the day was excellent (hot but luckily drinks available onboard) but the evening tour past the palace was the best, as the lighting at dusk made for superb photography. These are long boat tours so make sure you have the time for the various itineraries. Well recommended.

Amazing. Very worth taking a boat trip. There are plenty to choose from. We took the Legend one. Out tour guide booked it for us and we avoided the queue. It costed 19euros per person and took the 8.15pm one. The trip takes about one hour. Wonderful views. We were given a drink on the boat and had headphones to listen to the documentary that was accompanied by visuals shown on monitors while we were enjoying the outside views.
Beautiful River!. This is such a romantic and amazing sight. I was quite grateful to be there. I felt really lucky. The atmosphere is so awesome!

Probably one of the best cities to enjoy the Daube. The Danube runs through the heart of Budapest splitting the city In two...Buda and Pest. There are lovely views on either side of the river and cruising up and downs a must.

Absolutely Perfect. We took the Viking Danube Cruise early September 2016 from Budapest to Nuremberg. Everything was perfect - the ship, the food, the places we visited and, of course, the outstanding staff on our ship,the Viking Gullveig. We spent 4 days in Budapest before we set off on the cruise and it was nowhere near long enough as Budapest is a wonderful, friendly city with lots to see and do. En route we visited Vienna, Regensburg, Passau and ended in Nuremberg. Viking lay on lots of included guided tours at each stop and we only paid for one additional event, the Strauss/Mozart event in Vienna. On board, the main restaurant has tables seating 6 or more, so every meal we seemed to be meeting new people. Will we be booking a cuise with Viking again? Of course we will as this was up there with the best holidays we have ever had.
Great views of the city. Take the public ferries approximately 2GBP per person.You will see as much of the city views as you would taking one of the more pricey tourist boat cruises.

MUST MUST MUST DO!. As we flew back home form our 4 day visit in Budapest, my wife and I agreed that the highlight of the trip for us was the dinner cruise we took. There are many different boats you can take, but I believe most serve the same type of dinner and have the same basic music/entertainment. My advice is skip the goulash and music and just grab your favourite beverage and head up to the top deck and marvel at the view. The city at night is absolutely amazing. Forget Paris....Budapest is the new "City of Lights"

Scenic river separating the Buda from Pest. It's a beautiful experience to see the Danube in Budapest. You can cross the Chain Bridge and take a magnificent panoramic shot of the Danube and the attractions between the two areas in Budapest. You can take a river cruise to see the stretch of Danube and enjoy fine dining too.

The heart of Budapest. A day and a night cruise are a must during the visit to Budapest. We enjoyed very much the night cruise with dinner and open drinks. We watched folkloric dances and heard live music and songs.

Get my teeth sorted . Second visit to Budapest to have dental treatment with SODC. Very good treatment with highly skilled dental team. City is very interestingThings to do Lido on Margarite Island well worth a days it. Don't waste you money on the synagogue. Expensive to get in and not much to see.Public transporters good.Another day out is to idiot Vienna. 2.40hrs on the train. About £30 return. Coming back next June.

Big river - you can't miss it . The Danube is one of the world's greatest rivers. There is much going on along it's shores. Cruise ships have taken over in recent years, but you can still walk along the river and get great views of the opposite bank.
Boat Ride down the Danube. Boat ride was fun and relaxing, but if you have only a limited amount of time I'd recommend doing something else

In the evening you walk and you dream!. This is one of the best sides of Budapest, to walk on the banks of Danube. To see the bronze shoes of the Jewish who were killed there. To think how many times the city has been occupied, destroyed, to imagine the kings, to see the Chain Bridge, to have some fresh air and fresh thoughts. I suggest the walk to everyone!
Definitely worth it!. We got student passes for our holiday in Budapest and a friend told us we could go on a boat ride with them. Such amazing views. Would definitely recommend.

Romantic. It is a very nice river. there are 10 bridges that crosses it. It is great anytime of the day. It is great however to go in the boat at night. The lighting of budapest is amazing to be seen at night through a night cruise.

You may even Swim there :). I was privileged to do the IronMan 70.3 in Budapest and SWAM in a closed part of the Danuble. it is very relaxing. Take the public transport ferry till the end and back. it is very relaxing, but watch out of the operation hours.

A night time cruise is best.. Be sure to enjoy a night time cruise to really enjoy Budapest. We booked a wine cruise with Duna Koncert. It was a really nice way to see the city and enjoy wine in a comfortable atmosphere.

Boat trip. We took a pizza and beer boat trip on the river. This was a 90 minute trip and we upgraded to have unlimited pizza and beer. We sailed from riverside down to Margaret Island and after leaving the island, pizza was served. It was very filling indeed and we could not eat more than 1 pizza. We sailed from the island, heading back south on the river and during this time a full commentary was given in English about the history of the buildings and the city. Sailing the river is a great way to see the Palace and Parliament. We had a fantastic day.
Budapest by night. Experience sightseeing boat trip by night, Parliament, Margitsziget, Gelert Hotel, Lánc híd, Fisherman Bastion

The heart of Budapest. You can't avoid the Danube while in Budapest. You'll cross it when visiting the palace over in Buda, you'll sail along it on a cruise, you'll walk along side it while viewing parliament. There's a lot to do and see all along the Danube. We never went on any cruises but we crossed 3 of the bridges and took plenty of photos by day and night while around the Danube.
Worth the boat trip. I had the boat trip as part of the big bus tour. It's worth the trip as you can view so much more of the 2 parts of he city from the river

Public boat trip. The easiest way to see the Danube is by river boat. There are loads of options out there but the simplest and cheapest way is via the public river boat which makes various stops along the way. You can cross under the rakoczi, patofi, Liberty, Elizabeth, chain and st Margaret's, bridges. There are more upstream however we didn't go that far. A 7 day pass is 16 euro. This also gets you unlimited travel on the trams, buses and metro. Just to put it into perspective I saw an advert for dinner and cruise at 40 euro.Let's face it, it's the same river and sites that you see!!! For 16 euro you can go up and down the river all day and at night if you wish to.The sites from the river are fantastic. Remember to take your camera.

Danube river Cruise. There are multiple companies doing Danube River Cruises and I highly suggest taking one of them. The cruises start at about 3500ft per person and go up from there depending on lenght and if food is included. We did the Coffee Cuise by 6 Bridges Dinner & Cruise Budapest. This was a nice 1.5 hr river boat trip with audio recorded guided tour in English. We could have saved some money if we realized that most of the Hop on / Hop off Tour bus companies (there are 3 of them) offer river cruises along with the 48 hr bus pass. Either way I think taking a river trip is a worthwile way to spend part of the day, as you get to see a portion of the city that cannot be seen except from the Danube. The river area is about 10°F cooler than the rest of the city, so it is worth brining a light jacket.

No longer blue but still beautiful. Budapest is the city that has the narrowest stretch of the Danube so has several beautiful bridges spanning the river. They have mostly been reconstructed after the last war, as are some of the beautiful buildings along its banks. There are several companies operating river tours but the most interesting bits are within a 5km stretch along the central district.

Loveliest and least jerky city river . You fall in love with the Danube there is something mystic about it. It's waters so clear unlike other rivers. I already miss it! Look at it at night win the city is lit like Paris!

Danube Legenda offers excellent trip. Would highly recommend the 80 minute boat trip offered by Danube Legenda just opposite the Marriott on the Pest side. The personnel were pleasant and the boat comfortable. Most impressive was the excellent audio tour which is offered at each seat in 30 languages. The audio was clear and informative. After approximately 60 minutes the boat stops at Margaret Islands and allows you to disembark to enjoy the quite park which is close but so far removed from the city chaos. The provide a detailed map of the island and allow re-boarding of a later boat an hour and a half later. The pice of the cruise includes a beverage on the outbound leg as well as lemonade during the return trip. Excellent views can be seen from either of the decks. Consider this a relaxing way to learn more about both Buda and Pest, while enjoying the views from a quiet and comfortable seat.

Go for the evening cruise. Stunning boat trip at night. Budapest seen from the river with all the lights a very special experience and totally different to a day time sail. Nice touch having an included drink.
River trip. The last time I was here the river was green, today gladly it has cleaned up greatly. The best way to see the city sites. Brilliant

Cruise the Danube at night .. Spectacular. The river Danube is beautiful, it follows the city centre, dividing Buda on the east (hills) & Pest on the west (I think). The building when lit up at night & breathtaking. My only critisim is the people hardly ever smile, very helpful, but no smiles.
2016 Vacation. Take a cruise day or night down the Danube river. Amazing view of the Parliament and the Buda castle. Free if you have bought the Hop-on and Hop-off Tour bus.
Breathtaking views. If visiting Budapest it is worth spending some time on a tour of the danube particularly at night as the surrounding views of the capital are excellent

Dock 8A Sightseeing Cruise. We had this as part of our travel package. The boat looked one of the smaller and older ones on the danube but the views and tour were fantastic. The boat had a nice bar so we could sit, relax and watch the city go by. This particular tour stopped off at Margaret island which is very convenient. The ticket was also valid all day, so we came back and did the cruise again to see the beautiful city and buildings lit up at night. Make the most of the river, its worth getting a river cruise to enjoy it.

The River Danube.. It is a very beautiful river with lovely sights to see all along its banks. Lots of river cruises, cruise along to Prague and Vienna.Or you can take a ferry tour along, can have dinner by the edge or on a river boat. Most hop on off buses include a free tour for an hour. Lowly on a hot day......
Lovely Dinner Cruise.. Cruising the Danube and eating a Hungarian meal is priceless. We cruised past the Parliament at night and saw all the lighted buildings and church's.

Twice boat trip. the Danube is a heart of many cities, like Budapest. But in Budapest the Duna looks more magnificent and stunning. Like every other land mark in Budapest, the Duna must be see twice in the day and in the evening. Most of sightseeing landmark in Budapest is watchable from river.

Breathtaking views. The Danube in Budapest is breathtaking. Budapest is located on both sides of the Danube - the Buda and Pest. A walk along the Danube is lovely. There are lovely bridges on the Danube.

Lovely comentry and views. Get a ticket from the big bus co the one with a giraffe on the front of the bus.The ticket is valid for 48 hours and will include trip on the river which will stop at Margaret island where you will see the singing fountain.It will also allow you to jump,the queue at the funicular railway at the castle.
Visit 2016. Went for a cruise on the river organised by Prestige Hotel, it was great, interactive good food & wine & great traditional music

Viking River Cruise - Danube River - Budapest to Nuremberg. Cruised the Danube River on Viking Njord from August 27 - September 3/16 and must say that the service by Viking staff was second to none!! From the time that we arrived at the ship till our departure staff was always present to look after our needs. Air Canada lost both my wife and my luggage which was extremely frustrating as they continued to provide misleading and inaccurate information. Viking concierge Sonja was relentless, however, in trying to locate our luggage and to make our stay as comfortable as possible by continuing to call and email AC to try and help us. Laura picked up our clothes each night to have them washed and returned them to us in the morning at no charge while keeping our room exceptionally clean. The professionalism and service by Viking staff and Program Director Susie was exceptional. Meals were excellent as was the service by Jackie and Val. Would strongly recommend Viking Cruise Line to anyone contemplating a Danube River Cruise based upon our experience.
Fantastic view across the river. What better way to start a site seeing trip around Budapest than to gaze across the beautiful Danube river ...watch the boots and while away a few minutes

Boat trip. Took the boat trip as part of hop on hop off bus tour. The Danube is huge and the cruise lasts one hour and gives incredible views of the city especially the parliment building. Great on a sunny day.

Boat Trip. A boat trip along the River Danube is a must! It is a great way to view all the beautiful architecture and buildings of wonderful Budapest! We celebrated with a glass of Champagne which made it all the sweeter
Heart of Budapest. Take a short river cruise or enjoy it just sitting and watching - the Danube is a heart of many cities, like Budapest.

Beautiful River & Surroundings. The Danube, the 2nd longest river in Europe, divides Budapest into Pest and Buda. The area is beautiful on both sides. It is wonderful to walk near it and enjoy the picturesque sight. There are 7 bridges on which you can cross the danube and admire the view. The view is spectacular both during the day and at night. On the Pest side of the danube, I recommend visiting the Shoes on the Danube memorial to the Hungarian jews who were killed there during WWII.

Night cruises are fantastic, a must in Budapest. We took the dinner & cruise option. There are several companies that offer it. The dinner itself was ok, but the highlight is the views you can get. No camera can replace that.
Super Cruise. A must for any visitor to Budapest is a cruise on the beautiful Danube plus a visit to the equally beautiful Margaret Island.Fantastic fountain display and lovely flowers and trees.

Amazing Views!. We sailed on a Viking river cruise from Amsterdam and were on the Danube from the Main-Danube canal just before Regensburg all the way to Budapest. It was peaceful and breathtaking all at the same time. Castles, vineyards, bridges and delightful little villages all along the way.Words and pictures cannot do it justice.

Cleanest River so far in my Europe Travels!. The Danube is Budapests largest river, it runs through the middle of Buda and Pest. We walked over a few bridges as well as went on a river cruise which I would recommend (there are loads to pick from). In my opinion the Danube looks like one of the cleanest rivers that I've encountered on my Europe trip so far.

Beautiful River. Whether you stroll around Danube, walk on the Chain Bridge or take a Cruise , the magic of Danube will not leave you untouched . With Buda Castle on one side and Pest City on the other, river cruise and the walk are one of the best ways to feel the magic of Budapest!

Picturesque. It really doesn't matter where you are the views over or along the Danube are really beautiful. Views from the river banks or of Budapest from the castle are all dominated by this beautiful river.

Viking River Cruise - Romantic Danube. We took our first river cruise and it was wonderful. The "Romantic Danube" cruise on Viking started in Nuremberg, Germany and ended in Budapest, Hungary (it goes both directions). We were fearful after reading stories of high or low river levels, which can turn it into a bus/hotel tour. The weather was great and except for a minor issue getting the ship up to Nuremberg (we had to start at the first stop in Regensburg, Germany), it was perfect. Viking handled everything perfectly. The free tous are sufficient, but we added an Abby tour (Nuremberg)and the Schoenberg Castle (Vienna). Stops also included Krems, Austria, Passau, Germany. The food, ship and crew were excellent.
Beautiful - Night and Day. The Danube river in Budapest is one of the most striking river cruises anywhere. Especially a night.

Quite lovely . This beautiful River flow threw the center of Budapest. It has a couple of islands in it. Take a stroll on Margarit Island when you take the stairs off the bridge. Take a Danube River cruise for sightseeing or one of the dinner cruises for the special view after dark!
My Home. This is where I feel at home. Most beautiful City in the world. Nice shops, restaurants..promenade. I love it

Nice. Last year I did a river cruise on the Danube.It was a wonderful experience and today we did another local cruiseThe views are amazing from this pointIn 2 days time we will be in Vienna and will be back on the DanubeHappy birthday Charlie , have a wonderful day sweetheart , hope the presi are ok lots of love xxx

Blue Danube...........? Well...... An imposant river, surrounded bij many impressing buildings. The most impressing of the is the House of Representatives. At night it is even more beautifull.If you take the 10.00 am boat from Dock 10 (free in combination of Budapest Sightseeing Hop On Hop Off tickets) l;eave the boat at Margharita Island. Rent a bicycle (also for free at the same arrangement) and cycle to the Jsapanese Garden. Return to the fountains which give a perfect show on music at 12.00 am. At 12.30 the boat - Dunayaghts - will pick you up again.

Don't miss this. What better way to have an insight into Budapest than to take a trip down the Danube river, the main artery of the city. There are many private boat tours you can take, some are expensive-some less, but if you intend to stay a couple of days in Budapest I'd recommend you to buy one of the city's public transport passes (24hrs, 72hrs, 7days, etc) because it will also give you access, apart from the land transportation, to the boat lines. Take the boat line D12 which goes all the way from Romaifurdo southwards and have a splendid river tour of Budapest basicly for free. Enjoy.

It's like they're ashamed of it.. An iconic river. Yet, apart from the usual pleasure boats, it appeared wildly underused. We expected a thriving river scene, as in restaurants, cafes, etc. However that's not really the case. We were there for the Festival of St Stephen, so seeing the fireworks set off by the castle, watching from the other bank, was terrific, but that's about it.
An impressive river. I was surprised by its size and depth. There was not any recreation, like in Prague. There are a lot of tours and cruise vessels.

Lovely beautiful city. Budapest is a very dramatic city. Right on the Danube River. On each side of the river are very lovely buildings, parliament, churches, etc. It is a very historical city. We really enjoyed learning about it history. The food was typical Hungarian food. Excellent food well cooked. Like much of Europe there is a lot of pork products.

Viking Freya River Cruise - a dream come true. After years of planning, 5 friends and I finally booked our Budapest to Nuremberg Viking River Cruise up the Danube aboard the Viking Freya.
