From the very first phone call for information and then ultimately booking to the departure flight - accompanied by a Viking rep, this was an over the top, amazing experience!!! We embarked on this beautiful long-boat in Budapest where we were greeted with great warmth and enthusiasm. Our stateroom, though small, were elegant, comfortable and extremely efficient. The ship was wonderful - with a lovely dining room, lively lounge, library and plenty of nocks and crannies for resting and reading. The top sun deck was beautiful and a wonderful place to take in the charming river sights and a nice cocktail. The food was 5 star - delicious, plated beautifully and always divine!!! The staff was extraordinary. The Program Director was such fun. She added great value and entertainment with fun games, lectures, local information and ship updates everyday. Our port calls were terrific...Vienna, Passau, Krems, Regansberg, Nuremberg and a stunning day cruising the Machau Valley. Certainly there was not enough time spent in Vienna but what was made available to us was terrific. The contracted local guides were knowledgable, personable and helpful. The add on (paid) tours did not live up to our expectations however so far as value and experience. We agree that next time we'll pass on those. But all in all it was a trip of a life time - made perfect by Viking's attention to detail and customer service. As amazing as the ship, the food, the tours, the fun was - the best part was the engagement with the support crew. Everyone of our wait persons, housekeepers, even the sailors, were accommodating, engaging, courteous, friendly and so very helpful. They are the worker bees aboard but were never too busy to chat, fulfill a special request, make every effort to see to our comfort and needs. I will never forget a single one of them. Here's to you Milan and Boyan!!! I, We, will definitely do another Viking cruise again, and again and AGAIN!! These cruises might seem expensive but I assure you get your monies worth AND MORE! Go - now or soon. You will not regret the effort or expense!!!
Nice Wall by The Danube river. A lott of Nice Coffeeshops, restaurants and Icecream Bars. Prices are higher than normal. But not expenciv.

Viking River Cruise. Booked Viking for our river cruise along the Danube as although initially it seems so much more expensive than other companies when you start to compare Viking does actually include everything in their price while other companies charge extra. We were not disappointed! Cruising on Viking is amazing. The level of customer service is second to none, wonderful food and we visited some beautiful places along the way. Every stop has the option of an inclusive tour for which you pay no extra or a choice of additional tours for which there is a charge. After every trip you are welcomed back on board more often than not with a drink or a biscuit or chocolate. Cant recommend it highly enough.

7 night classic danube cruise. Had a glorious 7 nights on board the Amadeus Silver. Embarked in Budapest, enjoyed a cruise up and down the river at Budapest which is beautiful at night. It helped there was a full moon. Called in at Estergom, Bratislava, Vienna, Durnstein, Melk, Linz, Asach, Regensberg and disembarked at Passau. This was a well run cruise with impeccable staff and excellent food paired with wine of the region. There were organised tours available at each stop. Apart from the magnificent Melk Abbey we just did our own thing ashore. The entertainment was dismal ( fortunately only 2 evenings) apart from the delightful musical duo who played every evening. The only flaw in this typically efficiently run Austrian ship was the entertainment Officer - she spoke poor English, gave incorrect directions, looked a mess with messy hair. The rest of the staff were immaculate. Wine was complimentary at dinner and you are allowed to bring your own wine to Lunch The Amadeus Silver has cabins have huge pull down windows - they call then French Balconies. Views of the river are super from here albeit only from one side. The lounges, however, are big and airy and gives uninterrupted views. Will do another cruise with this line.

Part of our tour of Budapest. Took a tour of the Pest side of Budapest which included a river cruise. It was a little crowded on the pier & on the boat. I am not a fan of boats so if that helps..you might like it. The cruise itself was nice. Seeing the city at night light up was beautiful.
Clean. The Danube is a lovely clean fast flowing river with plenty of action with river cruises and commercial shipping.
Danube. Beautiful and I will definitely try to make a river cruise. The choice of all the different Cruise companies must make it possible!!

Lovely river, rich in history of European countries.. Such an impressive river to travel on with bird's eye views of century old cities throughout Europe. Commercial, personal and cruise boats all share this waterway.
Relaxing. If you visit Budapest among your tours in the city you should also book at least a sightseeing cruise.I choose a night cruise and i dont regret it.

Budapest to Bucharest. We are currently on board Emerald Dawn cruising on the Danube towards Bucharest. We have done river cruising holidays before and this ship is superb. The cabins are roomy and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The foods is excellent, plenty of choice, perfectly cooked and served by happy friendly restaurant staff. We really cannot complain about anything.
How can you miss it?. More brown than blue, but a lovely seam running through the city. We did a little 1-hour cruise that was pleasant, but not essential.

Cruise the River for a full Appreciation. Vital to the history of Budapest, a short cruise on this blue gray river is a must do. We found the views and photo ops from the river were worth our time. And evening cruise on the Danube is particularly stunning.
New Years Eve. Super beautiful, but very windy at that time of the year. I was on a boat for New Years Eve and it was super cold, but still beautiful.
Danube. beautiful river. we also took a boat ride from dock 10. they were much cheaper than other offers. i reccomend a ride close to sunset.

Danube by night. The Danube is not blue but a murky green. However with a trip by night it takes on a magical appearance with the major buildings such as Parliament House, the spas, hotels Eric and the various bridges all lit up, with the Castle Hill lit up behind and the Statute of Liberty lit up in the distance.

Worth a melody!. Maybe not so blue but certainly beautiful. Took a daytime cruise with excellent commentary but the night cruise was fabulous. Don't bother having the on-board meal. It's expensive, you'll have to rush and you"ll miss the sights. We bought tickets from an information stall in the centre-reduced rate €10 each. Well worth it. Get one when it's dark . September 8.00 is perfect. Can be chilly.
Danube river. It major cities like Vienna to Budapest. Good experience by travel from Vienna to Budapest. Many other cities/countries are to be visited by boat through this river.

Nuremberg to Budapest. Scenic Cruises provide an excellent all inclusive service with no extras to pay, including all food, drinks and trips. The trips were all good with guides and no tipping. The food on board is of very good resaurant quality. We booked a second trip to the Rhine, which was also excellent. All travel from airport to ship is also provided.

silverllne dinner cruise. We went on this evening cruise as a special treat...what a disappointment. The staff badger you to buy an extra drinks package but not all drinks are included.The food was basic and the fish very dry and tough.One circular lap around the river after an hour and we stopped to pick up more passengers who filed through the dining room while we were eating and they went to the top deck.Then we set off for the same cirular lap of river.Night views were super but spoilt by other events.

Fantastic Way To See Europe. Our group included five couples who had three different cabin types so we got the full flavor of the ship. We boarded in Nuremberg with stops in Regensburg, Passau, Krems, Vienna and Budapest. We were on the Njord and the crew was fantastic from our cabin steward to our meal servers. We never heard the word "No" one time. The city tours that were included as part of the cruise fare were excellent. Three of the couples purchased our airfare through Viking and this experience was terrific as well. A great time was had by all. We highly recommend Viking.

So bright and great!. Danube is inseparable from Budapest. It is the main feature characterising the city. The river and the bridges make the Budapest complete. The river gives the space and life to the city. It is beautiful in all hours and from all directions! Do not miss a cruise at sunset and night. Danube so blue, so bright and blue...

For a start, it is not Blue. Although we did a River Cruise along the Danube from Budapest to Prague, the life on the river is very much bouncing. From short day tours to lunch, dinner or late night sightseeing these are all choices you have, mainly from the Pest side of the river. One of the best ways to see Budapest if you are restricted with time available.

Must do boat cruise. No trip to Budapest is complete without a boat cruise on the Danube, its a brilliant way to see the fantastic architecture. Two free boat tickets were included in the price of our hop on/off bus pass and the 1 hour cruise was perfect.
Duna. I love it. The best thing about the Duna is it's view. It is just so amazing and the rest is still cool!
An excellent city to take a River Cruise!. Danube features a lot of beautiful sights, especially in Budapest. A mini cruise in the city is definitely worth the spending the day.

Meh. We went on a boat cruise at night and weren't very pleased. Although the views of the lit city are great, the cruise itself wasn't. It was advertised to be 1 hour long but only took 45 minutes. It also stated to have a drinks bar which was not on the actual ship but next to the entrance outside the ship so by the time we entered it was already too late. Plus, the audio guide wasn't synced with the boat's route.

So pretty and absolutely massive. We were following the Danube down Europe and in Budapest it is just so wide and pretty! Very relaxing just sitting by the river and having a glass of wine or whatever!

Excellent . The Danube flows on her northernmost point through my hometown Regensburg in Germany and through Vienna, Bratislava, Budapest and finally into the Black Sea. It's a beautiful, mighty river which also in Budapest creates an impressive open space within the city and has many impressive buildings lined up along its shores.
Beautiful river.. Had a walk around the river a few times and also went on a boat ride which was so nice taking in Budapest's beautiful scenery.

Mrs. We had the pleasure of going down the river on a boat at evening. Beautiful sights and the people who worked on the boat even pointed out what was around us . Brilliant photo opportunity. A definite must to see .

Take the boat! . Danube in Budapest is amazing especially if you are taking the 1 hour long trip on the river boats!We used the one at pier 10 and the boat was clean, left on time and delivered a bilingual (English and German) tour which was professional as it was interesting.The river trip was Reay enjoyable and the views spectacular. It is really worth taking this trip and listening to all the interesting stories and information from the tour guide. Highly recommended!
Beautiful Danube. I would highly recommend a river boat cruise on the Danube both during the day as well as night. Budapest is truly spectacular any time of the day!

An evening trip. We thought the very best time to experience the Danube and Budapest from the water is in the dark. Once the sun has gone down the lights come on and lift all the magnificent buildings to life. A dinner cruise would be a good idea, very romantic.

Boat trip to the Romai district. We caught the boat from Budapest city centre to Romai district back to our hotel. Sat upstairs and had great river views. Drinks available to buy on board. Our trip took about 40 minutes one way and cost 750 Forint.

Danube River cruise. Absolutely great eight night cruise from Passau, Germany to Budapest on Viking Prestige, launched in 2011. This was our second Viking cruise having done the Rhein from Basel to Amsterdam in 2015. Great ship, extremely attentive staff (50 staff for 181 passengers). We had suite 302 AA class which was clean, spacious and had all amenities.Buy the Silver pkg ($300/couple) for all the premium liquor and wine you want. Stops and side tours were great especially Vienna and Budapest.Food was excellent with high quality, many options from buffet to menu. Two restaurants so plenty of choices. Easy to meet people, made some friends the first night at dinner and had every meal with them during the trip.

You must take a boat down this. Absolutely a do not miss taking a boat down the Danube (Duna) in the evening once it gets dark. The major sites of Buda and Pest are all visible and amazingly lit up. Stunning.During the day, there are many beautiful bridges to walk across and many of the major sights are on the banks or visible from the banks of the river, so worth visiting then too.
Lovely buildings. Excellent views cruises day and night are a must it lets you take in the spectacular buildings in an easy trip
Just slowly walk it day and night. Spent one hot Saturday just walking along the Danube criss crossing the bridges. Stop have a beer ended up five and a half hours worth every second of if.
something you must do!. you are already in this beautiful place, take advantage of the hop on hop off tour that includes the cruise.

Really lovely and clean river with so many lovely sights. I visited the Danube around Budapest and did a 20 mile round walk from Budapest Marriott hotel to the bridge connecting to Gellert Hill Cave (worth a visit), then back along the river past Buda Castle and the chain bridge all the way to Margaret bridge which I used to visit Margaret Island. Then I walked all the way back to the Marriot stopping by the Parliament and seeing the shoes on Danube Bank (very close to the Parliament).
river cruise. the river cruise was a fantastic experience. People are so friendly and the service on the boat was the highest you can imagine. The price what we had to pay was a little money.

Fantastic experience. We used the River Cruise company for this week long trip along the Danube. Great staff and nice cabin ( all have windows ). Food was delicious. Itinerary was great as we saw a different place every day and tied up in central Budapest for example. We didn't do any of the optional excursions as it was easy to do our own thing but the excursions seemed popular. The Danube is a very interesting and relaxing river to travel down. I was probably the youngest guest on the trip ( 49 ) which I don't understand really as I think younger people would love this trip too.
Beautiful. Danube nice river.A lot of river cruises ships, hundreds turists every year,happy people.The sunset it is realy fantastic.
River. When you buy your travel pass it's entitle you to use some river bus when you have to use it to see danube
Lovely river. This is one river that gives London a run for its money, lovely sights from the river of the city, do a night cruise as the buildings/bridges are all lit up.

Great activity during summers . The Danube promenade is a great activity anytime during summers, you feel refreshed by the cool breeze and if you are there before sunset, you can enjoy the beautiful sunset in the mountains

Danube Night Cruise is recommended. Take a Danube Tourist cruise at night. This is really nice as Budapest is well lit up at night. All the main attractions like Parliament Building, University, Fisherman's Bastian, St. Stephens Basalica, Mathias Basalica and Chain Bridge and other bridges are illuminated offering good photography potential.

Cruising on the Danube on the AMA Waterways - AMA Dolce. This is an excellent cruise line. We saw beautiful scenery, small cities, many locks, and many sites on this cruise. The Danube was very calm when were there in August, 2016.
What a Cruise. We took a cruise from Linz to Budapest on the Danube. There so many wonderful sights along this historic river. Wonderful experience.

Nice cruise along the river. We went a cruise on the Danube which was part of our Tuk Tuk experience. The cruise itself lacked Diet Coke which was flat as anything. English tour available.Great opportunity to takes pictures at night
Take a short cruise. There are short cruises of 90 minutes which are worthwhile. Unlike Prague, there is no commentary in multiple languages, so you are on your own. but the views are good.

Riviera Danube with Budapest Extension. A very good Cruise. Excellent staff and fine dining. All the guides were excellent and cabins very comfortable. The extra 3 days in Budapest were very good but tiring. Felt the extension should be at the beginning of the holiday, followed by the cruise. The Hilton hotel in Budapest was very comfortable and central. Easy to get about using the metro (free for anyone over 65 years of age). The guide kept with the group (apart from free time) and even saw us go into Departure Lounge in Budapest Airport. Unfortunately the Airport, although new, sent you into an awful concrete hanger when waiting to board Easyjet plane. There was no where to sit and unacceptable for people over 65 to wait for the landing of the aircraft and cleaning of the plane before boarding.
Wow!!. We sailed from here on a river cruise with a cruising company. It is not blue, but a muddy brown, but setting that aside, we are coming back, hopefully not too long in the future.
Great Views from the River. Danube is a great big river and the views from the Danube and towards the Danube are sometimes stunning !

A real spectacle at night and pleasant to cycle along in the day. The beautiful buildings along the banks are lit up in a golden light after dark - it really is beautiful. The birds in the sky also appear to be glowing above the steeples. This is a fabulous river. Makes the Thames look very ordinary. On a par with the Seine and Vltava (Prague) - if not better. Lots of great views and things to do. Been 3 times and it has not lost any of it's appeal.

Viking Cruise of our dreams. We did a 10 day Bavaria to Budapest cruise with Viking and found it to be superior in every way. The food onboard was excellent, appropriate to countries visited, and the locations we visited were all notable in their own right. Each tour was better than the last! We met some wonderful people and shared memorable experiences learning about this part of Europe.

Danube evening by boat. Not a stunning experience. Cheap sparkling wine in plastic glasses - that was the champagne on the boat...Rather cold in the evening, you need a coat even in the summer.Will try to find a better solution for Danube cruise at night...

Danube cruise. Take a cruise along the Danube river to see all the well known monuments along the shore. It's a very good trip . Don't worry to reserve a ticket before your arrival to Budapest as there are a lot of agencies along the shore to reserve your place . try it .

Wonderful City. I was on a river boat cruise and Budapest was the last stop. We were docked across from Parliament. Absolutely one of the most breathtaking buildings I've ever seen, especially at night. On the last night we rode up and down a bit on the river to see the city at night. Wonderful experience.

It is like a port in a big seaside city - Walking along the port of Budapest Danube. Last night I drove my father-in-laws to a musical-cruise (Operett hajó) to the Danube which was with dinner and before the cruise we took a small walk along the port. It is so beautiful everything is lit. There was a light breeze and it was so nice to se so many people walking and chatting there. It is strange that the port got even more crowded as time passed by. So night life due to many cruises, bars and restaurants is very lively.

Nice view, disapointing voice guide. Nice to have boat tour, good for resting your feet for about one hour.But once again dissapointed by the voice guide that was so geographicaly wrong!!!The guide stated both in English and German that the Danube is flowing into the Black Sea in Ukraine!?!?!?Helloooooo!?!?!?!?According to all available maps, the Danube is flowing into the Black Sea through 3 channels of the Danube Delta that is 96% on Romanian teritory!!!!! I tend to believe that Hungarians hold a grudge to the Romanians.....

Misleading marketing. I went on a viking cruise from Budapest to Nuremberg earlier this year with 7 family members. The on-ship experience was quite good, but the massively infuriating part of the whole process was the ports of call. I was excited to visit cities in Austria and Germany, as advertised in the marketing material. What I found on the ship was much different than advertised. Non of the ports of call were in town; most were at least an hour away from the advertised city, requiring the use of buses. I didn't pay for a river cruise to spend my time in a bus. Viking's marketing is misleading a best.Please - before you book a cruise, verify with the company where you will *actually* dock!

It's a river.. In Budapest there are dozens of boats taking people on tours up and down the river. We found the ferry boat and travelled some distance along the river weaving our way along. It is probably just us but after about 30 min of going along the river we had had enough fortunately we had not booked a weeks cruise.

Visit at night for views like no other. We visited the Danube on the evening and needed only to wander around. The river and surrounding sights are lit up wonderfully. Perfect place for a romantic stroll.

For the traveller on a budget.. The Danube provides the best chance for sight-seeing in Budapest, and it can be done cheaply if you try.We tried walking, tram and ferry as ways of seeing the city along the river and found that ferry was best. There are ferries about every half hour during the day that locals use to get to work or go shopping etc. Cost is 750 HUF per trip, so to get value for your money allow plenty of time.We took a ferry from the Buda side of the river directly across from Parliament House and went upstream to the last stop (called Romaii Fürdő.) this took 90 Minutes The ferry has comfortable seats and air-conditioning downstairs and also has an upper deck if you prefer the wind in your hair. You can buy good wine (HUF200/glass) and beer on the ferry. We drank wine.When we got to Romaii Fürdő we disembarked and found a suitable restaurant (there are many to choose from) returning later to out departure point. The return trip took only 1 hour.This trip was the best value day out that we had in Budapest. Do yourself a favour and give it a go if you have the time.

Essential¡¡¡. Essential boat ride on the Danube.It is not necessary to do so with tourist outlets including dinner and music, much lower price, you can catch one of the boats leaving from several docks in the city, and make your own tour across the famous bridges and admiring the beauty of the buildings on both sides of the cityDo not miss it¡¡

Mother Danube is not blue is NOT blue!. There is no better city for a river cruise than Budapest. The Danube is wide and amazing at this part of her journey to the Black Sea. If you are not on a river cruise, catch one of the most popular attraction in Hungary. The locals and tourists pack the Danube cruise ships. You will see the famous bridges, many of the top attractions, and have a little taste of what it meant to be an ancient city divided by a major river. Evening cruises allow you to see magnificent buildings lit up just for you. Don't just look at the Danube, get out on it.

Nice and explanatory night cruise. We chose the 'Legenda - Danube cruise' service at night (9.30pm) and were very much impressed by a beautiful Budapest at-night setting. Especially the parliament building is really worth seeing from the Danube at night, as it is beautifully illuminated and is amazing to watch! We paid 15 euros as a student price for a one hour tour, including one drink and were very much satisfied!
Great river and plenty to see on the boat trip. Great way to see the city, and using the public transport on the river made it inexpensive and an easy way to get around,

Cruising along the Danube. This is an excellent trip for adults. I cannot imagine a more fantastic trip where I was indulged graciously, enjoyed wonderful history lessons via walking tours,could chose how much activity I wanted, or just stay on the boat, gourmet food vegetarian diets every meal, plenty of wine/beer if you like that with lunch and dinner, music and entertainment until midnight. No rocking of the boat, every single person who worked on board seemed to just want to make my trip pleasurable.I did not opt for an extra 3 days in Budapest, but I LOVED it there with our short walking tour. Will have to return to explore the city.Took the 3 days in Prague, a city had no idea to ever visit, but the history was amazing, and just long enough to get a taste of the city. Optional tours do cost extra,(except walking tours at each port )and the tipping is done at the end/or with the tour guides on land.Everything else but souvenirs are paid for before the trip. I have never been so spoiled in my whole life.!!

It is at its best at Budapest!. Flowing through a number of European cities the majestic Danube may not be truly blue but on a sunny day in Budapest it IS the most beautiful site you've ever seen!Given the location of the Buda Hills directly on the banks of the Danube you cannot be other than speechless at its beauty.
Great river . Lovely cruise on the river, up and down, the river you see all the lovely architecture of the city of Budapest
Beautiful. Buy a ticket to evening cruise and enjoy the view. Both side of the city looks beautiful with some alcohol in your hand

You can't miss this river in Budapest. You can't miss this river in Budapest. It's huge, and cuts the city between Buda and Pest sides.There are a few walkable bridges that cross it and give you stunning views of both sides.Consider a boat cruise if you have the time.Do tie in with other activities, such as Central Market, Gellert Hill/Citadel, Castle Hill, St. Mathias Church, Parliament, etc. The river's in the way of everything. Enjoy it's historical nature.

Boat trip. we bought tickets from a machine for five days travel, we travelled on the tram,metro, and the commuting boat on the Danube, it was an interesting river, both ways, interesting to see different building obviously built at different eras.

Dinner Boat Cruise was Fabulous. Hands down the best part of my time in Budapest. Buffet dinner, beautiful views of the city, and had the good fortunate to be seated with some fun fellow travellers. A night to remember and never to forget!
Boat trip!. Went on the river for a few hours with the commuter boats. STUNNING trip with so much beautiful architecture to watch

With Strauss in mind. Preferably walk the bank of the river from Margaret Island and keep your earpieces in to the tune of On the Blue Danube. I know it's Austrian, but Mr Strauss II wouldn't mind if you play it along its Hungarian section. Enjoy!

Danube ride is must.. We took a Big Bus hop on hop off and got the complementary Danube boat ride tickets, just out of curiosity took the ride, but it came out to be stunning, as in summers the ride starts at 9pm as twilight changes into night, Buda Castle on the left and Parliament on the right are illuminated, quite magical it looks from the Cruise. For serious photographers keep the Shutter high as there is a subtle wobble on the boat, pics will come little blur inspite of IS.The Big Bus boat had a Bar below one can enjoy Wine with the magnificent vista.
Wonderful Tauck River cruise. Traveled from Amsterdam to Budapest for 2 weeks on a Tauck cruise. Well paced, fun, great staff and crew. Only negative was it went too quickly!!
Twin-headed fish. I saw some people swimming in it. I mean, seriously? The river doesn't look that clean. Coming to the river is one of these free activities you might enjoy to do.

Take a cruise down the Danube. I can highly recommend Uniworld and Crystal Cruises for your adventure down the Danube. These are 8-10 day tours. Otherwise take a one day trip down or up the Danube from one of the local companies. Fabulous. Just as nice is an evening dinner cruise on the river.

An evening to remember. We were advised to take the evening boat trip along the river, as opposed to daytime. The views were absolutely stunning, all the sights illuminated along the way, definitely go after dark , we went at 8pm but I suggest leaving it until 9pm or later when it is quieter. Our trip was spoiled by the family in front of us who insisted on taking selfies and family photos during the entire journey. Finally we had to ask them to sit down,

The boat ride on the Danube is a must. Was there for a business conference. The large boats on the river offer excellent restaurants with excellent food. The boat ride on the river Danube is a must and an excellent way to view the famous buildings, both modern and historic. The walk along the Danube is very interesting and provides an excellent insight into life in Budapest.
It's a river . How do you review a river? It was almost 30c when we went down to the riverside so the cooling breeze was very welcome and there are some nice views.

Enjoy Budapest Fireworks Show. Though you have to wait til 20 Aug 2017 to see the famous Budapest Fireworks Show from the banks of the Danube or from a boat, it is worth scheduling your next summer program to enjoy Festival of Folk Arts in Buda Castle, Street of Hungarian Flavors on the Danube embankment and Fireworks at Budapest on 20th August (St. Stephen’s Day), celebrating the foundation of the Hungarian state.

Great way to get a view of the city. The best time to cruise the Danube is after dark in order to appreciate the city and bridges when illuminated. However, the river 'buses' also offer a great way to get around and to visit Margeret and Old Buda Islands

Romantic Cruise. Travelers coming to Budapest should not miss taking a nice sunset cruise in the Danube. No traveler would regret doing this. You'll get a fantastic view of the city lights of Budapest with this cruise.

Amazing. You have numerous choices. You can just walk along the waterfront on either side of the Danube. Or, you can take a river cruise and see the magnificent parliament building and may other amazing historic buildings. There is, of course, a hop on hop off bus as well as trams. Whatever ou choose, you must see the Danube and sights.

Must do Mini Cruise. You have to if your staying in Budapest go on a mini cruise along the Danube.We did a hop on hop off bus that includes a ride on one in the price. We went on the 2000 got back at 2120 and it was amazing the sun is starting to go down and then becomes dark. Some brilliant photo opportunities on this mini cruise.
Beautiful River. A cruise along this river is highly recommended. It is a lot of fun at night. Major sights are lit up and very pretty.

Very well developed. I live in a country that is crossed by Danube, Romania, but i have to admit that Budapesta is getting the best of it.
Because of the buildings and the bridges over the Danube it became a wonderful river
We love walking along the river. You can use Hop on/off bus (include cruise) and/or just any cruise boat down the Danube river. We love walking along the river bank.. take your time.

Viking Jarl. Nuremberg to Budapest. This was our first river cruise and we were blown away! The staff were just amazing, so attentive, friendly, helpful and kind; taking the trouble to remember your name and your favourite tipple! The ship itself was superb, excellently fitted out and spotlessly clean. We had a Veranda suite which was simply gorgeous with a double shower, lovely white fluffy large towels. Hot drinks, water and cookies were supplied in abundance and available 24 hours a day (for no extra charge). The food was excellent, the evening entertainment of a good standard and the majority of tours were fantastic. We chose a couple of optional tours (which did cost extra) but these were truly excellent, except that at times they were a little rushed. Yes, this is an expensive holiday but well worth treating yourself to.The scenery was truly beautiful, parts of the Danube are designated Unesco world heritage sites and were breath taking.Go on, treat yourself.Terry and Gina

“Perfect MS Beethoven on the Danube”. This is the first time my wife and I have had a river cruise with Croisi Europe and it was perfect and will use them again and again. We booked this thru Archers who were great as usual, but MS Beethoven was much better than one could hope for. A comfortable cabin, small shower so whats new and just the best service from all the staff at all times. When you book all-inclusive, you are never quite sure how good it will be. However from day one to the end this was first class. Anything you did not like, you could ask for something else and no problem and great variety. The curise was on time with interesting stops and tours. The free wifi could have been better but I am sure that is down to reception. No kids, fantastic for couples. You are also introduced to others from your country and placed on a suitable table. They made every effort on the entertainment with a puzzel each day and quiz nights etc and even a show which was average but fun. I read other reviews on other companies who are clearly not as good. I can reccommend this company and I and sure the standard will stay for all ships. So book with confidence.

Must see. The 48 hours hop on and hop off tickets allow us to go on a cruise as often as we wanted. It was the best way to see the beautiful habour of Budapest. On route we passed by all the bridges along the Danube in Budapest plus lots of other tourists atttactions. Highly recommended .

Poor customer service. Recently done a weeks river cruise on the Danube with River Cruise Line all started well. The hotel stop overs were less than acceptable (see separate review on Diehls Hotel),arrived at the boat after a reasonable coach journey, That's when the customer service went to pot, we had booked a drinks package with the tour organisers that we thought gave us drinks throughout, but no, when we ask the rep to query this all we got was put off saying if he pressed this he would lose his job, they were adamant that the drinks package was for meal times only. Lots of argument followed over the next couple of days to no avail, so we just got on with enjoying the cruise.The cruise to be fair was quite good, not as good as our previous cruise on the Rhine with Shearings, that was really great.So back home we raised our concerns over the cruise with the department laughable called customer services. We told of the sub standard accommodation at the overnight hotels, the poor standard of evening entertainment, and the fact that you could not possibly drink the amount of alcohol during meal times that they charged you for (£99 for 7 Days per person).We got in return a letter that failed to grasp the points and the disappointment that we made and felt.So don't be put of River Cruising just make sure you try the best provider.

The Danube needs more..... Nothing wrong with the river, but you need the Danube plus something to make it worthwhile. A cruise, a walk, a park. Find something to do on or over the Danube and you will be happier.

Viking River Cruise Budapest to Nuremberg (Danube). We have done many sea cruises - this was our first river cruise and first time with Viking.The organisation from transfers to itinerary was near perfect and accommodation and food excellent.Staff on board the Viking Alta were a joy to be with for a week and set a standard of service we have not experienced on sea cruises. They always went the extra mile and with a smile every time even though some of the guests were very demanding.You get what you pay for but Viking represents great value for what they do. They are well worth the gratuities you pay but cost this in your final bill.The organised tours in with the package were generally very good but could be more intensive but with Viking you get mixed requirements from a wide audience.We rate this tour very highly but however good it is ,it is far better due to the quality of service on board - and they do this every week of the holiday season!

Viking Grand European River Cruise Amsterdam to Budapest. This is an absolute bucket list item. We had heard good things of all the cruises:Uniworld,GCT, Tauck, Avalon etc. So we were very particular to see what made this special from all the othershere is the list1. They handled emergencies when we were sick and had the Doctor on board the next day2. The Program Director and Concierge were on 24 hour steroids. Always extremely cheerful,extremely helpful would cater to our slightest whim, encouraged us to do things like 36 KM bike rides, when i had not ridden a bike in 30 years, always pushing to get the very best out of the trip.3. Staff from Hotel Manager to the cabin stewards had 24 hour smiles on their faces, catering to all the passenger whims and desires and believe me when you have 80 and 90 year olds, there are lots of concerns4. Staff to greet you when you left the ship, and there to greet you when you returned.5. There were folks in the 90's doing bike rides, women with walking canes climbing steep stairs to castles and abbeys all the while being cheered on by the PD and ConciergeYes all European Cruises are great, but I don't think anyone would compare to Viking. They go out of the way to make the trip enjoyable and with 26 ships doing the Grand European from Amsterdam to Budapest,they are pros at that and have addressed everything you could possibly need: in our case separate 110volts plugs for my wife and my chargers so there were no conflicts as to who could get to e-mail first
Dont miss the cruise. The river is wonderful. We took the evening cruise. Goes along the river so you can see the city by night.

Tickets with hop on hop off buses. Hop on hop off buses includes tours in Danube, one during the day and one by night. I prefer the first day to go at the night. My experience is amazing. See all the photos of the Budapest by night with the night lighting. My day Danube boat trip stops to the Margaret island. The boat stops their. And i go to the island. It worth it 1000% and you save money.I think the hop on hop off tickets where valid for 2 days, but you can get the info from your hotel reception.
take a boat river cruise. Perfect tip for a nice sunny days or after sunset to také a river cruise boat trip on Danube river you can seew most of the imortant saigns of Budapest.

Nice Late Afternoon Cruise on a Sunny Day. The Danube is always busy with a wide variety of forms of transport. You can rent individual boats and self-propelled vessels or take a leisurely cruise on a variety of watercraft with restaurants. A relaxing way to experience Budapest.
Stunning. Very nice setting. Can do a walk along the Danube Promenade, and see sights such as the Parliament, Buda Castle, Chain Bridge in the distance.

"Beautiful Day,; Beautiful Scenic Boat ride". We got on the "Hop on Hop off" boat that was part of the bus deal. It was a beautiful day, and sitting outside seeing the impressive sights along the Danube was very memorable.

Budapest cruise. Budapest boat cruise was a great experience, we were serve red with good food, drinks and also good music. Anni Blahunka was the best host on the cruise.......she made it more interesting.........I recommend everyone to try the Budapest cruise

Fast Flowing Commercial Highway. This is a transportation road where more tourist boats than you have seen stuck in a little area are moored. Would l recommend a fast cruise? Why! You can see the same things closer up by local, tram, bus, and on foot.
Crusing Quietly. Found both the day and night cruises enchanting. If you are not one of the lucky wealthy cruiseship inhabitants the a cuise along the river will be worthwhile
take the river cruise at night. it worth it. There are a lot of river cruises. they usually offer good discount. never pay full price.

Lovely spot but perishing!. My abiding memory of our visit to Budapest and the Danube in particular was how cold it was! There was chunks of ice actually floating down the river! Stunning spot but maybe we'll visit in the summer next time!
Beautiful River Cruise. Would highly recommend the Danube. All along are breathtaking sights. Smooth sailing and villages are so inviting.
Filthy!. Dirty brown water, the promenade along the river is pretty until you look in. Still, one of the river cruises is worth it for the views.
River cruise a must. On a weekend trip we took one of the cruise trips which takes you along to the Island and back. Nice weather, couple of beers and great views alongside of river. Very good!

Cocktails and Cruise. My sister and I enjoyed the 10:00pm river cruise on the Danube. Our hotel suggested the cruise with drinks rather than dinner, as the cruise is really all about the view NOT the food. Two drinks were included in the price of the cruise. There was live music being performed on deck for our enjoyment and several of the guests even waltzed under the stars. The views of the city illuminated at night were unbeatable! A great relaxing way to end a day of sightseeing in Budapest!

Danube river cruise. there are various vessels and different cruise trips some with meals. there are many piers so be sure at which pier your boat is.normally it is 1 hours cruise and takes you upto the bridge and during the cruise yopu can see almost all the monuments.the best view is of parliament house during the cruise nothing like a few snacks and lovely wines . It might take some time to serve your order

You MUST do this. Hands down, sailing on one of these boats at night across the Danube river was one of the most stunning and wonderful things I have ever seen. It is the perfect way to see Budapest and I highly recommend it. I can't remember what company we booked with but I don't think that it matters especially as you're still going to see the same things. The buildings are all lit up in gold and they shimmer, honestly it's simply stunning!!

Awsomw. We went on 20.15 trip. So we could see River and buildings at Sun set and then later in darkness. It is an awesome experience as many government buildings are well lit at night. The entire city looks so beautiful at night. Must do a night river cruise - highly recommend.
must see. the danube is no longer blue, however it is a nice walk along and definitely even nicer to dinner cruise!!!p.s. there is a shoe holocaust memorial that is a must see!

Relaxing!. We went on a cocktail cruise at the EUROPA organised by Duna Palota, located behind the Four Seasons Gresham Palace hotel, next to OTKERT restaurant. The cruise was relaxing with live music played by a highly talented orchestra band. It lasted for two hours. There's one at 7pm and one at 10pm. I would recommend the latter as you can experience Budapest in all its illuminated glory!

A fantastic way to see the city. We did a night cruise with dinner. A string quartet played the whole time and the food was quite good.The views of the city were amazing! Everything visible from the river was lit up. This already beautiful city looked magical at night.Well worth the time and cost to do this (can exclude dinner).

Danube River Cruise at night was awesome. We took a late evening 20.15 cruise tour as advised by the hotel. It was awesome. We could see Budapest at Sun set first and then in darkness. With almost all key buildings and bridges well lit, the city looked really very beautiful. It was a very enjoyable tour. It is a must do for first time visitors. Highly recommended.

Do the river cruise by day AND by night. The hop on hop off bus ticket I got (Big Bus) included unlimited river trips during the tickets 48 hour validity so I did the cruise during the day and then at night. Even though it was the same trip it seemed different, the lights at night and the buildings lit up were beautiful. Danube was quite brown; I was lead to believe it was blue!

Europe's second longest river. One thing, don't go swimming in here, the currents are impressive and the water is kind of dirty! 4-star rating because it looks colossal and it is! Also, the Danube in Budapest has some very nice bridges crossing it and it of course separates Buda from Pest (hence the name Budapest)
Relaxing. Whether you are doing a river cruise for a week or just an hour long tourist ferry, the view along the Danube is pretty incredible . Then at night it really shines.
it's a big river. probably got fish in it too, although it's too murky to see. Lots of trees floating downstream, so I wouldn't want to swim in it.
Great cruise. Took the sightseeing cruise twice in 2 days. It allowed us to view the Danube plus all the buildings on each side of the river.
Boat trip. Wow we loved the boat trip so we took it twice! Once during the night and second time during the day. Loved the view! Very nice option that you can use tickets 2 times ^^

Good attarction from the banks of the river or by boat.. We saw various aspects of the Danube, either by walking the paths that run along it or by travelling on one of the many river boats. It is advisable to see the Danube both during the daytime and especially at night when it comes alive in a different way.

See the City from the river. This is a great way to view some of the sites of Budapest. Several options are available and the best we found was from Pier 10 - much cheaper then Pier 7. Margaret Island at the top end of the cruise a little disappointing. You can get great value at Pier 10 - a ticket for 2 days, or better still have one day-time trip then one in the evening - the City comes to life and looks quite different.

Go on the passenger boats when it is free !. You can go on the normal scheduled ferry up and down the danube for free with a travel card or a buda card. When it gets to the top/North, the last stop has a floating hotel and a lovely area for lunch drinks and eats for reasonable prices. It isn't a fast way of getting about particularly and we had some issues with the timetable, but if you have plenty of time, I'd highly recommend this.
So majestic. The Danube is big in Budapest and its sight is a relaxation for the eyes whose eye is already overwhelmed by the saring beauty of Budapest.

Danude river . I went to see the Danude and was only disappointed it wasn't blue as the waltz states, it's a wide river and is one of the longest Rivers in the world it's a great place to go and have a seat by the side and watch the different types of boats going up and down from little boats to speed boats and cruisers.
River boat cruise. We were recommended to take this trip as part of a city hop on hop off bus tour. We did it at night and the scenery is fantastic. Stunning city.

Stunning Views of Budapest at Night. As the final sail of our week long Danube River cruise from Passau to Budapest, Viking made sure that entry into our final port would be memorable. We reached Budapest about 10:30 PM as we could see the twinkles of light into the distance. And then the dramatic show of Budapest at night on the Danube, all the monuments flooded w/ lights, the Parliament dramatically lit, the bridges twinkling w/ lights, people walking the shores, covering the green bridge, sitting up high on the scaffolding, waving to us as we passed under them and the bridge, welcoming us to Budapest. If you are not on a river cruise, try one of the local cruises for the evening. There were lots of ships on the river, cruising up and down. What a wonderful way to arrive in Budapest!
Beautiful by night. Walked along here by night. Totally recommend doing this - all the bridges and buildings lit up are spectacular.
sunset cruise. We went on the red bus and included was a cruise on the river which we did at sunset. What an awesome view of a stunning city.

Legenda Cruise Line Evening River Tour. Tour itself is delightful. We started on Pest side of river at about 8:00PM. Sky was still alight. Cruised up river past castle, Parliament, several bridges. As the hour advanced we turned down river and started seeing all the buildings and bridges being lit up.Excellent headphone narration of sites in your choice of language. Boat was very comfortable. Cruise lasted a full hour at moderate cost. Dock easily accessible on foot. By 9:15PM we were eating gelato in a nearby square. A lovely evening and a good value for the money. BTW, boat is enclosed so this could be done in inclement weather.
Gat way to spend a few hours. Went on a morning river cruise. Really lovely and gentle and relaxing whilst seeing sights you wouldn't be able to get to I. A weekend - Reasonably priced too

Walk it, boat it, tram it, cross it! . I love a river. In one day in Budapest we: took the number 2 tram from near Margaret Island all the way to the central market (It takes you along the Pest side of the river with great views); walked along the Pest side and stopped at cafes for coffee and cake; crossed the Chain Bridge and admired the views along the river (walk back across the river on the other side of the bridge to maximise on views!); and took a boat trip from pier 7 for a guided tour along the river. What we COULD have done: hired a speedboat; hired a Jet Ski; done a candle lit dinner cruise; canoed around Margaret Island; done a 'duck' boat/bus tour; walked the Buda bank.
A good walk. For those that love to walk the Danube banks are flat and a easy walk. You can swap banks at the chain bridge or Margaret bridge.

It's a Must. But, think it through first. We didn't and as a result had to take the tour twice. First in combination with an organ concert in the cathedral to be followed by a nice dinner while cruising the Danube. Quite a let-down: each guest received a glass of wine and two glasses of water; beyond that everything was on your own expense. Annoying, and the good food didn't make up for this disappointment. So, the next evening we just took a boat again, this time as a free extension of our Big Bus ticket, and we had a ball: food and drinks on our own money, no surprises and beautiful Budapest in nightly illumination. A dream come true!

Picturesque river.. Although this was the 3rd time I have visited Budapest, Danube River still remains the must-go place on my travel list. My friend and I went on a Legenda Cruise. It was a nice experience and highly recommended.

7 night cruise with Viking cruises. If you want a week long tour of this river you can choose one of the many cruise ships. Yes they do cost a lot (especially Viking) but are a great way of seeing the river and all the little towns along the way. Much better then driving!

Do it by water bus. Rather than pay lots for the private boats we got the water buses. A great cheap way to ride up and down the Danube. It is included on any normal day pass so a super cheap way to see the river.
Wonderful at night and by day. Did this trip twice by night and by day. The night time is the better one as the whole river is lit up by buildings and bridges.
Beautiful. It's a vibrant awesome place friendly interesting with lots to see and do plan to return to see everything i missed on a weekend trip

Spectacular night book trip of Danube. We were able to take a cruise on a boat that left while light but as sun was setting. The views of the prices, Parliament and many other buildings were bathed in light. It was one of the most spectacular boat trips ever. Also either wine, beer or water was served. A must if a person is there at night.

river cruise at night was fantastic. we did a one hour river cruise at night which was included in our walking tour. It was a great way to end the evening. The city looks amazing at night. The only negative was that the service on the boat was slow- not because of the girls who were brining the drinks but just because they needed at least 2 more per deck.

Great views. Both sides of the river are very busy with restaurants and lovely buildings, but to get the best views of everything I would recommend going onto the Danube. We took a speedboat up the length of Budapest and saw great views of all the important buildings and the bridges (which are fascinating). You have to take a boat on the Danube to see the very best of Budapest.

Beautiful river. Danube river is the 2nd largest river of Europe flowing through many countries. The cruise on Danube in Budapest shows all the tourist destinations by the riverbank. Specially beautiful in the evening when lights are on.
Take a walk along the Danube . We walked along the Danube each night. You can also take river boats but we were satisfied with walking alongside and over on the bridges.

The cruise was beautoful and service outstanding.. Wonderful service and fun for all. The "Princess" boat was an older boat and showing it's age but the service from the complete staff was outstanding. Rooms were beautiful. Food was perfect. On a River Cruise you do not have assigned seating which as nice because you were able to mingle with different people each meal. The excursions offered were nice and top quality. Outstanding English spoken.  Our group had a medical emergency in Passau, Germany and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating to us. I thank you for saving my life and for the beautiful flowers at the hospital. I hope to return again and finish the cruise.

A no miss for tourists. Obviously you need to at least walk by the Danube when you're in Budapest, and also cross one of the bridges from one side of the city to the other.. Do this both at day time to enjoy the city, but also night time to discover the romantic side of Budapest..

Viking River Cruise: Danube Waltz, July 2016. The Viking River Danube Waltz was very nice. This was our first river cruise and we were not disappointed. From the special attention accorded passengers to the excellent food to the brown Danube and its nineteen locks, it was a relaxing and generous excursion. There were many stops along the casual ride upriver, more than enough for everyone: Budapest, Bratislava, Vienna, Durnstein, Melk, Linz, and Passau. That makes four new countries we saw.One new insight for you: we stayed in the cheapest cabin. It had a window that looked out at the duck-level, right at the waterline. We loved this room. At night, the water would gently lap against the boat and we could hear the Danube's gurgle almost speaking to our memories. This room saved us $1,200 on our total cost.I recommend Viking River Cruises' Danube Waltz, Budapest to Passau.In lieu of pictures, here is my poem:Danube Waltz 2016by Craig Parker The Danube River is elegant, brownFilling the senses and soothing the heartIt calls us softly with delicate soundTo praise the beauty and ponder our part Budapest offers a charming retreatAddress olden dreams and heed Europe’s wayGrand architecture with statues repleteJet lag assures you’ll take six naps per day Dank and disheveled shoes randomly strewnSad testament to humanity’s pallPrejudiced citizens viciously tuneFueled by a cowardice born in us all New Bratislava, a lesser-known starArias sang how to live the right wayWhatever your dreams, wherever you areRather than wait, you should do it today Vienna, behold, a marvelous jewelWhere Sachertorte is a delicacyFrequent the sights under Hapsburg's long ruleToo bad the tour guide had COPD Reach Schonbrunn Palace by riding the railsJosef and Sisi were tragedy’s playKing, workaholic and all that entailsQueen, dedicated, who went her own way Bucolic countryside there at the riseRuthless lands ruled by a strong iron willChirping and landscapes caress ears and eyesRichard the Lionheart waits on the hillHail to the Linz cake and Linz SymphonyKepler wrote books here on planets then knownDubious side note of dark historyEichmann and Hitler both called Linz their home Grant each bridge crossed finds a prosperous shoreHope those obscure sins somehow be made rightSay we be happy with riches galoreMay the brown Danube waltz into the night.
Divides The City..... It divides the city into Buda and Pest. It acts as another transport route for the many boats, water shuttles and cruiser boats, it looks pretty in photos....it's got it all.
Really worth your time!. We were on the hop on - hop off bus and 2 river cruises which were included in our tickets... And the view from the river was splendid, magnicent, really great!

Fabulous Cruise. Took Viking's 10 day cruise from Nuremberg to Budapest and was so pleased and excited by almost every aspect of the trip. The Danube was very full and fast moving, but certainly not blue. Beautiful cruising from start to the grand finale in Budapest. The stops along the way are all wonderful and Vienna is magnificent as is Budapest. Viking fed us so extremely well. We took all our meals in the dining room, as we loved their wonderful servers and service. Meals were exceptional accompanied by excellent wines or beers, some were simply divine. Their longships are spotlessly clean always and are handsomely and simply appointed. No clutter or curlicues anywhere, which felt like an oasis after a day of grand examples of baroque and rococo buildings and art. Not only were we well fed but we were well entertained too. German/Austrian musicians were brought on board on two occasions and performers from the Hungarian State Opera also. An organ concert in Passau and an evening of operatic and ballet performances in Vienna were wonderful. All the staff on board the Viking Gullveig were outstanding. I, personally, have never gone through a lock so I found that part of the trip absolutely fascinating. I would awaken at night and sit out on the balcony and experience the whole process, and while it was somewhat akin to watching paint dry, I loved it. You can reach out and touch the walls of the lock. Day or night, it was so interesting to me. Two things that are not discussed in the brochures are the docking accommodations and procedures. Longships dock lengthwise along the pier and then they stack four next to each other, so that you lose the use of your private balcony while in port and you must exit and enter through all the ships. As each ship enters and settle next to each other they all must discharge their holding tanks thru tubes and the fumes can really be awful. These two distractions would not make me hesitant to take another Viking cruise at all. Viking does not come cheaply, but it was worth every penny. I truly believe they earned every dollar I paid. I thoroughly investigated all the options open to us with other cruise companies before I booked this trip. Seeing those ships and the accommodations along the way, I was not disappointed in our choice of Viking. It was just beyond all my expectations.

Fine trip for one hour. Short trip during the day seem to be less interesting on first sight. When you join the group on a small boat, you are satisfied. It is interesting that you can't find Slovene language between 11 translations. We expect it next time.
Donau🕯. Part of every day life.... crosses number of countries and partitions Buda from Pest... good for mini cruises boat rides Margaret island etc

Danube...not blue . Pretty scenery and historic buildings along the Danube River. Walkable rivers. Bring your hat during summer as the sun can get quite intense.

Beautiful, do the night boat cruise. Big river. What can I say? It's one of the longest rivers in Europe. Plenty of excursion boat rides at various locations. Relaxing and pleasant. The only surprise was that it wasn't much cooler on the water than on land.

Blu, only in a song, but...!. To say wonderful river, sounds simple just words, but when in a boat you are "in" it's enough to fill all his story!It happens I saw the rivers of Budapest and Vienna, and I got now a problem to solve: which is the best?

Second largest river in Europe. The Danube is an amazing river, starting at the Black Sea and going all the way through Europe to Germany. It is much quieter in most parts than the Rhine, with more natural wonders. There are locks - large and small, A wonderful way to see a lot very easily. Taking day stops each day in wonderful and picturesque places, ranging from the wonderful Budapest in Hungary, Vienna and Melk in Austria, and passing through a number of countries, such as Bulgaria and Romania. A relaxing and fascinating way to see a lot, whilst enjoying great scenery and learn much about European history.

Viking River Cruise "Danube Waltz". My wife and I took the Viking River Cruise Danube Waltz with another couple in mid-July and had an excellent time. We don't have a lot of experience with cruises, but have taken one in Alaska and one in France/Italy, but this was our first river cruise. I'd read several reviews before we left, and there seems to be a wide spectrum of opinion out there about river cruising, but our experience was much better than we had expected.We flew from Indianapolis thru Amsterdam and into Budapest, arriving two days before we were to set sail on Sunday. We stayed at the Courtyard, which is fairly central and about a mile from the river. Budapest is the highlight of the trip as far as cities go, although Vienna is beautiful as well, but we had already visited Vienna and the itinerary dictated how long we would be in Vienna, so we decided to get a couple extra days in Budapest on the front end of the trip. In talking with other guests, the consensus was that it's best to take any extra time you might want to take in conjunction with a cruise on the front end of the trip, because when the cruise is over you just want to get back home. The cruise ended in Passau, and we were bussed to Munich for our flight home. We had visited Munich in 2013, and you would certainly enjoy taking the trip the other way down the Danube, spending a couple of extra days in Munich on the front end of that trip. (Going that direction is also downstream....which is faster, and may give you more time at each stop)The food and service on the ship, the Viking Legend, were great and better than we had expected. I don't recall a meal where we didn't have several choices, all expertly prepared and accompanied by generous servings of wine and beer. We expected the servers to be skimpy with the alcohol, but believe me....that wasn't the case. We had a German/Austrian dinner one evening, and you could walk back into the ship's galley to be served...which was interesting and cool. Our room was small, but they have done a nice job of squeezing every inch of storage space out of the cabins. There's ample room under the bed for your suitcases, and more than enough room for your other items. The bathroom is also small, but we have hanging toiletry bags that keep everything up off the counters, so space wasn't a problem. There is a nice hot shower, and at 6'1" I had no trouble using it, but the drain is some kind of bilge pump that is quite loud and recycles every 10 seconds or so while one is showering. Didn't bother me, but it takes some getting used to. The internet on these ships is notoriously slow, but I didn't think they would be THAT slow. E-mail would go through eventually, but if you're trying to send home a photo or a large file, forget it. You should be out enjoying yourself.....so quit sending e-mail already! The TV is terrible as well. They offer CNN Europe and a BBC channel. They also have a pamphlet-type abbreviated "newspaper" on board each morning that doesn't give you much but the headlines. Again, you're on vacation, so quit following the news.The staff were all very good, from our room attendant Sasha, to the activity director David, to all of our waiters which are too large a group to mention. (but Darwin was our favorite)The tours, which for the most part are included in the cost of the cruise were interesting, although I keep telling my wife I've seen enough castles and gothic churches to last a lifetime. Most of the other guests were friendly folks, and most were English-speaking. Of the 188 guests, about 160 of them were from the U.S., 13 or so from the U.K., and a handful from Australia. We were afraid these cruises might be a "Floating Nursing Home" as one of our friends suggested, but that wasn't the case either. I'm 63, my wife is 59, and I would guess that we were probably the average age. There were no children under 18 as far as I could tell, and there were a few older people traveling with family members, who were using canes or walkers. Everyone seemed to be active....or were attempting to be active, so I guess that's all you can ask.Our favorite parts of the trip were Budapest, especially leaving the city on Sunday night with all the buildings and bridges illuminated, the walking tour of Pesky Krumlov in the Czech Republic, a wine "tasting" we were bused to one evening in Vienna, and the tour of Vienna.It's also quite pleasant to just sit on the upper deck and watch the European countryside roll by. Early in the trip we spent about two hours navigating through the second-largest lock in Europe, which was pretty exciting. It takes 50 million gallons of water to pump the ship up 20 feet to continue on it's way downriver.All in all we had a great trip, our friends who traveled with us agreed and we've already booked another river cruise next October. We're also trying to encourage some other friends to come along. You meet and hang out with nice people on the cruise, but it's also fun to make the trip with another couple, or friends. If you have friends that don't drive you nuts when you travel together.

Off the track: try the public transportation. Danube is THE landmark of Budapest. By high waters, a northbound (upstream) ride between Petöfi and Arpad bridges may easily take close to 1h30 instead of scheduled 45 minutes, yet basic snacks are available on board. Definitely better deal than commercial tours.

Budapest, the Danube city. I don't think Danube is the blue river, but Budapest is the Danube city for sure. Riviera River Cruise - First Class Service, First Class Holiday. My wife and I enjoyed a week on the Danube on a vessel called the Jane Austin operated by Riviera Cruises. We sailed from Budapest, up to Linz, then back to Budapest.The Jane Austin is only a year old, and the public areas reflected this being bright and airy and not worn at all. Our cabin, on the middle deck had floor to ceiling doors overlooking the river and crucially, air-conditioning, a valuable resource as the weather was very hot during our trip. The cabin came with a refrigerator and, unlike many sea-going ships, supplied with free bottled water every day. That may seem trivial but having that every day was a joy.That joy was shown in the crew. From start to finish every member of staff was cheerful, efficient, caring, professional and did service with a smile. Our usual waitress, named Hristina from Bulgaria, was huge fun, and on a night of comedy laid on by the crew, was the star of the show.The food on board was exceptional. Well done to the chef and his team. Lots of choice, hot and cold, an omelette service at breakfast along with juices, pastries, fruits, yogurts and while some of the meals were on a buffet basis, many were table service and all done with total professionalism.Included in the price of voyage were day trips including Esztergom, Salzburg (OK not on the Danube but worth the hour or so coach ride), Dürnstein, Melk, Abbey, Vienna and Bratislava. We were all wired with earpieces so listening to the tour guides in each of our visits made life easier. My only criticism is that the tour groups (about 45-50 people) were simply too big. Half that number and with extra guides would have been better.All in all I would thoroughly recommend Riviera Cruises. If you want comfort, fun, lots to see and fine food and being looked after by a wonderful team of people – then look no further.

LOTS OF BOAT TRAFFIC. We have traveled all over Europe and its many rivers (Seine, Rhine, Rhone, etc., and other section of the Danube) and have never seen so much tourist boat traffic as we did on the downtown sections of the Danube. Numerous river cruise ships as well as hourly or dinner cruise boats traversed the river from dawn to late at night. There is a nice promenade on the Pest side of the river that is lined with outdoor restaurants/cafes. While the river is not dirty, it no longer is the "Blue Danube". We stayed directly on the Danube at the foot of the Chain Bridge at the Intercontinental Hotel and had a great view of river from our large triple picture window. Highly recommend taking at least the 1 hour 10 minute long scenic boat tour especially on the Danube Legend (Duna Bella) boat that departs from dock 7 near the Marriott Hotel. It offers audio guides in 30 languages and includes 1 glass of wine, beer or other beverage and a glass of lemonade

Not blue but gorgeous.. Taking a trip on the river is always a great way to see a place and this is no exception. It is a lovely river and the building along the river in Budapest are simply stunning. Take your camera.

Viking Danube River Cruise on Legend from Budapest to Passau. We arrived several days prior to cruise start day to visit friends and explore Budapest on our own. We did not receive any email update notifying us where Viking Legend was docked. The taxi driver wasn't sure and took us to all four piers along the river bank where the Viking ships docked to finally locate the Legend at pier 4 below a decrepit looking restaurant. No Viking personnel was present to help. We ended up carrying them down uneven steps to the ships gangplank. That certainly was a very unfavorable first impression. Passengers we met later in the ship restaurant shared similar experiences and security concerns from being told to leave luggage unattended on the curb side. What helped turn us around by the end of the cruise were as follows:1)The stateroom was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the towels were large. The housekeeping stewartNeriza was pleasant and hardworking, always striving to ensure our room was cleaned and resupplied several times daily. 2)The food was well prepared and delicious. There was a wide variety of offerings; we especially like the soup (tasty and hot) and the desserts. Most impressive was how attentive, genuine, and friendly Ruth and Dennis, our servers, were. Ruth, especially, remembered all our personal preferences and have them available so we didn't even have to ask for them.3)The shore excursions were nicely organized. The program director made seamless last minute rearrangements and logistics adjustments to accommodate unforeseen changes conditions. We found out he was also an outstanding singer when he performed on one of the nights. The cruise musician played American songs on the keyboard and sang beautifully. On the downside 1) Our room was right below the sun deck. More than once we were awakened at 6 am by someone jogging. We were glad that bad weather caused a stoppage of this activity stopped when the weather got increasingly windy and rainy. 2) Hand sanitation before entry into restaurant was not as strictly enforced as on ocean cruise ship. Just like our other cruises the ship stopped at many cities; some inevitably shine more brightly than others. Our favorites were Budapest and Vienna. It was a better than expected first River cruise experience.

free cruise. buy a hop on hop off bus ticket, and you get cruises thrown in, as many times as you wish, the bus has so many great stops, its a tussle to see where to go first. there are several routes on the one ticket, so allow plenty of time to see this great city. 48 hour tickets work best. you can purchase fron the hotels, or from reps at the stops.

Danube River. We spent three days in Budapest and walked along the Danube. We had lunch at a very good restaurant along the river. What we found most interesting though was a very simple monument to the Hungarian Jews who were shot and pushed into the river during World War II. The monument consisted of several dozens of shoes--children's, men's, and women's--that were bronzed or steel plated along the river's edge. It was a very moving monument to what had taken place there some 70 years ago.

I liked this better on the Hungarian side. My son and I saw the Danube in Austria surrounded by cell towers and bridges with graffiti. River runs through it. From the waltz music, I had anticipated a much different river. What I found initially disappointed. Phenomenal views from Buda Castle did, however, reinforce my opinion of a waterway as beautiful as refrains from an orchestral performance of Blue Danube. The river became more beautiful as I walked along the promenade. The “Shoes Memorial” (metal sculptures that represent shoes of Jews shot, their bodies dumped into the river) near the famous Chain Bridge and a dozen other memorials make for a full day of appreciation of Budapest—at no cost! But what caused me to most appreciate the Blue Danube was a night cruise on my last full day in Budapest. I had already visited many of the hundreds of attractions Budapest offers, so I was able to recognize many as the small cruise boat made a roundtrip voyage past these fabulous sites. Pedestrians on Chain Bridge waved a warm welcome as we passed below. The most memorable sights were Parliament and Buda Castle, both bathed in soft light that made them look like the fairyland castles that they are. High on the Buda Hill is Hungary’s version of Statue of Liberty, also bathed in a beacon of light. The Danube is far more than a waterway through a thriving European cosmopolitan city. It is that area’s lifeblood and probably the single most factor that contributed to Budapest’s origins and culture.

A beautiful river and some spectacular buildings along the way. A river cruise along the Danube in Budapest is a 'must' and you will not be disappointed. There are many options and all seem good, but the best option is the 2 free river cruises with the City Tour Hop on Hop off ticket.
Relaxing moment..... If you are tired of walking and walking and walking....take a tour through the Danubio river... I would recommend to do it during sunset...you won't regret it!

Night cruise. If you are only going to do one cruise on The Danube, make it the night time cruise; the city and major buildings lit up make for a wonderful backdrop to the cruise and a fantastic photo opportunity.
Beautiful. The river is amazing. We enjoyed a cruise up and down the river before commencing our 14 day trip. It is everything I imagined it to be.

Everything romantic you ever heard about this river is true!

Lovely views. Peaceful and amazing. At night perfect lightning and really fun tours. If you want to do a Boat tour and you have a ticket to Dock 10, you should be there early to take a good sit up at the air, because inside is ugly and the sound of the motor doesn't let you listen to the explanation, also there is a strong smelling of fuel.

Viking Danube Cruise Budapest to Nuremberg. This was our first Viking river cruise and we are already looking to book our next one. While the cost of the cruise is not inexpensive, the investment was well worth the money. The staff (Captain, Program Director, service providers, shore excursion tour guides and even the excursion bus drivers) are well trained, knowledgeable, courteous and go out of their way to make the vacation fun and memorable. The food was outstanding with a wide array of options and an effort was made to match cuisine with the area we were visiting at the time. The excursions we booked were all outstanding. The state rooms are understandably smallish, but with the amount of time spent there, this was inconsequential. We extended our stay beyond Nuremberg with a 3-day visit to Prague where the Viking personnel continued to be top notch and with us every step of the way. HIGHLY recommended!

Emerald River Cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam. Along with my brother and his wife, my wife and I had planned this river cruise trip for two years. We boarded the Emerald Sky on June 24 from Budapest and sailed toward our final destination Amsterdam and arrived on July 9. The 14 days cruise was spectacular, the views along the Danube and the Rhine rivers of ancient castles and small towns made this vacation an amazing and rewarding experience.The ship: the state room (Balcony Suite) was spacious, provided excellent storage space to enable us to easily unpack and store our clothes, comfortable beds and included a large size shower. The Horizon Lounge provided a wonderful view as the ship travels the rivers; although ample seating is available, some of the chairs were uncomfortable. The main dining area, Reflections, is well divided and provide a variety of seating arrangements, tables of two, four, six and even larger group; my only observation is that because of the ship’s size and the fact that there is only one dining room and only one seating, the room tends to be noisy at times. The Sun Deck area is well equipped with regular chairs and tables as well as lounging chairs you can use whether you wish to take in some sun or lie under covered areas in the shade. Another thing we noticed was the cleanliness of all the common areas and the washrooms. The ship is also equipped with an elevator for people with mobility problems.The food: the dining room is open for all three meals, providing buffet service for breakfast and lunch and a full service for the supper seating. The Horizon Lounge also provides a self-service “lite lunch”. The variety of food is well presented, hot and the trays are constantly replenished. The super dining provides a special “chef” meal which varies daily and included Chateaubriand and duck; the desserts were also fantastic. Worth noting that, during our 14 days the chef’s suggestions were never repeated.The service: all of the crew are unbelievably friendly, from a cheerful good morning, asking passengers how their day was going, how we enjoyed our daily excursions and promptly responding to any of our questions or special requests. I would like to acknowledge special people who made our trip special and provided excellent service: Patricia, our Cruise Director, was very well prepared in giving clear and precise information during her daily “ports of call” presentations as well as answering all our personal questions concerning extra excursions we had booked; she was constantly available at her desk and she was attentive to hear our comments on local guides when we returned to the ship. Patricia also provided interesting commentary information as we sat on the sun deck and travelled along the rivers. At our final passenger meeting, she provided clear and easy to follow instructions on the disembarking procedure we would have to follow on the day we left the ship.
