I would also like to mention the exceptional and cheerful service we received from Mohamed and Padlo in the dining room and Eugene at the Horizon Lounge.City Tours: when in port, accompanied by knowledgeable local guides who provided us with historical and on occasion humorous facts about the villages and cities we are visiting. With the exception of two guides, our visits were very enjoyable; I would like to mention Eva, the local guide in Salzburg, who made our visit to the city memorable. If you are looking for a special excursion to enjoy classical music, I would recommend you book the “private” (for our cruise ship only) evening concert in Vienna which was held at the Music Theater with a group of young and experienced musicians and singers; the performance was held in the same hall where Beethoven conducted and performed his third symphony. The music of Mozart and Strauss filled the room and made this an exceptional evening to remember.This was our first river cruise experience and we would not hesitate to recommend Emerald Cruise.Finally, I would like to make certain observations that neither the travel brochure nor the Emerald presentation we attended prior to our booking provide the potential clients: the numerous locks between Nuremburg and Amsterdam, a total of 68; although most of them are done during the night, the ship has to wait during the day if the other traffic is coming out or going into the locks; although the weather is uncontrollable, this year’s high water level and the height of certain bridges prevented us from using the sun deck for numerous days during our trip; when arriving in port, it was common for our ship to be parked beside other ships which, depending on your cabin, can block the view in your room and also force you to disembark by crossing through several ships (stairs could be an issue for certain people), at one time we were the fourth ship from the pier; and finally, in some ports we were docked in industrial sections of the cities far from the cities we were visiting, unable to walk to the centre and had to be bused into the city centres.
Easy sight seeing trip. Easy sight seeing trip, take the local public transport ferries up and down the Danube. Very cheap and you get to see the best sights from the comfort of the Ferry.

Highlight of Budapest. The Danube river divides the budapest area in 2 parts. Buda and pest. Buda side is old fashioned with Buda castle, while the pest area is the modern happening side. Walk across the Chain breeze and enjoy the feeling.

Lovely boat ride.. Use your hop on tour ticket which has boat ride option, not at all over crowded. Lovely cruise on Danube and relaxing. The sights of old monuments, on both sides - Buda & Pest, including the castle, the Parliament, the Chain bridge etc for an hour is worth it. You can even have dinner / beers etc on the boat.

It was admittably a pretty nice river. I was a pretty nice river to look at and walk by. Also nice with all the bridges so you can walk in different paths and do not have to go for only one side. It is a also a great way to navigate around the city, and gives the opportunity for good photos.

Sailing the Danube offers the best views of the most beautiful Budapest buildings. However you manage to view the city via the Danube (River Cruise, day cruise) you do not want to miss the opportunity to view the Parliament building (by day and night) as well as the beautiful buildings of Buda and Pest. Cross the bridges by foot as well to admire the views -- just don't climb up on them as we saw some young people doing. What might seem daring to some is stupidity to others.The Danube is not blue -- unless, as multiple guides told us, you have had a bottle of wine, but the song cannot help but roll through one's head when sailing this lovely River.

Very beautiful . The Danube was really wet. I did not expect it to be so. I had to walk on a bridge to pass it because it was so big, much bigger than a small Lake. It was very beautiful, especially at night, definitely one of the most beautiful places I've ever visited.
The Best Way to See the City. Find a way to get on the Danube! We took a night boat trip and loved the beautiful views. We also crossed several of the bridges during our stay.
Nice boat trip with great views. On this boat trip we took lots of photos as the views only make sense from this angle. It was the best way to view the parliament building, which was very impressive.
One of the most beautiful views in Europe!. Winter isn´t the best time to know Budapest because of the weather, but the Danube is always amazing!

Emerald waterways cruise. We had a wonderful trip on the Danube from Bucharest to Budapest. We cruised with Emerald Waterways who are slightly cheaper than others but still of superb quality. Good, well appointed ship, excellent trips, brilliant staff.
Hour cruise . Lovely views along the danube. Beautiful city sights is a must see along the river. We were lucky to have glorious weather which added to a wonderful trip.

The true Blue Danube. If there is only one thing that you do in Budapest it has to be to take an evening dinner cruise along the Danube. The food will be delicious without a doubt, but the real surprise is the city once the sun sets. The illuminations of the buildings are amazing and the best way to see them is from the river. As you cruise along your breath will be taken away at the beauty of this wonderful city and it's buildings. Of course, you can just wander along the river at different parts of the city and admire the bridges that span her from Buda to Pest.

Three couples. First river cruise. The boat was new and although the cabins are small they are well designed. The staff were beyond reproach. They even did a stage act half way through the week's cruise and whilst a bit too.long, one act was hilariously funny and very well done. The whole cruise was well organised and the guides, Stewart and Jill, were first class and very helpful. My favorite city was Salzburg but everyone had a different point of view. This is so different from a sea cruise, the proximity to the river banks, views from the boat, make it a more intimate experience. The food was good to very good and as there were only around 140 people on board, service was always good. Would I go again? Yes. With Riviera? Yes.

As pleasant experience. One should definitely take the cruise across the river. We took it in the evening . The monuments on the river are very well lit and good breeze blows across. It is a very pleasant experience.

Beautiful . The Danube flows in Budapest thus dividing the city into buda and pest .. Both the sides are really beautiful .. The river itself adds to the beauty .. Enjoy ur evening coffee or drinks at the many restaurants located on the banks

A no brainer...take a river cruise at night on the river. If you have come to Budapest, you absolutely must do one of the river cruises, especially during the evening when all the buildings and bridges are lit. We spent about an hour cruising and that is about the right amount of time. The Parliament building is sensational at night. Definitely do this!!

Romantic. Exiting, you are over Danube.! Connecting two side, Buda and Pest. A big water road. It flows on and on again, never stops. You watch, you feel inside. A large perspective of the whole city. You see all by a quick look. Sunset..!!

Slow boat up the river. We took the D13 boat up the river - since the Danube flows really fast towards the Black Sea, going up took a long time. We went past the island and to the last stop which is a lovely spot with many food stalls and play areas for children. We went to Fellini's which serves food and drink from a kind of shack. The kids could play on the swings over the river (it is shallow here and forms a beach with deck chairs etc.)

Not been in BP if you haven't seen Danube. Visit and see it from all the bridges, from above in top off the hill, at night time and daytime. Water is usually always a great to watch, gives you ease and pleasure. Remember, there used to be Buda & Pest not Budapest! :-)
The best thing in Budapest. I have walked over the Danube every single day of my stay in the city. It's very beautiful and I recommend seeing it during daylight and during night as well.

The best sight by night I have seen in any city. I have travelled the world and have not seen a more beautiful sight than the buildings on either side of the Danube lit up during the night. The Parliament, Palace, Bridge, all lit presented a glorious view of what is one of the most beautiful cities in the world
Great. What a fantastic view on Danube on the sides great hotels,Chain bridge,parliament & fishermans bastion.Crowded with cruises small & big

Beautiful!. We took an evening cruise along the Danube and we had the opportunity to see all the landmarks at evening time. All of them are incredibly beautiful and the bridges as well. A must-do in Budapest.

Awesome. You must take a cruise on the danube......its fabulous! Large boats. The price of mine included 2 drinks. You can see most of the sights from the boat. Parliament building is impressive but chain bridge is breathtaking.....even better at night when its all lit up

You Will Know Why Strauss Wrote Blue Danube. Walk along the pathways that parallel the river, or walk across the Chain Bridge, and you may find Johann Strauss's music resonating in your mind as you drink in the beauty of this legendary river. Look across at the Parliament building reflected in the quiet waters, or watch the river cruises as they head upstream, and you'll fall in love with this most European of waterways. You really can't miss the Danube when you visit Budapest, and you shouldn't.
Beautiful. go for an early morning run and take in the city as it awakens. Do it along the banks of the danube and its bridges.

The lifeblood of Buda and Pest. The mighty Danube separates Buda and Pest so it and its bridges play an important part in the history of the City.The river is a muddy colour and by no stretch of the imagination can be described as blue but you eyes are constantly drawn away from the river itself to the vistas on each side.The walks alongside the river are not particularly pleasant with your proximity to heavy traffic and limited greenery and shade. However a boat trip is a must. Although a sailing at night to see all the buildings and monuments illuminated is spectacular, so is a trip during the day is equally enjoyable as there are so many photo opportunities.

A must at night!. We took a wonderful dinner cruise at 10 pm ..the whole city was lit up and spectacular. The food wasn't great to say the least, but there was an amazing band playing music of all nationalities..the atmosphere was romantic to die for!

Best kind of vacation!. This was my second Viking River cruise and again, I was not disappointed. We went from Budapest to Nurenberg. We were greeted by Marcos as we boarded who showed us to our room. Turns out he was actually the Maitre D and was a joy to get to know throughout the cruise. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. As it is open seating, my friend and I chose to pick different people to sit with most of the time. It was a joy to get to know so many interesting people and hear their stories. My first Viking Cruise was 5 years ago and I would say the average age of the passengers this time was at least 5 to 10 years younger. Oliver, the program director, was ever present, making certain the passengers were well taken care of. With excursions included every day, he had his hands full. Dragan, our bar tender was very accommodating and fun to get to know. The outdoor areas of the boat give everyone a lot of choices to relax. The best part of a river cruise is that you have scenery all the time, there are only 200 friendly passengers, good food with lots of choices and excursions included. The one downside was that we booked a veranda room on the second level but most of the time when we were docked, we were side-tied to a sister ship. I still tell everyone that a river cruise is my favorite vacation! Now if we could only find a way to have less crowds in the ports, it would be perfect.
Wonderful by boat. Specially at night, when the main buildings are lighted (specially the Parliament), honestly, not to be missed

Take a stroll up and down the Danube. One of the first things we did in Budapest was stroll up and down the Danube, between the Chain and Liberty bridges. Down the Pest side and up the Buda side. Nice wide sidewalks on both sides. Great views of the river and the sites on the other side. Nice romantic stroll. The Pest side also makes for a lovely evening walk when the sidewalks and cafes are bustling.
Night time cruise -magnificent!. We took a cruise of the Danube at night at it presented breath taking views of all their major buildings. It is an incredible experience!

Amsterdam to Budapest on the Emerald Sky. Our travel consultant suggested Emerald Waterways (Evergreen Tours is the Australian agent) as a low cost but good quality river cruise company - she was correct on both counts. This was our first river cruise (although we have done a number of ocean cruises) and we wish to congratulate Evergreen and Emerald for a fantastic experience which far exceeded our expectations. Embarkation was smooth and we were able to board not long after midday and had lunch and all afternoon to unpack and settle in. The next morning, we were taken on an Amsterdam canal cruise in small glass roofed boats which was very good. We were impressed by the layout and quality of the ship (only two years old). The public spaces were excellent but we were unable to use the sun deck when passing under low bridges which meant that we did not use it for a number of days as it is quite a job to lower and raise the safety rails and deck furniture. This is an observation not a complaint as it is part of river cruising.The food was excellent with good variety and good quality. The beer and wine were not cheap house varieties. Breakfast was a buffet style with a wide choice ranging from Continental to hot food with an omelette/egg cooking station staffed by a chef. Lunch was again a buffet with a wide and varied range of hot and cold foods.Wi-Fi reception could be patchy due to the hills and gorges through which the river passed but we were warned of that in the pre-embarkation literature. Not really a problem.The itinerary, shore excursions and tour guides were excellent and we had a reasonable amount of free time on shore. The ports in which we stopped were excellent. The daily on-board entertainment was excellent including the resident piano player/DJ, Norbert, and the Oompah band and Hungarian dance troupe, among others.Not the least important was friendliness and excellence of the staff. We were especially impressed by the cruise director, Ray, who was always helpful, cheerful, knowledgeable and informative and always available. When we had to travel by coach for two days due to high water levels, he was sympathetic and very helpful and kept us informed of what was happening. Also, Maritta, the hotel director, was excellent as she was always cheerful and helpful. In our opinion, they were the icing on the cake! However, all the staff and crew were friendly and helpful.We were very impressed with the effort put in by the head office staff in organising excellent coach transport and 4+ star accommodation when we were unable to continue on the river. This certainly did not detract from our experience as we completed all but one of our tours and did not miss any meals or included drinks. Often the back office goes unnoticed but we acknowledge that they did a great job in keeping us going. Luckily, we were able to rejoin the ship a couple of days before Budapest.Disembarkation was very smooth and as we had a 2 pm transfer to the airport, we stayed in the Horizon lounge and had lunch before we disembarked - sad to leave the ship.We will certainly be recommending Evergreen Tours (Australia) to our friends and would certainly travel again with Emerald.

So much history from these riverbanks. We took a sunset cruise and had a couple of drinks whilst enjoying the views and rich cultural history the riverbanks offer.About the coolest place to escape to during sunset in the unbearable June/July heat.Make sure to put this on your to do list.

amazing experience. staff is friendly and always looking to go beyond their duties. great tours that are most of them included on the price , the guides are knowledgable. the views are amazing and the sailing is smoth.
Admire from the banks or cruise along. The cruise on the river Danube was a delight. Wonderful sights great commentary and nice drinks on board all make for a great experience.

Danube divides Buda and Pest. On the two shores of the Danube river lies Buda and Pest. It is connected by several bridges, which all were destroyed during WW II. You have magnificent views on the city from both side. It is a very pleasant activity to take a boat ride on the river.

Magic trip by boat. I recommend a trip by boat in the evening, it is better to choose the road because wine is included in the price, and meals are cheaper and generally comes out better priced. Beautifully looks Budapest in the evening, look for a ship with an open upper-terrace
Beautiful river . Lots of sights to see walking along the river. Several impressive buildings and bridges. Tour boats are frequent on the river and a good way to see things.

A Lovely Place to Walk. Budapest is an excellent city for walking. We were lucky to have a brilliant, sunny day to enjoy walking along the Danube. There are plenty of choices to stop for a drink or meal and numerous bridges to cross.
We recommend setting off with good walking shoes and enjoying the Danube.

No longer Blue but the Danube is still beautiful. A must do in summer in Budapest is a boat trip along the Danube. Even the shorter one hour tours are brilliant. The boats are comfortable, safe and give you a brilliant view. The commentary (for those who want to listen -and it is worth it) is provided through headphones with individual language settings in 27 languages. Budapest is a beautiful city and the Danube is its soul.
Lovely walk & cruise. Walking along the river was lovely, clean, mostly litter free and very relaxing.A cruise along to Margaret's island was also very good. A definite must.

boat trip on the danube. enjoyed a very nice warm eveining on board a pleaure boat one evening down the Danube, the ticket wa part of our hop on hop of bus ticket. whilst a good way to see the city especially at night, glad we didnt pay extra as the information was difficutl to understand

A Must-do!. All of Budapest is centered around the Danube, so it makes sense to take a river cruise while you're there! We recommend the Legenda cruise. In the summer, the 9:00 cruise has you on the water for both sunset and all the lights.

the big river. Rivers are everywhere, Rome has got its "flavus Tiberis", Paris the Seine. But just walk until the midpoint of a Budapest bridge, close your eyes, forget all the 2-D images your mind is full of, in modern days, and then REOPEN your eyes and enjoy the majesty and might of the Danube. Walk back again, that will let you feel better how big it is ! And if you want an inexpensive trip, literally, try one of the very basic BKK ships, it is included in your public transportation card on weekdays - free ! - and you pay a tiny sum on weekends. Just do it near sunset when the Parliament reflects the warm tones of the falling sun.Do it in summer, when some fresh air will be the extra to enjoy, on the slow movement of the inexpensive BKK service, from Jaszai Mari Tér to the Bazar.

Relaxing river. Not sure how to rate the river?? Location to the river really make the difference. But I would say that sitting in the park watching the river boats was very nice. Thrre is many nice locations to enjoy it. The island was one of our favourites. Sitting on the grass with a little music and a nice Hungarian beer. Refreshing to find very little to no trash in or around. Take advantage of spending some time watching it roll by.

Not so blue.... On our first visit to Budapest, we were looking forward to seeing the Danube. Its not blue now but very brown and untidy due to the branches of trees caught up in wires and cable from previous fast flowing waters. Nevertheless, we took both a day cruise and a night cruise and it is possible to have different ways of seeing the same sights. The day cruise included a visit to Margaret Island and a stop-off on the Buda side opposite the Parliament building. I bought the night cruise tickets from a young lady who was selling them outside the Intercontinental Hotel for about £17 for two which included a free day cruise the following day. The normal cost of a night cruise is about £27. The night cruise allowed us to see the Parliament building fully lit up which was an amazing sight.

Great way to see the city!. On our first evening in Budapest, we took a boat tour with Legenda cruises down the Danube! It was a fabulous way to see the city! We went as the sun was beginning to set, so we got to see the city during daylight and as the brilliant lights came on. Highly recommend this activity!

Do both the day time & night time cruises, worth every cent!. We were initially reluctant to do the cruise twice, but decided to go ahead. It was the best experience! Worth the extra cost.The morning cruise was less crowded, about 90 minutes with a stop at the island, the commentary along with the cruise is phenomenally informative. You can get off at the island in the middle of the Danube and do a short cycle tour, we decided not to.The night cruise is amazing, the entire riverside buildings are lit up and just look amazing. Take a good quality camera, the phone cameras do not do justice. It is also chillier in the night, take a light jumper or stole. Get there a bit early too, you have to line up to get into the ferry, and all the good seats get taken!

Do a River Cruise!. Budapest has the most beautiful river sites, as well as river bank. Especially when compared to other European cities such as Vienna. In Budapest, we did Hop on Hop Off Bus, and River Cruise, tours. It is wonderful since they explain all of the sites, and the Bridges, etc. We greatly enjoyed being on the Danube, as well as walking it's banks.

Overlooking Danube only from riverbank is NOT enough!. Overlooking Danube only from riverbank is NOT enough - you should also overlook the riverbanks from Danube - that's a big difference - day or night, short or long, dining or only viewing.

Lovely Cruise over Lunch and had a nice view!. Our tour group of 32 came by and took the 1.5 hour cruise where our tour agency had chartered the entire cruise for all of us, where we could enjoy a sumptuous buffet lunch (with wine) while we enjoyed our cruise along Danube River.It was sunny but cooling when our cruise set sail at about 1.00pm. Once onboard the cruise, the waiting staff handed each one of us with a welcome drink (white wine) and when seated, more wine bottles were placed on our dinning table and soon after, we were invited to help ourselves with the buffet.Honestly the spread of the buffet was not massive but they were all local cuisines and we had the opportunity the taste Hungarian food. Generally, they were quite nice and yummy.As the cruise sailed along the river where we passed by several bridges, from time to time, we went out to have a look at the scenery as the position we were in was in between the Old and New towns (that's why its called Buda and Pest). We saw many lovely buildings under the clear blue sky and what really attracted and impressed us was the Parliament buildings. It was so grand and beautiful.Well, each country is unique and different from one another and just realize that. Do not compare it with other countries as each is unique and has its speciality. Have an open mind and try to learn and adapt in and you will learn to appreciate the beauty and loveliness of what you see and experience.We enjoyed our cruise over lunch as it presented another view perspective of the city instead of looking at it from the top of the hill. We believe that if we were to take the cruise in the evening, it would be prettier with the special lightings from the bridges and building, they should look more gorgeous!
A boat trip is a must. Use the hop on hop off bus option and travel on the Danube for a totally different view of the wonderful city scape.

The mighty Danube corralled by Budapest but not tamed! . It's a great sight to see this ancient water way from the many bridges and countless viewing points and think back to how this river has influenced this city and many others over the last thousand years. Teaming with all kinds of boats and surrounded by impressive structures and hills on all sides it's hard to find anyplace that won't be a great photo!
Rather grubby looking river. Average city river without much to offer. Brown water. Quite wide and standard river trips available
Chill out afternoon. Took the ride along Danube to explore the entire stretch along Budapest. Worth the trip if you are keen to explore the city.

Public transport 7 day travel card. Our 7 day travel card gave us access to travel up and down the Danube by boat as often as we liked. In temperatures of 30-34 it was bliss to travel by boat, sitting in the shade enjoying the cooling breeze rather than by tram or bus.

Beautiful. The Danube is beautiful. We took a boat ride down the Danube and it was well worth the trip. We even visited a family member in country Hungary and saw a different part of the Danube amongst the hills. Beautiful
A wonder. The second longest river in Europe certainly does not disappoint. It's a wonder to behold and something people should make time to see & appreciate.

Excellent one hour cruise. We did the one hour sight-seeing cruise, leaving at 9p.m. It was perfect as all the lights had just started coming on for the night. The commentary was really interesting and the free drink was very welcome as we had walked for ages to find the correct gate for the cruise.

I assume that we are talking of the river.. The Danube is an amazing river to travel on. I had never been through a lock before and was thrilled to be able to experience being on a boat that is lifted via water to get to the next level. The scenery all along is wonderful and very different from anything I had experienced before.

A nice way to see a lot and relax at the same time. When you are tired of walking around Budapest's many sights, this is an excellent way of seeing the city from the river. You learn quite a bit about the sights you pass on the way. Especially when it is hot this is a super way to catch a cool breeze and rest your tired feet! Don't think it makes much difference which company you use, the day time trips last about an hour and all take the same route.

View From the River is Stunning!. We took an evening dinner cruise and saw a stunning view of Budapest from the Danube. We had walked and bus-toured during the daylight but the view of the city at night from the river gives a very different perspective. So many of the bridges and buildings are lit, the city looks like a fairytale!

A nice relax. Spending this hour for the danube trip is worth it's money. Not only that it allows oneself some recovery for the tired feet from sightseeing, we actually get a very nice overview of some of Budapests best places

Beautiful. We were taken around Budapest by night tour which was spectacular, completely different view of the city. The tour guide who also took the daytime tour told us the belief they have that people will see the Danube water as blue when they are in love. And by the time you have spend a day in Budapest you will. They also had a massive get together when we were there on chain bridge and by the sides of the Danube which was wonderful to see.

Night time cruise. We bought a hop on-hop off bus ticket that included a night time cruise up and down the river. I feel this was the best option to see the river and buildings lit up at night. A running commentary was given in English as well as German. Definitely recommended.

River cruise on Danube . When we booked our city bus tour with the Big Bus tour we got a FREE river cruise on the Danube. We saw the city from a different perspective and had lunch on board while we watched the beauty of the city..... Just amazing ... Has to be done

Budapest. Our river tour started in Budapest, on the Danube river. The river runs through the city and spotlights the entire area. Viking River Cruise had a perfect location, near downtown and we were able to see the river and surrounding area during the two day visit.

Holds the city together. Whether you travel up it on the many boats or you just sit and eat next to it in its many cafe and restaurants you won't be disappointed. It holds buda and pest together and has many many bridges connecting the two cities

Dream River. Just like a picture post card. Wonderful to watch the Danube in Budapest. A boat cruise, specially at night is definitely worth it.bthe parliament building, Buda Castle and other historic buildings lit up make it an unforgettable experience.

Beautiful Danube!. We took the boat from dock8A and did the evening ride which lasts for an hour and the sights were spectacular.Once the lights are up...all the attractions come to life:-)A must do when in Budapest!

River cruise with AMA Waterways. From Bucharest to Budapest - 10 family members. Other that the extremely hot temperatures (high90F) the river cruise was stellar. Lots to see and do if you could weather the heat.
A must do. Lovely day for a trip up the river with commentary, you can hop on and off if you want to stop off at the island for a picnic or walk around it.

Frozen. It was actually January we went two years back but I don't have that option to select from the drop down, the river was frozen, there was a tug boat slowly moving and breaking through the ice, we leaned on the bridge to look over and we all felt a bit quezon, it was as if we and the bridge was moving and not the boat.
Most beautiful and. I am living Buda and every day travelling to Pest sie for work. Each day help me to start a woring day and relax me at the end of the hard day.I love it.

You'll see it anyway. You can't not see the Danube in Budapest, as so many of the must see sights in the city are along the river. Of course, this makes the Danube particularly beautiful, as it is framed on both sides by spectacular architecture.
Lovely walk. This is a beautiful stretch of the river with views oof the castle and parliament building on either side. Definitely good for a walk.
Not blue. The river runs through the city and is worth seeing. Buda is on one side and Pest the other. Both sides are worth seeing but don't expect blue water.

Take a cruise. Beautiful to see the architecture from the river. You can purchase ticket directly at the pier. Would advice to do one in the morning and one in the evening after sunset to see the parliament building all lit up.

Nice Bridge over the Danube River. Lots of long ships that server as floating restaurants and tourist spot. Clean river overlooking the parliament and the other castles. Budapest has lots of these castles omg!

Hours Cruise stopping at Margaret Island. We took a Danube Cruise lasting an hour past the main landmarks and stopping off as long as you wanted at Margaret Island ( a good way to visit the Island.) Despite its romantic reputation the Danube is a fast flowing mud brown river but it is one of the best ways to view the City, with most of the principle monuments and buildings on view. In particular Castle Hill, The Chain Bridge and The Parliament. There was a English commentary. There were refreshments on board

Boat Party. With our hostel, we joined a boat party on the river at night. Stunning views and amazing experience to see the classical parliament, monuments and hills lit up at night. Worth trying to get on a boat party if you can!If not, still lovely to see during the day!

Beautiful Blue Danube (it is brown and brackish). Budapest is fabulous!. Visit everything in Budapest! The Parliament building is fantastic and the visitor's center there, undeground, is marvelous...including the unique gift shop. The Fisherman's Bastille is another part of town, on the other side of the Bridge and well worth spending an afternoon exploring and photographing. English is spoken. Use the safe and streamlined above ground city rail system. Buy some beautiful clothes, too.But, the highlight is an evening RT cruise on the Danube to witness the spectacular lights -- This is the new "CITY OF LIGHTS" (sorry, Paris, you have been outdone!) I could live here! This is the best city in Eastern Europe!
Danube cruise. Must enjoy the Danube cruise especially during night. The experience is wonderful..all the buildings along the banks are well lighted which gives a great view

By MS Beethoven on the Danube. An amazing holiday.It was decided that my wife and I would take a holiday this year, and after many starts and stops it was decided that we would take a cruise on the Danube.Now I have to be honest, I hate curries and I am a hopeless sailor.The Cruise line that we opted for was “Croisi Europe” It is a French company and has set menu and had optional excursions at every stop that one can pick and choose from. My big worry as I said was that I would not like the food if and if the boat started to rock about on a choppy Danube I would be in a bad way. In reality as far as I was concerned the “Mal de mer” never happened.The fact is all the meals were excellent but due to a medical problem I can’t digest alcohol. One of the desserts had this dreaded alcohol but within seconds it was replaced by an alternate dessert. I never had to tell the waiting staff about this again, anything with alcohol was immediately replaced without me informing anybody. It was just like magic.To those that need pampering then this type of holiday is for them. One is watched over like someone very special and every comfort that one needed is there for you. Wine, beer and soft drinks are free and in plentiful supply. If one cared to lounge out on the sun deck, the drinks, tea or coffee are brought to you. As the Euro football was on a big TV screen in the reception area, the bar waitress appeared every twenty minutes with another supply of beer. It is difficult to beat this type of service.All the staff on the ship are truly extraordinary in their attention to details and anything that one could ask for was sorted within minutes. I saw one of the managers, Andre sort out an extremely irate guest that was very much showing his annoyance with him, talking in an aggravated manner. Andre reminded me of pouring oil on troubled waters. He did it with such ease and calmness that within a few minutes the guest went away very happy. I spoke to this man concerned later and he was delighted with the way his problem had been sorted. This is the staff we encountered with Croisi Europe. This sort of thing happens in all sorts of situations but unless you see it personally it goes unnoticed. Andre was ever vigilant and on one occasion I was trying to have a conversation with the Captain who had no English and Andre very unobtrusively offered to interpret for me. He deserves a gold star and well deserves it for tactfulness and his ease of manner with the holiday makers.The staff member that deserves two gold stars is Soninha, the hotel manager. She has five languages in which she is totally fluent in. To me it seemed she never went to bed. I saw her organising a tour at before 06.30 and she was still on duty at 22.30 that night. She looked after the guests so well and yet she was totally unobtrusive. We had a small problem with our room and within two or three minutes the whole matter was sorted.She is the type of manager that every industry needs. It is called “management by walking around” She sees a potential problem and acts. Diffusing a situation. Well, done Soninha you made two people very satisfied with their holiday choice.A cruise on the Rhine is next on the agenda and without doubt we will be traveling with Croisi Europe and hopefully we will have Soninha and Andre looking after us.

See it on Vking's Danube Waltz Cruise. I cannot imagine a better way to enjoy the Danube than to cruise it on one of Viking River Cruises' Longships. We were only in each port long enough for me to know I had to come back, but we loved every minute of it. From remarkable large cities like Budapest and Vienna, to cute little towns like Dernstien and Melk, every stop along the way will be a gem. Our cruise was the Danube Waltz itinerary and it was excellent.
Must Cruise!. If you travel there and have a sunny weather, dont miss the chance to cruise on Danube!! It's so romantic!
Great danube trip. Great boat trip down the Danube, especially on the night time when it is all lit up, buy 3day travel ticket for the hop on hop off bus includes 2 trips on the Danube

Stunning Night Cruise!. I tried a dinner cruise in my previous visit to Budapest. The food was ok but not great, the views on the other hand were absolutely stunning!If I ever visit again, I'll take the "om deck" option for the cruise

The Danube amazed me!. My first visit to Budapest and I was amazed by the size of the Danube, it was massive and considering it was not tidal, the speed of the current was startling - not a river to fall into! Also, there was plenty to watch with massive cruise ships arriving and leaving at regular intervals
Great views either side.. What do you expect from a large river running through a city? You got it, great views and nice places to sit, drink and while away the day.

The Lifeline of 2 cities. This river not only divides the 2 cities of Buda & Pest but connects them also through multiple bridges built over it. The cool breeze around the river refreshes an individual. The view in the night is unique.

Colour not blue,!. Sailed down the Danube on a river cruise,Just some info.it is said the reason it was called the blue Danube was because of all the dead soldier killed and thrown in with there blue uniforms,Don't really know if this is true.

Riverboat trip on the Danube. We decided that a trip to Budapest would not be complete without a trip on the Danube, how romantic we thought, but were disappointed as there was not very much to see along the way and it ended in a massive thunderstorm, and we all got soaked as it was a long way to walk back to the town, glad we did it but not as good as we expected

Nice way to see the sights of Budapest. Did a boar cruise on the Danube while visiting Budapest in September. The day time temps were still decent enough to make the boat trip pleasant, although evenings were chillier. I would recommend starting late afternoon and then you get to see the lights come on in all the historic buildings as the cruise progresses. We booked a tour without a meal option which was fine, nice way to experience the city and to pass a few leisurely hours.

Night time boat trip - worth it!. I went on a evening boat trip with Legenda Cruises, and it was definitely a highlight of the holiday - I recommend around sunset/night time as the best time to go on one (although Legenda also offers day cruises which include a trip to Margaret Island). The city lights up at night time, and it looks stunning. You can book in advance (expedia has more options than trip advisor, and you can google more), but there's a lot of operators touting their trips down by the Danube - compare them all, as some are longer, include meals, feature shows or commentaries, or are on bigger boats. Legenda had one of the smaller boats (maybe 50 max?), which we preferred, and though the windows weren't particularly clean there were seats out on the viewing deck which were better for taking photographs. We had audio commentary headsets and a video too, which was a bit cheesy, but quite informative and probably good for kids. All in all, pretty great! Definitely a must do for Budapest.

Mighty Danube. Always fascinating. Stroll, cross over, watch the sunrise or the sunset and enjoy the fabulous views on both side of the river. From Rudas bath you can watch it all day without getting bored!

High Water Be Damned. We were on a Tauck river cruise from Budapest to the Black Sea, and I was afraid it was going to be cancelled due to high water. However, we learned that there are no low bridges on this stretch of the Danube, so it was not an issue. This was a great river cruise, with stops in Hungary, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, and Romania. Eastern Europe is less well know to Americans than Western Europe, and there is a rich history on this stretch of the river to absorb.

Take a boat ride. We decided to go on a boat ride around sunset, and I would definitely recommend this time of day. It's lovely to be on the water as the lights of the city are starting to be lit, and the views of both Pest and Buda are breath-taking. Don't forget to bring a sweater or light jacket, even in summer. It can get quite chilly on the top deck even if it's warm in the city.

Viking jarl Danube cruise Nuremberg to Budapest. I give this cruise 5 Stars although the pre holiday customer relations were poor due to lack of daily info as the Danube moved towards high water.The actual holiday was great and recommend Viking Did have one gripe over a 17 euro for two glasses of wine! I only signed for 8.5 euro!Only one behind the counter unfriendly lady, everyone else great.I do need to point out the Viking "recommended tipping levels are a poor wording. All other 25 sea cruises have incurred cabin steward tipping but never the programme organiser as that is supposed to be the holiday. Still give it 5 stars but do please read the T&C
night cruise. Beautiful to see the Danube and the architecture at night with all the go.den light haloing the buildings. Very good description too, with just enough detail

Great. Obvious choice if you're going to Budapest. It's a famous river! There are several bridges, boats etc. If you're going to visit Budapest, the Danube river, lit up at night, is definately worth doing. The Giraffe Hop On bus (we had 48 hrs) has a free BOAT night cruise. We took the last one at 22:00 (from Dock 8A), so was dusk to start and very dark. Was amazing.
Lovely river. A cruise on the Danube is a must. It's a stunning river. One of the highlights of our trip for sure.
Definitly do a cruise!. Gives the best views of the Parliament buildings, castle district and Buda. Most bus companies offer a free cruise, best done at night.
Take a night cruise.... The lighting of the buildings along the Danube are beautiful in the evening. Take the local 90 minute cruise for some great scenery.

Blue Danube Cruise with Riviera Travel. We sailed on the Jane Austin from Budapest to Vienna on 7'th June 2016.The ship was immaculate, We were very agreeably surprised at the quality of the meals provided - approaching the standard of a Five Star hotel. A nice touch was the availability of coffee and tea free of charge 24/7 - and free bottled water being provided daily.Evening entertainment was of a high standard. All of the crew/staff were attentive, polite and friendly and were obviously proud of their ship and the service they provided.The two Riviera tour managers did an excellent job- keeping everyone informed- and the on shore excursions well organised with very good local guides.For a high quality relaxing holiday with some sightseeing it would be difficult to beat.
Cruised down river.. An amazing experience cruising down the Danube and seeing all the sites along the way. Not blue but still an amazing river.

Danube boat trip. We bought the Hop on HopOff tickets and we had 48 hours of great fun and sightseeing on the bus and boat trips down the Danube. It was an amazing experience and well worth the money.

See Budapest from another view. We took our complimentary boat trip Included in our bus ticket, it was full which some of the boats are so be aware whom you book with. Seats upstairs and downstairs great to see Budapest from a different view without a bus or tree obstructing the view. Our boat took 90mins for a fully tour offering drinks and food if required.

Boat Tours are a Must!. One of the best parts of our trip were the 2 river cruises we took on the Danube. I think everyone who visits should do both a day time river tour and a night time river tour! Parliament lit up at night is simply stunning and a must see from the other side of the Danube!

Scenic River Cruises, an fantastic company to cruise with on the Danube. We returned in mid-June 2016 from a 3 week cruise travelling from Amsterdam to Bucharest. A good portion of this cruise was on the Danube. Probably the Western European part of the Danube is more interesting and scenic than its Eastern counterpart with small villages nestled on the river banks backed by hills planted, in terrace fashion, with grapevines. Every so often a medieval castle would be apparent on the hillside. The trees lining the river were reflected in the river water like those in a Monet painting. The river was well used with barge traffic and other river cruise ships so there was always some activity like that to watch, or even to wave at local fishermen and campers on the banks, or to take photos of the river ducks and swans which swam in the shallower parts of the river. While the river in this portion was fast running and very brown, there was no effect of its motion aboard the ship. This portion of the river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest took 2 weeks of sailing. Our journey was not impeded, fortunately, by rising river levels and low bridge heights. The river stayed brown but flowed less vigorously as we sailed into the Eastern European countries. It took 1 week to travel between Budapest and Bucharest along this less populated area. We travelled through the Iron Gorge which was fascinating to see with the dramatic changing width of the river and steep rocky sides. An interesting carving of a man's head - Decebalus - appeared unexpectantly on these rocks as did a monastery and a mid-river castle used for collecting tolls in past times.I enjoyed the opportunity of travelling on this Eastern portion of the Danube on a ship, similar to a 5 star hotel, enjoying good food and comfortable accommodation while being able to travel deep into Bulgaria and Romania by bus for daily sightseeing excursions. We were bused to Varna to dip our toes into the Black Sea and to see a most interesting archaeological museum in the town where finds from centuries of humans living in the area were on display with English labels. We were also bused into the midlands of Bulgaria to visit the popular tourist town of Veliko Varnovo and Arbanassi. Roads to these areas were in good condition - no wash outs, pot holes. In these 2 previous commie countries of Bulgaria and Romania it became evident that the Slavs did not want to be dominated by other people be they the Ottoman Turks or Soviets (don't know how they felt about the Roman occupation) who usually lined their own pockets and kept the people under their thumbs rather than improving the living conditions of the population. While the current governments were reported to be corrupt, at least the Slavs can elect their representatives. We noticed quite a contrast In the Western and Eastern European cities. While the architecture of public buildings at one time had been impressive in Belgrade and Bucharest, today they lack upkeep and many buildings appear to be crumbling and in disrepair. Unemployment rate was reported to be very high with a brain drain as young people left for better working opportunities and conditions in the West. I would definitely recommend the 2 week Western European Danube river cruise over the Eastern portion if one was new to river cruising or combine these 2 areas like we did into one long 3 week cruise. The time on the 2 week cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest just flew by while the 1 week cruise along the Danube seemed to take longer. We thoroughly enjoyed the all-inclusive nature of our ship Scenic Jasper as all expenses were paid up front including the tips of local guides and drivers. We left the ship without paying anything extra. Each day there was an included excursion; we usually opted for the city tour. Local guides with good English speaking abilities, usually university students or older experienced guides, spoke to us through headsets so one could hear their commentary from a distance. Scenic provides a lot of on board information in print form for the sights along the Danube like a travel guide, a map of the river showing the location of towns, and city maps. Add to this the information in electronic form available on Scenic’s hand held Tailormades (audio guides) for info on the sights in the towns, or from the internet with free access, for example, for current weather info. In addition, the cruise director gave nightly port talks in which he informed us of the program for the next day - what we would see and the length of time of the tours. Excursions lasted from 3 hours for city walking tours to full day excursions into the countryside. Rooms were comfortable with real balconies that were enclosed with glass so useable in all weather conditions. The window could be opened for fresh air. The upper deck was used most while in the dock. Here we could sit in comfortable padded wicker chairs or lounge chairs to enjoy a drink, read, use WiFi, do puzzles or visit with fellow cruisers. There was a small pool filled with tepid water as well as a walking track around the upper deck. For more vigorous exercise, there was a small fitness room with several exercise machines on the lower deck. The lounge area provided extra indoor seating to view the riverside from the bow of the ship or close to the bar for drinks service or at the entrance by the coffee machine where one could enjoy reading sample news from national papers or do a crossword puzzle. The library on board is unimpressive but had a couple of mysteries by well known English authors and a few travel books for the areas on the rivers. I had little time to read though. The dining room served breakfast and lunch buffet style but always had a menu to order from as well. Dinner lasted from 7-9 and was waiter served. White cloth tables and stemware were set for 4-6. Food was delicious and looked attractive on the plates; servings were small but many courses were offered – appetizer, soup, main course, dessert. Steak, chicken, salmon, Caesar salad, and hamburger were available as options to those on the dinner menu. Foods were identified for their allergic components and waiters dutifully helped gluten free diners select their foods. Ages of cruisers on this ship were 60+ with lots of Aussies, Canadians, fewer Brits and Americans. The staff was very attentive of disabled passengers needing help with motorized scooters; elevator was available for those unable to climb the few stairs between floors. Staff was friendly, organized, mainly from the Balkan areas, and got to know our names quickly. The butler even did 1 kg bag of laundry for free.  River cruising is indeed a different way of seeing common European sights. We really enjoyed our cruise and highly recommend Scenic river cruises based on our experience aboard their Jasper ship.
Relaxing.. Could of happily sat on the Danube for my entire holiday the views were spectacular, it was peaceful and relaxing watching all walks of life passing by.

Imponent. The Danube has been inspiration of many artists and poets. People can take a nice ride in the river and specially can make a stop in Margharetten islandna beautiful park to visit. Many offert everywhere to get in one of those boats rides
Peaceful. The river makes the city even more beautiful, and concentrates almost all the important attractions of the city in its both sides.
nice boat trip. It's good to make the boat trip in the night time. The city is enlightened and you feel like in a story.

Great Viking River Cruise. Our first ever river cruise and we were not disappointed. Viking are a good company, and this would be a 5 star except that they didn't contact me after the cruise when I asked them to, re a small problem.The rive is, of course, magnificent. we sailed from Nuremberg through to Budapest. Amazing scenery, plenty of history and enough castles and churches for anyone!

Beautiful at night. Walked along Danube river at night and it was so romantic! The pathways were well lit and there were many people doing the same thing as us. Trip to Budapest is definitely not completed without a night stroll along Danube River!!!

Best River in Europe. Beautiful just to look at in the daytime. Plenty of street art if you walk along the riverfront. Everything is lit up and night like jewels on velvet. We went on a wine tasting river cruise with gypsy music, that was fantastic value for money and a wonderful way to see the sights and sample local wines.

Try to explore the Danube via bike. If you are near the Danube in Budapest (by rivercruise, visiting town, live here, etc.) try sightseeing by bike. You can rent public bikes, or take your own and "cruise" through the 9 bridges across the river, visit Margaret island, look up to the Budavár Castle and glide in front of the Parliament. You will be amazed how different the city and the Danube looks from this level and this speed.

Dreamy landscapes!!. Visited the most scenic stretch of the Danube River. It was a scenic drive through the countryside, stopped to explore the medieval fortress of Visegrad, admired the neoclassical cathedral of Esztergom and browsed the handicrafts shops of Szentendre. Sailed back to the capital by cruise along the Danube River.

Go for a river trip . We bought a sightseeing ticket on the Big Red Bus which included a free river trip. The commentary could have been better but it was still worth doing. We had a welcome sit down with a drink and it was good to see the beautiful buildings from the river. Although you could get off we stayed on for the return trip which most people seemed to do.
A tour of the Danube is mesmorising. Good quality of boat, with excellent views of all the highlights along the river. On a hop on hop off tour this is included and the history is rich
really great. this boat trip on the danube is a great way to get some of the best pictures either in the day or night there are some really great snaps to be had.

A Great River. We spent a week on the Danube, taking a cruise on the AmaSonata from Vilhsofen to Budapest, during which we visited five countries - Germany, Czech Republic, Austria, Slovakia, and Hungary. On our last night on the river, we went on an "illumination" cruise, seeing and photographing the beautiful buildings of Budapest. This was quite memorable.

AMAZING FIRST RIVER CRUISE ON SCENIC TOURS. This was our first cruise - Scenic Tours "Gems of Danube" from Nuremberg to Budapest. First in planning for our cruise, we reviewed costs of various cruise lines. Surprisingly, Scenic was less than Viking but offered more since it was all-inclusive - gratuities, drinks any time, a number of excursions at each docking, butler (loved the 6:30 knock on the door each morning with a fresh pot of coffee), laundry etc. These extras at no cost made the cruise very enjoyable. Our relatives had taken a Viking cruise and after a day on Scenic, their opinion was that a Viking ship could not compare to the Scenic Amber.The Scenic Amber was new ship and fantastic. Cabins are spacious with lots of storage including space under the beds for luggage bags and 20 hangers. The king sized bed was very comfortable and you could change positions of the mattress with a remote control. The "Sun Lounge" concept is excellent - essentially provides an extra 40 sq ft of cabin space. You can sit on the 2 chairs and watch the scenery no matter what the weather - if it is raining, keep window up; if sunny open widow so that you have a balcony. Toiletries are top off the line (according to Anne - L Occitane). The crew were very friendly and willing to do anything they could to satisfy you. Meals were delicious and had lots of choices - hard not to gain some extra weight. They have a special restaurant called Portobellos with a 6 course meal. All guests can book it once during the cruise - would recommend they book as soon as they arrive to get the day that is best for them.The majority of the excursions were excellent - especially when the dock was located in the center of town. The best dock was in Budapest where the ship was directly opposite the Parliament Buildings. Some were not - main disappointment was Nuremberg - too much time was spent at the Documentation Centre and, probably due to the rain, the "Taste of Nuremberg" was disappointing according to some.The highlight was the night cruise of Budapest in which they light up all the historical buildings. Day and night photos of the Parliament Buildings in Budapest from our ship are attached.One decision we made was not to book the Scenic 3 night Prague tour before the cruise. We felt that the cost of $2600 more per couple was too much. We did the 3 night tour on our own at a cost of $2100 - a savings of $500. We were very happy with the results and for the $2100 we got:- Accommodation at the Marriott Prague - $500 - same hotel as the Scenic tour- Private Tour Company - $800 - included Prague airport pickup on Friday; 4 hour walking tour of Prague castle and surrounding area on Saturday; 4 hour walking tour of Old & New Town and river cruise on Sunday; transportation from Prague to the ship in Nuremberg including a Pilsen Brewery tour on Monday- All other expenses (meals, drinks, souvenirs etc) - $800 - One dinner was at the Zvonice Restaurant located on the 7th floor of a 16th century bell tower 5 minutes from the hotel with the tables surrounding the original bell. Another dinner was at Kampa Park Restaurant on the Riverside Terrace overlooking the Charles Bridge.We feel the Scenic Gem of Danube river cruise was excellent and exceeded our expectations. Our decision not to book the Prague pre-cruise tour and do it on our own was a good one. We will definitely consider Scenic first if we decide on another river cruise.

Tip: Do public boats instead of tourist boats!. Instead of taking one of the tourist boats, which cost a lot, take the public transportation of the city of Budapest. The BKK which also does the metro, tram and busses has boats on the river which you can take for about a just a small amount per person. When you buy a public transportation pass for a (couple of) day(s), this is valid as well.
An amazing river. We had a dinner cruise but think that maybe a better way of seeing it was from the many bridges and walking.

Different Than What I expected. The Danube River was not quite what I expected. It is muddy brown in color. Walking along the canal they have pretty long bike and walking trails that seem to go on forever. There are a few cafe's along the way - take your time and enjoy a leisurely walk!

Danube night cruise. We took a night cruise on the Danube to see the lights of Budapest. We were lucky that we had a very pleasant evening weather wise and enjoyed the sights while sipping on a glass or two of wine. The cruise took an hour and was well worth it.

Boat ride on the Danube. Taking a boat ride down the Danube lets you enjoy a different perspective of the city. The historic buildings an be viewed better from the river. You an also enjoy seeing Margaret Island - if you have the time, top off and enjoy a walk on this very green island. It has a small zoo and a beautiful Japanese garden amongst many ports centres.
Danube. Its Danube.... probably a good idea for most tourist is a walking tour around the river banks. For us, we ran it a few times in our short stay in Budapest

Picture Perfect . We traveled on the Danube from Passau, Germany to Budapest, Hungary for one week. The river was smooth, clean, peaceful with many fascinating/intricate locks (we went through eleven of them). We viewed amazing terraced vineyards, historical castles and charming villages. We made several stops as we meandered on the Danube as we were on a Viking cruise. The highlight on the Danube was entering Budapest at night under a full moon, viewing this amazing historical city, beautifully lit. It was breathtaking, especially viewing the Parliament building and the Chain Bridge. A sight I will truly never forget.
Spectacular - should not be missed. If in Budapest, make sure you take a cruise on the Danube in the evening/twilight. All the major buildings are lit up and it is simply spectacular
Beautiful river. Beautiful, be sure to take a cruise to enjoy it!! We did the beer/cocktail cruise that starts at 4pm daily for 1.5hr and it was fantastic!

Boat trip . This was included as part of our bus tour price. We did the day trip which lasted just over an hour. Was a really good trip and you get to see the outsides of all the main buildings parliament & the castle area & the Margaret island! Def worth the trip. Prices of drinks on boat are really cheap a bottle of champagne for about £6!

Definitely take a night tour. The city has done a wonderful job of lighting the main buildings so they show up beautifully at night. If you buy giraffe hop on bus tickets, you get a free night tour. Take one of the last ones so it is dark. We would give the night trip 5 stars.

stroll along. You can't come to Budapest and not be aware of the river that divides Buda and Pest. It is beautiful from both sides during the day and at night, so plan a stroll along the river and enjoy the views, the boats, and the city.
night scene is better. i was there by cruise day and night. I prefered night tour as the sceneries were so great. the palace and parliament were so beautiful at night.

Loved the walk along side. . We loved to walk along side of the Danube as it's beautiful and you can get to see almost all the sites along side. We strongly recommend to take the Tram 2 which just runs along side the Danube it's like a public hop on hop off experience and a way cheaper since we had the 72 hrs travel card. Love the experience.

Lovely after dinner boat trip. Does not take too long up and diwn from opposite Sofitel. We ate at boat restaurant Vanhajo then took another boat up and down the Danube. Lovely sights, but difficult to hear the commentary.
Romantic place fabulous views. We took a night boat trip, which was part of our hop on/hop off package. The view is fantastic, as you can see most of Budapest sights from the boat.

Cruising the Danube. We travelled with Riviera Travel on the Jane Austen and it was an amazing trip though Hungary, Slovakia and Austria. The ship and its crew could not be faulted, wonderful cabin with sliding windows on to the river. Marvellous food and spotlessly clean everywhere. Loved Budapest, Bratislava and Salzburg the best. It was our first cruise of any kind and I wish we had done a river cruise years ago!

Public transport through Danube. Completely recommend if you have transport card to take the boat that is free with public transport card. Not the quickest but awesome option to see the Danube properly for free :)
Lovely. Take a cruise down the river in a boat to be able to fully experience the beauty of budapest's buildings! Recommend here for a visit!

Some of the Best River Vistas in Europe. The Danube truly is a highlight of Budapest. From the Pest side looking up to the castle district in Buda, there is beauty all along the river. From Buda looking down into Pest, the same thing. A trip to Budapest is hardly complete without strolling the Danube. There's no reason not to, especially at night.

Iconic to the Capital City. A walk across the Chain Bridge and you cannot miss the photo opportunity. With a view upstream to Parliament on the right, to the bridge in the distance kissing Margaret Island splitting the River Danube into two, watching the trains, trams, buses and cars all crossing to and fro between Buda and Pest. It's what you come to Budapest for - iconic scenes from Hungary. This river is one of the main rivers in Europe.

Every great city has water!. Budapest has the Danube. Its beauty really intensifies Buda and Pest. The river, the bridges, the views all come together to make Budapest an amazingly beautiful city and provides a stunning backdrop to the fascinating city.

Murky and fast moving . It is hard to come to Budapest and not see the Danube as it separates Buda from Pest. It is not the most beautiful of rivers but similar to the Mississippi it is murky and fast moving. However it is enjoyable to see all the boats and realize how this city thrived on the river as a way of life.

Wallking hand in hand at the river, is very romantic!. After the dawn a walk at the river of Danube, is spectacular! All the famous buildings a lit up and creates a wonderful view! Take you time to sit down on a bench and just enjoy the view! Continue to Margit bridge and from there you see the lot!
Danube is Very Beautiful. No elaboration or narration is required as Danube is Very Beautiful. You can spend any amount of time by simply sitting at the bank of River Danube.
A great river. Danube is one of the largest rivers in Europe. At Budapest it is really a great sight. A short cruise in the evening is enjoyable.

Superb panoramic view. There are tram ways along both sides Pest and Buda along the Danube river. Very convenient since the Tram station is very close to the interesting and sightseeing places. Or can join cruise along the river. The Parliament is the highlight building with wonderful architecture.

Take a cruise in the day and one at night too. We really enjoyed cruising along the Danube. I think it well worth it to take a cruise during the day and also one at night when all of the buildings are so beautifully lit.

IT IS NOT BLUE. Most people remember the song about the "Blue Danube" and are disappointed that it really isn't blue. On most days it's a gray-green, but still very beautiful. You can take a boat tour or just have lunch on one of the barges tied to the piers that serve as restaurants.

Sunset 2 hour cruise. Well worth paying for the bus and boat ticket
We departed in daylight and returned when all the lights were switched on. Some stunning views of the parliament, citadel and other landmarks The boat was functional (plastic seats), clean and not crowded The weather was not foggy. A perfect end to the day
Night toime cruise. We enjoyed cruising down the Danube after dark when Parliament House. The Fishermen's Bastion and other buildings a illuminated.
River cruise. Viking river cruise, was very relaxing on the Danube lovely river with beautiful scenery. Lots of locks, able to moor in most places.
Dazzling view of the city. Cruising the Danube, especially at night, left memories of Budapest as a spectacularly beautiful city.

Cruise. We took a Silver Line river cruise that cost about $75 CAD that included a very good 4 course diner. The river is spectacular when fully lit. This cruise took two turns of the river. You can take a single turn at 9 pm that will show the sights at night. Highly recommended if just for the spectacular Parliament Building.

Cocktail cruise without a cocktail list??!! AND RUDE STAFF!!. My best friend and I booked for a cocktail cruise for 28th May at 7pm. When we arrived on the boat we weren't given welcome drinks like everyone else, when we went back for them we were followed back to our seats to make sure we didn't take twice the amount. We were seated inside as all seat outside were taken. A Barman started to take our order, when we asked for the cocktail list we were told we would have to wait for everyone else on the top deck to be served before he would get the cocktail list. 45 minutes into this 2 hour cruise and he hadn't come back. I went to look for this cocktail list downstairs but the barmaid was less than helpful stating she didn't know where one was, then ignored me (turned her head and started writing on a piece of paper) when I asked if anyoe ese would know. I went back upstairs to see if the other barman know where one was and he said 'the truth is, we don't have a cocktail list, but you can ask me' and he winked at me (INAPPROPRIATE!!) I asked what cocktails he offered, he said 'vodka and coke, gin and tonic' I stopped him and asked for a Mojito and a Sex on the Beach, I gave him my coupons and 15 minutes later he brought through 2 drinks that were completely inadequate. Their version of sex on the beach was Cherry Sours and Orange Juice, and my Mojito was soda water, lime and mint... no alcohol and no ICE! pretty basic stuff.When I complained to the bar manager he said 'sorry about that, there should be a cocktail menu around her somewhere'WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!

Famous thoroughfare. This river connects famous cities and sights in several European countries. Also divides the two areas of Buda and Pest that make up the great city of Budapest. Always a great place for photos or an afternoon walk...it never disappoints the tourists. Boat rides, bridges, restaurants, islands and attractions hail this ever changing landmark

One of the best places to admire Danube. Budapest is really one of the best places to admire Danube that really divides the city into Buda and Pest - with superb view points on both sides of the river.
Buda(Danube)Pest. The Danube is the symbol of Budapest. The river separates Pest (the flat land) and Buda (mountains). The most striking view is from the Pest side and facing the Gellert Hill! :-)

A dream fulfilled. You have the Danube River in front of you and not navigate it is impossible to admit. The view offered to the mariner is something very special. You can see both sides of the beautiful city of Budapest, its rolling hills and majestic buildings. And besides, you are surfing on the Danube, inspiration for great painters and musicians!. And what better way to go listen to the famous Blue Danube by Strauss?

A relaxing trip. We bought a hopper bus ticket and the boat trip along the Danube was included free! The Danube is a beautiful river with very interesting historical sites and the boat tour provided a commentary which gave a detailed summary of each building past. Well worth the trip and time

Peaceful cruising along the Danube. We recently took a river cruise on the Danube River from Budapest to Nuremberg, Germany. When we left Budapest, it was in the evening and the city at night was absolutely gorgeous...it was the most beautiful city on our route by far and seeing it from a boat on the river was the best.
Not as blue. After hearing all about the Blue Danube, I expected it to be, well, blue. But in fact it is green. At least what I saw from it in Budapest (it is a very long river)

Cruising on the Danube. We were lucky enough to cruise the Danube in Budapest in glorious sunshine. A cruise for just 2100Huf (£5) for one hour plus - with a recorded commentary which was very informative. A great way to see where many of the sights are situated and to see them from the Danube too - a must do!

The city sightseeing bus gives free cruises. We booked the City Sightseing Bus for two days and we got two cruises included all for 20 euros. One cruise during the day (heads north to the island) and one for the evening (heads south). We left the day cruise until the afternoon so both were a great way to relax, rest our legs and see so many attractions, so much architecture. This is a beautiful city and unlike many, you can see most of it from the river.

Beautiful night dinner cruise. We did a night dinner cruise on the Danube. What a beautiful trip, the buildings were all lit up, it was magnificent. The city takes on a completely different look at night.

Danube River Cruise. Evening cruise is worth taking. It's even great if it comes with bubbles or wine for free. Some come with dinner. Enjoy the scenery with the amazing illumination of the city at night. Enjoy the wind blowing thru your face and hair out on the deck. Enjoy listening to the serenade while cruising along the river. You may even be tempted to dance the waltz on deck. Take it. It may look touristy, but you are a tourist in Budapest! Enjoy being a tourist!

Danube River via weeklong riverboat cruise!. Over the course of seven days, we cruised the enchanting Danube River through four European countries -- from Budapest to Vilshofen -- and enjoyed every minute. We particularly enjoyed that the going was slow enough to allow us to fully take in everything from stunning countryside to medieval towns to cathedrals off in the distance.We docked in Bratislava, Vienna, passed the scenic wine-growing region of the Wachau Valley -- and more. We traveled in November, right as the Christmas markets were beginning to open, and found it to be the best time to avoid the crowds and still stay warm enough to get out and enjoy the sites.The Danube region has been a hub for art, music, opera, literature and more across the centuries. We didn't touch on even a fraction of it during our trip, but having the river as our entry point allowed us to see more than we could have solely by land. Highly recommend exploring this memorable river via a multi-day riverboat cruise!

The heart of Hungary. I've spent hours the last few days walking along the banks of the Danube. Beautiful heart and soul of the country. I recommend talking a night time cruise to see how all the buildings reflect on the water.

Beautiful at night - pick the right cruise.... The cruise on the Danube at sunset is spectacular! Don't bother paying for dinner included, just do the one with drinks. You will want to be outside enjoying the views and taking pictures.

Great trip. What you can expect in this trip is more of experiencing of a Hungarian life than a rich information of history. The tour starts with a church visit and then Hungarian lunch followed by a flee market visit.Kids enjoy the entire experience and the guide who came with us was sincere and honest definitely worth it . would recommend it as welcome change from a hectic historical places visit.

Cocktail and Beer Cruise. Duna Koncert advertised a Cocktail and Beer cruise viewing the six bridges that cross the river Danube in Budapet Hungary. The cost of the ticket covered your cruise and pre recorded commentary of local history which ran on a loop. And either 2 cocktail drinks or 3 beers. The small cruiser that we were transferred onto was well worn and after being encouraged onto the upper deck, there wasn't enough plastic seats to cover number of passengers. When asking for seating were told only lower deck with little ventilation was the only seats available.

Just grab a bench seat and watch the world go by. We sat on the banks for half an hour and just watched people strolling, barges, ferries, tourist boats etc drift past. A great way to take your breath and feel the rhythm not of the river

Lots to see and do. A lovely walk along to river front lets you see a lot of the sights. Start at the Parliament and see the 'shoes on the Danube'(a touching memorial to the people who were shotand fell into river by the nazis.) We also done a night dinner cruise booked through Viator, which was very good and you saw the river and city lit up.

Peaceful and Calm trip. Was amazed at how peaceful and well-kept this part of the Danube was. Travelled to the along the river from Stop 19 and passed beautiful buildings e.g. Bute Castle, and the most pristine forest once used by the last Hungarian King for hunting and is now a preserved reservation. No buildings are permitted to be built on it and it is used by walkers, runners and the peaceful enjoyment of the public. The air is to clean everywhere. Definitely recommend this trip.

Don't miss taking a night cruise of the Danube in Budapest. The absolute highlight of a weeklong cruise on the Danube was a night cruise up and down the Danube in Budapest. What an incredible, unforgetable experience! The lighted old buildings are spectacular.

Stunning by Night. Although all cities with rivers have an edge, Budapest really does have an edge with the Danube. Although not 'blue' it is very beautiful with stunning architectural buildings along both banks with a wealth of bridges crossing it. We took a daytime boat trip, which was good (watching the joggers running around Margaret Island was tiring) but the piece de resistance was the evening dinner/cruise. Stunning lit up at night, the buildings and the bridges and to crown if off there was a firework display to watch too.Take your camera we took some stunning pictures with a beautiful full moon over the parliament building.

The most storied river in the world.... Europe's second longest river and what an influence it wields! Lots of history and lots of beauty. Flowing through 10 countries....the stuff of postcards and of course, music.
Wonderful Walk. We walked along the Danube during the day and again in the evening. Gorgeous views. Also helps you stay oriented I town.

Nice by day, beautiful by night. Take a tour on a boat and definitely take a bikeride at night. The promenade and the buildings + bridges are beautifully lit. The Donau itself is big, but the water does not look pleasant.
Sunny afternoon on the river!. Bring a hut and sunscreen if you want to be on the top deck. You can sip a beer and cruse the river. Great way how to see many attractions around the river.

Exceeded Our Expectations. Trip Advisor provides such a great opportunity for travelers to be well informed consumers. Prior to our trip we did not consider ourselves cruise people but now we do. For us the trip was perfect. While, some reviewers have commented negatively on the size of the stateroom we found it to be more than adequate and amazingly functional. The small veranda with floor to ceiling doors made it appear more spacious. The housekeeping staff was excellent. Our cabin was immediately adjacent to the lobby area but we never were bothered by external noises.The food was well prepared and the choices were varied. We appreciated that the entree portions were not supersized. Our compliments to the chef. The wines that were served with lunch and dinner were fine unless you are a wine conessiur. The drinks at the bar were reasonably priced. We still have a hard time understanding why anyone would add on the liquor option. Several nights complimentary sparkling wine cocktails were offered. We enjoyed the more casual dining on the Aquavit Terrace a few times. The beer that was served with lunch and dinner was ok but upon asking my husband found a great dark beer that was available but not offered. Most nights at dinner we ate with a couple who were Vegan and unfortunately their dining experience left at great deal to be desired. They had made their dietary preferences known at the time of booking. The staff devoted time everyday going over their choices but it never really came together. One meal they were presented with a plate of sauerkraut as the entire meal. Unless, Viking intends to reimburse customers with special diets they really need to do a better job.The ports and tours were informative and well organized. Of course some places appeal more to different people and some guides are better than others but getting 190 people around in a peasant and organized fashion was well done.
