We especially enjoyed the unstructed opportunities to explore the various ports on our own. FYI, our favorite stops were Budapest and Durnstein and our least favorite was Vienna. We can't say enough about the staff. They were always pleasant and attentive. We were stunned when we first boarded to be greeted by the entire staff with Champagne and fresh flowers. Who knew that being the first couple on this brand new cruise ship would result in such a VIP greeting! We were fortunate not to need any medical treatment but those that did spoke very highly of how Viking handled the situation. Our travel agent recommended that we pay the extra fee to have greater flexibility in our flight arrangements. I can't speak to how that works if you don't choose that option but our flights and transportation to and from the airports were flawless.Several reviewers have commented on the situation when you can't cruise due to water levels. I can only imagine how frustrating this would be. I had heard of this happening through friends but I would agree that this possibility is in very fine print in the Viking promotions. Those of you considering a cruise later this summer or fall should be aware that the snows from the Alps feed the Danube and there was very little snow this past year.No experience is perfect for everyone but it was for us and we are looking forward to our next Viking cruise.

Glorious. A river trip along the Danube is a wonderful experience, It is a beautiful city and the vista is one of grandeur. You will get the finest views of Budapest's most historic buildings including the royal palace (now an art gallery) the Parliament building and the landmark churches. The river is majestic in its breadth and the city-scape is well preserved, Modern buildings have been made to fit in with the sillhouette and do not dominate. You can if you like enjoy drinks or a whole meal on board but I think it is better to concentrate on the view and eat later.

Don't miss this opportunity!!. We took the cruise departing at 7pm. We were afraid we might not see the sights lit up at night since the sunset was at 8.20pm.However the cruise left 15min late and at 8pm the lights went on on all the bridges and main monuments , streets. Etc...it was awesome !!!!! The cruise was excellent the hosts took good care of us. The free champagne and wine was offered as written . We , however ordered a Hungarian champagne , which. I know very well and would recommend strongly...it is pink and called Francois President. The buffet was excellent , had good variety of food. The cruise was smooth and picture opportunities were available also on the top deck in an open area. One need to take a little more money for wine or champagne if required, the tip for the musicians who can play songs at one's request (mostly by violin and trombone) , also souvenir pictures are taken of the passengers and sold in a "frame" with souvenir photo of the brig deg etc...nice memories.

Though Danube is not blue any more it adds a specific charm to all towns it runs through. Once in Budapest, you should not miss boat ride on danube river. And preferably at night as Budapest is perhaps even nicer at night with lights illuminating all the beautiful palaces and historical buildings.
breathtaking. well worth a trip to see many buildings and having them carefully explained through ear phones with the choice of language
cruise. we took a night cruise and it s a pretty at night to view the monuments and well explained history . we booked via our hotel

Walked along it as often as possible. I personally liked the neighbourhoods along the river best and walking along the promenade facing pest is really nice and relaxing, unfortunately in pest a street has been built on the theoretically best locations for restaurants and cafes.
Made us want to cruise it!. Seeing all the boats on and along the the banks of the river instantly made us want to book a cruise and go sightseeing even more countries.

Evening Dinner Cruise. This was a lovely experience supplied with a great four course meal which was brought to our table. On board was live music and to top it all - fantastic photo opportunities and seeing Budapest by night is a must!

Delightful Danube. The Danube is a highlight of Budapest wonderful views all day long, looks great in the evening when dark and all the main sights are lit up. Easy to while away a few hours strolling by the Danube. Not to be missed.
River cruise holiday. Very impressive scenes while sailing through to Budapest. Gorgeous when lit up at night. Apparently one of the best in Europe.

Vikng Does it Right!. We just completed a fantastic Danube river cruise from Budapest to Nuremburg and I have never felt so pampered in my life!! Viking thought of everything, and this was superb w/o exception...before, during and after! Life on board, land excursions, travel itinerary ... all presented with pleasant efficiency. Viking's motto seems to be "no problem" - and they live up to it, to say the least!I would not hesitate to recommend Viking and will use them in the future!
Absolutely beautiful . Such a lovely place to take a very romantic and calming walk. The views across the river and into the hills are breathtaking. Postcard picture worthy

AMA Waterways Prague to Budapest. My wife and I went on the AMA Waterways The Legendary Danube cruise. We started in Prague for 3 days and then took a bus to Nuremberg to board our ship for a 7 day cruise ending in Budapest.We loved this trip and AMA Waterways. We can’t say enough good things about John our cruise director. The guides were all local and very knowledgeable. The food was terrific. Our cabin was on the level of a 4 or 5 star hotel. The staff became like family. The nightly entertainment was very enjoyable. Each stop and city we visited was wonderful.This was our first river boat cruise. We are very experienced travelers including cruise ships. We really liked river boat causing. The ship held 143 guests and on this trip this was a little over hundred. There was 41 staff so you are very well taken of. This really gives you a chance to meet your fellow travelers. You also really get to see the smaller towns along the Danube as well as big cities like Prague, Vienna and Budapest. We liked it so much we are planning to take another AMA Waterways cruise in 2018. We highly recommend this cruise and AMA Waterways.
Magnificent view. saw the parliament building at night was beautiful. The fantastic panoramic from the river. Very good idea to visit !

An integral part of Budapest. Anybody visiting Budapest will not miss this beautiful river and the several bridges across it. Get the marvelous beauty of the Buda side from the Pest side of the river and vice versa. A boat trip [regular ferries though slow , are cheap] in the river enables us to take some beautiful pictures of the main attractions on the shores like the Parliament building.

Viking River Cruise Nuremberg to Budapest. We stayed three days in Prague before beginning our cruise with Viking. Our booking experience was positive and our transfers from the airport to the hotel in Prague were uneventful. No problems at all. We arrived at our hotel, got our orientation and had a free day. We had a walking tour of Prague included which was the best tour Viking had our entire trip. They tend to use Historians and experts to do the tours, not just a guide. We had other tours on our own, but what they had to offer was good. We are younger and being on guided tours with 70+ year olds is just too slow for our pace! The cruise:Once our stay in Prague was over, we were transferred by bus as a group to Nuremberg where the boat was docked. The people transferred from the airport got a chance to visit the town, but we arrived to late to do that. Our walking tour of Nuremberg was great. Our guide was great, but the weather was turning bad...cold and wet!!!We headed off to Regensberg which was a beautiful little town. There were lots of little shops but we hit it on a holiday and they were closed. We went to the Abby by boat. The weather was terrible but the views still amazing. We ate sausage, drank beer, hit a festival with more beer, walked through the town and decided that from then on we would ditch the tours! We, as a group of 10 had more fun without them. The Danube has many locks (about 22 from Nuremberg to Budapest. Most of them are at night but it's very interesting to watch the boat go through one! Our next stop was Passau where we took a side trip to Salzberg where we broke out on our own and saw the beautiful castle at our own pace! We this was a beautiful city. I wish I had been given more time here! Off to Krems. Not much to see here but a good stopping point for the boat to see the Benedictine Abby which was beautiful and interesting. We begrudgingly did this tour as a group because there was little offered. Next it was off to Vienna and this is a city that will take your breath away. We had a horse drawn carriage ride through the city just at dusk when the lights were coming on. It was magnificent. I totally recommend it. For the one hour ride it was 80 Euros. Pricy but really a neat experience. Get the carriage in the town square next to the church. Our last stop was Budapest which was my favorite. This city has so much history! Some of it sad history but it's a glorious city in all of its hidden splendor beneath years of neglect by the Russians. If you take this cruise, take the Nuremberg to Budapest route, instead of starting in Budapest. You spend less time on the boat going to Budapest than away from it due to currents and locks on the Danube!You'll have to read my individual reviews on all the sights to get details. Especially in Vienna, Prague, and Budapest.Our Boat:The river boat cruise is a very different kind of cruise. It's smaller and more casual. You get to make new friends. Our group was large so we had the same waitstaff each day. They were great. Our cabin was a Veranda A cabin which had a balcony on the 3rd floor. The views are not really any better, the cabin size is the same and the price is a bit more. The bathroom is small but very efficient. Luggage can be stored under the bed and out of the way! The closet and drawer space is ample for two on a week trip. Wifi is spotty because it's satellite. Put the phone down anyway. It's vacation time! Bring toilet paper....even the best European toilet paper doesn't come close to our worst! Come equipped to pay at least an additional $400 in tips to waitstaff, cabin housekeeper, and program director. The upper deck is great during times of sunshine and warmth. I suspect June-September are the best months to go! All totaled with 2 extensions on both ends of our trip, souvenirs, extra tours, spa treatments, meals and accommodations, we spent no where near what I thought it would cost. US money goes far in Prague and Budapest! Take this trip before they raise the prices! It's worth i!
11 bridges over the Danube. For sure Budapest is the place where the Danube is at its prettiest as well as the 11 bridges, all different and each one representing the time in which it was built

Fast flowing river. We took a cruise up and down the river and saw many of the highlights of Budapest. Highly recommend the cheap cruises during the day (less than £10 each) and night time cruises are supposed to be fun with dining experience (we didn't try them).Opportunity to travel to St Margaret's island in the Danube, which we were told is highly recommended.
A city needs a river. The water always gives a magic touch. It calms you, you can watch the ships and cross one of the bridges. It's good to walk alongside the river on both sides.

Just love the Danube. While in Budapest you must stroll along both or either bank of the Danube. The sites at water level are as impressive as they are from the Cittadell. See up close the power of this mighty water way is breathtaking. The night life is also warm and inviting. Stop to smell your coffee and sit and imagine the area hundreds of years ago.

Beautiful city . Visited Budapest may 2016 absolutely beautiful city walked along the Danube and also took two boat trips on the river highly recommended must see the castle lit up at night and the 'shoes on the Danube ' tribute. Highly recommend a visit.

A majestic river, lifeline of the city. Rivers, lakes and the sea add enormously to the charm and the economy of a city. This is also true for Budapest. The river flows, or rather meanders betweew Buda and Pest and provides beautiful views, a means of transporting goods and passangers and the opportunity for sightseeing. Staring in the mid 1850s, a number of bridges were built to connect Buda and Pest., All of them were blown up by the withdrawing German troops at the end of WWII. They were painstakingly rebuilt after the war, trying to keep the architectural style of each. The Chain bridge is the most speciaol one, because of its design, its location and its history. There are several islands in the Danube, but the one of interest for visitors is Margit (or Margaret) island. Located between Arpad and Margit bridges, this is a large park, with hotels, restaurants, thermal baths and places for sportts, suntanning and just strolling among beautiful gardens. it is well worth an afternoon. Within easy reach using the streetcar or bus system, it can also be accessed on foot, through one of the bridges.

Don't miss out. The beautiful Danube is so romantic if you can enjoy a lunch or dinner cruise. I had both because the latter has live music. The buffet lunch and / or dinner is providing a large diversity of international food tastes.
Beautiful river. Our first time in Budapest, and we loved every minute. The danube is lovely, and stunning when viewed at night with all the buildings illuminated.
Beautiful view. Budapest really makes the most of being on the Danube, compared to Vienna or Bratislava. Lovely to stroll by the river on a sunny day, or at dusk.
Great to see from the river. It was part of the big bus tour package. Always nice to see a city from a different perspective. Took about an hour for the round trip.

lovely cruise. jumped on a day cruise trip - well worth a look its gives you a different feel of the city - can here fully appreciate buildings - trip took a bout 1 hour in time - wrap up as does get cold
Beautiful. We went for a dinner and drinks cruise along the Danube, and got engaged. Beautiful city beautiful views!

Use your weekly travel ticket !. I was nicely surprised to find that I could use my weekly travel ticket on these boats on the Danube. You can travel in a loop, and get off where you got on. Coffee and bar services available on the boat. Reasonably priced :)

dream trip. our first river cruise on the danube with viking. it was a dream come true. so many interesting things to see and such a smooth trip....the danube goes through many countries....all of the rich in history. i would recommend this trip to all at least once in your lifetime. very different from ocean cruises.....more intimate and more individual service and attention to detail.

Relaxing trip and wonderful views. well worth this trip sea breeze Relaxing trip and wonderful views. A must do and free when you book the Red line hope on /off tours. really nice to see the building from the river. Night and day cruses

One busy river!. Wide, powerful, beautiful. So much activity and so much to see makes this a river which you sit by and easily while away an hour or two. We walked it but there are many opportunities in better weather to take a ride on it. It's amazing. I was on a photography visit so the river was in hundreds of my photos!

take the cruise. A great way to see Danube in Budapest is to take a cruise.I prefer evening sightseeing cruise. but it can be chilly so wear in layers. They offer audio commentary in multiple languages. You can just follow along. Budapest at night is simply gorgeous. You can join a cruise by signing up in your hotel or in any visitor information stand in various locations in the city. The rate is competitive, you won't go wrong with any of them.I would not suggest dinner/lunch cruise. The food is so so.

Best way to admire the gorgeous buildings . We took a river luncheon cruise and enjoyed the very best views! For photography enthusiasts, it is perfect for crowd-free views of the very ornate architectural dreams. The Parliament building looks especially beautiful from the water and you get to see more of the details. I would highly recommend a splurge on a river cruise!
Cruise highly recommemded. great day , lunch and cruise on the Danube great value for money..Excellent view from inside the ship.

Boat trip. I had the opportunity to take a boat trip on Danube during the day and during the evening. Both trips were impressive! During the day you have the chance to admire the architecture of the old and the new sides of the city. During the night, one can get amazed by the beautiful lights of the city and bridges.Do not miss the opportunity of a boat trip in Budapest!

The walk along the peer of Danube at night, is an amazing experience. The light of the castles, the parliament and many. The light of the castles, the parliament and many other buildings give you moments to remember forever! Have a coffee at night by the Danube and you will see what I mean!

danube river.. the weather was excellent all the days that i was there; so, the river water did not look muddy at all. it is worth while taking a cruise on one of the boats and relax with a glass of wine, beer or scotch.
Immpressive. Huge river, for tourists and a working river with work barges. Beautiful at night, great place for pictures, banks were clean, although water looked murky!

Danube cruise . One way to see the sights in Budapest is to take one of the river cruises. This is such s beautiful way to see this fascinating city. All the cruises have guides that can tell you all about its the rich history. The architecture of the buildings you will see along the way are breath taking and you can truly appreciate them from the river. On a hot summers day there is now better way to discover this city and take in all sights from the comfort of a river cruise.
Both day and night cruises. We took a day Cruise lasting one hour, very good. W also enjoyed the dinner Cruise at night. Good food and music.

Beautiful trip. Just returned from an hours cruise on the Danube and what a beautiful cruise. The boat was fitted with headphones in different languages and gives you all the information you need to know about some of the sights. The parliament building chain bridge palace etc are all beautiful from the water. Be aware that it can get quite cool from the river and take a coat. Our boat also had rugs for extra comfort. A complementary soft drink or wine was a lovely touch. Once again good value for money. Some of my the hop on hop off bus trip prices also include the boat trip free. Don't expect the Danube to be blue.
beautiful view. after exploring the Buda side, enjoy your lunch & sit by the river side. Or enjoy the sunset here. It's just beautiful.

The beautiful Danau/Danube. A walk along the Danube here in Budapest is a must. Now the center of River boat cruising.They are lined up ready to board and sail off in the evening so there are tourists galore everywhere. Budapest is obviously the destination of choice and the Daube is part of the draw of course..
Short Cruise on Danube. Pleasant cruise round Margaret Island. Just took the cruise for 70 mins without a meal - although drinks included. Audio in many languages allowing 90 min stop off on Island.
Never regret - Danube in Budapest. Amazing mode for transportation, irrigation and water resources. Nice to cruise along it during night time.

The most beautiful river in Europe. I just love the Danube! You must go take a walk along its coast and enjoy yourself and a little sun. It is also great to make a picnic nearby the river. Amazing view!!!
good for a potter. good for a potter if the weather is nice enough as it can be chilly by the waterside. water is a bit dirty also but you can see up into the hills.
Beautiful views of a beautiful city. We were on a river cruise and the evening cruise along the Danube was incredible. The lit up parliament and other buildings and bridges were spectacular.

Boat tour to Margaret island.. The hop on hop off bus ticket also includes a hop on hop off boat tour along the Danube to Margaret island. This was one of my highlights from the trip as you really do see Buda & Pest in its true beauty from the river. I got off and spent some time on Margaret island which was just so serene and peaceful. At only 2.5km long, a couple of hours was all you need to fully explore the island and take in the fantastic surroundings. Although I walked the island, there are plenty of ways to get around from hiring bikes to little trains coaches. A must see.
A really top river. It's got everything you could want from a river; it's big, it's wet and it's wide. It is that perfect merky brown colour
Love it. We have traveled up and down the Danube several times. Love all the history on both sides of the river. Great for all the sights to see.

What you'd expect of a big cosmopolitan river. Does not live up to all the hype of the Blue Danube; we did a river cruise that was part of our hop-on hop-off bus and all in all it was quite nice at night to see all the building lights. Otherwise the Danube is nothing special

It's not blue.. Contrary to the popular song sung, The Danube is not blue it's brown from pollution. The river front is more beautiful than the river. It's just a roadway for boats.When you're in a cruise on the river, you're looking at the hills and places, not the river.

A Beautiful River in a Beautiful City. You can't really say you were in Budapest if you did not pay a visit to "The Beautiful Blue Danube". It may not be as blue as advertised by Strauss II, but it is indeed beautiful and majestic, just like his waltz (which couldn't stop playing in my head during my stroll alongside the river). The promenade is very attractive and the view is great from both sides.

Try a relaxing river cruise. Walk through Budapest's historical centre to the Danube River and go for a river cruise to see some of the city's sights from the comfort of a boat. There are daytime and nighttime cruises, so make sure you check out both.

Recommend taking a dinner cruise on the Danube. The Danube is the most gorgeous and fun place to site see when you take a dinner cruise at night as that is when the city is lit up at night and the best pictures are the result.

Not blue, but still beautiful!. We took a river ferry from an outlying area back to Budapest late one afternoon. What a wonderful way to see and appreciate the river and the city of Budapest. Water levels were quite low during our visit, as the area is suffering from dry conditions, as are many areas of Europe. But to see and travel on the historic Danube along some of its iconic riverbanks and the city of Budapest was a real delight for us. Future travel plans of ours include taking a river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest, traveling a longer portion of this great waterway. We are looking forward to it!
definitely need to do a river cruise. A must-do when you are here is a river cruise up-and-down this timeless landmark. A daytime cruise gives a different perspective to a night-tme cruise

A river's a river's a river. Budapest has done a nicer job than many cities in decorating the banks of their great river with buildings, promenades and parks. Two of their central bridges are antique gems. The river traffic is also well done with scads of cruise boats and dinner ships. Nice.

Danube River Cruise. Danube River is the main highlight for all visitors to Budapest. Enjoyed a romantic cruise to see the city palaces, bridges and other city lights. Danube is simply so amazingly beautiful. It will be even more romantic if the boat can play the classical "Danube Blue"; then it will make the cruising even more unforgettable.Recommended to all visitors to Budapest to try Danube River Night or Twilight Cruise. It's best experienced at dusk or after dark.
Nice Boardwalk . Beautiful board walk to walk on a nice sunny day. The shoes of the holocaust victims , on the parliament side is also sad. But the views are beautiful

Sightseeing from the ordinary ferry. We didn't want to use a big tourist boat, but wanted to view Budapest from the river. Thge ordinary ferry service is very hit and miss time-wise and the staff (man who ties up the boat on landing) was not very helpful, but why should he have to cope with foreign tourists? It isn't his job. The journey is delightful and you can get a decent drink on board and either view from the covered bottom deck or wander upstairs. The ferry is basic but very adequate - a lovely sightseeing journey at a bargain price!

If you only have time for one Activity in Budapest Go for a night Cruise Awesome. If you only have time for one activity in beautiful Budapest, you should go for a night cruise, this is a wonderful experience you will not believe your eyes. We booked tickets from our hotel, they also offer dinner and cruise which we will try next time. This is our second trip to Budapest, and probably not the last, if you really want to enjoy something very special you should opt for a night cruise, most cruise includes something to drink, they have headphones which you can listen on your own language, you can also go on the back of the boat; a really nice place to take pictures. But the best places are on top, you should arrive early. This is also a nice relaxing activity to do after a busy day. Go for it and enjoy.
Beautifull all the way. Every single metre of this river is beautiful - both during the day and night. Just walk and enjoy !
Danube at Night.. A very fun ride. Scenery is spectacular. The Parliament building at night from the river is so beautiful.

To see the river is a wish fulfilled!. The iconic Danube features so widely in literature and film that to actually see the river and it's fantastic panoramic surroundings is just so breathtaking! How can there be more of a review of such a magnificent sight?

Danube. Danube, Budapest this magical European river splits into two areas: Buda and Pest. Margaret Island in the middle of the river is a magical oasis of peace and greenery. Access to the island is on the bridge of the same name.

Sam. We bought a three day travel pass from the Metro station which includes trams, buses, metro and the boat ferry. Price of the pass is cca €13, very good value. The ferry is fun as it goes to every pier on each side of the river. So you see everything for the fraction of the prices of touring boats.

Beautiful Boat Trip thru the Danube. My parents and I booked a boat tour with" Legend" along the beautiful Danube.We were lucky with the sunny nice weather,which allowed us to see clearly all the important monuments on both sides: Buda and Pest,like the majestic Parliament,The Royal Palace,the Castle of Buda,the Chain Bridge,Margaret Island,where we stopped and had a very nice walk.The whole trip lasted around 3 hours.I would strongly recommend this attraction.

Great cruise on Viking. We just returned from a Viking cruise from Passau to Budapest. This was a fantastic experienced. We are seasoned travelers but this was our first river cruise. As a group of 10 who travel together we found the accommodations and service 5 star. The food was superb. They provided several shore excursions at each stop on the way from Passau to Budapest. The guides were local and very knowledgable. We would travel with Viking again.
Buda or Pest?. Danube Splits the Buda and Pest, nice to see with good weather. Massive! But nothing special, 1 hours is enough to see.

On the Danube. We experienced the Danube on a dinner cruise that began before sunset and ended at night. We got to see the sights both in the daylight and at night. Although it was a dinner cruise, I spent most of my time on the top deck taking pictures. you can pretty much find a cruise that fits your agenda and timeline as well as budget, therefor I would recommend taking one to see both banks of the river.
Great for a walk. There are several places (especially close the Parlement) where you can walk close to the Danube. Sunset is beautiful for great pictures.

Classic River Venue. The Danube s a classic river venue, not as busy in budapest as the Thames, however just as big and essential to the town. Flowing through the towns of Buda and Pest providing the visitor with two very differing venues in one location. A river tour has to happen in such a place and we did a simple sigtseeing tour past Buda Castle, the Hungarian parliment and past the Central Market hall the other way.. A stunning venue, which interestingly its actually quite hard to walk along as theres a stonking main road next to it on the Pest side of the river and the buda site..
Good quality for price. Very nice people and service ! Impressed by food quality of buffet !! And there was enough... Good music as well !
Beautiful walk . Every way and every bridge we crossed allowed us to see a different view. At breathtaking. We love this city. Walk it and see the beauty.

Beautiful!!!. Danube is so beautiful to see in Budapest but also in the small villages around it.You don't have to book for a tour if you don't want to spend money,you can go by the subway and walk around.In Budapest don't forget to visit Danube by night!

River Ride. A trip up the River Danube must be part of a trip to Budapest. We took the boat as part of a Hop on Hop off deal and it fitted well. It's a good way to get a view of the imposing Parliament building.

Must do. This cruise is a must do in the evening. Budapest is very romantic with the lit up buildings in the evening. It's two hours well spent seeing all the beautiful landmarks. Food is excellent and what a spread of dishes and desserts. Very reasonably priced.

Perfect way to look Budapest from the different point. Perfect way to look Budapest from the different point - we sail with a little ship, and for an hour we saw a lot of different points from the town.

Views from the river.. After a walking tour we took a Danube river cruise lasting approximately 90 minutes.We passed several places of interest including Parliament building and the chain bridge.We also saw the "bottleOpener"statue on top of gellert hegy 150 metres up.Apparently this cruise,which included a beautiful buffet spread,is even better at night when all is lit up.A Beautiful river and our best cruise yet.visited 4th may 2016.

Cocktails in the Afternoon. My friend and I took a delightful 90 minute trip on one of the smaller river cruises with about 25 passengers.It included two cocktails of our choice or three beers. We had lovely generous sized cocktails served as we sat in the sun listening to the commentary on the wonderful architectural and historical buildings bordering the Danube.The trip took us to the Margit Bridge one way then beyond the green bridge the other way before returning to the pontoon where we embarked.It was lovely, relaxed, tasty, informative and thoroughly recommended.

Beautiful night cruise. The Danube meanders through the beautiful cities of Buda and Pest, with their grand buildings rising majestically on both sides of the river. A slow cruise up and down the river is a great way to soak in the sights, especially at night when the buildings are all beautifully lit up.
Beautiful. It is worth to work around the city and find beautiful places as the Danube river seen from different sides or chains. When it is foggy you can't even see the other side!

Amazing night trip. I recommend everyone see Budapest tour in the evening. The most important buildings of Budapest are fantastic illuminated. It conjure up a fairytale city.Even children aged 3 to 8 years have been impressed by vistas of the Budapest

Hop on off bus tpur. As part of the Hop on Hop Off tour you are offered a free Danube tour, we visited Margaret island which is a really relaxed place, boat is hard to step up and down if you have issues with walking but is manageable.
Interesting and easy. Great way to see Budapest it's easy,interesting and informative,the trip takes ninety minutes and the architecture both old and new is well worth seeing from the river.

take Cruise and ejoy Budapest from the water. It's a great way to dicover budapest, we stopped at Margitsziget and strolled around. We choose one of the boats that offered guides in different languages and alos a glas to drink!
Stag doo. Fantastic trip down river!! Weather was hot and the scenery is good. Buy on the river near boats. Don't buy through agents as you will be charged more

Lovely by day, beautiful by night. We walked across Chain Bridge, used public transport buses for free as part of our 7 day pass, went over the Danube by tram at Margaret Bridge and did a tour by night to see the buildings on the banks of the Danube lit up.The Danube is obviously central to Budapest, cutting through the city. The night tour is the most memorable time on the river and a great opportunity to get lovely photos to remember your time in Budapest.We did the cruise with Dunayacht and they were fine and well priced.I would highly recommend a night cruise on the Danube while visiting Budapest.

Centre stage. This river is very special. After visiting a lot of Eurpean cities this is definitely one of our top two. The Danube is beautiful with some lovely bridges crossing it and Margaret Island in the middle. We took an hour cruise which was very worthwhile.

The front door to Budapest. This was our second Viking River cruise that ended in Budapest. Coming in on the river at night is spectacular. The entire city is lit and it is simply a beautiful view. If you are staying in Budapest - take a short boat trip on the river or walk along the riverfront if the weather is nice.
I love this city . Been to Budapest twice on business. It is a magnificent city an inexpensive. I will come back as a tourist. The Danube is magnificent.
Nice journey. Any of the boat trips along the river are worth it. Rain or shine. The views of the city are really spectacular.

ARCHERS DIRECT WITH CROISI EUROPE. Just returned from a weeks holiday down the Danube. The weather was fairly awful and much colder than expected however I give a full five star rating to ARCHERS DIRECT with Croise Europe as we had a wonderful time. Have been on other river cruises in Europe but this has topped the lot and the crew of MS VIVALDI were truly excellent.
Nice. If you are in Budapest, you should definetly walk by the Danube river. It is nicely renovated and very relaxing if the weather is good.Would also recommend taking a boat tour.

River Cruise. We took a short cruise on the Danube, about 90 minutes. The cruise offers hop on / hop off on a limited number of stops, including Margarit Island. It offers unique views of many of the top sights in Budapest, particularly the Parliament building, the Chain Bridge and the Castle. It also serves hot snacks, drinks during the cruise. Very enjoyable and well worth the time. Included as part of the Big Bus Tour ticket package.
Gorgeous. A beautiful river. Took a cruise across it and listened as the history of Budapest was brought to life

danube by day and night. Spectacular buildings each side of the Danube and by night when they are floodlit. Went on dinner cruise for birthday treat which went up and down the river and we had amazing floodlit views of the city.

Boat trip on the Danube. We took two boat trips during our stay in Budapest one in the morning and one in the evening. We really enjoyed both trips the river is lovely and at night when the bridges and buildings are lit up it looks magical .

Views!!!. From every angle or part of the Danube there is something incredible to look at whether it's one of the bridges, Liberty statue, buda castle, parliament.... The List is massive! Spent an afternoon walking along with my husband whilst visiting different attractions and we had to keep stopping for photos...just breathtaking views!

Beautiful riversides (both). Somewhat difficult to find the right dock, but the trip along many nice and amazing buildings, like the Parliament and many others was great. One hour is just enough to have a good impression.

Amazing . We took a river cruise during the day lasting an hour. There are many companies offering trips. Amazing weather on the day and such great views and we had a spoken guide using headphones. Definitely recommend as a must for a visit. Evening was lovely too.
Joining cruise with dinner. Although the dinner is not great, you will have great night views of the golden Danube and bridge (the chain bridge) and both banks.

Danube Cruise Only at Night. A magnificmet way to see this beautiful city in all its glory...really the best way. The buildings are beautifully lit and this is the best way to appreciate the grandeur of the Parliament House. We had wine, listened to beautiful music and saw all of what Budapest had to offer (from the river) and loved every minute of it. The Parliament House is large and grand during the day, but at night, it is so much more than that. This is a must see for any visit to Budapest.
Breathtaking. Beautiful view, especially at night when all the buildings and bridges are lit up. Highly recommend taking a night cruise along the Danube.
Swell ride on the Danube. The family really enjoyed the day long ride on the river and the picnic on the island in the centre...great flowers in bloom...all in all, a memory to treasure

Blue strip between Buda and Pest. The scenery with the bridges and the panorama of the hills and built-heritage of the city along the riversides is really unique. Take a round trip using streetcars no. 41 between Margaret Bridge and Liberty bridge on the western (Buda) side, cross the river on the Liberty bridge by foot, and go back to the Margaret bridge terminal on the board of the streetcar No. 2 on the Eastern (Pest) riverside.This trip (about 2 € for tram tickets) offers you an unforgettable impression on the Danube. As highlight of the day, take at sunset or evening one of the dining boats to view the illuminated Budapest including the nice bridges!
Picturesque and historical. You can't miss Danube if you come to Budapest even if you'd want to! One of the most significant rivers in Europe, it's both picturesque and full of history.
It's a river. Not an attraction. You will pass by it a million times. It's not that you "must" visit it, but you will see it a million times as you go around the city.

Beautiful by night. The Danube is pleasant by day but beautiful at night. There are trams which run on the east bank (2) and west bank (19 & 41) which save your legs. The Citadel provides the best aerial view of the river.

Looking is free. The views from the Danube are some of the most beautiful I've seen. They vary according to the time of day but are always lovely. It's definitely worth walking up to the castle to see the views from there and like most of. Hungary the beauty is free. Whilst you pay to go in most buildings you can walk through the streets for free and wandering along the water front is a definite must. It's a wonderful way to spend the day.

Stunning. WOW, what a way to see this city, truly breathtaking. We had such a beautiful day for it as well. Informative automated tour down one of the most famous rivers in the world. This trip is a must, and it came as part buying hop on and off bus tickets. Such a great way to get round this city.

Still looking for the blue river. We took a boat trip up the Danube which was windy and cold on the day. While the views of Parliament were close I am not sure the boat trip is worth the hassle. The river looked dark and cold rather than Blue.
Must visit. Boat trip is necessary both day and night .... Can see all city buda and pest on different view... Night tour should b done as well but first the day trip to see than night to enjoy ...

Magnificent to walk along . Great to see from either walking along it, especially at night with all the lights or from looking down towards it from the Castle - one day I hope to do a cruise down it in one of the hotel boats.
A MUST!!. 1. Go there with coffee in the morning and just sit and relax2.after u wake up - go to run in the danoba and then shower+ sex (:Amazing place and so pretty

Night or Day - Bridge orBoat or Walk way this is a lot of why your hear. Don't miss walking the chain bridge and taking a night boat cruise on this wonderful river. It is the lifeline to the Heart of Europe... Budapest!

Awesome night time views !. It is very worthwhile to take a evening sightseeing tour by boat, you will not be disappointed ! Make sure to leave on a later boat to ensure the Parliament and other sights are lighted

a graceful river. Trips on the danube are included with the many different tourbus
companies which ply for hire and can be as cheap 6000 forints

Nice sunset cruise, with dinner and drinks. We was 4 pepole joining the Dinner and cruise tour. Nice views, good buffet and vines. We was placed on a table for 8 persons, so we also have nice conversation with pepole from other countries and got some good tip for what to do i Budapest. Very enjoyable evening.
Lovely views, loved it . Lovely river lovely views boat trip is brilliant some of the views in the evening are breathe taking must visit

Don't go to Budapest without cruising on the Danube. We enjoyed a very memorable cruise on the Danube in lovely sunny weather. It is a fantastic way to see any city, but particularly one as beautiful as Budapest. Well worth making the effort, however, I would not recommend it on a wet day.

Night boat ride with dinner. . Beautiful. We opted to go on this trip at night, the views were amazing. The city lights up gold which adds to the evening. The food on the boat was delicious A buffet was provided but it was proper hot delicious food. Very nice. The staff were very friendly. The boat does not get packed so there is plenty of room to wonder around and take in the views. I would defiantly recommend this if in Budapest.

Boat Trip not Road Trip !!!!!!!!. Fantastic boat trip (done it day and night)...It is much different in the evening since the city is full of lights and its magical. A must-see and a must-do in Budapest....
Night Cruise. Budapest is lit beautifully at night, and the boat trip provided us a view of sights that we had missed. Better to sit on the "Buda" side of the boat.

This is am important part of Budapest!. The river is significant to this city. It splits the city into two segments: Buda and Pest! Buda is the part that has most of the old historic parts in it, while Pest is a bit more modern. My impression was that most tourists were in Buda, taking in the sights. The people here take pride in the lights along this river at night. They light up the buildings all along the river. It is lovely. You can choose to dine on a boat docked on the river, or take a riverboat cruise, with or without dinner included. This you can do during the day, where you really can see more sights and details of the lovely buildings, or at night, taking in the beautiful twinkling lights strung around all of the buildings. I wanted to do both, but time did not allow this. Plus just being on the historic Danube is a treat in itself.
Great sightseeing. If you use a public transportation boat in Budapest you get a wonderful river trip for more than fair price. Be prepared to a windy stay on upper deck!

By day or by night, both views are outstanding. We were on a river cruise and were able to see the Danube by day and by night. I think this is a must do via boat, walking along the banks are wonderful but boating view was best. Night view was stunning. You don't need a long tour, hop on hop off? Do bring your camera

River cruise with silverline. Had a wonderful sightseeing tour at night with silverline tours (operating from dock 11). Paid 3000 HUF per adult for a 70-85 min trip.the Danube (Budapest) is a lovely place which becomes a real spectacle once the buildings are illuminated at night.

Romantic Danube river cruise Ama Waterways. Just returned from our Romantic Danube river cruise. I did not enjoy the trip as I found it too hectic with all the excursions, and the constant bing bong of the cruise manager to make sure we were ready to go on the trip of the day. Excursions were ok but a bit boring for me, by the end of the cruise I was exhausted as I felt I always had to be somewhere at a certain time. This is not a reflection on the experience, it is just my personal opinion. Ama Waterways offer a very high standard of service. food, everything in fact and they could not of done more to make it an enjoyable trip. The weather was cold and that meant we could not sit on deck as it was too cold, also we did not travel very far and that was dissapointing. I would recommend Ama Waterways to anyone who wants a luxury river cruise, but alas it is not for me

Water view of Budapest. A good way to take in the sights of Buda and Pest. An hours tour and if you buy the Official Hop On Hop Off bus tour, you get the river ride complimentary. The is a fully licensed bar to enjoy a drink and take in the sights. A must do with excellent value.

Large busy river flowing though the heart of Budapest. The famous Danube river which divides Buda from Pest. Very busy with river traffic including tour boats, army vessels, large river cruise boats. Beautiful at night when all major sites and bridges are lit up.
Great stroll. We did a late afternoon-to-early evening stroll from the Chain Bridge up to Parliament, checking out the Memorial of Shoes along the way. Great views, easy going path.

Fabulous Cruise !. The 8 day Viking cruise which we took in April was absolutely stunning from start to finish the service, high standard throughout was second to none.The food was a very high standard at all meals with an option to dine outside if the weather permitted.The cabins were very comfortable and the air conditioning provided an excellent control of the cabin temperature for day and night.The inclusive films on the widescreen TV monitor was a nice touch for late evening viewing and the internet was also very efficient throughout the journey.We particularly enjoyed all of the inclusive tours provided by Viking, we got to see all of the important features of all of the cities and towns that we visited.We enjoyed it so much that we have re-booked with Viking to go to Portugal on the river Douro next year, we talked to several people that recommended this trip, so within a day of returning home we made the new booking.In summary, Viking provided us with service that I can only describe as 6 star from start to finish and I can only praise them for creating such an excellent cruise line!

The Danube is every bit as enchanting as expected. We walked along the Danube on both sides and also saw it from the window of our hotel room as it weaved its way between Buda and Pest. At night it lights up and takes on another aspect of its beauty.

River . We took a tour on a boat and payed 3'900 forint (which are around 13-15 euros) per person, drinks inclusive. It was a very pleasant tour, although the tour we took didn't explain anything about all the buildings we passed which I thought would've been nice. All in all it was very nice- we had the perfect weather for it too. Little windy but the sun was shining.

Good for having a sail along the river Danube several interesting trips to do. Very interesting trips there are several bridges to sail under and there's evening trips also which you can watch entertainment and Neva a meal and a drink

Beautiful views at night. We took a one hour tour. The sites were beautifully lit, and the historical narration through headphones was helpful. (Several languages are offered through the machine at each bench or chair.)Be sure to use your tokens for coffee, water or wine. When the server came around taking orders, I forgot about the tokens and did not order anything to drink. My bad.
River Cruise. Best thing I did when in Budapest. Would recommend going in early evening when the landmarks are illuminated
Cheapest cruise. The cheapest way of navigate the Danube is taking the public boat. We took it from the Green Bridge till Margaret island. A good experience.

Do a river cruise. River cruise by night - excellent way to see all the beautiful buildings lit up. We did the dinner cruise which I would recommend BUT you can't see everything fully, if I was doing this again I would do a cruise without dinner as when I nipped outside afterwards the views were spectacular.
Cruise. We had an hours boat trip - you can see a lot of interesting places from the cruise boat - a guide tells you about each building you pass.

2nd longest river in europe. The Danube is a long and rather wide river -fresh water - that cuts the town in two : Pest and Buda . There are about 10 bridges acroos the river - special - and there is a nice Island called Margit in the center of the river . place worth visiting

Take a boat ferry and/or tram. Rather than an organised boat trip, a much cheaper option is to take the public boat ferry and zig zag across the Danube by day. Then at night catch the No. 2 tram and see the spectacular Danube lit up - fabulous.

Dinner Cruise. Not so great....the cruise itself, looking at Buda and Pest, was very nice, but the food was average, and when they ran out of food; (they ran out of salad, chicken, meat and very over cooked vegetables) they shrugged and said that was all there was. Even though the boat was only 1/2 full, they ran out of food within the first hour they put it out. So if you want to eat...get to the food ASAP. Like as soon as they put the hot food out--get your plate.

Just beautiful. After a long working day come take a walk along Danube, admiring the architecture and watching people jogging, walking dogs, socializing. Or take a boat tour. Even at night it is worth it. Also Danube views are marvellous when seen from one of many bridges of the city. Enjoy!

Good in the day. Spectacular at night.. An easy walk along the Danube filled with sights for all tourists. Budapest shines (WOW!) at night and along the Danube is a must. Can walk all the way from the Grand Market to Parliament in less than an hour.

Not Blue, but great to walk along. This is a great place to walk along and admire all the buildings. Quite romantic at night, and a lot of couples sit and drink wine and admire the views. For those not so keen on walking, the no 2 tram goes all along the Pest side, and the 19 or 41 the Buda side so can appreciate the views without the walking.

Beautiful river cruise on the Danube. We took a river cruise from Budapest to Nurenberg on the Danube. The Danube separates the Buda and Pest part of Budapest, which is the old city and new more modern part of the city. Part of the cruise took us through Austria's beautiful Wachau Valley viewing castles and Abby's along the way.

My experience in booking a tour online. In the beginning, I am interested in an evening cruise on the official website of Budapest tourism (budapest.com) which require an online reservation. I have sent two reservations and got no reply. So I chose another cruise tour with dinner included, but there are none available on the website. Lastly, I booked directly through the official website of the company by googling the name directly. There were plenty of places left but need to pay in full in Euros. I hope my experience may help some travellers. Besides, when you get the ticket (regardless of which company you are travelling with), you will get the pier number. The pier is rather long between the Chain Bridge and the Elisabeth Bridge and you can't google the exact location of the pier. The location that Google map generated is the mid-point of the pier only. So spare time for walking to and finding where yours locate.

Time to relax but still with lots of sightseeing . We bought our tickets from Danube-yacht, wich is a 2 days unlimited ticket for only 2.100 HUF (less than 7€). It's a good deal since you get an English and a German speaking audio guide. Danube-yacht provides 2 different kinds of tours: Daytime (you see the Parliament and Margaret Island) and Nighttime (you see the opposite part of Danube). So for two days you can sail as much as you like... just be there 15 minutes at least before the departure If you travel during spring and summer, bring sunscreen(!) and a cardigan since it can be quite chilly

Lovely river. Popular destination for access to Danube. River crossed by number of bridges. The chair bridge the older was British design linking both halves of city over the river. There are plenty of bot trips offered to take trip of varying lengths on the Danube. The key buildings along the river are pointed out and there is translation available for a number of languages. The boats are comfortable with bar and toilet facilities. Night cruses are available. Worth a trip if you have time. This river forms part of a longer river trip cruise circuit.

Pleasant way to spend an hour . Good price for ticket including a coffee or cold drink. The trip lasted about 50 mins with good commentary via headphones. Although the boat was a little ahead of the commentary for part of the trip.
Lovely walk next to the river. The river walk is just lovely. We felt safe and the views of the castle on one side and the city on the other made it interesting.
Really good scenery . We where on a river cruise and they took us on an evening cruise along the Danube at Budapest the sight was amazing when city is lite up at night

night ride. we had a night ride on the Danube, it was wonderful, from the boat, we saw all the bridges and all the important buildings along the coast, if you go in a larger group you can get a discount on tickets and prices are a bit different on ships

Perfect! Must do at night!. My entire family enjoyed the boat ride. Prices reasonable, bring your Rick steves book and get a discount. Great historical information on the headset (in 30 languages) while you view the beautifully lit up river sides. I wish they turned off the tv to be able to avoid the tv glare for picture taking.

Beautiful Danube. Just finished a Viking Cruise on the Danube. It was a wonderful trip. The Danube River is a beautiful river going through beautiful cities like Budapest and Vienna but also small villages and towns. Groing through the narrower parts of the river and the locks give you a very intimate view of the countryside.

“Boat tour on the Danube”. We had a boat tour on a nice breezy clear evening on the River Danube. It took around an hour. A boat tour is the only way to enjoy the fabulous scenery from Margaret Bridge to Petofi Bridge especially when the sun was setting. From there we passed through a few famous bridges and enjoyed the lit up Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, the Gellert Hill and Statue and Parliament building. Most impressive was the Parliament building; it was so bright that you need a shade for your eyes. Hee! Hee! Happy Travelling!

Beautiful from any angle. With monumental buildings on both sides of the river, lots of boat traffic, lovely bridges along the way, a stroll along the river is very relaxing. Lots to see, and with bridges along the way, a trip to the opposite side of the river is easy.

Nice walk. Was in Budapest a few weekends ago for a hen party and some of us decided to arrive a day early to have a little explore around the city. Loved walking along the river - it was so peaceful and calm!

Worth a boat ride. We had an inclusive ticket from a bus tour and this give us a boat trip up and down the Danube. We enjoyed a 90 minute trip up to Margaret Island and then down past 3 of the bridges. Good for getting great views of the parliament building

Very scenic and tranquil. Yes there's a busy road running along side it but it is truely tranquil and a very romantic walk. Plenty if sights to see along the route and amazing architecture. Remember to visit the shoes by parliament building and spare a thought for what they mean, it's happening still today.....

Its not Blue, but its beautiful. A wonderful river with a picturesque city both sides. The public buildings are kept sparkling with constant attention to detail, to attract tourists.We did the river cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam - an absolutely captivating experience for the entire journey.

A bucket list experience. You must take a river cruise on the Danube, which, while it is not exactly blue, is a stunning river. Sights on both sides, both Buda and Pest, are great photo opportunities.

The best city to appreciate the Danube!. Of all the big cities on the Danube, Budapest is the one that takes best advantage of it. Historically, this really has a lot to do with each riverbank historically being a separate city, but we get to enjoy the benefits of it today in one unified capital. The views across the river are impressive in pretty much every spot, though nothing really beats the view from Pest to the Buda Castle Hill at night. There are many ways to enjoy it, from a stroll down one of several riverbank sections, perhaps with a pause at a sidewalk cafe with a view (for low-key, try one of the spots at the new Balna ("whale") center), riding a bike along the bike paths down one side and up the other, or taking to the water by boat. For this, skip the tourist boats and ride the public transport boats, accessible from well-marked boat stops, styled just like the other public transit service (tram/bus) stops. It's a lot cheaper and a lot more bang for your buck.

AMA Waterways. AMA Waterways offers the best river cruising throughout Europe. Whether it's the Danube, Rhine or Rhone Rivers you cannot beat their ships, on-board service and tours. Beats ocean cruises all the time!!

Whatever floats your boat. Our boat trip was just over 1 hour long and we went out during daylight, so please check out other reviews, to balance against our experience. Initially, the boat gave us a great photography platform to view & snap the best sights of both Buda & Pest and obviously the Chain Bridge. However, as you head towards the island, Pest becomes an urban concrete jungle. Maybe our trip wasn't quite what others have encountered as we got this free with a hop on, hop off bus pass. Anyway, Pier 10 boats are of poor quality, small & slow but quiet stable. Eat before you get on though, as I would not eat anything off these boats!

2 hour trip along the Danube. We took a 2 hour tourist sight seeing trip along the Danube from Pier 10 . For my partner, myself & child it came to HUF 6500 . There was guided commentary in English and German. On board is a little cafe/ bar where you can get drinks / alcohol etc. It was ok for the price.

Breathtaking. Breathtaking, wonderful, beautiful experience. River cruise along the Danube river must be listed in everyone's dream. You will see how God indeed made the world beautiful. Every place you stop by is significant and enchanting in its own unique way. The river is safe, clean, simply amazing.

Route for whom have less time to explore Budapest. If you don't have much time in Budapest, you can take a trip around 3 hours by Passing by the imposing building of the Parliament, you can admire the panorama of the Margaret Island (first stop-over). Then you will be passing the Castle District, the Royal Castle, the Matthias Church and the Fishermen’s Bastion, located on the Castle Hill, the Liberation Monument and the Citadel, located on the Gellért Hill. Continuing the tour in the southern direction you will see the bridges of Budapest, the National Theatre, the Palace of Arts. On the way back, you can see the universities of Budapest and the Central Market Hall.Hope you enjoy it

Try the public boat (D11). It is indeed a big river! I took a trip with a public transportation boat, D11. Its included in the travel pass and also Budapest card, so you don't have to pay for the ticket anymore.It gave me a nice view of Parliament building and both Pest and Buda.

What a sight. Seeing the Danube flowing through the city of Budapest is simply a great sight. That mighty river, flowing through Europe, makes a great pass here in the city because of the historic background. I'm sure that, if you visit Budapest, you won't miss it.

Heart of buda-pest. I have seen danube river in many countries, but I think this one is the best. Daytime is nice but nights, you forget everything bad in your life, and enjoy the pearls. So many sailing boats make the river alive the whole day.

Walk or boat?. We spent lots of time walking by the Danube exploring and we also did a boat cruise. Was a little disappointed the boat didn't go round the Island which was a walk too far on our travels.The best thing is all the statues along the rivet and you can't visit Budapest without viewing this mighty waterway.

Very nice views. We took a cruise on the river but since we had walked so much already we had seen a lot of the views. The historical facts provided were very useful. I would definitely recommend going on a cruise especially if you want to save your legs for walking around other parts of the city.

The river Danube. Although it spans many cities and countries across europe this has to be one of the most beautiful stretches due to the views of both Buda and Pest. The views at night are just as, or even more so, worth visting come dusk. The attractions spanning the Danube are lit up and look stunning! This is a sight you cant possible miss whilst in Budapest, just ensure you allow time to go back to the Danube in the evening! Happy holidays!
Danube. The Danube runs through the center of Budapest, separating Buda and Pest. Most picturesque at dawn and dusk.

Anything but blue. It's not blue these days, but the Danube is still a wonder to behold, a waterway for so many long boats, crossed by many, many fascinating bridges, a river that flows by magnificent buildings from another era. Famous, and deservedly so.

Boat trip. Booked through VIATOR, and was very pleased. They picked us up from the hotel and took us to the boat where we had s lovely meal. The music was a string quartet. Parliment looks amazing as does the chain bridge

Walk and make a cruise.... Danube gives Budapest a romantic atmosphere. It worth walking near the river and crossing it through the bridges. For a different perspective you can take tram n.2 and admire the river and the nearby buildings. Making a cruise, especially at night, will be an unforgettable experience.

choose a nice boat!. The most impordant to enjoy this activity is to choose the best boat! We chose a chip one and it was bad experience! Night cruise offers better view...Otherwise you can see everything just by walking next to Danube-which I prefer unless you haven't got enough time!

Beautiful evening. We did the candlelit dinner on the Legenda and had a wonderful time. The food was excellent and plentiful with a great atmosphere. The staff on board were very nice and we truly had a lovely evening.

The river, oh the river.... Ok, take a walk along the river, at the sunset please, and keep walking, from the city centre until the parlament. Wide river with a pleasant cruise. I had nice river cruise over Danube. You're able to visit Margaret island with a boat trip. What is more it is so nice to have windows to Danube from your hotel to have a look continous traffic of boats.
Not so Blue Danube. Cruising up and down it has to be the best way to see most of the attractions lit up at night, we did it at 9pm and it can get very cold so go prepared.

Finally got to see this famous landmark . I can tick this one off my list . Nice river with the 3 bridges and lots of boat trad did. So Glad to finally see this. Cold breeze coming off the river so make sure you are well wrapped up in winter or as now spring.

Old Blue Danube...:). So anyway...it is a river...:) You can see boats, river ships passing by. the best way to explorer, to buy a ticket for public transportation (max 2 euros) and go with the ships operated by them. You can find the ship stations on each sideof the Danube. So enjoy!;)
beautiful especially at night. Walking along this river gives your a great view of the architecture in Budapest. Definitely check it out in the day and at night for a nice contrast in the skyline!

Worth a short cruise. We took the river cruise included in our Big Bus ticket. It's a bout an hour and you get some nice views of either side of the city. Big Bus is worth the money taking you to most of the sights etc.
Dinner cruise!. We enjoyed a dinner cruise along the Danube. Dinner consisted of a buffet of local foods but the view from the top deck of the boat was breathtaking! Definitely a travel highlight!

Boat Trip. We went on a boat trip(included in the hop on hop off bus ticket) and it was a very worthwhile and informative trip with some excellent views.

Budapest opens the true beauty of Danube.. We (a couple) believe that you won't be able to realize the beauty of Danube unless you will visit Budapest. The best panoramic view to the river opens from the Gellert Hill.From time to time, the river shows its wild nature and covers some parts of Budapest with water as it happened during 2013 flood.No matter what condition of the river you will meet, it will stay forever in your mind.

A great way to get an impression of the city. The Budapest card gives free acces to the public boat service. There was a stop near our hotel and we made the trip twice. It was a good way to get an impression of the city and to take photographs.
Day/Night Cruise !. Try both....day and night cruises !! And choose a sunny day because you won't regret to experience a sun set in the middle of the Danube !!

Beautiful river trips.. My friend and I enjoyed the cruise trip up the Danube as it was included as part of the Big bus tour. Fast flowing. I am unsure why they call it the blue Danube because it was not blue lol. It had some trees in it and I mean full size trees not just branches but it did not distract you from the view. We went on a boat trip on the Danube and it was a nice smooth ride.
Danube. This is a busy river carrying tourists and cargo alike. It certainly isn't blue! Nevertheless it is an interesting feature.

Danube river cruise. Great way to see the major sights of the city really beautiful. Highly recommend doing the river cruise Bidapest is such a lovely city & would especially recommend walking in the city as night falls when the buildings are lit up its amazing.

A loverly stroll. What more can one say about the Grand mighty Danube. It is so loverly to watch the boats sailing up and down and the tourists enjoying the ambiance. Nice café's and restaurants along the river.
River Cruise. for my birthday I went on a river cruise on the Danube river. It was absolutely amazing to see the views of both sides of the city. Highly recommend it!

Great view's.. Lovely walk. Had a fabulous walk all along the river unfortunately had just missed a boat and too cold to hang about. I saw the shoes and though they where a wonderful tribute.

Hreat place to sit & watch the world go by. The Danube is a great place to walk or sit by day or night and you can get boat trips on it. nice... but ok, in vienna is better. you don't go to Budapest for the river. but it is there, and the walk on its banks is good, at least if you keep looking at the castle

Particularly Beautiful At Night. I was on the M.S. River Adagio and enjoyed watching the various bridges go by while sailing. Our captain took us on an evening sail the last night and it was magical. Buildings and monuments were lit up. I particularly liked the Liberation Monument.

Great vies from the river. Fantastic river that gives real feeling to the City.Great views from the river of many of the beautiful buildings around the city.

Its a river !. Whilst the Danube seperates Buda from Pest and is available for boat trips etc it is a brown fast flowing river as it passes through the city - you still have to see it though

Only cost 750 huf each, you can go up past Margaret island, and past all main sites in central budapest. The boat criss crosses from jetty to jetty. Great cheap way to travel on the Danube.

Danube by night. My first night in Budapest was a rainy one, but I had planned to take the Danube by night with Legenda. Due to the rain the hour's tour was no "wow show", still it gives you a romantic and general idea of Budapest and its light. Had a 20% discount thanks to Budapest card and a glass of wine included. I suggest it no matter the weather and the obvious touristic service. Average/good
Nice for a walk. Nice place to escape to, to take a walk. Not the most picturesque views at some points, but a peaceful escape, nonetheless.
Just great. Free boat ride with big bus tour, am and night tour. Great pictures and scenery at night and during the day- unlimited rides.

One of the great Rivers of Europe. Had several strolls along the Danube both during the day and night and it did not disappoint. The water is murky and there are lots of boats but the scenery is fabulous and much better walking the streets. BP is such a walk able city we did not need public transport or taxis.
Worth walking aside this river!. had a couple of great walks aside the river where I could see the water and the historic buildings. Very wide and in a good condition pavements. Worth walking!
sights. Loved cruising on the Danube in the evening but wrap up warmly as it can be very cold on the upper deck but plenty to see so well worth taking the trip
Nice to walk by. The Danube is the separation between Buda and Pest side it's nice to take a walk during the night to enjoy Budapest lights.

Budapest's best attraction. To me, the Danube embankments in Budapest, both the left and the right ones, represent the city's best attraction. It obviously deserves the title of UNESCO World Heritage site. We walked there at daytime, from the BME university to the Parliament building, a day later, took a boat trip in the evening, and then, on the third day, walked again. The beauty of historic buildings facing Danube (Danubius Hotel Gellert, the Buda Castle, the Mathias Church, the Parliament, etc.) and the famous bridges is something that you never forget.

Night time cruise is lovely . Loved our night time cruise along the Danube. We felt the cost including a meal was very expensive so we just went for the cruise and it was nice. The only thing was that our boat had plastic sides rather than glass so it meant it was a little difficult to see out without going on deck which was freezing!

It's Hard to Rate a River. It is hard to rate a river, especially one like the Danube. I give it 5 stars because it is a must see in Budapest, particularly to understand the significance of the city itself. For those without background on the city, originally the Danube separated the cities of Buda and Pest until their unification a little over a century ago. I wouldn't recommend a specific visit to the river, only because it is so large and runs through the city and would actually be quite hard to miss. See the other sites like Fisherman's Grotto or the Parliament building and you can't help but take in the Danube itself.

Romantic Danube. Viking seemed to be TOTALLY unprepared for a low water situation on the Danube despite the fact that it has been a recurrent issue. AccommodationOf the tour was limited and half the tour was aborted. No realistic alternative to the advertised touring was presented. The alternative of a beer garden visit in Pasau was border line insulting as were the proposed 7 hour round trip on a bus to Neurenburg and the abbreviated tour to Regensburg. Customer concern was secondary by a large margin.Very disappointing trip!! Communication from Viking was late and limited.

Great views at night. During the day it looks fairly brownish and the boats (e.g. anchored restaurants) are not attractive. At night, the lights make it a different experience and a stroll along the Pest side of the Danube at night (not on the tram lines!) is not to be missed.
The beauty of Budapest is complimented by Danube. Majestic river flowing into Budapest crossing many important cities in EuropeWas lucky to see a red Bull Air Race above the Danube...
very nice walk along this mythic river. There are some coffee shops and pubs on the river itself, some with restaurant and relaxing lounges where the clients can admire the boats passing by

Remarkable. Along with my friend, we have thought to get the boat tour but we did not require such a thing. Moreover, I recommend to see this river both by day and night, since in changes drastically from day and night but still remains a remarkable attraction to see.
Boat Tour. Took a boat tour down the Danube amazing views you get to see everything... all the bridges, the parliament everything beside the river.

Big river. It's a big river, isn't it? Man, that river is big. This river is a big one. Let me tell you, friend, that this river is big. There's some branches and debris in it. And sometimes some birds. The water is cloudy. I wonder how deep it is?
The artery of the city. You can't miss the Danube on a trip to Budapest. It separates the Buda part of the city from Pest and can be crossed by several bridges, ferries or the red metro line.
Duna.... I love 'Duna' as the Hungarian call it. I walked daytime and nighttime, very romantic - and very safe.

Lovely River with a lovely bridge!. We loved walking around the river day/night time. Especially at night time with the reflection of the lights all around, the river looks even prettier.
