A must at NIGHT!. Grab a two day bus pass from a local street vendor ( I believe we were on the red bus w/ the pic of a giraffe on it) and make sure it includes a free Danube river tour and go at night. The buildings, statues and bridges look spectacular!
Lovely river. The river was nice, they do a good job of keeping it clean. People were fishing near the Elizabeth Bridge frequently.
Nice Panorama. Went on A Night Budapest River Cruise. 2nd Longest River in Europe. After the Volga. Approx 1800 Miles and 10 Countries. I Believe very Popular with Viking River Cruise 's

it is always nice to watch the river. crossing it through one of the bridges, for example Libety bridge, biking by it to the North, for example to Szentendre open air museum, or riding a boat or a ship to Margaret island for example, or just strolling by Danube on Pest side, there are several ways to enjoy it

Danube (Duna). The river is the organic part of Budapest, the town wouldn't be the world's most beautiful Capital without the Danuabe. You can have a nice shipping there and in the evening it's a beautiful sight from the bridges and the buildings around.

The river of Budapest. The second longest river in Europe after the Volga River - (almost 3000km) crossing 10 countries from Germany to the Black see. There are many Danube river cruises, which may include the cities like Vienna, Budapest, Munich and Prague. If you are in Budapest, you can take a one hour sightseeing cruise on the river along the city with several stops at the main attractions. Some operators even offer lunch or dinner on the way, or you can also find some fixed floating restaurants on both side with live music or concerts sometimes in the night (like on A38) .view is gorgeous in the night from both sides or also from the bridges - worth a big walk along

You can`t avoid it!. It`s impossible to visit Budapest without seeing the river, what I recently found out though is that it`s a nice walking path right next to the river on the pest side. You can walk along it for quite a long while. I did this from the chain-bridge and all the way up to the Parliament, Along this path you also find the famous shoes at the Danube which is a nice sight for history lovers.
Relaxing. It's the perfect place to just sit down and read a book, write, draw, or just think about life. Beautiful panorama as well.
Stunning views and a relaxing walk. I love walking along the Danube, especially in fair weather. It is a really relaxing way to take in the sights of Budapest.

The River that Separate Buda and Pest. Well there are rivers in many places what set this apart is it being right there in the middle of the city. It become a part of life for the people living there but as a tourist visiting this place and seeing the city from the river is a different experience all together. Must visit around in the night to see the beautiful lighting and the view from it
Fun around . The river never leaves you with surprises. Now a days it is getting more and more commercial , but should not miss the Restaraunt Spoon on the boat , the three course meal is super
Beautiful to see Budapest from the river. This is not to be missed. The Parliament buildings just pop from this view point. Budapest is so beautiful. Nice to see it from the calm and tranquil Danube

Always changing . . .. We were fortunate to have a hotel room overlooking the Danube and watched as grass lines floated by, double barges plowed upstream, and tour boats enlivened the dark waters with flashing lights.

Peaceful . We did a boat tour on this river which was included on our hop on and hop off ticket. It was a great ride on this historic river and you get to see views of Buda on one side and Pest on the other and each of its characteristics of modern vs historic. A definite must!
It's a river. Aside feo. Walking across it or along side it or maybe even going for a cruise on it, it's just a plain old dirty brown river:/

Boat trip on the Danube.. A really good way of seeing the beautiful bridges and buildings from a different perspective.You can have lunch or dinner whilst doing so, but we opted not to. Many of the cruises offer you the option of hopping on and off so you can take as much time as you want to enjoy the sights.Seeing the underside of the bridges to get an idea of the amazing architectural feats that were performed is well worth it. There are also quite a few birds to look out for.

One of the World's Grandest Rivers. The Danube River is much wider than I thought it would be, and it adds to the allure of Budapest. The river splits the Buda and Pest sides of the city, and no matter what time of day, you can always see boats and cruise ships going along the water. The bridges span the river and are wonderful to walk across and really take in the grandeur of the river. There are tons of great buildings and sights to see along the river, too.I highly recommend taking a river tour at night - preferably a dinner cruise, so that you can really experience the Danube.
The not blue Danube. The river is wide but not blue..... why is it not blue, we don't know but the trip down it is a wonderful cruise to take and one everyone should do before they die.
See at night. We went on a cruise for one hour when it was getting dark. The city is worth seeing at this time as all the buildings are lit up.

Not the 'Blue Danube' of Strauss, but fabulous anyway!. A murky brow eiver....but still evokes true romance of days of a bygone era! We sid a river cruise (£23) which included an excellent buffet meal and all the key riverside sights....its a true 'must' for any short visit and well worth the money!

How do you rate a River?. The Blue Danube it is not. It is more the Browny Green Danube. It is about as wide as the Thames at the Parliament part. It flows a bit more rapidly than the Thames. And in the center of the Town, lined with the Palace and other Grand buildings, Buda on one side and Pest on the other, it is, with the absent Blue notwithstanding, quite a romantic looking place. I enjoyed it.

First come, first sits. The cruise is located near the elizabeth bridge to your right. We had the ticket included in our hop on-hop off city tour bus. The times are 14:30 and 17:00. The 14:30 is one hour long boat ride while the 17:00pm is 30minutes ride. At first,we wanted to ride the 14:30 but it was fill up. So they refused us to go. Must be done at night. Although by day this river is murky and not overly nice, it is amazing to see at night with all the building lights reflecting. Amazing to cruise down on a boat and see the city from all angles

Best way to spend the night. You must do a night river cruise. Regardless of what type of cruise, be it; a dinner cruise; wine cruise or just cruise, you just do this. It shows the city in the most beautiful light at such a reasonable price. You see so many of the main sights which are lit up magnificently. Great way to spend a night in Budapest.
Flowing beauty with lots to see on the banks. My title more or less describes what I wanted to say. Beautiful river crossing beautiful cities including Budapest. Try a boat trip, worth.

Great for viewing buda riverline. The Danube is something you will undoubtably pass on your way between the "buda" and "pest" sides of the city. I would highly recommend taking a boat tour (we got the basic one with commentary, none of the fancy ones) and it was informative and a nice chance to relax after a day of walking.

Experience Budapest by Captain's view. This is the main river that splits Buda and Pest, it is hustle and bustle with transport and tourist boats. Take a river cruise at night and get the best views of Budapest while the city is lite up and breathtaking!
nice for party. great place for sightseeing and party on the boat clubs acroos the river , love it , meet a lot of people and had a great fun
What a view. Wow. How beautiful to see the Danube in this area of Europe. It is a must see when visiting Budapest. The old castle overlooks the river and makes a beautiful sight.

Tram 2 a great ride tip for all Budapest visitors. We took Tram number 2 which runs along the Danube on the Buda side and also by Parliamenh, the Ronald Reagan statue and other landmarks.
This is a quick inexpensive way to see the Danube area.
the Doctor hit me with a helpful vote

Duna Palota Dinner and Cruise on the Danube - Feb 2016. Just had the most lovely experience on the Danube. The food was lovely. The staff were friendly, attentive and helpful. The musicians played individual requests for you at your table a tip is customary for this. 4.If you have any worries or need anything the staff were so helpful. 5. The ship is large, clean and modern. We had a lovely evening and the lights of the city were amazing with plenty of time to take photos out on deck. Hope this review helps you!

Very nice and relaxing.. Took a night cruise with a friend,and it's really relaxing and pretty.You can see the famous buildings from both sides,and also before going up the boat you can get a nice beer :]one of the best attractions i believe.

Danube River, bridge, fishers house and castles all are amazing.. Budapest the oldest European history is amazing. Not very expensive like other European country. Danube river and pest side is full of historian place, Must to visit place if you wanna something magical in East Europe

If u r in Hungary, Must cruise through this river. In Hungary then u cannot miss this river. Make sure to take a morning as well as night cruise to see the beauty of the City and monuments around it. Nice pathway along the river for a long nice walk. Enjoy the lighting around.

New Years Eve To Remember. We had pre-booked earlier in the year for a New Years Eve dinner cruise on the Danube. Despite the boat sailing from a different location we checked in on the quayside and were shown to our vessel for the evening. Our table was read for the 4 of us and we were offered a prosecco aperitif to start before dinner. It was exceptionally well organised and there was constant entertainment from a gypsy trio who could play anything - we were amazed when they came round the tables and we asked if they knew the Intermezzo from Cavalleria Rusticana which they then proceeded to play perfectly! When I wiped my wifes tears from her eyes we carried on with dinner and an endless supply of drink to accompany it. The boat did 2 x 1 hour cruises - one at the start of dinner, and one just before Midnight - the scenes on the shoreline with all the building decked out in lights and constant firework displays were spectacular. We then had gyspy dancers and after the Sylvester meal there was a disco. What a great way to see the Danube and all the bridges and magnificent buildings.

A very picturesque river with many sites to see on both sides.. If you use the Hop On tour bus, it will include a trip down the Danube, which will allow you to determine what sites on either side of the river that you wish to see in Pest and Buda. The river itself is murky but not smelly.
The River. While in Budapest, you might as well take a short cruise on the river and see some of the sights. There are lots of good options.

Very Cool @ Sunset. We did the Hop on/ hop off tour & it was so worth it! We were able to get off and explore for 2 days! It also included the boat tour at 3x of the day (Feb is slow time so not as often). We arrived for the 5pm boat tour, right when the sun was setting. Made for some absolutely stunning views when the sun was setting and city lights/buildings lighting up.

Very picturesque at night. Had an incredible night boat ride and saw many of the great iconic buildings along the river light up which was fantastic. We were very lucky with the weather as it was in February. I would suggest a nice glass of Palinka to warm the cockles on your voyage
Worth to visit!. I had brilliant boat trip in the evening on the river Danube and was impressed with wonderful views of the bridges, Parliament and castle hill...

Beautiful scenery. River Danube has many beautiful building such as house of parliament alongside it. The river is very wide and the shores are nice and clean. The boat ride is smooth and covers quite a fair length of the River. Thoroughly recommend it
Lovely Danube. Had a wonderful boat trip along the Danube, good commentary, great views across to Pest, great views of the bridges.

Blue Danube. For us, the most beautiful river in the World. The river that gives life to million of families. If I think as one name, one river, provides life for all those leaving around, or far, from the river. With all this 5 star cruises, mainly with Uniworld, you can explore all the beauties, attractions, comfort, history, and entertainment what this river can provide along its flow. Experience of your life!!!

A walk to Remember. The walk around the river Danube is one of the best ones I've ever had. Starting from the Margherita Islands (bridge) and walking on the side of it to Chains bridge and then continuing on the other side of the river. The views are astonishing no matter it's sunny or drops of water falling from the sky ... no matter daylight or night sky .. A must do thing in BUDAPEST
Lovely boat trip. The boat trip on the Danube from the pretty (but touristy) village of Szentendre to Budapest is a very pleasant way to spend a late summer afternoon.
Breathtaking river. It is as beautiful as you've heard. Feels great to walk close to it, enjoying the peaceful atmosphere and cool air from it.
View by night. We took a short boat trip at night, the place realy comes alive from the river, would strongly recommend. Refreshment prices were cheap to.

A great, safe walk on the riverwalk. On a Sunday, this place is full of joggers, walkers and if it's sunny, families on outings. Have a guidebook with you to know what you are passing--it's worth knowing!

fascinating view...especially during the night. looking at the river you can see how fast it is flowing, how can the small boats handle it? Go down to the river at nighttime: all the bridges are illuminated!

The Danube to taste in a town of Szentendre. すべてクリアI move from the town of Budapaest to the town of Szentendre on a Hungarian railroad.This town is a town in the bank of the Danube.It is a small town, but there are many tourists.　Is the Catholic Church on the hill Maine?The Danube flows through the east of the town relaxedly.The Danube of October was already cold; ^^
Crouze at night. Ive buy the ticket at the boat and it was cheaper that way....very nice view at night.....you can order a meal or a drink. Meal is a bit problem moving at that boat

Beautiful Scenery. It is well worth taking a trip up the Danube in one of the many covered boats. Most trips include a drink, beer, wine, champagne or soft drink and a video commentary of the many sights.Some of the trips also include a meal option for an extra cost. The trip usually last about an hour and I think it is really good value for money. You can't go to Budapest and not take a trip up the Danube. The evening trips are great because all the buildings are lit up and the scenery is beautiful.

Sightseeing cruise with Silverline. Good value for a 1.5 hour cruise on the Danube, roughly 11 euros per person. Recommend going after sunset, as lights on Parliament building and others are impressive.

Must do !. No trip to Budapest would be complete without a cruise on Danube to see the parliament building, castle and Mathias church. I would take the cruise at night. - we took the one without a meal as we weren't interested in the Hungarian meal.The lighting is spectacular and gives a different picture at night.

Horrible Service...Then and Now. About 5 years ago several friends and I took a Viking River Cruise down the Danube. First and in all fairness, the ports and excursions were absolutely breathtaking. We visited Budapest, Slovakia, Vienna, and Passau...an experience I thoroughly enjoyed and will never forget. I would strongly advise taking this voyage on any other line but Viking, as our ship and customer service left much to be desired.We've been cruising and primarily ocean cruises, for over 20 years. And yes we do know there is a big difference. That difference however shouldn't come in the form of "low quality" food, accommodations, and customer service.Viking is far from cheap so we began our voyage with great expectations. When we boarded our riverboat, The Viking Sky, we found it to be old, worn, basically dilapidated. A vessel that I am now told has been "decommissioned" and which should have been prior to our voyage. We did however, give Viking the benefit of the doubt saying..."they'll make it up in food and service" HAH!!. The food was the worst ever, full of sodium to the point of where our feet and hands swelled daily. Thank goodness none of us had heart issues. After our evening meal, if we were hungry, there was nothing to eat...no room service, snacks, nothing...a cooler of water in the lobby was it. We had to go ashore and spend more money satisfying appetites that should have come with our "high priced" ticket.One evening at dinner a waiter starting arguing with a guest at our table. Instead of trying to please a customer, this waiter was trying to prove his point and did so while embarrassing the entire dining room. He wasn't the only staff member that exhibited unprofessional conduct and poor customer service during our trip.The complaints go on and on with this awful experience. The reason however that I'm writing this review now...years later, is that Viking recently contacted me concerning a not so nice comment I posted on FB. They asked that I please deal with them directly to see if they could finally at this late date, rectify things from my previous voyage. I was a bit impressed, once again gave them more credit than they deserve and thought perhaps they had changed.Shortly after our cruise we did send letters of complaint and were insulted by the lack of consideration and the fact Viking offered us a "meager" discount voucher to take a chance on another one of their overpriced trips. It was offensive. Regardless, when the sweet Viking rep approached me this time, I still wanted to try and give her more than her company ever gave me...a chance to finally do the right thing.Well some things never change...and Viking seems to be one of them. After several discussions, this staff person, who swears Viking is continually striving to be better than ever...basically offered me the same insulting deal from long agoIn closing all I can say is when you're in the business of serving people...every customer should matter as if they're the only customer you have. Viking does a great job of "impressing" people with beautiful scenic pictures and stories...yet when it comes right down to it, they truly only want to speak to one of their fans. Some people know a good thing when they see it, some don't. Viking is the furthest thing from good and charges you double the price of any other reputable cruise line out there. It's easy to satisfy when things go well. It's when they don't that you truly see what a company is made of. When it comes to making the wrong right...Viking is all talk and no action. There's another saying too and it's "Money Talks and Bull Manure Walks". If you're listening Viking...other things talk as well, like people you have treated poorly and then disregard. In other words...bad news travels fast.
Viking River Cruise. Well, the Danube is not blue, but it is beautiful to leisurly float down the river with no cares in the world. I highly recommend this trip.

Buda | Pest. The river Danube splits the centre between Buda and Pest. The river itself has great views but also is key in history to the Shoes on the River which are on the Eastern side towards Parliament which are very meaningful and quite thought provoking.

Spectacular. ANY cruise on the Danube is well worth the effort. It is truly beautiful. Having done both day and night cruises I must say night time was my favourite. While daylight allows the opportunity to see more things in detail, at night seeing the shores lit up, especially in Budapest, was nothing short of spectacular!

Danube Cruise is a must. Tickets for the Danube Cruise can be booked from the guide on city tour bus itself. That saves time. We paid at Dock No. 7 for the Legenda Danube Cruise. A one hour long sail down the Danube offers a magnificent view of both Buda and Pest. About five bridges on the Danube can be seen with all the architectural details. View of the ornate Parliament building from the Danube is spectacular. We also saw the legendary "boat bus" sailing on the river ! The audio guide narration was very helpful. View of the Fisherman's Bastion, Liberty Statue, Buda Castle and the Budapest Veil remain unforgettable. The day being bright and sunny we enjoyed the cruise to the hilt. We got down at Margaret Island and explored the place on our own for about an hour and returned by bus to board a tram on the Yellow Bridge to reach the Pest side of the city.

Great trip. We did a night one hour tour down the Danube with an English commentary ....really good. The most fantastic buildings look magnificent lit up and so many to see....well worth the trip, but wrap up warm...it gets cold
See all the sights. A trip on the Danube is a must while visiting Budapest. On a clear day there is no better way to see the major sights
Beautiful views. Not much more to say! amazing views, would have done a boat trip if we visited in the Summer, and I imagine that the view fr castle hill would be even better
More enjoyable from a boat. If you're near the Danube, get on a boat, just so you can say you did it. Views FROM the river are, as a rule, more beautiful than views OF the river.

A beautiful place. The Danube is a beautiful place that connects different worlds together. The point of reference for locals and travellers alike. I recommend any visitor to experience this place of serenity.

One of the best free walks in Europe for photographers professional or keen amateurs. I think the best time to take a walk along the Danube is at night and from Parliament to Chain bridge as the views of the illuminated buildings are totally awesome, and amazing for the photographers professional or keen amateurs.

Gorgeous for a walk in the evening!. Worth the walk in the cold evening to see the spectacular Buda side at night and the bridges, all light up. Caution that some of the promenade is not fenced so a drunken walk might take you directly into the Danube.

Lovely river with so much history. Bigger than you can imagine, a lot like the Thames in London. Watch how far down the river you go, you can begin to smell the sewage in it further towards the Gellert hotel. A must see in Budapest though.

Such a romantic Danube Cruise... We bought our tickets online from the "budapest river cruise" .. We chose the late night cruise (10pm) with drinks (2 for each one of us).. The night of the cruise was raining but in the end it didn't bother us.. It was a romantic 1h30 trip.. Don't miss it!

Boat tour. I will one day cruise the Danube but for now this little boat tour will have to do a great way of seeing the famous sites from a different perspective great views of the Parliament the Chain bridge Fishermans Bastion and the castle
Night cruise . I will keep this review short. Just got to be done. The views from the river change during the cruise as the sites begin to light up.
Just beautiful!. Very relaxing and gorgeous as taken on a river cruise. I would be keen to see it from other countries.

Wet and cold. How do you review a river? Well it is one of the largest in Europe and makes Budapest what it is. Try strolling along the river and watch the natural currents. Always nice to see any birdlife moving and using the river.

Unbelievable views. You must take a river cruise along the Danube. It is part of the hop on hop off sightseeing tour and we went at dusk. The building are amazing and then the lights on the river at dark is indescribable

Evening cruise on the Danube. we had this cruise via the Big bus tours which throw this in as part of the deal. For a small extra fee we had pizza and unlimited beer. A fabulous way to spend an evening cruising along the Danube seeing the beautiful buildings all lit up. Recommend a night cruise!

Dazzling Danube. We went on an evening cruise on Christmas evening. The weather was relatively warm and clear. it is the best way to see sites on both banks of the river. There was an opportunity to take awesome photos.take photo

Change of colour and season. It's very hard to review something long and massive as a river. Went on an enjoyable cruise.. Can recommend the boat cruise which lasts an hour. Best taken during daylight hours. If you purchase the City hop on and off bus tickets you get a free cruise included in price.
Stunning views.. If possible travel on the river at night as well as daytime to experience stunning views of the lit up buildings and bridges.
You cant visit Budapest and not run into it.. The views from both sides and from higher places are worth seeing. Every spot you go to has a different view and you discover something new.

Duna Palota Cruise - a big NO!. We went on this cruise because adviced by our hotel (Leonadro Da Vinci Hotels).The food was poor quality, the wine was sour.The boat spun in circles a few times and I did not see much. It would have been better to be a guide to explain the area. Those who spoke at the microphone had shaky and insecure voices. There was no organization in terms of the venue, everyone was crowded into a room to change their vouchers (purchased at the hotel) in trip tickets. From there we had to go on foot pile of 100-200 people to the place of boarding.After dinner we were offered 3-5 kind of liquor/wine for additional charge.In the boat was a little cold so I had to keep the coat in my shoulders.We saw other boat on the river which were very nice and well maintened, look everywhere else but Duna Palota Cruises (Europa).

brilliant trip. We had a lovely meal and trip down the Danube at night. There were 3 musicians playing ss we ate our excellent meals which was hot food buffet. The trip was just about the right amount of time , 1 and half hours. We loved seeing all the lit up bridges and buildings in Budapest. Enthralling. We will go again in March 2016.

nice for a walk. everything is along the Danube in Budapest: the parliament, the castle hill, the fisher's bastion, some nice statues, big hotels, restaurants, the shoes on the Danube Promenade Memorial... there are boat trips too... I went in autumn but I want to go back in summer!
Amazing river. The river is so blue. Its beautiful. The building along the river also very charming. Hope to be there again.

Silver Line cruise on New Year. There are a lot of cruises on the Danube river. some are free (when you buy the Hop On Hop Off bus) and some can be quite expensive including dinner or lunch.We went with Silver Line on a new year evening with a dinner an a live performance. it was very nice but expensive.
Very beautiful!. Very beautifull and romantic place - got a marrige proposal there .. :)Was in the winter so a bit chilly to go on a cruize but in the summer probobly more atrractive.
On the blue Danube. Budapest is the best city for a river cruise on the Danube. I enjoyed the view and the peace in a chilly air

An amazing Promenade to stroll by. walking along the Danube Promenade in the Pest region of Budapest was a very enjoyable experience. walking alongside it gives you access to many sights in the city, such as the Chain Bridge, Parliament Building, and, further away, Margaret Island.

Winter wonderland. A freezing early January Budapest is definitelly worth visiting. Less people, freedom of movement and even some cheaper prices for food and drinks. Just make sure to bring long-warm underwear!
Great. Well it's just a must since its one on the main sites to see in Budapest. Visited on January so it was very cold and yet very beautiful to travel around the area.

Beautiful and historic.... Splitting Budapest in two (old Buda on the west and Pest on the east), the river looked rather cold where we were there. Not a lot of boat traffic either, but I would imagine in the warmer months there must but much more going on. Crossing the river over the Chain Bridge was fun and provided great views.

Best way to see it at Night!. We took a night time one hour cruise of the Danube and it was wonderful. Parliament alone lit up in golden light was worth the trip! They served hot mulled wine in the boat so you could weather the cold outside and be able to take wonderful pictures. They have a recorded narration and history of buildings you see during the voyage so it is quite informative and entertaining. It is a must!
Christmas Eve. Had a great night Christmas Eve with lovely cruise at europa. Tasty food, great service, great music.
budapest. To see Budapest from river side is the best choice. Our family took it with Hop-in tour package together with bus tour. There atre options night, day or both sightseeing.

Great views of surrounding monuments. A walk along either side or a river cruise gives you the opportunity to view some of the stunning statues and buildings in Budapest. There were various companies offering river cruises, though due to low tide the cruises do not always stop at or go around Marget Island (also accessible via bridge). The Danube from what I saw was free from waste normally you see plastic bottles or bags or other random things though what I saw seemed to be quite clean. Recommend walking or cruising along the Danube during the day and night, both times the vies are stunning.

Sail the Danube. We took a comfortable boat trip.and they furnished lite drinks. The tour was about an hour long, and you may want to do this early in your stay, so you can get the layout. They have headphones in many language to explain what you are seeing.

Stunning. You can't hardly go to Budapest and not see the wonderful Danube river, and it is certainly worth going to see. Probably one of the best known rivers of the world, the Danube lives up to its reputation. Whether viewed at river level from the shore or on a boat, or view from high above at Fisherman's Bastion, it is a stunning view. By day or night, it is a beautiful sight to see. I hope to one day do one of the river cruises.

Danube Cruise. New Year's Day cruise. We booked VIP tickets for the NYD concert at the Pesti Vigado which is highly recommended. Followed this with the Danube cruise...."a 5 minute walk to the pier"......NOT !! Do not take the additional meal....it looked awful as we passed it. The boat was already full prior to our arrival and complaints were made to allow us some sort of view during the cruise.

You must sea and try!. The Danube is the backbone of Europe. The stretch of Budapest is the most wonderful part of it.
It is a must to see and try even if you are not a good swimmer at all :)
The Blue Danube. It is certainly blue at times if the weather is right. You can walk alongside the river mainly on the Pest side, or you can take boat tours around.

Take a night cruise to view the city in lights. For a very reasonable fee you may take a night cruise of the Danube, easy to access from anywhere in Budapest. See for yourself by Budapest truly is one of the most beautiful cities in the world.
River cruise. Had a great night New Year's Eve with fantastic organised cruise great company good food and entertainment and as much drink as you could manage! Palinka won in the end!!

Duna Bella. Everyone should take a ride to Danube ,and the best way to do that is the Duna Bella ship which makes a big ride for 1 hour and 20 minutes moreover ,you can have a drink on it and its pretty warm for the winter. among the most ships that are on Danube ,the Duna bella is the most value for money ride.

Great experience!. We did a Danube Cruise on Christmas Eve, which was nice, but decided against going during the day because the mist was so heavy we would not have been able to see any of the sights.

The river of Budapst. What can one say about the river Danube? Best known though the classical era, many times cited in musical symphonies, poems etc. Definitely worth a visit, one can also take a tour with a boat offering lunch or dinner.

Beautiful sights. The Danube is so wonderful both at night and in the day. At night the buildings are lit up and are best enjoyed from the river. In the day the fine mist made it look like a postcard.
A river trip?. There are boats that do evening trips with dinner. A lovely way to spend an evening if it is not too cold!

Emerald cruise Nuremberg to Budapest. We took this cruise to see the Christmas markets, which after the first few, were essentially the same. However Budapest market was definitely the best.The cruise itself was excellent, especially the crew, who could not do enough to make the experience special. My wife, who can find fault with most things, could not find anything to complain about. The organisation was excellent, so you did not have to worry about anything. You were told well in advance about what was planned and always given 15 mins notice to get ready for the day trips/events. We had a cabin with panoramic windows, well worth the extra for the view. As it was so late in the season, there were very few other boats and the highlight was mooring directly opposite the parliament building in Budapest, it really is an incredible sight to see from your room.The food was good, with plenty of choice. We did not have a drinks package, but there was no shortage of wine served with the meals, which was usually from the region that you were in.Never having been on a cruise in Europe before we were amazed by the number of locks, and the size and complexity of some of them - never a dull moment.The cabin was fine, with TV and WiFi, the bed was comfortable.Overall it was excellent, so well done Emerald.

Danube at Budapest is beautiful. We were unlucky in not being able to cruise from Vienna to Budapest due to falling water levels, but upon arrival at the city, were greatly impressed with the views of the river from many vantage points. If you can, do a night cruise, as most of the attractions are lit up at night and they are spectacular from the water.
Stunning views.... The Danube is a stunning river, much larger than we expected that separates Buda and Pest on either side. In good weather take an afternoon stroll and take in the views.

Danube waltz. We take a boat to see Budapest from water, and we went both during the day and on evening. It was so relaxing and we enjoyed the silent water even it was a windy day. It worth all the money.

Beautiful--during the day, spextacular at night. Budapest on the Danube is truly 'the Pearl on the Danube' and 'the Paris of East Europe'. If you take that evening cruise, you see the buildings during the day and as the lights come on at dusk, the sights are spextacular. Walking/driving on the riverbanks, across the bridges are a treat as you see the hustle and bustle of the city while enjoying the lovely sights.
It's not blue.. This is a most famous river in Europe with lots of history. The river and the bridges over it hold a lot of stories. Well worth seeing. It is greean, not blue.

Grand European on Viking from Budapest to Amsterdam. First, the trip from Atlanta through Paris to Budapest was daunting only because DeGaulle airport in Paris is so very time consuming and difficult. Avoid DeGaulle if you can.Arrival in Budapest was very nice, fast luggage retrieval, and a 40 minute ride to the Viking dock. The evening sailaway from Budapest is fabulous - with the golden government building and lighted bridges in full-on lighted like magic glory. Sailing the Danube, Rhine, and Main was sometimes fabulous, sometimes boring. We sailed during late October, so colors along the rivers were fabulous. I've seen enough gray German cities to last. One tour guide said our group looked like the ABC group. Another Bloody Cathedral... or...Another Boring Castle.The Budapest Market has lots of cheap trinkets, but also some very good quality leather goods -- look carefully to sort out the low grade products. Cologne was my favorite city, partly because it was a safe, easy, close walk from the Viking dock to the downtown area which sports all the major name-brand stores you'd expect in the city. And it's right next to the cathedral. So it's a good walk.I took a side trip one day to a winery in a small mountain town - that was worth the trip, with amazing scenery over the valley and vineyards when the bus stopped for a photo op.Nice trip. Viking is all kinds of very nice and accommodating to guests aboard. Entertainment is schmaltzy, but ok. Food is great, as would be expected. Eat some lunches on the Aquavit terrace - it's never too busy to get a table within a few minutes. The tiny, tiny cabins are just barely liveble for space, but oh so nicely appointed. The newly designed bathrooms on the Bestla and Eistla made me want to go home and install all new wood-look tile with Grohe fixtures!Yes... the Bestla AND the Eistla. We booked on the Eistla but did a ship swap (October low water) at Passau. It didn't kill us, and we had a wonderful experience on both these identical river boats.

Lovely famous river !. Our hop-on hop-off bus ticket included a trip up the Danube at night - it was lovely to see all the buildings on each side of the Danube lit up and it was nice to travel on such an iconic river !

The majesty of the Danube. The Danube, second among the main Europeans rivers, divides in two Budapest You can see all the mayor buildings of Pest and Buda when you visit of the city by boat. This visit last 1 hour and it is very rewarding. The banks of the rivers are so well built that they defend the town form the recurrent flood of the last years. We have seen it in 2013. The only part of the town not equally defended is the Margaret Island situated in the middle of the river and in the middle of the town. Anyhow in the beautiful days on its banks there are also many fishermen..

You can not get away from here. Danube is your companion all the time in Budapest. A cruise in this will give you a beautiful view and one must spend an evening alongside Danube to enjoy this city. Number of restaurants alongside to enjoy or just get couple of friends and sit at the banks and enjoy this beautiful city.
Danuba view- breath taking. Our hotel room was facing the Danuba. I could hust sit and watch the view It was breath taking. You were lucky that there was no smog otherwise we could miss the view.

Viking river cruise on the Danube for Christmas. We did a Christmas markets river cruise and it was fine - not fancy but we did see what we went there to see and do - We have done the Danube in the summer time as well and we saw a lot more in the summer than in the winter

Viator Lunch Cruise on the Danube. The Danube lunch cruise by viator.com was exceptional value for money and very well organised. The background on board was peaceful classical music. There was no loud music or jarring commentary. A brochure showed the main highlights to be seen en route. The vessel was silent and glided slowly along. The large picture windows provided superb views of both banks. The buffet meal, including 1 free glass of champagne & wine and a bottle of mineral water was excellent value. The food was superb and one could eat as much as you liked. The vegetarian food was excellent too! The staff on board were helpful and friendly.I highly recommend this cruise.
Cruising the Danube. You cannot visit Budapest without taking a cruise on the Danube. Our cruise included dinner offering a wide variety of traditional dishes. Outstanding and must not be missed.

The river that conects Europe. Danube is the river who conects europe from west to east . In Budapest 4 of the bridges across it looks wanderfull and they are full of history . You can take different kinds of boat tours along the river and learn a lot of this city past by the audio guides . A plesent afternoon on the blue river .
Blue river. They call it Blue river. If you dont see the blue colour inside the river, you have to try some if theirs red wine. It helps :-)

Emerald River Cruise on the Lower Danube. Our river cruise started with a night time cruise of the Danube at Budapest, followed by a seven day cruise along the Danube, passing through the Iron Gates gorge, and culminating with 3 days in Bucharest. We were passengers on the Emerald Dawn, a newly commissioned ship, with all mod cons such as might be associated with a high quality hotel. I can honestly say this is the most relaxing holiday I have ever experienced - just sitting on the boat, seeing the scenery as we passed by was a delight. For the energetic, there were daily excursions included in the cost of the holiday, including guided tours of many main towns. All meals were included together with hot drinks throughout the day and beer and wine and soft drinks at lunch and dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful. Altogether an unforgettable experience.
The singing fountain. A must see, the Island, the park- great walk. I really enjoyed the singing fountain, also the beer at the near by terrace.

Wonderful walk. We walked along the Danube on the Pest side after we left Parliament. We came across the Shoe memorial. There are lots of benches that you can just sit and watch the river. The area was very clean.

Wonderful Views Along the Danube in Budapes. While the Danube may not have been "blue" on our visit, it was still spectacular. Budapest truly is a city that takes full advantage of a city that is divided by the Danube River. The most scenic city we saw on the Danube with the spectacular hills on the Buda side and the city, parliament building and churches on the Pest side. Day or night the Buda side is spectacular with its elegant castle and more. Then the Pest side has scenic views of the Parliament building and the city. A night tour on the river is the best!
Not to miss. One of Europe's most important rivers, really beautiful during sunset. Just walking down the river side is relaxing
Great Cruseing. We were on a one week River cruse starting in Budapest , lots of boats to choose from we were on Tauck 5 star family friendy
serene and relaxing walks. In Budapest, the Danube allows a serene center point that frames the city and historic elements in a most charming way with walk ways on either side.

Viking River Cruise Danube Waltz. Just returned from this cruise to see the Christmas Markets on the Gullveig. What a fabulous cruise mostly because of the serenity of traveling by river and the workings of the staff. The food was fabulous and abundant. Plenty to do onboard and interesting and doable shore excursions, most of which are included in the price of the cruise.Warning: while the Christmas markets are fun, many of the items are imported from China and not homemade as I was hoping to find. Still, walking around and sampling sausage or baked goods or gullwein was fun. Also, the entire area is filled with fog most of the day so you won't get good views of the castle ruins or even large vistas. I believe we saw the sun twice in our 8 days!Still, this is a part of European heritage that you can't find at any other time of year. The bonus is that there are fewer tourists so the crowds aren't bad and it isn't so cold as to be a problem. Much better than the very hot days of summer!Highly recommend Viking ships as they have great balconies and seemed more modern than the others we came across. This is a great way to see many cities at your leisure rather than having to climb into a bus every morning at 7 am! No need to pack and unpack and the opportunity to make lots of new friends!

The Danube Ferry from Vojka, Slovakia to Kyselica, Slovakia. Only few minutes from Bratislava, Slovakia toward south east along the river Danube you can find small ferry that goes across the river from one bank to the other. When the new Danube channel was built, the builders did not plan to build a bridge between the northern and southern bank. That's why there is a small ferry which allows pedestrians and cars to get from side of the river to the other. Ferry is free of charge and the ride takes approximately up to 10 minutes. It is a nice trip if you have kids and you can take ferry both ways for free. At the peak times one can expect more cars waiting for the ferry but you can leave car at one of the banks and just use the ferry as pedestrian. Unfortunately, there is nothing more to see there just the ferry but it is a rare opportunity to try something like this in this area.

Wonderful Danube River Cruise and Land Tour - There are lots of rivers yet to see!. Our traveling group ("The Nova 6") experienced a wonderful Danube river cruise (Budapest to Nuremberg) and land tour (Prague, Dresden, and Berlin) with Gate 1. The seven-day cruise was on the Sound of Music, not the most modern of the river cruise ships (built in 2006), but one that is very well maintained with both the private and public spaces aboard the boat attractive and appealing. What made our first river cruise memorable, however, were the staff and the food. STAFF: Our Gate 1 Tour Manager, Nora, was very knowlegeable about the places we visited and she interacted seamlessly with the excellent tour guides provided in each of the towns and cities we visited. Nora, with her delightful personality, could not have been more accommodating, always doing whatever she could to ensure our happiness and satisfaction (she even ran down the street in Prague to tell us the restaurant where our companions had gone!). Our dining room waiter for most of the trip, Ellia, was terrific. He attended to our every need (including the special and extra meals one of our companions required). Monica, our stateroom staff member, kept our very nicely appointed cabins (we had rooms with full windows that opened; excellent choice) neat and tidy as a pin. FOOD: Our well-traveled group is very focused on quality dining. The aspect of the trip about which we were skeptical was the food. We were more than pleasantly surprised by the remarkable choice, excellence in taste, and attractive presentation of all of our meals on board the Sound of Music. All of us have extensive traditional cruise ship experience across several of the major cruise lines. Our dining experience on this trip matched or exceeded all of them, including service in the ships' specialty restaurants. When Gate 1 launches its new river cruise vessel in 2016, we urge them to match the dining room staff they have on the Sound of Music!In sum, the river cruise experience on the Sound of Music was exceptional. The Nova 6 is very likely to consider another similar holiday. After all, there are lots of rivers in the world!

Viking River Cruise - Romantic Danube. My wife and I decided to book this cruise after receiving an offer from Viking River Cruises for 2 for 1 free air 8 day cruise from Budapest to Nuremburg. We purchased the optional insurance for 600.00 still a great value. Our cabin was on the lowest level but had a window just above the water line. Viking booked our flights on Lufthansa economy, from LAX direct to Frankfurt and on to Budapest. I was pleased with the airline and service they provided. We were met at the Airport in Budapest by Viking personnel and taken by motor coach to the boat docked at the chain bridge. We were welcomed and shown to our room after a shower we explored the boat.We were told there were 175 people on the boat and never felt crowded plenty of room to spread out. We purchased the silver drink package for 300 euro, we received our money's worth but probably would not do so again since beer and wine with lunch are poured generously. We considered cancelling after reading of low water levels and bad reviews, but decided not to. We were prepared for the possibility of having to switch boats and indeed had to but aside from having to pack and unpack Viking has seemed to have this down. It wasn't bad, they also offered a free excursion to Figaros Wedding which we skipped and free drinks for an hour for the inconvenience. The staff on our first boat seemed better but were still top notch. The tours were mostly walking tours with local guides and were first rate! The food on the boat was very good. We ended up getting to know quite a few people on a first name basis and sat with them during meals often, which surprised us since we really aren't fond of schmoozing. Some people act snobby and acted as if they were first class passengers on the titanic which actually was quite amusing. We tipped according to the instructions we were given which came to 225 euro and were provided envelopes for cash they take dollars and euros. There are no names or way of tracking if you tip or not ? You may also charge it to your credit card when you settle up. Everything went flawlessly until the day before we were to fly home. Lufthansa went on strike and our flight from Nuremburg to Frankfurt was cancelled, we notified the Viking program director and concierge and they said they were unaware of any problems with flights? We assumed since Viking arranged the flights they would provide us with alternate arrangements, not so. They actually never made any announcements or notifications regarding the Lufthansa strike and took us to the Nuremburg airport and dropped us off at 4:00 am, a Viking representative was there who basically showed us to the Lufthansa counter and said good luck. Lufthansa finally opened at 5:15 am and told us we would have to take the metro to the train station and take a train to Frankfurt,(2 Heavy bags in a city/country we were unfamiliar with? Wow, I mentioned someone in our group was flying to Zurich then to the USA was that a possibility and she checked and said yes but it meant we would have to wait 4.5 hours to fly to Zurich and on to LA on Swiss, we decided to take the sure thing and although it was not as nice as Lufthansa we made it home. I am glad we were first in line some people were not as lucky as us. We would still take a Viking Cruise in spite of this and will remember it the rest of our lives.

Warning on Viking cruise down the "romantic Danube". Although Viking did many things including adding extra excursions to our 8 day trip along the Danube, ending at Budapest, the basic fact is that there are major problems with low water along this route. The weather and water conditions cannot be changed, but Viking was not up front about these issues when we asked and implied that the decision to use buses along part of the trip was a "day to day" thing when really the problem has occurred for months. We spoke with other travelers in Prague on other routes who were emailed the day before their cruise that part of it would be by bus. No such email for us.Viking does so many things right that it seems incredible that they would not be up front about this issue. Memorable. I was very impressed by my first view of the Danube from the river bank in Budapest. It was a sunny day in November and the clear blue skies made a perfect back drop to the the classical buildings lining either side of the river. We were able to walk a considerable length with the river in view and used the tram to take us further where we found a lovely cafe where we were able to sit outside and have lunch and further enjoy the view. A boat trip, the next day was enjoyable but not essential. A hop on and off bus trip did enable us to view the river from both sides and from different angles and so to be recommended.

great experience. This was part of a 15 day tour on Amawaterways, and we decided to grab a cab and do our own thing. Fortunately, we had friends in Budapest who spoke English fluently. Unlike most of Europe, you cannot even guess what Hungarian street signs say and the average citizen speaks no English (why would they?) so without our friends, we would have been lost! We were there in the refugee crisis, and were very impressed with the logic and calm displayed by the Hungarians, who remembered they were also refugees just 2 generations ago.

It certainly isn't blue, but it is interesting. This is an historic river with much to show and to teach. Here it separates the win cities of Buda and Pest, and isolates my little island of Margitzigit. There is much to explore over a very long history

Wish they had some better riverside walkways. The Danube is an impressive river and we found plenty of great vantage points in Budapest but it would be wonderful if they put some riverside promenades in so that you could walk along a bit easier. It is just about possible but the area is not really geared up for it which is a shame.

Wonder To The Eyes. Strolling along the river bank in autumn is plainly amazing. The fresh air, the blue sky and all the beautiful building along the river created an exhilarating feeling. One of the nicest river bank to stroll around is near the Parliament towards Shoes on the Danube. The view is just awesome.
amazing big. the danube is very wide river give budapest a nice and unique view , you will find many boats cruise to take you a long the river and see the fantastic castle architecture
Must see when in Budapest. The best option to see it from the Castle area to enjoy the stunning panorama and cross the Chain bridge to be impressed by its grandeur.

Viking river cruise. Danube waltz river cruise.Viking are excellent at these river trips one of the best trips we have ever enjoyed.the crew,cabins,food and excursions were first class.we have booked another for Portugal 2016.

Nice Little Trip. My friends and I did a short break to Budapest and decided to do a daytime boat trip on the Danube. Some of the views are nice and there is an audio guide telling you what the various landmarks are.
Nice and chilled little trip.
Danube sightseeing. On a clear day you can see for some distance. You must go on a boat trip. The evening cruises are well worth the money just to see it by night.

A nice walk. The Danube in the Budapest area is very nice for strolling along, as it is mostly built for pedestrians and cyclists. In the city centre, the most touristy places are situated river side, and youll see everything from the parliament, castle, wwII memorials and much more on your tour of the river. A river cruise is much recommended as a way to learn the geography and history of this beautiful city!

Wine Tour on the Danube!. After booking a wine tour cruise on the Danube, we were left thinking we should of gone for the meal option. The views and timings of the cruise were brilliant!! Was such a good way to see the city lit up at night. The wines we tasted were slightly disappointing but overall it was a really good experience

Beautiful view of buildings on evening cruise. WEnt on the one hour Legenda evening cruise. All the key buildings were lit up and breathtaking. Budapest is beautiful and nighttime on the Danube was a beautiful way to see the architecture and the bridges.

A must see historic river. This great body of water was so significant in Western Civilization that you MUST put it on your to do or bucket list! Western Europe as well as our society owes a huge debt to the history of this river - and it can be quite remarkable if seen from the river on any kind of boat.

A starting place to learn of Buda and Pest.. Two years in a row when visiting Budapest I have taken this 1.5 hour cruise during the mid day on the Danube. It is a most interesting and educational experience listening on headphones with options in 45 languages reviewing the history of Hungary from ancient times through modern day. Unfortunately, the headsets are not maintained or kept the best of order as two years in a row, I needed to move around and try 5 or 6 headphones before finding an operable pair. I suggest a mid morning or early afternoon cruise, because by 3:30 PM in Nov. the sun had gone donwn making it difficult to photograph many of the beautiful buildings.
Magnificent. It is a special feeling walking through the bridges, admiring the palaces along it by night and by day.
Its a river. There are a lot of water that goes downstream. Also it is difficult to avoid it, because it cut through the heart of the city.

Well worth a trip on the river.. We had a brillian trip on the river. We used legenda cruises and went on the Duna Bella. They provide headsets which inform and describe the landmarks and history of Budapest. the trip lasted abouit 1 hours and was very goos value for money. Would recommend this.

Kind of Sad to see!. This used to be a major waterway linking powerful districts of emerging competitive markets and cities...now it is brown, filled with cheesy tour boats and not much else to see. I would say the best part of the Danube is it adds a nice touch to the scenery when looking across to the other side, Parliament wouldn't look so good if it weren't perched over this river, but other than that I didn't feel very happy seeing a dirty channel that once split two wonderful cities!
Beautiful!. Recently took a river cruise from Nuremberg to Budapest. The Danube River is beautiful. The Wachau Valley is especially pretty. Many cities on the river or close by.

Grand Circle River Cruise Budapest to Prague. Good company and will travel with them again but I think they are being taken over by the lawyers. Food safety. Their food is determined by a manual approved in every detail, including how the food is plated, by Bucharest, as told by the chef to us. Bucharest? What culinary capital is that? It is very bland food and does not represent the excellent cooking of the regions we visited. I think most, if not everything, is pre-packaged and just warmed up in the ship. No good aromas from the dining room. Some people impressed, but probably not cooks. Stay with the ice cream for dessert.

Ama Waterways river cruise on the Danube.. Spent eight days cruising from Vilshofen to Budapest in September.This is a very romantic holiday as it sails through four countries.The food and amenities were excellent.Staff always friendly and helpful.There can be no better way to experience so many places in a week.Would really recommend a river cruise with Ama Waterways.

Take the Big Bus down the Danube !!!. We visited Budapest during October when it was raining most days, but thanks to The Big Bus Comp. our stay was not spoilt by the weather. We toured the sights of Pest and Buda by day and night using their all inclusive 48 hour ticket which also gave us a separate day and a separate night river cruises on the glorious Danube, which could be upgraded to include a 3 course meal and drink as an optional extra . Fantastic value.
Danube in Budapest. I love Budapest a lot. The Danube goes between Buda and Pest. Very romantic to just walk and see this capital from the river side. It is even better to go with boat.
Beautiful but close to the highway. Perfect for a walk along the river but because of the highway it is really loud and not really relaxing.
The Danube. Of course, the Danube is one of the world's great rivers. It is lovely as it traverses Budapest, separating the hilly Buda from the flatland Pest.

A must do!. A must do in Budapest is to take a cruise on the Danube. I highly recommend taking a nighttime cruise to see the lights of Budapest. The lights of the Parliament building and Castle Hill are something to not miss.

One of Our Highlights in Budapest. We hadn't planned to take a cruise but it was a beautiful evening, the sun just about to set over the Danube, and an over zealous young Hungarian tour guide over sold us on a 2-hour "booze cruise", that had food and drink on board and stopped at Margaret Island. Since we had been up 39 hours without sleep, we thought this would be a great ending to our first day in Budapest. Well almost none of that was correct: there was no food and drink on board, no stop at the Island and the cruise only lasted 1 hour. Despite all that, the boat trip exceeded my expectations in every way! Absolutely beautiful to view Budapest by night and no booze required! I will definitely not miss this activity, especially since it only cost about $7 US.

A great way to spend an evening. My family and I took a dinner cruise on the Danube one evening recently and it's a great way to see the city from a different perspective. There is lots to see and it would be a waste to go to a wonderful city and not take a trip on the river.

nice, beautiful, free drink en good guidance. it magic to have a boat trip on de Donau. Among other company's Danube (Dock 7) really was the best. No long waiting time, two free drinks during the trip and perfect guidance in a lot of languages. Really perfect to have such a boat trip. Our evening tour was even more magic with all the lights and buildings in full light. We defenitely advise and evening trip.

Good but not for a larger group. We had a group of 13 people on this trip. Unfortunately due to the size of the group we were placed around a corner so didn't get to see much of the dancers (made worse by the fact that a rather rude lady decided to stand in front of us to take a video). There was no commentary on our part of the boat.Food was fine (especially the vegetarian selection). However, there was a bit of a scramble to get to the buffet - some guests thought it was acceptable merely to push in and pick items up by hand instead of using utensils provided!Was tempted to give 3 stars but the singers and dancers worked their hearts out and the food was ok but more thought needed for organisation. We paid for VIP tickets and saw the backs of the singers/dancers more than their faces!

cruise on the Danube.... we did a dinner cruise on Danube...it was beautiful... when the lights come on at night on the banks one gets an awsome view of the monuments & bridges....definitely not to be missed!!

Sunset cruise. I did the cruise twice cause i had it on my hop on hop off offer. Its a really amazing sightseeing by the sea . You get to all budapest sights . At night , you will enjoy the great lights of the Parliament and the Citadelle. You can find beverages and goulash soup on boats. The audioguide was quite disappointing . I didnt understand the english. They were streaming it along the trip. Very annoying. We didnt have the best time in october but we did it . It was freezing but it was really good.

Trip to remember - a must. Many people think the Viking River Cruises are for the older travelers, well they are not. My wife and I with her family just finished last week on the Viking Gullvieg ship from Nuremberg to Budapest, a trip to remember. I can't say enough about the trip and staff. Many times employees only work to do their jobs , hopefully receive a gratuity and serve the next trip. We were fortunate to have a staff that cared about you , your memorable experiences, your service and your well being. One the second day they knew our first names and knew what we liked and who was part of our family. Special thanks go to Zoran Ilic and Doru Ifrimesu ( bartenders) they knew what we liked and always said hello and had fresh drinks even when the bar was ready to close they stayed and talked to us. Our waiter at our table - Damir Milijenc, I had an issue with my sole of my shoe . The evening before I spoke to the receptionist to ask for glue, the next morning he knew about it and had glue for me to fix. Plus his service and attention to us at dinner was as good as a fine restaraunt. I have a severe food allergy, panayot Tsletkov, personally ensured my meals were cocked safely and served me himself, his position head maitre d. Above anything I expected or wanted. And finally Beatrix Oliveira, concierge, where do we starts. She knew our family by name on day 1 and knew everything about us so we had an excellent time. She was amazing on how she would always makes sure we enjoyed our trip. If you haven't heard The Danube is low due to a hot and dry summer. Many cruises had to bus the guests between cities so they were able to see everything. We were fortunate to make it all the way down river to Budapest. Buses were used but for only short rides to tour destinations. As you can tell we loved the concept but especially the Viking staff. This group cared beyond my expectations and proposals many of the other quests. If you get the opportunity to take a river cruise - do it with Viking, it is well worth the price.
Night Cruise!. my friend and i took the night cruise up the danube it was so stunning at night and well worth doing!
Nice hangout. One can take advantage of any of the offers of boat cruises on the Danube. exploring it is quite exciting as along it are some good attractions to look at.

Castles rolling hills and villages. We took a scenic cruise through europe of which part was sailing down the Danube. Its something everyone should do as some stage of their life. We went in autumn and the colours along the river at that time are sublime, all oranges, greens, crimsons and yellows. There are castles, chrches and beutiful villages set amongst rolling misty hills. A most wonderful experience I will never forget

TAKE A NIGHTTIME CRUISE ON THE DANUBE. Numerous boat companies provide 60-90 minute scenic cruises as far as Margaret Island in the north and to the south end of the built up area to the south. Night lights are wonderful way to experience the varied contemporary and historic architecture and plazas of this beautiful city.
beautifullllll!!!!. take a romantic trip by the river. it is great wide and beautifull! all kinds of boat trips day or night!! i love this part of the danube.

Wonderful night trip!. it was beautiful! Wonderful view of historical Budapest at night!
Great movie showing all the places & perfect explanations. nice service with glass of champaign & wines.
The Danube in Budapest, the most beautiful. Most beautiful river.I was in different cities on the Danube in Budapest, but very nice.Many river boats for excursions.

part of hop on hop off tour. This was included in The price of the bus tour. a pleasant boat trip on the danube. well worth the 20 euro for a 24 hour ticket includes 2 day time bus tour a night time bus tour a boat trip and a walking tour. [The Bus with the Giraffe on the side]

Amazing. Amazing location ! If you are stuck for time in Budapest then this is the place to head for. Walk the river and you will get to see most of the sites . Or if you have more time walk to an attraction stop and explore it . I crossed 4 different bridges walked to top of both hills and all using Danube as my starting point .

Pleasant cruise on Danube. A nice day cruise with Legenda KFT. Started the journey with a chilled beer to the Margaret Island. Another drink to conclude the trip.All together a great value for money cruise trip.

Breathing. We visited the river twice. First at night, after we arrived in the city and later by boat in a roundtrip, included in the tickets from the hoponhopoff busses. Away from the busy traffic and noisy city, we liked the quietness of the river.
Blue or green. Too many rivers in Europe are brown or grey.In Budapest, Danube flows in blue or green colour,adding vibrant colour to the city.

What's not to like? It's the Danube. We took a 7 day cruise on AMA river cruises, from Nuremburg to Budapest. This was our first river cruise and we are glad we chose the Danube, each stop was interesting and the river has so much beauty. We got to see the turn of the leaves the entire 7 days!!!!! What a bonus!! Each city along the river holds its own structural interest. Budapest at night from the Danube is the most beautiful thing I've ever seen.
The Blue Danube. From Germany to Bulgaria, this wide and strong river connect us. It is magnificent in Budapest, view from the bridges are extraordinary, and so is a cruise up and down the river.

River Cruise. It was part of our city tour it was a great experience to see both sides of Budapest. It was a great river cruise with the family and a different experience for all us. It is must do I'd you are in Budapest.

It isn't blue but it's beautiful. Our Viking River Cruise brought us from Amsterdam to Budapest so we saw this river up close. Scenery is exquisite, especially now in fall, and at night? Well, you have to see that for yourself.

Cold in the winter, buzzing in summer. Walked up and down in Winter, wrap up warm, take a scarf, enjoy the sights on both sides. There is a nice island you can stop in and chill and take in the surroundings. Did not do a boat cruise. Best view of the old buildings from accross the river.

Just in dreams. I have seen a lot of movies about Danube. But when we journied and cruised on Danube, I found the meaning of the river which connect different countries and nations.
It was like a dreams.

Nice river cruise. We used the BigBus hop on-hop off tour (2 day tour) which included a free river cruise. The cruise begins by the Elizabeth bridge and makes it's way to Margaret Island before reversing. About 1 1/2 hour tour total. Both enclosed and top deck seating. Food and beverages available for purchase. Wonderful way to see the city.

Great. You should not miss the opportunity to take a boat ride both in the day time and perhaps even enjoy a dinner that is easily organized on one of the many boats that offer the service. The city is seen very nicely from the boat rides and it is highly recommended.
Danube day cruise. A relaxing view of the city upon arrival. Good value for around $15 for an hour n a half which started at 2pm.

The charm of the city. To my personal oppinion, the Danube is one of the real charms of the city of Budapest . The beautifull bridges over the river join to ghether the two major parts of the city.The hilly Buda, with it's old streets, the impressive royal palace, the Church of Holly Matyas and the Fisher's Bastions, which dominate the architectual landscape of the western banc and of course, thr Statue of Liberty, dominating the skyline of Gelert Mountain.On the eastern banc , which is Pest, the most beautifull spot is the Parliament House ( Az Orszag Haza= The House of the Country, if verbaly translated from Hungarian), reminding us very much, the British Hous of Parliament - The Westminster in it' s neogothic architectural stile. The nice recreation island - The Marghit Island, ads its charm to that of the river, with the green parcs,alees, nice hotels and spas.One of the intersting and atractive ways to see and feel the beauty of the city, shuold be a boath trip on the river and if you want to accentuate the romantic side of the charm, do it by night , taking a diner and listening to live music. Surprisingly, do not expect too much, from the touristic buffe menu and you'll not be disapointed.If you wish to have an idea of the good Hungarian kitchen, then go to an Hungarian local restaurant .On this journey, the athmosphere and the landscape are the winners. Add one or two drinks and you'll get a grate feeling and pleasure.

Breathtaking Budapest. Have always wanted to see Budapest by boat on the Danube and it did not disappoint. The cruise we did was one with food and the food was average at Best. Yet to be on the river at night and see Budapest more than made up for it. Have to do but would do it next time maybe just with Drinks.
Blue Danube. Blue Danube is a misnomer; however, I have always wanted to take a boat down the river. The sites were nice and the guide was very informative about the history of Budapest.

Danube river cruise on Viking Lif. We took a 7 day cruise on Viking Lif from Budapest to Bucharest October 14-21. Some ports were disappointing, such as Vulkovar, Croatia, and Vidin, Bulgaria especially. The quality of the shore excursions was poor with too much time spent on coffee breaks and lunch. The Viking Lif was also a disappointment. The relatively high fare is coupled with many obvious cost cutting measures Poor service in the lounge, due to under staffing. Ditto in the dining room, no maitre'd to seat you, only a few dinner entrée choices. very cheap wines served and the very same white wine 7 days in a row. Surprisinly no food service in the cabins. No coffee in the morning, unless you dress and head down the hall to the coffee machine. Give me Crystal, Seaborn, or Regent anytime, they are all the same price as the inferior Viking experience.
Nice afternoon activity. Good to see the attractions from the river. Old, basic boat and we learnt more about the hotels than we did about the other buildings. Good escape from the rain though.
perfect to walk by even in the rain. Many cruise ships are travelling everyday,every hour through Danube with many things to do on board. Even walking by is magic.

Danube - River Cruise Line - Diamond Holidays. We took a 9 night holiday with Diamond Holidays which included a 4 night river cruise aboard the MS Serenity during September 2015. To be fair, the boat was fine and we enjoyed the 4 nights aboard.Much of the rest of the holiday was mis-informed. Do not trust this lot. We were supposed to be staying in 4 star Novotel Hotel by the river (with wonderful views of the Parliament Building) for our 3 nights in Budapest prior to the cruise. We were actually put in the Best Western hotel near Kaleti station which was an hours walk from the river and in a dodgy area. Hotel was very poor with dreadful rooms and would hardly qualify as 2 star. Following this we were taken to the boat and had to queue in the pouring rain on the long gangplank to the boat while passengers were checked in. Would have been more sensible to allow all aboard the boat and wait in the dry for check in. This was most uncomfortable for the many elderly people on the cruise. I could mention many aspects of the trip that were found wanting but to highlight just one more - We were told that our final night would be in Frankfurt but on arrival were herded aboard a coach and driven for an hour along the autobahn to stay many miles from the city in another low grade hotel. On complaining following the holiday, we were offered a £100 voucher off the cost of a future booking with Diamond Holidays, as if this would even be considered! As I say, don't trust this lot. Book elsewhere!

Europe's 2nd longest river. I'd always imagined the Danube to be tranquil and blue, and though it wasn't so in Budapest, it still had its awe. The historical old bridge between Buda and Pest was especially memorable. The old castle and palace complex looking from across the river is something that has to be seen

A night cruise on the Danube. What a fantastic way to see the sights, at night and during a river cruise. The food was great and the wine. Views were breathe taking and even able to see the bats flying above the parliament building. Overall a great evening was spent and I think well worth the effort.

Spectacular evening views. We booked the evening Danube cruise on the Danube Legend through our hotel concierge. Cost for two was 11,000 Ft ($39.74 U.S.). While you can sit inside, we opted for the open top deck where chairs are provided as well as blankets for chilly evenings. The night views of the lighted buildings along the Danube were spectacular, especially Parliament. Drinks are also available during the cruise as are audio guides in various languages.

Great cruise. We enjoyed the cruise. We took the 60min cruise included with hop on, hop off bus)Pros:Spectacular viewsCons:Bit hard to get to- uneven sidewalk, unmarked crossingTips: they offered unlimited beer tickets. I thought it was pricey but may appeal to others
Beautiful River. Lots of lovely bridges over the river, plenty of choice of riverboat restaurants and sightseeing trips.

Beautiful . At night took a boat and dinner cruise. Piano playing in the background. Smooth boat. A great way to appreciate this super stretch of river with budapest lit up. Traversing below the bridges. Not to be missed. There seemed to be plenty of choice to cruise here. Enjoy.

UNIWORLD CRUISING-FANTASTIC. Had the best time. Cruised the "Enchanting Danube". Bratislava, Vienna Durnstein Salzburg and Munich. The excursions and the guides were top quality. Our state room was adequate, like most cruise ships, with cozy spa bathrobes and slippers. The bed was very comfortable with cushiony blankets and pillows. Entertainment was fantastic at night with Greg and Margaret singing and playing the piano in the lounge. We had waltz lessons in the lounge during the day and we were able to give it a try at night. Every night around 5:30 our cruise manager gave us a short talk on what to expect the following day. The food was top shelf every day and so were the drinks that were all included. Can't think of a negative issue.

River cruise on Danube with Scenic. It was an excellent trip from Budapest to Amsterdam, starting on the Danube and then the Rhine. Beautiful scenery and great cities and sightseeing as we cruised on the river.

Beware of river cruises. This river floods and gets too low to travel on - virtually ruining a river cruise holiday. We were scheduled to do a river cruise on the Danube early October. The river was too low between Budapest and Bratislava so the authorities shut down river travel. The tour company bussed us to Bratislava one day and also on the next day - a total of 7 hours on a bus. By this time they had arranged a new ship to pick us up in Bratislava. We sailed at night to Vienna and then disembarked. We were to have sailed to Vienna, Melk, the Wachau valley, Durnstein and then back to Vienna. We saw nothing of the shoreline of the Danube. What a disappointment!

Viking cruise should be avoided. Viking river cruise does not care about its passenger. They transformed our river cruise from Nuremberg in Germany to Budapest in Hungary, passing by Vienna, into a bus tour as the river level was too low.They don t tell you before you leave so that you can t cancel and then pretend that it is a rare occurrence whereas they have been affected by the low water level since August and we travelled in October.Their solution it leave the ship anchored in Regensburg and then bus you around to Passau and Melk so that they can say that they delivered on the destination. Then more busing to Budapest. They then rush you on another ship, which greatly limits the time available to visit Vienna and Budapest, the two highlights of the trip.We simply left the ship, took the train to Vienna so that we would not be posed to this abuse by Viking..I did not want to do a bus trip across Europe. We rejoined the ship later in Vienna and let me tell you that passengers were outraged by their trip..What they also forget to tell you is that most of the time, they attach their ships together in port so that the beautiful veranda stateroom with balcony for which you paid a hefty extra is facing another ship, 6 inches away, or sometimes facing a concrete wall. Did I mention the announcement on the PA system at 8h15 in the morning in your stateroom to announce the next activity.To be fair, food is good, service is attentive and the ships are nice, but as expected small versus ocean liners. Very disappointed by Viking. They gambled with our precious vacation time and we were the ones losing.

CK Shuttle service. If you are concerned about taking trains, buses or boats from Vienna to Budapest, or Prague, Vienna or Munich you may want to book a car and driver with CK Shuttle service. That's what we did this September (2015) when the migrant crisis was at its peak.The cars are clean, well maintained, delightful English speaking drivers and offer competitive pricing.
