I rarely write reviews but this company deserves 5 stars for its service.
Restful. We found our boat trip up the river Danube to be very restful after days of walking around seeing the sights.
river trip. We bought the red Hop Hop off which included 2 boat trips, which we took during ady and evening. was grrreat

Great for a walk. If the weather is good or not be sure to go for a walk on the side of the Danube river. The Hungarian Parlament is on one side of the Danude and Buda Castle is on the other side. So dont miss a good walk

Take a cruise for magnificent views. A beautiful sunny day we took a cruise on the Danube, the perfect way to see the sights, the running commentary also helped us learn a bit about the cities history and buildings. You can enjoy a drink on board and relax while taking in the Beauty of the city. We bought tickets from a tour company on the street that allowed 2 boat trips and unlimited use of the hop on busses within 48 hours, which made it all very easy to get around.

The Beautiful Blue Danube. Strauss was right- We rode on the Danube in Budapest ,where it is probably the major feature in a spectacular city& the river is,itself,spectacular too. A terrific and worthwhile thing to see.
Very Romantic.. The Danube runs through the middle of the city. It is a very romantic riverside. Everyone should take some time to take a stroll along the river.

Yep. It's blue.. What can you say about the Danube? Beautiful. That's a start. Personally I took a nice long cruise up the river. Calm, relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable. Many great views of Budapest. If it's a nice day, seize the opportunity and take a ride along this amazing river.

Take river crouse and enjoy the beauty of the city. . The river crouse is one of the most attractive nice tours either via the ship or the bus that goes in to the water and sails for 45 min in the river Danube, at night the views are magnificent... Don't miss it.

A Budapest must do!. Although many prefer to do this at night, we did the cruise during the day, and so glad we did. The views on both sides of the river were spectacular. The commentary that accompanies the cruise was a little out of step with tyne pace of the vessel but that did not stop our enjoyment. With regards to cost very reasonable. We bought tickets at the start of our visit for a night cruise and day cruise that came with our 48 hour bus pass automatically- ideal!

Relaxing Cruise, Disappointing View. We traveled the Danube, Budapest to Passau on Avalon Waterways. The cruising was very relaxing. The food was exceptional. The service was spectacular. Avalon touts the views from their unique cabins. The view are exceptional until they dock the boat. They have a pattern and practice of tandem docking with other Avalon boats. At some locations we were between a dock and another boat, and at other locations we were between two other boats. After the boat was docked the view from the cabin was into another cabin on another boat, with the persons in the other cabin looking back. We had to keep the curtains closed. We paid a premium for an upper deck cabin with a view. With the curtains closed we had the same view of the people who had paid much less to be two decks lower. The consequences of the tandem docking practice make an otherwise excellent cruise experience only average.

Integral part of Budapest. The Danube is the massive river that splits Buda and Pest. Many of the famous landmarks of the City are based on its shores. You can take a lovely walk along either shore to take in some of the beautiful architecture.At night various landmarks are lit up (st Michael's church, Chaim Bridge, Buda Castle and the Parliament building). It is simply stunning. Well worth taking a stroll after dinner. Taking a boat trip along it is a great way to see the city and you can also dine on it as many of the boats do a dinner cruise.

The Beautiful Danube...Is Not Blue !. Planning a river cruise on the Danube for 5 years and we finally made it! However, the river was not blue and the water was low from the hot summer draught experienced on the River. Grate 1 Travel however made lemonade out of lemons and provided a wonderful land/cruise vacation. Where we could not be on the river, Gate 1 had luxury coaches waiting to drive us to our scenic tour sights in Nuremberg. In Regensburg we boarded our ship and continued down the river o Passau, Linz, Melk, Durnstein, Bratislava with side tris to Salzburg, Vienna and finally Budapest. Unbelievable castles, abbeys, mountains, valleys, and cities...a trip of a lifetime!

Budapest by Night Dinner Cruise on the Danube. During our guided tour to Budapest, our tour guide arranged a private dinner cruise on the Danube which she called Budapest By Night. Essentially we rented the entire boat for a few hours so we could enjoy dinner, drinks and sightseeing. The dinner buffet included several tasty Hungarian choices and the local wine was very pleasant. Although the dinner was very good, the view of the city at night was the highlight of this evening! Several landmarks in the city of Budapest, including the gorgeous Parliament building and the bridges spanning the Danube were illuminated spectacularly! I am so glad that we signed up for this very enjoyable evening event and I recommend this attraction to all visitors to the wonderful city of Budapest.

A must do in Budapest . When in Budapest I suggest a cruise on the Danube is a must do . We first did a nighttime cruise with a good English commentary . This lasted about an hour first commenting on the building on the RHS and then coming back on the LHS of the river . It was a beautiful sight with all the buildings and bridges lit . We also repeated with a day time cruise (we had four cruise tickets to use) . This was good but not as great as the nighttime cruise . It went around the island as well and lasted almost two hours.

Nice evening river cruise. An amazing a river cruise on Danube river crossing most of the bridges starting from chain bridge in front of the parliament. You can view both the sides of Budapest look beautiful with the lights on
Nice. Walked along Danube during our business trip to Budapest. It was relaxing seeing the beauty of the place and knowing the past history that engulf the site.
ABSOLUTELY LOVELY. Really lovely journey and fantastic time. Beautiful river and very relaxing. Very highly recommend if you have the opportunity.

Wonderful Boat Ride. The boat ride of the Danube River came as an add on to the 48 hour city sightseeing bus tour that we booked. The ride offered a different perspective of the sites as it was viewed from the river. The ride was wonderful. Worth the time and money spent.

Evening Cruise with 4 Course Candlelit Meal on the Danube. One of the highlights for us was this cruise.(from Pier 7 on teh Pest side). To see all the buildings lit up from a different perspective was captivating and coupled with good quality dining made the experience memorable. The accompanying music was average but did not detract from an excellent evening (out of the rain)
Ferry Ride is must. dont Miss this Ferry cruise ride, its for 1 + hours and must do in Budapest. beautiful picturesque sites from the boat. dont forget to take your camera
Worth A Visit. We took both a day and night tour which was included in our hop on hop off bus tour it was lovely to see at night and during the day you can get off at Margaret Island and walk artound

Wonderfull. I'm from Lisbon, Portugal. Travelled with a group of 50 people. Just awesome to see this monument by night in the Danube cruise. and to dance to the Blue Danube Valse while see all the monuments in Buda and Pest
Never thought that this city would be so wonderfull. Loved it!

Budapest break. we walked a way along the Danube after visiting Parliament square to be honest it looked dirty, but Budapest is so lovely anyway it really doesn't matter. we also had a cruise one night which was beautiful

Memorable experience that I will remember for some time. We took a nighttime boat trip which included dinner and music. It was very relaxing sailing up and down the Danube and viewing the city,s main landmarks at night. The food was excellent and the atmosphere intimate and relaxing. One of the best experiences of our trip.
Beautiful river you cannot miss. A must see when you visit places such as Vienna and Budapest. Take a day cruise to appreciate the beauty and night cruise with dinner to enjoy the night scenes.

Worth at night. I recommend to take a 1 hour cruise tour by sundown or at night, beautiful views of Buda and Pest , and most important buildings are lightened at night. This cruise is included with the hop on-off passes

Cheapest tour around!. We took a river boat all along the river on a Friday when we could use the transport passes we'd already bought. The views were great, and we liked how the boat sort of zig-zagged between stops so it was easy to get across and hop off whenever we wanted. Only downside was we couldn't go out on deck, but it was free with the pass so can't complain too much!

One of the great rivers. I have read a lot about the Roman Empire and how the Danube marked the eastern border of the empire. Getting the opportunity to sail down the river made it very clear how this river was an imposing barrier.
Nighttime. Take a boat ride along the Danube, especially at night, to get great views of both Buda and Pest. The beautiful buildings all lit up are spectacular. Highly recommended.

WATCH OUT FOR VIKING - WITHHOLDING IMPORTANT INFO. The Danube had low water all summer/fall 2015, which required us to change ships mid-week, lose several itinerary high-points, and sit 10+ unscheduled hours on buses to complete the "cruise". Despite repeated attempts before and during the cruise to get answers, all these itinerary changes (which Viking had been performing all summer) were not disclosed to passengers till the night before. The crews and ships were wonderful, but MANAGEMENT GETS THUMBS DOWN.

Great River to Sail along. If you have the time sail with Uniworld from Istanbul to Amsterdam along the Danube, Mein and Rhine, it is a relaxed way of seeing all the great cities along the waterways without having to pack and unpack
views. Look for the one hour river cruise small boat with hot coffee and bar. English and German info for 8 Euro. Recommended MeuterMedia

DISAPPOINTED IN VIKING'S ROMANTIC DANUBE CRUISE. Just completed a cruise (more like a motor coach tour) on Viking's Longship the Gullveig. I feel Viking should have informed me of the low water level on the Danube prior to my arrival and given me the option of rescheduling at another time, as I understand they knew far in advance of our departure the water level was low. I resent paying many dollars only to be bussed to almost every destination.

The River. Enjoy the huge Duna,walking along its banks. Overnight it's a unique experience. Its enlightened bridges make Budapest skyline,along with the most beautiful buildings on the two shores. And have a nightly cruise, suggested one with music and dinner on the boat. Duna IS Budapest.
Fantastic. nothing better than having a boat cruise in the nice Danube river while enjoying the sunny day and the light breeze.

Not much to say. Well its the big river dividing budapest to buda and pest. You are not going to miss it even if you want. You should have a walk on both sides of the river and also in the dark time. Beautiful

The Blue Danube - no, but still beautiful.. Rosie and I had two trips on the Danube. It is just great to say that only have we seen it, put our hands in it (it is freezing!) but we took two boat trips on it. The first trip was a public "bus" trip but the second an organised trip. Neither great buit we always say that to see a city you need the bus and the boat.

interesting. we had a cruise along the danube whilst visiting Budapest. it was in October so the weather was not brilliant but it did not distract from the amazing views of the old buildings and land marks. the guide explains the buildings and gives a good history of them.it lasted about an hour and is not to be missed if in Budapest.there is a bar to eat and drink and also toilet facilities

A great break, the guided visit throught the Danube and its history. A guided visit throught the Danube and its history might come as a great break to understand the history behind this two fellow cities met at this river. It might come as a great first glimpse of what to visit in this gorgeous and antique city.

beautiful lit night bridges. Travel the Danube river at night.The bridges are beautifully lit and all landmarks especially the parliament building appears even more impressive.I think everyone should take a night cruise down the Danube.Once , one can afford the dinner Danube river cruise take it

Fantastic River cruise. This September, 2015, we cruised the Danube from Regensburg Germany to Budapest Hungary with Tauck Cruises. We had an amazing vacation. The Danube is by far one of the most enjoyable rivers in Europe to cruise on. It affords us the most countries to visit and its waters are calm and very navigable, even during periods of lower water levels. In eight days we experienced quaint villages and major cities throughout Germany, the Czeck Republic, Austria, Slovakia and Hungary. It afforded us opportunities to tour places such as Prague, Vienna, Saltzburg, Brataslava and Budapest. Truck Cruises is by far the most premium cruise line to offer such an itinerary and we would recommend Tauck as your first choice in cruising the beautiful Danube.

Lovely views by boat or foot. We went on boat trip which pointed out the interesting buildings and historic info,we also walked across the chain bridge and along to the parliament building.People watching and looking at the boats was very interesting.

Boat trip down the Danude. This river divides the separate parts of the city, Buda and Pest. Take a stroll down the waters edge at night to get some of the best views of Parliament, Castle Hill and Fisherman's Bastion.

Cruising down the river. A cruise down the Danube is a must as you view all the buildings from a different angle although I cannot say it is very blue.The one we did took an hour which we found was just enough

Must be seen from every angle. We came into Budapest by bicycle and watched as the "Emerald City" grew from a jagged horizon to the magical array of spires and bridges. We walked both sides of the river along the promenades then took a river cruise on evening as the sun was setting. The play of the midnight blue sky and the glowing yellowish lights that illuminate the buildings and bridges creates an amazing contrast that begs to be photographed.
Dine on the Danube. Highly recommend the Legenda dinner cruise. Food excellent and brilliant sights to see at night. Staff very pleasant and efficient, Good value

Buda on one side and Pest on the other. WE stared our river cruise in Budapest and although this was our first we know we will do more of these. Cruising on the Danube is the best way to see the beauty.

You must do. My husband and I were enjoyed the trip very much and very pleasant . We had evening trip, including dinner and music.The food was good and the beautiful view. I recommended people to go this trip.

Majestic River. Our hotel was situated on the Danube so we had a spectacular view from the room. The river with all of the spectacular bridges are beautiful to see. I recommend a nighttime boat ride so that you can see everything lit up.

A romantic and relaxing way to discover Budapest.. Both the day and evening cruises are worth it, for the view you get on the city from the river. It is relaxing, and VERY romantic. On the day cruise , wine tasting is included (excellent wines). I experienced the evening cruise with dinner. Live music, excellent buffet, ideal moment and place to declare your love ! Highly recommanded !

River cruise. The Danube River Cruise from Budapest to Passau is nice, the best part is the Wachau Valley it is so beautiful and peaceful. We enjoyed all the stops in Bratislava, Durnstein, Linz on our way to Salzburg, Vienna. I think Durnstein was the quaintest little town especially since we arrived on a feast day and were able to see the precession through the town streets it was a highlight.
Beautiful by day and by night. I walked along it by day in the city, on Margaret Island and at Szentendre and did a cruise at night. In all circumstances a magic river.
If you like river cruises, then you can't miss the Danube cruise.. The Danube goes through many countries and you can see a lot of attractions. It's rather cold so don't go swimming :)

Night cruise on the Danube is a must!. My boyfriend and I booked the night cruise on the Danube with live music and Hungarian buffet for our first night in Budapest, we were not disappointed!! The live music was fantastic and the Hungarian buffet was very scrumptious! (: In my opinion, for the price, this experience was worth it. Very romantic.

My Amazing Retirement Cruise.. In March of 2015 I embarked on my amazing retirement cruise. My companion was my only sibling and sister who had just celebrated her 70th birthday. We flew Singapore Airlines, great service, to Budapest via Singapore and Munich and on to our destination Budapest. We stayed 2 nights there, my dream come true, then joined our APT Cruise the next morning. Never once did we have to move our luggage It was always taken care of by the staff. Sailing and day trips with marvellous dinners etc on board took up our time on the way to Amsterdam. We saw so many exciting and interesting places and had free time as well to explore on our own. I felt entirely safe the whole journey and we made some great friends who have already visited us and stayed a night in their van. Laughter good food and entertainment were abundant the whole journey. I would recommend this cruise to everyone. No rough water Full on smooth sailing in all aspects.

Not at all like I Imagined. My first time in Budapest & I walked along the Danube & it was covered in mist or smog, I'm not sure which, it was definitely not blue but grey & gloomy looking. Nothing at all attractive about it.
Can't Miss, but can Sweeten the Deal. You really can't miss this while you are in Budapest, also the train passes work on the boats so I highly recommend taking advantage of that.
Beautiful river. Beautiful river to eat a picnic lunch by. Be sure to take a boat ride, day or night, this is a must.

A beautiful powerful , river loaded with history..... Beautiful by day or night a stroll along the banks is always a must .... Taking one of the excusion boats on a sunny day is also fine... Impressive in every way...

Narrowest in Budapest. Danube may be the river that flows through the maximum cities, capital and countries in the world and it is at its narrowest in Budapest - only 200 meters wide.
One can some of the best architecture that Budapest has to offer by jumping onto an hour long boat cruise along the Danube (better by night).

Just when you thought nothing could be more perfect..... The Danube here is wonderful by day and magic by night. No visit is complete without a night cruise on the river. Few experiences match the magic of seeing the illuminated buildings at night.
Very Nice. Very ice trip through the river, as one reviewer said that the water is not blue but still nice, I enjoyed the trip & seen.

Amazing landscape but.. . We decided to make our day with an amazing river cruise from "DECK 10" ( we bought our tickets from a guy selling them in vorosmarty Ter).We really enjoyed the landscape and the amazing view from both side of the river.However, the cruise wasn't organised at all. People walking every where and the english recorded speaker wasn't really understandable. 2 tickets - €18 / 4200 HUF Choose other boat cruise.

Beautiful View From the Pest Side. Lovely views of the castle and the bridges and churches from the promenade along the river on the Pest side. A nighttime river cruise is well worth it with all the buildings in lights.

Its not Blue but it is still beautiful.. we cruised the Danube and loved it. We were on board river duchess and tho the Danube water levels were low our captain was able to get us right through, where other ships had to stop and put their guests on coaches for a few sections.

Interesting views. On a 3 day trip to Budapest, we were advised to take a mini river cruise on the Danube. Being the tail end of the season, we booked an afternoon cruise which included a soft drink, tea or coffee. I think there was no more than 20 people on the boat. It is a good way to see the banks of the Danube with a really good view of the parliament building.

The capital is definitely not capital without the Danube.. There are several things what make Budapest so special. The Danube is one of them. We were sitting in traffic on the wharf but it was still enjoyable seeing how the lights of the city started to appear on the water. We decided to take a boat ride and see the city from the middle of the river. It was amazing. All of the turists waved at each other from the boats, it made us smile. We took long walks by the river, visited all the beautiful, famous bridges. We were really amazed by those lions guarding the Chaing bridge and really enjoyed the view around the Liberty bridge. The capital is definitely not capital without the Danube.

Evening tour on the Danube. We did an hour cruise on the Danube it was lovely and informative we even managed to have some wine We didn't book in advance we got a a hop on bus ticket which the tour was included £11 for two day , great value will definitely do it again
Walk along it. It was nice to walk along the river and take in the sights from the river banks. Walking across the bridges makes you appreciate the river

Lovely walk across the river!. Budapest would not be the same without the Danube river! Walking across the river day and night is a must do when in Budapest! Also having dinner on some of the boats on the Danube is lovely!

Danube Viking River Cruise. Two days before our departure date 21 Sept we rcivd a phone call from Viking Cruises advising that our travel arrangements had been amended due to low water levels on the Danube and that we would now be taken to an hotel in Nuremberg and then for onward travel to our ship The Skirnir. On arrival at Munich airport we were advised by the rep that the coach would now be taking us to Passau for boarding. Passau was our scheduled stop on day 4 of our trip. We were therefore docked there for the first half of our holiday river cruise.Once on board our stateroom was very smart, comfortable and had a great river view. We were very fortunate that we faced the river. The staterooms on the other side faced a damp ugly black wall for four days! At the evening briefing we were all offered a three hour each way coach trip to see Nuremburg....which we declined. We did however except the alternative offer of a visit to a typical Bavarian museum village. Which was interesting and informative.Day three we had a guided walking tour of Passau and enjoyed an excellent organ recital in St Stephens cathedral.Day four there were several alternative excursions offered. We took the one and a half hour coach trip to Regensburg for a guided walking tour. We set sail at three that afternoon. Travelling through the night arriving in Melk for a visit to the spectacular Abby. Back on board for lunch and onward sail through the Wachau valley to Vienna arriving at six pm. Next day as per schedule we had a coach and walking guided tour of the city and an excellent guided tour of the Schronbrunn Palace in the afternoon.We sailed through the night to arrive in Budapest the following morning. We enjoyed an excellent city tour.In summary we had paid and looked forward to a river cruise not a coach trip which is what we feel we had for at least half the holiday. All the staff onboard were excellent. The ship itself comfortable and modern. Food was varied and good. The programme director worked hard to compensate for the lack of cruising. We understand that Mother Nature will do as she wishes but it would have been appreciated if Viking had advised us more accurately and offered alternatives in advance of travelling.

avoid Legendaray Journeys. booked a cruise and pre and post vacation thru Legendary Journeys. The cruise on Danube to Budapest and Vienna sounded so wonderful. You dock right at the port. Except LJ booked it so that we landed at 8AM and left at noon, giving us enough time to wander around in a bus!! Same with Budapest and Vienna. The only port in which we stayed 8 hours was Belgrade, Serbia- a hole in the ground with bombed out buildings, nothing to see. Ship had nothing to do, so it was boring. When we finally got off, they booked us in a hotel with horrible food and no air conditioning. no laundry facilities either, in Romania, Constanza- nothing much here either. Cannot reach anyone to complain or change hotels. DO NOT USE LEGENDARY JOURNEYS!

London to Budapest (3 nights) cruise on Danube to Frankfurt, train to London.. This was billed by therivercruiseline as Danube Discovery Cruise & Stay 7th -16th Sept.This company changes transport and hotels at will and regrettably badly in several cases. We told them that we would join the tour in Munich( which we did) but they sent us instructions for joining in Paris.Next day we were taken on a very long coach journey to Budapest to a Best Western Hotel despite the programme of rail and Novotel. The Best Western was badly sited with many groups there - a horrible hotel. The cruise manager was not noted for any explanations ! On arrival at the ship ,ms Serenity, we were kept waiting in the rain for check in (55 people) although it would have been easy to have taken us to the lounge to wait.The silliest thing was "afternoon tea" 4 - 4.30 pm. A long table was set up with two waiters to serve so a long queue was quickly formed - the queuing was one of my principal recollections of this tour !Back in Frankfurt, we had a coach journey of an hour to a really dreadful hotel "Mercure Bensheim" I promise you that it is NOT a Mercure in the Accor group, then an hour back for the rail trip to London via Brussels. For the part from Frankfurt, we had a really good guide who joined us at Bensheim and organized everything very efficiently The River Cruise Line is to be avoided
great river. the most favourite river of mine in europe. u must take a river cruise here. if possible one in a day and one by night. the night looks amazing from the river.

Viking River Cruises Romantic Danube. In August 2015 we and another couple went on a Viking River Cruise, Romantic Danube, from Budapest, Hungary to Nuremberg, Germany up the Danube River. This was one of the best vacations we have ever taken. The trip began with a change in flights due to bad weather. The cruise we purchased included air, and when the first leg of our flight was delayed due to bad weather which would have caused us to miss our other flights, Viking quickly rerouted us. When we landed in Budapest 6 hours later then our scheduled flight we were met at the airport and put on a cab to our ship. One of our bags was left in the US and Viking representatives told us not to worry they would take care of getting it to the ship (which it did join us a couple of days later. The service and food on ships was outstanding. I mentioned ships as in plural because the Danube River was so low that our initial ship could not travel fro Passau, Germany to Regensberg, Germany, so we pack our bags and switched ships with the same Viking ship that was going down river in Regensberg. The detour involved minimal disruption, and Viking bussed us to Regensberg (45 minutes) and we had lunch in Regensberg courtesy of Viking. Not one complaint, it was a bit of an adventure, which Viking made up with an open bar that night. We did not have one bad thing to say about the trip, all excursions are included. We felt we had plenty of time to see the cities (we skipped lunch on the ship several times to stay in the various cities. Great way to see lots of Europe without having to pack an unpack.
1st visit. nice experince, try to get a cruse with friends at night. or you can take a walk at night or run around it in the early morning

The Danube and Budapest! What a miraculous place!. We've visited the Danube in Vienna, Bratislava, and Belgrade. While we especially adore the view from Kalemegdan in Belgrade, the Hungarians have truly adorned one of Europe's most important waterways and the surrounding landscape with beautiful architecture. It's a sight to behold and always impressive no matter how long or how many times you've experienced it! I always hope that this time wasn't my last!

Amazing views of the city. A sail on the Danube is a must when in Budapest. We did an evening sail and the buildings and monuments were spectacular when lit up. The tour guide also provided lots of information, this sail was include with our purchase of the hop on hop off bus.

Beautiful river to cruise. One of the loveliest rivers to wander along the banks of. So many river trip boats always going up and down. Lots of tour boats stop here as well. Make sure you walk along both sides of the promenade to get the best views. Also we did a day river trip and a night one. Both good and slightly different itineraries.

Your holiday will not be complete until you've cruised the Danube.. Taking a cruise on the Danube is a must. Great way to relax, have something cold to drink, just sit back and enjoy the sights after a long day of walking tours. Definitely worth it!

Holiday. Very nice many tourist having a cruise in the water ways so famous very popular it's beautiful all around. It's so amazing and nice place to just relax take photos and just walk and walk to see all beautiful waterways and buildings.
Not Blue these days. We went on a cruise starting in Budapest so saw rather a lot of the DanubeIt is certainly NOT blue but is quite beautiful to cruise along
it was ok. very nice, saw how the levels of water got up to in the event of a flood, people are sort of friendly.
not so interesting but relaxing. totally ok to take a boat tour but I dont think it was too much interesting to see. If you have some time over and just want to relax, why not..
So much like Paris. A beautiful river with stately historic buildings lining the sides. It reminds me of a bohemian Paris. See it at night when the buildings are lit.

NIGHT CRUISE ON THE DANUBE. The night cruise that we done a while back on the Daube was the best thin we did. Saw the Parliament House all lit up also the bridges. The buffet was great and plenty of variety. Would recommend it.

Must do. Do not miss out on a river trip on the Danube; which last for about 1hour 45 minutes. If you can only do it once go after dark. Truly stunning and as such haven't a clue about the facilities on the boat as I was too interested in the sights around me.

Stunning . The Danube in Budapest is just a lovely place to be in general. Getting a boat from north to South is a great way to see the views along its banks (all a World Heritage site) and appreciate its bridges from another angle. My parents family live right long side it and we always take an evening/night stroll when we're visiting. As most tourists choose to take the boat, the walkways along the banks are usually the preserve of Budapest's people and is a popular spot for dates and picnics. Hungary is a nation known for being brilliant at swimming and kayaking because of their river. Try and do either upstream and you'll soon realise why their athletes are quite so strong. It's the heart of the city, so it's pretty unmissable. The Danube is definitely one of my favourite places to be close to.

The BLUE Danube?. Take a stroll along the Danube and watch the boats sail by. While I enjoyed this, what struck me most was that the Danube is not BLUE but rather brown! A little disappointing but none the less beautiful.
The blue Danube. A cruise through its water is the best way to have a wide view of Budapest. It seemed quite clean and smelled good. Sometimes it showed as blue. I loved it!!!

How could you not like the Danube?. Kind of an odd thing to rate, but the Danube is a great river! Honestly, if you are in a Budapest you need to get on the river. There are many options from big river cruise vessels to humble ferries with every kind of tourist tour in between (i.e. Dinner cruise, sunset cruise, daytime cruise, nighttime cruise...). We took the ferries which are included in a multiday transit pass. They don't make many stops and are not set up for tourists per se. It's a good way to take a rest and a river cruise at the same time!

Great. Have viewed this river from 4 different cities, and it never fails to impress in various ways. At every stop there is something different from the last. Whether by rail, boat or just strolling, it will appeal to all.

Avalon Danube River Cruise - Prague to Budapest. For anyone considering taking a river cruise in Europe, look into what Avalon has to offer. We all have seen the beautiful commercials on TV by Viking Cruises, but this company seems to spend more on publicity than on their ships. Avalon is a relatively new - 8 years - Swiss company with new ships, excellent food and service. I am very glad we chose them for our trip down the Danube. Their scheduled visits, as well as the extra sightseeing to be had for an extra fee were instructional and interesting, well organized and sensitive to the different walking needs of their passengers. I will do it again, maybe this time on the Rhine.

Cruise The River danube. Try a short half-day river cruise to acquaint yourself with the topography and general lay out of Budapest from the river. Pass under all of the bridges and enjoy a relaxing trip on the Danube.

Boat connection Esztergom - Budapest (high season). We took a bus (70 minutes) from Budapest to the lovely town of Esztergom on the Slovakian border and visited the town.Then, we took the boat back to Budapest (Vigadó tér). It took us about 4 hours. The boats were operated by the "MAHART passnave" company. Cost: 5000 HUF. Beautiful scenery along the way ("Danube Bend"). You stop at a few towns. Nice view of the Visegrad Castle.Entering Budapest by night is magic. Passing under the bridges, slowly floating past Parliament...Beware, the boats only operate until the 3rd week of september and will not depart in case of extreme weather. Check the website for more info.

A must thing to do.. One of the things you must do when in Budapest is take a trip on the Danube, it is one of the things that will stay in your memory forever, a different perspective of the city of Budapest, one not to be missed.

Gorgeous view!. If you have watched the commercials for the river cruises in Europe you have seen this spectacular view from the Buda castle overlooking the Danube with Margarite island and the Parliament buildings - just stunning and well worth the trip to Budapest
It's truly blue.. Stunning view from our fifth floor room. The Chain Bridge was one of three we used to criss cross the river as we walked our legs off.

It is not blue!!. What a long river. What a wide river in rhe Hungary side. There is even an island in the middle of this river.We followed this river from Germany through to Austria then to Slovakia and to Hungary and so far it has always been green but never once was it blue. The source of the Danube is Germany. Not sure where it ends - black sea in Ukraine I think. It is the border for a long while between Germany and Austria and also borders Austria and Slovakia.

Rains ruined the experience. You drive to the place where the river cruise starts. Please ensure you take a good tour as you are in a mini van /bus from Budapest to the place where the Danube river cruise starts and reaching there (with halts on the way) takes a good 3-4 hours.The cruise is worth it but when we were going on the same it started raining and became a bit chilly , if it had been sunny would have stayed up in open and enjoyed much more
The Donau. Budapest along the river is spectacular at night-we enjoyed eating on a restaurant ship and viewing the wondrous sights. Just a bit noisy, but very good in spite of that.

River of Buda & Pest. Danube River is the Beautiful Attraction at Budapest. The Cities Buda & Pest are on the Either Side of the River and Beautiful Bridges Connect these. Lot of River activities and Cruise Travelling on Danube.

Beautiful Danube River Cruise. We took a 2 hour cruise on the Danube and one cannot see Budapest or any other city on the Danube without experiencing the river from a sightseeing boat. Our cruise was during the day; but, there are also evening and nighttime cruises. Totally enjoyable since our weather was picture perfect.

Danube. Although we didn't sail on it we did walk along and over it, a very wide (by Aussie standards) and pretty river, which I have every intention of sailing in the not too distant future. A trip to Budapest would be incomplete without a visit to the Danube.
Beautiful Danube. Loved watching the boats, especially at night, had a nice boat trip to see the sights. Danube looks green, but looked blue from the sky.

Relax and Take in the Views. We had hoped to do a Danube Bend Cruise, but the water level was too low so we did the short ride which was part of our Hop on Hop Off bus ticket. This ride does stop at Margaret Island which we wanted to do, but it was getting late and one of our group was having back problems. You should definitely try one of the many boat tours offered on the river. You get great views and photo ops, you get to relax after all your walking and you are actually on the Danube River. Everyone warned me to expect brown water not "the Blue Danube", but I was pleasantly surprised and found it somewhat blue.
Great attraction at nigth. If you want to enjoy excellent views of the Buda and pest during the nigth, this is the tour. It cost around 20 euros and the wine is include during the tour.
A Must to Do. Budapest is a beautiful city but if you do nothing else in Budapest you MUST do the night cruise of the Danube. Truly stunning.

We fell in love with AmaWaterways on the Danube. We sailed with AmaWaterways on the AmaSerena from Budapest to Vilshoven & loved every minute of it! The food, service and accommodations were probably the best we have ever experienced...& we are seasoned cruisers. This being our first river cruise, we loved the calm waters and daily tours. We walked, hiked, or biked daily and fell in love with the beautiful Danube and its quaint and lovely towns & cities all through Hungary, Austria & the Czech Republic. We will be returning to Ama soon ;-)

Takes your breath away. The views of the Danube are incredible. Like the waltz it is blue when the suns out and the buildings on it are beautiful. It really did take our breath away when we first saw it.

Relaxing tour, good value for money. The Danube is worth a visit just for the view. We had a river cruise tour which was great; luckily the weather was good and it showed us all of the landmarks close to the river. Our tour was included in the price we paid for the big bus city tour, so definitely value for money!

Must see in Budapest. The Danube in Budapest must be seen and you must walk along the banks. It can be viewed on Tram 2 both day and night. If you walk the Chain Bridge you can see it from both sides. A river cruise is also a good way to see the Danube.
Cruise. We did the cruise on the danube and this was a great way to get your bearings. The Danube has stunning architecture on both sides. Spent many hours wondering along the banks in awe

Lovely places beware of the boat companies trying to lure you in.. Fantastic places loads of little cafes and restaurants around, just be aware of the boat companies offering tours. We got tricked into taking a tour and we wanted an outdoor area to admire and take photos of landmarks around but we ended up on a tour with no outdoor space. So just research all the boat tour operators before choosing

A must see. A dream come true. A walk along the Danube late in the eveing after the sun has set . Absolutely a must do. The walking area is clean and safe with lovely statues as photo ops and so close to some f the nice hotels which overlook the Danube. Flooded with restaurants along the walkway and on tne river as well.

Spectacular at night!. I've never seen a city lit up the way Budapest is at night. The bridges, the Castle, the Parliament building to name a few. The best way to view them is from the Danube. However, most of the boats are enclosed. For the best views I prefer open air. We were able to snag the few open air seats on the boat we ended up on. I did find one that was open air (that we did not take due to large group) but if you research on TA you can find it.

An essential part of your trip. Do not miss!. You can tour the Danube in the day, at night and with or without food. There is a huge selection of options but we took an hours cruise at night and it was spectacular. For 11 Euros you can go on an hours boat trip up the Danube complete with headphones. The audio and the boat speed weren't in complete synchronisation but it was the last trip of the day at 9pm but we still enjoyed it. All the top attractions were floodlit and looked incredible. Boats can be boarded between the chain bridge & the Elizabeth bridge and are usually noted on your guide map. Do not miss!

Check for high water/low water before you leave!. We booked a two-week European river cruise on the Amadeus Silver from Budapest to Amsterdam. We had a cabin on the Mozart deck, which was lovely. Slightly larger than an ocean cruise cabin, with plenty of storage for clothing. Exactly as pictured on their web-site. Bathroom well appointed, compact, with walk-in shower. My husband didn’t care for the frosted glass door on the bathroom (shy bladder!) The “French balcony” style automatic window was fantastic. The food was great, the staff were friendly and bent over backwards to satisfy our every need. Unfortunately, on the third day, in Vienna, I tripped and fell disembarking the ship (my fault, not theirs), badly spraining both ankles. Off to the hospital by ambulance for x-rays, aircasts and crutches. The Cruise Director sent his assistant to the hospital with us to ensure we were treated well and translate if necessary. Upon my return to the ship, the Hotel Manager offered me a complementary credit for the hair salon, whatever treatment I would like. She also called our cabin at least once a day to see how I was doing and if there was anything I needed. The Maitre D’ brought me dinner in our cabin for the next two evenings as I wasn’t too ambulatory. The elevator wasn’t working when we boarded the ship, but they had it repaired a couple of days after my fall so I could go down to the dining room. Due to the heat wave/drought in Europe this summer, the Danube river levels were too low for our ship to proceed past Passau. Our second week became a bus trip, which was not what any of us signed up for, but we were given the option of leaving the tour – Lueftner offered a credit for the remaining days of the trip and would pay the transportation of anyone who wanted to proceed directly to Amsterdam and home. The cost of changing your flight home would be borne by the passengers, however. I thought this was a fair offer, all of the fine print provided with the travel documents warned that river levels could affect the cruise. Certainly we were all disappointed, but those that were especially disgruntled should have read their travel docs with more attention.The Cruise Director and his 2 assistants then had to book buses, hotels, restaurants, etc. etc. for the next 7 days. They were exhausted by the time we reached Amsterdam (as were most of the passengers!) but they did an awesome job. So kudos to Lueftner and to Christian and Dahlia and Sorina. The hotels they booked were almost equivalent to the cabins on the ship. The food was hit and miss and not the same quality as on the Amadeus Silver, but any restaurant faced with about 90 customers seated for lunch or dinner at the same time has quite a challenge. Any changes to excursions or routines were communicated well to the passengers. And they run a tight ship – things happened on schedule for the most part, despite the disruption caused by the river levels. In spite of my fall and the loss of a week of river cruising, I would definitely book with Lueftner again. Their employees from the Captain to the maids go out of their way to ensure that they provide the best river cruise experience for their passengers.

Magestic and busy wide river with lovely buildings both banks. Touring the city one is endlessly told the river rises in Germany and flows 2860km through 10 countries to the Black Sea. In Budapest it is majestically wide, capable of taking sizeable craft. There are many splendid buildings on both banks, notably the Parliament buildings and the Castle complex on the Buda side. Most of the Pest side buildings date from the mid-Victorian era, the low-lying land there flooding catastrophically in 1838. All the bridges were destroyed in WW2, but all but one were rebuilt in their original style.A must visit and see.
A boat at night. very plaesent night ride on the Danube with the big bus company. We enjoyed the night view of all the monuments

BEST NIGHT TIME VIEWS. We went on one of the latest sailings of the 90 minute cruise which was part of our hop on/hop off bus pass and it was FABULOUS. Everything was so pretty all lit up at night on BOTH sides of the Danube...from Castle Hill on the Buda side to Parliament on the Pest side. Even though it had been super hot in Budapest all day, we were certainly glad that we had jackets for the cruise as it did cool down greatly at night. Another bonus...our boat had a small bar and so we were able to enjoy a glass of wine while drinking in the sights. This is a MUST DO in Budapest...preferably the first night to help you get a sense of direction and the lay of the land.
Enjoyed. Had a good cruise on the Danube. Scenic views all around. Danube river cruise is must if in Budapest.

The famous Budapest river. The Danube runs between Buda and Pest with lovely bridges connecting the two over the river. Walking the promenades give beautiful views day and night and sunset over the Danube is beautiful
Blue Danube. We enjoyed the 90 minute cruise of the Danube that was part of the hop on hop off bus tour. Great opportunity to take pictures of the Parliament, castle and other points of interest.

Viking danube river cruise. The Danube Waltz River cruise on the Prestige boat was excellent! Highly recommend. Included and extra tours and events- we did most.Guides were super. Not like the big cruises for entertainment but very appropriate for the area. Food, service - all wonderful. GO!

Cruise the Danube . I loved the Danube cruise and would say take at least with lunch or dinner.
Relaxing with great views.

Do a river cruise at night - DO IT!!!!. If you're in Budapest and have yet to hit the Danube, do a a short river cruise at night. The words "spectacular" and "magnificent" don't do it justice. Great views of the cities can be had from numerous places along the shore, but nothing beats the view along the Danube!!

Hop into the Danube ferries with your combined PT ticket. Here is a tip for you: The Danube ferries are a part of Budapest's combined public transportation system, so if you have a 24 hours PT ticket, you can just hop into one. The ferries only work till 8pm tough

Take a Danube boat ride. This river is famous, huge, flows through a number of countries, starting in Germany and ending in the Black Sea, at Constanza. You can do a walking trip, just some meandering or sit by one of the countless coffee shops or restaurants and watch the river go by. In Budapest, there are a number of boat trips you can take for an hour on the river. I would like to recommend a local, city-run boat (its the one that the locals use to get around) that is included in your Budapest City Pass. On week days. Look out for the D11 and D12 boat, it works like a hop-on-hop-off. Of course there is no running tourist commentary, but who needs that with the larger-than-life buildings passing by ?
See Buda and Pest from the mighty Danube. Take a boat trip on the (not-so-blue) Danube to get a different perspective on Buda and Pest. Pretty much a must-do thing

Boating, Sightseeing, dancing while wining - great combination. Fortunate to have stayed near the great river as also evening one hour boat ride on the Denube. Grandeur of Budapest along the boat ride is simply breathtaking - thoroughly enjoyed with Hungarian wine & add the dancing on the boat be some enthusiasts. Just memorable & unforgettable experience. Don't miss this.

The stunning Danube. By going on the hop on hop of buses and boat you can have an hour's trip down the Danube which is absolutely stunning .The views are beautiful on both sides there is so much history in this country this trip has got to be done.

Spectacular views at night . We took a dinner cruise on the Danube and thoroughly enjoyed it. It's a whole new experience to see the majestic buildings on both sides lit so beautifully.  The bridges, the parliament, Buda castle, royal palace, fisherman's bastion, Matthias church, they all look and are spectacular at night.  A night cruise on Danube is a good way to appreciate all this.
Danube river boat ride. Romantic night activity. Worth every $$$. And realy shouldn't be expensive. Gives a great show of lights during the night.

drinking wine on the Danube. We took a boat trip on the Danube, seems crazy to be here and not too, it was free with our hop on off bus which was also very good and well worth doing, it was wonderful sailing past the Parliment buildings.
Trip down the Danube.. Take a trip down the Danube the sites Are stunning. You must take your camera,phone or iPad to record your trip.

Uniworld River Cruise. We did a river cruise on Uniworld from Passau to Budapest. Stopping in Melk, Linz, Brataslavia, Vienna and ending in Budapest. Luxury all the way. Wonderful guided tours, special access to attractions, amazing food. The staff can't do enough to make you happy. All inclusive, even gratuities.
Beautiful. Took a lunch time cruise and a night time cruise, both of which were lovely! Great deals to be had and many spectacular views with such history.
Beautiful river. Be sure to take at least one of the many boat tours on offer, you do see the city differently from the river.

No excuses...this is a MUST DO at night. A MUST DO adventure while in Budapest is to take a river cruise at night. Being on a Vantage river cruise tour and staying 2 nights in Budapest, we were thrilled that we got to do this twice. Because we were on our river cruise boat, we were able to wander up on the top deck for incredible views. The buildings lighting up along the river as it starts getting dark, is quite an experience!!!! And the number of boats on the river each night tells how popular this would be, not only first time visitors, but returning visitors to Budapest!

Best Experience in Europe Yet!. The dinner cruise 7:30 was excellent! The music was delightful with the trio playing Johann Strauss the Beatiful Danube. The buffet was great. The only down side was the lack of area to take pictures that were not through the window. But great all around! I would call it my best experience in Europe.

The Danube at Budapest. Compared to Paris and London (but as with the Tiber in Rome), the river itself is not a major attraction. The banks of the river are generally lined by highways and there is little walking space (though along the Pest side of the river there are many cruise boats). Buda and Pest themselves are interesting, of course, and the river can be seen as picturesque from some vantage points (especially Castle Hill on the Buda side).

Excellent river cruise . We cruised from Budapest to Passau Germany with Viking River cruise. We had a good time and learned a lot about the various towns that we toured. The best side trip was to a Mozart and Strauss Vienna orchastra presentation. The opera singers and orchastra were outstanding. The Danube river is beautiful and very scenic. Try a river cruise they are nice
Beautiful. I recommend a cocktail or dinner cruise to fully appreciate the views, especially at night when all momuments are lighted.
Beautiful, wide river, but it's not blue!. Lovely to walk along, and of course take a boat trip. Roads either side of the river do get busy with traffic, but still easy enough to walk along..

Beautiful River- Take a boat ride. The Danube in Budapest is so beautiful. The views akong the river on both sides of the river are stunning. The bridges are also beautiful. Take a boat ride in the evening when everything is lit up. Do not, I repeat do not take the public transportation boat. It is very cheap & is part of the whole Metro system. The problem is the biat spends most of the time going back & forth across the river to pick up passengers on the docks on each side of the river. More than 50% of the time on the boat is spent docking. If you want to see a lot of docks take the public transportation boat, otherwise avoid it.

Great way to visit central Europe. A river cruise on the Danube is a great way to tour Central Europe and a great viewing point for the city of Budapest, especially at night. The river is not actually blue but seems clean. Shallow water conditions have been causing problems for some cruise ships but not for ours.
Nice. We took a 90 minutes river cruise on the Danuba and it was fun and productive as we could see both sides of Budapest.

Beautiful. Get this trip on a fine day and then walk along at a more leisurely pace. The views are beautiful and you will see many places you want to explore on foot. Budapest is a beautiful city worth exploring and this is the place to begin. The buildings are awe-inspiring on either side of the river.Many boats leave from Jane Haining Rakpart and this Scottish woman is worth finding out about, too. She helped Jewish children in the second world war. If it's wet, you can take the Number 2 tram along the bank opposite the castle.
Dinner cruise. By all means, take a boat tour--maybe even a dinner cruise---on the Danube to see the city at night because the lights are beautiful.

The blue danube river song is a fantasy .... For starters, the romantics will be disappointed: the river Danube is not blue; rather, it is a muddy river and its charm lies in going through beautiful landscapes and very beautiful cities (such as Vienna, Prague or Budapest, among others). The Danube River, which is navigable to a great extent, and goes through various capitals of Europe, constituting the natural border of ten nations. The Danube is the second longest river in Europe (after the Volga): it has between 2845 and 2888 kilometers long. It crosses the continent from west to east, from its source in the Black Forest (Germany) until emptying into the Black Sea, the Danube Delta (Romania).In the main capitals through which it passes it is possible to make beautiful cruises by boat, many with animation and good national food on board.
Nice to relax by. We often wander on to Margaret Island to walk then sit by the Danube and watch the boats go by while drinking a coffee.
Lovely Danube. Lovely Danube ! from wherever you are, just walk all along and enjoy the great view or take a cruise!

Not blue...but definitely beautiful..... Based on the classic composition, we thought the Danube would be blue...but not in our experience. That said it is clean and beautiful...and the experience of sailing into Budapest on the Danube is exceptional. Definitely worth a boat ride...regardless of the colour!
Adventure Budapest. The Danube is more beautiful than I thought it would be. It is just Grand. We have been fascinated with the views from both sides. It is such a busy big river.

River Cruise. First time in Budapest and very impressed with the history and architecture in the city! There is a wealth of grand buildings and beautiful architecture everywhere in the city. It can take a few days to explore every building and museum but for a quick trip the best way is to take a river cruise and enjoy the views on both banks of the river- Buda and Pest sides. The river cruises leave every half hour and are reasonably priced. They are hop on hop off and good way to take pictures and enjoy the sights and sounds!

6 hours of sheer hell - unsafe, don't use. We took the hydrofoil from Budapest to Vienna as a nice way to see the river. We couldn't see the river. The windows were dirty, scratched and towards the back of the boat, frosted. This is a very old boat run by surly staff. There were NO announcements the whole time, not even a safety announcement or to say where the toilet was. You are confined to the inside of the boat which is cramped and dirty. Think economy airlines on a very bad day. Your checked luggage goes in a van by road but no one tells you this. You hand luggage goes on your feet or knee. It is hot and dirty. It's unclear how the passagengers crammed in would get out in an emergency. Even when you enter the lock with 50 foot concrete walls, no information. Save your money, go by train, or bus, or walk - anything but this! This service should be shut down on safety reasons, how can there be no safety briefing, obvious means of escape - and possibly even no life jackets (we didn't see any) on a fast moving ship. A horrible experience, just don't do it.
Great river ride. Both in day and night this is a great excursion! The river is calm so you don't have to worry if you are getting seasick.. Not expensive as well.

Now Budapest this year is more beautiful than ever.. It is very pleasant to stroll by boat. Budapest this year is more beautiful than ever. There is a new illumination of buildings and monuments and at night is a very beautiful city.

Danube by night. If you do get the chance, take a boat trip by night. We were lucky in that we had a dinner cruise on the Emerald Sun whilst we were there-the views of the floodlit Budapest architecture is a memory we will cherish.SS
Stunning. Very clean, shinning through water, making it a beautiful landmark. Has loads of water transports available!

Not What We Expected. Danube Bend Day Trip fro Budapest: Nothing was mis-stated on the listing it's just we did not get what we expected. It wasn't really a Danube cruise. After the basic tour was over, they gave us boarding passes for a boat headed to Budapest. The bus was not the best and combined with the very interesting roads, made it nearly impossible to hear the guide. It was OK at best.

First impression was the best (what an entrance to a brightly lit city). Seeing Budapest from the Danube at night as our river cruise ship entered the city was breathtaking. I had been told to expect a marvelous sight but I had no idea it would be this spectacular. The buildings, monuments and bridges are all beautifully lit up. Each building seemed to out do the last. All I can say is wow. My only recommendation is that you make sure your camera is set up properly for night shots before you arrive and stay sober enough to keep it steady.

Highly Recommended. We decided to go on a day-time cruise on the Danube. We purchased our tickets from one of the tourist information points in the city and one of the gentlemen at the stand was kind enough to walk us down to the actual boat itself as we were unsure of the location. Once on the boat, we were presented with a complimentary glass of sparkling Hungarian wine and our ticket entitled us to one other free drink during the cruise. The cruise itself was extremely relaxing and a fantastic way to get acquainted with the city and the main sites of interest. The staff on the cruise were friendly. I would recommend this as the first sightseeing thing to do in Budapest as it instantly gives you a sense of the layout of the city.

Sail in the evening. If you do nothing else in Budapest, you must take an evening cruise along the Danube! Absolutely amazing! Very romantic! Take one of the many boats that do this. A smaller one would be less crowded and be sure you book one that you can go up top and get a 360 degree view. Did I say, "Absolutely amazing!" Worth repeating!
Danube cruise. A brief 2 hour trip on the Danube on our wedding anniversary. Great views of the city and, well, it had the "Danube" vibe.

The Hungarians have done an excellent job of marketing. When you take a night cruise on the Danube, which by the way is a MUST, you will notice how the city has diligently worked with private enterprise in order to illuminate the two shores of the Danube along with the bridges, into a surreal fairyland light show. It is absolutely captivating, Plus you might even meet some nice people. The only downside on our cruise was the old fashioned, old age home, type music from mediocre bands, lol. During the day the walk along the Danube was nearly as spectacular, the only weak point being a a lack of railing to protect the walkway from a 10 foot precipice Riverside. this right beside a multi-million dollar Parliament for politicians where we saw a contrast between favours for the privileged and the common people .

Lovely Way to See Budapest. Our small group really enjoyed seeing the city fade into darkness and then watching as the lights on the bridges and historic buildings began to illuminate Budapest by night.....such a glorious sight. The river cruise is the best way to experience much of the history of Buda and Pest. The on-board tour guide did an excellent job of narrating the highlights, including the war years. Alcohol is available for purchase on board and the hot wine was a real treat on a cold night in March.

Excellent choice. Our tour take a 40 minutes sailing the Danube under few bridges. There was a english and deutcshe guides and we found very interesting to learn something about that beautifull city. Latest evening is maybe better to take a tour and see that city by night.

Not the prettiest river I've ever seen. We took a boat cruise in Budapest along the Danube and around the island. The water is pretty murky, which limited the reflections of the beautiful buildings along the river bank. There was a fair amount of river traffic, but the water was calm. The most interesting part to us was seeing the large river cruise boats that were docked for the day.

River cruise at night. We went on the river cruise offered by Viator. Choose the drink only option (so no dinner). I recommend mixing the peach juice and champagne together. The view, WOW! With everything lit up it's spectacular. Can get quite chilly so dress appropriately if you want to go out on deck to get an unobstructed view.

Walk it!. One of the best parts of our trip was walking along the river one evening after dinner. We started out at dusk and continued walking after dark and got some fantastic pictures of the river, the chain bridge, the Parliament Building and the "Shoes on the Danube" memorial. We enjoyed walking past the floating restaurants and the various river boats. There were several "dinner cruise" offerings. We chose not to do that because we would be departing on a river cruise a couple of days later. After walking, and also seeing the river on our cruise ship, I would say I enjoyed seeing the lights along the river more when I walked.

Beautiful river. Beautiful big wide river, where we sailed around around Margaret Island enjoying a drink in 40 degrees of heat. Hard to believe that the Danube runs through so many countries down all the way to the Black Sea, and is Europe's second largest river.

BLUE DANUBE IS JUST A SONG!. The Danube is really not blue. But it is beautiful. We took a river cruise. We will always hold fond memories of the Danube. The Roman Empire traveled the Danube. On the Danube you will go through many miniature versions of the Panama Canal locks. It touches ten countries. But on our trip we only visited three, Hungary, Germany, and Austria. Which means only one thing. WE'LL BE BACK!
The way to view Buda and pest at one go.. A busy yet somehow peaceful stretch of river. Amazing to see the flood markers on the building. Well worth an hour on the water to see both sides of the city

Beauty. Never have I seen a river so clear and clean in the middle of a city. Walking along the river, night or day can be very relaxing and you can even take a bench and watch the world go by. You can also hop onto many different boat tours which will give you a different perspective of the city. I recommend going to see the view across the river at night.

Travel on the Danube from Villshoffen to Budapest. We had a beautiful trip down the Danube, stopping in Passau, Vienna, Bratislava among others and ending in Budapest. One of the highlights was the cruise in Budapest at night when the bridges and the buildings are all full of lights. Spectacular!

River Boat Crusie. Taking in the sights of the Parliment buildings and the old stone statues. Gorgeous scenery on a sunny day. The journey back a bit boring however with a group of friends and sunshine it's a welcome break from the walking sightseeing!!!
Danube. Love this river ,has an amazing skyline and is beautiful at nights with the lights on the bridges and the attractions.The hungarian parliament looks stunning from here.

very romantic!. I wanted to do this for a long time...but I needed a special guy. In the end, Hungary gave me more than I had expected. The boats are nice, the river is clean, there are many birds and the views from both borders of the Danube are amazing. Just go up to the Buda Citadel and watch the sunset over the Danube......magnificent!
Cool. Very very magic and beautiful Danube. I'm in love with it all days of my stay. At night the visualsight is fantastic and romantic with citylights and sounds.
Got to do the night river cruise!. Budapest at sunset/dusk is best seen from the top deck of a river cruise. Views on both sides of the river are breathtakingly beautiful. Do it!

Danube in Budapest. Ine of the beautifull experiences in Budapest was an cruise with a boat in the night along the Danube. For a relatively small price you can have a cruise, with a dinner included and a guide to explain what are the buildings you see and history stories.

Beautiful River. Beautiful river. Was on a riverboat cruise with Emerald Waterways. Beautiful new ship and a great crew. Went from Budapest to Nuremberg along the Danube. Very pretty and beautiful river. Slow moving to see all the quaint towns and scenery along the river. Wine growing areas, small towns, and many river locks. Relaxing and scenic.

An Important Aspest of Budapest. The Danube running right thru the middle of Budapest makes this city special! The riverside promenade is great people watching and its Restaurants are good. But watch out for signing up for the river, some of which are not on comfortable boats or boats that are handicapped accessible.
Everything revolves around the river. The Danube is the heart of Budapest with beautiful Buda on one side and Pest,more city-like on the opposite side

Try the Riverboat Tour on the Danube in Budapest. What an impressive sight! The history on both sides (Buda and Pest) sides is astounding. This is one of the best place to take some amazing pictures. There are Riverboats everywhere. The water traffic is impressive.
We took the tour (1 hr) which includes a drink.
Enjoy the trip and it's only ($16.50 euros) per person.
The blue and adventurous Duna. The Duna in Budapest is really pretty and appears as the real landmark in the city. The banks are not fully walkable but it gives you a real nice time.
Night Cruise Danube. Your trip is NOT complete without a night cruise for an hour and a half. do the one with drinks only then have a dinner in one of the many restaurants right on the bank!
Wonderful. The Danube Bend tour was very informative, nice progrwm at our visit. Great cathedrale esztergom, breathtaking panoramic view in Visegrad! M&R C
Essential part of Budapest. The entire city is centered around this river. It makes for a beautiful city and lots to see along the Danube.
Boat ride on the Danube. Had a great time on the boat, enjoying the scenery of Buda and Pest sides of the city. It's a great way to understand the layout of the city.
Lovely Budapest. Did two boat trips very relaxing taking in all the buildings guide very knowledgeable. Had an amazing time

Beautiful Danube. Hey!
If you are planning for Budapest visit make sure you also book one of those Danube cruises. I would recomend you also take at least 1h walk tour near Danube coast.

Viking Danube Cruise was Disappointing. We took a VIking Danube cruise from Budapest to Nuremburg in August 2015. The boats are only two years old and are very nice. We had a good time and enjoyed the locks and the Danube, however...We paid for an upgrade to have a balcony. Do not spend the money for this. Viking double parks the boats so you are about a foot away from the stateroom of another Viking boat. You can't even open your curtains if you want privacy, let alone use your balcony. Our balcony view was of the ship adjacent to us when we were in port (or of the people in the room in the next boat).Also, we don't like bus tours and thought we would see more from a river cruise, be able to get off in tiny vinyard towns, etc. (We believed those ads on TV). But, the Viking cruise is actually a series of bus tours, you just get to sleep on the boat at night. Unfortunately we were there during an incredible heat wave - we were left in towns with 2-3 hours to spend and no ability to go back to the boat to get out of 100 degree plus temperatures. In every town the guides said, "Get a coffee". In one town we sat in a church for two hours because it was dark and cool and there were no other options. The heat wave was not Viking's fault, but they did nothing to help.Our other problem was that we were told that the Danube was too low for our boat to make it through. We had to pack all of our luggage and be bused all day to the next port where we boarded a different VIking ship. The crew handled the luggage transfer, etc. well, but it still was not what we planned. We did not plan on having to pack up and move, nor did we want an all day bus ride. And we question whether it was necessary because we met passengers from other boats or cruise lines who had sailed the part of the river that we were supposedly unable to travel. It may have been simplythat there were too many boats for the locks and they told us the river was too low.The first boat we were on, the Jarl, had a wonderful crew. The second boat, the Atla, had a rude and cranky crew. It felt like we had changed cruise lines entirely, not just changed boats. We don't know what that was about, but the final crew experience was very negative. Also, we had paid for the "Silver" package for upgraded alcoholic beverages. It became unnecessary on the Atla because they were providing free drinks to make up for the boat change - but they would not refund that portion of the "Silver" servcie to us, so we paid for our free drinks.At the end, we had paid for the Prague extension. We had to have our bags out at 6:00 where they sat in the rain uncovered until our 7:30 departure. There were two problems with this. First, the luggage was drenched and as we departed the crew was setting up a tent to cover the baggage of arriving passengers. It felt like they were done with us so our luggage did not matter. Second, we were bused to Prague where we arrived hours before we could check in to our hotel rooms. Viking obviously knew this was the case but did nothing to allow us to leave later, stop and see something along the way, etc. They provided a brief walking tour of Prague upon arrival, but we were all carrying our carryon bags with valuables and there was no provision for storing those securely. Plus, they had one guide and over 60 people.So, nice boat, nice fellow travelers, good service on one of the boats - but we will never take another Viking River Cruise.
The most beautiful riversides!. Amazing river with the most beautiful riversides I have ever seen. I do recommend enjoying the sunset by this river. It's something very nostalgic and different.

The "Blue Danube". Don't really know where the term "Blue" originated, personally I've never seen it blue. Maybe it's like the Kentucky Blue Grass - those that see it see blue.
It's obviously a major river in Europe originating in the Black Forest. Many islands in the river, one of the best is Margaret Island - a recommended visit.

ABSOLUTELY SUPERB. My wife and I travelled with this most excellent company aboard The Freya from August 15th to the 22nd. from Nuremberg to Budapest. From first contact with Silvia our booking agent, the cruise itself, and finally discussions with Mr. Martin in customer relations, the service was ABSOLUTELY SUPERB. I am in my 71st year and have travelled to many parts of the World always staying at 4 and 5 star hotels and have NEVER repeat NEVER come across such a first rate, friendly, good humoured and proficient team as those on board The Freya. The guests' needs are the absolute top priority. Cabin accomodation is of the highest standard and the food five star.The scenery is absolutely lovely and Budapest at night is like something from a fairytale.Unfortunately the ship developed a fault during our cruise and had to spend a day in dry dock added to which several coach journeys became necessary, but Viking did all they could to make sure guests suffered as little inconvenience as possible at the time and on our return offered the most generous compensation. All in all a holiday for the most discerning holidaymaker.....we have already booked again for the South of France next August.....THANKYOU SO MUCH to Viking...a company who care.

What a thrill to walk over the famous Danube!. My husband and I enjoyed walking along both sides of the river as well as across it. We even took a boat tour in the evening. What a thrill to see the beautiful buildings lit up along the river!
Dinner cruise and piano. We travelled the Danube on a 3 hour dinner cruise with piano accompaniment and seeing the sights of Budapest from the river in the evening is an amazing sight.

Boat ride up the Danube. Great ride and saw all the lovely buildings and architecture, took about an hour but well worth the money ( used hop on hop off ticket) 2 boat trips included in the price Great commentary and very informative
Wonderful in the evening. Take an evening trip, it's wonderful.Budapest, the beautiful city is wonderful in the dark with all the lights.

Sunset boat trip. Sat on top deck with a small band of local musicians and watched the sunset over the palace. Warm evening with pleasant breeze. Glass of wine x2 included. Watched the sunset transition into night lights fabulous

Avalon Panorama - Amsterdam to Budapest. If your looking to do a river cruise then this is probably the pinnacle. Avalon were outstanding from the booking process to every little detail on our voyage. The ship itself is simply luxurious, the staff exemplary, same for the captain and the cruise director. The food and wine were of the highest (5 star) quality. The range of included and optional tours just coulndn't not be bettered. This is an expensive cruise, but worth every penny. Our mix were Americans, Canadians, Ausies, Kiwi's and last (and least) half a dozen Brits. I could write so much more but this really is a holiday that needs to be taken to fully appreciate how well Avalon do.
The night lights of Budapest. The dinner cruise starts at just before sunset and it only gets better with the lights on the buildings. Stunning.

Viking River Cruise - Nuremberg to Budapest. The ads on NPR finally got to us and we booked a vacation on the Viking "Tor" from Nuremberg to Budapest. One of the best vacations we've had yet; with some caveats. Some advice: Don't book the costly state rooms with balconies (we didn't and were glad) for several reasons: you are not going to hang out in the room, the view is often blocked by double parked boats and when you go through a lock (27) you are not going to like being on the balcony. Save your money for shopping instead. The tours - both extra and included are worth it. Nearly all of our guides were smart, educated people with enthusiasm for their cities and sites. We especially loved Regensburg, a quaint medieval town and of course Vienna and Budapest. I wish we had booked for extra time in Budapest because a day and a half just does not cut it for this lovely and interesting city. Same with Vienna - do some homework ahead of time and pick places you want to see because time is limited.The food on board was fantastic - really fresh with salads available at every meal. Wine flows freely; the staff are spectacular and professional.Had a great time all in all. Worth it.
Danube at night. Book a trip at night to enjoy the lights of the City the look beautiful reflected on the water you can have this included with your hop on hop off bus tours.

Amazing Danube. I learnt about Danube and also heard people talked but that the Danube is so amazingly beautiful, I did not imagine. The promenade, the paths along the bank, the river cruise in the evening with the road lights on, Parliament and other building lights of different color ON, is an experience which is difficult to get any other place. My experience of Budapest had been fantastic due to the Danube.Ideal for all types of photoshoot.

Blue Danube Delight !!!. Take a cruise along the wonderful Danube River and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Sail along and see the historical old buildings and the vastness of the Danube River in itself.You can choose a cruise where lunch is provided or just sail along for an hours trip, it is up to ones choosing. This is a must to do while visiting beautiful Budapest.

NIghttime beauty. We have traveled a lot but our boat cruise at night on the Danube looking at the beaty of this city all lit up was breathtaking! An added bonus was the full moon that night. Will never forget this night!

Best do two boat trips - one by day and one by night.. We got a "free" 1 hour three stop boat trip as part of our Hop on Hop Off Bus Package and also booked a separate night time candlelit gourmet dinner 2.5 hour trip. The later cost about £40 with drinks live music and a good quality four course meal. Both were good and the Danube truly is beautiful - and blue. The night time trip was the best as all the landmarks are beautifully illuminated and the jewel in the crown is the spectacular Parliament building. Highly recommended the Danube is why most people come here and I would love to explore beyond Budapest next time we visit.

Budapest to Amsterdam River Cruise with Travelmarvel. Doing the Danube and Rhine rivers on the APT Travelmarvel was an experience not to be missed. It was 14 days of history & geography rolled into one while enjoying nightly entertainment sourced from local villages along the way. Each day was a new excursion and the weather perfect although a little on the warm side for some.Our cabin (332) was great as were the meals and all staff. Our Cruise Director was exceptional.

Lunch & Cruise is the way to go around the Danube - Drinks included -. This was one of our highlights of our trip to Budapest.
