There are multiple options when it comes to tours in the Danube, for some reason I didn't find reviews for the company that provides it, as it also has dinner and other things. But you can see the links in the bottom to make the reservation. Bottom line, they were very professional, the food buffet was very delicious, so was the wine. All these, at an affordable price. We went as a family, but it can also be a romantic tour. http://www.budapest.com/leisure/sightseeing_tours/boat_tours/lunch_and_cruise.en.htmlhttp://www.viator.com/tours/Budapest/Danube-River-Lunch-Cruise/d499-5808LUNCH

Relaxing boat trip.. We had a pleasant river trip on the Danube which started and finished just near the chain Bridge. It's a nice relaxing way to spend a couple of hours and it enables you to view things from a different perspective.

Disappointing Accomodation Danube Viking River Cruise. Spent a fortune expecting a stateroom with a view only to find on arrival a cabin below deck with virtually no view and being on the port side of the ship every time we docked we looked out on to a stone or metal wall and had virtually no natural light. This made our accommodation claustrophobic. Stateroom was definitely a misleading description.However on the plus side the staff were very pleasant and efficient. The food was well prepared and well presented.The onshore excursions from Budapest to Bucharest were reasonable given the limited time available and the areas where the ship docked. The Programme Director was enthusiastic although his pigeon English was difficult to understand at times. Tour guides were mixed in terms of quality.Insaying all the above we enjoyed our holiday but it definitely wasn't worth the money.

Viking River Cruise. Have just returned from a Viking River Cruise on the Danube from Nuremberg to Budapest. We had a lovely time, made new friends, ate and drank extremely well, saw some fabulous sights and enjoyed many interesting tours but... I am not normally nit-picky by nature but would have to say that at times our cruise felt more like a bus tour with overnight stops in lay-bys. There was a bus from the canal at Nuremberg into the city centre, a bus from Regensburg to Bach because the ship had to move on while we were touring the city and a bus from Vienna to Budapest. Moreover, the practice of double parking meant that the view from our stateroom often extended no further than a stateroom of the ship that had moored alongside, which must have been really irritating for those who had shelled out serious money for balconies. Double parking no doubt means that Viking River Cruises can have more ships on the Danube at any one time but it doesn't exactly make your average punter rush to book another cruise. And I still don't fully understand why it was necessary to bus us from Vienna to Budapest. I accept that the Danube was low and that a bridge was being repaired in Bratislava but this doesn't fully explain why the Viking Jarl was to be found moored by the Chain Bridge only 24 hours later (there had been no new rain).Having said all that I would like to award 5 stars to the staff and the crew who invariably went the extra mile to make our cruise as enjoyable as possible (which it was). The WW2 tour in Nuremberg is an absolute must. We enjoyed medieval Regensburg, a UNESCO world heritage site. The stop at Passau was perfect because we were able to walk off the ship and straight into the town. The baroque splendour of Melk Abbey has to be seen to be believed. The stretch of the Danube between Melk and Vienna is quite wonderful. I would strongly recommend Cafe Sacher in Vienna for lunch, followed by the Batliner exhibition in the Albertina and the optional opera evening (we saw a superb 90 minute version of the Marriage of Figaro) while the waterfront at Budapest has to be the most beautiful I have ever seen.
River Tour. Crusing the river and seeing Budapest was enjoyable from "pier 10",at reasonable price,Boat was nice.

Danube Waltz Viking River Cuise. After our Elegant Elbe River Cruise on Viking was cancelled last month due to low water levels, we booked a Viking cruise on the Danube for December. This cruise has begun terribly. In order to get to Munich from Atlanta, we are having to fly to Houston, which is west of Atlanta, wait for 4 hours at that airport, and then fly for over 10 hours over Atlanta to get to Munich. This is the only flight arrangements Viking could get for us and once again. all they could do was to say us was, "I'm sorry, but that's the best we can do." I want to know why they didn't book our flights as soon as we paid them the money for this substitute cruise. There are non-stop flights from Atlanta to Munich, but Viking can't get us on one of those. And they have us coming back home on Lufthansa, which does not let us select seats prior to getting to the airport on our return flight from Frankfurt. We have to leave Budapest at 6:30 AM, and hopefully my wife and I will be able to sit together for the 10+ hour flight to Atlanta. I do not understand why we are unable to select seats before all the ones together are taken. There's one thing I can guarantee: We'll NEVER take another Viking cruise again. NEVER. Prepare yourself for disappointments if you choose Viking.
Don't miss the ferry at night . I recommend to take one of the boat at night this is one of the main attraction in Budapest. Don't miss it.

Stunning. We took an night time cruise on the Danube with a tour guide talking about all the famous landmarks along it, that are illuminated during the tour, it was stunning, even better with a couple of glass of beer included.
A great experience. This is a trip not to be missed. The danube stretches 10 countries and there are more facts like it. Highly recommended when you visit.

A must do in Budapest: night cruise in the Danube. If you visit Budapest for the first and have the time and can afford it, you must do the night cruise in the Danube. It really is a must do not to miss. You will have the oppotunity to take wonderful pictures or make great movies, don't forget to bring all the cameras you may have. You may also have dinner on the boat and assist a dance performance, but that really is the less important. The best is really to go to the highest point of the ship, manage to sit down and enjoy the view!

Highlight Of My Budapest Trip. The Danube is the second longest river originating in Germany & flowing through 10 nations in Central & Eastern Europe.The late evening/night cruise on the Danube turned out to be the highlight of my Budapest trip.On this cruise as my boat glided through some clean blue waters, i saw the most fascinating sights of the `Pearl Of Danube`centuries old historical city with beauty & grace visible every where.The water was clean & blue & the buildings on banks looked impressive & really beautiful when fully lit at night.Romantic indeed with champagne glass in hand with music playing & dinner later!

Even Julius Caesar Was Impressed. It is a pleasure to review the Danube. It gets very high marks as a river. Because both sides of its passage through Budapest are World Heritage Sites the buildings enhance its natural grandeur. But also one can not look at this river - any more than the Seine, the Thames, the Arno or even the Hudson - without falling under the spell of a history that we all learned from our youngest years to the more advanced graduate studies in almost any area - history, architecture, geography, warfare and even psychoanalysis.
cruise. did a cruise along part of the danube but disappointed, the scenery hardly varied at all became slightly boring, especially in comparison to a cruise on the rhine
Danube trip,. Great boat trip, stop off at Margaret Island, great for sightseeing and relaxing. The highlight of our stay and would do again!

Worth it at the right price. We were able to buy cruise tickets for about 8 euros a person by just going to the pier and looking for sellers.
Cruise was amazing. Everything is so much more beautiful at night. It just so happened that we took the cruise on the last night of Sziget so there were fireworks while we were on the cruise.

Night cruise. Although we were tired and exhausted by the hot summer day, the evening cruise was a great way to end our visit. The town is beautifully lighten and all the highlights of Budapest were delightful. The guide was knowledgeable and proud to present the vast picture that surrounded us.
Amazing :). Beautiful!!! I can't understand, how it is possible, that the water looks so clean and blue :) and every bridge is unique and amazing

Great city. Beautiful area at the water side of Budapest in Danube, but the restaurants there are highly overpriced and the quality of the food i can't say was the best i ever had. But an awesome place to see nevertheless.
I'm a Sucker for a River!. It's no wonder that most of Europe's Grand Cities are on rivers. Besides the great views there are tremendous walkways to stroll. Once again I'm sold!

Római Part. The Danube cuts Budapest into two part Buda at the right side and Pest at the left. In the inner districts the bank of the Danube is not easily accesible because there are lots of traffic. I love to bike along the Danube banks. It has bicycle road at both side. My favorite part is the Római part where you can go down to the water and relax with a drink after work. My favorite bar is Fellini Római.
I HAVE BEEN IN LOVE. The Danube has left me impesionada, which can not do any bad reviews. Just one thing, do not miss the boat trip and visit Margarita Island.
Stunning. The Danube River is mesmerising, especially at night when all the beautiful buildings are lit up! Visit by foot to get the best experience and absorb the amazing period architecture.

The Blue Danube is a MUST SEE!!!!. You just cannot go to Budapest and avoid seeing the Danube River!!!! It is a beautiful sight, especially at night. The cruise boats are a sight to see as well as they tour up and down the river.

Nuremberg to Budapest. Lovely part of the Danube River with lots of interesting places to stop. Regensberg, Passau, Melk, Durnstein, Vienna and Budapest. Good to be able to get off at the smaller places and explore them yourself. Trip lasted 7 days. Lovely to sit on sun deck and watch the river go by. A very relaxing holiday with fine food and drink. Interesting locks and bridges.

Best overview of Budapest. Taking the river cruise is the best way to see all bridges and most historic sites of Budapest. You can negotiate the cruise price, depending on the boat, it cost you from USD 15 to 60. It usually is an hour's ride.

Traveled with Scenic opal.. We did the Amsterdam to Budapest in July 2015 on the Scenic Opal. It started out a disaster with a main drive shaft breaking just as we were to go on board. I've always said that it is only a stuff if it is not fixed straight away. Well, it was repaired rather quickly. In the meantime we were taken to another one of their boats, The Diamond if my memory serves me correctly and wined and dined remarkably well. On the way up river we called in to many towns and cities and it would take ten thousand words to describe all that we enjoyed. I'll just pick a couple of stand outs. The Deppisch Winery was the only true five star experience of the whole trip. The presentation and entertainment was second to none. You certainly would not expect to encounter this level of food, wine and entertainment in the back blocks somewhere in Germany. These people did more to create an experience that bought every one together in a couple of hours. Check the itinerary of your suppliers and if they haven't got this place on their list, I would ask them why the hell not. O.k, so we went to the Viennese Concert at the Palais Lichtenstein. The orchestra was a stand out but unfortunately the acoustics of the room didn't lend itself to the human voice. There was just too much resonance. The vocalists sounded like they were singing with the 60's rock and roll echo. You go to so many towns and the architecture of the buildings is magnificent but the castles and the churches get a bit much. They give you a lot of free time in these towns and in some you ask yourself, why? There is so much to see and I would recommend one of these cruises. The biggest problem on the Opal we thought was the food. We thought it was reasonably ordinary. Much of the food was centered around a taste that didn't fit well with us and many of the people I spoke to. The entertainment on the boat was a bit ho hum as the one guy supplied the lot apart from the local groups that came on board. He was a brilliant musician but not speaking English there was not a great deal of entertaining done. I thought that we paid for five star and were given four.
Gorgeous at night!. You must take a river cruise at night. The hillsides and bridges are lit up and it is just gorgeous. Bring a light sweater unless it is a very warm summer night.

Great cruise. Danube river cruise was one of the best parts of our trip.We visited at the perfect time in the evening, when it was still bright enough to click good pics, but was not very hot and sunny.

Danube not blue, but very nice!. Not blue, but still pleasantly pleasing. We took a river cruise on it and it was very enjoyable. Many towns to visit along the river with shops, restaurants and people galore. Many attractions too. If you get the opportunity to travel on the dAnube and see the sights and experience the town's...do it!

The beautiful Danube. Lovely views from the river of some magnificent buildings. Best vacation ever. We did the15 day cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest. The staff, food, and rooms were excellent. All the tour guides spoke excellent English & were very knowledgeable. Our room was very comfortable & always clean. We had to change ships because of water conditions, this was done without a problem,so smooth tat we hardly knew it happened. I strongly recommend.
Very romantic night scene. So romantic and pretty in a very beautiful Budapest. Crossing the Chain Bridge at night is such an enchanting experience one should embrace.
Trip in July 2015. Take a night cruise. Good food, open buffet, good service, amazing view of Budapest. worth the last penny.
Beautiful River. Wonderful river. The center of the city-Really beautiful views of the Parliament building, chain bridge and everywhere else.

viking river cruise on danube river. Started in Romania and ended with a post trip extension in Vienna, Austria.....thrilled we took this route! Most east european countries cannot compare to the beauty of Budapest or Vienna!! So glad we ended with the best! Wonderful, history laden trip! Each country unique and interesting!

Beautiful evening cruise. I took a one hour evening boat cruise down the river with Duna Corso.
A very magical experience, beautiful night scenery.

Up the Danube with a difference. Taking a hydrofoil bus from Budapest to Vienna is worth the six hour trip. We changed from a train to the romantic danube. It is a bus ride equivalent complete with locks to negotiate but it is a pleasant trip.
Lovely cruise. Done as part of a bus tour, enjoyable end to a brilliant day relaxing. If you can go when it gets dark (unless you want to get on/off) to view all the lovely sites along the route

A different dimension.. After a bus ride the best way to get a feel of both Buda and Pest. Make use of the tickets from the buses or use the water bus either way absolutely make sure that you take a night (in the dark!) ride. The views of the city are incredible.

River boat cruise on the Danube highly recommended. We were on a cruise, on Amadeus Silver II, for 8 days and it was amazing. DANUBE RIVER CRUISES, GREAT!. We booked a 7 day Danube river cruise with Gate1. Excellent value . A night on the river of dreams . Take a night time cruise on the danube and you won't be disappointed The majestic buildings and bridges are lit. The trip includes a commentary and a free drink it is not very expensive to do the cruise and if you enjoyed Budapest by day you will love it by night don't miss out you will regret it

Amazing City. Great views from the castle overlooking the chain bridge and the city. Amazing architecture adorns the city. Must see at night from the river when the buildings are illuminated, never forgotten.
Gorgeous. Easily one of the best rivers I've seen in Europe. Whether you're walking along it or exploring it by boat, it really is beautiful.

Beautiful Budapest. Amazing experience. We had taken the Amphibus and travelled on the Danube. Our guide was a lot of fun!. The boat traveled on water and land. Budapest is a very beautiful place! We had a great time!
Just amazing . Budapest is probably the most underrate city in Europe. I think it's one of the most beautiful cities in the world especially at night. The river cruise is a most when in Budapest.

The best of the Euro experiences!. Budapest is for always one of the best cities every traveler should see in Europe, with an amazing architecture and unforgettable scenarios; don't forget to extend the city tour walking thru the river!

The blue Danube. This river flows through 10 countries. Budapest is the largest city located on it's banks. It is the best too, presenting the most beautiful view on both sides. Danube has seen many centuries of bloodshed, development, growth, misery, rise and fall of civilizations on it's shores. By the time Johann Strauss composed "The Blue Danube" the river was full of pollution and not blue at all. So the composer was questioned about his composition. His response to this was, "Have a glass of wine and look at the river and you will see how blue it is." People were very impressed. Later on Strauss commented, " Have several more glasses and you can see any color in the river."
Enjoyed it!. Very scenic and enjoy some Hungarian stew, music, and watch some brave people do a little dancing. Very nice time.
Incredible Views. Incredible views of the beautiful buildings that line the riverbanks in Budapest.I unfortunately didn't get an opportunity to travel by boat but I think it's a must!

Beautiful Danube. You can't come to Budapest and not see the Danube. It divides the city and is a great vantage point for seeing the beautiful buildings that line the river. The best way to experience it is to cruise along it, but also good is to just walk along the banks.
Awesome. It's amaizing! I think the most beautiful river-in-city. The bridges are awesome, the Castle is nice. If You want to see the most beautiful city in Europe, You must visit Budapst.
Spectacular at night. Our guide recommended a nighttime cruise . It was one of the best things we did in Budapest. I'm sure the day cruises are nice but the lights at night are magical.

Avoid the River Lunch Cruise. Views of Buda and Pest are the most beautiful and impressive!!! Just take the cruise. The lunch servers were nice but this is not worth the meal you get, nor the tour. Buda and Pest unusual view from the River. The boat will take you to the end of the island and bring you back on the other side of the Island later on.We stayed 4 hrs on the island It is the minimum stay to make the most of it if you will not make use of the pools.An experience not to miss..Wonderful views from Buda and from Pest and you clearly will see where the oldcity finishes and modern new construction begins.Amazingly the contrast is clear and non aggressive ,

On and around Danube in Buda and Pest. It has been a fascinating memory even nine months after my stay in Budapest in November 2014. It was a long weekend and those days I was teaching in AGH University in Cracow, Poland as a Visiting Professor. One of my students suggested me for this trip to Budapest on the banks of river Danube.Buda and Pest are the two twin cities on the two sides of the river. Like most of the tourists, I stayed in Pest in a Youth Hostel in the downtown. However, I spent a good share of my time in those two days in boats on the river. There are different companies who conduct boat cruises on the river. One can choose between cruises on upstream and downstream the river. Some of the tourist Bus companies conducting bus trips in routes covering old monuments of Budapest include a free pass for boat trips or you can buy those separately from the Jetty. I had one of the most memorable Hot Red Wines on one of those boats on the river.

A memorable ride on the Danube. It is pleasant to walk along the Danube but you can also take the inexpensive city shuttle boat which is used by the locals. He is stopping at numerous place along the city and you can spent hours going along the Danube.

Beautiful Danube Cruise. We sailed on Emerald Dawn down the Danube with Emerald Waterways. We booked cabin 332 with picture window which could open. Cabins quite spacious and the whole boat was absolutely spotless. Food was good although breakfast and lunch were buffets which at the beginning were quite busy. Dinner was a sit down. Entertainment was brilliant and free bus tours included round various ports. Hubby and I attended the Viennese concert which was fantastic. The staff went out of their way to satisfy everyone. All in all a very good value for money river cruise.

MUST visit attractions. A trip along the Danude on a boat is a must in order to appreciate the beauty of the City of Budapest. Great photo opportunities of historic buildings and enjoyment on the river.

So chill. Never a dull moment here. What a beautiful way to spend some time. Wondering and people watching. Get a party boat/ night cruise. Worth the time to see the city lit up. Nice to relax on a boat during the day with a meal. I was here for the red bull air races, spectacular event with tons of excitement.

Excellent tour. I had an amazing time. I had my tour around 9pm was a perfect timing. I need to ensure my friends and I arrive early and start queuing so I could get the best spot. I love it and has changed my impression on the Budapest. I had a lot of tourists with us.
sail the Danube at night. Sailing the danube at night is a must. Budapest seems to be designed to be appriciated from the Danub. It is spectacular by day an brilliant by night.

It may not be blue but it's beautiful!. We spent 5 days in Budapest and a considerable amount of it was at various places near the river. We climbed Castle Hill and looked over the fortress walls down on the river where the views were amazing. Margaret's Island was up a little from where we were, a park for pedestrians and bicyclists. This is truly Nature's relief from the bustle of the city on either side of the river. Across, on the Pest side, was the dramatic house of Parliament. There is the river itself, of course, with the boat traffic that always is of interest. We didn't have time to take a boat ride (There is so much to see and do in Budapest that even 5 days weren't enough to do all that we wanted to.). I recommend taking a boat ride if you can fit it in because the views of both banks from the river would be breathtaking. Budapest is a city of grand architecture and the Danube enhances the scene as it winds along its beautiful course.
To work by ship. Take the ship public transit down the river it's a slow way to enjoy the city. You can get off on either side of the river and enjoy the city ambiance. Inexpensive and interesting.
they say blue danube more green, beautiful scenery. stunning river with the 3 bridges, lovely at night. safe to cross as pedestrians got their own walkway, good for kids and photo stops

Viking Danube River Cruise July 2015 - Budapest to Nuremburg. This review is to try to give potential travellers an insight into cruising on the river Danube about things we were not aware of before we left. I am not going to give any negative comments because we enjoyed the holiday very much.Firstly, two days before we departed we were informed that we would not be going on the named long ship 'Tor' but on the 'Var' which is a sister ship and absolutely identical to the Tor. The reason for this eventually became clear when after about three days we were asked to pack our cases to transfer to the Tor by coach because the Var could not continue. This was due to the lack of water in the river, and I suspect this happens most summers. This manoeuvre went very smoothly and we did not 'miss out' on anything. Of course, we missed lunch on board but we had a nice meal in a German restaurant instead. The only thing we missed was the scenery along the river, but we had scenery on land instead, ending up in Regensberg, a lovely place. The inconvenience of packing your case mid-week was a bit of a pain and a surprise, my only concern was that Viking obviously knew about this but did not let us know before we left home. I suppose it was to prevent people cancelling.Another thing we did not realise is that we had to go through numerous locks along the river. Whilst this was not a problem, the high walls of the locks blocked out the light in the daytime, sometimes when we were eating. The rails on the top deck were taken down for part of the journey to enable the vessel to get under low bridges, so we were deprived of the sun except for a small area at the front on deck two.All in all, I cannot fault Viking for food and service and the Bavarian themed night was exceptionally good. The cruise was most enjoyable and the places we visited and guides were exceptionally good. I estimated that 80% of passengers were from the USA and 20% from the UK with about 180 people approximately on board plus staff.The coach trip from Nuremberg took about two hours to Munich Airport at the end of the cruise.Well done Viking.
Danube at Dusk. The Danube evening river cruise is what we recommend - just as the light fades and the city's buildings and bridges begin to light up. We enjoyed it so much that we did it twice.

Budapest should also be seen from the river. We made use of the option to go on a Little boattrip on the Danube, through our 48-hou sightseeing ticket with the Giraf Hop on Hop off. Budapest is a quite sight to see from a boat, and try to experience it. I am sure it's even more beautiful by night, with all the beautiful lights.

Splitting The Pearl In Two. I must admit that when I first spied this waterway back in 2002, I was a bit disappointed as I had expected it to be blue- a la the music. But my disappointment soon turned to an appreciation of this as a beautiful and integral artery dividing Budapest into Buda and Pest.There are 7 bridges which span its girth in Bp, but my favorite for walking is the magnificent Chain bridge (Lanchid), followed by the Freedom Bridge (Szabadszag hid). Each afford spectacular views of the river and the myriad castles and church spires which dot the banks and skyline. A nice stroll is from the Chain Bridge to the Parliament (Pest side). Along the way. you'll pass the touching tribute of the "Shoes"- a poignant reminder that, at one time, all was not peaceful and well in this great city..A nice walk is also on offer on the Buda side which provide great views of the Pest banks and Parliament. Varkert Bazaar (Castle courtyard) is a worthwhile visit where you can grab a cup of coffee before setting out again to visit Clark Adam Tée (square( to the north where you can ride the funicular train up to the castle after enjoying a sweet treat at the Cukraszda (Took-krahss- dah, confectionary) there.There are many dining possibilities all around but for this I favor the Pest side. The boat, Spoon, offers a delightful dining experience for lunch or dinner with great views. Further south, between Erszebet hid and the Szabadszag hid is a bevy of great restaurants and cafes featuring, Greek (Dionysis Taverna), Italian (Trattoria Toscana) Japanese (Takebayashi) cuisines. I can recommend them all. There is also an Egyptian establishment in the row which I haven't tried yet.A cruise on the river is exciting and memorable. Bring your cameras! For a less expensive alternative, look at the public transportation boats on the Danube (BKK.hu)

Cant you hear the Danube Walz Playing?. Lots of opportunity for boat rides, people watching and walking along its shores. It struck me as odd that I did not see one private craft on the river, only tour boats and river patrol. Maybe that was because we went during the week?

IMPORTANT. The Danube provides an important mode of transport for leisure & commercial travel in Hungary. It divides the city of Budapest. with Buda on the West side and Pest on the East side. Daily boat tours are available from Budapest to Vienna.
Beautiful and tender .... Great to walk along the river and great to cross different bridges ... the sunset is beautiful and the boats moving is so peaceful ...
Beautiful. Had a wonderful night time cruise on this marvelous river where we had a couple of drinks whilst taking in the sights on both banks. All the buildings were lit up and it was magical.
Main river of the city. The Danube devides the capital into 2 parts. Between the Elisabeth bridge and Chain bridge on the Pest side you can have a nice walk under beautiful trees.

Girly Trip. Visited Budapest for 4 days with my friend. This place is amazing! Being Londoners we walked everywhere. The Danube is such a pretty sight specially from a high point in the city. Easy to navigate. We even took the the bus in the way back to the hotel. Great sight. Be careful when taking pictures though. There are opportunists who may want to grab your bag. Otherwise pretty safe city.

Atmospheric. Interesting by day because of the boats, it really becomes beautiful by night with all the lights reflected on it. The Chain bridge is strongly illuminated as is the Castle and Parliament, and there are lots of permanently moored boats to eat and drink on.

Danube Legend night cruise. Lovely and informative cruise on the 8.20 pm boat Danube Legend. Took us for an hour along the Danube's banks where all the buildings were illuminated in splendour. A commentary in various languages accompanied the journey and we were treated to a glass of beer or champagne included in the ticket price. Well worth doing but get there early in order to get a good seat.
Perfect for a stroll. Lovely views over the river. Very scenic at night with the lights. You can get to the edge of the river and walk along.
Do both day and night. How do you rate a river. Don't want to review just for review sake. Only comment is to do a day and a night cruise if in Budapest. Really is different

Danube Bend Tour. This is a great tour that hits three high spots for tourists. The bus leaves Budapest in the AM and heads North along the Westside of the Danube and first stops at the furthest point which is Estergom where the Basilica is located. As the church was having services, our tour guide had the bus driver take us across the river into Strovo, Slovakia where we stopped at a cafe on the river with a view of the back of the Basilica. We then went back to the Basilica where we enjoyed some amazing organ music as well as the beautiful church. We then went to Visegrad for lunch atop a mountain across from the castle. Downhill to the last and best stop in Szentendre, a lovely artist town that was bustling with people shopping the handicraft stalls. Wander the back streets and mingle with very friendly local people. End of the day we head to the boat for the relaxing trip back to Budapest. Grab an outdoor seat for the view and fresh air.
Nice. There is a nice promenade to do. It's not really romantic but it's nice to walk and discover Buda & Pest side
Beautiful view. i liked the view of the city,the palaces are splendid,the castle and churches also,made two trips, one day one night with different boat companies,absolutely amazing sightseeing

This made all 68 locks worthwhile. River cruising meant enduring 34 locks up to the Continental Divide and (what goes up must come down), the same number on the other side on the way down. Grinding and scraping our way through the locks was not the highlight of the cruise but this certainly was! We had the astoundly good fortune to have spent 2 nights cruising back and forth on the Danube, enjoying the light show the entire time. How could it possibly get any better?By far, the show stopper was the glorious Parliament Building, lit up so that I am sure it could have been seen from outer space. That building is so massive and impressive, even in the daylight, but at night ... it is a whole other experience. It takes first place in the prize category for eye candy.The bridges are pretty nice, too, and the whole experience was exciting. Many of the great monumental buildings are lit with flood lights so it seems more like a theme park than a city. It was so sophisticated, cosmopolitan, and memorable. Loved it!
Beautiful place to see in Budapest. Beautiful must see in Budapest! Take a river cruise so you can see a lot of the attractions that are along the water's edge.

The 'Blue' Danube. I took a boat trip as I felt I could not be in Budapest without sailing down the Danube. I'm glad I did. People watching is a favourite pastime, and it was fun watching people on the river banks and on the boat. I loved the passing views; mine went round St Margaret's Island and it looks really peaceful there - I'd like to check it out on my next visit. The Danube is green up close, but shines with a blue hue on a hot sunny day. It was an hour well spent. All the hop on hop off bus tour operators sell add on passes or include this in their higher priced tickets. Worth it, too.

As good as it gets. The Danube and Budapest are as good as it gets anywhere in Europe. Enjoy a stroll during the day but it's beauty really lights up during the night, best seen while on a cruise absolutely stunning it will be etched in your memory for ever.
Nothing special.. In Vienna the danube looks cleaner.. On each side there is high traffic and only few passages of the promenade are really really nice.
River trip!. Lovely leisurely tour along the Danube-able to have a good view of some of the city sights! Nice to do for a change!

I loved it. From the first moment we entered Budapest by car, I loved it. I loved the Danube. It looks like a storage of millions of stories over the centuries and tells one story with every drop it moves. What a lovely place to spend time looking at by night time.

VBT Bike Tour - Best of the Danube - was great fun. VBT Best of the Danube bike tour - began in Bratislava, Slovakia and ended in Budapest, Hungary. This bike tour was rated "easy" but there were definitely some challenges for novice riders like me. But I enjoyed the riding challenges and there was never any pressure to hurry up or catch up when I rode at a more leisurely pace or in some instances, walked my bike uphill. The tour included a wonderful variety of local, historic and cultural stops and experiences such as watching a horse show depicting the history of Hungary, a stop at a farm for a strudel making lesson, and an introduction and plenty of taste-testing of the Hungarian fruit brandy Palinka at a rural farm orchard where Palinka is made. Our VBT guides were unfailingly helpful, friendly, knowledgeable and generous with their time and guidance. I would certainly make plans with VBT again for bike trips in other locations.

The Lifeblood of Budapest. My the history witnessed by the Danube. If only the river could talk, what stories it would tell. The Danube divides Budapest into two parts: the Buda Hills and the Pest side. These two cities became one when bridges first crossed the Danube. There is tremendous history and monuments and the Castle District on the Buda side and great shops and squares and businesses on the Pest side. The best views of the city, and the Hungarian Parliament are from the river. At some point during your visit to this city, you need to take a dinner cruise aboard one of the cruise lines to truly appreciate the beauty of this city, especially at night.

Beauty and history on both side. It's worthwhile to walk along the river with beauty and history on both sides. Or you can take a one day hop-on-hop-off bus and not get off which is a fine chance to see the river at various points and to go across the chain bridge.

River cruise a must at dusk. We arrived at Budapest at 11pm by boat. WOW!!!!! The next evening we had another small cruise (on our Viking cruise ship) lasting from just before dusk until after dark.
Absolutely incredible -the city is the most beautiful sight seen from the city at night.

Lovely sights, no info on fussy return trip. We took the 10 pm evening cruise up and down the river. We chose no dinner, no music, just floating along sitting on the open top deck with our two included free drinks. Lovely, because the city is well lit up, although not in the colours some flyers show you.... It was amazing too sometimes - there were birds circling upwards on the warm air from the floodlights above the Parliament building, and feeding at the same time probably. It's a good idea to find out which sights you can expect where before you go. On the downside, on the return leg, about 20 mins before the end, it was announced that the trip would end on the other side of the river and we could go back to the starting point by relocating to smaller boats. Not what we wanted to hear close to midnight, when the metro is shutting down for the night.

Stunning Budapest. We had a free cruise on the Danube that came with our Vienna Pass. It was nice way to see both Buda and Pest from a different perspective then enjoy a wander around Margaret Island.

Take time to enjoy the view!. Walk up and down the river sides and over the many bridges on a nice day. I took the streetcar on a rainy day at the end of a long week of walking in the cold & rain... view from streetcar was the best. Buy a one day unlimited pass.

Breathtaking. One of the most amazing views you would have of both Buda & Pest are during an evening Cruise in the Danube. The architecture and magnificent lightning gives everything a spark of magic. The illuminated panoramic views, the historic touch of the surrounding buildings and the bridges you get to pass through.We fell in love with the city right there and then. In the tour you get the pass though one of UNESCO World Heritage sites viewing the Buda Castle & Fishermans Bastion in castle district, the Parliament, the Statue of Liberty on the Gellert Hill, the Gresham Palace (Fours Seasons Hotel) and St Stephens Basilica.
Cool and stunning. A monster river which divides the city of Budapest. Excellent boat rides and boat restaurants on the river itself. Stunning view once there.
Spine of Budapest. Along the Danube is the best part of Budapest. Promenade on the Pest side more beautiful and full of activity too.

Beautiful, scenic walk or drive. The Danube in Budapest is much more blue than the same Danube in Vienna (go figure). The views are spectacular. We took a motor boat up past Margaret Island, but found that walking along the bridges was much more scenic.
Even looked blue from our aeroplane!. Great river with many boat trips available. Some include food, some drinks etc. Make sure you know what you are paying for. Visit Margaret Island if you can.

River Boating. River Boating on the Daube or any river is an experience not to be missed. Max capacity on a boat is approx. 135 which allows you to meet ALL of the passengers and in many cases form life long relationships. The experience of cruising the Danube at a most leisurely pace can not be adequately described in 100 words. Try it, you'll love it.

Must take a night cruise on the Danube!!. At night the river is magical with all the sparkling lights. The best views are from a boat on the river. There are lots of options from dinner cruises, to pizza and bear cruises, to just a plain cruise without even a drink.

WONDERFUL. Definately take the cruise, it is fantastic. You see a completely different view of all the wonderful buildings. I could only do the day tour but would have loved to do the night tour as well.

Charming River Danube adding life to Budapest. The highlight of our visit to Budapest was clearly the lovely cruise on the river Danube during the evening hours. The sight of the Pest Hills with its panoramic views and the wonderful historic buildings that boast valuable architecture provide an unending feast to the eyes. You get the view of the bridges of. Budapest in close quarters as you glide below them. The cruise on river Danube in Budapest is an experience that must not be missed.

Viking River Cruise. We took a 7 night Viking River Cruise on the Danube from Hungary to Nuremberg, Germany. This was probably the best vacation we ever had. Certainly not restful mind you. Lots to see at every stop. The ship was great het staff on the ship great, food very good. All in all A++. The trip is not cheap but it was worth it.

Has to be seen at night!. This was the absolute highlight of our river cruise this summer. You cannot appreciate how beautiful Budapest is until you come into it at night in the center of the river. All of the bridges and buildings and statues are completely lit up and it is nothing short of spectacular. If you cannot get on a boat, walk over to one of the bridges. My son and I went to the liberty bridge and just hung out and took photos of the water and the sights. They even shoot fireworks over the river at night so you get a terrific view of everything.

A great way to arrive in the city. I was fortunate enough to travel to the city from Vienna in a small boat. The voyage down from Bratislava was fairly uneventful without the stunning scenery that I had hoped for. However, as you get close to the city all that changes. The Castle and Fishermans Bastion high on the hill on your right. The parliament building on your left and sailing under The Chain Bridge. Unfortunately, I did not get the chance to do an evening sail tour to see the buildings lit up at night, but I hear it is well worth doing.
Must take the cruise.. loved the day boat ride and the dinner cruise was unforgettable...good food, excellent service, the river is full of life with boats and beautiful buildings

The jewel of budapest. The danube is an irresistible attraction especially at night with the szeneyi bridge, parliament, fishermans cave and other bridges brightly lit. Do go on a cruise to absorb its beauty.

Busy yet relaxing. Excellent, but not blue! Between the scenery, historic buildings and the variety of river boats, the Danube is a river worth seeing whether from up on a hill on standing in the middle of one of the bridges.

Beautiful river flowing through the center of Budapest. We found the portion of the Danube flowing through the center of Budapest to be spectacular with many of Budapest's major buildings flanking the river.
We feel it is best seen on boat tours - one during daylight hours and one during the night.

Blue Danube??. we were on the boat twice once during the day and once at night .Going at night up and down the lights of the castles and other building change colors.It is georgous well worth the money you pay for it as it includes dinner.On the day cruise the food also wonderful BUT didn't see the Blue that the Danube is to be a little disappointed but still was great
Beutiful Blue Danube. The river is beautiful and a stroll along the Danube especially walking toward the Parliament is extremely relaxing and pleasant. Cruises are available on the river also.

Stunning at night!. You can walk along the Danube and there are some great sights to see, but it is really amazing when the sun goes down and all the large buildings and the chain bridge are lit up, its possibly the most beautiful city to view at night along the Danube!
For a relaxing day. Excellent place to stroll on the Danube Promenade, especially in the afternoon when the light is good for spectacular photos. Don't miss it even in the night.

A Must to Do. We were there last year and after a planned stay of two days decided to stay another two days as so much to do. A Must is a Night cruise as the city is fantastic from the river and suggest a dinner cruise. The Danube itself just is history as it is mentioned or drawn on cave walls since early man. There are drawing in nearby caves so this area drew people from the first days with its location

Definitely blue on a sunny day. On either bank there are superb buildings as you amble along the side of the Danube through Budapest. The river is busy with cruise ships and barges and each bridge you come to is different from the previous one. Enjoyable way to spend a few hours, just looking as you walk.

The Danube by Night. The river tour by boat is a typical tourist experience which provides beautiful views of Buda- and -Pest. Options include a dinner and cruise (avoid this option for sure!) or a cruise which includes two drinks. This option was a hour and a half and seemed about 40 minutes too long. Even so, the views of many of the historic building lite up at night made this tourist trap enjoyable.

Cruise the Danube by night in Budapest. We cruised around the Danube up and down and saw all the sights by night. It was really a lovely sight--two beautiful bridges, dramatically lit buildings, other ships, twilight...

You can"t miss this anyways. You anyways can't miss the Danube if you are in Budapest. The river that divides the city in to two parts Buda and Pest gives the city an unique view. It a pleasure to take a walk along the river in the evening and admire the lighting on many bridges over it
Loved the River. We walked along the Danube every day! Beautiful to see in the evening as all bridges are lit up. Many spend evenings sitting along the river. Lots of boats to watch as well!

A great way to relax and enjoy the scenery.. We have done several ocean cruises but never on a river. This was our first. We felt at home straight away it was just like being on the bigger ocean ships just smaller. Rather than the usual 1000+ passengers there were just 160! The staff were superb. They came from all over Europe, Poland Romania, Hungary etc. but all spoke excellent English

Beautiful City. This ranks as one of the top European places the river setting of Budapest and Pest have so many beautiful buildings which are even better when lit up at night. It's worth visiting the shoe memorial won the bank near the Parliament buildings
Enjoyable. Danube river sounds romantic and the river cruise offers more than that. Perfect view of the city and bridges. A most relaxing way of viewing the city. It's not expensive after all.
What a mighty River. While the Danube is not blue it is still an imressive river that is a vital link across many countries. The buildings that line the river add to its beauty.

Must do a river cruise. We did a river cruise down the Danube and it was fantastic. You see all the major attractions of Budapest, and the many impressive bridges along the picturesque banks of the river. We did a night cruise which departs at 10pm, and seeing the beautiful city lit up was amazing.
Nice in summer. Amazing views of the river that dominates the centre of Budapest, it was nice strolling along it in the sun,and crossing the old bridge into the city centre,

Europe's Great River. The Danube is one of the great rivers and Europe and its no doubt what made Budapest, Budapest! You get some lovely views of the city and the omnipresent Parliament Building from the river. Try a dinner river cruise. You won't be disappointed. We booked with Legenda and the experience was great.

Avalon. Danube river cruise. This was our first river cruise.We went in June 2015. it was fantastic could not fault it in anyway .We normally do the larger ships. This cruise was very calm and relaxing and very smooth on the water food was excellent and it was very nice to have good quality wine with the main meals. We flew into Gatwick from Sweden and the next day we were picked up on time by a chauffeur driven Mercedes from our hotel at Gatwick and taken to Heathrow for our flight and the same on our return. everything went so easy. We highly recommend Avalon you won't regret it.

Sound of Music Danube River Cruise. Never dreamed I would take a cruise like this one day. The boat was an intimate little floating hotel. Never felt like I was water. The crew and passengers were friendly and happy. The food was great and it was nice to have free wine and beer at dinner. It was great to just walk off the boat and take a short walk into the little towns. I would highly recommend the side trip to Salzburg Austria.

Beautiful Danube. We took a short cruise from Vienna to Budapest on Avalon via Melk, Durnstein and Bratislave. Beautiful scenes along the way and fell in love with it more after our stay in Budapest. Our hotel room gave us a perfect river view day and night. Though the Danube isn't Blue but Green, it is believed the person who wrote Blue Danube may have been downcast and feeling Blue, or in German, Blau when the song was written. Or maybe, the Irish turned it Green after St Patrick's Day bash upstream?

Cruising the Danube. We did a 7 day cruise on the Danube from Budapest, through Slovakia, then Austria, into Germany Regensburg and Nuremberg, and then by bus to Prague for three days. Each stop, with day excursions was delightful. Avalon cruise line was wonderful with excellent service and great food. My wife is vegetarian and they went out of their way to please her.

Loved this area!. I didn't do a Danube cruise, due to money and time- and I really wish I had- but walking along this river, looking at all the buildings, and getting a No2 tram all along the riverside area was just as amazing- and it's free!! No matter what time of the day, the Danube in Budapest looks amazing, especially when you're looking right across at the city from the other side! Buda from Pest, and Pest from Buda, look just as stunning either way, and while it would look magical at night, all lit up, it looked just as amazing in the day, with a clear view of all the buildings, and the river activity. And it is also in such a busy, lively, convenient area, so it's easy to get to no matter where in Budapest you're staying!

Service sets this company apart!. This was our first river cruise after having taken numerous "big ship" cruises. I will never go back to those big ships again. 146 passengers made this joy where you could actually meet people from all over ... all English speaking, however! But the biggest plus for us was the attentive staff, especially the waiters and our Maitre'D, Alin Prioteasa. A handsome young man with a wonderful sense of humor and the ability to make everyone feel that we were his personal favorites!As a young woman who was on the cruise to evaluate the excursions and guides told us ... "AmaWaterways does not want to be the biggest. We want to be the best with staff that cares about our passengers and excursions that offer experiences off the "beaten path"."The food was superb with sensible portions that kept our weight gain to a minimum. We especially enjoyed the Chef's Table Restaurant ... make your reservations early on in the cruise to be sure to get in!At the top of our list of favorites is Ornulf Johannessen, our cruise director. He was helpful, thorough and best of all, funny. If you are lucky enough to be on a cruise with him, you will really enjoy it!

beautifull river. Danube seems to be ordinary river but its strands are really beautifull. In Budapest, under the river there are the most characteristic and lovely buildings (e.g. The Parliament, Chain Bridge, Buda Castle). Moreover, Margaret Island is located in midstraem. Really worth to see, especially in the evening - it's simply charming!
Lovely. The Danube was not blue here, but we loved it just the same. A wonderful option is to walk along next to the water for sightseeing, people watching and to enjoy the day.

Beautiful river, magnificent city. A cruise on Danube is a must in Budapest. That too preferably in night when all the buildings are lighted.I recommend this tour as almost all major attractions can be seen in one go.The way city has been developed on banks of Danube is worth noticing.

Enjoyed my stay in Budapest. The Danube.... It was late winter and very cold. Beautiful to see. Very happy there. We walked across the bridges, took buses and cabs. It very easy to get around this area.

Tantalizing Danube River in Budapest. The Danube River in Budapest is unlike any other part of the Danube River elsewhere. It neatly separates the Buda side and the Pest side of Budapest. Some of the landmarks on the Pest side are the Danube Promenade, St. Stephens Basilica, the Hungarian Parliament. On the Buda side are the Buda Castle, St. Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion, and many others. There are several bridges that connect the Buda side and the Pest side. Among them are the Chain Bridge, Elizabeth bridge, Liberty bridge, and Margaret bridge. Along the Danube is the Shoe Memorial. The boat traffic along the Danube are made up of river cruise ships, harbour cruise boats, barges, and other kinds of aquatic vessels. Watching the ships go by the Danube is a very exhilarating experience.

One of the World's Great Rivers. We loved everything about the Danube. It was a pleasure to look at and a joy to cruise on. Try to find a spot high above the bend and view the beautiful river from that vantage point.
River Cruise. Viking River Cruise - wonderful trip on Danube and would recommend the extended stay in the Budapest Marriott - great views over the Danube

Beautiful River to Cruise. This is a not to miss area to visit for a river cruise. We went from Budapest to Prague (We bussed to Prague). You visit some beautiful towns and get to experience the Europe of old as well as seeing how the former Communist countries have recovered.

Romantic cruise!. You can not visit Budapest and not have a cruise in Danube. This is a must and recommended from my side.There are many companies that have boats that organizing cruises. You can choice from cruise at night or at day or you can choice to have dinner/lunch on board or just a drink. We arranged a cruise at 11:00 am and can say that was fantastic. Big plus is that you can have audio guide in many languages and learn the history of each building you can see. If you have the time the boats are making a stop to Margarita Island, you can depart boat have a walk in the Island and then embark again the next boat for returning back to Pest.Even if we had the cruise in the morning believe it will be even better if you have it at night with the lights of the city giving a better atmosphere.

You must cruise at night. Due to a minor problem our Avalon Cruise got away at night instaed of afternoon and we're glad it did. The view across the river to the brilliantly lit up buildings and the sounds of the city with various music venues as we passed was hard to beat. Having done it by accident as it were we can only recommend that visitors make a point of organising a local cruise after dark.

Unforgettable evening. We were 4 couples who toured Europe on July 2015. We were very impressed when we took a river cruise one evening ( Viking River cruise) we had dinner on the boat when the boat moved along the riversides. The food was so so. But we were amazed with the views on the banks. Several beautiful buildings,bridges,parliament,monument,market etc with glasses of champagne in our hands and a musical band who browsed around the boat. That night was unforgettable.

Don't MissIt.. Danube river cruise is a must experience. You get to see areas that you can't reach by driving and the scenery along the river is just breath taking. Best to do it in late afternoon. So you get to see it when all the lights are on.It's cheaper to by it yourself in local hotels or travel agents. If you visit other sites some of your tickets might include 20% or 25% discount for your next one.

Not so Blue, but a Beautiful River in a Magnificent City. Truly the center of this city. The Danube is a working river as well as a river one can spend hours walking along. The danube also provides a wonderful platform for viewing both sides of Budapest, especially at night with the city in light. Be sure to walk at least tow or three of the great bridges over the Danube in Budapest, we particularly liked the Chain Bridge. However, the Erzebet and Margit Bridges also provide excellent views of the city and the river. If you do journey on the Margit, make sure to stroll on Margit Island too.

Nuremburg to Budapest. The crew of the Viking Gullveig kept a very clean ship and fed us very well on our 7-day cruise on the Danube. The wait staff in the restaurant was very attentive, our basic-level stateroom did not feel at all cramped, and every part of the ship was well-appointed and comfortable, but this segment was the least favorite of our 2.5-week Europe vacation. Much of the journey was spent going through locks and scenery no better than along the Ohio River in the U.S. There was one half-day of truly gorgeous views passing through the Wachau Valley, and there was supposed to have been a night cruise through Budapest that would have been lovely but was cancelled. The official word was that bad weather prohibited "all but essential river traffic" that night, but while we were docked, there must have been at least fifty sightseeing boats passing us by on the river. The actual reason may have had more to do with the Viking exec visiting the captain and senior staff that night than the heavy storm which passed through a couple hours earlier. Maybe he wanted to get back to his luxury hotel in Budapest.Some of the optional excursions were disappointing, and when we cancelled one we had previously booked, we caught a little "attitude" from the staff. Toward the end of the cruise, we opted out of the included excursions as well, preferring to sightsee on our own. I think we are about 10 years younger than the Viking target demographic, and we would have preferred a little more activity. It was still a very pleasurable trip, and I am glad we did it, but I doubt that we will do another Viking cruise in the next decade.

Take a cruise. We've made a Cruise from 'Budapest danube cruises' - look it up. It told us a little about the interaction between Pest and Buda, Also it had a very nice stop on the Margaret island which is not only beautiful but very interesting. There was an audio-guide in many languages.

Beautiful river. This was a most beautiful and tranquil river. It was nice to walk along the side of the river from both sides. It is tranquil and very enjoyable. I did think the Danube River and Dinner Cruise we took was a little over rated though. You could get beautiful photos just walking.
very enigmatic. full of life and the serenity of the castles on the other side. I went during the Air show. I dislike nothing. all was ok.
Danube Budabest. The Danube is a relaxing place to walk along. The scenery is spectacular! You can stop at any of the restaurants to have a nice meal or coffee with a great view. Very relaxing.

The Danube. Visited Budapest and crossed the Danube numerous times. The bridges are so cool looking that we even walked across the Chain Bridge just to enjoy to views. River was clean with junk or soap suds in it despite there being many River Cruise Boats tied up on the banks.
Not blue. Not blue! But great history lessons as we cruised. It is a great way to see the historical main means of development and transportation.
Danube night cruise. Night Cruise on Danube is a memorable experience during the stay in Budapest. It showcases the architectural marvel of Budapest along the river.

Night cruise on the Danube. Must do while in Budapest is a night cruise on the Danube. Night means after 9 PM in the summer. The city lights up to reveal its majesty. Bring your camera for picture of once in a lifetime.
Danube River. We took a night boat cruise on the Danube. Lovely. Lots of sites are lit up so you can get great photos. Well worth the one hour plus...
great views. Enjoyed an hour cruise on the Danube. Great views of the major landmarks, Buda castle, churches, freedom monument, Parliament, Margaret Island and bridges.
It's not blue!. It isn't blue (when we saw it) but it's pretty cool. It's so easy to find your way around the city having this landmark in the center of it.

Beuatiful day and night.. The Danube river is the heartbeat of Budapest and it is simply spectacular at any time of the day or night. During the day, the views of the castle and the Parliament buildings, mixed with the rest of the riverside architecture are a site to behold. The many bridges across the river allow you to cross at your ease and numerous companies offer cruises up and down the river. If I had to recommend a time to go see it, it would have to be at night. The boats lit up along the river are gorgeous but nothing in comparison to the castle, the citadel and the Parliament as well as the Gellert baths. These buildings light up the night sky and I would thoroughly recommend a cruise after sunset. Just remember to bring a jacket with you onto the boat because even though it may feel warm before the cruise it can be pretty cold out on the deck while the boat is in motion.

Great view from Buda Castle on Danube. Wonderful view from any of the bridges over the river. It is recommended to take a river cruise, which is easily found along the river on the Pest side, near Marriot Hotel. The night view was also perfect. I took a stroll along the river in the evening and enjoyed the view it was really relaxing. Going up to the Buda Castle and the view was even amazing.

River cruise to Szenchenzi. Love this large swift flowing river, endlessly interesting to watch the boats travelling up and down. The river banks in Budapest are well cared for, the bridges amazing and once out into the countryside the cleanliness, islands, summer bathing and small beaches are all well maintained. We enjoyed our river ferry trip.

Danube not Blue. We had an afternoon sightseeing trip and an evening meal trip.Both were excellent value. My only disappointment was they did not play Hungarian or Strauss music, this would have made it more authentic.

Great to walk beside. The best thing is you can walk beside it on both sides of the river, crossing on any of the historic bridges. Didn't have time for a river cruise but really enjoyed the long walk.The other way to do it is hire a bicycle.The buildings along the Danube are lovely, except for the modern chain hotels which look more like concrete blocks and to my mind spoil the riverside.

She is best at Budapest . Oh, such a lovely place, I felt like staying back here. There are many things that you can do on the Danube banks like go for a boat ride or have a drink at one of the floating restaurant or have dinner at one of the restaurants over looking the river or just go for a stroll along the river. Go counting the shoes on the banks or just sit by the benches on the banks. Once you are here you will never know how the time passes.

Boat tour at night. We took the hop on hop off bus that included boat tour at night! It was completely worth it and I would highly recommend not to miss on it. Make sure you get there early so you can get a good spot on the boat for good pictures.

Night On The Danube - Budapest. At the conclusion of an eight day river cruise, our Captain took our ship for an evening cruise on the Danube. It was the highlight of the trip as we stood on the upper deck, gazing in wonderment at the beautifully lit buildings and statues. The Parliament was stunning. So travellers take an evening cruise on this beautiful river!
Lovely River. I was there after a big flood so the water wasn't so blue - more of a muddy brown. However! It was so wide and peaceful. I can't wait to go back and take a boat down it.

Viking River Cruise "Cities of Lights" Prague to Paris. First off, I want to say that the only reason that they are not getting a 5 rating is due to the booking process through Viking and NOT the river cruise itself. If I could just rate the River cruise portion and all the staff (especially our Program Director, Susi) on the ship, I would give them a 5 PLUS PLUS. We did the Prague to Paris route (you can also do the reverse), where we spent the first days in a hotel in Prague, then were taken by coach to Bamberg, Germany, where we boarded our ship. The luggage and boarding process went well, despite a couple of tardy passengers on our bus. The accommodations on the boat were nice. Not luxurious (keep in mind this is a Riverboat and not an Oceanliner) but very nice. The beds are designed so that you can put your luggage under the bed. There was also plenty of storage for my husband and my things. The food was wonderful, the tours were well managed and organized, and the staff was terrific. We were also very lucky in that the average age on our cruise was lower than most ... being about 50, so we had a lively group in the lounge / bar area after dinner. The excursions are included, with a few extra excursions you can pay additional for if so desired. Our group (we were a group of 5) decided on just one of the extra offerings and it was wonderful. They also did a good job of giving the guests options (when they could) for a Highlights tour (which moved faster through the same areas, and allowed for extra free time), a leisurely tour (which was great for those that moved a little slower) and then the regular tour. Since our group did have a pretty big age spread, this helped to group the passengers based upon abilities. Regarding the booking process (we booked directly through Viking) I would suggest booking your airfare and any extra days you may want to add on your own, then coordinate with Viking once booked. Viking's airfares are very reasonable, but are only for coach, and you don't know which airline you are going to be on. Any upgrades on flights to Business Class or First Class seem to be a hassle for Viking and you likely won't get them, regardless of you status with whichever airline they choose for you. They will credit you back the airfare portion of your booking. Also, if you want to add extra days to your trip, book them through the same hotel, and coordinate with the hotel, the two reservations (you will have your own and Vikings). If you do add days, you will lose your transfers to and from the airport through Viking. (they will credit you back this money, as well.) This was also not a big deal. We were able to coordinate a car service through the hotel and it was more convenient and less expensive than going through Viking. I highly, highly recommend the Viking River Cruise. It was an amazing trip and we saw such beautiful places, history and views all throughout Prague, Germany, Luxembourg and Paris. I would put it up there as one of our best trips ever, and we travel a LOT.

Legend dinner cruise of Danube. Great and relaxing dinner cruise. As the sun set the city lights came on and was extremely beautiful. The dinner was very good and the service was excellent. Worth doing in the evening.

Incredible experience on Danube river!. Our group were invited to have a cruise on Danube. It was unforgettable experience. On a boat you will see all the landmarks of Budapest. Chilled wine with appetizers were served, Danube breeze, and the gorgeous views... Life is really beautiful)))
Great views. Walking near Danube or going around it, felt amazing. There are excellent views and I highly recommend to walk on both Buda and Pest side. In addition a river cruise is a must.

Wider and Bluer than in Vienna. The Danube is wider than in Bratislava and Vienna. Under the midday sun it also appears bluer. Where the Danibe is not close to the Old Town center in Vienna, the Buda castle and the Paliament are right next to the river ( among other attractions) so that the view from the river to the banks on either side is more interesting.
Great Trip!. Was amazing to see some of the places we did during our riverboat tour of the Danube River. Budapest was the highlight!

Beautiful river walks. We had an evening stroll along the Castle Hill side of the river between the Chain Bridge and Parliament. Beautiful illuminated views and in my opinion you don't need a cruise to see it (the daytime river boats are far better value and part of the 7 day transit pass Monday to Friday). Don't miss the Shoes on the Danube just beside Parliament - one of the most moving memorials I have ever seen

Not to be Missed. You cannot come to Budapest without having a cruise on this wonderful river and see all the attractions from another view point. Also you can just sit on the banks and watch the world go by
beautiful river. the lifeline of budapest,beautiful river,one of the best in the world,great for a river cruise and for travelling thru europe
dunai cruise. Great dinner cruise up and down the Danube. Loved it. My wife and i felt we were back on oue hney moon, we were enchanted
Always a must. If you a walk next to the river, if you cross the bridges, if you have a dinner in the boats, it's always looks amazing.
Sight seeing in Budapest. A wide river, looks impressive. Loads of boats on it and old historic bridges. Adds a nice feel to the city
Promenade of Danube. You can see the manority of famous building from promenade next to Danube, together with great atmosphere and ''shoes'' which are made from iron; many good restaurants
Took A boat trip. Purchase tickets for the Hop on Hop Off bus and get a boat trip included on the Danube. This was well worth doing and only cost about 6,000 HUFs for 48 hours. Well worth doing .

Cruise on the Danube. This is a 90 minute cruise on the Danube, offering lovely views of the historic landmarks of Budapest. We took the lunch time cruise, included in the price was ony a small cup of coffee or cooldrink, which is a bit poor
Beauty, romance, and wonder!. What a landmark! Beauty, romance, and wonder are what one experiences around the Danube, especially at night.

Danube public transport ferry. There are many tourist ferry boats on the Danube in Budapest but a very economical trip is on the public operated ferry (BDk I think). If you have daily, weekly, or monthly bus/train/metro ticket it can be used on the ferry which takes in a good distance. It crisscrosses the river to the different ferry stations and there is outside seating so that all the sites can be seen well.

'Unforgettable' Romantic, Danube Dinner Cruise. The absolute highlight towards the end of our visit was an evening Dinner Cruise on the Danube. Once we had boarded, champagne on arrival, we settled in to our table, and ordered dinner. A very good Duo played music (guitarist and solo singer) for the whole of the two hour cruise. The boat was covered by a 'see through bubble, so that you could snap a gorgeous Site - between 'bites' and sips'. Just wonderful! (Obviously Budapest lit up at night on the Danube, from the boat is so amazing). Heaven. We enjoyed the service from friendly staff, prompt fine dining meals, and the Champagne was good enough to ask for more. The cost we thought was quite affordable, and the memories of course - priceless. Highly Recommended.

The View is Breathtaking. The View of the River Danube is breathtaking with the traditional Buildings in the Surroundings....One Should visit the charles bridge for some great photographs and view of the city...

Well Organised from booking until we boarded our home flight. My wife and I have never taken any cruise after watching giant cruise liners disgorging hundreds of sightseers at various ports around the world. However we decided to "take the plunge" and book a river cruise along the beautiful River Danube. We opted for the 2 nights pre-cruise in Budapest followed by 3 nights post cruise trip to Prague. The booking was made in London nearly 12 months before our voyage. We booked on Viking Prestige because the dates were what we required (wedding anniversary). We choose an upper deck stateroom. ( I would not recommend a main deck room as it as small windows and is at water level). The V Prestige is diesel electric driven o there is no engine noise or vibration whilst cruising.I informed the booking clerk that my wife had a severe food sensitivity to MSG and she said she would make a note of it. I thought nothing more of it until shortly after we boarded the maitre d'hotel sort us out, and discussed the evening's menu with my wife and determined which courses would definitely not contain any bought-in sauces that may contain MSG, Flavour enhancers, E621 etc. This attention to detail continued every morning of the voyage. 5-stars for attention.The meals were "free seating" in the restaurant on the second deck and there was also a smaller restaurant on the third deck. We met some interesting fellow travellers at meal times. The choice of courses was wide and all was well prepared and presented. The cruse director, Anthony, was knowlegeable and gave a great lecture on Strauss before we arrived in Vienna.The daily trips were well organised and the guides informative and spoke excellent English.Our stateroom (cabin) was well designed and not cramped at all.The design of the cruise was good although personally I would have liked more time in Vienna and/or Strasbourg. Vienna is my favourite European city having visited it several times in the past. Strasbourg is on our list for a long weekend break.Would we do another cruise? probably but not exceeding 7 nights as I was "churched out" by the end of the trip. Viking are planning a cruise on the Mississippi in 2016/7 which will definitely interest us.
Evening on the Danube. Great cruise in the evening, beautiful sites. Take your Rick Steve's book and get a discount. Don't forget your camera.

Fiery and languishing.. Reflections, freshness, of power, of Majesty ... It emphasizes the city, it frames your eyes, he embraces the monuments ... It flows, it strolls on his waltzes. Sometimes blue, sometimes copper, sometimes gray; It reflects the life and history of this city.

History and Wonderful Views at Night. Traveled to Budapest on the Danube from Nuremberg. Beautiful vistas, villages and incredible views while in Budapest. We stayed at Intercontinental Hotel at end of cruise with views of the historic river.

Inexpensive Budapest. Budapest is beautiful, and inexpensive. The Underground is very efficient too. We felt very safe everywhere and most people we met were friendly and helpful. The Danube river makes for beautiful views and make sure you get to the Buda side and see the views from the castle and St. Matthias.

Beautiful walks along the river. Beautiful strolls along the river, both in the day and the night. I jogged along it one morning, which was great, but too much pollution. Lots of things to see along the river, including the houses of Parliament. We took a boat cruise along the river and it was lovely to see both side, Buda & Pest.

Good way to orient ones self to the landmarks of the city from the water.. I cruised the Danube on the modern Duna Bella during the day (they also offer evening dinner cruises). A head set with many languages offers a running commentary as to the sights of the city as you pass by. Refreshments are provided. An option of getting off and exploring Margaret Island with it's ruins and Japanese garden is included (the boat picks you up after about 1 1/2 hours)
danube cruise. the cruise was ok but a lot shorter than advertised it was part of the big bus trip so overall it was good value

Sandals Grande Riviera Ochos Rios. Had booked 10 nights at Sandals requesting a ground room floor because of personal walking issues. While the resort is beautiful, it is not handicapped friendly. This resort is built on hllls and there are stairs to every restaurant , pools and beach. Having said this the Staff were wonderful and very personable. The Food at Valentinos, The French Restaurant and Sky view were all satisfactory. Kellys Dockside and The Beach Bistro were under renovation as was a lot of the property. I have been to many of the Sandals properties and would not return to this on mainly because of my phsysical disabilities.

promenade on the danube. take the city tour bus discovered in combination with a barge trip on the DanubeBudapest, Hungary’s capital, is bisected by the River Danube, and the 19th-century Chain Bridge connects its hilly Buda district with flat Pest. A funicular runs up Castle Hill to Buda’s Old Town, where the Budapest History Museum traces life from Roman times onwards. Trinity Square is home to 13th-century Matthias Church and the turrets of the Fishermen’s Bastion, which offer sweeping views.

On a budget. A Water Taxi is a fraction of the price for a daytime Danube river cruise, buy tickets from Boraros Ter and travel all the way to Margaret Island. After all a trip up the Danube is a trip up the Danube and it cost us 3,000 HUF (about £7) for four adults!
It divides the Buda and Pest side of Budapest.. Beautiful river in Budapest. It divides the Buda and Pest side. It has many bridges that cross the river. Many smaller cruise ships are docked.

Indeed a Memory for a Lifetime. I and my wife boarded the Amadeus Royal in Passau for a week tour on the Danube River. We reached Buda Pest and then back.Due to a reservation glitch we got a suite cabin, which was a fantastic upgrade. The owner. Lueftner Lines, the ship owner and the crew were all very forthcoming and very polite specially the cruise director.We had stops at Vienna, Bratislava, Buda Pest, Esztergom, Vienna once again, Melk and finally Passau. We also visited Praga before our flight back.The food on board was simply fantastic with a perfect service.We had tours on all these stops with a fantastic guide that can be called a walking encyclopedia.At the end all the criticism regarding the ship and working staff were found to be unfounded.Highly recommend for those in early retirement.
A stunning river. Try to do a short river cruise just before it gets dark. Illuminated Budapest from the river is just beautiful

Great place to start a River Cruise. What a great place to start our river cruise. We choose Scenic cruises. They provide everything. You are truly spoiled. Their side trips give you a nice taste of the area in a very relaxing atmosphere. If this is on your bucket list of places to see definitely start here. The cafe's and walk along the Danube is beautiful. We sailed for 15 days and ended up in Amsterdam. The boats are so smooth you don't feel like you are on a boat at all and I am so sensitive to motion and didn't need anything. So easy to sit back and watch the world go by. It was difficult to come back to reality. Definitely will try one of their other cruises.
Romantic stroll. My wife and I had a number of strolls along the Danube. It was so romantic and lovely especially at night with many building lit up.
very pretty. lovely river to walk alongside, very easy to get lost with a coffee and watch the world go by! the memorials are also definitely worth a visit.

River cruise. Took the Danube Legend cruise. Go after or around sunset when the lights are coming on, very atmospheric coupled with a dramatic commentary. Add the complimentary glass of sparkling wine, a perfect end to a lovely evening.

A River Runs Through It. The Danube is 'one of those things' that you have to see while in Budapest. It's hard to avoid if trying to get to the Buda side, but I would definitely recommend crossing the Chain Bridge, if even to turn and come straight back.Have no opinion on any guided river crossings or cruises.

Try the BKV river lines D11, D12, D13!. This is something what you cannot miss if you visit Budapest.
