Once you buy a 24 hour public transport ticket it is valid for the river lines(D11, D12,D13) as well and it is like a river sightseeing. The boat crosses the Danube several times and you have a beautiful view. The only negative thing is that on weekends the 24hour ticket is not valid for it only on weekdays...on weekends it cost about 2,5euros which is still really cheap for such an experience.
Beautiful cruise. It was one of the hottest days in Budapest. We went for an evening cruise and the breeze was delightful. The food was not that good, but the sites were wonderful.
Christmas time. Saw the danube as part of a Christmas-time tour. I would have enjoyed it more had I had the opportunity to take a boat ride.

Delightful Danube Cruise on Travelmarvel Sapphire. As seasoned cruisers, this was the best cruise ever! Superb booking arrangements by Lesley at Cruise.co.uk followed by a sensational cruise on a wonderful boat. Staff excellent, food well above average, beautiful scenery and fantastic stopping cities.It would be hard to find a better cruise of any sort.
Amazing in the days and Magical in the night. The magical city with the amazing Danube river. Being on at boat to travel along the river is a must, especially at night. Great experience.

Stunning River. Ideal for a day and night river cruise to view the Buda and Pest side of Budapest where the Parliament building and other historic buildings are visible. Visible on the cruise are various buildings of different character. Just lovely.

Iconic. I think this is the second longest river in Europe (should've checked Wikipedia before I started this review...) and the section running through Budapest is certainly spectacular.The river is the beating heart of the city. The hilly Buda side has some amazing views of the river, the flatter Pest side seems to feature most of the floating bars, restaurants and clubs as well as the cruise ship docks.Planning a river cruise next year so I can see more of this gem.

The River of life for Budapest. Well the Danube defines Budapest. It separates the hilly castle are from the plains of pest. It is the dominant natural feature of the place, also figures heavily in it's history. The river is full of river cruise ships but the #2 tram gives fine view of what is what on the Danube.

Night River Cruise. We took the 3,000 priced Night River Cruise from Dock 8A. Get a seat in the front and get ready to take pictures, it is beautiful. The best departure is the 10pm, nice and dark by then.

Amamzing!. What a cruise on the Denube it was.... will never forget this!We set out on a late evening cruise and saw all the monuments romantically lit up in the night. With Champagne in your glass and amazing views around this will be most memorable river cruise you ever went on!!

Not so Blue! More a greenish hue?. We go for a walk along the Danube [Duna] - skies are blue - almost the timeless blue of a mountain lake. It is nice and sunny and a perfect afternoon to walk around along the river banks. The river is Danube, Duna in Hungarian. At the ‘Chain Bridge’ the width of the Danube is about 350 m.; upstream the river is even wider when passing the Parliament and reaches more than 450 m at the point of the Margit Island. The Danube has its origin in the Black Forest [Germany] and ends up after 2,888 km in the Black Sea, flowing through—or forming a part of the borders of ten countries: Germany, Austria, Slovakia, Hungary, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Romania, Moldova, and Ukraine.
Hop on Hop Off. Managed to catch the last boat to and from Margaret Island - return journey was just when it was turning dark and there was a very good view of the city lights - amazing sights.
Wonderful. I liked the view from the riverside. The buildings are beautiful, the danube nice blue. I like it so much.
fantastic. The night light adds such a fantastic flare to all the already imposing architecture. There are so many grand architecture along the Danube and many river cruise to choose from,

The heart of the city!. Take a walk along its banks or get on one of the many water taxis or cruise boats and experience the wonder of the Danube! This wonderful River wines its way through the city and that's the reason for all the beautiful bridges.

Beautiful Danube. We got to see the river from various vantage points and it is spectacular. It is clean! Fishing is excellent! Perhaps most beautiful of all are the varied, historic, and interesting bridges between Buda and Pest.
At night, this is arguably one of the most beautiful sights in Europe.

Waterborne view. A sightseeing cruise on the Danube is one of the 'to do' things whilst in Budapest, and there are a plethora of organisations offering trips, day time, night time, with a meal, without a meal , and every option plus or minus music - so you just have to decide what suits you best.A simple sight seeing cruise, such as the one offered by Eurama Travel, gives a good overview of the main sights visible from the River including a particularly good view of the Parliament Building - which is very imposing but appears almost too large for a fairly small country - Castle Hill and the Citadel.Tickets are valid fro 24 hours and there are two stop overs allowing a degree of time for sightseeing
majestic waterway. the rive views were beautiful and especially romantic at night. seeing the landscape from the river boats as we traveled along the danube were breath taking.

it isn't blue. When I think if the song Blue Danube I was expecting something more than what I experienced. It was gray and a little brown. I then looked up the date the song was written to discover for myself that it has been more than 150 years since then. It was an OK framing of the Parlaiment building and the river looks better at night when you don't see the pollution.

Not to be missed....difficult to miss.. A trip to Budapest is likely to involve the river some way or another. Crossing over it between the two sides of Buda and Pest; walking alongside it along the promenade or cruising on it admiring the scenery on both sides there is plenty for everyone. A lot is free entertainment and toilet facilities are to be found near the base if the funicular. You can spend as much or as little time as you like engaging with the river and its surroundings. Look out for the unusual. I was walking alongside the parliament building early the other morning and witnessed some form of salute ceremony from the crew of a river cruiser escorted by three gun boats! The river was also the race course for the RedBull air race whilst I was there. It was also used as a route for a couple of fighter jets!
River at night .. Whether you walk at night lang the Danube or take a boat it is simply beautiful . The lights on all the buildings are beautifully done .
river cruise. I love all, the view and the guide .Learn a lot from it, about history of Budapest.The tour is about one hour.

boattrip. Forget the (little) cruise ships, just go by (public transport) boat. Lines D11, D12 and D13 go from north to south and back on the Danube. About three times an hour (both directions). There are about ten places to hop on and of. Look for the BKK sign at the riverside. The timetable is not that exact, but you can just wait for the next boat. Buy your tickets at the ticket machines for tram, bus and metro tickets ("other tickets"). HUF750 for a one way trip. Sit on deck, buy a beer (on board) and just enjoy the scenery.see also http://www.bkk.hu/en/timetables/#D14

The Danube was the focal point between Buda and Pest. We rode the trolley, walked along the sidewalk, and strolled over bridges every chance we were given because the Danube River was captivating. Our only regret is that we never took a boat cruise. There are restaurants along the Pest side of the river.

Free boat-ride!. There are many boat company´s that provide various type of boat rides on the river but if you are like me and want to enjoy yourself and don´t need nothing but the views... Take a water bus!
If you purchased a BKK (metro/bus card) you can ride the boat without additional charges :)
Lovely.. One has to walk along the bank of the river and then take an evening cruise to fully appreciate what the Danube has to offer, as everything worth seeing seems to be built along the river.
River tour. Brilliant. Started at 8.15 pm in July and is the best time by far. Still warm but get both light and night experience of riverside buildings
Great at night, too. Walking along the Danube in the evening is wonderful. The bridges and the castle and the parliament are beautiful in lights.

Danube river makes Budapest one of the most beautiful cities of the world. I am living in Budapest but still like very much the river which splits Budapest into two parts Buda and Pest!
Since several Years the river became more and more active! Today very busy with the many cruisers, touristic sightseeing boats, swimming restaurants, etc...but the most important is the beautiful view of both sides with the historical buildings!
The main waterway central Europe. We did a diner cruse and the views were wonderful as the Sun set over Budapest. Take a boat ride, or just walk along it's banks

The Almost Blue Danube. Calling it the "Blue Danube" is a real stretch. It may be blue but more a muddy blue. Although the name may conjure a waltz tune in your mind, the beauty lies in what is on the banks of the Danube. The buildings in Budapest especially the Parliament building at night is a magnificent sight. Outside of Budpest, the Danube is surronded by farmlands and vineyards as well castle up on the peaks of mountains. It is almost impossible to take a bad picture of the surrounding unless you are out of focus.

Beautiful river viewed from the bank, the castle, the parliament or Gellert Hill. Liked - It is clean, attractive with beautiful views of the buildings on the bank.Disliked - nothing to dislike about it
River Cruise. Definitely have to take the river cruise at night to see all the lights of the city! It beautiful, relaxing and a great way to see the sights!

the river flows. danube is the watery distinction between BUDA and pest. i did the night cruise and its beautiful. relaxing and serene. sipping your glass of local wine you get lost into the yesteryears as you hera the stories of how margaret island began. lovely way to spend an evening.

Dinner cruise. Wonderful Hungarian dishes and a magnificent view of Budapest at night. Tour is about 2 hours and a good value for your money. It includes a welcome drink and a small glass of wine. If you buy a bottle of wine , be prepared to pay.

Rent Bikes is better than on foot. Try to go at golden hour and rent bikes so you can cover more ground and get off the beaten path! The city bikes are annoying because they have to be returned every 30 minutes but it's the cheapest option I found. The park on the island in the middle is a little underwhelming.

You can feel the city!!. Just find a place you like , take your friends your drinks and your music and go relax ! There are a lot of places around and you can enjoy the true view of Budapest! definetely worth spending some hours !

Evening cruise on the Danube. The dinner was good and it was lovely to see the city in evening lights.
The cruise was 2,5 hours long and the boat went the same route many times so you could get good photos.
A must see. while in Budapest you have to go and see the River Danube stunning area where you can sit and enjoys some lunch
Great stay. Budapest is such a lovely under a ted place to visit for all types of people.great weather in the summer and some really lovely places to visit

Could sit by this rivier all day.. If you don't mind paying more for your food and drinks sitting on the river is perfect on a hot summers day. We spent the afternoon people watching. Perfect to see the river cruises passing by.

beautiful river and its cruises. It appears that Danube is the most happening place in the whole of Budapest with all the historical and interesting places around it. The best way to explore is to have a boat trip and stop where you wish. You could buy a hop on hop off boat trip and enjoy the river, a drink on the boat with lovely scenery around and also enjoy hopping off the island where you could enjoy to your heart's content.

Just a river.. This bit of the Danube, as it flows through Budapest is not pretty, it big and wide and flanked by some nice sights and some horrible industrial wasteland sights. You can see what you want to see by wandering the banks - or take the Number 2 tram, especially at night.Don't bother with a river boat trip, you've seen everything already if you've wandered down to the banks for 5 minutes.The real spoiler for us was that the Parliament building - potentially the most stunning building in Pest - is covered in perma-scaffolding, which is just horrible.

Strong Currents. The river itself has alot of history, you can see the shoe memorial from the boats if taking a boat ride, viking river cruises as well as a number of cruise river boats come and go from Budapest so if looking to hope on you can, they also offer ferry tours going across, currents are very strong, can be amusing to watch the boats struggle going upstream, river itself her is mostly brown nothing fancy to look at
Tram it. Great to take the 2 tram along the river, and then walk the other way. Some amazing buildings to see, and if you have a one day pass you can hop on and off when you want a closer look

Can't Go to Budapest and Not See the Danube. The Danube is the heart of Budapest connecting Buda and Pest. We saw it during the day and at night. We loved the nighttime cruise down the Danube to see all the city's sites lit up by lights.

Wonderful boat ride!. We toured Budapest the first day on the hop on hop off and a boat ride on the Danube was included. We lost didn't do it since we were going on a Danube cruise but soooo glad we did!!! The views were quite spectacular and we thoroughly enjoyed the Danube scenery!!!!

Night cruise should not be missed.. We took a late night dinner cruise. It was 1 1/2 hour cruise with buffet & wine for only around $70 total for two people. We had taken a bus tour during the day but it did not compare to this. If it is your 1st time in Budapest then this should be at the top of the "to do" list.

dinner cruise. we did the Legend dinner cruise and it was great. try to sit up top for best photo ops the food was just okay, we got the ala carte option ad I think that helped us get upper deck seating

Evening cruise on the Danube. There are different boat operators. We picked Legenda which lasted an hour. http://legenda.hu/en/danube-legendPrice for an adult is 5500HUF which includes one drink. The tour is a pre recorded video and the equipment used allows you to select it in 30 languages. Latest tour was 22:30.The lit buildings and bridges are beautiful at night.

A good way to see Budapest. We saw the Danube several times on our trips from the river banks to the views down from Buda Hills. We took a boat tour and whilst I would not necessarily recommend the particular boat tour that we chose it is certainly a good way to see the buildings from the river.

Viking River Cruise. Just finished Viking's 15 day River Cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam. It was great! So many things to see everyday. The ship was great. Our room was small but didn't stay in it a lot. We had the French Balcony, just a sliding door that opened, which was fine. It gave us a lot of light in our room. The lower ones on the main level, had a very small window at the waterline. The staff on our ship were amazing & the food was great. There are less than 200 passengers so it was quiet & very nice. If you want a good deal, wait until around March or so & you should be able to get free airfare. If possible go early to Budapest & stay longer in Amsterdam. You can book your own hotels for less money.
Cruise on the Danube. Took a boat ride down the Danube to go to Margaret Island which was nice to see. We would recommend the champagne it was soonnice
Beautiful but not blue. Our Viking ship was docked in the shadow of the lion bridge between Buda and Pest. The river is wide and serves as a commercial highway. Wonderful experience!

Budapest is tourist delight. visit Budapest and take a trip on the Danube and see some of the beautiful , historical sites. Or walk over the chain bridge and take a ride on the funicular railway . Wander the streets and see some of the most beautiful churches , statues and buildings ever. Have a snack or full meal at one of the many street cafes and restaurants ,all for the budget minded . I personally think it is one of the most beautiful and interesting citie in the world .

Beautiful . Our tour company chartered a private boat for our tour group. A no-frill boat. But the cruise is definitely the highlight of my visit to the already stunning Budapest. Will do it again if there's a chance.
Beautiful experience. Budapest looks very different from the day time city.It is a very advisable to take a late evening boat ride trip when the city and its bridges are in lights.
Things for everyone here. . There is something for everyone on this beautiful river. Adults and children alike, activities, restaurants, and clubs.

The Danube!. We walked both sides of the river and both are lovely. I would recommend walking on both sides during the day and at night as the major buildings on both sides are lit up at night. We did not have a tripod but used the wall on one side and the railing on the other to get some awesome night pictures of Castle, the Parliament House and the bridges.

That's why they call it the Beautiful Blue Danube. We went on a boat tour that came free with the on-and-off bus tickets we bought (all three of the companies, I believe, have this feature). We weren't expecting much, but we were wrong; the boat was nice, they had drinks available for purchase (I'm not sure about food), and the tour was for about an hour. The river portions of the city on both sides have been beautifully restored and maintained, and the views from the River were superb. We've been on different parts of the Danube, and she never fails to please. In the Budapest Danube, there is a long island in the middle that is put to much use for the denizens of the city. What appeared to be tennis courts, running/walking paths and athletic fields were all being used by lots of people, and there were also plenty of trees and flowers blending them all in. Budapest's famous bridges were lovely to glide under.We'd have paid more than we paid for the on-off bus tickets for this freebie! Being on the Danube is re-living history, and no one should go their whole lives without seeing her at lest once.
River Tour. We toured the river as part of a package for the hop-on hop-off tour. lasted about an hour. Great view of the city from another angle.

We took a boat trip up the Danube. it was recommended by our hotel, but the boat was old and decrepid (it was burgundy in colour). We went to Szentendre, which was nice, with neat shops and market, but the ride there and back was totally uneventful and not that attractive. The view from the boat of Budapest was great - but I'm not sure if I would recommend spending a day this way - not a must do.

Ferry on the Dsnube. If you are over 65 and have EU passports, you can travel on the ferries for free and it is a. Dry relaxing thing to do. We went from one end of the route to the other and enjoyed it very much
Cruise. We took the evening cruise with a meal for my husbands birthday which turned into a wonderful evening would highly recommend
Despite the rain!. Had a great trip on Danube - wish it had been longer. Food was unexpectedly good. The Zsigmond Trio were excellent.

Great way to say goodbye to Budapest. It was our last day at Budapest and what a way to finish this journey, cruise with dinner on the danube.
The changes from late evening and night are impressive, all the lights and the views to both margins.

lively river!. We regularly found ourselves walking along the banks of the Danube as part of our routes to attractions as it is such a lively, interesting place. There are lots of little bars and restaurants which face onto it, as well as river boat restaurants! We ate in Spoon one night which was fantastic, the river boat restaurants are generally a little more expensive than others in the city but still good value considering the city is a pretty cheap place to visit. Lots of little boats, river cruises, even a boat-bus, and many beautiful bridges spanning the river! Also lots of public art and statues along it's banks

Take a boat trip. You won't regret it.. World famous river, lined with incredible buildings and a true sense of history. You'd be mad to visit this beautiful city and not take at least one cruise on the famous Danube.

Romantic and spec views. This is the focal point of Budapest . All photos tend to include the river . Great to cross it. Nice to see both sides of the Danube. Great views from szentendre which is just forty minutes north of Budapest. Definitely worth it. Just costs £2-3return trip on local bus. Has a look of costa del sol when you see the river running through a scenic, story book village of szentendre. Great , great, great. You can. Sunbathe by it or sail in it or swim in it etcc.

night time is best. We saw the river by day, but at night we took a cruise. Do not go earlier than 9.00 p.m. This is when the city turns on the lights on all buildings and bridges. Totally breath taking.

You must take a boat tour at night.. The Danube continues to be the center of activity in Europe and a look at the variety of boats tied up will convince you of the role in plays in tourism. A boat ride a night is a magical tour as the city puts on a real show. The buildings are beautiful during the daytime but the lighting really turns it into a fairy land.It can be could on the water. Take a jacket and enjoy!

Different view of city sites. The Danube is legendary or story and song, but it's just a river unless you enjoy the sites along the way. It's a great way to see the buildings along the river from a different perspective - especially parliament.I would highly recommend a boat ride on this river - best best best at night!

Beautiful Danube from Passau to Buda Pest. One of our most memorable trips.. River cruise down the Danube was all a highlight. Some of the most beautiful stops. All inclusive river cruise was hassle free. No added excursion fees made it even more delightful. Menus is ample, but not exagratted like the cruise ships. Impecable service. Highly recommend this way to travel.
Take a cruise down the Danube. Went on a Viking River cruise from Budapest and sailed through Austria and Germany up to Nurenburg. Beautiful scenery..the Danube is wonderful!
Nice. Very nice stroll along the Danube in Budapest, It is what makes the city special and beautiful altogether.

Shoes on the Danube. The memorial Shoes on the Danube was moving. Located near Parliament and right on the river edge, the bronze footwear honor the many Hungarian Jews who were shot on the banks of the Danube and pushed into its swift current during WWII. Many sizes, shapes, styles of shoes depict the many people affected.

The Danube is as majestic as they come.. You can hear "The blue Danube" in your head as you either cruise down it, take a sightseeing trip around it in Budapest, or alternatively whenever you cross it or gaze at it. Despite it having a poor reputation during the era where land run off and polluting industries of the former eastern bloc countries let whatever run into it, it is getting better and the wildlife is apparently returning.

Calm Danube. Toured Danube river from left to right of Budapest and passed the small Margaret Island on Europa Cruise.Saw Budapest in the evening and its transformation at night, beautiful is the word.I would really suggest a trip on a boat to see the awesome panoramic view and you go clicking with your cameras.The castle, Parliament house, Chain Bridge and the Liberty statue (Citadella) are a few attractions worth mentioning.If you buy the Hopo Bus ticket, the boat ride is complimentary.Let the photos speak for themselves.

So you thought is was Blue!. Travelling from Passau in Germany to Budapest on a bike and barge (150 passenger ship) on the Danube was a lovely experience though the water was mostly a milky green. There was severe flooding in 2013 which may account for this, but it definitely was not blue water, no matter the weather conditions. Still it was a delightful trip on My Story that I would recommend to anyone.

Lovely views of a Beautiful City. relax and take in the view. A good way to orientate yourself and note the places you want to visit. Enchanting views of this fascinating city, sorry nothing to dislike.

Romantic boat tour through Danub. I travelled to Budapest by bus and arrived at night. A spectacolar lights view appears behind the hills of Budapest, many bridges of lights and sculptures connected the two parts of the city. The tour boat at night is amazing and very romantic, accompanied with viennese wals and the aristocratic city view. Budapest has many gothic and habsburg buildings that will make you feel like a king or queen that leads. It is definetly a must see city.
sailing down the Danube. We sailed down the Danube on the scenic diamond, had a lovely time saw some wonderful sights through austria and Germany

AmaLyra Legendary Danube River Cruise - June 5 - June 12, 2015. We toured the Danube on the AmaLyra ship and overall it wasn't bad. It's a very controlled environment meaning there's not much time to relax and not much space to relax in. PROS: every day we did a complimentary city tour which was well facilitated. CONS: when we wanted to hang out longer in the lounge or in the lower level restaurant, we felt that our presence was not welcome and that we had to leave after eating. The food and staff service was excellent but the itinerary included cities in which the stores and certain public buildings were not open. The Cruise Manager was not friendly and we avoided her as much as we could. I had no access to INTERNET on the boat but AMA advertises there is internet in all of the the cabin's on their promotional Youtube. In our cabin, we had a TV/Computer but the computer didn't work due to no internet service. Overall, we wouldn't travel on AMA again. Once was enough!
Danube by boat. See the city from the boat. Nice in the evenings to see the city lights! Also good way to move in Budapest. buy a city card so you dont have to pay any extra.

Beautiful River (but not "Blue"). The Danube is a calm river to be on in a boat. Anyone who visits a city on the river should most certainly take a boat ride on it. In Budapest, a person can see many of the landmarks, such as the Citadel, the Palace, Parliament, many interesting bridges, etc. We enjoyed taking a small boat ride as a city excursion, plus we began our river cruise here on this river.
Hop on hop off. Nice river cruse see both sites of the city from the water.Can get chilly so wear a jacket at night.

Danube river cruise with Duna Palota - No seating arrangements. Having heard so much of Danube river cruise, my group of 4 decided to get 1st hand experience of the Danube river cruise. We bought our tickets from Duna Palota, from a mobile booth opposite central market, and opt for cruise with drinks only on the upper deck. When we bought the tickets, we asked, and were assured that we will be assigned to a table of 4, as we wanted to be seated together. Unfortunately, it was not so. When we boarded the cruise, we were each given a welcome drink and directed to the upper deck. Once on the upper deck, you got to find your own seats, and all the tables were partially occupied (all tables setting were for 4). We were not able to get a table for our group of 4 as assured - what a disappointment. Seats arrangements could have improved.There were 3 musicians to entertain you throughout the 1 1/2 hour cruise, but we would prefer if commentary of the major buildings / sights can be aired over the PA system instead.As for the view, it is nothing to shout about. If you had done some sightseeing of major attractions and strolled along Danube during the day, you are more or less repeating the scenes during the cruise. As it was summer, we didn't get the chance to see the night scene.
beutiful night walk. I can recommend a night walk along both sides of the river. Views are great from both sides and you can easily enjoy more than two hours walking around.

Get on a Public Boat. Buy the 3 day public transport all areas pass (12 euros but you can buy 1 day also) this allows you to hop on/off the public ferry boats that go up and down river stopping on both sides. No need to pay for tours and dinners are always better at land based restaurants. Tick the box and get great photos.

Stroll along the Danube. The Budapest Korzo is a perfect walkway to stroll along the majestic Danube. It is about 1.5 km long on the Pest side of the city with a great view of Buda. Restaurants, cafes, luxury hotels and tour boats along the way.
The heart of the city ........ It remains the focus point of the city. Bridges give the variety. Boat trips use it's flow. Diners and drinkers take it it's view. Superb
Nice river and not more than that. I was anticipating the Danube to be blue as in Strauss' waltz, but it is really a bit grey. The architecture sorrounding the Danube is beutiful.

Stand on the Chain Bridge. Day or night, the River is the place to see the amazing vistas that Budapest has to offer. I fell in love with the Chain Bridge for some reason...there is a nice walkway across it and the architecture provides wonderful picture opportunities. If it is hot, go to the bridge, a wonderful breeze comes off of the river! If a river could talk... Definitely find a restaurant along the river and sit and watch the sunset and the lights come up on this magical city/river.

Not Blue, but breathtakingly beautiful. No visit to Budapest can be complete without a cruise down the Danube at sunset. Seeing the magnificent buildings, statues, bridges,churches and of course the Parliament House, lit up by the golden Sunset and then lit up as darkness descends, is a most memorable experience.... something everyone should have on their bucket list

A trip down the Danube Main & Rhine Rivers. Our trip started in Budapest as we stayed at the Hilton on the Buda side. We say many new sights as we traveled through Budapest on the hop on hop off bus to different points of interest. Budapest is a magnificent city combining old and new Europe with the Danube running along the coast. Some points of interest were Hero Square, Dohany Synagogue, the Opera House, Parliament and Fisherman's Bastion. Viking River Cruises was running the show and delivered 100 percent. The picked us up at the airport, arranged for transporting our luggage and fed us well. We were on the Maiden Voyage of Viking Vidar running from Budapest to Amsterdam. We did the pre and post tours which Viking arranged tours lodging food and provided the shleppers. We sailed down the Danube to Vienna, ate weiner schnitzel, apple strudel and drank local wine. We were in a new port daily and the guides and tours did not disappoint. Traveling through sixty seven locks, visiting churches ,opera houses , museums, palaces, castles, having lunch at local restaurants was a great experience. Slovakia, Austria Germany and Amsterdam were our stops along the Danube, Main and Rhine Rivers. Visiting many coffee house and wineries along the route added flavor to our trip. Learning about the different cultures and histories of these countries held our interest. We had daily briefings from The Cruise Director, previewing what we were to do the next day, whether it was a musician on board, a glass blower or cook, we were thoroughly entrenched. Meeting new people from different parts of the world, eating different food daily and touring was great. Vikings staff is first class as there was nothing they wouldn't do for you. I would rate this a five star operation and first class all the way.

sweet memories. Our family has visited once all together, the river is always beautiful and this is a place very near to our hearts. In Feb, part of our family was back and enjoyed just being by the river once again.

It’s the central nerve. Danube is the central line to this great city and a tour or ride on it is amazing to be incorporated into the Budapest itinerary and even not so, walking along the coast is equally a mesmerizing experience. Taking a night ride gives you splendid view of the city. There are lots of attraction along the coast and makes for a memorable experience.
Not blue but spectacular. No matter where you view this gorgeous river from the scene will take your breath away. Especially lovely from Castle hill and Fishermans Bastion

Grand river. The Danube divides the two parts of Budapest. The hilly Pest side is home to the castle and other historical buildings while the Buda side hosts the very grand Parliament. You can only really see both sides in all their glory when you are cruising down this mighty river and passing under the lovely bridges like the chain bridge and Margaret bridge.

Walk around the Belgrád Rakpart. It's unquestionable that Budapest is the city that knew how to take the best from the Danube! In my personal opinion that's the biggest difference between Vienna and Budapest: how beautiful is to walk along the river. If you go to Budapest you should reserve 1 hour with comfortable shoes and to walk around the Belgrád Rakpart from the Erszébet bridge until the Margit bridge. You will pass by the chain bridge and the parliament. You'll also enjoy the beautiful view to the Buda hills and castle. If you have more time I advice you to give the round and return from Buda side to see Pest and to have the perfect picture from the parliament! :)

Dinner Cruise on the Danube. The best, easiest way to see Buda and Pest is from the river. And when this is done late afternoon into the evening with the marvelous buildings being illuminated, while sipping champagne and awaiting a good dinner on the tour boat Legend, it is hard to beat. No narration or guide to interfere with eating, drinking and thoughts but a helpful, cheerful wait staff to get food, drink and snap photos. Trip takes about 2.5 hours to allow comfortable time for dinner and so cruises by more than the normal shorter tours.

THE RIVER DANUBE !!!. To view the RIVER DANUBE is an experience never to be forgotten.. Something about the history and romanticism that it projects.. has to been seen and experienced.. Watching the cruise ships, tourist boats, restaurant boats, etc., is hard to look away from Take enough time when you are on the river bank to take it all in... WORTH the time.......

What a View !!. The Danube River divides the two cities of Buda & Pest & the very artistically designed bridges across Danube unite these two. The Danube is alive with a number of boats laden with tourists, a floating hotel and some cruises dotting the Shores, especially on the Buda side. The River cruise is charming and one can see the twin cities in a different perspective once on the River with amazing views of the imposing Castle Hill and the secong largest Parliamnent building in Europe.

Famous river. The majestic river flows through wire a few European capital cities and is one of the great rivers of the world. The Danube in budapest forms a central lounge of sorts separating the Buda and Pest sides and giving a promenade to walk along and view each side. Awalk along is the river and over the many bridges is definitely recommended.

Take the river cruise. Take the river cruise down the Danube. Best if you do the evening cruise as you will see the buildings and the Chain Bridge all lit. There is a running commentary so you will have a good 'guide' to tell you more about Budapest, the Danube and the island nearby.
Not blue!!!. Having never seen the Danube before May this year was amazed at the actual size and strength of it. Not sure how Strauss envisaged it as blue, however still a fast flowing river.
Relaxing. We did the river cruise which was included on our HOHO package! It was a great way to see and take BEAUTIFUL pictures of some of the landmarks from the river!

Breathtaking view of the city. We were awed by the sight of this magnificent city as we sat on the bank of the Danube at night. Looking up at the Buda side, it just take's one's breath away. I have never seen such a beautiful city. Pictures tell only half the story.

Walk by day, take a boat by night. Walk along the Pest side in the daytime, or ride a tram along the river, and you're sure to take a bunch of great photos. And in the evening, take a boat trip to see all bridges & buildings lit up — that's a stunning sight!

The beautiful Danube. Walking by the river is an nice experience, although the routes are not everywhere made for pedestrians. The views are great and you can stop for a drink at some of the many restauranfs and bistros.

Mesmerizing. River Danube is just so mesmerizing to me. Taking a boat tour would be the best option with either lunch or dinner. You can see the Parliament building and them go under the bridge is awesome. You will feel really relaxed if you go on a boat cruise.

THIS RIVER IS INCREDIBLY BEAUTIFUL. It is very similar to the Seine River, but wider and maybe not so busy. It is very beautiful, it is great for a boat ride when you are visiting Budapest and it is a river full of history. The sight of the Parliament Building or the Buda Castle and of the Liberty Statue are unforgettable. We bought a ticket for a Bus Hop on Hop Off Ride with a Boat Ride bonus and this can be a cheaper way to get a sight of the most important landmarks of Budapest and of course, to go across the Danube, which is a must!!

Wherever you go, take some time to see the Danube!. There's plenty of perfect spots to rest your eyes in the Danube! Don't miss it no matter what because it's very peaceful to keep the trace of this river.

Viking river cruise -Romantic Danube, Budapest to Nuremburg. Just returned from a seven day trip on the Danube with Viking. We were attracted by the prospect of seeing a series of 'bucket list' cities without having to waste time and energy packing up and moving on for each place. What we experienced certainly achieved that and was an excellent compromise between relaxation and sight-seeing. Viking aren't the cheapest but the operation is super-slick, the staff really look after you and the food is plentiful and high quality. Wine, beer and soft drinks flow freely at lunch and dinner and there is even bubbly at breakfast if you're up for it. For us that was enough but there is a premium drinks package if not and the bar is available to supplement the freebies. Service levels on the boat probably benefit from the American clientele and the tipping culture ( a suggested Eur14 per person per day) which adds around £150 to the week for a couple but the result was better service than we've had in many 5* establishments. We arrived at a different place each day and were always provided with a tour, all good. Additionally we did the BMW factory at Regensburg and the WWII tour at Nuremburg - both optional extras but well worth it.Room-wise we had an upper deck stateroom with a small sit-on balcony but no separate sitting area indoors. The balcony was useful when traveling between stops during daylight. The room had sufficient space to walk round the bed and a decent shower/loo cubicle, so, as you'd expect on a boat, not huge, but nicely presented and cleaned/refreshed twice a day.All in all a good trip and a method of exploring the planet that we'd consider using again.
One has to try it of course. "Waltzing" down the Danube, albeit with a boat between me and the water, I travelled to Szentendre. Not very blue (anymore?) but still one has to travel on it.
a dream fulfilled. I had always wanted to see the Danube, and I was not disappointed on this trip to Budapest whose historical buildings provide a stunning backdrop to the river

Beautiful walks. I walked every morning and evening by the magnificent Danube. It's refreshing and has the feel of good old days. I stayed close to the river for this purpose alone so I could walk by the river.

Cruising The Danube at Night. Delicious food, beautiful sights, wine and friends...Is there more???Yes, Take a ride on a river cruise along the Danube and sail under the 10 bridges. You will get the most glorious photos of your trip. One building even changes colors. We liked this so much we wished we could do it again.

Hot Hydrofoil. Reasonably priced for a 90 minute trip (£12 each) to Esztergom but you will be sat inside a fairly old and tatty hydrofoil with no aircon or drinks service. Sit at the back to get the benefit of the breeze once the hydrofoil gets going.

River CRUISE.. We arrived in Budapest ON A RIVER CRUISE, the boat was THE RIVER BEATRICE, what a way to see the city wesalied in early morning to see all the Landmarks and Buildings. That night they moved the ship so that we could see all the buildings lit up, what a sight, wonderful. A once in a life time experience.
Very nice boat tour. We went on a 1 hour tour of tge Danube from Budapest City and around Margarithe Island.Very pleasant and relaxing way to see the City from the Danube.

Scenic river. Beautiful both daytime and evening. Beautiful sunset scene and night time cruise trip. It was a river with gems on both sides. Beautiful night scene. It is romantic to walk with your love ones along the river bank. Relax and comfortable.
Go on the Danube. You must go along the Danube, there are a lot of photo opportunity to take on both sides so much to see and a great view of a lot of the sites

Breathtaking at night, beautiful bvy day. Cruising the Danube through Budapest is a wonderful experience. If you aren't taking a river cruise, you must take one of the many Dinner-sightseeing cruises. The night views are breathtaking.

Nice, but just like any other city river. The Danube in Budapest is a nice river. Walking down the banks and looking at both sides of the city, or walking over Chain Bridge and looking at the river, are enjoyable experiences. Essentially though, this river doesn't differ much from, say, the Thames in London.

great views. Great views from either side. Take a bus boat and see fantastic Budapest just like those on the exptremely expensive river cruises for practically nothing. Thw river is Not particularly blue though...LOL.

Worth a boatride in the night. My family and I took a no-frills boat - we paid 2000FT just for a ride. That suited us fine because we didn't want to eat or drink on the boat. Usually other companies charge more because they give you a glass of wine or whatever else. The ride lasted an hour and a half. We were sitting on the top deck with an open roof so it was very enjoyable. The city lights up really beautifully at night. Worth doing one evening.
a romantic cruise. We can see beautifull palaces, monuments during our trip of two hours; this trip is combinated with hop and off bus
So beautiful. SO much to do, take the local boat on the weekends, it operates like a bus and goes up and down in Budapest.Best kept secret.

Cant go wrong woth an evening stroll along the Danube. We walked from the island bridge south towards the parliament on the Pest side of the Danube. It was a nice walk and we saw the shoes which lined the Danube.

It may not be blue.... But it is beautiful! If you aren't on a river cruise, it would be worth your time to take an evening boat tour to see Budapest lit up in all her glory! Just seeing the Parliament building is worth the trip.

Beautiful inspiring Danube. Took a night cruise on the Danube and what a beautiful introduction to an enchanting city with its key buildings and bridges lit up in their majestic glory. It was inspiring and captivating. Not to be missed.

The diamond of Budapest. I can't imagine to go someone on Budapest and don't visit Danube...It's something magic...We had a cruise on Danube at night and it was amazing...You can see all the sights lighted...I felt something magic in the atmosphere...

No idea what we was looking at. Did the Danube river tour at night time, the scenes were lovely but did not know what we was looking at...No one to explainThe live music was nice I suppose but felt it was a waste of my time as no one was around to tell us what each building was.If you want a tour around and not need to know what the buildings are then yes worth a visit. otherwise not recommended
Nice cruise . It is the highlight of my trip. I got seated on the top. The boat left around 8pm. Service was top notch. Make sure you save one night for a cruise along the Danube river.

It's a river. What can I say? It's a river. Lots of touristy boats ferrying people on tours along a short stretch of the river. It's not for swimming in as the current is very strong and the water is murky, and has the odd branch and log floating down it. A lot like the Thames really. Night time is probably the best time to appreciate it, when the sun is setting or has set and the lights are on the bridges and surrounding buildings.

River. Doing the boat tour up and down the river for an hour was included with my hop on hop off tour. I didn't necessarily like the boat or poor recording quality, but just to sit on the river and see both sides of the city was a great experience and a good way to get familiar with the city at first.

Amazing views. Take time and enjoy the Danube River tour - you will see amazing views of the beautiful surroundings in both sides of the river: Buda with nice houses and garden parks in the hills and old but pretty and historical buildings over the Pest side of the river. Get the best of both worlds.

Fabulous views. The Danube is "everywhere" in Budapest. The views are amazing from both sides of the river- the castle on one side, parliament on the other.The tram ride along the city side is good- ride one way, walk back. Look out for the statue of the little prince near the tram tracks.Walk across any of the many bridges for great views, but probably the Chain Bridge is best.
Danube is Budapest. The city of Budapest is oriented by Danube river. All classical sightseeings are located among its banks. Beautiful views from boats travelling down the river.

Romantic Danube Viking Cruise. Started our trip in Budapest and ended in Nuremberg. The crew of the Viking Ship Jarl was top notch. Always there when you needed something even if it was just a simple question. They knew our names and drink preferences by the second day. Shore excursions were very well organized and informative. Guides were locals with firsthand knowledge of the site and attractions. Was a little on the pricey side but you definitely get what you pay for.

Best part of Europe.. I was in Budapest for work and the city was just so beautiful and the people so friendly I would suggest it over and above Paris or London. The Danube is not blue, but the bridges and city are worth it.
Peaceful river. Huge river with amazing view of the city. Try checking out the cruise if you have the time. Find a hotel that's by the river. Will be worth the visit that way.

Beautiful river dotted with castles and ancient villages.. I have cruised down the Danube 3 times and am going again in September. The castles and ancient villages along the banks are marvelous especially from the deck of a river cruise boat, day and night,

Cruise and dinner - a true highlight of our visit to Budapest !. Seeing Budapest at night with the buildings on Castle Hill and the buildings of Parliament lit up was truly magnificent ! Our boat left from dock 7 . We were seated on the top ( enclosed) deck - only 8 tables seating 2 people each. You could choose off a set menu and the food was beautifully presented and very tasty ! A truly memorable evening !

It's a river, but the Danube.. Really it is just a river, but it does take you back. Still has the river barges transporting their goods up and down. As for blue, sorry more a murky green. It's the buildings that line the Danube in Budapest that make it a beautiful sight. Didn't get to go on a boat, but would recommend.

Sit back and enjoy!. Finding a boat was the hard part (or finding where to get a pass for one).We took the public boat service.So reasonably priced with a bar on board!Sit upstairs and outside if you can if the weather is fine.The public service zig-zags from side to side to each pick-up point but that doesn't matter at all.You pick up all the sights of Budapest and can get off wherever it takes your fancy.The routes are either north or southbound but all eventually end up where you want to go.I absolutely loved this trip. So relaxing, beautiful weather, breeze in my face and beer in hand - perfect!
Not so worth seeing. It was a kind of disapointment - the whole river. Very dirty: you can't see trough water the bottom at all.
Stunning. Definitely stunning from street side. Even more so when viewed at night from boat as is the rest of the lit up waterfront.
Very pretty. Our Danube dinner cruise was one of the most memorable times for us while we stayed in Budapest. We were treated like kings and queens.
Must cruise at night. A cruise along the Danube is a must both during the day as well as the night when many of the major buildings are beautifully lit making it a fairy tale city.

Be sure to see at night!. Since we ended up in Budapest at the end of a 15 day river cruise of the Rhine, Main and Danube Rivers, we enjoyed a sizable portion of the Danube. In this review, I'll attempt to suggest the best ways to view the Danube as it meanders through Budapest. We approached Budapest on the morning of our last day of the cruise. My wife made the mistake of staying in the state room, which afforded views on only one side (in our case, Pest) of the river. I went up to the sundeck to witness the splendor of the Parliament Building, the Chain Bridge, the Citadel and the many Beau Arts, Gothic, Baroque and neoclassic buildings that define Budapest. But the real treat was our river boat's taking a special nighttime, hour-long cruise that highlighted the lighting that bathes Budapest after hours. To the sound of Strauss' Blue Danube, we sipped champagne, toasted our new friends and took pictures to capture the ambiance. Note: The Danube is not blue. It's a muddy brown, but that doesn't detract from the sights along its banks.
So much to see and sing. Historic compositions and writers, maybe not blue, but a lovely spot. We visited while the moon was full, the reflection on the water was amazing
Must Visit. BEAUTIFUL!With an even better story!Either pull out an history book and read about Danube or go for a walking tour to hear it's tale.
The blue heart of the city. My favourite river. It makes Budapest even more impressive and breathtaking. Visit it with a bottle of wine is a great spend of time.

Great tour. We went on the unlimited boat rides, we only used the tickets once as wasnt enough time but the tour was really good and the buildings are beautiful from the river especially when they are Lit up we went on the boat as te sun was setting.

Viking river cruise. We just returned from the Viking ship Ingvi on the Grand European tour from Amsterdam to Budapest. The adventure was overwhelming. We have been on 15 prior ocean cruise but this trip rates at the top for quality, cleanliness and friendliness. The staff were all very enthusiastic and willing to do whatever was needed to make everyone comfortable. The itinerary with shore excursions were excellent with viking's own buses. Food was excellent and variety was amazing. Would highly recommend this cruise line.
A must excursion on the danube. take the silver line evening trip with dinner and pianist...out of this world allow three to four hrs for the trip

Dark Blue Danube,magical evening. Our cruise down the danube on Danube Legenda was simply marvellous.They have boats running till almost 10 pm and we did this cruise on our first night in Budapest .What a magical introduction to this brave and beautiful city.Much better than the cruise on the same river in Vienna which was a huge dissapointment.This particular company also had video images of the insides of some of the beautiful buildings we passed.and the option of cruises with dinner or just a drink was perfect.

Avalon Waterways - "Impression". We joined Avalons "Impression" ship at Budapest for the 15 day 'Magnificent Europe' tour. We could not have been more IMPRESSED with the full holiday with Avalon, particularly the fantastic start in the amazing city of Budapest. We had a beautiful first night on the ship, sailing after dinner, back into Budapest viewing the pretty twinkling lights on the bridges and buildings. It is simply a sight that I will never forget - nor my time on the "Impression" ship, part of the Avalon suite of ships

Sunset at the Danube: for couples or introspective happy lonelier.. Danube and the sun are incredibly made to each other! The sunset at the Danube is something to be seen several times if possible. You pic your bridge and simply watch!

Do It. Too much to tell try it & see great river beautiful sites and several choices to do one.Take the camera & Do booth Day & Night tours if able take a longer two three day tour all the way on the Danube

Beautiful Danube. What can you say about the Danube that hasn't already been well stated by others. There is something new going on at every turn, beautiful buildings along its banks and a great place to go for a leisurely stroll or sit down for a while and just people watch. Just don't expect it to be blue because I think that's a fairly rare event when conditions are just right.

Blue River from the Black Forest to the Black Sea. The river Danube flows through ten countries, and the folk of ten countries summons it on different names, Duna, Dunav, Dunărea, Donau,etc.It inspired poets, painters, composers, just think about Johann Straus’s most famous work, the waltz called An der Schönen blauen Donau- "The Blue Danube".Unfortunately the river now days is blue only in its name, or just I wasn’t lucky to see the true colour. Blue or not, it is beautiful, and you have to admire it standing on one of the spanning bridges looking at its stumbling waves.If you’re a water enthusiastic like me, enjoy a relaxing boat ride to Szentendre and Visegrad , and come back with train or bus. If you’re already there, both places need at least half a day to look around, so don’t venture upon to do it on the same day.To try to know a river a bit better, you have to navigate it. To see Budapest on both sides, the bridges above you, and the rolling river underneath.If you have only a very limited time, at least sit down on the wharf for half an hour and let the sight of the river transfix you.

Fascinating powerful and muddy. We visited in Budapest and enjoyed following the traffic of cruise boats, taxi boats and a few cargo boats/ships. You can see the powerful current especially after the bridges.
Recommendable is a cruise especially in the evening when the center of Budapest is nicely lightened.
We were missing some trees or more green areas along the Danube (Donau in Danish).

A picturesque contrast between two sides of the same city. A walk along the banks of the Danube is a must when you're in Budapest.Stroll along the Pest side for the better views of the old world feel of Buda, with the castle up on the hill taking pride of place. Head back along the Buda side to see the more uniform and imposing buildings of the more communist-inspired Pest.The beauty of Budapest compared to other major European cities is the cost... even the 'tourist trap' cafes or ice cream stalls you find along the way are generally cheaper than you'd pay somewhere off the beaten track in other cities further west in the continent, so you feel as though you can really enjoy the whole experience without having to pay through the nose for it.
a must. cruising down the Danube is only beaten by a night cruise when the bridges are lit up and magical. there are numerous cruise boats but the best deals are when you book a tour bus combo ticket
Danube River Hungary. So lovely to have lunch and look out over the Danube and think of all who have gone down this amazing river!

The Budapest Danube. The weather here in early June is comfortably warm and beginning to be overly humid. The river is beautiful no matter what time of year. The rich history oozes from this mixture of German and Turkish cultures. A must place to visit at least once.

Pretty but crowded. The towns along the Danube are pretty and well worth seeing but the whole place is becoming too busy with more and more boats being built each year. We were there in May and it was very busy (often having to access the dock through another boat alongside) so I can't imagine how crowded it would be in the summer months of June July and August.Of course the many number of barges doing river cruises all along the Danube do create great tourism euros for all the shopkeepers and attractions along the way, but the authorities really need to start limiting the number of barges allowed.

Terrific cruise. We went on the Danube boat cruise twice in three days. What a lovely relaxing trip up and down the river with such fantastic views of the bridges, the old castle, the Houses of Parliament etc.The weather was an added bonus being 28 degs ! Such a worthwhile trip and does the city proud !

Boat trip on the, not so blue, but still beautiful Danube. Taking advantage of the Red Bus bonus we did two boat trips to Margrit Island where we found dancing fountains and lovely walks. Bicycles and other means of getting around the park were available and it all adds up to a good experience. So much we returned for a second visit.
Took a boat ride. Boat ride was part of hop on, hop off bus ticket. Was nice to see Buda and Pest from the Danube. Ride took about an hour or so
Fascinating river. Always something happening on the river with many cruise boats using it as a stopping off point. Good views of the main city buildings if you take a short river boat trip.

Afternoon cruise. Take a cruise, enjoy the beautiful architecture from the Duds and the Pest, pass my Margaret Island and cross every bridge while listening to every detail of the the Danube River.Most cruises will include a beer with the ticket. Good for pictures.

River trip at night. What a way to see the city just as darkness fell . Parliament and the Royal Palace were fantastic all illuminated . Gentle trip the last about 1,30 minutes were was just enough to see the city and its sights . Make sure they give a commentary before you book .

Danube - Legenda river cruise. This review is only for the Legenda river cruise not for the Danube river and the reason I have given them a terrible rating is that the audio guides on one side of the cruise were not working. The staff knew about it but did not bother to tell anyone before buying tickets or boarding the cruise. Our whole experience of the Danube was ruined because of this. Also the champagne that they served on board was of very quality.

do this at night. Take the river boat tour at night to see the city lit up. The Castle and the Cathedral up on the hill. The Chain Bridge. Especially the Parliament Building. It has had an extensive cleaning and gleams in the light. A magical ride.

Beautiful cityscape views from the Danube river cruise.. We took an evening river cruise and the sights are spectacular. Budapest is probably the most attractive city we have visited to date. I don't recommend the dinner cruise, rather just save the money and find a hole in the wall restaurant to get some authentic local food.

The night cruise was perfect. Budapest is a beautiful city by day, but at night it is over the top. The river ride is a perfect way to see and enjoy it. The fact that it was included in the HOHO ticket made it a bargain. Would highly recommend doing this.

A grand tour on foot, by vehicle, on bike, or by boat. We spent four days in Budapest and I'm reasonably certain that I would have been happy had we never left the bank of this historic river. The river itself is home to so much ranging from cafes, shops, and spas to historical landmarks, artwork, and memorials. We walked most of the time and enjoyed every step.
Take the nightime cruise. Daytime cruise is only OK, but the nightime cruise after they turn the building lights on is really special.
Absolutely beautiful. Take a river cruise and wine and dine on the world famous Danube -- great taste of tis great city's architecture.
Maybe not Blue but lovely. I did the Nig Bus Tour so this included a river cruise evening or afternoon I did afternoon lovely to sail on the Danube and see Budapest from this very famous river

Great sunset and night pictures. Fantastic opportunity to see the city for a different perspective. We took a 2 hour boat ride beginning at sunset - beautiful! The evening trip was incredible to see all the evening lights and buildings from both sides. We were on a pizza cruise which I would not recommend in participating in the pizza portion but the boat rides was extremely worth it. Highly recommend.

Danube bank walk. It's a nice walk through the downtown of Budapest if you walk along the Danube bank - both sides are nice, but I would recommend Pest side as it has more attraction and Buda side has a nicer view from here. You will see beautiful old buildings, churches, you can find shops, restaurants, bars and cafés where you can refresh yourself before continue the "tour". You can drop-on a boat as well if you like, it will take you on the same way: usually between Margaret island and Petőfi bridge.
Night Tour Rules. The buildings are lit up and it was relaxing to cruise by on a boat drinking champagne. We took Legenda tours and it did not disappoint.
Ferries. You can have a ferry to go to Margaret Island. So, you can have a chance to see the city while you are floating in Danube. Don't miss to rent a bike at the island!

Danube River Tour. Be sure to set aside an hour or two for a Danube cruise. Early evening is the best time...it's less crowded, the lights on the buildings were just coming on, and it wasn't dark yet so you could actually see the architecture. The boats have headsets at each seat, the audio is available in several languages, and you control the volume. It's a great way to get an overview of Buda and Pest and to guide you toward figuring out which of the marvelous buildings you might want to tour. Just do it!

Viking Danube cruise from Nuremberg to Budapest. First river cruise and we did it with 4 other friends. Overall our experience was positive. Food was fine, nothing fabulous but no complaints. Service was great. We sat at the same table - no reservations but we always got to the dining room a few minutes before dinner to claim out table because we loved our waiter, Darwin. Our stateroom was spotlessly cleaned everyday.Inclusive tours were wonderful and we were well-taken care of. The only con and it's a big one is that Viking docked along side other boats and in once case we were between boats at most of the ports which rendered our veranda useless because we were literally 12 inches from the other boat's veranda. If one wanted to, you could easily climb over the veranda and on to the other veranda. You could see clearly into the other cabin. We had to keep our sheers AND curtains closed to have privacy. Internet/wi-fi access generally was terrible and only in a few of the ports it was okay.

A Historic cruise!. It's hard not to be impressed by a trip on the famous Danube River! Gliding past an array of floodlit historic buildings and castles, whilst having a champagne dinner, to the strains of 'the Blue Danube Waltz', is hard to beat! Such a romantic river, especially at night. The Danube is different from different angles. Be sure to go on a boat ride. You will see it best that way.
dinner cruise on the Danube. cruise was lovely, though food was pretty basic and unimaginative. nevertheless, good value. would suggest the 3 hour trip - entertainment was reasonable too.

Danube Boat Ride. Enjoy a relaxing night out in Budapest with this scenic Danube River cruise. Sip drinks including wine and Champagne and choose an optional Hungarian buffet dinner. To walk in the Sunshine along the beautiful Danube in Budapest is irreplaceable. The boardwalk along the Danube on the Pesr side is long, clean, and easy on the feet. And the view is magnificent. What a river, what a city. A combination the you cannot beat.

Romantic . Boat trip. We had a lovely boat trip on the Danube. We opted for drinks only no meal and thoroughly enjoyed it got some lovely photos.

Beautiful. The Danube is beautiful in Budapest, especially at night. We took a cruise along the river and had incredible views of Budapest, both sides. There were many River cruising options, as well as many bridges offering fantastic views of this river. This is what makes Budapest so charming.
Great view!!!. Great way to see the parliament specially in the evening. It's worth the one hour tour in the Danube

Historic and beautiful. We took a Danube cruise with a commentary that told us about the fascinating history, architecture, etc of the bridges and buildings along the river through Budapest. It was absolutely stunning.

nice boat trip. as part of our sight seeing tour we had after the trip a ride on the Danube. This gave a very nice view of the sides beside the Danube and during the trip we got a glass of champagne.A trip by boat on the Danube should be part of your trip

breathtakingly beautiful!. The riverside has lots of beautiful buildings and sites. You could just walk around the area and enjoy the view! We have returned here everyday while we were in Budapest.

Something you must see. Definitely something you need to see. Book a cruise with many of the tour companies that offer trips and dinners. DANUBE RIVER=BUDAPEST - Its that simple. We visited Budapest in March, 2015 and the first thing we did was walk from our hotel in the evening along the Danube Promenade to see this magnificent city ablaze at night. A cruise. I enjoyed my cruise on the river. Had a River lunch cruise and it was a great experience enjoying Hungarian food as well.

The defining factor in Budapest. On my trip I walked and took the trams along the Danube. Grabbed lunch at a local deli/butcher and ate in on the banks of the river. Crosses it many times on the several bridges, and spent a great day on Margaret Island in the middle of the river.

At night, a feast for the eyes!. Danube River is the second longest river in Europe. 2860 km long it passes through 10 countries of Central and Eastern Europe and 4 capitals (Vienna, Budapest, Bratislava & Belgrade). As it's navigable, it's always busy and offers a lot to local communities, especially after the construction of the Rhine-Main-Danube Canal in 1992, it became the link between North and Black Sea. At the same time it's beautiful and romantic too. In Budapest it's the main tourist attraction. 8 bridges over it and the impressive buildings in Buda and Pest form the perfect panorama. At night when everything is cleverly illuminated, you stay speechless.I had visited Budapest before, many years ago.But this time I had the luck to be on a cruiseship and arrive to Budapest, late in the evening. The weather was good, no rain, a little bit chilly but who cared! I had the best panorama ever. I'll never forget the feeling. We passed slowly under the bridges, one after another, with new buildings on both sides of Danube, everything illuminated. A feast for the eyes. If you find yourself in Budapest but without a cruise, you may enjoy the river and the panorama on small boats, even during the night. You'll never regret the cost. During the day, walking at the Promenade (Duna Korzó) it's a must. From one bridge to another, from Buda to Pest, you'll enjoy the views and discover very interesting attractions. Or take the funicular, in front of the Chain Bridge (Buda side) and visit the Castle district to see the river and Pest from above. From Gellért Hill you'll see the river and Buda from above. Think it over and decide!
Budapest Would Not Be Budapest Without the Duna. I was intrigued when I saw the Danube listed as an attraction in Budapest. The Danube River IS Budapest.

Touring with TravelMarvel on the Sapphire.. We travelled from Budapest to Vilshofen along this beautiful river in April this year and saw much wonderful scenery and experienced many amazing experiences. I would recommend Travel Marvel to anyone wanting a European river cruise. The service is second to none, the boat is beautifully set out and maintained, cabins wanting for nothing and food to die for. All this whilst sailing gently from port to port and being taken ashore on guided tours whenever we stopped. These stops included Bratislava, VIenna, Durnstein, Passau, and Linz. A truly magical experience!

happy cruising on the danube. we 5 lady friends went to Budapest. we were there for 5 days.amazing city.wonderful places to see.we had purchased the 1 day hop on hop off bus card. got the 2 day free and a cruise.since it was early may, no crowd. gentle waters, smooth cruising, lovely view of the castle, fisherman's cabin, parliament, bridges, Margaret island.carry ur water and snacks.delightful sailing.must do.radha aiyar.Mumbai.

Lovely for a nice walk, spectacular at night. Easy to walk around Budapest in a day, especially using the bridges and waling along by the river. Especially looks lovely at night watching the world go by and beautifully lit up.
The Connection. Great, beautiful, and historic. Travel back in time. Easily assessable. I liked it. Looked like it could get crowded but in May not too many tourists
Seriously.... Its the Danube and if you are not involved in a cruise ship on the river then you must take a Danube cruise and it MUST be at night. If you missed this you muissed Budapest.

Brilliant views. As part of the hop on - hop off bus tour you get 2 boat trips thrown in. We went on day time trip. The views are excellent and a great way to see the city. The staff, however, were really not interested in their guests. There was no safety briefing, no instructions of advisory messages. The 'captain' was more interested in reading from his phone, with his feet up on a chair, occasionally looking up to change course. We did not go back for the evening boat trip.

Legenda Candle Lit Dinner Cruise. We booked for this dinner cruise over the internet in advance and would strongly advise you do this - it is a popular attraction. The Legenda proved an excellent boat for the task with well laid out tables and excellent staff service as we cruised for two and half hours up and down the Danube. The city at night from the river is a must see.The food was very good (indeed considering the difficulty of serving on a boat, even excellent!) and throughout the evening we were entertained by a duo playing and singing just the right set for this kind of evening - e.g. plenty of well interpreted Norah Jones type easy listening.
excellant. we used the hop on hop off two day bus and got a free 1 hr cruise which was lovely....plenty other cruises to choose from along the riverbank
boat trip at night. We had a wonderful boat trip on the danube at night, even at night the architecture is delightful its a wonderful city and well worth a visit, looking forward to going again soon
River trip a must. A trip down the Danube is a must. There are both day and evening/night cruises available. For the photo opportunities you should do both.

Great Service, Terrible Shore Excursions. We traveled from Bucharest to Budapest on the Danube river via the Viking Embla. The service on the ship was superb, the meals excellent, the cabin comfortable. On a River Cruse I expect a small ship experience, and booking with Viking I was prepared for 190 guests (the boat capacity) at each stop.The problem is that Viking had another ship following the same itinerary as us. So when we arrived at a stop (daily) the ships would dock to each other. So to reach the shore you had to move through another boat. Worse, it meant that instead of 190 people at each of the small towns, there were at least 380. This meant 8 busloads of people traveling to small towns, where, quite frankly, the town was overwhelmed.But that was not enough! On one day there were 4 Viking ships at the same stop. 16 busloads of people! Terrible. Most of what could have been a beautiful day in a small village was spent in line waiting for a rest room- the only one in the small town. On another day there were 3 Viking ships at the same stop.The Viking buses each packed in 48 people. This meant they were uncomfortable, with seats very close together (think airline seats). The towns we stopped at were beautiful, but mostly small. If they only did not have 5 Viking tourists for every resident, they would have been great. My recommendation is to travel on another cruise line, and look carefully at the capacity of the boat. If the capacity is over 140 people, think twice. Also, avoid a big cruise line for your river cruise. If you make sure they only have one boat on a particular river, then you will have a great experience!Viking could take care of this by staggering their ships by a day or two so there was never more that one ship in any town at the same time. Of course, this does not apply to the huge cities like Bucharest, Belgrade, or Budapest. By the way, we added days to Bucharest and went to the Black Sea. Again, although it was wonderful to be there, we traveled in a small bus with 18 people, completely full. Very uncomfortable. Viking should use a larger bus for this excursion.We also added Prague to the trip. Here, Viking did a great job on the transfer from Budapest to Prague. Although there were about 90 people, Viking had us travel on 4 large buses, so there was plenty of room. However, the buses traveled in packs of 2, so at every stop there were long waits for a bathroom or for food, because 45 people were all doing the same thing.In summary, Viking needs to make this a small ship cruise by only allowing one ship on each itinerary. Until they do that you would do well to choose a smaller cruise line.
Peaceful. We spent time walking along the Danube and went on a boat trip, it was so peaceful. so many buildings and statues to see along the way

Free Boat Trip. Picked up the no 12 Ferry at Gellert Jetty and as I was over 65 and a EU citizen, the ticket collector on the vessel would not accept payment. Spent nearly 4 hours criss crossing several miles of the Danube on a nearly empty boat. Low cost beverages and toilets available.
best place for views. The river is powerful and beautiful. Cuts right through the cities and makes for wonderful photos in the daylight and in the evening.
Very impressive river.. Splits Buda from Pest, it's a very impressive river with some nice bridges crossing it. Well worth a boat trip, as there are o many sites to see from the river.
stunning. The Danube maybe be a bit brown but an evening cruise up and own Budapest at night is something to behold.

Powerful. Such a powerful river. I loved crossing over the bridges everyday on my trip and stopping to enjoy the beautiful view of this river. I also walked down the steps while on Margaret Island to stand directly next to the river and enjoy the warm breeze across the water. It is a powerful river, not one you would play in by any means, but it is beautiful to see!

Take a Cruise: the right vantage. It was a beautiful May afternoon. But even if it weren't, I think this would have been the right move. The best view of the Parliament Buildings is from the middle of the river. We took the Hop On, Hop off cruise on the Danube for just 2000 HUF, and it was the best money i've spent in awhile. Commentary was helpful. Trip just the right length.

Spectacular Danube in Budapest. If you are visiting Budapest for just one night, make sure to take a river cruise for a relaxing night out and a spectacular visual experience. The river Danube flows through the middle of Budapest— and this geographical location makes it truly unique. Enjoy Budapest’s lavishly illuminated UNESCO World Heritage-listed urban panorama—the Parliament building, the Royal Palace, the Buda Castle Quarter, the Chain Bridge and the Freedom Monument. the atmosphere is simply electrifying. A must-do experience

boat trip. Nice to see areas of the city from a boat but once you have done one boat trip you've done them all. We had a meal on board and to be honest the food was a little bland and the wine was awful - stick with a beer!
Romantic. I loved walking down the Danube. It was chilly in winter but it's the perfect way to appreciate the beauty of both Buda and Pest on both sides. Absolutely lovely!

Danube River Lunch Cruise. On Apr-20/2015 my wife and I enjoyed a Danube river cruise. We purchased the tour with VIATOR and the company that coordinated the activity was Hungaria Koncet Kft. The cruise coordinator was Mark Fekete.We loved it!. Usually, when you go to a city river cruise that includes lunch or dinner, the problem is that you will likely have to decide where your attention go to, the meal or the view. Mark and his crew figured a great solution to this: The ship does two passes over the attractions, so you can first have your lunch and then you can admire the beautiful Budapest landmarks or vice versa. This is very important because a visit to Budapest without admiring the monuments from the Danube will be frankly incomplete.The lunch consists in a very generous buffet. The menu is very good (I really liked their Goulash!) and one drink (soda or beer) is included and there is a bar where you can purchase additional beverages if so you desire.We highly recommend this tour.
Danube cruises - a must see. Great tour of the city by boat; also wonderful to be seen by night, when all the lights are on. Also, be sure to stop for a walk on the beautiful Margaret Island.
Majestic river. The views of the Danube from above is great. We took the hop-on hop-off bus up to a restaurant with great views and from there are impressive views.
Lovely river. Lovely river with great bridges and boat tours. it is great looking in sunsets! I loved the smell of water in the mornings too. here are monuments on river banks too.

Lovely by day, Exceptional at night. This was the fourth time I have visited this beautiful city and the second time that I have been fortunate enough to do an evening cruise. What could be more spectacular than the illuminated Parliament and Chain Bridge?
nice river, much to see. nice river, much to see, beautiful bridges, cruising options, all you might expect from this, period

Great overview of the city. Got on a 90 mins cruise ride at 7pm and everyone loved it! The cruise gave a great view of the major landmarks of Budapest.
