The staff are friendly and not pushy at trying to sell anything.However, what's lacking was some guide to tell us what we were looking. Hence it will be good to do some homework before going for the cruise.

The Danube by Night. We had our own little boat for our tour group of 16 and took about an hour ride up and back on the Danube to see the illuminated structures on both the Buda and Pest sides of the city. The Parliament building on the Pest side is probably one of the most spectacular sights you will see.Even though the weather may be warm, take some covering as it can get chilly on the river at night.
Not exactly Blue but fantastic scenery. Find one that stops at Margarets Island and return on it later. Go on a sunny day and enjoy all the landmarks either side.

A SHORT CRUISE TO REMENBER. Withe advantage of a beautiful blue sky and sun, the chance of a 2 hours cruise up and down the Danube and enjoy fantastic views of Pest whilst sipping wine and tasting Hungarian food, it was the icing on the cake to finish our visit in glory!
A must. Have a boat trip to appreciate the views. We did a day and a night ride. Would recommend both to get the full benifit

River cruise. Very nice to take a river cruise - but try and take one in the evening when everything is lit up. Try and take one of the better operators - we used one that had pianos on the boat -charming

Night cruise. We did a night cruise as part of our hop on hop off bus deal. It was brilliant and so beautiful at night with all the bridges being illuminated and also the various buildings of note on both sides of the river. One tip though, it had been a lovely sunny day but we were extremely cold on the upper deck of the boat - taken something warm with you!

The best way to see Buda and Pest. A slow ride by the public transport boats was perfect for admiring the architecture and lay-out on both banks of the river. If you want return more quickly, get off at any stop and take a bus, tram or subway back!
Beautiful!. Very romantic even it is not "blue"!The scenery along the river was beautiful, the villages were very picturesque.Highly recommended

Danube River Cruise. The cruise through the Danube was excellet. The scenery is fantastic and the cities visited were very well preserve and beautiful. My husband and I really enjoy it. Was very relax.
Just Lovely. Almost feels a little like London's Embankmant//Southbank!Beautiful views across to 'Buda' especially at night when the palace is all lit up!

Romantic Danube River Cruise on AmaPrima (AmaWaterways). Never would have thought about doing a river boat cruise, but was offered an opportunity to join a friend and the experience was AMAZING! Many people hear more about Viking Cruise Lines for riverboat cruising, but AmaWaterways goes above and beyond and delivered the most amazing experience. While I was traveling with friends, I can see this as more of an experience for couples or small group of friends. The staff and service were impeccable! The ship was modern and the perfect space. It's basically the same size of ship that Viking uses, but take approx 30 less passengers. Instead, AmaWaterways makes room for a gym, and small massage area and a small salon area. Price includes meals and alcohol during meals (wine and beer), and most excursions. Everything was well planned and executed. I look forward to taking another river boat cruise again in the future, and will make sure it is done on a AmaWaterways ship. Truly and amazing experience. Traveled on the Danube River through Germany, Austria, Slovakia and Hungary. A beautiful journey.

Ever changing but never blue!. We were in Budapest in April and spent a lot of the time exploring along the river. It is a wonderful area from which to view central Budapest, the parliament buildings are beautiful, especially when illuminated by night, the bridges provide wonderful aspects over the river and Margaret Island in the middle of the river is a haven from the city hustle where one may walk or cycle safely. A cruise up or down the river from the city gives an excellent perspective of the city and most boats offer multi lingual commentaries.

Danube Tour. Don't visit Budapest without visiting the Danube the Danube Tour! Not only is it picturesque but after viewing The Royal Castle, walk through the cobblestone village and visit the hundreds of little shops and cafes of Szentendre
Delightful Danube!. The sights along the Danube - the palaces and castles and museums are absolutely amazing. It is particularly beautiful in the evening when it is all lit up!
Not blue but grey. We crossed over 4 bridges and walked up and down the river quite a few times. Wrap up well as a strong breeze can chill you.

Budapest Spectacular at night from Danube Cruise. Seeing Budapest for the first time by night from the top deck of our Viking River Cruise Ship was breathtaking! We sailed into Budapest about 10:30 PM and it was all floodlit and even the bridges were outlined in lights. We cruised up and down the river several times giving us close-up views of all the sights. Its something I'll always remember.

The Danube. The river Danube passes through the hart of Budapest and to see how beautiful it really is you must see it at night with all the lights on from across the river from the houses of parliament
river cruise. Big Bus trip included a relaxed trip on the river allowing sights of the buildings and bridges from a different angle.lovely staff on board provided a light snack and coffees.

The best way to see Budapest. The Danube in Budapest is like no other river in the world. It is so peaceful and the bridges are amazing structures. We visited it in late April and it was the perfect time to be there. You feel like you can travel back in time while taking a river cruise the Danube.

A different perspective. A walk by the side of the Danube is better way to absorb into the wonderful sights of the city. The boat trip could be recommended for those traveling short on time. And not to mention the sight of the Hungarian Parliament Building which is best viewed by the boat. So if you have the time, you should go for it.

The Danube River Front at Night. Buildings along the river are illuminated at night, much like Paris. Our riverboat relocated from Buda to Pest in the evening. We "cruised" the waterfront for about an hour. Saw the bridges lighted.All of this time we were on the riverboat with a bar. Not a bad evening.

A Beautiful River Ride. Don't leave Budapest without taking one of the major river rides offered. Both regular sight-seeing and dining cruises are offered and provide a different perspective of Buda and Pest than one gets solely from land-based exploration.
Riverside splendour. Parliament building is so architecturally beautiful. You must take the River Ride - a regular coach which also sails the river - amazing and such a unique gimmicky experience.

Ok boat trip but you can see most of the sights on food. We did the boat trip on the Danube and found it a bit lacking. It was crowded and yes ok it might entertain children and be good for those with walking difficulties, but if you can, walk a good part along the Danube on foot, it is much better. For the rest of the sights, take Tram No 2 you actually get to see more than you can from the boat.

Walk the Danube. You can simply walk the river both day and night to see how beautiful the city is. We walked the river from the Hungarian Parliament to the Elizabeth Bridge. Both day and night it is very pretty. On a sunny day it is remarkable.

Sapphire On The Danube. by Morris, SwanageHome | Cruise Reviews | APT River Cruises | Travelmarvel Sapphire | Sapphire On The Danu...  awardsSapphire On The Danube.Overall Rating: 5 0 views Cruise Line: APT River Cruises Cruise Ship: Travelmarvel Sapphire Destination: River Danube Reviewed By: Morris, Swanage on 29th Apr 2015 We booked this river cruise as a first timer for all of us - we travelled with my wife's 2 sisters and their husbands, after I had succumbed to a 2 for 1 offer through Cruise.co, and sold it to the rest of the family. The APT site doesn't say too much about the Sapphire, and I was a bit anxious that I might have persuaded others to a second class trip. However, this was certainly not the case! Our bargain deal was the result of locks being closed on the Danube, so that we had to make the last 2 destinations by coach - but it didn't really matter. We flew by BA to Budapest, and then joined the boat - staff were really welcoming, and the boat is extremely comfortable. Our cabin was the best we have yet encountered - plenty of space, a very comfortable 6ft wide bed with room to vanish our cases underneath, and a very nice bathroom with a glass door shower and room to move. The big difference between river and ocean cruising is that we had a full width glass patio style glass door to look out of, rather than a porthole or small window - lie in bed and watch the ever changing river bank drift by. All meals were excellent also, in a pleasant dining area, and with dinner offering a minimum of 4 courses, with a main choice of meat, fish (including pike and char) or veggi. They are not niggardly with the inclusive wine either - refills throughout the meals ( I have heard that other lines are less generous). Our stops each day included Bratislava, Vienna, Durnstein, Linz, Regensburg and Nuremberg - tours were well organised in parties of 20-30, with excellent guides and vox boxes so that one can keep up and hear all the details. Enormous thanks to the Cruise Director Herbert Hutter, who arranged all this, and who also helped me personally with my suitcase which BA managed to misplace when we flew, but which eventually caught up with us in Vienna! We were very taken with the whole experience, which will certainly make us want to go river cruising again in the future - friendly, high quality and fun!Times cruised before: 3-5 Sailed: April, 2015 Age: 65+ Cabin: Outside Occasion: Family holidayQuality of FoodOnly one dining area; all meals excellent, with a chef cooking fresh omelettes in the mornings, and an excellent choice at dinner5 EntertainmentA good range of evening entertainment, including an Oompah Bavarian band and an Aussie singer/guitarist5 Shore ExcursionsAll shore excursions were excellent5 StaffOur waiter Marta and wine waiter Milly were excellent, and nothing was too much trouble5 Children's Facilities0 Onboard ActivitiesA riverboat, so no casino/shows etc. Good cabin television service.4 CabinsYes! Very comfortable, with an excellent bed and bathroom. It exceeded Fred Olsen and RCI cruise ships we have been on previuosly0 Overall Rating5
River is picturesque. goes through the middle of the old city. Most of the sites are situated within view of the river. Had a great dinner night cruise on the Danube

Stunning and Moving. The Danube is perfect for a stroll or for the more hardy walkers, go by foot or take the river cruises, many options throughout the day, personally I would walk during the day and see the sights, outside parliament building and the immortalised bronze shoes, the princess statue, the trams, the palace etc. Take the river cruise of an evening either with dinner buffet or a la carte or just a ride as the city lights up and is stunning.

Wide Danube. The Danube flowing through Budapest is very wide, and if you get a chance to visit the Bastion/Castle District you get a sense of how wide especially the area by Margaret Park which sits in the middle - the Danube seems to split to accommodate it. Re: short cruise. We took an hour evening cruise of the Danube. We started before sunset and finished by the time the buildings were all lighted. It was a spectacular sight. We did this on our last night in Budapest. It was worth it seeing the city lights while cruising the river.
Yes!. Everything about it is magical. Take the boat during the day and at night. It was wonderful. Two boat tours came with our tour pass. Not to miss!

Danube dinner cruise. My friend and I went on the dinner Danube cruise with live music. It was a great experience! The boat we were on was a rather large one, which was good as there was a decent sized group of people. The views from the Danube itself were great, especially as it was becoming dusk/night and the lights of the sights came on. It really is a dazzling view! The buffet dinner was good. We received 2 included drinks- a welcome drink and some wine with dinner, and you of course had the option to buy drinks separately. Budapest is a walking city. Stroll.... Get off the tour bus, walk across the chain bridge, take a stroll, catch one of the trams. It really is hard to get lost, there are lots of landmarks, I like to watch for the Ferris Wheel, or Parliament. It is an extraordinary walk, with many lovely cafes and landmarks. Buy a metro pass, if you are in town for 3-5 days they are a great value and give you access to all city buses too. You will eventually find a bus or a tram or a metro line, and your way back to the Danube. It is a great way to explore the city- when you buy your coffee ask questions, the staff will help you
danube. beauty, beauty, beauty, buildings along the shore, beauty, beauty, beauty, beauty, beauty, beauty, beauty, beauty, river cruise, beauty

Viking Cruises Danube Waltz. We just returned from a Viking River Cruise, Danube Waltz. We added the 3 night Prague and 2 night Budapest stays. The Viking staff were all very knowledgeable, professional and very courteous. I just wanted to give a little insight into the Viking experience for those of you considering booking with Viking. First, the air was not paid for by Viking until very close to departure. This means that you cannot reserve or pay for advance seating until very near to departure. Their choice of flights and connections are not always what we would choose for ourselves. Of course, American Airlines canceling our flight the morning of our trip, had nothing to do with Viking, however, I would never have booked the flights they chose to book for us to begin with. If you choose to do your air with the Viking "special" air package, there is no upgrading allowed. When our flights were canceled and changed, I advised the Viking people immediately of our change in arrival plans and was told that they would do all they could to have someone meet us upon our new arrival time. As I was giving them 15 hours notice, I would have expected a more favorable reply. They did meet us with no issues, but it left me a bit apprehensive through my entire flight. Our transfers and baggage upon arrival were all handled quite well. Arrival and check in at the Sheraton Prague was smooth. The staff at the hotel were helpful and very friendly. The hotel was a first class hotel with an amazing breakfast full of local foods, cereal, eggs to order, breakfast meats, fruits and the most delicious choice of breads I've ever seen at a hotel. This was not a luxury hotel. The rooms were well appointed with a large bathroom, shower only, heated towel rack and the normal amenities. There was a safe in the room as well as a hot pot to make instant tea and coffee. The rooms were very clean. They had free in room wi-fi as well as a work area in the lobby. The hotel is in a good location, near the underground and a strip club right next door! All the advertised "included" tours are city tours. There are no great tours included with the package. We chose an optional tour to the Terezin Concentration camp for 40 euro pp. It was a full day tour that should have been 1/2 day and 1/2 the price. Lunch was included and was good, but they really had to stretch to make this a full day tour. We all agreed the guide was simply wasting time in the end to make this a full day. She had plenty of time to let us shop at the local square, but chose to drive us around the streets, park and have us walk up a steep hill just to see the view, which was nothing to speak of. We were all a little disappointed with this excursion. In the evening we chose to take the Folklore excursion for 50euro pp. This was a very enjoyable evening with decent local food and good local entertainment. As this was the second day of the three day Prague add on, it gave us a very good chance to meet and get to know the others that would be on our cruise. On our travel day to the ship, we arrived into Passau very late, just in time for dinner. There were a few delays along the way, but it was a fairly enjoyable 3 hour drive. The scenery was beautiful and very well narrated. The Viking tour guide was full of information and passed around quite a bit of her own literature along the way. Our luggage was immediately delivered to our cabins as we were the last group to arrive to the ship, there were no other groups in the way. My luggage arrived broken, and I was not very pleased with the first response from the Viking crew member who suggested maybe it arrived broken! I was very quickly aided by the ships hotel manager who had it fixed and returned to my cabin in a few days. We had a balcony cabin on the second (middle) deck. Cabin 225. The cabins on this ship, (Viking Var, long Ship) are the smallest cabins I have ever stayed in, and I have taken approximately 22 voyages. This was, however, my first river cruise. The cabins are appointed like any other cruise ship I have been on. The toiletries are a little better, L'Occitane. Other than that, there is nothing at all I could find that would make this cruise as expensive as it was. EVERYONE on this deck was complaining about the noise. The water and toilet system runs through pipes over head. It is the MOST annoying and obnoxious sound. This noise was non - stop throughout the entire cruise!!! We heard many people complaining about it at the desk and it was even referenced when the Cruise Director was asking us to fill in our comment cards at the end of the cruise. He asked that the crew not be judged for the "possible noises we may have heard during the cruise". I am totally convinced this is an issue with these "new" long ships and that each and every one of them must have the same design flaws. The only people on the ship that did not complain about the noise were those on the upper deck, 3. I tried to keep an open mind and not judge too harshly, but for this very reason, I would most likely never take another Viking Cruise again. If I do consider it, I would only consider a cabin on the upper deck.The food on the ship is a step up from the mega ocean cruise lines in the United States, but certainly not as good as the specialty restaurants offered for additional fees on the mega ships. The Viking staff did a good job of getting meals out to 160 people, but most meals were served warm. The coffee was never hot and the drinks were always warm. The best coffee was served from automated machines at the aquavit lounge. Breakfast was quite good, with eggs cooked to order and trays of sausage, bacon and other breakfast items. The milk for cereal was always warm and although pitchers were labeled cream, I'm sure they were not. There were options of a buffet or cooked to order from the kitchen. There was a continental breakfast offered on the upper deck each morning. There was always a good selection and choice for lunch and dinner. Good Wine was served for free with lunch and dinner and they were VERY generous with it. There was very little entertainment on board. I think there were two nights where they brought on local talent to entertain. There was absolutely nothing to do on the ship while on board other than read or watch the scenery. This was not really a problem as nights usually ended early. They made you depart on tours each morning by 8:30am. There were two afternoons where we cruised during the day. Other than that, there was very little time to actually see the banks of the Danube while cruising. Most cruising was done during the evening and overnight. The ship goes through quite a few locks to acclimate to the different water levels. They did not tell us about that before the first one an it can a little scary at first. It seems Viking had done some polling and discovered that people do NOT like all the announcements. So, they have chosen to make as few as possible. This means you very rarely know what is going on. None of the announcements broadcast into your room, so if you are not in a public area, you won't hear what few announcements they do make! The small, intimate setting of the ship really was quite enjoyable. We got to meet and talk to almost every guest while on board. We met a core group of people that have now become great friends and we all hope to vacation together in the future. Our two night Budapest extension was a nice cap to our trip. I would definitely recommend it. Viking placed us at the Le Meridien Budapest hotel which was horrible! They call this hotel luxury, which it is not by any means. The lobby was wonderful and had all the charm of an old luxury hotel. The rooms were huge but very, very old. There was no air conditioning in the room or anywhere else in the hotel. The bathroom has no outlets, but it did have a heated floor to add to the overall room temperature of 90 degrees! The location was very good, right in the center of everything. The breakfast was okay. They offered a lot, but again the coffee was not hot and all the milks and juice were warm. The waffles were put out in a stack and were cold. They were not friendly and almost seemed as if they were annoyed to be there and have to serve you. In general, the cruise was very nice. In my opinion, there was NOTHING about this cruise that warranted the $11,000.00 price tag. It was nice to have Viking take care of all our transfers and hotels, but definitely not worth the price tag. I realize that there are limited choices for this type of cruising, however, there were many other companies we saw along the river that seemed to mirror the Viking ship we were on. I think Viking's marketing budget is what makes it popular, not their product. I would definitely look into the other options available before booking my next river cruise.

Danube walking tour. wow so romantic and historic and what else can you say. flabbergasted at the sights. so many people so many things to see. definitely worth a repeat visit.

Beautiful!. We took a river cruise up the Danube from Romania. I recommend this direction as the scenery got more beautiful as we went along. Budapest is a beautiful city, both day and night!

Romantic Danube Itinerary on Viking Freya. Our itinerary for a group of 12 started out with a 3-night stay in Prague and then boarding the Viking Freya in Roth, Germany for a 7-night cruise on the Danube with a final destination of Budapest, Hungary. We chose to take the trip in mid-April because we added a stay in Amsterdam (on our own) to experience the spring tulips. We were extremely fortunate that we had the best weather possible. The week before we left, it was cold and even snowy on the Danube. We were also lucky that the winter was not bad in Europe so the locks were open and able to be navigated. Some posts complain that their cruises ended up being land tours. That's something that spring departures face and there is nothing that can be done about that. Check with your travel agent on details and for the best times to book your cruise.Although experienced travelers (I am a travel agent myself), this was the first river cruise for all of us. There were some definite distinctions between ocean and river cruising and some similarities as well. The obvious are one unpacking, meals included, short stays at each port. The biggest differences are that the small group makes it much more intimate; there is no open ocean to contend with; and, our river cruise experience was much more active than any ocean cruise we took.If you take the Nuremberg to Budapest itinerary, keep in mind that you depart from Roth, Germany so upon arrival at the dock you may be quite disappointed and question the location. But, not to worry, you're on the canal until you reach Passau. If you have more than four people in your group, I would suggest you not try to eat meals together at one table. I believe our larger number made it difficult for the kitchen and waitstaff to get everyone's dinner to the table hot and we had some complaints over that. The ship does not take reservations or hold tables for guests, but we ended up getting a large table every night and I think it would have been better if we hadn't.If the extra price for the French Balcony is affordable, I would suggest going for that over the window only cabins. However, you literally spend very little time in the cabin so whatever you are comfortable with price wise you can make work. Window cabins are on the lower level. The cabins are comfortable with good showers and water pressure and the ship is kept spotless.You can have breakfast and lunch on the terrace if you want something lighter and dinner is served in the dinning room at 7:00 pm. There is a newsletter delivered to your room with the following days activities, information on the day's destination and times just like on an ocean cruise. Coffee, tea and cookies are available throughout the day. Water is provided before each excursion. Beer, wine and soft drinks flow freely during lunch and dinner and if you are not married to a specific wine or brew what is served is usually local and sufficient. Anytime other than meals, beverages are at your expense, but the price is not exorbitant. We did not take the spirits package and for us that was a good decision.I personally found all the food quite good. I would not consider it exceptional, but I enjoyed every morsel. My only comment is that I would have liked to see a little more local food served.I was very surprised at how active the cruise was. Every day there is an included tour, most of which offered a leisure version for anyone who was concerned about too much walking. We like to see and do as much as possible, so we took advantage of the regular tours. Then there are optional tours - at least one a day - that you can take as well; or, stay on the ship and relax; or, go out into the villages/cities on your own. The optional tours are extra (usually about $49 per person). I would have preferred to know what they were before we left so that we could have planned better, but you are briefed the day before and then must sign up that day.The tour guides were by far among the best I have ever experienced. Kudos to Viking for selecting the best of these very knowledgeable professionals. It is suggested that you give $2 per person per tour guide and $1 per person per driver for every tour you take, so plan that into your budget as well. Gratuities are shared by the staff and for a 7-night cruise it amounts to about $100 per guest as suggested. If you have an exceptional server or bartender or cabinperson, you can certainly give them a little more personally.For our ship, we couldn't say enough good things about Cruz in the dining room and Ben and George in the lounge - absolutely wonderful and made our trip that much more special.The staff, including the Captain and Head Chef, were very accessible and would often appear in the dining room or public areas. There seemed to always be something going on. The staff participated in a game show for the guests, there were three nights with musical entertainment and lectures and informational segments on several occasions.Going from Roth to Budapest requires traveling through over 25 locks. When they ship arrives at a lock at night, it can be a bit bumpy and one night the engines seemed to grind quite a bit. But, other than that, you seem to just float along in relative calm.If you take all the tours, there isn't a lot of time for shopping which can be a little disappointing, but then it depends on what you want out of your trip. On this itinerary for the optional tours we totally enjoyed the visit to Weltenburg Abbey and the Bavarian Cruise, Anita, our concierge, booked an evening concert for us in Vienna that was one of the highlights of our trip. (Viking was offering an opera evening which we chose not to attend.) We also went on an excursion to the Thermal Baths in Budapest, which was much longer than necessary. I would suggest doing this on your own.Make sure to spend some time in the Village of Melk if you can - I would love to go back myself. Once you leave Melk, you start to travel through the Wachau Valley. Make sure you get a drink and a chair on the upper deck with your camera ready and enjoy some amazing scenery!!!There were a few docks where we tied up adjoining sister ships - so what??? We got to meet a few more people as they walked through our lobby or we through theirs. The demographics for river cruises are people over 55 and on our ship there were about 3 or 4 couples who were in their 30's. They seemed to enjoy it just as much as the rest of us. All in all this was a great experience and I think Viking lived up to our expectations and in many instances surpassed them.

River cruise on the Blue Danube. I highly recommend cruising the Blue Danube with Grand Circle Cruise Line. The staff was awesome! They catered to your food and beverage choices. The staff remember your name and always greet you by name ~ I loved that!

Great. So good we went on the boat trip twice. The boat trip came with the green bus tour. Basic boat, we were not welcomed on the boat and nobody to see us off the boat. The view of the Parliment is fantastic.
Do the night trip!. Travelling down the Danube at night, passed the Parliament buildings and Palace is like being in a fairy story - it is magnificent.
Amazing. Went to see the Shoes on the Danube, it was quiet amazing really. The sun was beaming done and just to think of the hell those people went through was quite humbling.

Massive river. Ok, stating the bleeding obvious... but it is quite a sight! The view down it is great and there are some lovely river cruises. In Budapest, we took the Legenda river tour. For about a tenner each, you get a headphone-guided tour, a glass of something yummy on the way to Margaret Island (we chose wine) and some lemonade on the way back. Margaret island is worth a stopover. In general river terms, it's really long, wide and wet, with clearly a strong current. It's a bit murky, there are lots of ducks and lots of rubbish along the edges.

Beautiful. This is one of the most stunning aspects of the city. A must see if you are in Budapest. We walked all 4 bridges across the Danube River. Each one beautiful and special in their own way. The Green bridge is an amazing. The Chain bridge was my favorite.

Wonderful buildings along the banks.. We booked the hop on hop off bus and it included two boat trips. we got on at the Elizabeth Bridge and went up the river and around Margaret Island. We were able to get off and explore the island. There were vouchers included for a one hour free cycle ride. This cost 6000 huf . The total for two days, and if you wanted it to include the night boat you could pay an extra 1000.( 1000 = 3.69 euro). On the boat you see many of the beautiful buildings of Budapest including the outstanding Parliament building.We unfortunately picked a cold day but this did not distract from the bueaty of the buildings.

Budapest generally - great river views and very walkable city. I loved Budapest! Budapest airport was easy to navigate and the information desk and public transport ticket office were very helpful. Get a map there. It was easy and cheap to get a ticket on public transport to the city (bus 200E from outside the terminal to the last stop, then on the train to wherever your accommodation is - need two tickets - one for bus and one for train). I found the public transport system to be excellent - very short waiting time for trains, easy to understand maps and convenient stations. Buying a ticket around the city is easy as they are all the same price for a journey (bus or train). Orientation is pretty easy as well as the Pest side is flat and Buda hilly, the river runs north south and the bridges are all different and identifiable. Take a free walking tour (triptobudapest.hu) to get great tips about the city and culture. I took the general tour, jewish district tour and communism tour and they were all excellent - locals showing their city. Just leave a tip at the end of the tour.My favorite locations were Buda Castle - fantastic views of the river and the Hungarian Parliament, the Fisherman's Bastion - almost fairytale turrets, the walk along Andrassy Avenue to Heroes Square (take the underground train one way for the underground heritage experience), the eclectic range of buildings in the city in various states of disrepair, the bath houses (can get very busy in the evenings) and of course the bridges and river. You can walk to most places (take decent shoes) and probably should as the food is great (traditionally highly calorific). Try the gulyas!
good exp. we used amphibious bus . That's incredible. It is safe, and I saw a brand new bus .good tour of Budapest
Take the boat. With the hop on hop off pass you can enjoy Budapest from water and land.If the weather is nice go to Margarette island for a walk.....Great city

Beautiful views. We went down the Danube on a river cruise during the day plus again at night. It was lovely to see the different landmarks by day then by night, when the landmarks are lit up at night makes them look different. Absolutely stunning.
Hop on Hop Off City tour. We booked a 48hr Hop on Hop off ticket which included a Boat trip on the Danube, fantastic value for money compared to other City tours.

Not so Blue, Danube!. Having seafaring in our backgrounds, we always like to see the Rivers being used for freight. Here we saw very large barges carrying everything from cars to ballast, oil and containers as well as the long floating hotels used for cruising and the Budapest pleasure craft. The river was murky and running very fast but then it was March, its a long river and would be carrying lots of rainwater.

Danube River Cruise on the AMADOLCE. We just returned from a fabulous cruise down the Danube River on Amawaterway's "AmaDolce." What a spectacular ship & crew! We sailed from Nuremburg to Budapest after a 3 day adventure in Prague and cannot say enough about crew and how they worked to exceed every expectation. Included in the price of the cabin- food, wine with meals, outstanding excursions in every port and even complimentary bikes. We would recommended this company and any of it's river cruising ships!

Extremely windy!!!. its a lovely river and there is lots to see as you walk along it. The only downside that if you go anywhere near the river you are sure to be blown away by a gust of wind which seems to blow right down it!

Nice and romantic!. I recommend a stroll alongside the Danube river, although a great part of it is under construction at the moment. But if that is not possible you should definitely go on a cruise on the Danube, that lasts approximately 1-2 hours and you can see the city from another perspective.
Boat trip. Great views and lovely visit to Margaret island where I lost my hat! Pleasant bike ride and walk. Nice views across to Budapest.
Fast and furious flow.. In the centre of Budapest the flow is strong and so can the wind be.The huge river cruise ships are so low and narrow, but very long that they do not spoil the scene.
River Cruise. The cruises are all about the same in length. We went at sunset which is ideal, as you can see both sides at night.

Take a river cruise. Took a lovely boat tour down the Danube today with Mahart Passnave. I was one of 5 passengers and the only one on the upper deck which was nice! It's a great first introduction to this fantastic city with a bit of history thrown in. Highly recommended
A Dream come true. Have always wanted a trip down the Danube was not disappointed Amazing views and a lovely cruise. A must not miss experience
Great evening. Wonderful food, atmosphere and hospitality. Hidden gem, in the heart of a beautiful city, a must for locals and tourists alike!

Beautiful views. Not a prettier river cruise at night!!! A 5 star must must do!!!!!! Nothing like it any place we have ever been. Just look for a good company we did It on our Viking cruise with champagne.

Such and awesome experience!. Once you take the Danube cruise you will understand a lot about Budapest and its culture. The views are outstanding and you get to see the great architecture of this beautiful city. On my next visit I will take the night cruise. The photos you can take are magnificent!
Cruising on the Danube. No trip to Eastern Europe is complete without a cruise on the Danube. By day or nite, the sights are amazing and the history is mindboggling.
great for a stroll. the sights are great and a stroll along the riverside, on either side, and during the day or the night, is fantastic

The River Is Calling and I Must Go. If you are familiar with the "Blue Danube Waltz" and you sail on the river expecting blue waters, you will be disappointed. Beautiful it is, but to be honest, it's more of a brownish color than blue, thanks to the lime and mud stirred up from the river bed. The Danube's romance lies in the medieval castles, baroque churches and amazing palaces it passes on its way through central Europe, as well as the historic cities that have grown up along its banks.

Stunning. There is a reason why Viking Cruises has half their advertisements in Budapest, the view is breathtaking. Really quite beautiful at night with it all lit up. Taking a night boat tour is a must if you are here, even for one night. Well worth it to relax and enjoy the view. I think it would be great during the summer to take a stroll up and down the banks as well.
Beautiful. A gentle stroll along the Danube is a most.a couple of drinks in one of the bars whilst over looking the river is so relaxing.
Great. A must see at night on a boat cruise. The lights are unreal.Runs through the middle of town.Can see Castle hill from boat.
Brown not blue. The blue Danube was great or brown and definitely not blue in Budaperst Very impressive with lots of bridges and loveley buildings both sides of the river
Out of sync. If you can get a live commentary get it. We had a prerecorded one, which was around 10 minutes after the boat trip, which means we were around 2 bridges.

beautiful Danube. we took a boat cruise with lunch on the Danube and it was wonderful. The food was an all you can eat buffet of a very high standard, not the usual fare. Lots to choice from and all delicious.

A walk by the Danube. A lovely clean river framed by beautiful buildings on both sides. The paths alongside made walking and viewing easy. Be mindful if it is cool the breeze off the river is quite cold, so dress accordingly.

View the river from every vantage point ...day and night. ...and if you can, take a sight-seeing touring of the Danube Bend on the river itself. Try to imagine time before time when your ancestors possibly lived here, near, or traveled past on their way to where.

Worth taking a Cruise. Budapest is 2 cities that meet at the Danube. Buda and Pest. The view of the combined city from the river is gorgeous. Better than many cities in Europe. Manu tour boats available. Well worth the money.
Blue Danube. It really is blue, even in February. A lovely river that is the heart of Budapest - walk beside it, take a boat trip.
The Blue Danube. You cannot go to Budapest without going on the Danube, some of the buildings are so impressive from the river that are difficult to photograph from the the banks. it is a must

Well It's Not Blue But.... It's always fun to see places and things mentioned frequently in literature, music and history. The Danube is iconic in all of these. The Danube is more than 2,000 km long and runs through 10 countries. It's a must see for these reasons. It is not, however, blue.

On the River. We were blessed to have a hotel, the Marriott, right on the blue Danube which was brown from the Mountain runoff....... A beautiful city with friendly people, great sights and wonderful food and beer.

Nice day-time river cruise at no cost. It was very useful to know the water-tram tours on Danube are covered by the day (24, 48, 72-hours) tickets.I would say that travelling from one end to another is a perfect experience as it allows seeing both Buda and Pest from the river because the boat is zig-zagging and stopping on numerous stops and it gives you a perfect opportunity to enjoy the best views. It is very convenient on both good weather - enjoying fresh air and rainy days as well - good alternative to staying half the day in the cafe or walking in the rain. The whole trip can be wel over one hour but you enjoy it taking pics and sipping your wine or whatever you brought with you. In warm season visiting Margit island will be a must - they call it lungs of Budapest. Very interesting and affordable!

Spring Break. Big Bus Tour and free river Cruise, great history with some excellent views.Extremeley cheap to eat and drink especially if paying in local currency, it costs more if you use Euros.Make sure you visit before Hungary joins the Euro in 2020

A lovely walk. A beautiful river to walk along, you can see a lot of the amazing sights that Budapest has to offer; walking along the river as the sun is rising/setting is truly breathtaking. I would also highly recommend taking a river cruise on the Danube, as it allows you to see the city from a new perspective.

The cruise - wow!. If you are in Budapest, do not miss the night cruise on the Danube. There are many operators and the cruise is typically an hour long. The beautifully illuminated historical buildings along the banks are sights to behold. The commentaries are in English and probably in other languages.
History. A big, lazy, splendid river. Stand on any of the bridges and watch it flowing beneath. You can feel that it's been there for centuries.

Water, water, and more water. We have walked the embankment of the Danube. There is a lot to learn of the river and what it has to offer. There are boat cruises and it also offers great views of Gellert Hill and Castle Hill.

One of Europe's Biggest Waterways. The Danube river is another major attraction in Budapest dividing the city into two. One of the best places in Budapest for an evening walk is along banks of the river.

Beautiful Views. We did a boat tour as part of the Hop On Hop Off tours. It was about an hour overall, although we did spend another hour at Elizabeth Island, walking around. The views of the city(s) of Buda and Pest on either side of the river are so beautiful! It's a very nice, historic ride, and well worth taking a cruise on.

its amazing!. One of those places that doesn't need a rating. just impressive, goes trough buda-pest and is a great walk. No matter the weather nor the mood. Just go for a quick walk, its totally worth it!

Beautiful!. This area was well kept and beautiful during the day and night. In the area you can find water tours for around $5-10 dollars for two days unlimited rides instead of just doing the Big Bus/Hop On Hop Off deals. Lots of historical stories surrounds this location!

Beautiful views; recommend a dinner cruise. I bought tickets for a Danube Dinner Cruise with a friend. It was our first night in Budapest and we thought it would be a great way to see some of the sights as well as try some of the foods, and we were right! The boat had a lovely atmosphere and we felt like we were on a nighttime adventure. The dinner buffet gave us the opportunity to sample all of the Hungarian dishes that we had heard about (potatoes paprikash, chicken and dumplings, goulash, cabbage, etc). It also had some more familiar options for those who are less adventurous (chicken, fish, grilled vegetables, lots of different types of salads) - though I recommend at least trying some of the Hungarian items so you have some idea of what to order when you're in a sit-down restaurant later on in your trip. After eating dinner, we really enjoyed drinking a glass of hot mulled wine while bundled up on the outside deck looking at all the bridges and government buildings on the Buda side. A dinner cruise is a great way to experience the Danube! Especially without having to fight other tourists and sightseers for the best view of the river in the daytime.
The river of Budapest. I walked by the Danube for many hours it's really beautiful, especially if the weather is good, there are benches to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

Excellent but crowded, the view fills our hearts with joy, perfect location . I went for a conference in Budapest which was in intercontinental hotel. excellent service with the view amazing in such a way that you again come back . in front of the hotel, you can see a person who plays music with glass, superb in it's own way

UNESCO World Heritage. the Danuba panorama in Budapest is on the list of UNESCO World Heritage, and there is a good reason why. Both banks of the Danube, the mightiest European river in Budapest contain breathtaking monuments. Go, see and you will prove me right.

Nice view without the need to walk . Let the boat take you along the river and take in gellert hill. Parliament buda castle and many beautiful bridges. However photos turn out bad due to low lighting condition.

So chilled out. Going down the river danube on a river cruise boat in midsummer, with food and beer on board, a soft breeze and your beautiful Hungarian girlfriend by your side upon first arrival in Budapest is the best welcome I've ever had to a capital city.
Doon the water!. The lifeblood of Budapest, travelling down the river you can see many of the historic sights, the Parliament building etc
Sunny afternoon...... A very pleasant way to spend a sunny afternoon, the views of the parliament building from the river are very good.

Use public transport -better and cheaper. To travel along the front in central pest, use the no2 tram - voted third best tramride in the world.if you want to cruise cheaply on the danube use BKV public transport. Take the underground (or no 4/6 tram to Bereros Ter and catch the ferry there = it criss-crosses the river all the way down to Margaret Island , Cheaper way than getting the commercial ferries from Vigado and just as good a view.

Good Job it was Free. We bought a 2 Day Hop On/Hop Off bus tour ticket, and the Dunayacht tour was included. It sails 4 times per day from Pier 10. Evening tours last an hour, daytime tours nearly 2 hours. You do cover lots of ground and see all the major sights on the river, and lots more sights you might not have known about, or wanted to know about. The recorded description is in English and German; the English one was often quite difficult to hear/understand. Overall, it was a good trip, but I am pleased we didn't pay the normal ticket price (although having done the conversion, it's NOT expensive - 2000 HUF (£5) per person per ticket.)

even more beautiful during night boat trip. Danube during day time is nice but you have to book a night boat trip with dinner to discover the real beauty. Last time when I visited back we went for a boat trip and I was surprised as I have never seen the city from this unique spot. It was beautiful to see the Gellert Spa, Gellert Hill, Nemzeti Szinhaz, Parlament, etc. during night time in their special light bath.

Beautiful river best viewed in this magical city Budapest. Danube cruise in Budapest is like being captivated by architectural splendor all around you. The river truly comes alive in this city both day and night as though the city and her glistening quiet movement whispers secrets into your ears as you stroll Budapest's Danube promenade. The Danube in Budapest is truly the best place to experience this mighty riverway.

The Blue Danube. Don't miss the opportunity to take a cruise along the river when visiting Budapest. Everything looks quite different from the water,and there are views which you would otherwise miss. If you buy a ticket for the hop on hop off bus, the river cruise is included
Danube. Not as blue as the waltz implies but a fascinating river. We enjoyed strolling along it and sitting in the sun on its banks. Crossing the bridge was a memorable experience
Cruise trip. I took 2 hours in it as acruise trip it was at night with good food and romantic views i recommend it if you search for nice and cool views.

Absolutely beautiful, but don't go during the day. Amazing, astonishing, I can't find word strong enough to describe it. The view at the building at night is breathtaking. Hungarians say that they've lit everything that is worth seeing. The Parliament building is the best one. Everyone should go on this cruise.

Have the cruise preferably in the evening!. You cannot complete your trip to Budapest without this cruise to the Danube River.The whole group enjoyed this evening outing, first walked along the bridge and then enjoyed the cruise up and down the river. Preferably have it in the evening. The guided tour was great, each of us had a complimentary glass of bubbly watching the illuminated buildings, the lit bridges in this magic city thinking how nice it would be if the tour never ended.Cost 2.100 forints …worth every penny.

You can't miss it. Well, the Danube is not only the privilidge of Budapest, but runs through so many important cities. In Budapest it devides Buda from Pest that are connected with so many nice old historical bridges. Unfortunately Danube is not that "blue" as the song suggests, but still amazingly beatiful from where ever you admire it; from the hotelroom, from the hill or just during a walk along its shores. Enjoy.
Beautiful. We just admired it. We didn't take a boat cruise or anything but worth seeing and getting some photos.

Night time cruise. Took the Danube Legend after it being recommended and booked for us by the hotel concierge. Very easy to find the dock. Great audio guide and free glass of bubbly. The night time trip is beautiful - the bridges etc all lit up. Very nice to spend the hour cruising up and down the Danube.

Short cruise. We got an hour river cruise included in the price of our Hop on and off Giraffe bus tour. It was interesting to view both sides of the city from the boat. It gives one a good perspective. English commentary helped too.

Amazing view's. No trip to Budapest is complete without a trip on the river danube.By day it is a really nice trip,lot's of interesting sight's and a good insight into the history of this wonderful city.Go by night when every major building is illuminated and you really see the beauty of this city.There are a number of cruiser's to choose from,set tour's ,hop on hop off tour's,and cruise with a meal and a drink, again superb.If you enjoy taking photo's,you will be in your element.I myself think the night cruise is the best,more interesting,but either way a trip on the Danube is a must do while on holiday in this great city.
Take a stroll at sunset. With the castle lit up on one side, and the parliament lit up on the other, it really is absolutely stunning and very romantic.

River Cruise on the Danube with AmaWaterWays. This river offered us wonderful sites, cute towns and cities, warm people and as we went in December, we visited the Christmas Markets of the ports and bought unbelievable gifts for everyone. The art and architecture were breath taking.

Kickin Down the Dube. It's Definitely worth a trip down to see the Danube. Even if it's just to walk there and see food vendors set up in a square, making you look down streets or alleys you might no know existed. The river views may not be as beautiful as other cities, but its cool to see a city splayed out along the river. You get to see the juxtaposition of the old and new played out in the buildings and architecture played out on the rivers edge. I love looking at rivers in cities and getting to see what was, before modern automobiles and planes, the lifeline of goods and transportation.

Stumbled upon the Danube Bend too!. The river itself does not look very clean at all, however on one of our day trips just outside of the city we stumbled upon the Danube bend, it was a small trail up to go see it but totally worth it! We drove up a mountain and saw some signs, very happy we did, later to find out that the Danube is famous for that lookout point!

Part of the Trip. You can't really visit Budapest without walking down by the river at some stage, and if you have you've missed out! Looks a lovely shade of blue on a nice day, if a little murky on a not to clear day. A walk down the Danube is a must.
River cruiseI. Everything was great nothing to much trouble with the staff, fabulous views wonderful food
Take a stroll at night. That's what we did and had some great pics of the parliament building. some of the other sites are are lite up too!

Amazing. There is a hop on hop off bus trip you can avail of in Budapest. It has3/4 different routes with the free being the main one. On the green route we got little booklets where you could get buy one get one free or something for half price. Also included was a cruise on the Danube by day and by night. We availed of both cruises and I have to say an experience I will not forget. I enjoyed both but the one by night was something else. Seen the whole city lit up from castle hill on the buda side to the chain bridge to cross over to the pest side where you had the parliament buildings and the gresham hotel. I would definitely add this to your to do list when visiting budapest

Dinner and cruise. The river trip and dinner were fantastic the sights of Budapest from the river were amazing after dark everything about this Tripp was fantastic my wife was very pleased with this surprise Tripp would recomened this to anyone

Danube Legend. We took an evening into night cruise on the Danube Legend, which was recommended by Rick Steves. A great view of the city as the sun went down and the awesome lights of the city slowly came on. The tour provided you with an audioguide in many different languages so all could enjoy. The plexiglass covering over the boat did restrict picture taking to a degree but kept the night chill out. Most people went to the open area on the boat to take their pictures. A glass of your favorite beverage was, also, included in the trip. Overall, a beautiful trip on the Danube.

Beautiful and must see. The Danube is a must visit place in Budapest. I recommend walking along the river, crossing the bridges by foot and also taking the cruise.
The views are simply amazing, and in nice weather you can't get enough.
visit. the river Danube has the most amazing builds along it plenty to see also the Jewish shoe memorial is out side the parliament building had lovely day just sight seeing take comfortable shoes

2 boat trips day and evening. The evening trip was great seeing the buildings lit up.
The day trip was great to see the bridges.
The boat we were on had inside and an outside top deck.
Drinks were reasonably priced onboard.
River trip. Did a 1 hr boat trip along the Danube - enough information and sights to cover the history of Budapest and the Danube
Fantastic. Went on night cruise up the Danube would reccomend to anyone visiting budapest well worth the 2100 forints each what was paid for the trip the sights were fantastic

Beautiful River Walk. Took the time to take a stroll along the Pest side of the river from the Parliament buildings all the way past the "chain" bridge and down to the next one. The walk was pleasant, flat, well lit and refreshing in the cool spring air. I imagine that during tourist season it may be a madhouse but for me, I had it all to myself.
Hop on hop off. The best value for money is the hop on hop of ticket which gives you 2 days of bus travel and 2 boat trips on The Danube and only costs around £18
Fabulous views. Managed to get a 1 way cruise ferry back from Margaret Island to the main port and the views are spectacular. was very cheap and saved a long walk back.

10 minutes is enough. We went on a Danube trip as part of our Red Bus Hop on/Hop off ticket. The boat was very disappointing being inside, under cover, hence no opportunity to take photos. The views from the river were really only the same as from the bank. We got off after one stop and walked to our next desired destination.

River cruise. We did a river cruise in the evening and it was worth it. After dark with the various sites lit up was wonderful and very romantic. We just booked cruise which included a welcome drink as we did not want to be having dinner and miss any of the sites or rush eating due to length of time the cruise lasted. Our cruise lasted 1 hours and included prosecco which did taste good. I would recommend booking cruise after dark and make sure you get there early so can get a good sit either upfront or on top of the boat.

Lovely Views. We took the boat trip as part of the "hop on hop off" bus tour. Departure times were punctual. It was a beautiful fine day and the historic buildings on both sides of the Danube looked beautiful.The boat itself isn't mobility friendly and trying to gain entry to the top deck wasn't an option, there was also work being done on the inside of the boat which took away from the feel of being on a cruise on the Danube.The tour itself lasted an hour.

Danube River cruise through Uniworld (7 days and nights). Wonderful trip starting in Austria, Germany and Prague. We started in Austria at a b&b then boarded the ship. Wonderful staff who treated us like royalty, lots of beautiful views from the ship, went through several locks and the food was tremendous. We loved all the tours on land and at night there was some entertainment and several speakers who taught us their rich history. The Cathedrals, the Jewish quarters, the friendly people in these countries was amazing. We would love to do it again. A bit pricey but a must do once in a life time at least.

The best point to view all the famous buildings in Budapest is from Danube!. It was a ship tour in the midnight, and it was amazing, didn't see anything more beautifull: passing the house of Parliament, the Bastion, the Bridge.... I guess, it is so romantic if you do this with your love person.... what can be better, to have a glass of shampagne and see the beauty of the city....Unfortunately, if you take the Danube tour it is very short in time, and you start to feel sad when leaving the boat.... same time it is good spare time with friends: something relaxing, easy and usefull, better than going and wasting time in the nightclub.
Moonlit river cruise. Best way to take in the sights of the City and the river. 1 hour 15 min.night cruise with free drink and informative video costs roughly £14. well worth the cost.

A dusk/night boat trip a must do!. We were able to get a boat trip as part of the bus hop on/off tickets. We caught the last one at 17.00 (there are different schedules on/off season) and really was brilliant to ride down the Danube - one of the best part of the trip. They have commentary in english and hungarian, telling you the history of the Danube. Really informative and really pretty.

Take a cruise at dusk to benefit from the beautiful lights. Sit back & relax with a glass of wine on 1 of the many cruise boats.It was great to take a break from all the walking & the buildings are stunning by night.

Romantic Cruise along the Danube!. We did a cruise on the Danube and it was one of the most amazing experience! The entire City is lit-up in the night making it a very pleasurable experience and a delightful visual as you cruise along the Danube!

Great to Walk along or Cruise on!. The Danube is what makes Budapest what it is ! With great views on both sides,wonderful bridges and great River Cruises which also serve food and drink if required! It is also great to watch the amazing barges navigating there way up and down the River all day!

Relaxing . Nice little get away. Drinks with friends and a beatiful view in the heart of Budapest. Hop on, hop off boat ride was what we got on and it was reasonable for the bus and boat ride. Two day pass for 1700/adult. Good stuff.
interesting, especially at night. The view from a boat at night is spectacular. The main places to see are the parliament, the castle and the San Mathias church.

Must do!!!. Beautiful sites, views, food as well as lovely hosts and entertainment!!!!
100% recommend going!!!!!
Short daytime cruise. Took short daytime cruise which was a good way to see historic building was relaxing and good value. Not crowded in March 2015

Wonderful to see. The Danube is such a prominent river it was a dream come true to cruise this river. A short evening cruise took in both Buda and Pest enabling one to see the beautiful buildings at night.

heart of this city. This whole city runs round the river. If it nice walk the bridges all very different but can be very cold if it is windy.so get a budapest card and jump on and off trades. Take a boat trip at night the lights are lovely. Dinner cruise are pricey but the food was amazing on the one I went on and if you go as a couple it would be really romantic.

So much to see. The views along the river are varied - numerous monuments, amazing buildings like Parliament, very active river traffic, and incredible people watching. Tram lines running along the river let you see much of that as you go by, but a long walk along both sides of the river will be very rewarding.
Very beautiful. The river is very wide and it seems that has a great flow and its a very nice image to the background of a photo!

Relaxing. It is nice to walk alongside the Danube and enjoy the views of the cities on both sides. Each bridge connecting the cities has got good views. There are many cruises which can be booked at the tourist info center..

Rivertastic. Very scenic and pleasant to walk or jog along the water. The bridges were pedestrian friendly. The river offers great photography opportunities. I recommend visiting at sunset. While everything could be crossed on foot I would recommend using the metro system.
Wow. This is a beautiful river! Walking alongside it on the promenade on the Pest side is fantastic, especially at night.

Evening Dining Cruise. The trip was organised quite well as usual with these events you met in the town and walked to the ship when everyone had gathered.The boat was lovely and clean, the food was hungarian traditional dishes which were delicious.The musicians played a request for each table and were to a high standard. A very enjoyable evening.

Gorgeous River in Budapest. I went at dusk and stayed into the night. WOW! It was beautiful to see from the Citadella Fort above the city. The bridges and their lights are amazing ... along with all the other lights of the city. Be sure to have your camera, extra battery, and extra SD card, or big one. Being a lover of photography, I had a hard time pulling myself away from the panoramic view.

AMACerto on the Rhine. We are ocean cruisers and have taken more than a dozen of them. Going on a river cruise with AMA Waterways was our first and may be our last. We like the freedom and size and diversity of an ocean going vessel. You don't get that on a river boat, Don't get me wrong, AMA did a wonderful job, well worth the cost, it just wasn't our thing. If you get inclement weather and can't take advantage of the top deck for the cruising part, it won't be much fun.The big attraction of a river cruise is to see so many towns and cities along the way, sometimes two a day. If you're into cute little towns, a Rhine river cruise will not disappoint. It can be like an adult Disneyland. We loved all the cities along the way, and in our opinion the best was saved for last...Budapest. If you can stay there an extra day it would be well worth it. And Budapest at night is one of the best parts of the trip.'We may take another river cruise someday if that's the best way to see more towns, but not until we've exhausted all the ocean trips we want to do and the ports of call that are of interest to us.

Nice cruise by night. We booked it before travelling, a night cruise with drinks (not dinner). It was beautiful, including the Musicians. It was quite a different experience getting to know Budapest by night, with all its lights and bridges. Highly recommended.
River Cruise. We took a 1 hour cruise and there were many great sites to see. It was very informative and the crew was very nice.
Beautiful . The sight of Danube, either by day or by night is apsolutely breathtaking. We spent one evening and one morning just walking around and it was apsolutely charming.

Stunning night time river cruise. We pre booked an evening river cruise with Hungaro Concert via the Budapest by locals website *(which I found really really helpful - just google it). Our booking was for cruise, dinner, drinks and live music, and at around £30 a head we thought it was a very good deal. The cruise included a welcome drink, a free bottle of water and 1 other free drink, but extra drinks were not expensive for city centre prices. The meal was a buffet and included a good range of food, although it was a bit of a free for all as you only get 90 minutes on the boat and some guests feel it is an opportunity to eat as much as possible. Bit there was plenty to try and it was a decent meal.The music was wonderful 0 a 3 piece group, 2 violins and a double base and they played a range of music from classical to more modern tunes and some Hungarian folk. . The night was wonderfully clear and the lit up buildings were just stunning. You had the opportunity to to the top deck any time and take photo's which we chose to do several times and we got some beautiful results, but ot was also just nice to sit downstairs and enjoy the view as it went past. They do try and sell you extra's - a photo of your table printed and in a presentation booklet which we bought (about £6 and it was a lovely photo) and CD's of the music which we didn't buy. There wasn't too much of the hard sell, but it was there. This trip was one of the highlights of our stay, It was amazingly romantic and special and just a lovely way to spend an evening and see the beautiful city of Budapest. Highly recommended.

eTake a Majestic Danube Trip Whatever Time of Year You Visit. Budapest is my birth place. Therefore I think I am biased and I believe the Danube is its most beautiful in this City. I travelled up and down on it many times, day and night. It always offers something new. Daytime trip offers an open panorama going up and passing the Parliament and other famous buildings. If you need romance an evening trip is best. You will be masmorised by the lit up bridge's, Halaszbastya, Matthias Church and the hundred of tiny lights on the hills. It is simply sublime.Boat trips are offered day and night and the length and activities are varied too.You can take just a short trip going up to the end of Margaret Island and back again, or you can choose going all the way up to Visegrad or Szentendre, both places are magnificent. Have a good lunch, wonder around on cobbled street in the old part of Szentendre. The time of year will determine your choice. Spring and Autumn are the best but having said that the New Years Eve are something to remember till the rest of your life. The latter is pricey, but you will have everything. Wine, food and entertainment throughout the night.Whatever your choice is it will be a memorable experience. Enjoy your trip on this majestic River!

Focal point of Budapest's visit. The river Danube can be probably considered as the focal point of a visit in Budapest, since many are the wonderful attractions that surround it, but even for the breath-taking views that can be enjoyed from both its banks. The sights are surely exciting in daytime, but even more suggestive in the night, when a very efficient and amazing lighting system highlights the contrast between the darkness and the enlightened buildings.Many cruises are available, for anybody wishing to spend some time for a journey along the river; nevertheless, in my personal opinion, a walk along the banks, or through the several bridges crossing the river, offers the chance to customize the “perfect view”, according to any taste.The overviews from Buda Castle or from the Fisherman Bastion adds the “plus” of elevated position, giving your eyes the further chance to overlook a quite longer portion of the river, with its bridges and the neighboring Pest panorama.The route of historic tram no. 2 follows the Pest side bank, giving the opportunity for a faster “journey with view”, stopping at the several attractions along the river.

Illuminated night river cruise a must do. When you visit Budapest seeing the night illuminations from the river at night is a must see attraction. It absolutely stunning getting a view of both sides of the beautiful city and the illuminations turn it into something magical. Very much worth it

Beautiful and Clean. When I look at the rivers from my country and rivers of Europe, there is a difference of David and Goliath... not in the sizes but in the cleanliness.Danube is very big river which is very clean and Cruises on the river add extra beauty to the river. There are 2 main bridges - chain bridges.I enjoyed the night cruise ride at night which comes as a complimentary from hop on hop off service. The ride was blissful and colorful.

The icon of Budapest . You cannot visit Budapest and not walk the Danube! Best enjoyed from the numerous cruises crossing it or even just jump in one of the many floating restaurants or cafes parked on its sides.

Viking River Cruise and the Danube. We just completed a week long river cruise on the Danube on the Viking River Cruise ship Odin. We went from Nuremberg to Budapest on the Danube. The river is spectral with the locks, scenery, Wacau Valley, picturesque towns and ancient ruins. This is a must cruise to see the beautiful Danube.
River with beautiful bridges. Danube is a river, just like any other river, but what makes this worth-while seeing are the beautiful bridges that connect the two sides, Buda and Pest...

Wow!. The river shows you two cities! Buda & Pest. I walked along the river on both sides. It helps give you a sense of direction, as both sides of the city look quite different. If you get lost just ask where the river is. There are many bridges. Also, on one of the peaks on Pest you can see some WWII landmarks.

A lovely little cruise. We spent a few hours on the river cruise, we went for the cruise that was included in the big bus tour and took the option to add a few drinks which was both worthwhile and excellent value. We were fortunate enough to do the trip at dusk into dark and the city looks spectacular as it begins to light up. Would definitely recommend

Viking Christmas Danube Cruise. We just completed an 8 day cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam, and I must say this was a top of the line experience. The cities from Budapest; with all of its magnificent architecture lit up at night for Christmas, to Melk and Passau and every city in between, left you speechless. The Christmas Markets just got better and better. The weather was warmer while there than it was in Georgia. Our ship experience was 5+ star, with an enthusiastic staff, comfortable nice rooms, excellent cuisine, great wines and other libations, and a ship filled with enjoyable people. The tours arranged by Viking were outstanding and allowed you to see the main attractions in each city visited. This was the best cruising experience I have ever had.

Running along. We went for a walk along the Danube and even though it was raining, I was amazed by the number of persons who were running along the river. It made me wish I was staying more in Budapest.Also, the Parliament was mesmerizing.
Cruise of the Danube. The cruise is a must. Most of the hop-on/off bus offer a free cruise. Great option to click photos of the Chain Bridge, Parliament, Castle, etc.
Nice Danube cruise,but very cold in January.. I dont advise going in January,is too cold,loved all the city churches,avenues, parks, market,pedestrian streets,night tours, bridges.
Magic. A must see at least once in your life, magic place for walinkg and for seeing Parliament and the Castle
Bobbing along.. Amazing city views from the river. An excellent way to get to know the city. A real treat for all. Really loved it.

Tour on the Danube. We took an evening trip on the Danube and we weren't disappointed - The buildings looked spectacular and we learned a lot of history about Budapest. Would recommend a night time trip as definitely has the wow factor!
Beautiful River Views...Truly Rivals Paris!. We did an evening cruise....unbelievable views of bridges & magnificent Buildings...breathtaking! Most Excellent. ..DO GO!

Great sights along the river. Quite the impressive site in Budapest. The whole city appears to be centred around it. Doing a river cruise is highly recommended as many of the spectacular sites of Budapest are located along the river banks. It's equally as impressive to walk along side the river and see all the sites. The river looks incredible from above, such as when you head up the castle, however up close it is a little dirty! Nevertheless it's a great feature of Budapest.

Very informative. We took a river trip in the early evening so we could see Budapest lit up at Christmas. The commentary was very informative although a couple of the headsets weren't working so we swapped around and managed to get everyone listening in. We were given a glass of wine included in the price and really enjoyed the hour on the river. Nice thing to do

OK. The Danube is magnificent to look at, and looks great in pictures (especially from fisherman's bastion and gellert hill). However, if you are thinking of taking a cruise, be aware that many of these trips are long and boring. Audio recordings of guides rambling on about uninteresting facts of the city is draining. Find a good tour operator and good ship.

Best to see Budapest is with public transport boat on Danube. There is also a public boat transport on Danube. You can find the timetables on http://www.bkk.hu/en/timetables/ (D11,12,13,14), For us that was the best way to see Budapest.Fun part is, that the boat goes zig zag among all major attractions, so you can see Parliament,Castle hill, Citadele, Margit island and all the bridges and many lovely buildings along the Danube. And with a 24-hour or 72-hour travel pass the ride is free (Monday-Friday). Otherwise you pay 750HUF.

Lovely. On the day of our cruise it was cold and raining but we had a lovely time. We were given a complimentary drink to warm us up! The boat was really nice and was open all sides to allow us the perfect view! Would definitely reccomend.

River cruise on the Danube. It is such a prominent part of Budapest. We did a night dinner cruise on the Danube, and food was excellent, views amazing even though it was -4C outside the inside was warm and toasty, the staff told us all the sights when asked, it was great.
Night cruise on the Danube. After a day on a tourist bus tour around the city of Budapest ... We went to a night cruise on the Danube. The scenery is amazing. Great attraction and inexpensive

City views from the river. We did a river cruise with Legenda, who I would recommend. Good views of principal buildings and an informative commentary. We did a 3:30 cruise, which was good timing in mid-winter as the first half was daylight but then coming back was dark with the buildings and bridges floodlit.
Very picturesque..... Lots to see walking along both sides...Good vantage point to see key buildings across Budapest. Wrap up warm though if you're visiting in winter. Very cold in the winter wind!
Beautiful river. Clean, wide , peaceful. Made us concierge the Viking river cruises. Bridges were beautiful, intteresting to see locks on the light cages.

The Ribbon of Europe. The river is Europe's biggest after the Volga. The water is fairly clean. Connects several countries. Starts in Germany, finishes is Romania and flows into the Black Sea after app. 2800 km.

What a River. Traveled from Passau, Germany to Budapest, Hungry on the Danbue. Really beautiful River. Surprised at the current in the River. I wanted to do this to get a feel of Eastern Europe and observe how people can continue their lives and rebuild after the Nazi and Soviet occupations. Two wammies! A few folks told me the Nazis were the worst of the 2 for their families. Both bad! I really enjoyed and admired these people and wish only the best for them. They made me feel welcome. Everyplace we went someone said thanks to Americans. Really sounded good.

Evening dinner cruise was wonderful. I am so glad I chose to take an evening dinner cruise on the Danube River during my recent visit. This was the highlight of Budapest! The parliament house, palace and all the buildings along the Danube are lit up beautifully at night, providing a stunning and wonderful sight seeing experience. The pictures I took turned out fabulous, but still did not do justice to the actual beauty of the buildings. I truly enjoyed my time on the Danube!

I'm sure some love it. We took a night cruise... mmm well... I guess we got what we expected, I mean its not bad, you get to see the city from the Danube in all its glory with the lights blazing and hear a commentary while having one drink,. It sure was warm, in fact roasting but it was a a 45 min boat ride that took 90 mins if you arrive 10 mins earlier than the board time then have to wait on a Coach load to arrive through traffic. It was average, but nice staff.

Beautiful Danube. We took a boat tour on the Danube in Budapest. Seeing the sights from the River was fabulous! We took a late afternoon ride and got to see bridges and buildings as the lights came on. It was spectacular!

Ship trip on Danube. We had a night ship trip on Danube. It was cold bud we could go down stairs to the ship restaurant and to sit there. The trip was wonderful. Night Budapest is fantastic. There was a audio guide on 2 languages: English and Dutch. The information was interesting. We enjoyed these one hour trip.

Amazing on both sides. This river is amazing during daytime but even more impressing during nighttime due to the stunning buildings alongside it. Take a stroll on both sides of the river and you will past many must see attractions of Budapest.

We traveled to Budapest from Amsterdam on a Uniworld cruise. A night cruise on the Danube through Budapest is priceless. This city has most of its famous sites along the Danube lit up at night. It is a gloriously beautiful city along a fabulous river. The Danube is the perfect way to get an overview of the city.

Awesome River Sights!. The views of the Danube along Budapest are breathtaking whether day or night. There are so many interesting buildings to see from either side of the shoreline and the Chain Bridge just adds to the majesty. It is especially beautiful at night when the lights from both sides sparkle and enliven the skyline.

I love everything about the Danube. I grew up by it, I come back to it every year. I know I'm home when I see the Danube. Do not miss this beautiful and majestic river, especially in Budapest... after dark.
One hour boat cruise is worth a go.. You get an overview of the landmarks along the Danube and a free drink. Lasts an hour. Night time is lovely because you see everything with lights.
this river is amazing. Danube is passing heart of the budapest, i stayed in Pest side. When i was crossing the bridge to watch the danube...thats amazing view...
