Beautiful views. During the week we spent in Budapest we walked along the Danube almost everyday and spent most of our time along here. Like most places some areas are nicer than others but there is always something to look at. Best to go at night when you can see the Parliament and the bridges light up, we even managed to catch a beautiful sunset on our final night which was the perfect ending to our winter break.
Great Architecture. I have seen it in the sightseeing bus tour.then we hopped off and made a quick visit.my impression can be summarized in one word "Wow "
Great river views. Stunning river and amazing day/evening views - be sure to take a river cruise during your visit, so many great sights right at the river edge

Beautiful river Cruise on the Danube. We took a cruise, not the dinner one,but when we bought the Green Hop on Hop off bus tour their is a Danube Cruise included in the ticket,which was about an hour,with a good commentary of historical facts.Hot dogs ,and mulled wine can be bought on the boat.It was all we needed to enjoy the ride.

Budapest during the winter holidays. Having wanted to take a trip to Budapest during the holidays for an entire year, I finally went albeit for an all too short 24 hours. The sites were beautiful celebrating Hanukkah and Christmas as well as the new year. The only regret is not having more time in one of my favorite cities in Europe.

Ferry tour,worthy experience . We had a delightful tour along the river and luckily it was sunny and we could stay on the ferry deck. The view of both parts of city from Danube is very distinctive,thanks to the monumental parliament and the hill of citadella. You can sightsee from a different perspective.

Not blue. The river is about 1km wide at Budapest. We liked the different styles of bridge which span the river there. The water is brown, rather than blue. Cruises can cost anything from about 10-12 Euros (for a simple daytime cruise) to 70-80 Euros (for a nighttime cruise with a meal and drinks). The nighttime views of the city are lovely, it has to be said!
The best Postcard of Budapeste. The heart of Buda and Peste...the historical castles and buildings, the bridges - some are so beautiful and interesting, the river itself.

Among the best river side walks. The river walks and views are great on both sides of the river with lots of places to see. You can spend a lot of time here just walking , sitting and enjoying the sites. Lots of places to stop for a drink n bite
Looking nice. It is really great experience to walk alongside this river in Budapest! City architecture and night lights looks amazing!
the Blue Danube. Walking along the river was exciting. The vistas of the old buildings were amazing.The bridges were easy to cross by foot and very safe

Danube boat trip. The boat trip was lovely with live music and well worth the money but we had bad weather.The trio on board were very accomplished and friendly and it was possible to have just a drink or a drink and a meal (which looked top notch);

NOT BLUE BUT BEAUTIFUL. Just walking by the Danube river in Budapest is atraction by itself. It must be splended in sunny days cose ours was rainy, and in the same time so nice. Bridges are so nice to cross over river many times and whic one is niciest? I can spent days walking here.....and my kids love it.

Must Do When You're in Budapest. I bought hop on hop off ticket, and it's including ticket to have one hour cruise in Danube River. It's amazing experience to see those two cities (Buda and Pest) in the same time. Buda on the left side and Pest on the right side. We passed many beautiful and historical buildings, including Hungarian Parliament Building, Buda Castle and many more. For sure, it's must thing to do when you're in Budapest.
Unique experience!. Its just a unique experience to navigate at Danube's river for an hour. Passing thru Patliament and Island is just incredible. A must do tour!!!
Hop on, hop off bus river cruise. We took the boat trip as included in the red bus tour. The river was beautiful in the dark, with the buildings on both banks illuminated. Great way to spend an hour

Not in winter!. Gray and cold--went on the included river tour for hop on/off and the small ship left a lot to be desired with an inaudible commentary and very basic facilities.Really not recommended in wintertime.

Follow the river on foot. This wide river is not the 'Blue' Danube conjured up by Johann Strauss' waltz, but a rather murky grey one. However, it divides the old town of Buda from its modern Pest and is thus an ideal route to follow when sightseeing. The city is easy to visit on foot and many of the well-known sights border the river. You can also take a boat to view them from the river itself.

Viking Riverboat Odin Nov.2014. We had the opportunity to take a last minute offer on the Danube river aboard Viking's Longship Odin. Our trip was over Thanksgiving week and we traveled from Nuremberg Germany to Budapest Hungry. We had been on one other Viking riverboat cruise and were familiar with their new Longships . Much to our delight the Odin was as nice as our previous cruise on the Rinda. Our room was one of the nice suites, and having a separate room to relax and entertain our travel companions was a treat. The suite was very comfortable and kept very clean. Let me commend the staff on our ship. They were absolutely fantastic. From our delightful housekeeper Julia, to the Hotel Manager Kornelia and Radim our Program Director. I must also give the Executive Chef Andreas the highest of marks. He took such pride in his food and would visit each table after dinner to hear our comments of the meal. At breakfast each morning he would place a homemade cookie on our plate just for a sweet addition. He was a delight. We had fun with all the staff that we became acquainted with and they all did as much as they could to make our trip enjoyable. The fact that we only had 81 passengers on board to their 52 staff members probably helped with the immediate service we received. We sat at the same table each evening and felt really spoiled by our wonderful servers. The tours were very well conducted and we enjoyed all the towns and villages we visited. Only problem we have with Viking is their advertisements of "all inclusive". This seems is a bit of a stretch. You are encouraged to tip your tour guide, bus driver, and the staff on board at the end of your cruise. Your free drinks are only included during meals. To me that doesn't really represent "all inclusive" Other riverboats we have traveled on also include a small coffee server in the suites. Not on Viking, unless you are in their executive suite. Perhaps that seems a small thing, but such a nice addition when you have spent the extra $$ to secure a suite. All in all this was a wonderful trip. Thanks again to the staff on the Odin.

Beautiful river night and day. There are many historical monuments along Danube. If you have one day, you can visit many places. As I always visit here on business trip base, the place of my access is limited. Please see attached Danube night and day!
danube. The river runs through the heart of budapest, great photo opportunities from the bridges, plenty of boat trips available.

WIDE!!!!. I had not realised that the Danube is such a wide river ! I expected smaller. There is a lot of hustle and bustle with the pleasure cruisers to-ing and fro-ing. We noticed a realy strong current - you would be foolish indeed to try and swim !!

Sailing up the Danube at night. This has to be one of the most wonderful sail ins in the world up there with Venice, New York etc. We started our sail in at about 10 pm on a beautiful clear night. Following the tradition of cheering as you pass under each bridge. The magnificent buildings along the embankment are beautifully illuminated including the castle, palace, Liberty and many others. We were on Viking Lif where we were kept warm with a glass of schnapps as we enjoyed this treat.

uniworld danube tour christmas markets. just returned from seven glorious days on uniworld's beatrice going from budapest to passua. There are not enough superlatives to describe just how good this ship was. Service was Ritze Carlton level, food was just out of this world and the crew was over the top.

Gate 1 - Danube River Cruise on The Sound of Music. Thank you again, Gate 1, for such a positive experience. The Gate 1 - 9-day Danube River Cruise offered on Travel Zoo was such a steal, it could not be resisted. What a perfect way to spend the Thanksgiving holiday. It was everything I hoped for, and more. Starting at the beginning, Kimber made our reservations. She was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. We got the flights we wanted, with just one transfer in Newark, where we already met new Gate 1 friends. When our group gathered in Munich, an immediate bond was formed. The transfer to the ship took nearly 2 hours, and gave us welcomed "nap time" on the bus, after such a long flight. As we boarded The Sound of Music, we were served soup and pastries as a welcome treat. And that was just the beginning.The tours...included and optional....were fantastic. The tour operators were quite knowledgeable. Some were very entertaining as well. Of course, the sights of Nuremburg, Regensburg, Passau, Salzburg,Melk, Vienna and Budapest were amazing....outstanding! The food was delicious and there were plenty of choices for everyone. Beer and wine was served with dinner, and it was included (a bonus!). The on-board LOCAL entertainment was great....just wish there was more of it. The Christmas markets were a bonus as well. The most important aspect, however, was the friendliness of the Gate 1 tour managers, the Sound of Music Staff....waiters, housekeeping, front desk, etc., etc., local guides and bus drivers. All in all, it was a very rewarding and pleasant experience. Did I mention FREE WiFi.The one regret we have is that we were not able to take advantage of the opportunity to extend our trip on either end....Munich or Budapest. But that only means we'll have to return. In the meantime, we have two more trips booked with Gate 1....Turkey & Greece....celebrating special occasions. There is no doubt about it.....it's Gate 1 all the way for us. You can't go wrong with them.

With Scenic Tours you'll enjoy the luxury of 5 star service and a fabulous holiday. Wow! Our first river cruise and Scenic Tours have more than exceeded our expectations. We spent 15 wonderful days being spoiled on the Scenic Crystal travelling from Amsterdam to Budapest and have nothing but praise for the boat and it's crew. Special mention: Zoltan (Leonardo Di Caprio), Regina, Anita and Putro. Marin our cruise director is a 24/7 wonder! I don't think he had time to sleep from the minue we met him in Amsterdam until we departed Budapest. Scenic take care of passengers well before and long after arrival at embarkation and disembarking from the boat by providing a day room in excellent hotels where passengers waiting for transfers can rest, have a snack, explore the city they are in and fill in time until being transferred to boat from airport and vice versa. Scenic staff are still in attendance during this hiatus.The all inclusive fare really is all inclusive. There is absolutely no need to spend a cent on the boat or the tours. The ship is pristine the food is great.Of course the scenery is breathtaking and the tours with experienced guides are very well managed with lots of choices of where to go, what to do and see. With so much going on we found we needed a "day off" just for my husband and myself so we waved the other passengers off and had the boat to ourselves for several hours. Of course the staff were still there for us as we relaxed and recharged our batteries.Autumn is a spectacular time to visit and the Christmas markets are in full swing by the end of November.River cruises and ocean cruises cannot be compared. They are such different experiences but both are wonderful ways to see the world. Having a familiar base, staff, bed and restaurant to return to each night really enhances our holidays.The final highlight was the night cruise through Budapest. What a perfect was to end a 5 star holiday.

Choose your operator well. A day of sightseeing had to include a tour on the Danube, and its really worth it. The views are excellent and the impressive buildings you see from the water should not be missed. However choose your operator carefully, i bought my tickets from a street vendor, which was working under the auspices of "Budapest Tourist Information". A lot of comforts and extras were promised but never delivered. The tour operator i used was Kossuth Museum Ship, easily identifiable because it has a black and white funnel. We were seated on the top deck at very basic pic nic tables and chairs, the carpeted deck was filthy and worn, the drinks were poor and expensive, the music was modern and very loud, but the worst thing was that throughout the entire cruise there was ZERO explanation of what we were passing, what we should be looking at or any kind of history, even though they advertised a full tourist guide in 37 languages!!!. Since taking this journey i have found out that other operators offer everything i expected, so choose carefully.
You'll see it whether you want to or not. Amazing river because of the size of it. Worth a wander down and across the bridges but quite murky.

Waterbus 11. Included in the day ticket or budapest card a trip up the Danube. We sailed on the municipal ferry as sole travellers from South to North. Great views great seats and all included for free or 700 uhf if you don't have a travel card 3 euro! Must be the best value river in Europe even including Venice grand canal on the water buses

Loved the River at Night. We waited to take the ride at night when all the buildings along the Danube are lit up. What a spectacular sight. The Parliament building was the highlight of the trip but so many other buildings are featured including Chapel Hill. The ride was only an hour but well worth our time when there is so much to see and do in Budapest.
evening boat tour. Turned out that we took the last boat tour on hop on, hop off line. So we were watching evening city with all the magical lights from water, it was very romantic and beautiful.

A wonderful experience. The magical blue Danube. So poignant. Stunning architecture, great views and fine people. Had a great afternoon sailing along the river in radiant sunshine enjoying all that Budapest has to offer. An amazing trip

Romantic Danube Cruise on a magnificent river.. The Danube unlike the symphony is not blue but green. The water is clean and clear. Sights along the Danube from Budapest to Nuremberg were well worth the trip.
Boat trip. Really lovely scenery and food was good. There was a band playing which gave it a party atmosphere. Other visitors onboard were friendly too.

Hop on hop off. We brought the 48 hour big bus ticket which gives you a free 2hour boat trip on theDanube, a free night tour round trip so cannot getof the busbutduring the day you can get on and off as many times as you like
There was nothing to dislike about any part of the experience.
Great Value. Took a tour by boat was hop on and off and ticket was valid for 2 days including night tour for just 3000huf around £8. Good value and great way of seeing the sights

Not sure how you can rate a river. It's a river and as I say not sure how you can really give it a rating, but it is beautiful and the views on an evening across the Chain bridge to Budapest and back to parliament on the other side are lovely. Well worth a walk to take a look after the lights go on.
As rivers go. As rivers go, it's wide a flowing fast. Great to take a boat rip both day and night if possible as the views are terrific.

Perfect River in Lovely City. Budapest has a lovely harmony with river. There are many bridges on the city. River splits the city in two half. And both sides has a different taste. I stayed one week in this city with my wife. And we enjoyed every day of it.

The Danube. Beautiful walk along the river that divides the cities of Buda and Pest. Lots of amazing sites and colorful characters along it. Nice way to spend some time. Plenty of cool places to eat along the way
You can't miss it!. You cannot visit Budapest without seeing the Danube. There are great views from Buda castle or by taking on of the trams that go right along the river.
Beautiful vistas. Beautiful views of the Parliment, Castle Hill, the Chain Bridge and all of the other buildings. We visited during the day and the evening. Both times were spectacular.

Beautiful. Amazing to see how two parts of the city are divided by this river - Buda and Pest. I loved my visit to the Budapest and this river was like a constant companion on the many walks I had around the city. Must see!

Beautiful River. Thus is such a lovely river that so cunningly divided up the city of Budapest - or so it seems!So much life still occurs on this ancient stretch of water.So much has been written and so many photographs have been taken, but to see it in the flesh so to speak is the only way it should be to get the feel of its life-force and importance to Budapest.

Got to see when in Budapest (hard to miss). Lots to do on the river including various boats trips and cruises. Sadly we didn't go on any as we ran out of time! The river and the bridges over it are lit up beautifully at night and make for some perfect views, particularly from the Castle!

Sunrise, sunset day or night all good times to visit. I love bridges, so it was a must to cross the Danube at least once, of course chain bridge is essential to view or cross on your visit to Budapest. The view either side of the river is just great, I viewed it in the early morning light, and also at night. Just beautiful..

Cruising down the Danube. Cruising down the Danube,From the boat you can see most of the city lit up the castle parliament buildings and much more. The boat has capacity for up to 1000 people. Music was played while eating more than enough food typical Hungarian food one of the best trips lasted 1.5 hours. And the musicians came around before we docked and played at each table, great time

Danube by night. it is the biggest river we have seen and we were fascinated by it because we live near the sea and we are used to still waters(FYI Danube cant be blue because of the mud on the river bank, its blue only in Waltzer). we took the night cruise from pear 10 which was included in our hop on-hop off price. we strongly recommend to go by night because all the buildings are in light of reflectors and it is very fascinating. we were there in November so warm clothes in very welcomed. it is really worth seeing.

Night Danube River Cruise in Budapest. Our Gate 1 tour departed at night from Budapest on the Danube. For photographers and sightseers, this may have been the best Danube River sight, because Parliament, the bridges, and other important building are beautifully lit. I know even non-cruise tourists can find good vantage points in Budapest on both sides of the river.

For those arriving on a river cruise .... For those arriving in Budapest at night on a river cruise (ours arrived around 11:00pm) you MUST stay up to watch the approach, preferably on the bow. From a distance you can see the glow of the city. As you quietly approach, the sky gets brighter and brighter, you can start t see a few lights, and the anticipation builds. Before long you are right in the middle of the city, and both sides are lit up like a Christmas tree. It is amazing! The Parliament is so bright it looks like it might explode. I had been to Budapest years ago, but this was an eye-opening experience.

7 Day Danube River Cruise with Gate1 Travel. My wife and I completed a seven day Danube River Cruise with Gate1 Travel. The cruise started in Budapest and ended in Regensberg. We then took a continuation in Prague, Czech Republic. The ship, The Sound of Music, was fantastic. Food was excellent, service was exceptional and all our local and Gate1 guides were the very best. As we travel a great deal, we realize when we have found a gem. The services offered and the value of this excursion are not to be missed. We recommend this trip to everyone. What a great experience.

It's not blue!. Don't believe the lyrics from the Strauss waltz; the Danube is not blue! We were supposed to arrive in Budapest by river boat on the Danube from Austria, but the water level was too high for boats to travel safely under the many bridges, so we ended up traveling there by bus. We did get to see the Danube, though, by walking to it from our hotel. It looked like a river.

Best Way to See All of The Castles.. It is so beautiful to view the castles, vineyards, and lush hills from the Danube (especially on AmaWaterways). We took the AmaCerto from Budapest to Amsterdam and it exceeded all of our expectations--from the first-class excursions and tour guides to the superior service of the crew,

Pleasant way to spend an afternoon.. We took a boat ride on the Danube which was really nice and informative, there are many splendid buildings along the river and you are able to get a good view of them. The weather was not the best on that occasion but I will revisit again.

Don't miss the river tour. We went in the late afternoon. It was cold and blankets were supplied. The trip was just the right length. We got to see the Parliament building and Buda Castle on the way out and then again all lit up on the ride back. I would suggest this time of day, just magnificent.

Cruise. Had a lovely cruise on the Danube which included dinner (buffet style) Food delicious and so too were desserts. The boat itself was beautifully decorated and it was lovely to see Budapest at night with all the bridges and buildings lit up. I would recommend this trip.

The delightful Danube. The mighty Danube River carves through Budapest, adding to the character and beauty of the city. The old city, 'Buda' ('hilly settlement') lies on the west side of the Danube, whilst the new city 'Pest' ('flat settlement') is situated on the east bank. We very much enjoyed checking out the Parliament in Pest, before heading south along the banks of the Danube past the Shoe memorial, then across the Széchenyi Chain Bridge to explore Buda.

A beautiful attraction in Budapest. The river Danube is the heart of Budapest. It's attractive to see either by day or at night time. We did a river cruise in June and it was lovely to view the city from our cruise boat. On our latest visit, in December, we walked along the river bank and it was a great way to walk through the centre of this historic city. On the Pest side, tram #2 runs alongside the river and it's a good alternative to walking, particular if it's cold and/or wet. One of the great attractions by the side of the river on the Pest side is the Hungarian parliament and the riverside walk takes you right past it. Good views can also be gained by crossing the river by one of the city's bridges. Try the Margaret bridge and use it for visiting Margaret island in the Danube, which has several parks and restaurants.
Visit. A long, long and very long time experience for keeping up your best moments available for the rest of your life. If the weather is nice too everything will be absolutely perfect.

Absolute must. We went on a night cruise when all the buildings were lit up. It is beyond beautiful and I would highly recommend it. Audio is available in many languages for those interested in the history of the buildings. Make sure you are dressed warm!

A river, but a big beautiful one. As many reviews previously have said this is extremely hard to miss, if you have some time to kill, take a walk from one bridge to the next, there are other attractions near the central bridges such as a set of baths, or if you are just crossing from Pest to Buda to see the castle area.
Actually not Blue!. Historical, beautiful scenery, and gives you no doubt you are in Europe! Although the water is murky, it is alive with excitement!

Viking River Cruise. We just completed an 8 day river cruise on the Danube from Budapest, Hungary to Nuremberg, Germany. The food was excellent and so was the service. Most of the tours were included. The local guides were good and he sites were awesome. The Viking tour director was organized and helpful. Overall we found the trip a very good value!
A Great River for a Great City. As the Thames is to London so the Danube is to Budapest. Great to walk along the river, just wrap up warm! !

Perfect views, May 2013. Absolutely perfect views. I'd often seen the Parliament building in the background of several tourist photos and postcards, but actually being there was something else. Best views in all of Budapest!
Romantic. take an evening cruise it is Spactacular at night very informative and the buildings are so nice. we took the one without the dinner

Cruise taken through travel company. Arrived on the dockside to take a cruise at 2 pm for a 2 hour cruise. It took off on time and went down the river and turned around to go back up again, stopped off where we got on and waited a while to take off again. We then went up the river and made a stop for a 10 minutes and headed back again. Disappointing. I think the River Danube is absolutely beautiful with fantastic bridges spanning it. Nice to have done it anyway.

Great cruise. As part of our 'hop on hop off' bus ticket we were able to have a cruise on the Danube. This gives a very different view of both the Buda and Peat sides of this city. I enjoyed the cruise, history and facts about this river. However as the song says about it been blue, the colour is more a grey!lol

River cruise. late in the afternoon I took a boat trip to cruise River Danube . Along the cruise we passed by many beautiful architecture buildings and bridges and also a tiny island called Margaret Island . I was told River Danube flows from Black Forest to Black Sea .
A must. A trip on the Danube is a must, the views are stunning, especially at night when everything is lit up.
Beautiful river. The river was flowing fast and was great to view from the several overlooking points along the river.

Budapest a lovely, interesting and friendly city. I enjoyed my 3 days in Budapest greatly. The Budapest card was a great value, and the two free walking tours that come with it, excellent. I exclaimed inadvertently at the beauty of the parliament and some other buildings, was impressed with the consistent friendliness and extraordinary helpfulness of locals, loved the street artwork, night life, thermal bath, and the art history museum, even the opera was good. I appreciated the social values I heard and observed. I feel I learned a lot in Budapest.

Magistic in all its splendor. I have traveled on the Danube both toward Amsterdam and on the other hand toward Bucharest. There are times when the height of the water do not allow for sailing on larger ship. So far I have nor encounter any such experience. I adore River cruising, You always have a view of land and it varied scenic view.

Evening Dinner and Music Crruise. 3 hour trip, food was very good the Music was okay. The boat did a few turns up and down the Danube saw several of the sights repeatedly. Great for a chilled out evening - reasonably priced
River cruise . Awesome cruise. I only did the drinks but the dinner section look nice. Great attention and the sights you see are worth the money.

It's a river.... It's a river. It gets 5 stars because it does exactly what it is supposed to do- flow through a beautiful medieval city without killing too many people. A wonderful place for a romantic stroll!

Amazing!. The views, whether walking along either bank or across the bridges, is beautiful. You have to see it during the day and night. At night most of the key sights are dramatically lit, some appear to be floating on air! Truly awe inspiring! Don't bother with meal cruises, they are not really worth it and just take away from the viewing, better food at the restaurants afterwards.

My favorite place in Budapest!. As erasmus student I enjoyed my time in Budapest. I lived in the city centre quite close to the Danube. I used to jog as much as I could from Corvinus University to Magrit Island along the Danube. Each time I was in awe of the buildings, the bridges and the river. The island is such a nice place and offers many possibilities during spring, summer, autumn. There are boat tours possible, restaurants,... . I definitely recommend this site by night, for me it as beautiful as during the day. Enjoy it's for free.

A river boat trip. This boat trip was part of the ticket price on the open top green line bus route. The trip took an hour and went past all the tourist sites, the Palace, the Parliament building etc.

majestic river. take a walk over the Danube on any of the spectacular bridges that cross it, it is really worth ! it is not until you do it , that you realise how big it is ! in nice weather you can take a panoramic walk on its shores, yu will be delighted !
Wonderful river. If you have never seen Danube before, you'll be thrilled by its size and beauty. It is interesting to see how the river shaped the city through years and centuries.

one of the great wonders. I have heard about the Danube ever since I was a kid. all I can say at night looking across the Danube at the lights of the city is truely magnificent. it is a once in a life time experience

Wow... Great trip. I got the free boat trip with the hop off - on bus . Which was good as you can go everywhere and the buses are very punctual. The river trip is lovely  You see it from a different viewpoint I love Budapest
Free boat trip. Barted with the red hop on hop off company and had this free boat trip included Views from the danube was spectacular well worth a visit

Trip on the Danube. We went on the Boat trip on the Danube as part of the celebrations for my friend's 60th birthday and it was wonderful.
Afterwards we visited the shoe statues on the banks of the river, a very very moving half and hour, just remember the atrocities of war and particularly the children.

Don't do what we did!. It was late afternoon when we decided to get a ferry to Margaret Island. We bought tickets for a lovely looking boat on the quayside. This was merely a front. We had to walk though this and two other boat before boarding the rusting old tub we'd paid for. Arrived at the island at 5pm just in time to find it was the last ferry back. Not even time to set foot.

This is an amazing tour to do!! A cruise in the Danube at night. The danube is really beautiful. You can walk around during the day and do a cruise at night. We should the tiur withiut food or we would loose the best of thee trip:the view. We stayed outside of the boat and the view it ie really amazing.

Miles of Walks Along Both Sides of the Danube. You can spend days walking along both sides of the Danube and be entertained by the sights and sounds. Wide walkways on both sides mean generally no dodging of traffic. The half dozen walkable bridges mean you can easily cross from one side to the other - trams on both sides allow you to ride when you are tired. There are surprises very frequently with a lot of beautiful sculptures especially on the Pest side between the Chain And Elizabeth bridges. Although, my favourite is a statue of Elizabeth in a little park on the Buda side surrounded by concrete overpasses approaching the Elizabeth bridge.

Can use as public transport. On arrival at Budapest, we purchased a 72 hours transport pass for metro, buses and trams. The Danube boat during the day can also be used with the same ticket.It is worth booking a separate evening trip where there is talking guide about the locations along the Danube and a night visit is a must.

Beautiful walk on any kind of day. What I love most about a walk along the Danube is how you stumble across beautiful statues and memorials along the way. It is a lovely way to spend a morning or afternoon in Budapest. I was there in November but I image there are many musicians performing along the river's edge on summer days. Lovely.

Take the Sunset Cruise..... We took 2 cruises, one during the day. Which was very imformative, learned alot about the city. The second was 1/2 price. The day time was nice and mellow, not many people.The Sunset Cruise was breathtaking. I believe there in no city in the world that meets the beauty of Budapest, espeically at night. The sun was just starting to set when we left the dock. The boat was quite full, but we managed to be one of the first ones on, so the seats were great.Make sure DO NOT forget your camera. The views will not disapoint. The way people act, might. But I guess it is not an evening out in Budpaest unless there is at least one argument between people. Well worth it.

Danube cruise. We cruised from Nuremberg to Budapest on Viking and could not ask for any better service. My husband is in a wheelchair and we were helped at every step of the way. We were informed of places he could not go and he was assisted on the bus when we went on city tours. We were extremely pleases with every part of out tour. In Budapest our ship made several circles so we could all take pictures of the most beautiful lit buildings you have ever seen. They were lit and the Parliament building looks like a building made of butter, It was gorgeous. Take this tour, you will not be disappointed.

Danube Cruise. It was a marvellous cruise. Sarting at 7pm and lasting an hour and a half. A richbuffet dinner with delicious glass of wine. A concert during the dinner. Staff very kind and an the view was breathtaking.very very good experience at only 33€ each!

Gorgeous at night!. When in Budapest, you must book a night time cruise along the Danube. All of the buildings and monuments are floodlit and it is just gorgeous, the best view of any city in Europe. Parliament is awesome! This is a must do and see.
Pretty but its no Paris. Nice buildings but I think that it has been built a bit more than is necessary. Pretty with a few nice restaurants but a five minute walk and its the same old

Cruise on the Danube. I think this is a must for any traveller to Budapest. We were on a budget so we availed of the free cruise which was included on our bus tour with the big bus company. We decided on the 4pm cruise and because it was November it was a good move as the night closed in quite quickly and it was dark as we passed the city heading towards Margarets Island. Beautiful views and great photo opportunities with all the lights of the city and bridges shining.

Scenic river front!!. Scenic river front!! Budapest was my last stop on a solo trip in early 2006.I loved walking alongside the Danube and checking out little riverside restaurants along the way. It was one of my favorite times on my short trip there.

Budapest River Cruise at Night. We signed up for a 3 hour night time dinner cruise which cost just under $100 a person. Yes it was pricey but worth every penny. They offered a wonderful buffet of hungarian food which included goulash soup, paprikash chicken, numerous salads, caviar and cakes and all the wine you could drink. The table had beautiful flower arrangements and the staff was wonderful. After dinner grab your camera and head upstairs to the party deck to soak in the beautiful buildings all lit up at night. The parliament building was breathtaking! This was the highlight of our stay in Budapest
across the Danube on a sunny day. If you visit Budapest a cruise on the Danube is all you need so that you can fall in love with this special city . Very nice view!

Boat trip. I would highly recommend booking a ticket with the hop on hop off tour buses. you get two full days and a boat trip on the danube for €20. the river is the best place to see both views of buda and pest. magnificent buildings and architure. a must to do
Great views. The scenery from this river is amazing. The buildings are so ornate and a cruise on the Danube allows you to take some breathtaking pictures.
A night cruise is a must. A night cruise is a must. The walk by the river sidde is very pleasent specialy at the sunset. crossing the river by the bridges is also nice, easy and safe.

Take a boat ride late in the evening. or ride across any of the main bridges in the evening. The view is breathtaking! - Check out the river by walking/running around Margaret Island... If you have the time, take a longer ship tour on the Danube. The water is cleaner than it used to be when the raw sever emptied directly into the river but it is still not clean (and safe) enough to swim in it...

This is the most beautiful cuty riverside of the world. Come to Budapest, come to Hungary and watch the Danube river. Bith sides is full of beautiful buildings, The Parliament, The Castel Hill, The Fisherman's Bastion, The Gellért Hill....enough things to do for a holiday. Budapest is a hidden treasure in Eastren Europe. And still very reasonable...

Spectacular. We did 2 cruises at night on the Danube. The lights of Budapest are amazing. To see the Statue of Liberty, Parliament House, Castle Hill and all the bridges are spectacular. Did the cruise through Big Bus. Boat had plenty of seats up stairs which was great.

Don't miss taking a boat tour up and down danube. The skyline of Budapest is a UN World Heritage Site. The ships leave every hour from the dock and you are given an audio guide that tells you what you are looking at. And yes, you can figure out what buildings they are describing. The ship goes up one side and back down the other getting nice and close to the bridges which are beautiful.
Great at Night. You just have to see it and walk over the bridges especially in the evening when it turns absolutely magical in the dark
awesome. beautiful structure, must visit for everyone.. It totally tells about the charm and awesomeness of Budapest. Only for structures like these does Budpaest come close to Vienna.
River trip a must at night. Mulled wine whilst cruising the Danube at night. Beautiful. The monument to the Jews that were shot into the Danube striking and emotional.
A bit dissapointing. The boat we took just made a big circle in the river and came back to portbecause it was too big to go under some of the bridges!
Danube. Everything, walked from Parliament to the hotel. Great walk on cobblestone walkway with the chain bridge in view, Buda on one side, Pest on the other side of the Danube

Beautiful Views Of Historical Buildings From The Danube. We stopped on the Danube in Budapest on the Emerald Star for only one night and day we were not in the least disappointed. From our cabin looking across at the historical buildings especially the Parliament was well worth the short stay. The city cruise also revealed more impressive buildings and several beautiful bridges.

Walk -- Day or Night. This is a must for all visitors to Budapest, because so much takes place on both sides of this great river -- on water, on the banks or a bit further away. This is where the heart of Budapest thumps and pumps and its blood flows. I walked from Liberty to the Chain bridge at night on the Buda side and during day walked the Pest side. Simple things are sometimes difficult to describe accurately and must be experienced. First it is the beauty of the river and the bridges and historical buildings that dot both sides. The joggers, cyclists, romantic walks keep the side walks on the river banks busy. On the bridges you will find young lovers drowing themselves in alcohol and ciggarettes. All very quite and peaceful. The river breeze is very soothing. I have walked many great river sidewalks, but I am sure the Danube is one of the best. You will do well if you carry some drinks and snacks with you as the immediate side walks do not have eating places for hawkers. For this you will have to side step a bit. Be careful of the walking lane vs the bike lane. Bikers are careful but at times very fast. Renting a bike might also be a great idea to cover all the bridges at a faster pace. Bike rentals are nearby, but may be closed in the evening. Some hotels carry bikes for rent. Bring a camera as the are great night scenes and day photo ops.

Amazing views from Danube!!!. The Danube divides Buda (hilly) from Pest (flat) and the views along the river are SPECTACULAR!! The castle on the hill, the bridges, the old town on the Pest side and the Parliament Buildings, which rival castles anywhere!!! If walking along the Danube on the Pest side, don't miss the WWII memorial right before the Parliament Buildings. A series of cast iron shoes are along the river bank, and are a memorial to the Jews who were told to take off their shoes, and were then shot and dumped into the river during World War II. It is very moving.

History and Beauty. We went on the Gate 1 Danube River Cruise, beginning in Nuremberg and ending in Budapest. Every day is an adventure. You will need good walking shoes, because you will do a lot of that, but it is well worth it. You will have tour guides on all of the excursions that will tell you the history and answer your questions about the buildings, Roman ruins, and other sites that you will see. We took advantage of the extra two night stay in Budapest and were glad we did. If you can stay for 5 days in Budapest it would be to your advantage. We saw a lot there, but would like to have had more time. This is a great trip!
Evening stroll. The pier is an easy walk into the Market district with an enclosed market and good small shops and restaurants.

(NOT SO) BLUE DANUBE. We very much enjoyed a river cruise on the Danube from 2 to 9 November 2014 in the Uniworld River Beatrice travelling from Budapest to Passau. A most comfortable and beautiful trip accompanied by excellent food and wines. Highly recommended.
night river cruise. excellent night out and amazing food. cruising the danube at night, seeing all the main buildings all lit up. Entertainment on board.
Magical. In sunshie or moonlight....magical views. Walk a little further than just around the Chain Bridge, its worth it.
Lovely to walk across the bridges. Lovely for walking,day and night.The views across both sides of the river are brilliant. There is nice boat trips on the Danube

The mighty Danube defines Budapest.. Take a cruise and explore both sides. Walk the chain bridge. You can either take the funicular or take the cheaper option Bus #14. We also waked the Liberty (Green) Bridge and had lunch (Langos) at the Central Market on the Pest side. Also did some titbit shopping in the market
One of Europe's major rivers. Great wide interesting river, lots of bridges cross the Danube through Budapest making it easy to cross. The most famous bridge is the Chain Bridge or Szechenyi.

Great for a stroll or a cruise. The Danube offers great views whether you are walking on Buda or Pest sides of the city. A cruise is also a must do, there are many to choose from. I went on one that came with the hop on hop off bus tickets. You also get to make a stop for a couple of hours on Margaret island. Highly recommended.
Dinner cruise. The food on the cruise was very delicious the service was excellent, it was an enjoyable evening cruising along the Danube the view of the Parliament building at night was fantastic .
Lunch cruise. Did a lunchtime buffet cruise. Good value for money and the food was plentiful and there was a great variety.

Give dinner cruise a miss .... Booked a dinner cruise at Info Centre near Heroes Square 07 Nov 2014. Meeting point at Duna Palota, Zrinyi u.5 [Duna Koncert Kft.] On the "Europa" - no champagne - of course not, it's sparkling wine :) Dinner was nothing fancy. Musicians played at the start and at the end ... OK. No atmosphere. Overall a boring experience. If you really must do this, buy a ticket for upstairs where you can see the beautiful buildings lit up at night. Or walk along the Danube - for free - you'll see exactly the same. Sorry, folks, I simply loved every minute of exploring Budapest, however, this can really be missed. :) (With all due respects, there might be other cruises/companies that are worthwhile). All the best.

The Danube is best seen in Budapest. We've travelled the Danube for several days now as part of our Viking River Cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest. Without doubt, the best place to see the beauty and majesty of the river is in Budapest. The lit building along the river, the lighted bridges, it's just a wonderful sight.
Danube Viking River Cruise. Wonderful with daily visits to cities for tours. Interesting that Danube has over 65 locks in order to travel its length. Danube divides Buda and Pest - hence Budapest.
Wonderful. We took a cruise on the Danube during daytime.It was awesome!We felt good.We also made a stop on Margaret Island which is very nice to see,we don't evern know when the time passed.
Cruise ship. Perfect experience - sail Danube river in the night, see Budapest from the river in the night. Good food. Worth for the price

Simply awesome. In Budapest and you can’t miss Danube. Danube divides the whole place into Buda and Pest and both sides have their own share of offerings and sights. I had visited both the sides and even took a cruise on Danube to enjoy it more. The cruise will not only takes you through the shoreline attractions but treat you good to nice meal and drinks. You could either opt for lunch or dinner but I would say the night views are simply outstanding, so might be a good idea having dinner on the cruise while enjoying Danube and its site

Another Perspective. Another pleasant way to view a great place to visit. So many dimensions to Budapest and its people this is a great way to broaden your appreciation especially when the passes are part of the combined bus boat option. Just watch the number of folk wanting to take the same trip. The operators could give a little more thought to the imposition too many onboard makes to reasonably viewing

Just beautiful. Just beautiful especially at night being able to stand on one of the bridges that span the Danube and looked at the lights beautiful landmarks and watch the boats as the go up and down nothing quite like this place

The Danube is most beautiful here. With its striking bridges and riverwalks, Budapest is probably the best city to enjoy the Danube. It's beautiful at all times of day and night because of the way sunrise and sunset hit the historical buildings on both sides of the river and particularly at night when the most important buildings are illuminated. The bridges add their own charm with their twinkly lights. It's magical and romantic. The promenade on the Pest side is lovely with cafes and flower planters lining the river. It's a great place to sit, and watch the world go by. There is one other incredibly moving monument that is right at the river's edge near the Parliament building. It's the Shoes on the Danube Holocaust Memorial. It is a sculpture of shoes that the victims would have worn before they were chained together and shot into the river to perish. It is one of those monuments that really touch you in ways you cannot imagine.

Really not worth any time. Don't know why I expected anything, it's only Danube. Riverfront is not really good, there's cars and trams everywhere and the cruise is just not worth the money. Climb the Fisherman's bastion or citadela, they are much better places to enjoy Danube and Budapest.

Must-see for overview of the city. I was only in town for a few days, so I didn't have much time to sightsee, but had the opportunity to take a 90 min river cruise on the Danube one evening. It is a great way to see the bridges and sights along the river, and the tour guide provided some history of the two cities, Buda and Pest, and pointed out the highlights along the river. A wonderful way to see the city easily, I was there in November and while it was chilly outside, it was still comfortable and a nice break from the city (auto) traffic.
Nice river cruise. Really enjoyed this 1 hour river cruise. It was very informative and picturesque. Beautiful way to see Budapest.

Danube River Cruise Budapest to Prague. We booked a River Cruise on the Danube with Avalon. We stayed on our own in Budapest for 4 days prior to cruise at the Le Meridien. Well located. We bought a Budapest city card on line and picked it up at the Tourist Bureau minutes away. It was centrally located so the metro lines all converged here as well as the Trams etc. Very easy to walk around. We could have just bought the Transit pass without the museums but it was no fuss or bother. Metro very easy to use.We visited St. Stephens Basilica where the "Holy Right is kept .For a small fee you can visit the view area via a lift ... great views of the city.Next day took metro to Hero's Square & City park and visited the Castle. The SZURKEMARHA festival happened to be on that SundayWe walked down Andrássy Avenue and visited the Opera... A must take the tourWalked down to the Danube and found the "Shoes on the Danube" moving site.Next day trip to Buda castle but a wine festival was on so could not enter.No problem walked around the area.We took the Funicular up the Hill and Back ..not included in the City pass even though it mentions it!St Matthias church a must see and the Fisherman's BastionNext Day had a full day tour "Puszta Great Plains and Kecskemet Day Trip from Budapest" with Viator. Booked it on line.Good break from walking around. Different. Friends had suggested it.Our last day we took the Tram to Liberty Bridge and walked across to Gellért Baths and Hill We visited the Cave church and walked up the Hill to the top .Needed several rest stops. View is worth it. Easiest way is take Bus up to the top of the Hill and then walk down!Our last night we went to Budai Vigado - renewed theater in Budapest. The Hungarian State Folk Ensemble performs here. must do while in Budapest. We reached it again by Metro.River Cruise the next Day well organized by Avalon. Pre-paid excursions we goodWe went to the Opera night in Vienna. that night on arrival and was Happy we did.We walked around Vienna next day afte a included walking city tour.Visited Saint Stephen's Cathedral anther worthwhile visit. Also visited Hofburg Palace, Sisi Museum, Imperial Apartments and the Imperial Silver CollectionThat night we had a Special presentation on the Wachau valley.problem with river cruise is that you don't have much time viewing the River. But this part most were up on deckNext stop on cruise was Dürnstein. We did a walking tour some did a bike tour to Melk.Sampled White wine and Apricot ScnappsNext stop in afternoon was Melk . What a beautiful place. Another must see!The following day we had a full day excursion to Disembark to do a all day tour of the Salzkammergut lake district in Austria (First stop Lake Taunsee at Traunkirchen , Lake Wolfgangsee,St. Gilgan and last Mondsee . Well worth it but so were the other offered full day excursions. A matter of choice.Next day was Regensburg Germany & we went on the Danube Gorge and Weltenberg Abbey tour in the morning and a included city tour in afternoon.Feasted on Saukraut, bratwurst sausages and beer at the Historic Sausage Kitchen. Paid by the Cruise.Last day on to Nurenberg visited the castle for view. Not enough time with the tour. Wished I had seen the Deep Well and Sinwell Tower inside.I booked my own Hotel In Prague at the Sheraton . Avalon bused me to their hotel Intercontinental and I took a taxi .Again I had Picked up my Prague city card and did a city tour that day by bus included with the card.Easy to walk around. Sheraton was at Charles square easy access to transportaion. but we mostly walked to the old Square. Yhe new city hall tower was near the sheraton so we walked up the stairs for the view anda small price.Toured the Old square. Palladium shopping and Korva shopping area. Look for stores displaying Global Blue Tax Free Shopping signage in the window. The tax free site Global site was in the Korva shopping mall but still had to claim the discount at the airport. That went easy.We visited Prague Castle,Karlova Crystal where i tried my hand at Glass blowing. Also booked a a haunted underground tour by lamplight. This was ok but funWe had breakfast buffet at Sheraton in the Am and was shocked at the 75$ price tag. The following morning had coffee at Mammacoffee with croissant for 10$The last day bused across the Legion Bridge. Then took the Funicular to the TOP. It was included with the Prague card.Lots to see up top. Observatory was not open but went up the "Eiffel Tower" superb views. We visited the House of Mirrors then walked down the Hill along the Hunger wall.Stopped for a Brew at the Monastic Brewery. Then visited the Strahov Library. A msut see. Look at the books in the corridor and read the description. Real wood and lichen and moss on the covers. Amazing. Also visited the Museum of Minatures well worth the small fee ( Eiffel Tower on a Cherry Pit!)picked up some chocholate near the Golden Star restaurant at steps going up to Prague Castle. We then visited St. Nicholas church in Lessr town Square.. Another good vistWe then walked across the Charles bridge excellent.Our last night we went to the" Mozart Dinner' at the Grand Bohemia Hotel in their Boccaccio ballroom.Booked this on line. of note is that the doors open to let you in off the street at 7:00 not a minute before. So the line up was outside. This was my wife's best night. She even got a rose. We had a Front table for 2 wit hthe 3 drinks included. The best option.Any way this was a great Holiday 14 days total.

Danube sightseeing cruise at night is a MUST!. Having visited a great many beautiful European cities since moving to the UK 3 years ago, I was genuinely surprised at how stunning Budapest is -particularly when viewed from a Danube cruise at night! The spectacular views of the Parliament, Buda Castle, St Stephens, the Fisherman's Bastion & Saint Matyas Church, and the impressive bridges were a real highlight of my travels to date.We went on the Legenda Danube cruise (Note: it is worthwhile booking in advance -the 6:30pm cruise that we had aimed to take was full, but we were lucky that they added an unscheduled 8pm cruise due to the high demand). This appeared to be the best-priced of the many Danube cruise options, and it was very well-organized and the boat seemed quite new and was in great condition.

Good view of Buda and Pest. You get a good view of both sides of the city from the cruise. It was really cold so could not stand in the open deck of the cruise long enough. Evening is the best time to use the cruise (between 6-7pm).

Amazing at night. i was in Budapest for the 6th time already and i must say that the view of the danube at nigth surrounded with the bridges illuminated the castle and the parlament is probably the nicest view by night i know (and i live in prague..)So enjoy the free cruise offered with the bus ticket hop On hop Off / budapest sightseeing, but do not forget to get the little leaflets with all discount coupons to enjoy the cruise.
perfect. try the Irish floating pub - great wings!! and irish beer. Friendly service and the views are fabulous

River cruises are fab!. Lunch river cruise - buffet and wine for about £20 per head - great!! Takes about an hour and a half and could have been longer..buffet was lovely, plenty of choice of mainly Hungarian food which was well cooked and plentiful. Great views along the way!

Picturesque. You can't really spend time in Budapest without seeing the Danube, given that it divides the two halves of the city. We spent a morning exploring along the bank of the Danube on the Pest side (walking around Parliament, etc.) and taking pictures of the Buda Side. We also crossed the Chain Bridge and had lovely views of the Pest side. I believe that same day we went over to the Buda side to view the castle area. The architecture on the banks is impressive and the views from either side are amazing. Luckily, in mid-December, there were not many people on the Pest bank. Note: We actually visited in December 2011 but TA does not allow you to select dates from that far back.
a dream come true. The fact of taking a river cruise at night and watch this splendorous lighted city is an unforgettable experience. And if you listen to the Blue Danube Strauss valse... speechless!

What's not to love. The river and its bridges are wonderful. Chilly in a fall wind. And, Budapest traffic can be loud and smelly (no exhaust regulations, so old cars and trucks can belch fumes). BUT all that aside, the river, and views of the river from the hills on Buda side are just wonderful

beautiful view of both Pest and Budda from the Danube. Worth taking an evening boat ride to see the lighted parliament and the castle district. There are many tour boats operating that provide this tour.
Breathtaking ........ The focal point to this beautiful city is the Danube, I would recommend a boat trip during the day and the evening to see the contrast of the city. Amazing.

Not Blue but who cares. Europe and the Danube go hand in hand. River cruises abound on the water year round. It passes some of the most historic sites from Amsterdam to Budapest and it gives me goose bumps just to know I have seen it, been on it and enjoyed it's beauty and history is amazing to me.

Take a Danube cruise. I booked a Danube -bend cruise which took in a few small towns to visit and a nice lunch at Szentendre.You get a different perspective seeing some of the sights from the river. Most enjoyable.
Danube Cruise. We took an evening cruise at 7:00pm. We wanted to see the city at night and it is really beautiful. It was a lovely relaxing evening.

You must go for the river sight-seeing. If you are in Budapest, don´t miss the boat trip on the Duna (Danube) river. There are many boat offering this river trip, mainly in port near the Vigado ter. You can choice wich boat do you prefer - covered or open board. The guide is available in many languages - we did the trip with the boat trip with the boat name "Legend" and there was 30 languages audio available - working well:-) Interesting story about all the attractions near the river and about the city. Nice view, good personal on the boat, good drinks:-)

Beautiful , and peaceful despite some of its history. My wife and i were here in May for a Viking River cruise and i am back now in October for a conference in Budapest.....a must see city. Wonderful and some chilling history but beautiful architecture and tours and parks ....go to the Night Market!!!!
Amawaterway river cruse experience!. ohhhhh yeahhh! Great spots and great food. Many stores to visit. The parlement is the masterpiece of the river cruse.

Awesome. The ambiance of sailing along the Danube at night is something that will stay with me forever. Budapest at night on this short cruise is simply gorgeous. Very inexpensive and close to most hotels.......just do it, you will not regret this.
Beautiful. The Danube is beautiful to see , a cruise on the river is a must you see all the famous landmarks for example the palace looks stunning and of course the Famous Chain Bridge

8 day cruise down the Danube. Our first River Cruise, so had no idea what to expect. Lots of information on the cruise arrived with our reservation confirmation, however ambiguous info on meeting point at Munich airport caused a bit of confusion. Eventually met by representative and transferred to ship (Emerald Sky). Lovely friendly welcome on board by the Cruise Director and Hotel Manager and the ship was stunning. Our cabin (Owner's Suite) was excellent - lots of space with a walk-in wardrobe, and 2 inboard balconies. Beautiful bed linen, with a pillow menu and very comfortable bed. Night and day cruising ensured maximum time ashore at the many beautiful towns and cities. Our first impression was that the holiday was rather more organised than we would have wanted. Many of the tours started at 8.30 am. OK for many people, but one of our main holiday requirements is relaxation! However, we accepted this, and, of course, the choice was ours whether we joined the many excursions, or not. So that is not a criticism of the holiday, merely a personal observation.I would compliment the whole crew who were most attentive and helpful to my husband, who is reg. blind. This particularly applied to Ross and the other waiters in the Restaurant who were absolutely wonderful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Possibly only slight criticism was the décor of the ship. It was very beautiful, with lots of glass, mirrors and very shiny floors. However it was very difficult for my husband, with very limited sight, to get around without walking into something (too many reflections).Would definitely recommend this holiday. An excellent way to travel through 4 countries, visit many beautiful cities, traverse seamlessly through many very large locks, enjoy the gentle passing of the panorama, and all with the minimum of effort.

Stunning. At my wife's suggestion we caught the no 27 bus to the citadel in the early evening. It was five minutes walk up the road from the stop to the viewing area where the sightseeing buses stop. It is a stunning view of the river, the bridges and adjacent buildings - all superbly lit like a fairground. We had no interest in the citadel in the day so it was our first visit up there. The buses are reasonably priced and every few minutes, as they are throughout the city. Go, you won't regret it but will surely remember it!

Night cruise on the Danube. We took a night cruise on the Danube... oh it was so beautiful. The air was a bit chilly , but we could manage with a light jacket. They take you down the river and show you the beautiful buildings which are brilliantly lit up. The ambience and the river itself are totally enchanting. A glass of good Hungarian wine to keep you company completes the pleasure of the trip

Beautiful river. A beautiful setting, particularly at night.looking up at Buda from Pest is an unforgettable sight.loved it one of the longest rivers in Europe and a beautiful river and can take you through many countries lots of beautiful bridges and lit up at night is gorgeous Budapest alone has 6 or 7 bridges.

Must try the Danube River cruise at night, gorgeous view, never forget. Tried the river cruise on October 1, 2014, 6:30 pm to 9:30 pm, good Hungarian food and live music. The night view of the Buda Castle and the bridges with all the light were very impressive. Must try and the price was Euro 35 one person, very reasonable. Ask hotel staff, they can make the booking for you.

Beautiful in Budapest. Take the time to stroll along the river. The many bridges allows you to walk along one side, walk across a bridge and walk back on the other. There are also lovely cafes to sit and enjoy the view

Use tour eyes as you will be deafened by the engine and unable to hear anything.. Good job its all included otherwise I'd ask for a refund deafening & dangerous hope we don't need a life belt, font know where they are!!

Beautiful river. The Danube is the main feature of Budapest with both sides of the city separated by it, however the council has not made the most of it. There are not enough nice spots down by the river banks to sit and relax and there are roads running alongside most of its length within the city.

amazing. this city is great, take a boat trip on danube, this is worth it! city is amazing, i didnt have time to visit much but what i saw was nice, mix of modern and old, city is clean, all nationalities are mixed

Great View from the River. Never miss this. Strongly recommend to take the dinner and cruise package. The lights on the parliament and palace are spectacular. Get your camera ready. Always bring a spare - preferably a camera body compatible with your DSLR. Mine died!

Walking on both sides of the River. See the recently remodeled Várkert--the Garden area below the Castle, walk along the river. Great for people watching, take the #2 tram, too, from the city center to the National Arts Palace (MűPa).
Boat tour on the Danube. I took a boat tour in the morning and also at sunset. Both times were amazing, there is so much to learn and the Parliament building looks awesome all light up at night

Fantastic River Cruise. This is a rather belated review of our Viking river cruise in July. We set sail from Nuremberg in Germany on a Viking river cruise sailing through numerous locks & stunning scenery to reach Budapest. Each port of call including Passau, Rasenburg, Melk, Vienna & finally Budapest were amazing! I had it in my heart that Budapest would be the 'icing on the cake' & it certainly was both by day & night!

free trip. 2 river trips (day and night included in hop on hop off bus tour which valid 2 days. Other usual summer trips with tour and river trip cease end of September which was a pity. You can still get river trips but not in general tours.

The Beautiful Danube River. Must-see part of Budapest. Lots to do and see along this beautiful riverfront including great views of the Parliament (iconic), memorials to the holocaust, important bridge walks, and the list goes on and on. Highly recommend.

Free cruise -Big bus tour. Was OK except it would be beneficial if there was a facility to plug in the headphones(that we were told to bring with us). It would be more enjoyable knowing more of the history and background of the Bud and Pest side. The Big Bus was exceptionally good, and the visit was fantastic.
Lovely to walk along or take a boat ride. Definitely take a boat cruise at night, the buildings along the shore look even more beautiful at night.
oh so scenic. So much to see and do. The boat trip was magic. Gives you a great feeling of the power of Budapest and the contrast between the two towns. Need to go again to experience more
Very historic sight.. Beautiful to look at and think of the history. At night is a must! The chain bridge is awesome to see as well.
Night boat trip was brilliant. Budapest at night from the river is well worth doing. Key buildings are lit up, and the parliament building is superb at night.
Romantic place. You could just spend hours just walking by the river and watch all the beautiful buildings and enjoy the atmosphere

Beautiful. We did a dinner cruise on the Danube and it was quite good. The dinner was decent with a variety of choices. The wine selection was adequate. The Danube at night is truly spectacular, particularly,the Parliament building. This is a must when you visit Budapest. I suspect all the dinner boat cruises are on the same par.
Cruise included in our hop on hop off bus ticket. We had a short cruise using the ticket included with our hop on hop off bus ticket. Great value and lovely to go to Margaret Island via boat

Trip of a lifetime. Just completed the 14 night river cruise on Emerald Star from Amsterdam to Budapest. It cannot be faulted. Only thing I wish is that it could have been longer and we could have stayed longer in some of our ports. The food and wine was first class, as was the service, waitstaff and cruise director, Daniella.Put this on your bucket list.

Its not blue, but it is enchanting.. Don't miss the opportunity to go on a night voyage on the Danube. The lights from Parliament and all the beautiful buildings on the Danube cast a light show on the waters that is spectacular.
Lovely place. We spent time there in the day and evening, lovely every time. Must see, very relaxed place to eat, drink or even just sit. You got to walk down the riverside as wekk

7 nights Danube River Cruise with Sound of Music and Gate 1. My husband and Just came back from our 7 day Danube River cruise with Gate 1 travel. We travelled a lot and always made our own arrangements but decided to join. gate 1 on this vacation. we got an excellent price with Gate 1 compared to a lot of the more familiar cruise line and we were a bit hesitant at the beginning as we are from Canada and have not used their service. We booked this trip well in advance. The flight arrangements were good, they have a live agent if u have questions. The Sound of Music was not luxiious but it was clean, staff were friendly and polite, 3 meals were excellent and provided plenty of choices. We had a room with panorama window and it was very comfortable and clean. The Danube was amazing and we enjoyed going in the small town. The tour manager from Gate 1 was helpful and friendly and both the crew, gate 1 staff worked so hard to accommodate everyone. We feel we need to give more as tipping at the end of the trip as everyone on board is so friendly and tried so hard to make their customers happy. In US servers demand to be tipped 15-20% and sometimes we feel they don't derserved it as they feel it is mandatory. with this cruise, we feel more than happy to be generous in tipping as we got such good service. Gate 1 made everything so smooth and I will definitely travel with them again.

Danube in Budapest Vienna Bratislavia..... Look at a map of Europe and follow the Danube. Where there's a great city such as Budapest, Bratislavia or Vienna then there are bridges of greta architecture both old and new. These cities are vibrant and alive besides the Danube. Go to any one and you'll get great views of the Danube.

Loved It!. Plenty to see and do - good restaurants, bars and cafes. Great views from both sides of the river and from the bridges.
The 'shoes on the Danube' is a very poignant memorial that I would recommend.

Stunning river, interesting bridges. The river is alive with an array of mainly tourism boats, especially river cruises. The bridges are all very different from each other. The oldest, known as the Chain Bridge (architect Adam Clark) is particularly nice. Take a look in the posh Gresham Hotel at the end of it.
It is not so blue, but charming anyway.. Danube river is the heart of the City. You need to cross it to see all the city amenities, one way, or another. You can even sail it.
Cruise doon the water. This is a must on your visit doon the danue river out to Margaret island a lovely relaxing sail the views are great please enjoy ax we did.

A wonderful voyage. In September, 2014, my wife and I set sail from Budapest, Hungary and travelled upstream on the Danube to Passau, Germany. The scenery along the river is spectacular and the small villages are wonderful to visit and explore. The larger cities, Budapest, Bratislava, and Vienna offer wonderful history, art, architecture, and food experiences. We didn't stop at every village, but some of the historical sights took us back to our childhood tales of Robin Hood, because Richard the Lion Heart was held for hostage in the castle above Durnstein, Austria. The ship offered a marvellous way to visit and view the countryside. The towns offer real local experiences, unlike cruise stops on the Caribbean.The only disappointment was that the Danube is NOT blue...it's greenish-brown.An unforgettable experience!
Well worth your time. Had been on the bus tours and found the boats gave slightly different views and information.We had tickets for bus and boat but would pay to go on the boat seperately

Boat ride. The hop on off red bus includes this for free but this October we had weather in the 70's and chose not to go on a boat with no open air space. It's pleasant for an hour and we got off on Margaret Island and picked up a bike for four which was great fun. Missed the musical fountain which was a shame - main reason we went there but we couldn't find it at the time we needed to be there!
Take a boat tour on Danube. The Danube River tours are well worth the price. The historical buildings on both sides of the river are beautiful.
Viking River Boat Cruise. I liked it all! An awesome way to explore the countryside and culture from a boat..........with people pampering you.

Danube River Cruise. It was a wonderful cruise that started in Hungary and sailed to Germany!! Started in Warsaw and was bused thru Poland, Slovakia and to Hungary!!! A lot of walking but well worth it!
A famous river. A famous river which you have to visit by boat! It's the central area of Budapest, so you'll be able to see many important buildings of the city from there.

Amazing River Cruise. This was my first river cruise and we decided to cruise the Danube from Budapest to Nuremberg. There were six of us and we all met in Budapest prior to the cruise which I would recommend doing. Budapest is a beautiful city and so much to see. From our first step onto the Viking Njord, we were greeted by crew members and did not worry about one thing from that first moment to our disembarking the ship. The ship was modern, clean and sleek. Our cabins were a little larger than an ocean liner and our bathroom definitely was a step above. The ship only has about 140 cabins so it was comfortable and not overwhelming. The food was great and portions were just as they should be. The selections were enough and always enough fresh food available. The crew were wonderful. Everything worked smoothly and any problems which did occur were taken care of immediately. The included tours were worth it and provided a chance to see the towns that we were visiting. My only two comments on what to improve on: the bed pillows need to be upgraded but this is a small nit in the entire package. Also, I wish there was a way to have more time in Vienna. Not sure if this can be accomplished. Overall, I felt that they did a fantastic job and would definitely try another Viking River Cruise. I would recommend this River Cruise to anyone.

Great walk. I started up at the Margret Bridge and walked down to the Liberty Bridge on a sunny October afternoon. Lots to see but watch were you are stepping if you are right by the water as the cobbles/pavers are quite uneven and nobody wants a twisted ankle on vacation.

Dinner and Budapest at night cruise. As part of an Insights Vacations tour, we had dinner on a boat that cruised up and down a section of the Danube at night so that we could see all the lights of the buildings. Many boats run this cruise and it is well worth the time and money. Our boat had a buffet served that was excellent.
Amazing!. Very historical river with lots of stories. Has a great view both day and night but especially at night. also a very romantic place for couples. dont miss it

Fairylike. A beautiful setting, particularly at night...looking up at Buda from Pest is an unforgettable sight....the view from the fort in Buda down the river toward Pest during the day is also memorable.

By the Danube, past, present and future. The Danube is providing a fantastic panorama of Budapest, reflecting the silhouettes of the Gellért Hill, the Castle Hill and the Mathias Church if you sit on the terrace of one of the restaurants or stroll along the riverbanks on the Pest side. You will have a cosy evening by taking a cruising trip with dinner and good wine and enjoy one of the evening sightseeing cruises, which are combined with a sound and vision show. You will see the illuminated hills, palaces, the beautiful Parliament, the bridges, such as the historical Chain Bridge and finally to finish your evening program with the Blue Danube Waltz, which will whisper in your ears, any time you remember this fantastic tour on the Danube. If you have more time, you can take a boat trip to the picturesque small town of Szentendre, or further to see the basilica in Esztergom in the North and the picturesque Danube Bend. If you are interested not only in sightseeing, gastronomy, photography, but also in literature, on the Kossuth Square, close the Parliament look at the statute of József Attila, one of the most excellent poets of Hungary and recall his beautiful poem: “A Dunánál” (“By the Danube”).

Lovely. It would have been nice to take a boat and have a trip on the Danube but we just walked along during our 3 days in Budapest, and if you are lucky to have a nice weather like we did, it makes for a relaxing walk and beautiful pictures. There are also so many bridges along.
Cruise on the Danube with dinner. It was in the night on the boat Europa. Good animation (music)and good hungarian buffet. To recommend.

Viking Legend cruise from Passau to Budapest. Have recently been on a Viking River Cruise aboard Viking Legend from Passau in Germany to Budapest in Hungary to celebrate my wifes 50th birthday. From stepping on board till we disembarked the whole trip was absoloutely fantastic. We could not praise anything highly enough. All the crew were very very friendly and helpfull. Our tour director David was brilliant as were all aboard. Special mention must be made to Sonny on bar, Mary Ann and Ali G in the dining room and Peter our fantastic resident musician. This trip will long be in our memories. Thankyou.

awesome. loved it one of the longest rivers in Europe and a beautiful river and can take you through many countries lots of beautiful bridges and lit up at night is gorgeous Budapest alone has 6 or 7 bridges. Go

Worth the walk. The views from both sides of the Danube are lovely. There are some sculptures/statues to admire along the way. Have a meal by the river or take a walk in the morning. It's refreshing and enlightening

Viking River's "Cities of Light" Cruise. I wish I had read reviews of Viking River Cruises before we booked our expensive ($14,000) trip! Viking has the poorest management of any company we have ever traveled with - we are shocked at their lack of interest in their customer once they have your money! Please do NOT book with Viking! They rerouted our original flight reservations without informing us and we ended up arriving in Paris an entire day later than originally planned. By the time we arrived it had been 48 hrs since we had been in bed. We complained but were told they didn't realize our flights had been changed! Are you kidding me? We even paid extra to have Viking take care of our flights - what a joke! We had been on a waiting list to upgrade our cabin for 6 months, and called regularly to check on availability of any upgraded room, at any cost. When we were boarding the ship we asked the current status of our request and were told that they didn't the fair way to give the available upgrade cabin to someone, so they just gave it to the first person that boarded the ship and asked for it! Again, are you kidding me? We were on a waiting list for 6 months, and the person they gave the cabin to was never on a waiting list. Talk about pitiful management, they are beyond belief. We were given wrong information about where to meet at touring destinations, what time to meet, where to find ATM's, etc.... When we got back to the states we filed another formal complaint on line and received a phone call. After explaining all that happened to us we were told that there was nothing they could do for us except give us a voucher for $1,000 off another Viking trip. What? Why would we ever consider traveling with a company so incompetent? Really, please believe us when we tell you, STAY AWAY from VIKING!!! Save yourselves all the agony of dealing with a company that dimply will take your money and run away with it!

Beautiful river. Boat trips up and down the Danube visiting the interesting architecture. Use the hop on hop off bus service which is also worth it you can use this service for 24 hours including the evenings

Cruising Down The (Danube) River. In one word - fantastic - Matched our greatest expectations and then surpassed them. Viking Cruise down the Romantic Danube was all that and more. Scenery, culture, personnel on board, accommodations were all wonderful.
