From quaint villages, to castles to cathedrals and vineyards - seven days on the Danube was restful and at the same time educational. We'll be up for another river cruise with Viking soon.

Stunning views. I followed Rick Steeves advice and took the night champagne cruise at Dock 7. Overall it was a good experience, but the audio at my seat did not work and the server did not have a way to fix it. Since the whole boat was full on the upper deck, I could not move to another seat. But I enjoyed it all the same

BEAUTIFUL. Magnificent view of this river both night and day. Many opportunities to do water activities, boat rides, dinner and lunch cruises, row boats etc. All bridges crossed over the bridge so we walked over it at least 10 times. Also trams run on bridges over it as well.
a little gray and damp. the predicted weather (sunny and high 60's) turned out to be gray skies, windy and damp but we still enjoyed the river walk.
Fun river to check out. Many European cities have a beautiful river running through them and Budapest is no exception. Definitely worth a stroll/cruise.
Not as charming. Walking by the river (smelly), next to the road (not main by still there was a traffic) was not so charming as I thought would be. Better to go to Margaret island for a nice walk :)

Beautiful River to Cruise. We saw the Danube from the river itself, sailing in on a Viking River cruise from Amsterdam, and the Danube really is a beautiful river to visit. Castles, churches and quaint European towns, what is not to like. Of course in Budapest, the Danube is central and essential to the city. The City was built around the Danube as a shipping route and Strategic location. Both the Parliament and the Royal Palace sit facing the River and are all lit up at night so it really is spectacular to see especially as we sailed into the city at 10:30 PM. It is harder to stroll along the Danube as the riverside promenade is at times interrupted by roads, tram lines and cruise ship terminals. As well, sections are very rough with uneven cobbles. Oh, BTW, the 'Blue Danube" from the waltz no longer exists, it is now more mud brown or grey. Still a lovely river.
relax by the river...!. The Dabune river it´s worth to enjoy it from the pubs around it, or you can take the boats. Check out and relax the peace it gives, at night too.

Danube cruise. This trip was unbeatable! We sailed from Nuremberg to Budapest, visiting Regensburg, Passau, Melk, Vienna &Budapest. Mediaeval towns& cities, marvellous Baroque cathedrals & churches, wonderful architecture, beautiful scenery -all on our comfortable journey. We sailed through the Danube Narrows, visiting beautiful Weltenberg Abbey, & then through the Wachau valley with peaceful, gorgeous scenery. We went to magnificent Melk Abbey, the largest abbey in Europe. Vienna was memorable & lovely, though we needed much more time to explore! Two delights were a fantastic organ concert in Regensburg & a marvellous classical concert in a Viennese palace! The entire trip was truly enjoyable, a dream come true!

The night cruise is a must. I have travelled on many rivers but there is something eternally romantic about the Danube in Budapest, especially at night when all the amazing architecture is lit up for your enjoyment
Best way to orient. The best way to orient oneself in this magnificent town. Even great if you take the night cruise. Get to see the buda castle, iron bridge, opera house etc fully lit up after dark.
River Boat Cruise. So colourful by night. Buffet was sumptuous and plentiful and the pick up / drop off arrangements all well met.

Can’t miss this. How can you come to this great city and not experience Danube. There are actually a whole lot of ways in which you can experience Danube. Take a stroll along its coast while catching on the beautiful sights all around or simply take a cruise probably with a dinner at night and watch the beauty of Budapest with sparkling lights.
historic. Cruise provided with hop on hop off bus was evening great view of city. We went for an hour , saw all the bridges and famous buildings lit up. The Danube is the heart of the city

If the light is just right, it is blue. Mostly a reflection of the blue sky as seen from high atop the hills in Pest. We admired the river from afar and in elks along the banks. There were many river cruise boats on the river. What is a trip to Budapest without notching its centerpiece?

Absolute must. The Danube is beyond a shade the nerve of the wonderful city of Budapest and a cruise on the river is an absolute must. You can decide to either do it in one of the expensive cruises which also give you lunch/dinner tours or you can decide to do it on the super cheap BKK boat services the D11, D12 lines on which the day passes work fine on the weekdays. Either ways you will love it.The river has a different feel during the day and night so if you can you should try and do a ride during the both the times. During the day especially on a clear sunbathed day everything is sparkingly gorgeous and during the night with the lights on the city looks so sparkling.The trip towards the Elizabeth Bridge is probably the exciting one as compared to the one towards the Margaret Bridge unless you were on a longer 2-3 hour cruise to the Sentzendre for instance.
its a river!. its a river! a fairly wide, fairly long river, there are boats and barges on it , the same as on other fairly wide, fairly long rivers. oh yes, and its brown........
Bring a date!. We took a night cruise on Danube. It was amazing. It was so calm. The city were lit up in a fantastic way. I'd recommend any couple to do this at night time!

feeling the wonder & romance. The river just flows and you feel the life in it, we cycled the banks, walked the shores, sailed on the surface, crossed the spectacular bridges and really felt the rivers life being given to us !

A must do in Budapest. Well worth doing.All buildings are lit up and it all looks magical as you float by. It takes about one hour. There was lots of room on board and it was easy to move around or go up on top to take lots of photos. We booked our trip on The Hop on Hop off buses and the boat trip was included.Really great value and we used the bus a lot for touring and just generally getting around this great City.

Fabulous views on both sides. Lovely to cruise along the Danube with great views on both sides. The Parliament building looks amazing, especially lit up at night. There are also a few pub and restaurant boats moored on the Pest side.

Night cruise is must. Night cruise on the Danube was the best thing about our Budapest trip. Budapest has done a very good job in illuminating all big architectural and historical places surrounding Donube.
Love it!. Fantastic views, you must do a trip round Margret Island. The whole city is steeped in facts and myth it's just fascinating and this river is the instigator.

Night boat trip definitely better. took a one hour trip at night down the Danube having walked long it for 2 days beforehand. Definitely worth a night time trip. Views are awesome.Not sure the dinner boat is a great idea though.
I guess this is a 'must do'. Did a 2 hour circular boat trip, which came free with the Big Bus Tour ticketWell worth seeing the 2 sides from the river.
Went on the Danube Bend.. Beautiful sail down the river, with interesting stops at small towns and villages on the way. Like the peaceful and calm atmosphere all the way.

Beautiful City set on the Danube. Gorgeous river which allows the city to sit around it. We did a boat trip and bus trip all along both sides, both during the day and night, fantastic and quite romantic.

Brilliant. If you are in Hungary and especially in Budapest you can't doing a sight tour without see and amoused by the river. Especially at evening, night time, illuminations of building (Parliament, Castle Hill, Fisher Bastion, etc) so beautyfull, that you can't see anywhere else!

mixed blessings. To begin with, it isn't blue! we cruised from linz to Budapest, and it was all very sameish! we were unlucky to have chosen The MV ESMERALDA which is an old boat compared to so many beautiful boats on the river. The cabins are very old fashioned and small, one of the bunks! had to be folded into the wall just to be able to pass one another, and as for the "bathroom" this consisted of a shower ,WC and small wash basin all in the area of a shower cubicle!!. Because its so old the whole thing shook and vibrated when under power during the night. The whole staff/crew tried their best to make things pleasant but the list of negatives about this "boat" are too much to list, at list everything was very clean and the menu, although very limited in choice was well cooked, but....if you are vegetarian....forget it, unless you want to be eating cheese, cheese and more cheese.

Beautiful site to see. Wonderful experience travelling down the Danube by boat. if you use the tour bus you can then get the boat for free to go down the Danube and can take as many trips on it as you like for 48 hours. There is a restaurant on it and very cheap to eat.... I recommend the Hungarian goulash soup, very tasty. You pass a lot of main attractions to view and take pictures.
Beautiful Danube. A boat cruise on Danube is an excellent way of seeing budapest. You can relax and at the same time watch all the excellent attractions.

Viking good choice if cruising ur thing.... Our first cruise. After much anticipation, discovered this type of traveling not quite for me yet. Viking Legend folks did a fine job on our Danube trip, but still prefer staying in one place/exploring that area leisurely/doing day trips. With cruises u stop at a port, do a several hour whirlwind tour, then back on boat for dinner. Not enough time to explore place, shop or enjoy different dining experiences, etc. As an example, spending half a day in Vienna was disappointing.While my wife would likely give higher grades for this cruise, we both agreed if we do it again we would be sure to do it with family/friends. Each dining experience (3 times a day) we had to join a new table of strangers. That is OK on occasion, but finding the comfortable dining partners that many times was a little stressful.While in the US I am usually a pretty good tipper (20%), Viking asks u to tip the entire ship staff, whether u were serviced directly by them or not. Viking made it easy (one €500+ tip at end for all), sometimes I wonder whether the employer, not just Viking, should be paying these folks better, rather than relying on their customers to make up the difference.Food was pretty good, especially breakfasts, but not as much fun as discovering new restaurants/ambiances.Having said all of the above, if cruises are ur thing (good if personal mobility is an issue for example), then Viking is a very good choice.
Long banks of trees. Took the trip on the Danube from Szentendre to Budapest. Nothing of note to see - lots of trees along both banks blocking any outlook. The scenery was great in the city itself.

Danube cruise around Budapest. The cruise was great and interesting!However it was NOT HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE as we were told by the cruise line and by our hotel. I use a scooter and although there's a ramp to get to the boat there are steps going down into it.Do not believe it when you're told something is accessible. Check it out. In general Budapest is not very handicap accessible yet, especially for scooters.However I must commend the crew for getting me on the boat, scooter and all!
River Views. Walking along either side of the river is an enjoyable experience. Plan the walk to fit in with weather conditions and lighting conditions for great photographic opportunities.

Boat cruise up the Danube and around Budapest. We stayed just outside from Budapest in Hotel Oswaldo. It was a 4 night stay. It was bargain bucket and took about an hour to commute but the staff were friendly and very accommodating. We got used to the train ride and where to stop for pizza haha. The owners of the Hotel were very good to us. They give good advise and directions of how to get around Budapest and places of interest to visit and restaurants locally as well as in Budapest that you could use. They allowed us to use their internet. Breakfast was about five Euros at the time.(This was 2009). Some locals looked at us strangely, probably not used to seeing people on holiday who are of African heritage. But other than that, in Budapest everything was fine.There was a restaurant that they recommended around the corner. It was great, relaxed and fairly priced. I cant remember the name though but i will upload some pics.Amongst the other places we visited and enjoyed was Szechenyi Baths and Pool. Biggest in Europe.Tip: Go early so you can spend the whole day.It was amazing outdoor pools and variety of saunas and indoor pools. Best ever!The day river Cruise on the sea was great, calm. You obtain ear phones with a choice of languages to choose from, for the guided tour of this historical city. It was about two hours in length. I saw some great views from both sides of the boat and the sea was calm enough, although I took travel sickness tablet, it seemed very smooth. We passed Parliament building and other important buildings and statues. The ride captures the city's history. It was unlike any other boat tour I experienced. We also passed many bridges on route. Sept 2009

Huge river with bridges and good views of Buda and Pest and beyond. This major river was not able to be crossed until the 19th century when the Chain Bridge was built. This structure is now, in effect, the emblem of the city of Budapest - before this it was the flat Pest on the left bank and the hilly Buda on the right. The dominant features are the Buda Castle, the Parliament and Gellert Hill.There are also boats that go further on round the Danube Bend, to - for example - Szentendre - a artist village with nice galleries and eateries; well worth the excuirsion
dinner and sail. we had a great time food was excellent views amazing definately recommend great value for money lovely music and lots of wine

Riviera's Blue Danube Cruise.. As a celebration of our Silver Wedding Anniversary, we booked a Blue Danube river cruise with Riviera on the five star Lord Byron. We have always been impressed by Riviera, having done six previous holidays with them, none of which were river cruises. Again, they get high marks for organisation, accommodation and quality of Riviera representatives. We have always found our fellow travellers to be interesting and good company and this was true to a large extent on this holiday but, unlike other holidays, the average age of our companions was twenty years higher than my own!We had a Standard, Diamond deck cabin which had a small, perfectly formed bedroom with sliding doors and a juliet balcony. The ensuite was very good, a large shower, plenty room for toiletries and a good makeup mirror! Food onboard was very good at dinner, with at least four small courses. A system of free seating is operated, tables cannot be reserved for small groups. There is a small restaurant to the rear of the boat where reservations are accepted though. Lunch is a buffet. I don't like buffet meals and ended up having more or less the same salad on every occasion we had lunch onboard. We were given a packed lunch on the day we visited Salzberg, I'm afraid I gave mine away to a beggar, who I am sure would've enjoyed it more than me! All members of the crew were very friendly and helpful and we enjoyed the show they put on for us one evening in the bar; very amusing!The cruise started in Budapest, where we started in the evening, a stunning city and worth seeing illuminated at night. The view from the boat during the first couple of days of cruising was mainly a tree lined bank and our first stop was Estergom which was very unappealing and quite depressing in atmosphere. The next day, Bratislava had more to offer but things really improved as we got into Austria, in terms of view from the boat and places to visit! Durnstein, Salzberg and Vienna are fantastic destinations with plenty to do and see.Speaking to our fellow travellers, I would say that perhaps a Rhine cruise would've suited us better, so we might think about that in fifteen years time!

beautiful architecture. Beautiful tour on a sunny day the architecture is amazing with a good audio and history tour, the boat had small but suitable bar, the beer went down a treat, the toilet was not so good, but adequate, what do you expect on a sightseeing boat.
Night time cruise. We enjoyed the cruise, except that the windows were highly reflective and that made it difficult to see outside.

MS Sound of Music. We just returned from a Danube Cruise on the MS Sound of Music through Gate 1. The trip included destinations on land as well as on the Danube and so we chose this trip because it had a unique itinerary. This riverboat was not a new one. It has been refurbished but can do with another complete face lift. Our room, which was an upgrade, was large and comfy. The common areas were pleasant but needing an upgrade. The staff went above and beyond to please. The food was plentiful but the variety was often lacking and chicken was a staple. There were very limited medical personnel or equipment capabilities to deal with an emergency on board. All in all it was a good trip. In the future I would probably book with a company having more modern riverboats.

Viking River Cruise. We took a Viking River Cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest on the ship named Viking Lif. We had a great time but this review is about the river, not the ship. Of course, there is no Blue Danube. That is only true in the song. That said, the scenery was spectacular and the cruse from the Main-Danube Canal was most enjoyable.We sailed past castles, under bridges and through locks. The cities and towns visited were great (especially Vienna and Budapest), the food was good and the scenery spectacular. Highly recommended.

Danube river cruise with Riviera Travel on the Lord Byron. My friend from Vancouver and I spent a wonderful week cruising the Danube. On board and off board the experience was exceptional. The food was undoubtedly five-star as was the service and friendliness of the entire crew and Riviera staff. If you are a light sleeper you might wish to choose a cabin on the middle or upper deck since passing through the locks can be a bit noisy during the night. We are planning our third holiday with Riviera travel for 2015!

Must go. We went to Budapest on a day tour from Vienna. We had some time available in the afternoon and preferred to do the Danube river cruise and we didn't regret doing that.It started near Inter Continental Hotel and was a two hours cruise. There was great view on either side. We sailed under various bridges, passed through the Palace, Parliament building to name a few. It takes you to near one island and would return to the same place. It was a great experience and must do in Budapest.

Lovely. We bought a 72 hr budapest card and used the public bkk river bus from the bottom of the city centre to just before margrit hid, it was a lovely boat ride with fantastic views of most major buildings along the river, it took about 45 minutes

Boat trip on the Danube.. Paid 2,000 huf about a £5 for a trip from Elisabeth bridge upto st Margarets island where you could get off and wander about for 2 hours if you wished.The boat would return and then circle the island and take you back down the other side of the river.Great value I thought.
Danube River Cruise. The Danube River Cruise was very beautiful by night. We did a day and night cruise as part of the hop on hop off bus offer.
Jazz cruise and dinner tour.. Very pretty to see the buildings along the river lit up at night. The service was super and the Jazz band were very entertaining.

Viator cruise tour down Danube River-A Success!. We took a late night Danube river cruise booked through Aviator tours. Booking was easy enough as we got our tickets only the morning of the cruise. Directions to the meeting point were challenging and we were lucky to see the group crossing the street and asked if this was the tour. Exhilarated that we connected, we were led through one fancier looking ship to cross through to another that was less fancy. Directed upstairs with a glass of champagne (or juice) to sit at tables, it was cool and what views! We could open the windows and a handful of people were able to sit in the limited space out on the deck. The boat took off as planned and a waiter came up to take additional orders. I ordered a bowl of ghoulash soup which was very tasty. It came with two thick slices of bread and was very reasonable and satisfying. I'd read a number of unhappy reviews on their website discouraging purchasing the meals for the trip, so we ate dinner long before the cruise. Our glass of wine followed and we had a good time enjoying our leisurely jaunt up the beautifully lit Danube. For some reason we thought water came with our ticket and asked for it. The waiter was very kind bringing our ticket agreement back up so we could see our trip did not include water and then he comped us two bottles of water.anyway! Sweet! We wanted to tip him, but he never returned as someone else came to take our money for the soup. The trip ended at just about the right time for me. One hour and half was enough time on the River. Great tour! We will look for more Viator tours where ever we travel!

having a relaxing holiday. loved watching the many tourists walking along the Danube "Boulevard" and listening to the different languages being spoken.What I didn't like was seeing these same tourists throwing cigarette stubs on the ground, and excuse me "spitting" but because of the beauty of this place one forgets all
Evening River Cruise. An absolute must to view the magnificently lit city at night. We booked "Legenda" and received a discount by showing the Rick Steves tour book.

Travelling with Viking River Cruises. If you are a vegetarian or have dietary requirements make sure before travelling that Viking River Cruises are able to accommodate you ....... we were informed on our recent Danube cruise that there were no vegetarian dishes on the menu !!! We were offered a menu list that we could select from and the chef would make a non-meat equivalent, but there were no veggie choices on the daily menu ....but we found this out the hard way by finding meat in our food. Come on Viking vegetarians are accommodated all over the world the vegetarian symbol is international. We had stipulated on our booking form that we did not eat meat !! This really spoilt our trip !!!

Like Judging the Universe. What can one say about the Danube - one of the major waterways of central Europe? It transcends description (although, on my visit, it was definitely NOT blue, a result of about a week of very heavy rain. It is simply an entity not to judge but simply stand in awe of.

Enjoy the views from the river at night. The City sparkles. I did a river trip at night and would very much recommend this to travellers. The City lights up at night allowing you to fully appreciate the romance this City has to offerOur trip was the Big Bus trip and took an hourThe photographs of the castle and parliament building were stunning

Must do. It seems unthinkable to visit budapest and not go onthe Danube ... but dont waste money ona tourist boat ... pick up the BKK public boat at one of a dozen stops and travel for 750 florin, 1/4 of the tourist price. The views either side are spectacular and not to be missed, on a sunny day get off at Margarets island and walk back to Margarets bridge in 30 mins.

Outstanding AmaWaterways Cruise from Vilshofen to Budapest. My husband and I just took the 8-day AmaWaterways' "Romantic Danube" cruise, embarking at Vilshofen, Germany and disembarking at Budapest. It was our first cruise of any kind, and we can't imagine a better cruise experience. The ship, the AmaPrima, was named Best River Cruise Ship for 2013 -- though we're confident any of their ships would not disappoint. The staff couldn't have been better: friendly, polite, thoughtful, and accommodating. You can take this cruise either direction, but finishing in Budapest, where on our last night we cruised the harbor to see the illuminated bridges and buildings, was unforgettable.

There is no way.... You can go to Budapest and not experience the Danube. It is the jewel of Budapest. Unlike many of the city streets, it is clean with not a lot of garbage floating in it..also, no graffiti which was a pleasant change! It is a nice walk along both banks...i walked over all 5 bridges during my 3 day stay. I enjoyed the bronze statues...i got started early everyday to avoid the crowds which i would highly recommend.i

Where's the Blue?. A walk along the Danube exposes you to the city's history with amazing architecture both historical and present. Very scenic, great for picture taking but no "Blue" Danube. The water is rather brown.

Night ride on the Danube is stunning. We chose to take a small boat ride at night (90 minute tour ) down the Danube. With all of the major landmarks on the Danube being dramatically lit at night, it was a beautiful way to spend 90 minutes. The tour begin at sunset and lasted to about 8:15. Drinking some fine Hungarian wines and cruising down one of the most famous rivers in the world-followed by alight dinner afterwards at one of the many excellent Bistros, was a neat way to spend an evening.
What a sight. Came into Budapest on a river cruiser about 10pm the buildings all lit up and reflecting on the waters of the Danube what a wonderful sight
Unforgetable evening river cruise. Try to take an evening river cruise. Don't forget to bring a good camera. All scenery are brilliant and unforgettable.

Take in the Views. What a great way to get some fabulous views and pictures of the sites and architecture of Budapest. We did the City Tour, Hop On Hop Off boat and bus tour so the boat gave us a great insight and we were then able to decide what we would like to investigate further.Refreshments could be purchased on board with a full bar.

Nice cruise. Don't leave Budapest without a cruise trip on Danube and visit Margarethe Island in the heart of the city! Cruise is a great way to see some beautiful historical buildings along the river and Margarethe Island is a great place for a leisurely stroll in fresh air after the buzz of the city! Rent a bike and enjoy the island!
Beautiful at night. All of the many beautiful buildings along the Danube are lit up at night....spectacular, especially when seen from the river.

Viking River Cruise. Totally awsome trip from Munich to Budapest.. The ship was VERY nice, good food, great staff.Our favorite stop was the last - Budapest. Could have stayed one more day. So much history and beauty
Beaufiful! Do a river Cruise!. Very pretty to cruise down the river and see all the historicla sites. Highly suggest it or just walking down it.

WOW. Do not leave Budapest without taking a river cruise and if you can only do one cruise ..make it a NIGHT CRUISE.The buildings, both Historic and New that are situated along the banks of the Danube are SPECTACULAR .EVEN MORE BEAUTIFUL AT NIGHT WHEN ILLUMINATED.Certainly, Budapest May be one of the most beautiful and certainly affordable Cities to visit in Europe.The Danube possibly makes it the most beautiful.
Wow. We sailed along the Danube on the booze cruise and wow, some very beautiful sights for the culturally inclined of us. Don't ever leave Hungary without taking a trip on this famous river

A Night Cruise to Rival any City's. I wish we had also taken a more extensive trip on the Danube up to its famous bend above the city (next time), but the 90 minute night cruise on one of the smaller boats is a must. The city by night is the equal to any of its more famous competitors for best lights, and to see it unfold on the Danube is rather magnificent. Our boat took us up one side and down the other and we passed under three of Budapest's amazing bridges which are all beautifully illuminated. Hint: sit on the side of the boat closest to the dock so as to get less obstructed (by passengers) view of the sights. The fee was a mere $8 per person for 24 hours worth of travel.

Nice Dinner/Show. Hotel has recommended Silverline Danube Dinner Cruise. It was realy good : food, music, ship conditions. I only don't give 5 stars because its folder states that a cruise will take 3 hours, but we got only 1.5 hours at the river.
Fortuna river boat dinner cruise. Delicious well prepared dinner buffet and great wines. The view at night of the city is wonderful and it is a great must see activity

absolutely beautiful. Beautiful view ....well worth a long stroll along the banks which has many scenic views and historical buildings and attractions from the parliament buildings to The Shoes on the Danube
A must: nighttime cruise on the Danube. Arrange for an evening cruise with or wthout dinner, and get carried away. Alternative: dinner on a moored ship.

Do you mean a Danube Cruise?. We enjoyed an evening cruise on the Danube. The city sparkles at night. Only quibble is our difficulty in finding the proper peer in the dark, but ultimately we did. Other passengers had headphones and seemed to enjoy the visual presentation playing from monitors.

Enjoyable hour. My husand and I took a boat trip along the River Danube during our 2 day stay in Budapest. We opted for the boat trip for 1 hour with a drink of champayne or beer. Very relaxing with audio headphones. The sights from the river are worth seeing. Some beautiful architect.

Wonderful Amsterdam to Danube River Cruise. Experiencing the Danube on a river cruise is the best. We arrived in Budapest at night and experienced the welcoming site of the City buildings and bridges all lit up. Everyone one we talked with was over whelmed by how wonderful Budapest is and all that it has to offer. Wonderful sights, theater and concerts, restaurants, thermal baths, shopping and beautiful views everywhere. An evening stroll on the river front is a must and dinner at an waterfront outdoor restaurant or cafe is even better.

Scenic but not essential. We took one of those voice-guided cruises that last an hour or so. It was a wet and windy morning, with hardly 6 or 8 passengers on board. Yes, you get to see the Pest side and the Buda side while you're floating down the river. The Buda side is obviously the more scenic view, while the Pest side is dominated by the Parliament building. Recommended only if your itinerary has a 60-minute hole in it. Else you'd be better off taking a ride in tram line #2. It's more fun than sitting in an empty, floating restaurant.

Cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam.. Budapest was beautiful. Although excited for the cruise, we were sad to leave budapest. Walking on either side of the Danube morning, noon, or night offered incredibly beautiful views

Wonderful. The Danube is beautiful and very relaxing. To appreciate the beauty, you must take a relaxing stroll along the Danube at night. The lights are gorgeous and you can lose all track of time while you take in the gorgeous surroundings. Simply wonderful.

Danube walks. We walked along the Danube every day throughout our holiday in Budapest. We walked from the Parliament over to Chains Bridge, up to Margaret's Bridge and back to the Parliament which gave us the opportunity to take so many photos. I suggest you try and find some time to walk by the river at night, its amazing.

Great River, Tour... not so much.. We just returned from the Viking Danube River Cruise, beginning in Budapest and ending in Nuremberg. We added extra days in Budapest and in Prague, Czech Republic.Positives:We loved visiting three of the worlds great cities.The cruise is a great opportunity to meet wonderful people.Attentive staff, especially housekeeping, bar, and wait staff.Excellent suite, beautiful ship. We had no problems with any shipboard functions.Viking booking staff, and hotel concierge (guest services) could not have been better!Negatives:The ship was sold out, We felt the ship was crowded and not equipped for the 182 passengers.Uncertain schedule – due to river traffic and lock schedules. We arrived late at some stops and early at others. Although the crew did try to compensate, it left us constantly feeling hurried. We also felt there simply was not enough time in each location.We felt Viking provided poor communications about the amount of walking involved and little if any alternatives. This was not a problem for us, but we did see others with this issue.We found the buffet breakfast and lunch mediocre at best, the dinners were excellent, although portions are extremely small. The dinner wait staff seemed undermanned with.long delays serving. Possibly due to the high passenger count. We had no complaints with the wait staff, there simply was not enough of them.On board entertainment was a piano player and a few games.Overall, did not feel the trip was worth the price.

What we expected. In the middle of a lovely city, it allows the elegance of the city to radiate and attract people.The Danube is a river which runs right through many parts of Europe including Budapest a must visit a must see any time
Great Danube. i had a sightseeing trip in this river it was wonderful, another view to the city and to its great monuments: the parliament, the castle....
Do the night tour!!!!!. Buy the ticket to do a round trip and then get on the ferry that is just before sunset. It is absolutely breathtaking to see Budapest at night.

Great River. The city is built around it and plays a special part of the history of the two parts of the city. It's chain bridge is the major like between pest and buda. A lot of nostalgia is from the river.

Childhood memories. As a child and young adult that loved musice, I remember An der schönen blauen Donau (or The Blue Danube) very well. Now as an adult in my 40s, I found standing on the Elizabeth Bridge (Erzsebet hid) and watching the Danube flow beneath me quite awe inspiring. One of those 'tick the box - I did it' moments, but it felt much more than a tick the box exercise. There were plenty of opportunities along the bank to take a river boat cruise but I didn't have the time.
like the music. always loved danube... both sides of town also... bridges... small caffees... some of the people don't like the smell of river, but it remind me on my childhood...

Impressive figure of he city. the best way to discover the Danube is having a boat trip You see all the nice buildings from the water and you get information about Budapest. Walking by the river is again is a nice activity. You can walk during the day or night see all the historical places. I would say without Danube Budapest would be an ordinary city.Yes the river doesnt look clean but still attractive.

Danube is not very blue here.. Naturally, it is not blue in Vienna either. I started to write a review only because I find it weird to review a river. Too wide, too narrow, too slow, too swift....?Danube is Danube, the fact that it is going through Budapest is of course a benefit to the city and also a reason the city was build there.Going under the bridges, around the Margaret island in one of those tourist ship is a great way to get a overall feeling for the city of Budapest.

1350 km. a 4-week self-guided bicycle journey landed us in Budapest (from source of Danube). The section from Esztergom to Budapest was particularly scenic and the pathway was mostly good. It was easy to access the centre of this large city with dedicated bike lanes right along the river.

Avalon Expression Budapest to Nuremburg. This was our first River Boat Trip. We sailed on the Expression from Budapest to Nuremberg.We booked the least expensive room #105. It was roomy and comfortable. Plenty of places to store your stuff. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our only problem was in Vienna when parked 3 deep with other ships we had a very bad sewer gas problem in our room. We talked to the Captain but it was coming from the ship parked next to us. The food was very good. Many selection to eat healthy if you chose to. We did not care for the Open seating. We traveled with a group of 7 and each night one person had to line up at the dinning room to grab a table. The tours and excursions are great ,the head phone system me it nice not to be in herd walking you can spread out. I would book Avalon again but do not waist your money on a fancy room. Your in your room so little to enjoy to the view if your not parked next to another boat looking at that. The laundry service on the boat is very reasonable to take fewer clothes and have them washed. Also bring sweatpants for lounging, a insulated coffee cup to the 24 hour coffee and cookie bar. One of the best things to do is pick up local wines and beer as you go. You can enjoy them up on deck or in your room. They charge a small cork fee at dinner and you can't bring it in the lounge of course. But if you have it in your insulated mug they don't know what's in it..... I hope this helps a few people going for the first time. I know I wish I knew these things ahead of time.

Danube on Viking Riverboat Rinda. We began our trip in Bucharest, Romania where Viking put their guests in the beautiful Radisson Blu overnight. We had spent 4 days in Bucharest prior to our joining Viking and found a lovely boutique hotel in Old Town called the Rembrandt. . Nothing fancy but wonderful location and the staff were ever so helpful. It was given a good rating of hotels to choose from in Bucharest. Upon arrival at the Radisson we were helped by the Viking staff located in the lobby. We were instructed to have our bags outside our rooms the following morning by 6:30 am. We did so and went to breakfast but upon returning around 8::45 am bags were still outside our room. Had a driving tour of much of Bucharest that morning with a stop at the Palace Parliament for those desiring to do an inside tour. We had already been on that tour during our stay prior to the cruise, so we got a walking tour of Old Town instead. We were all given a walking tour of a Village Museum. . Lunch was at a local restaurant that made us feel a bit like cattle. Way too many people, and loud, and quite hurried. Not a pleasant experience. Once on the Rinda we went into our AA Cabin Suite. Very nice accommodations and we were happy to get settled in and unpack. Our friends who were traveling with us were able to visit with us each evening in our separate living room which was a real plus. The Viking Rinda longship is a rather new ship put into service 2013. Attractive with modern décor. This is our 3rd. riverboat cruise, but 1st. with Viking. The cruise we chose was to the eastern block areas we had been unable to tour in the past. We found the excursions very educational and enlightening in many ways. Only problem we found was they seem to try to cram too many sites into a day, and way too many people per guide. Sometimes as many as 48. There were afternoons when we would return to ship with only 40 minutes or so to clean up from the day and change clothes to be up for the evening briefing at 6:30 or 6:45. We felt very rushed and we weren't the only ones to make mention of this.. You don't have to dress fancy for the evening, but you often do feel you want to possibly shower and clean up a bit for the dinner. As for the wait staff and the food, both were exceptional. We chose to sit in the same area each evening and became very close and friends with our servers. Travel Tip.... All tables are 6 tops and more and open seating. We chose to send one person ahead 15 minutes prior to the meal if you desire to select the same waiters. One thing that stood out was the Captain was missing in action most of the week, to the public, including the Captain's Dinner. He was introduced to us at the beginning of the cruise and that was it. Very different experience from that standpoint. Twice on the ship we had to up and available at 6:30 am. Once for a customs check, which I guess was understandable. The second was to have our bags out precisely at 6:30am the final day as it was a safety issue to have the hall cleared. We left the ship around 9 and all bags were still outside our rooms. Some of you may be very early risers and this is not a problem, but for those of us who are on vacation and not really happy about 3 mornings, including the Radisson Blu, of Very Early Risings, it was a somewhat irritating and seemed to be unnecessary. Overall our experience was positive. However we have discovered that Viking's "all inclusive" is grossly inaccurate. Unlike other cruises we have been on, the only thing you get for upgrading to an AA suite is a pair of slippers and cheap robe to use. No coffee pot, no soft drinks or wine / spirits and no laundry included. Laundry cost is obscene. Then there is the "recommended tipping". Most Company CEOs would not get the salary rate recommended. For example, the cruise we were on was touted as 10 day cruise, but 3 days were in hotels with breakfast only provided. The tipping guide suggests tipping rates for all 10 days... you were not even on the boat. We did individually tip our wait staff and we did provide a proper tip for the general staff and tour director, but not as large as the suggested. As we checked out we noticed a minor revolt among the people as they were asked if they wished to add the tip to their bill. All 10 of the folks in line with me said no. All 15 in line with our travel mates said no. We felt they deserved tips but not as Viking suggests. Especially when they tout "All Inclusive".Very unfortunate for the staff.Viking boats are extremely quiet and functional and the staff is excellent. We felt special on our cruise as we celebrated our 51st anniversary with an evening to remember.We would recommend Viking, but suggest you plan to be nickel dimed for the bus driver, tour guide, beverages (except coffee and tea), laundry, and bar costs. Other lines on similar routes with true all inclusive rates that at first glance may seem higher, but a check out would be competitive. The ability to have a coke zero or glass of wine or a beer other than at meal times more than makes up the difference in price.Hope this helps you choose with a little more info as you search for your cruise.cheers,eeg3
Magnificent!. I know the Danube from my own country but here in the middle of Budapest is has a different meaning and a different view. It's very magnificent to watch from all it's bridges. :)

Great views. So romantic! The boat tour is included with the hop-on tour bus and best done in the evening. Only drawback was it was really crowded at 9 pm. I think the 10 pm cruise would have been better.
Stunning. Take a walk along it in the evening, you won't be disappointed! - Truly beautiful with many nice places to eat and drink along the waters edge.
Do a river cruise at night. I highly recommend taking a night cruise on the Danube. The views of the brightly-lit Parliament building and the bridges are amazing.

Dinner Cruise. We enjoyed the breath taking night view of the city. Spend a couple of hours going up and down. Just couldn't stop clicking the camera.. It was so beautiful..especially the Parliament building.

Just walking along it is wonderful. You can do a tour with a company, or you can use the city boat in the evening for 1 euro and get pretty much the same service...the next pricy is the hop on hop off boat which I heard was 9 euro but you should check. It also comes with a city card if you got one of those.
BKK river service. Cheap. Included on weekly BKKticket. Bar available. Both directions. This is more than 50 characters.

Viking River cruise Amsterdam to Budapest. Awesome is the one word to describe this trip. It first started with the transfer pick up in Amsterdam. Our driver was there with his sign as soon as we entered the terminal. Whisked us off to our hotel in Amsterdam the Movenpic. We did the pre extension. The hotel is very nice, though they could provide viking guest with priority entrance to our rooms, after travelling sitting until 3:00 waiting for a room is annoying. However if the weather would have been better it probably wouldn't have mattered. The walking tour the next day was fantastic we had Klauss, he's amazing! Boarding the viking Eistla was...wow. It was more than I expected. The "light lunch" was great, salad, sandwiches, pasta salads, really quite a bit of food. Free flowing wine and beer! The whole trip exceeded our expectation. The staterooms are very nice, small but efficient we had a balcony so that was nice. The showers are great. The staff are fantastic, from the cabin stewards to the dinning room staff. We were likely enough to have Goran, Martina, Lucas and Seta! If you have them your in for a treat! The food was amazing five star all the way! I'm not sure what some other reviews complain about but I guess you just can't please some people...we had some on our cruise. Rude people really. I would go on a viking river cruise and we are looking into the ocean cruise for 2016. Highly recommend it, although have to say make sure you go on the new long ships as they are fantastic!
not blue. Unfortunately the Blue Danube no longer exists. There are some boat trips you can take that are enjoyable.
Cheap trip on the Danube. Not expensive and didn't last too long boat basic with movable but not comfortable seats. Great views of all the historical buildings

Have a boat tour for the price of two bus tickets in Budapest. During the daytime you can use the Budapest transport boat service to tour the river for the price of two bus tickets. It's not a tour service but public transport so take a guide book with you!

Must take an evening river cruise. We had a wonderful experience of taking an hour Danube cruise at night when the lights on the buildings were on and also the bridges. This was a very nice experience. Even though the day was warm it was cool on the river boat so dress accordingly.
Night walk. We walked on both banks straddled by two bridges..,awesome views of the monuments... Very safe and alive and rom
Lovely hour on the river. We bought tickets to hop on hop off bus. 5000 huf each . It came with 2 days use and 2 free trips on the river. Very good value and a must to see the sights from the river.

Lovely river with great public transport boats. The river makes the city so much more interesting. You can walk on the riverside, admire the views from the bridges and take a boat ride to see the city from a different angle. The views at night are specially recommended as the main buildings are all lit upand look lovely with nice reflections in the water.The city transport service also runs boat services, which is a great bargain alternative to the overpriced tourist trap of tourist lunch and dinner cruises. The local tourist offices work on commission it seems, because the girls were very keen for me to book on these cruises but did not tell me that if I just wanted a simple trip down the river I could use the public transport boats. These boats have twic decks with great seats and tables with linen covers for sitting nicely - I saw several people had brought food and drinks to enjoy while cruising. They have toilets and food kiosk on board. Best of all, if you have the 24/48/72hour travel card you can use this on the boats for free rides. The bboats can be boarded from several piers.
Highly recommend a nighttime booze cruise. We booked a trip on the Danube via our hostel (Retox) and had a great night for relatively cheap. Incredible views of the parliament building and bridges.
Danube in the evening. Take a boat trip in the evening, it splits the city in to Budanad Best, and the ligths in the evening are spectaculor

Beautiful Danube. A beautiful part of the world and one of Europe's classic rivers - lovely buildings and lots to see and do on both sides.

Rip off Danube tour. It started badly. We bought 4 tickets from a courteous street vendor for the 2.45 Margaret Island boat trip. Until 3.10 we were contained on a moored boat until the scheduled boat arrived and after the disembarkation of the previous load, were allowed to board. The bilingual commentary was unimaginative and robotic and the English version was barely decipherable and spoken with a strong Chinese accent. The tour we were given was the alternative tour to the one we had bought. We were returned to the dock at 4pm more or less 45 minutes after setting off. We tried to redress this with the less than charming staff who met us on the gang plank. Their only justification was that all tours were subject to modifications, a word that was clearly displayed on their billboard.They were deeply unpleasant and we a saw a side to Hungarian people that up until that point we had no inkling of. The whole issue was shabby, upsetting and rather reminded us of the Marchioness disaster. This was the only thing that marred our otherwise fabulous stay in this delightful city.

Only a few hours availaable to us. And we toured the city by bus, walked around a little bit, stayed on the River ( Intercontinental) and it was a beautiful walking area. The River by night is amazing seeing the lights on the bridges, the Palace lit up, and boats traveling the river.

AMA Danube. Absolutely over the top. Ran from Budapest to Nuremberg and then bused up to Prague. Spent extra days in Buda and Prague (well worth it). The streets in Buda were clean enough to eat off of and people were genuinely friendly; not " uppity French" friendly where they take your money because they have to. We stayed right on top of the Danube river. Plenty of places to sight see on both sides of the Danube in Budapest. We could have spent another 2-3 days easily. From there we traversed north and then west through Slovakia, the Czech Republic, Austria, & Germany. Paralleled our ship on a bike ride from one port to another one day. (should be in fairly good shape to do this even at only4-5mph) and saw the countryside from a different view. Visited local wineries and churches. Dropped in at the cemetery location where the Sound of Music" filmed. Wonder what ever happened to Rolfe? Speaking of wondering, why are the Danube ships built the way they are? I mean they only hold 130-170 people. You don't have to travel very long to gain the knowledge to this answer. Traveling on the boat meant connecting with a lot of people; most of whom you'll recognize by the 4th or 5th day as being off your boat and if you let yourself float around at "feeding time" you eventually settle in with a core group you'll interact with. Can't vouch for any other ship, but ours was always kept spotless, and the crew was overly accommodating. Food was abundant at all meals as was the unlimited wine, beer, milk, and pop (colas). Thank goodness for the top deck running track to walk/run off all those extra calories! The trip gave you ample time to sample the country side not only with your palette but also with your cinema tonic acumen. Evenings on the ship had entertainment of some sort several days although this was not the highlight of the trip. This after all was not a cruise where you are stuck in the ocean, this is a destination excursion on a giant water taxi. You do a lot of walking, shopping, walking, eating; walking, sightseeing, and did I mention walking? Not that some people didn't skip several of the free excursions to relax on the boat. Several of the excursions also accommodated handicapped or walking impaired groups. With all the countries in the European union, travel between them was uninterrupted and smooth. From the portion of the iron curtain on display and Holocaust death camps to the palatial views and scenic countryside, history reaches out and shakes you by the scruff of the neck. This trip has a lot to offer everyone from serious historian or religious romanticist, to the transient existentialist. Once again, I can only speak for AMA Waterways on this ship, but corporately speaking they seem to know what to do and how to do it. All timing seemed well scripted and almost not enough time to spend on some of the excursions for us real fanatics on the trip. I'd do this trip again if not for the fact that I have other "bucket list" travels to do.
