Viking River Cruise- Fabulous! Well worth the cost.. We went on our first cruise this past May. After years of "doing our own thing" with the Rick Steves books, we decided to let someone else take care all of the details. We went with Viking on the Danube River, starting in Budapest, ending in Nuremburg. Our ship was the Viking Delling. It was such a relief to unpack just once, and not have to run to catch trains/planes/buses from one city to the next.Our boat was so clean, you could eat off the floors. The state rooms (cabins) were well-designed. There was storage everywhere, so we never felt the room was small. Besides, other than sleeping and showering, we spent very little time in our cabin. The (queen) bed was very comfortable. All of the public areas were very tastefully decorated and comfortable. 24/7, you could go to the coffee bar for tea, coffee, cookies, etc. The lounge had smaller groupings of seating areas so you could sit with a smaller group of people to visit. And, a piano player for "gentle" background music. One of the best parts of the trip was getting to know other people from around the country. The food was excellent. There was always something on the menu that appealed to us. For dinner, in addition to a couple of daily specials, chosen to offer a taste of the local region's cuisine, you could always choose one of three standard offerings. The wines (complimentary) were of very good quality-- not the usual wine-in-a-box stuff when you get when wine is "free".The tours were thoughtfully planned, and all of the guides spoke English. There was even a "special" version of each tour--the "leisurely tour"-- for those who might be a little slower at walking. Viking thought of everything: one day, we had some rain, and they provided large umbrellas for everyone.The activities director provided on-board afternoon/evening entertainment that tied in with the city we would visit the next day. A cultural submersion, if you will. We also received a newsletter each evening, reviewing what was going on the next day.To be honest, I can't think of a negative thing to say about our experience. We look forward to booking another river cruise as soon as we can. Considering what it would cost to stay in hotels, hire tour guides, pay entrance fees to various attractions, transportation from one city to the next, transportation within a city to do sightseeing, possibly rent a car, pay for meals in hotels and restaurants, deal with the stress trying to figure out other languages... we felt the cost of the Viking cruise was very reasonable.
Dinner Cruise on the Danuble. Evening dinner cruise, great sights and lots of fun, Great Value!Nothing not to like! great for all ages.

A view from the river. The crew on our Amadeus Royal went out of their way for us. We stopped at several places and we were warned about the 11 locks that we went through mostly at night. Did not like the two hour meals all the time. Once would have been enough.
Who can resist the romance of the Blue Danube. The Danube is beautiful: the river itself, the bridges, the ferry ride, the view from the tallest hill at sunset.
The Best. One of the best place to see in Budapest; lots of Cafe's Bazaar and venue along the Danube.And so much to do

Budapest Jew, of the Danube. The Danube divides this beautiful city in two, Buda on one side and Pest on the other. Our experience of the Danube began in this city this is where we began our European Odisy, The river is the conduit for many vessels making their way through Europe. Along the river there are many quaint and romantic villages to explore. We enjoyed all the history, sights and sounds as we travelled the river.

Lovely, but magical at night!. My husband and I enjoyed strolling along the banks and taking pictures but the boat ride on the danube legend was magical! There was a lovely breeze and all the fantastic antique buildings lit up in the best way.I suggest either the boat ride or a nice relaxing walk to end the day in a good way, especially on hot summer days!

boat cruise on a regular basis, by the local transportation company. Just to make our stay more interesting, we decided to see Budapest from a side which we have never done before. There is a regular boat cruise which goes up and down on the Danube and it has stops on both sides. Such a stop looks like a bus station, with time table, maps and everything. Boats are not so young, but with powerful engines and both interior and deck space. Usually in good weather the deck space is not enough, everybody wants to stay there.Going up on the river is nothing special, but going down implies some interesting maneuvers, in order to dock the ship, as during docking it will always turn it's nose against the water flowing direction. Due to the fact that not only the things you can see on the riverside but also the ships which you may see coming and going near you , the overall experience is marking it's spot on the personal memories list, both for adults and kids. For enthusiasts who want a little bit of adventure, I recommend the boat-bus, which , seen from the distance, can give you the shivers while going into the water and then cruising upwards on the Danube. Next time I'll definitely try it.
Lovely promenade with eateries. You can watch the world go by or take the No 2 tram which goes down the length of the promenade at peanuts cost... book of 10 transport tickets only 3000 HUF.

Evening boat ride, romantic and perfect for photos. We booked a boat ride (as it was my husbands birthday) and managed to get loads of photos of the castle and bridges. It was cold, rainy and romantic.It included wine and we could have opted for food which looked lovely but as he's a (REALLY) fussy eater we ate before the tour.

Dinner Cruise on the Danube. This outing was organised as part of our tour. The food was buffet style and mostly very tasty Hungarian specialities (particularly liked the stuffed cabbage eaves and the goulash). The views from the river as the evening was drawing in and the buildings were floodlit, were magical. I would love a chance to do this again.
Nice river. Didn't do a boat trip but saw enough if this river from different view points on my travels in Budapest walked up and down it plenty of times whilst I was in the city! Worth a look!
Great river from high school history days..... Great river from high school history days....Nice to do it from a boat trip and then one of the overlooking bridges for awesome photos.
One of the Worlds rivers you must experience. You cannot go through life without witnessing the Danube. Such a great European river that can be seen and admired from a number of capital cities.
A Boat Trip. You must experience the boat trip at night - so many positive emotions that is enough for the whole summer!
Stunning at night. The view at night on a boat cruise was beautiful and seeing the parliament building all lit up was breathtaking. A must do whilst in Budapest.
Beautiful Danube. We were on a river cruise on the Danube and loved every minute of it. Each place had different foods and cultures. We had a fantastic time.
The Most Beautiful River in Europe. The Danube River cross several countries and split the Hungary's capital city in two parts: Buda and Peste. Amazing!

Danube cruise . We cruised into Budapest on a river cruise and it was a beautiful site. Do try a boat trip on the Danube - at night it is even better with all the lights on the bridges and boats. A wonderful sight and a must in Budapest. See what colour you think the Danube is - they say it's blue to lovers !

A mighty fine river. In my recent trip to Budapest, I stayed in a hotel right next to the river. The river is a fine example of the history for not just Hungary, but Europe. If you ever plan to visit this place, take a river boat and learn about the river and its surroundings.

We've never seen anything like Budapest at night. Our Danube river cruise on Viking ended in Budapest. The cruise line makes sure that you sail into Budapest at night. We arrived at 11:00 p.m., and can honestly say that we have seen few places (if any) that are as beautiful as Budapest at night.The lighting of all major buildings, bridges, streets was amazing. I stood on deck for an hour taking photo after photo (over 100) of what I was seeing. We went well down the river, and than turned around to come to our mooring site. So, we got two good looks of everything. This was an awe inspiring city, and a complete delight to see. As I've said, never have we seen anything to compare.

Best view of the city. If you would like a complete view of Budapest, you absolutely must take one of the Danube boat tours. It lasts about 30-45 minutes, depending on the type of the tour and gives you a totally different view of the city. Some tours will take you to the island, some will not go as far, but without the boat tour, your Budapest adventure is not complete. Look for the Budapest City Pass which gives you 2 boat tours free (one during the day and one at night). What a magnificent view – Budapest at night!!!

Boat trip. Well worth the cost, combine it with the hop on/hop off bus for more economy. Beautiful views of all the main sights from the river, Castle, Parliament, Margaret Island, Citadel, Freedom, Chain, Elizabeth & the yellow bridge. do it!

unbelievable beauty. City on the river is something incredible. Incredibly beautiful city day, and at night, when all the lights light up, the city acquires even more beautiful, breathtaking view. A cruise on the Danube will make your stay in Budapest unforgettable.
Beautiful river. Beautiful river, lined with many historical and important buildings. Taking a cruise along the Danube would be amazing.

Cheap way to experience the Danube River. If you would like to do a boat trip on the Danube River, consider the 3 Public Transport boats that go along the river. They even sell alcohol on board! If you buy a Transport Card it is included in the price, but only on week days. 72 hour cards, which cover all forms of public transport, are excellent value. If you are staying more than 3 days then buy a 7-day card.

Hydrofoil from Budapest to Esztergom or Visegrad. They're run by Mahart. Best to book ahead but in June it wasn't necessary - you could just turn up at the office near the landing stage half an hour before it left and buy a ticket on the spot.It takes about 90 minutes to Esztergom, and if you come back by hydrofoil too it gives about 6 hours in Esztergom for sightseeing, lunch, etc - a lot more than you'd get if you were travelling by boat. On the other hand, in the hydrofoil you're closed in a noisy metal tube, sitting in seats halfway between aeroplane seats and train seats, unable to get out. There are windows, and a television screen showing what's ahead, but you get nothing like the romantic view of the Danube bend you'd get on a boat. The Esztergom hydrofoil also stops in Visegrad. From Budapest to Visegrad takes about an hour.For times, ask Mahart (36/1-318-1223 for English speakers) , In June, the hydrofoil left Budapest at 0900 and started off back at 1700, I think. It should be possible to get the hydrofoil up to Esztergom (tickets are sold one way or return), then a bus back to Budapest, maybe stopping off somewhere on the way. If that sounds a good idea, check bus-times first. The baslica in Esztergom's built on a hill, and it can be a nasty trek, especially if it's a hot day or you aren't too fit. If you'd like to arrange for a taxi to meet you when you arrive in Esztergom and drive you up, there are telephone numbers for two taxi firms on the Eszterghom hydrofoil landing stage - 06 30 / 309 01 05 and 06 306 340 403.
Hop on, hop off. Nice boat tour on the Danube. The whole tour lasted for an hour. Clear info about sights were pewswnted through the loudspeakers.

Viking Danube River Cruise. Recently completed a Danube river cruise on Viking. The service staff was excellent; in particular Alex, Ali G., Linda and Desi. The ship was clean and the rooms well organized. Our ship was built in 2009 but it was well maintained. The food was good with the exception of a few nights when the meat was on the dry side. The included excursions were well organized, enjoyable and informative. Overall I was very pleased with the trip. The only significant negative is the extra charge I paid for a balcony room. At all the ports, ships were double parked so you looked out your room window directly into another ship; making the balcony useless. Since most of the travel was at night, the balcony was not much use when the boat was moving. This is not a Viking issue, I noticed all the different cruise lines had the same issue. I would use Viking again due to the quality of the service of the staff.

Danube River: Important link to the history of Central Europe. This part of the Danube is bordered by BUDA on one side and PEST on the other. One the PEST side, there is a lovely waterfront walkway that allows a great walk every evening. The river traffic, including the well advertised Viking River Cruise ships and others, is fun to watch both in the daytime, but especially nice at night with landmarks lighted up with flood lights.Make sure you see the river at night, just once during your stay in Budapest.Only SLIGHT disappointment: at this part of the river, the Danube is NOT "blue" ;-)

How many things did this river see?!. The Danube river is passing through 9 countries, from Germany all the way to Moldova. It has seen the town of Budapest changing throughout the years, people have come and left, many victims' bodies especially of World War II have been carried away. Walking along the river just gave me goosebumps!

Quick Trip. This was a major check on my bucket list. While I was operating in Kosovo my buddies and I decided to hop on a turbo prop and check out Budapest. Ive never been to anywhere like this before or since. I wish I had more time.

Another Viking River Cruise. We splurged for our 30th wedding anniversary and went on Frea from Budapest. The ship was superb, and the crew was fantastic. I don't want to talk about the food as we are still trying to shed some weight we gained trying different dishes. The variety of food was amazing. Our first night on the ship was while it was docked in Budapest and the view was amazing, the weather was perfect and we enjoyed each and every day on our cruise.
Beautiful!. Between the Parliament and Chain bridge there is "Shoe" monument in memory of thousands of Hungarian Jews that were executed on the river banks of Danube. It's very moving.

Free boat trip. If you are staying in Budapest and buy a multi day bus and metro pass you can use it to catch a boat on the river that acts as a bus.We took the no2 tram down to Petofi bridge the caught the boat up to Arpad bridge at the top end of Margret island,the trip took about one hour as the boat pulls in at several stops.You get great views of the city and all the bridges on the trip but there is no commentary on the boat,as we had seen most of the sights on land this did not matter its just a good way of seeing the sights from the river.

Great River Cruise at Night. I went to the River Cruise by around 9pm, the city is wonderful but it looks even better at night. All the bridges, parliment and important monuments light up to be admired, if you have the chance don´t miss it. There are many companies offering this cruises and also they are unexpensive (4-7 euro), if you bring a student card you´ll find even better prices!

Graceful. The Danube - a large wide body of water flowing gracefully through many countries and home to a constant supply of barges and river boats. It is a beautiful river but don't be fooled - it's not blue but rather a murky brown.

Viking River Cruise. This was our dream vacation. A Danube River Cruise. We were on the newest Viking ship, the Kara. The ship was beautiful and the river and scenery outstanding. Despite some rain along the way every day was a good day. Even docked in Budapest the view of the Chain Bridge was amazing. Budapest was a great city. Would love to go back and spend more time even though we were there three days. There is so much to see. The people are so friendly and welcoming. Very warm and inviting. The rest of the river cruise beautiful and amazing. Each city we visited was great. This was an outstanding vacation..
wonderful night and day. make the most of the Danube day and nightwe used the hop on and hop off bus which had the add on of trips on the Danubesmall boat but for the day and night trips did the job

Day/Night cruise unlimited use over 2 days. For only 2000 Forints, about £6, Dunayatch lets you cruise down to Margaret Island, get off and explore the island, and then hop back on for a great day out. Then use the same ticket, unlimited use over 2 days and do the night cruise to see all the lovely bridges and sights lit up. Value for money. Not to be missed.

You must take a river trip. Take a trip during the day and again at night because you see things completely differently. There are wonderful bridges including one that bends around to meet a road. And the buildings are awesome in daylight and stupendous at night

Fantasic way to travel. A cruise up the Danube on the AMALyra could not have been nicer. The ship was beautiful, the workers on the boat were extremely friendly and wanted you to cometo them with any questions or problems and took care of everything. After coming back a from excursions a couple of days when it was a little chilly, they would give us warm cups of tea or warm washcloths. We felt very catered to. The only down side, and this was only because it was chilly and rainy, is that there is only one room to be in other than your cabin. If it is nice out you could sit up on the top deck, but when it isn't there was no where else to go.

Must see. Walked over the Chain bridge. The river is magnificent. You could just stand on the bridge and look at the river for ages. Always something happening. Check out the cruise boats, and the views from the river. Excellent.

Elegant river with gracious bridges. What else you can say of this wonderful but sometimes dangerous Danube River floating through Budapest, special the bridges connecting the city, Pest one side and Buda on the other side. Recommendation: Take a boat trip, that is specially nice on the evening with dinner onboard.

Cruising the Danube.. After cruising the Danube on a Viking cruise we were delighted to see it with a distinctly blue tinge in Budapest. It had looked quite green up until our last day, when the sun shone brightly and the blue sky was finally reflected back to us to match the promise of Strauss's waltz.
A cruise on the Danube at Night is a must. Taking a cruise on the Danube at night was one of the highlights of our trip. The city's landmarks are lit up and beautiful.

Boat trip. We went twice on the boats, first time during the day follwed by a night trip.The day trip took us to the island which is great on a sunny day.The evening trip was lovely with everything lit up and the bridges look stunning along with the parliament building.
excellent. must do the river cruise in the evening ... very scenic, you will get to see all the important landmarks of buda and pest and enjoy the weather at the same time . a great experience.

AmaDolce. Incredible cruise down the Rhine from Basel to Amsterdam. Tours were well planned and thought out; food was very excellent; crew was spectacular. Can't say enough good things about the cruise. I can't believe any other cruise company can exceed the experience.
Danube Cruise. This was a very pleasant experience and the Champagne on board was most welcome. We spent an hour on St Margaret Island which was worthwhile but an hour was sufficient..

Danube River Cruise. We had a lovely day for our Danube River cruise. We had a whole group of folks talking so I can't say that I heard the audio as we were more interested in socializing but the cries, views, etc. were great! Very relaxing. It would probably be great at night too.

great way to split the city. the contrast between the old hills of buda and the commercial vibrant pest is split by this amazing river, i would recommend a night cruise down the river which gives you some splendid views

Joining, not dividing. What can one say about a river? This one is quite broad. Most important, it is very famous, and not only in Hungary, partially due to the famous "The Blue Danube" by Johann Strauss II. It does divide the Buda and the Pest parts of the city, but it also links them into the city of Budapest.Makes a lovely walk, and if you get as far as Margaret Island, try to get there around 8 pm when the fountain starts playing classical music and 'dancing' to it.

Blue and Watery, but lovely. What we liked about the Danube were the reflections at night of the Parliament Building. It's also a place to cool down on a hot day (stay in the shade), and it's lovely to walk along the Pest side and see all the beautiful buildings. Or hop on Tram #2 and take a ride (it goes along the banks of the river).
Very nice wiev. I have been there at 9 pm. It was very amazing lemonade that I have ever tried. They were very nice. My Slovenian Friend an me azamed from the wiev
Cruise the Danube. We took the time to cruise the Danube near the end of our trip and it was a great opportunity to see, again, the sites of this beautiful city. I recommend this relaxing pleasure.

Danube Cruise. If you go to Budapest you should take time to get on the Danube. We didn't spent too much time picking out a tour company. Go at sunset, or during the evening, seeing the Parilament and Buda Castle lit up at night is stunning.
Walking. Pretty to walk, lots to look at, generally peaceful! Had a lovely time meandering along. River cruises are great, watch out for touts!

Danube. The danube is a beautiful river. We stayed on the danube and also took a night cruise on the danube. The area of the danube near the city centre is getting polluted and the city should do more to preserve this beautiful river. There are so many restaurants that the embankment is losing its charm
beautiful river. This river is stunning. It may not be blue in reality but it is certainly stunning and very romantic.
Beautiful. It was beautiful at day and nighttime also!!! We can walking on both side and it was romantic and very long trip!

A beautiful city at night, but lots of wasted time getting started & unimaginative onboard.. My wife & I took the night-time cruise at 10 PM on Monday 5/12 with the cocktail option (no food).Assembling & getting started was hugely inefficient. The meeting place was on a street beside the Four Seasons where folks started to gather even before the 9:30 starting time. After the group was complete, we all walked several blocks to the pier (to which it would have been easy to go directly...). After boarding, my wife & I went upstairs to the aft, open-air fantail area so we could be outside with unobstructed views.Once we were underway, the illuminated buildings, statues & bridges were beautiful, but there were far fewer that one might have thought. The boat took a long loop north to the Parliament Building then south to the Liberty Bridge & back to our starting place. Without any narration & dreadful champagne, the tour was - for a while - visually engaging, but then it sagged & dragged.We're glad we did it, but in our opinion the tour operator should improve the assembly process, add English narration (& perhaps other languages with headphones), & decent drinks.
Beautiful at Night. The night cruise around the harbor area was splendid with lights shining on the Parliament Building and the other buildings.

The Blue Danube?. Is the Danube still blue as it was always referred to? We visited Budapest twice, once overland and the second time approaching with river cruise. From the two weeks river cruise, the Danube was as exciting and blue as ever. When we visited Budapest the first time we did not realize the importance of the Danube River to the city. With our cruise and further staying for another few nights in Budapest, we came to appreciate the whole city-river-bridge relationship to make Budapest such an interesting place divided by a beautiful river.

sailing into Budapest at night on the Danube was excellent!. One of our most memorable travel experiences is the Danube at night. All the special buildings of Budapest are lighted. This was an experience not to be missed!

Night time cruise. A must do in Budapest is a cruise down the Danube at night and if you can, make it with beautiful classic music in the background.The beautiful building that are lit up at night are just like a fairy tail and believe me not to be missed.

Review of Avalon River Tour on the Danube. My experience is only from taking an Avalon River Cruise on the Danube. The Impression was a new boat and we started the tour in Prague. We were so pleased with the Captain, the Crew and all of the organization for our trip. Our tour had a complication with the river being too low to cruise which obviously can happen. We ended up by staying longer in Passau Germany than expected but I would have to say the cruise line did everything possible to make up for that issue. They bused us to all of the sights we had reserved for touring and paid for a concert in Vienna on their behalf. I am sure every cruise line has river issues but I was impressed with how accomodating Avalon Tours was. The food was good, it got even better as the cruise progressed and the entire crew whether it be the main reception area, the crew on the Impression, the Cruise Director and ours was Andrej (can't say enough about how great he was) made our stay well worth it. River cruises on the Danube can have it's problems. Two years ago a river cruise line had to cancel and refund everything due to high water. We were lucky, we just had two days in Passau Germany (a delightful town). This was my first river cruise and I highly recommend Avalon Tours from my experience. We went with a group of 8, met many others, had some wonderful experiences, would have booked earlier to get a cabin on a higher floor (we were on the first floor) but it didn't change our trip in the least. I was impressed with Avalon, don't know about others. If you get Andrej as your Cruise Director, you will be pleased. Can't vouch for the river levels on the Danube!!

Chilling on the river. Excellent views of the Parliament building and other well known sights whilst drinking cocktails! Only one criticism - it would have been better if we could have travelled a little further along the river rather than just back and forth along the same bit.

A natural divide between Buda and Pest with beautiful bridges. The Danube divides the Buda and Pest side of Budapest, which are linked to each other by beautiful bridges.Tip : when you want to take a river cruise at a decent price, take a public watertaxi.The boats cross back and forth to different points at the Buda and the Pest side of the river, and you don't have the frills of wining and dining abord, but you get to see the city from the water.
simply beautiful. Had a boat trip on the danube, what a fantastic time had by all. Beautiful views and buildings. Amazing. The service on the boat was second to none, very polite and friendly.

Stunning views. Loved it the views were stunning .chain bridge ,castle,parliament .
Nice trendy bar at the start of the bridge prices for cocktails vey reasonable .cool hangout

Take a cruise on the lovely Danube River. We enjoyed taking a 70-minute cruise on the Danube. Very comfortable river boats, tours available by headset in 30 languages. Snacks and drinks available on board.
Beautiful. The building along the Danube are amazing and will not disappoint! There are lots of cruises running day and night up and down the river!

Night Tour. Budapest at night from the river is a "must see". With the parliament building and the many castles all lit up the best view is from a boat tour. I would advise to just book the tour with drinks, not the food and just go for dinner at a restaurant before the tour.

Still beautiful.... The Danube is an impressive river. It is great to walk alongside the river, either during the day or in the evening, and observe the interesting variety of water traffic that uses it. We first visited the Danube in 2007, being lucky enough to be going on a European River Cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam. We had a bit of time prior to the departure of the cruise and were able to see some of the sights of Budapest. The evening views of the lit-up bridges and town were spectacular, as we sailed away on our adventure. In May 2014, we spent a couple of days in Budapest and enjoyed a walk along the river. Although there is a lot more traffic on the river than there was in 2007, we were still able to appreciate its beauty and significance. It is definitely a great experience to be able to go for a cruise on the river, whether it be for a couple of hours or as part of an extended holiday.
Budapest from the water is great at night. Budapest in daylight is fabulous. Seeing the castle and the Parliament at night is an once in life time experience . It is sooooo. Beautiful at night.

Another Perspective. After seeing the site of Budapest by land, it is not only relaxing, but enjoyable to see Budapest by night on the Danube. You get to view this beautiful city from another perspective, an opportunity to witness Budapest's monuments brilliantly illuminated while enjoying the breeze on the River.
Go for a twilight cruise. Our twilight cruise was gorgeous; we found another level of beauty to Budapest seeing the lights come on from the river. It would be a shame to miss this side of the city.
Great river through Budapest. Spectacular views right along the Duna from both sides of the city. The Parliament building on one side and the castle from the other.

mighty river but underused. The danube is a formidable river cutting Budapest in half but it seems very under utilised. There are no riverside restaurants or bars. Perhaps due to flooding concerns. Beautiful to see it at night with Parlament, the Chain bridge and the castle all bathed in light.

Very poor!! Book elsewhere! Do not book river cruise on pier 10.. After receiving vouchers as part of the hoo on, hop off bus tour we took advantage of a day and night cruise. On both occasions we were faced with the worst service ever. Both times with a blonde lady in her 60s who clearly started her days with a goal of how many people she could annoy and frustrate. She was so awkward and spoiled out experiences on both trips. The second interaction was so unbelievable. I had detached the vouchers from the discount booklet so I didn't have to carry the booklet with me. This was an issue for her and she made a big scene. Only to allow us on anyway. She was miserable and really shouldn't be working with the public never mind holidaymakers looking to enjoy their trip. Aside from the service they rammed far too many people onboard and it was really unsafe. We also couldn't eat the guide recording at times. Stay clear of this river cruise!!!

Easy Sailing!. had dinner by candlelight, 3 course plus enternainment. The whole evening lasted 3hrs od great food, fine wine and caberet. The people who ran the shoe were very welcoming, friendly and courteous. This is a must.

An enjoyable nighttime cruise on the river.. Took the evening cruise as the sun was going down. It was just an hour, but the major buildings in Buda and Pest were lit ... a beautiful sight. Be sure to bring something for cool weather, even on a warm night, because of the river breeze. For a romantic event.
Walking by the Danube. Lovely to walk up and down and watch all the boats. We were taking the River Cruise in a couple of days so it was so nice to cruise up on that river.

Take a cruise. The Danube is a beautiful river , you can walk along it , cross over it via several bridges but the best way to appreciate it is by taking a cruise.We took a 45 minute cruise with Duna Bella.You get a audio recording in English plus a free drink.It highlights all the sights including old and new and explains some of the history.You get a different perspective from the river.They also do eveing cruises , most of the historical sights are lit up at night.

Main artery of Budapest. This great European river is the heartbeat of Budapest, dividing the city on Buda and Pest. For connecting them great bridges were built to cross it, which make the Budapest panorama so great.Numerous companies make boat excursions along it. Take the longest one which stops at Margit island. You have the option to disembark on the island, take a walk there and after embark again.

Danude Cruise. Did 2 cruises on the river - one in the day which was free with the hop on hop off bus tour and one at night which was a dinner cruise. Daytime one is good - nice freebie! - goes quite a way down the river past the island and all the way back. pretty basic facilities on board. the one at night was a different story - was marketed as lovely dinner/music cruise so thought it would be relaxing - it is very nice to see the buildings lit up at night so worth the trip but was hard to find the boat to start with then when we did board it is all quite rushed as it doesnt go for very long - so get on, welcome drink, then wine then dinner and music then off - all fairly quickly. We could tell that they must have had another cruise right after ours so they were keen to get everyone off quite quickly
cruising. Did an evening cruise so the sunset during our trip very picturesque. Along the river looks great at night. Like Paris with less people and cheaper

Pleasant time to spend an hour. We had an hours 'cruise' included with our big red bus pass. Recommend early in the day as it is much quieter than after lunch and makes it a much nicer experience. Good way of hopping off at the island beyond parliament building as well

Beautiful river. The Danube river in Budapest is one of the most beautiful rivers in the world to see! Just walking along the promenade with all the restaurants and sights to see is amazing. Night time is especially nice and is a must!
great for walks. we started our trip with Margaret Island and were walking along the river - great views and the opportunity to take awesome pictures.

A Magical Evening. With a group party, hire of a boat with superb meal supplied, starting off in daylight then returning as all the lights came on to reveal the floodlit buildings and bridges with a reflection in the river, and standing on the deck with friends sipping wine and drinking in the magic. Really something special!

could do with a clean up. dont get me wrong its a lovely river with great views up and down it and with a lot of traffic so maybe thats the problem, there is a lot of debris lying all over the river and it does look a bit muddy but you cant not go and see it when you go to Budapest
Not just a river..... The amazing part is the whole life over and around the Danube. A site which held so much history. Amazing!

We all know the pictures, you just have to do it!. We all know the pictures, especially if one sees "Viking Afloat" ads. You cannot come here and not do it. We did an evening dinner cruise and, assuming all boats have similar food standards and menu, it is a case of which one do you like the look of. Food and drink were acceptable and not too expensive and we saw all the sights and sundown. Must do part of the holiday.

Danube. Loved the view of the river on either side. A part of History the river separated Buda from Pest. Our hotel was located l block and we were able to walk up and down crossing over several bridges including the famous Chain Bridge.
It is the beauty of the city. Without the Danube the city would lose 50% of its beauty. The Hills surrounding it give the rest. Probbly Worth to make a cruise, which I had no time to make.
Relaxing cruise. Short (1 hour) cruise to Margaret island. Very cheap and extremely cheerful. Crew exvellent. Vale for money outstanding.
Loved the Danube. Took a river cruise. Strolled along the Danube several times. Enjoyed the great river views from all locations.

Cruise the Danube. It's a very rewarding experience cruising up and down the Budapest section of the Danube. Feasting on the majestic buildings on either bank of the Danube. After visiting the beautiful landmarks such as the Hungarian Parliament building and the Matthias church, it was nice to see them again from the Danube...a totally different perspective, but just as lovely...

What a wonderful river. This river is wonderful. Large and clean, this river provides for a great deal of river traffic. As you stroll along the banks, take the opportunity to look at all the luxury river boats in all their finery. A boat trip on the river is a great opportunity for photos and to see some of the wonderful palaces and buildings from a different angle.You simply can not come to Budapest without spending a day walking, eating and exploring by the river!

Bike the Danube for a treat. Four of us bicycled along the Danube from Passau to Budapest. It was a trip to remember. There is so much to see and touring by bicycle means you get the real picture. We scheduled extra day in Passau, Vienna and Budapest and we could have used even more time to explore all there is to see.
Shoes. Look out for the castings of shoes on the bank, we came across these whilst walking from the parlament hotel towards the bridge, very sad.
Beautiful River. Absolutely stunning river, it is a must see when in Budapest. It is not hard to find at all, the closer your food and accomadations is to the river the more expensive it is.
Amazing views. Gorgeous views and reasonably priced trips. We stayed on the budapest side and as we walked along the views are breath taking.
it's a river.. lol. seen a river... seen them all...some of the cruises look ok, and some offer live music which can be good.

a must-go on the river cruise!. Catch a river cruise if you can, it is highly recommended, and there are affordable ones (i got mine with student discount at around 7 euros). I stumbled upon it and happened to catch the 8.45pm slot which is to me the best time to go on the cruise, because we got to catch the sunset and then halfway through the sky turned dark and the bridges and buildings started to light up - it was truly a magnificent view and awesome photo-taking experience. Try to arrive earlier to get the better seats, you do not want to be blocked by everyone's heads bobbing up and down as they try to get the best shots for themselves too!
Nice walk. A very nice and romantic walk in couple. Don't miss the other side of the bridge and walk up the hill to have an amazing view of the Parliament!

Boat trip on Danube. Everyone should try a boat trip on Danube when visiting Budapest. A great river, and you will pass under the Chain Brigde and see the most beatiful buildings from the seaside. The great Parlament, the Royal Palace and the famous statue on the hillside on Buda side. The boat went to the Margaret Island and back to the center Pir. On board you can enjoy snacks and drinks as well and also buy some souveniers:)
Boat Trip. Had a civilised boat trip on the danube, was a nice was to view the city in the sun. However, there was a bit of waiting around before we 'set sail'.

The Beautiful but Busy Danube. We have just returned from a 7-day cruise down the Danube from Vilshofen to Budapest on the AMA Waterways AMACerto river boat. While the boat is beautiful with excellent service and many interesting included excursions (although some are extra), future passengers need to be aware that many companies have added and are adding new boats to this river (and many other European rivers) on a regular basis. This leads to double and even triple side-by-side docking of boats. We were not happy to look out the window of our suite (for which we had paid a premium) and find we were looking directly into the bedroom of another boat only inches away. This happened several times at various ports and also necessitated climbing through one or more boats on occasion to get to shore. In addition it led to very crowded conditions in many of the excursion cities, since the boats of all companies seem to follow the same schedules - we saw folks from several Viking boats, other AMA boats, Uniworld, Tauck and several others. We found the same conditions on a Viking cruise of the Rhine last fall. While there is much beauty to enjoy on the Danube, the river cruise industry may be killing the goose that laid the golden egg.

GREAT RIVER, GREAT CITY. IMO a river makes a city. The Danube is a great river, and Budapest is a great city. Took the local boat bus from Margaret Island stop to the end of the line (cost about 2 Euros if I remember correctly). Views from the river of parliament and other buildings exceptional. Trip took about 30 minutes one way.

Awe inspiring. Our hotel was within a stone's throw of the Danube, or Duna. It was incredible to see the modest river that starts out in my part of the world so massive and huge. We booked a night dinner cruise on the first night we were in Budapest and it was incredible. You must not miss the view at night from a boat on the river. Breath taking!
Truly A Jewel Amazing City. Amazing City, Very Clean Very Safe We took the subway downtown Our dinner cruise was a great way to see the city,

Fantastic Adventure. This was one of my favorite activities. I had a blast. Some of my favorite Budapest photos came from boating down the river. The meal was great.The space area is small on the boat. You have to tuck in and it is difficult to move around. But, you are not there that long and the food is great. An evening cruise is recommended.

Night!!!. To really appreciate the beauty of this city find a night time Danube boat tour. The lighting of the river's grand buildings is nothing short of jaw dropping wonder and it can only be seen at it's best from the river. You have to have the panorama view, it's that simple.

Dinner Cruise on the Danube w/Silverline. Our hotel recommended this company. They leave from Dock 11 which is difficult to get to and from if you have mobility issues. We enjoyed the cruise itself because the city is beautiful by day and by night. The pianist were highly skilled, however, the music seemed too loud. It was difficult to hear conversations right next to you. The food was plentiful, filling, but average. The staff was accomodating and called a taxi for us after we docked.

Awesome walk. My favorite part of cities is generally by the river. There is something soothing in the air and sound, and mostly cities make the river a main atraction. This is not the exception, the great Danube is marvellous. A wide river where you can spot the phenomenal architecture of the parliment and the outstanding majesty of the royal palace. You can spot the Shoes memorial, or go for a walk to the Margarita isle.
Excellent. I went on a Silverline evening cruise and show. It was a great meal and "piano battle". First class service the whole way.
Incredible. Nice view of the towna cruise is a must during the eveningIt was great and a great experiance.....

Pleasant Walk. It's a great walk down the Danube - although my son was not enjoying the walk we just had to drag him along this very nice walk along the river taking in the sights of local building architectures,and boats from Europe anchored.

A delightful evening trip. A trip on the River Danube at night is a must to all who visit Budapest.It is the Wow factor the city has to offer.All the main buildings on both sides of the river are floodlit.An hours trip is enough.to have a meal as well and you would miss the sights.

A beautiful river that dissects Buda and Pest. Walking or cycling along both sides of the Danube gives you a wonderful view of both sides of the city. It is a place where the locals and tourists promenade at night in the cool evening air. This is also the time to see the Parliament, the Chain Bridge and other public buildings come alive with spectacular lighting at night. If you are a keen photographer you may consider taking a small lightweight tripod with you so you can take some wonderful night time photos of these buildings. I did.

Beautiful river to sit by and have a coffee. This fast flowing river was at its best. Take a cruise and view Buda and Pest from a boat or even better enjoy dinner on one the the cruising Restaurant. We commenced our cruise to Amsterdam from Budapest so we spent a lot of time on it going through many locks

Night cruise on the Danube is not to be missed!!. We visited Budapest in June 2014 and went on the Legenda 1 hour night cruise on the Danube. It was beautiful seeing the buildings on both the Pest & Buda side lit up at night.Walking along the Danube at day/night is not a sight to be missed, it's a gorgeous sight & calming - as Budapest is not a densely populated city.

Beautiful!. The Danube area is just beautiful. There are lots of significant buildings that also look amazing around and I would definitely recommend a river cruise. The water is not blue as the famous waltz suggests but it still looks amazing.
Beautiful. One of the main things to see in Budapest, lots of other attractions around it as well such as the parliament buildings and the castle.
Evening cruise is just doable. Cruise is suggested in the evening to see the illuminated Parliament building & the bridges. Nothing else. Worth the price for the experience once.

Wonderful Danube cruise!. It really is a must to take a 2-hour Danube cruise, which gives a wonderful overview of both the buda and the Pest dise of budapest. Our cruise was included in our Big Bus Tours Hop-on Hop-off tour. A real bargain.
Spectacular. The views were breathtaking especially the bridges, castle and parliament buding and I would advise to take 2 trips, 1 during the day and 1 at night.

Brilliant to Cruise. Great to see the city from the water, both day and night. I really enjoyed the night cruise seeing the magnificent building lit up.
A river that runs from Germany to the Black Sea and always atreat to see.
A must at night. To best view Budda & Pest you have to take a boat ride on the Danube...Breathtaking. Dont forget The Var (indescribable)
Good. Took a cruise down the river which was nice and lots to see on both sides of the river. river its self is just like any other river!

Sunset cruise...amazing!. Whilst staying in Budapest we were lucky enough to have a speedboat cruise down the Danube, complete with sunset and champagne.
Views are absolutely fabulous and if you can get there for sunset or just before the contrast of the sights from day to night is astounding. Highly recommended!

A nice way to spend a few hours. We got our river cruise as part of the city site seeing tour and it was excellent value for money. The river cruise gives you a great view of both sides of the city and there are refreshments available to purchase. I recommend the hot chocolate which was delicious!

Enjoy Budapest at its Best. The Danube crossing Budapest is best part of the Danube; the scenery is all around left and right; every 5 minutes you see something new and very interesting. The Danube in Budapest is really much nicer than in Vienna; very impressive buildings, bridges, monuments, churches, and statues.We had a dinner cruise at Europa River Boat; the reception was great; seating was excellent; the buffet was very rich and delicious; the music band was professional and very entertaining, and the most interesting part was the last 15 minutes of the cruise when all Budapest buildings and bridges were eliminated for a breathtaking view of this dream City.To enjoy the Danube; a night cruise is a must; avoid the bus type boats so you don’t miss the fun moving around.

Take a water tram. Take a tram rather than special boat. It will cost you much less and the experience is the same. On top of that there are party boats and many more. Everybody will find something for themselves

Cruising the Danube. We took a dinner cruise down the Danube. It was way better than the one we did in Prague as the view was just magnificent particularly when the lights came on and showed up the sheer architectural grandeur of the Castle, Parliament House, the bridges and the churches. The food was well laid out and extremely tasty as were the assorted dessert dishes. The live band played nostalgic songs from the sixties and seventies and the evening was just great.

Drive along the Danube after sunset - Beautiful!!. During the day we drove along the Danube to Szentendre - it was quite pretty. But at night when we returned - it was nothing short of fabulous! The city lights just make this place look like one of the most beautiful cities in the world. I've been on other European rivers at sunset such as the Rhein but nothing compares to this

best river city in the world. You have to see many views of the Danube from various sides tofully appreciate how Buda Pest and Obuda became this great cityspanning the river. It is not blue, however. Black and shiny at night, silvery with ice in the winter, lined with sunbathers and fishermen when it isn't too hot! A walk along the Pest or Buda quai (the Duna Corso) is a good way to begin, and then visit Margit Island in the middle.

Evening cruise a must see.. Wow an evening cruise on the Danube seems to be one of the highlights of the trip.Once the sunsets the lights goes on and Budapest is quite magical. The grand palaces lit up. to be honest i enjoyed it more than the eveing cruises in amsterdam or even paris.Simply gorgeous and quite romantic.fair warning it could feel really cold on the river in march. Even though the weather was night during the day..at night the windy river can be quite chilling. IMO wear a thick coat and enjoy the view. AThe light will warm you up easily.I bought a hopon and hop off ticket...so entrance to the cruise was free. Matter of fact we could cruise as often as we wanted. Glad we chose evening one.Remember during high seaso..boats could be packed.
The division of it all. On one side, Buda.On the other, Pest. And this river, so wide and peaceful, will be beautiful from both sides... Yu might want to walk along it just to get the citie's vibe...

Danube Bend River Trip. Everybody tells of how wonderful it is taking a ride on the river either to or from the Danube Bend so we had to do it didn't we?We decided to take the Mahart Passnave boat service back to Budapest from Esztergom after using the bus to get there in the first place. The bus from Ujpest goes through Szentendre and Visigrad on the way to Esztergom giving you frequent glimpses of the river but in reality it isn't a particularly interesting or rewarding ride but it is considerably shorter in time than using the boat as it pushes upstream.We chose a Sunday to do the trip which was maybe a mistake as Esztergom seemed 'closed' when we got there. Maybe a combination of Sunday and it being the middle of May gave everywhere an almost deserted feel and look.The, rather old looking, Mahart boat is scheduled to leave for the downstream journey at 4.30pm but didn't get away for some reason until nearly 5pm. The river was still suffering from excess water, together with tree trunks etc, being washed down from somewhere upriver so much so that Belgrade and Bosnia downriver had been suffering some horrendous life taking floods. I'm assuming that this floodwater had tainted the river making it most certainly a million miles away from being the Blue Danube is it normally described as. More muddy brown.The boat was comfortable enough without being what you could call comfortable! It looked and felt old and neglected and I won't even start and describe the toilets on board.The trip was disappointing because the river was the muddy brown mentioned earlier and it was flowing very fast with not very much to see on either bank.It was a day out but not one I could recommend to others unfortunately.

great evening boat ride. Took a river cruise on the Danube at night and saw how different the lighting could show off the high points of a city. Budapest is a lovely city with some superb architecture.
Crowning glory!. The only way to see Buda and Pest at night is via a cruise on the Danube, a memorable experience, very beautiful!!
Hilton Budapest City. There was a heel of a lot of water in the Danube when we were there (in flood) - it ruined our river cruise but walking the banks between the bridges was still enchanting.
Stroll on the romantic Danube!. So many cafes and sights along the river. Wonderful to just walk along the water. Scenic tramway is a great way to travel it as well!

What an Experience. We sailed into Budapest at night on a Viking River Cruise! I took over 300 photographs. It was excellent the ship sailed down and turned around to come back to our dock. I know there are cruises you can take there, but nothing can match coming into the city at night for the first time. I highly recommend!

Day & Night River Cruise. A Daube river cruise is one of those must do's when visiting Budapest. We decided to use a company called EUrama for the sightseeing cruise, departure Dock 8A boat terminal near the Elizabeth bridge. The ticket is valid for 24hrs & is advertised as a hop on hop off boat tour priced at 3000HUF, approx £8.50, which to me is great value for money. If you stay on the boat the round trip lasts approx 1hr. We bought our ticket from the docking station because I wanted to confirm that the same ticket was valid for both the day & night cruises, the very pleasant sales girl said it was and advised us to arrive in good time for the evening trip as they are very popular. The day tour was very pleasant, we managed to get two seats at the front of the boat giving us the perfect view & ideal for photo taking. The audio guide, over a loud speaker, is in English & German & gives a brief overview of the main attractions. We did the round trip choosing not to get off at Margaret Island. Came back in the evening for the night cruise and must say it was stunning to see the city by night from the river , an abiding memory of our holiday.

Top marks for the river but I didn't rate the service of the hop on boat. River is stunning, top marks a definite experience while in Budapest.We went on the hop on hop off boat and had buffet lunch. It was a lovely experience but the staff were not friendly and were seemingly have stand up arguments with a group of people that wanted to have buffet. I presumed it was mis communications until the guy came to tell our group off for swapping a still water (given on table) for a sparkling one. Just no need for this attitude when working in the service industry....why? It did not spoil the beauty of the River of the chilled experience of dining on the Danube...just tainted it a bit. I'd still recommend it!! Please let me know if this is useful information and I will write some more.

Glorious River. We passed over the river many times during the day and its sights were truly magnificent. However when we took an evening cruise on the Danube through the cities of Buda and Pest a feeling of awe washes over you. Each and every one of the castles and the parliament building and bridges and statues are lit and highlighted to their best advantage and show to be art in themselves. There is a pride and glory about the way the city is shown that exudes a greater time and mentally brings you into that era. We sat on an open deck, with a drink in hand, sailing along the Danube as one phenomenon led into the next and all the hype and history began to make sense. The boat rides take only an hour and there are boats doing this every 20 minutes and are well worth it. I see in my mind the effect of the Danube at night much more than viewing the sights during the day.
Smaller then I thought but very pretty. Took a boat ride along the Danube at night and had a really great time. Amazing views and a great way to see the two parts of the city.

Heart of Budapest. It's hard to miss the Danube when you're in Budapest. You're bound to have to cross it at some point in order to view the many sights on both sides of the river. It’s hard not to be impressed by the sheer scale of the river. It’s not the bluest or more picturesque river ever but it’s pleasant to walk down and provides a stunning backdrop to many pictures of both Buda and Pest.
Wonderful. We went for a cruise on the Danube ,,, just wonderful. The scenery and architecture on show along the banks is breathtaking

Average river, but stunning views. Okay, there is no doubt a certain romanticism associated with the Danube i.e. Strauss and his Blue Danube, but in all honesty, the river itself is nothing special - big, wide and a muddy brown.What is special, however, is the stunning and amazing views of Buda and Pest that are visible from the centre of the river, whether from a boat trip or the centre of one of several bridges.At night the views are even more spectacular, as bridges are lit up and buildings and attractions along the river side are bathed in lights that make for a pretty impressive sight.Nice in the sunshine, but spectacular at night.

Beuatiful Panoramic River. Many of the beautiful sites of Budapest will have the Danube cutting through them somewhere. The river is beautiful during the day and, combined with the lights from the surrounding buildings and bridges, gorgeous at night. Take time to stroll along the streets running along side the river and if you get a chance take a boat for a mini-cruise.
River cruising. An evening cruise along the Danube is a delight. As the sun sets and the embankments are lit up, it is a delight to behold.

Cruise the Danube ............. Take this trip by night, all of the magnificent buildings will be illuminated which makes for a great photo op , sailing under the Chain Bridge and the Liberty Bridge whilst lit up is just spectacular to see, Buda Hill is amazing by night as is the Parliament Building and all the other beautiful buildings that adorn the banks of the Danube.Wrap up because it can be a bit chilly oh and enjoy the free glass of champagne with your voyage !!
Ahhh the Blue Danube. For some reason, I could not get enough of the Dube. It was so relaxing and exciting at the same time to walk the banks.

amazing river, amazing city. Budapest is a really beautiful city, it is like we're living in a beautiful museum. I enjoying this city alot, especially around Danube river are. I can spent all day long just to sit and enjoying this scenery.

Scenic Tours River Cruise. Just completed 2 weeks ago a River cruise Budapest to Amsterdam with Scenic Tours of Australia.The crew(except one) were perfect. The ship was near perfect. The paying guests were great.What the issue was that we had 20plus Travel Agents on freebies travelling with us for the whole trip in 2 batches.They were young arrogant uninterested in any of the fare paying passengers and they dominated the lounge seats the bar the gym the day trip where the guides gave them the front seats and the best views of all that was going on.Many passengers were irate and were told by the Tour Director it was a management problem not his. Many of the elderly paying passengers had to stand or miss out on briefings and could not get pre dinner drinks due to the agents taking up most of the bar and surrounds. I am writing a full account to the MD Paul Moroney but need to get this note out to warn other potential cruisers. There were passengers who had traveled with Scenic up to 6 times before but they were shocked at the activities of the agents and the lack of action by any one of the management team on board. Poor effort Scenic and I will not be travelling with you again nor will many of the paying passengers.

Not blue, just dirty. Budapest is a very clean city so we were totally surprised at the color of this water: muddy. The current is fast moving so it was interesting to watch how quickly "stuff" moved. Otherwise, not a big deal.
The Most Beautiful River. Danube is the most beautiful River I have ever seen. Get a cruise on Danube and enjoy the beauty and romance of this river and it's magnificent view of the city.

Dunayacht Boat Tour. I can see that there have been negative reviews, but I enjoyed this trip which was included in the price of the Green Route Hop On/Hop Off Bus Tour. The boat left from the Elizabeth Bridge, and went up past the Parliament building round Margaret Island (where you could stop off for a couple of hours) and back in an hour.

The Danube. They call it the Blue Danube or the Mighty Danube or whatever they call it in the so many countries that it goes through. Sitting on the banks of the river in Vienna or Budapest was the highlight of the tour. Mighty is a good word to describe it, and so is Blue.
All about the river. Get yourself on a boat....cruise it. Have some palinka, eat some food, listen to some great music. Just soak in the beauty at night.

It's beautiful but not blue. Depending on where you are, the Danube can be commercially oriented or feature lovely small towns and medium-sized cities. Because the rover has had some very high floods in recent years, many buildings have markings showing the high water lines.

Cruise on the Danube. We were on a Danube River Cruise great way to relax and watch the small towns pass by. Like cruising on the River. You have wonderful food and meet very interesting people as you tour Hungary and Austria
Boat trip. Great perspective on the cityFinished our trip with this, great value for money. Nice commentary to accompany in English.

Dinner on a boat down the Danube. Unfortunately I don't remember the specific company i went with on the dinner down the Danube, but it was absolutely amazing. I think any trip on boat would be awesome. The one I went on we went before sunset had live music and amazing food! Great experience and I would recommend to anyone. Budapest at night time is too amazing to miss. Especially sitting down with friends food and drinks.

Not blue but great. Please walk the Danube from the central market to Parliament. Don't miss anything along the way. Walk the Chain Bridge and other bridges over the river and see it from Buda Castle. Awesome.

Danube at night a must. What a beautiful view of the city-I only wish my pictures could have turned out better and it would have been a little warmer. The boat co. supplied blankets which was greatly appreciated.

Lucky to enter the city by water. We were lucky that we entered Budapest on a river cruise ship and as the city opened up it is turkey beautiful, from this you can read it is really a worthwhile experience to do a river boat cruise, the views from the river are very nice, I expect that at night even more spectacular

Grand river with magnificent view!. Danube at Budapest is really grandly majestic...whether one takes boat cruise or river ride with amazing bus or just watch the river from any of the 7 bridges of Budapest, the sight is really mesmerizing and awesome!

How could you miss it!. Worth going for a cruise up the river ....so beautiful by day and by night. Take a walk along the front and see some of the bronze art work as well as people watching from the cafés and bars.
Boat trip is recommend. I recommend a boat trip, but you can also enjoy the Danube by viewing it from the hills or walking next to it. In all the cases is it a beautiful sight, especially by night..

wonderful walk. So beautiful to wallk by the river during the day and also magical in the night. Nice pavement for running, bike or just walking and adore the view. I strongly recomend this experience!

ferry on the danube. If you buy a day pass (about 5 euro's) for the public transport it's also valid for the ferry. It passes and stops at a lot of attractions from Gellert hill to Varhegy castle, parliament building and Margit island.Especially on a sunny day it is relaxed to sit on the deck and enjoy the Danube instead of taking the metro or tram (of course it takes more time)
Required boat ride. A beautiful tour down the historic Danube. The boat is quite comfortable. Views are wonderful. Be sure to do it.

Great River. Take the boat ride along the Danube and that is an extraordinary sight. If you have enough time take a night cruise on the Danube . The Parliament and all the other buildings along the river can be seen in a different perspective.

Danube River Cruise. Beautiful scenery and very scenic stops along the way from Budapest to Pargue. The river boat, Amadeus Royal was comfortable as was the cabin. We were extremely satisfied with quality and quanity of food served, I did not hear one complaint. Employees on the boat were extremely helpful, made our traveling very pleasant. We stopped in Vienna to tour city and see a concert in the evening, outstanding. Another stop along the was in Salzburg where we toured the area the Sound of Music was filmed as well as going through much of the city. A city everyone must tour. Another wonderful city we toured was Ceskey, Krumlov, and Terezin, a concentration camp. History that can never be forgotten.

Beautiful Historic River. We took the Viking Danube river cruise. It was lovely to see the beautiful and historic towns along the river. One can imagine how much commerce traveled along this river (and still does). The river has been mostly tamed through locks and walls but as we traveled to Passau and saw the water level marks on the buildings, one can appreciate the engineering and resilience of the Danube towns.

cruise not snooze. We went on an Hours trip down the Danube to Margaret Island which was excellent, shame it wasn't a good day, would have liked to explore the island. It was good value and you could see lots.

A lovely river. If you stay in Budapest, you must to take a boat and admire the landscape and perspective from the Danube. It's a beautiful view!Most of the hop on/hop off services have included a boat trip.
authentic!. We had a trip down the river with buffet and entertainment, we did enjoy it but, beware the info said embark Number 8 when in fact it should be 8 A, luckily we noticed in time!
Lovely views. Boat trip is a must to see all the river and city has to offer especially at night. If get the open top bus can get the river trip for free

Great to walk along or cruise on. The Danube is a big part of Budapest's history and needs to be walked along. The views of the buildings from the water are impressive and a great way to take unobstructed pictures of the Parliament building, Buda castle, and many churches. There are lots of river cruises to choice from that have an hour tour and audio commentary.

Riverbus. River Bus is a great alternative to the river cruises and a bus tours. It doesn't go to all attractions in Budapest but the main ones on Pest side. The best is obviously the moment you drive into the river and the water splashes on windows.Great fun and way better then the river or bus tours as it has live tour guide (not a recorded one) that speaks English and German.Great fun.
Danube. One of the things that make this city so beautiful is the river. You should go to a cruise where you can see the most attractions.With the montly ticket is free I think except Weekends

Massive. My goodness this is a wide river. The beautiful views on both the Buda and the Pest side are amazing. It was lovely to walk across the various bridges and along the river. I definitely recommend a walk down the side of the river.

Impressive from both sides. The river is really breathtaking, especially after rains at high levels. The parliament on one side and castle on the other are impressive. River tours (I did the about 2-3 times years back) are worth going.
Danube by boat. Went on a party boat with my hostel and got to see all the sites from the river at night. It was beautiful.

Not to be missed. On a recent short visit to Budapest we took the opportunity for a one hour river cruise with the Bella Dune tours. The trip cost about 13 eur each, lasted one hour and ten minutes and included 2 x free drinks. The first drink included beer, wine or champagne. The Multi language audio commentary was good and the boat very comfortable. The crew were delightful, with drinks served at our seats.The Danube itself offers magnificent views with architecture that is unrivalled in the world. The Parliament building is a must-see sight.Great value and well worth a visit.

Rolling on the river.... Taking an evening (dinner) cruise on the Danube was a well-arranged and beautiful experience with excellent food and wonderful views of the city with its lights turned on. We will absolutely recommend this!
DELIGHTFUL DANUBE. We adored a river cruise from Nuremberg to Budapest - highly recommended!It's a shame that I cannot review the cruise here.

Budapest’s illuminated buildings on the Danube are breathtaking. When the Viking Forseti pulled into Budapest at 11:00 pm we were all on the sundeck, cameras at the ready, to see if it was really true that Budapest’s illuminated buildings and bridges on the Danube are so incredibly beautiful that no one who sees them ever forgets them. They are, and we haven’t. I don’t think I’ve ever heard so many people say out loud exactly what I was thinking at the time: “It doesn’t get any better than this!” We all picked the same favorite -- the Hungarian Parliament Building. That floodlit wonder may very well be the most beautiful urban structure I have ever seen at night. (If there is a better-looking one in my future, this will do just fine until then.) The Chain Bridge and several others in that magnificent collection deserve special mention, not least because they are equally striking in the light of day.My bottom line advice: See Budapest’s illuminated buildings on the Danube before you die.

Fabulous boat tour of the Danube with excellent buffet dinner and music. Unforgettable boat tour of Budapest where you could view all the major buildings from the river. The tour offered a first-rate buffet dinner with champagne and local wines, accompanied by live violin music. Very reasonably priced. Warmly recommended to all visitors as an unforgettable experience.
better on the movies. as all the rivers a get to see, they are polluted a smell funny. same with the thames, the rin, the senna... movies kill the real thing

massive River. A not so blue Danube bit was nice to see, we went a tour on a boat that lasted an hour and got to see a bit of the city, it is busy and as a lot of cruises going on to, be careful where you buy from though, we went to the tourist office on the danube and though the route for the price was good value as you get a free drink but it only lasted an hour and we didnt go around margaret island which is what it seems to show, the touts on the side are good value as get to go back at night for free and they also have many more tours for you to pick from so have a look around first, good to do though!
River cruise. Make sure to take a river cruise, the view is breathtaking. you will feel like you have known the place after the cruise. Enjoy buda and pest side.

take the night sightseeing cruises. We took the Danube Legend cruise at 930 PM and it cost 21 Euro per person. Each person was given a glass of drink - choice of champagne,wine,beer,
Softdrinks or mineral water. The cruise lasted for one hour. Each passenger was
provided with a headset with 30 language film and audio guide.

Walk or ride but see it at night. There's a wonderful promenade along the Danube and it's just such a great place to experience. At night there's the added bonus of so many illuminated buildings. If you take one of the boat rides, you'll be able to relax and just soak in the the view but either walking or riding, don't miss the experience.

Free for oldies. EU visitors aged over 65 can travel free on public transport in Budapest, this includes subway, trams, buses AND the river ferries.The subway system is the oldest on mainland Europe (and looks it) although the trains are fairly frequent. Buses are efficient and trams speedy.To qualify you need to carry photo ID such as a passport or EU driving licence.Travel up and down the Danube on the ferries is good value at any age, although the boats are a little shabby the river and the sights on its banks are fantastic.

Take the night cruise and imagine you've paid for a viking river cruise. Yes we saw the tv adverts and decided that we wanted to see the sights of Budapest at night illuminated like some Disneyland attraction. It is as magnificent as it appears on the adverts the best buildings are beautifully lit and reflect in the dark waters of the river creating a magic moment to treasure.

Excellent Cruise. We took the Dunayacht cruise, which left from the pier next to the Elizabeth Bridge. We paid about $8.50 each for two one-hour cruises, one at night and the other during the day. Payment was by cash only; credit cards are not taken. Boats leave about hourly, so the trips were very convenient for our schedule. The two cruises must be taken within 24 hours of each other. An audio recording in English and German was played, pointing out the various sights and giving some useful background information about them. A cruise on the Danube should certainly be taken. For one thing, the price is certainly reasonable. For another, the views of the bridges, the buildings on the Pest side, and the hills on the Buda side are excellent and quite different from what you get on land.
Grey not blue. The Danube is a wide placid grey river that bifurcates Buda and Pest. The river offers a great anchor for all the amazing buildings and bridges.
Nice trip. Going by boat at Danube is one thing there is a must, when visiting Budapest. There is great view's all over and at night is it very beautiful with light on the city.

Historic River. Spent the better part of a week cruising up the Danube last December on a Viking cruise. Would probably not take another European cruise as it's just so easy to get around. The river is beautiful even during a cold winter.

Great views / well maintained. The river is really huge and impressing. You can admire the views from many bridges as well as walking up the promenades beside the Danube, which are very well maintained. At night everything is illuminated and it looks beautifull. I really recommend taking the walk, how could anyone skip it while being in Budapest? :)
Superb View. Magnificent !!!Both side views are superb ... the castle , the churches , the parliament , the chain bridge , Elizabeth bridge , buda hills ..

Very nie place specially if you live there. River goes through the center of the city. Next to Danube is a very nice pedestrian path, bike path, road for trams and cars. There are as well many restaurant on land and on boats to grab an amazing chilling lunch or a romantic dinner. Check it out :)
River cruise. Good boat, lovely service. Rained on the night so didn't go to the upper deck. But can be used next day for day cruise. Didn't use it as not much time.

Danube cruse by night. Nice cruse down the Danube by night.about 1.5 hours. Entertainment was excellent, Violinist , Chello, and base.
Staff were good, food not brilliant.
Well worth a trip.
+. You can have long walks along the river admiring great sights of the city. The best part is the Parliament Building which I strongly recommend.

River cruise. You can't miss the Danube if you go to Budapest! We took a river cruise as part of our Hop on Hop off bus ticket. Definitely recommend it, as great sight seeing and photo opportunities. We went in the day time. If we had had more time, I would certainly have done a night time cruise as well.

Relax, have fun, and get dinner while sailing. Budapest card allows you to have 1 cruise dinner while sailing on the Danube in a reduced price Or 2 coupons cruises by the Hop on hop off (1 at day time, 1 in the evening) .The dinner is fun, tasty and for extra 7e you get a nice photo to remember. While getting to taste the local different food "all you can eat" style, including desserts , you get to see the view of the Parliament and the bridges, enjoy the little orchestra and soon an hour and a half are over Cruises are also wonderful, if it is raining . Along the river banks you can sit and relax on the benches or have bike tours or a nice walk. Early evening is the most beautiful time when the clouds have their special colors and the city lights are turned on. Enjoy!

Never got tired of looking at it. Never got tired of looking or photographing it. Whether you are up at the Citadella, Buda Castle, on the Chain Bridge, whether it is sunny, cloudy, dusk or night, it's beautiful. Loved it.

Beautiful, especially at night. Our river cruise docked on the Buda side of the city, we watched the city light up in the evening. The Chain Bridge, other bridges, castle windows, city lamps: beautiful! During the day, one can see the wear and tear on the city of its recent past, but at night, all is forgiven.

Lucky Hungarians to have Danube crossing their capital. I know Danube, it boarders my country, but the Hungarians really knew how to emphasize its beauty and water richness. If you get to Budapest take the Danube cruise, preferably around Margarita Island. It is a great opportunity to learn somethings about Buda and Pest, about their architecture, history and meaning for the Hungarians.
City of lights. We sailed into Budapest around 10.30pm what a spectacle the chain bridge, parliament etc makes this a must to see.

Europes second longest river. This amazing river originates in Germany and finished in the Black Sea by Romania. The river passes through 4 Capitl cities and runs 2,880 Kms. The Danube runs by or through 10 countries and holds the longest length through Romania. The Danube through Budapest is very beautiful, Hungary used this great river as a lifeline for industry. There is so much taking place on the Danube with many vantage points to view it's beauty. For me I simply enjoyed riding a bicycle, taking a tram and even viewing this from the many bridges from Buda to Pest or on Margaret Island. Having only seen the Danube in 2 of the 10 countries I have to say the Budapest has been the cleanest and most beautiful I have seen.

The Famous Danube River. A very well known river that split a city (Buda & Pest) or the river that joined a city. A must see if you are there with a boat cruise.

Lovely views. Would definitely recommend doing it whilst in the city, especially if its a nice day!

River Cruise. We did this trip on our last night. A very good way to see Budapest from a dfferent level. The buildings lit up at night is beautiful and romantic. Our trip of 1.30 min included two free drinks.

The Lovely Danube. We took a boat cruise (approx 90 mins) which cruised past all the lovely buildings on the Danube. Viewing from the water gives the buildings a new perspective which is not obstructed by the crowds that flock to lovely Budapest.
a noble river. The views from the river on both the Pest and Buda sides rival any in the world. The buildings, full of history,are beautiful, best seen from a river cruise.
