Danube River - Dividing Buda and Pest. The Danube is a major river in central and eastern Europe that is the second longest waterway on the continent. This river cuts through the centre of Budapest separating Buda on one side of the river and Pest on the other. A popular way to enjoy the Danube is to take a boat cruise along the river, allowing you views of the attractions on both sides of the river. There are quite a few companies offering these services which you can find online or by visiting the Budapest Vacation and forum pages here on Tripadvisor. Similarly, there are floating restaurants mooring in the Danube that you can visit for an interesting dining experience. Floating hotels are available as well keen to try something very different. Another way to enjoy the Danube is to walk one of the many bridges that cross the river, linking Buda and Pest. The two that we enjoy most are Chain Bridge and Liberty Bridge. Chain Bridge is excellently located in the heart of the city centre area for Pest and just under Castle Hill on the Buda side of the river. Liberty (Freedom) Bridge is further south, linking the two sides near the famous Gellert Hotel on the Buda Side and Spa and the Great Market Hall in Pest. For very nice views, you can walk along the Danube Promenade or even take the famous yellow Tram Line 2 along the river. This affords nice views of the river and Buda, allowing you to see Castle Hill and its attractions on this side of the Danube. For best views of the Pest side of the river, you can make the leisurely climb up Gellert Hill or make your way Buda Castle or St. Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion where you will be richly rewarded with stunning views of the river and the Pest side of the river. Views of the gothic style Parliament building is gorgeous from up here, especially on clear days.In the end, much of what Budapest has to offer is found near the Danube so you are very likely to end up on or near the river at some stage of your holiday. Just have your camera ready so you can snap a few pictures of the Danube and the beautiful city buildings and attractions which line its banks.

A boat trip is well worth it. Like many others we had a family trip on the evening dinner cruise with music and it was well worth the cost, even though I was paid for. Romantic evening trip. We walked along the Danube lots of times during the day so decided to have an evening boat trip to see all the bridges and buildings lit up. Cruise the Danube at night. Lots of information, beautiful lights, and a free drink! Budapest is a very beautiful city both day and night but to get the best picture of Parliment building you need to be on the river !

Beautiful Budapest. I recently spent a weekend celebrating my birthday in Budapest. It may be one of my favourite European cities yet. You can read about it on my blog at http://joannasjourneyaroundtheworld.blogspot.it/
The thermal baths and ruin bars were my favourite!
Beautiful Views. We just walked along part of the Danube... Beautiful views, the buildings are just amazing... so old....

Boat Trip. Good experiance. The Danube is a lovely river,and if you go take a river trip on a Restaurant river boat all food and drinks good value.

Cruise down the Danube. Definately recommended. Brilliant sites and history given via ear phones. Drinks included in the price which was very reasonable and included Chapagne !!

river cruise. took a short river cruise on the danube, a must for all as the history of the river is very interesting. Great view of the elizabeth and the chain bridges from the river.

Worth a trip on the river at night.... We did a night river cruise, without the dinner, and that was worth it. The views were spectacular and the entertainment on board - two violins and a double bass - was very good indeed. There are plenty of options for the cruise, the one we did was run out of the Danube Palace. You can book it online before you go, or you can buy the Budapest travel card online and book the cruise when you get here and get a small discount. Personally, i'd do it all first and not have the hassle of booking it on arrival.
Stunning to walk to day or night!. We took many walks next to it and never got tired Looking at it! Stunning and really sets the tone for Budapest! You can see this is the heart of Budapest!

One of Europe's main rivers. Seen in many times, in many countries and places - Bulgaria (Ruse, Svishtov, Vidin), Serbia (Belgrade), Budapest. I love this river, a road and connections between nations and cultures.
Blue???. We had a trip on the Danube and enjoyed it very much - easy to get a clear view of the whole city in one go.

Beautiful views. especially at the dusk, magically the lights come on the bridge, and the city becomes even more charming...We tried Colombus Cafe, best views, great food and they spoke english, very nice staff

Danube visit in Budapest. This was rather unique, as the Danube was flooding while we were there. We missed out on a river cruise due to the flooding, but it was interesting to see everyone look at the river flooding, etc.

Viking Danube River Cruise. If you want great and easy travel arrangements, great food, great activities, great scenery, go Viking. It's a great deal of fun, great people and, best of all, the travel details are all managed for you.

excellent, the river, buildings and bridges. of course beautiful, romantic and festive perfect trip for Xmas! Budapest is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe and the Danube a gem! Passes through 10 countries its banks have wonderful vistas, excellent for walks and unwinding!
Go at night. A trip down the Danube is included in most of the bus tours. Go at night, or after dark. The buildings and the river are beautiful then.
Night Cruise and Dinner. Absolutely beautiful on the river at night, very magical views. The dinner was a buffet and with good wine and nice people we met it was a terrific night.

So relaxing on the river. Took a cruise along the Danube with Viking River Cruises. Started in Nuremburg and finished in Budapest. The Viking longship was superb - great crew and great food. And the cruise was a great opportunity to recuperate after a major operation while getting to visit some major places, such as Regensburg, Melk, Vienna and Budapest. Would definitely recommend a trip along the romantic Danube river, and highly recommend Viking.

Beautiful both day and night!. It's really great walking down either side of the Danube, crossing its bridges or taking a ride with the tram trains and enjoying the view! Definitely worth seeing both day and night, as the lights decorating the bridges gives another perspective to the scenery!
Historic, lovely. Beautiful river with Buda on one side and Pest on the other. Very historic…lots of tour boats and action in the area. Relaxing.
genius experience. take a boat (better at night) you can be inside drink and eat as well as go outside and take a smoke picuture-take something worm to wear.. believe me for outside. Must DO.

Viking Christmas Market. I am going to be much more critical than is warranted because I want to point out the limited downfalls of Viking. Overall, we would rate this trip an 8-9 out of 10 so we liked it and would do another. I think it important to research what type of cruise you want to do. Viking does a much focused type of cruise with a very set schedule. It’s kind of like going on vacation where the first day, you just relax and say "I am on vacation" and don't fight it. Viking can be very very set in their ways and for the most part, they do all they can to make this a good experience. However, if you want something out of the ordinary, like upgrade your room, schedule a airport transfer or if you want to tip with anything other than Euro or US$, then they are not flexible and it can be irritating. They could work on that a bit. Our cruise was a Christmas Market Cruise and we did everything and more than we had hoped to. We booked our own airfare only because we did not know better. Viking works best if you use all of their services and if you confine your trip to what they offer. If you book airfare with them or extended stay, then they will make sure they meet you at the airport and take you back. One caution however is that you must remember that there is no such thing as a $199 air fare that they tout once in a while. It is simply that Viking is subsidizing part of that cost so they do not discount their room, which they very very very seldom do. When you book your air fare through Viking make sure you look at the flight times and layovers. That $199 airfare will most likely get you stuck in an airport for a few hours or a longer flight home so just check the details. We ended our trip in Passau, Germany so for 95% of the group, the trip was over and they needed to go to Munich airport for their flight back home. While I suspect not normal, one couple had to get up at 2 am to catch their bus. Let me explain. The drive to Munich is 2 hours so they allow 3. They schedule pickup 1/2 hr prior to that and then you need to be at the airport to 2-3 hrs ahead of time. If you have a 7 am flight, booked for you by Viking (can you say $199 air fare?), then you get the idea. On our trip, we booked our own airfares and were able to screw up our own schedule by allowing a 4 hr layover in Amsterdam so you need to get involved. You have to remember that you are in the middle of the night when you get to your first layover so my advice is to pick a flight to minimize layovers and look closely at departure times and where the airport is. Doing this will greatly improve your experience. The other somewhat irritating issue is tipping. Viking being an American/Swiss company asks you to partially subsidize their costs and tip at the end of the trip. Its the American way. It was interesting watching the Tour Director and others encourage tipping in Europe where there is no tipping. This is completely up to you but they do lay on the guilt trip for you. Something I felt amusing is that they will only accept tips in euro or US$. If you are to tip, a great way to get rid of the misc currency, from Hungary for example which is not euro, is to leave that as part of the tip. NOPE, we only accept euro and US$. I never had anyone tell me before when I was giving money away that they wanted it only in certain form. Viking could work on this.Now the good part. There are only 170 or so people so this is not a 3,000 person Princess Cruise so you need to rethink this. With only 170, they can plan pretty well. I liked the single dining experience. We had time for Happy Hour and usually a brief talk about what was going on the next day in the Lounge and then you had 1/2 hr or so to make your way to the dining room. I would rate the food overall 7 out of 10 which I think is pretty good. If you are a picky eater, look closely at the menu and you will find a César salad always available with Salmon or chicken on it or some other dish so look and ask. We purchased the unlimited bar which probably was not worth it $150 euro or $200US each but it did boost the level of the trip. We ordered a bottle of wine off the separate list each evening and had a few cocktails before or after the meal. It was nice not putting yourself in a position of wondering how much it was. On the other hand, if you can eliminate worrying about the cost, then I think you could drink as much as you want for less than the $200 per person. A bottle of wine was about $30. A typical day started with a pretty good breakfast that started at 6 and went to 9AM. You can get a European breakfast of cold cuts and cheese of a Texas breakfast of eggs, bacon, ham, sausage etc. You get the idea. Following breakfast 6 days out of 7 is the tour of the day that is usually included in your booking fee. They do have a couple of side trips like an opera (that only 50% thought was good enough to warrant going). Most tours have a guide who wears a microphone and broadcasts a monologue as they walk. Each room and person is provided a devise to listen (make sure you charge it every night) This works very well. The walks are not that difficult and normally Viking, after the first day, formulates a special tour group for those that do not want to or cannot keep up and they do it gracefully. Given that this was the Christmas Market Trip, we usually had a tour of town and then back to the boat which was almost always close to the market or you could easily walk. Trying to figure out where to spend your time was never a problem. It was a bit cold so we always looked forward to getting back about 4 for happy hour and talk to other guests about their experience. Always about 5 or 6 the tour director would come in and have a presentation about the next day’s trip (always something you want to do) Following was open seating dinner but within a couple of days you started to know people and which ones to sit with and which ones to avoid if you know what I mean. .Not very often did we need to avoid anyone but we did form a little group that sat together each evening so the conversation was not ever strained. Especially with two of the ladies that loved to shop. At one point, one of the ladies had to buy luggage in town just to bring back to the ship what she bought.Let me summarize my suggestions for booking with Viking. If you can do all of the booking with them, do it however make sure you look at the times and discuss when you need to be off the boat. Consider arriving a day or two ahead to get used to the time change. If you arrange your own air travel or decide to extend your trip without Viking I highly suggest you make your own arrangements. We wanted to go to Munich to meet some friends and booked a Transfer from the ship to the airport. Viking wanted $150 euro each for this but we bought it. We only had one day in Munich so we wanted and early transfer and were told by Viking a number of times that their guests are first and they will take us when they have time. We canceled with a $30 fee each and rented a car for $100 euro and had a wonderful drive. Viking takes care of its own and after that you are better working it out yourself. Bottom line we would and will take another Viking Cruise but will not leave the travel details to them as it should be. You need to watch out for yourself
River trip. You must do that, You can enjoy the City from another perspective, I rally enjoy it, is the best way to discover the town in a short time and relaxed as possible.

Would recommend a sighseeing boat ride. We took a sighseeing boat trip of approximately 1 hour, which was included in the ticket of a "hop on hop off" bus tour of the city. It offered a great view of the city which you wouldn;t normally experience. Well worth it!

Fabulous trip. The ship itself was fantastic. A very attentive crew, fabulous food and a very clean and organized ship. The shore excursions are included daily, so very little extra money was needed. There were optional tours as well, but reasonably priced. The onboard entertainment was pleasant, but not overwhelming as on some ocean cruises. We could relax in the lounge, read in the library or play a game. There is a computer in the room with free wifi access, movies and music. Because of the limited number of guests, a true family atmosphere exists. Water is provided in your room and refilled daily free of charge. Coffee, tea and water is also available in the lounge. The cruise director was knowledgeable and even booked our train tickets as well as printed them for us. Gratuities are also left to the discretion of the guest and not forced on you as on some cruises. We took this tour over Christmas and so we saw some of the Christmas markets. If you want to see all the markets, take it the week before Christmas as most of them close on December 24.

Night Walking Tour and Danube River Cruise. The Night Walking Tour around Budapest is a must, especially around Christmas time with the beautiful lights glowing throughout the streets of Budapest. My tour guide Anita was very knowledgeable about the history of many locations around Budapest and I'm not a history person but I found it very interesting and enjoyable. Of course, Anitas English was great, I could understand every word and really got to know about the history of Hungary. After the tour I was also recommended to a couple of other places in Budapest which took up my whole day! I needed more than a day to fully enjoy it though I felt but I'm glad her knowledge goes past just giving the tour. The cruise on the river was great, you get served a drink and you are guided by the river Danube and other great people of Hungarian History in the language of your choice! (Mine being English)All in all, really great tour and cruise, great picture opportunities everywhere, definitely around Christmas time. 10/10 would tour and cruise again. Thanks, Anita : )

you just cannot miss it. I just took pictures from the car but i love the Danube and the surrounding areas. If you are there perhaps the best is to hop on the #2 tram line. there is one car that is decorated during Christmas. it is fun and a great way if your legs are tired
on the Danube. not much to say- great river and nice views from the boat. Especially like Margaret Island in the middle

ALL I CAN SAY IS "WOW"!. Earleir this month, my wife and I cruised from Nuremburg to Budapest on the AmaWaterways vessel the AmaCerto. Wow! What an incredible experience! We loved every minute of it. The cabin was comfortable, spotlessly clean and catered for all our needs. The restaurant was fantastic. The food was superb and service levels were incredibly high. The lounge, with coffee, tea, hot chocolate and snacks available 24/7 and the bar with it's friendly staff far exceeded expectations. The shore excursions (including the 14 Christmas markets we discovered) gave us a wonderful taste of Christmas in Germany and Austria and Budapest has to be one of the most beautiful cities I have ever seen.Staff on board the cruise boat were top, top class. They were warm, friendly, chatty and often deightfully amusing. Worthy of being singled out are Csaba Tamaz, the superb Tour Director, and Constantine, one of the restaurant stewards, who must surely take the award for Mr Personality 2013.I would recommend this trip to anyone and will most definitely do it again.

Hop on hop off river cruise. We took the hop on hop off river cruise at 4pm one cold December afternoon. We decided to stay on the boat for the duration of the tour which allowed us to see various attractions along the Danube including the Parliament Building, the castle, St Margret’s Island and more. We were also able to go upstairs on the outer deck to take some amazing photos. The boat has a bar, is heated inside, and also provided a guided audio tour in English and German.

Perfect end to a perfect weekend. We had booked a dinner cruise on the Danube for our final evening in Budapest & it was perfect.We were asked to meet fellow diners at the Budapest Palace (just behind the Four Seasons Hotel) & from there all walked together with our host for about 5 or 6 minutes where the boat was waiting just by the Chain Bridge.Welcomed on board with a glass of champagne & led to our table. Very well presented & not cramped at all.Live music played throughout the cruise giving it a lovely romantic atmosphere,The views were spectacular which ever side of the boat you were on so everyone could enjoy the magnificent buildings all illuminated showing off their splendour, Food was buffet style & plentiful comprising of salads, goulash soup, several hot dishes, breads & deserts. The dinner included 3 drinks - champagne on arrival, wine or beer plus water, You could purchase more & the prices were very reasonable.Once you had finished your meal, you could spend time on the outdoor upstairs deck.All staff very pleasant & helpful & even organised a taxi to take us back to our hotel when as the cruise was coming to an end.Do this cruise & you'll love it as did we
A must do.... ....no trip to Budapest would be complete without a cruise along the Danube. I took the trip at night and the illuminated palace and parliament are a truly beautiful sight

Too stunning for words. Looking at the Danube, the incredible water power, it reminded me of how very dependant on Nature humans are. The long, broad river connects the city rather than dividing it. One could just spend hours and hours striding along or looking at it from the Chain bridge. The best that Budapest has to offer.

So relaxing. Warm welcome on board with welcome drink on arrival and second drink during the boat trip. Lasts about 1hr 10 mins and a great way of getting a bit of the history of both Buda and Pest. Multi language audio. Good value for money.

Do A Dinner Cruise On The Danube!. The height of our group tour stop in Budapest was an evening dinner cruise on the Danube. The beauty of this city at night was so much more than any of us expected, and everyone in the group found it breathtaking. They light up all the buildings (and the historic architecture is spectacular) all along the Danube for several miles, and this includes the many bridges that cross the river. I could never do the experience any justice in trying to describe it, but I can tell that you should NOT miss it if you have the opportunityWe had a perfect September evening for the trip- pleasant temperature and perfectly clear skies. A light jacket or sweater was all that was needed for being out on the upper deck to observer the city from the boat. The timing couldn't have been better.Our dinner cruise included delicious local fare in a large buffet on the lower, enclosed deck of the boat, along with drinks. Once we had finished eating, everyone went up to the upper deck to view the city. By that time, darkness had settled in, and the boat began to turn around for the trip back to the center of town. The large, impressively elegant buildings and bridges were brightly lit, making them pop out of the background of the night sky.. and this went on for miles as we leisurely made our way back down the river. n fact, many of us noticed that what we might have thought were very bright twinkling stars were actually birds (presumably white gulls) dancing and diving overhead, reflecting the bright light that shone on the buildings. Again- I can't do this justice. Do yourself a favor and don't miss this evening that everyone in our group found unforgettable.

Delightful dinner cruise. We were able to book a dinner cruise down the Danube for our anniversary without any problems. It was the highlight of our trip, with good food, and quality entertainment. Want to take a river cruise on our next visit!

Danube "Cruising" on a budget.. Since I can remember I hear about the Danube. Who hasn't listened to Strauss' Blue Danube? So it was always my wish to at least navigate for a couple of hours along this legend. The usual cruises are rather expensive, but wife and I found out that you can use the transportation local Budapest folks use to commute along the Danube. It is very cheap and you can enjoy a "Danube cruise" for a couple of hours going up and down the river.If you are on a budget, this is certainly a very handy and cheap way of cruising the Danube.
Lovely way to see the city. We got a one hour Danube cruise with the tourist bus ticket, on a beautiful day. This was very informative and set the city in context.

Blue Danube river cruise. My wife and I have recently returned from a Blue Danube river cruise. This was our first experience of river cruising and won´t be our last! How easy to enjoy the beauty of some of Europe's historic cities from the convenience and comfort of our 'floating hotel'. Thanks Blue Danube for a wonderful holiday and, thanks to the people of Budapest for their hospitality in, what is now, our favourite city.

Sailed along the Danube. I and the wife went on a Cruise along the Danube from Budapest to Nuremberg the views were spectacular as the Danube went through several major cities also encountering numerous locks including the largest the company that we sailed with even a lock keeper coming on board to explain how they work. Beautiful way of touring several countries instead of changing Hotels several times during holiday the Hotel changed locations so only packed unpacked once over the 13 days cruise.

Traditional and nostalgic. Songs and music have been written about this mighty river, the second longest in Europe. A leisurely cruise on one of the many pleasure craft is well worth it, just sit back and relax, enjoy the view and take in some of the great architecture the City has to offer.

Cruise it. Take a boat trip up the Danube to see all the buildings lit up at night. It was stunning. Such a beautiful city to see lit. We actually went at 4pm (in Oct) so we had the sunset on the way up and darkness on the way back and it was brilliant.Boat trip took around 1hr

Wonderful experience. Breathtaking view day or night. This city is one of my favorite europe.
Very lovely and relaxing at night.
Cruise the Danube. Take an evening cruise on the Danube and sit outside. It is a breathtaking visual experience with incredible views so have your camera ready!

Lovely night views. of Budapest from the Danube. Take an evening river cruise and see the city from a whole different perspective. If you can, sit outside on the upper level and get the full enjoyment...take your camera!
Cruise the Danube. When in Budapest you have to take a night cruise on the Danube. Second Best way to view the city. best way is explore on foot inland

Even on a cold, wet Sunday, this was enjoyable. We took a boat trip up the Danube to Sentendre with Silverline Cruises, the last of the year. The launch was clean, prices very competetive, and the views afforded from on board excellent. The english language commentary was informative and not intrusive, and the changing views on the two hour trip fascinating.

Gorgeous strolls along this river. As gorgeous as it is in the day it is even better at night! If wanting another experience on the river I highly recommend the Fortuna Boat Hostel as you sleep on an old boat docked on the Danube!

An essential element of Budapest' history. the city really developed around the river and it would be great to make a tour in order to better understand the Budapest' history and evolution. Danube is significantly more beautiful than in Wien here and the Hungarian people really understood how to make money out of it. The boat tours are compulsory and it's best to take the boat during the night.

VAST and VERY ACCESSIBLE via a number of boat tours, if interested. there are a number of boat companies that ply the Danube. Were one to want a unique and pleasant day NOT on foot ( say, perhaps, in the summer?) THIS would be the way to see BudaPest !

Relax and see the city. The Danube River is a must so go see it by night and day! By night we had a dinner cruise and saw the city illuminated. The food was good, but the beauty of the city was excellent. By day I enjoyed the relaxation and the many sights that were pointed out by the overhead recordings in German and English, as part of the Giraffe Hop On Hop Off bus tour. Don't miss seeing the famous river and try to make time to see it both by night and day.
Budapest at Night. Make sure that you take a boat cruise on the Danube at Night - the city is in lights and it is breathtaking.

deviding Budapest. The Danube devides Budapest into two parts: Buda and Pest. I prefere the Buda side, because it full of historic buildings and it is wonderful. We also booked a hotel on the Buda side, which is a perfect place to stay in Budapest.

Best Way to Budapest. We concluded a Gate1 Travel cruise on the MS Sound of Music recently. Although we lived in this magnificent city for two years, we finally discovered a great way to get there! The cruise started in Nuremberg and was a great price performer! The ship is not as glitzy as many but the staff was great, the food oh, so good, and the sightseeing tours along the way were excellent. It was our first Gate1 trip but it won't be our last.
Must do. Dinner and cruise trip was fantastic, to see the city by night from a lovely vantage point on the River Danube - magical.

Debs1534. We took a river cruise on the Danube which was included in the price of the hop on/hop off tour buses so was great value for money. You could see all the sights from the boat whilst they were pointed out by the tour guide.
They do not respect the schedule.. Boat Dunayacht Dock 10.They do not respect the schedule of beginning of the trip. The people are not friendly.Francisco.
Beautiful River. At Budapest the Danube is quite wider than I expected as well as seeming to be fairly clean. A boat ride here on the river is a necessary part of a visit to Budapest.
Breathtaking. Say no more, see my title..... it is gorgeous, I have to write more, 50 characters or more..... so I shall say again, GORGEOUS
Not as blue as the song. Interesting to see all the different boats etc on the river. Many of the river cruise boats moored whilst the occupants tour the city.

Very Pretty. Hey, someone said its not blue....but you know on a really clear day, which you don't get many in Europe, it is....we did a short river cruise and managed to get down and get some photos at night. It was lovely, so wide and peaceful.
not blue- but beautiful. I like Danube one of the most beautiful river in Europe. Alongside of this river, the wildlife is amazing.

Cruise. We went on a short river cruise the weather was beautiful, and added to what is a nice part of the world. The views are exceptional, we ran out of time so we did'nt manage a night cruise maybe next time.
River Trip. Spectacular views of Budapest from the river amazing architecture such as the Parliament Building.Disappointed that the Danube was'nt Blue !!!! Heyho ! Well worth doing this trip.

The Danube is Central to Budapest. I cannot imagine a trip to Budapest without seeing the Danube and it does not disappoint. A wide body of turquoise green, silty water winds through the city. There are great views of the river from the hilly viewpoints on the Buda side. It is possible to cross on foot, by tram and bus as well as cars. We visited in October and the wind blew strong and cool as we crossed by foot, but as long as you are appropriately dressed, it's very pleasant.

Gorgeous Views at Night. We took a river cruise from Budapest to Nuremberg but the evening views from the Chain Bridge along the coast of the Danube is breathtaking. You can see Fisherman's Bastion, the Parliament, Buda Castle, the funicular, Buda Tunnel, Elizabeth bridge and much more. If you do cruise the Danube, make sure to take the excursion to the Danube Gorge in Kelheim (near Regensberg, Germany). About 20 min from Kelheim (upstream), there is an abbey that is reknown for their dark beer. Try it. The abbey is right on the Danube.
Magical river. Every time you look upon the Danube it looks different. It is a magical river that seems to bring live to Budapest.

Beautiful river. Great bridges, lovely architecture on both sides of the Danube, a lovely and lively river with great historic flavor and active for tourism...view terrific from both Buda and Pest...can't help but experience when you visit Budapest, so not really a separate site, but part of the overall Budapest experience.

Night Trips are the BEST!. If you visit Budapest, make sure to book a cruise down the Danube at night (season permitting). Budapest really lights up at night and it was probably one of the most fun things we did in the city. If you are a photographer, make sure to take a tripod!
Must do cruise. Better to do the cruise in the late afternoon for an amazing sunset view! the danube cruise shows you a different perspective of the City
Must See. Take the public transportation lines if you want to save money and do not need the guided explanations

Very comfortable boat ride. We were well looked after, soft drinks or sparkling wine. We were warm and dry - it rained the whole duration of our trip along the Danbue. It did not spoil the magnificent views of the majestic and architecturally interesting buildings along the banks of the river

THE so touristic stuff to do. As we expected, there are a lot of tourists from all over the world and some of them just behaved badly towards other tourists. Apart from that the night cruise gave us a good overlook on the main buildings along the river which was great

Sailing the Danube in Budapest. We spent several days in Budapest prior to sailing up river to the continental divide and ultimately on to Amsterdam via the Main and Rhine rivers. The Danube runs through the city separating the Buda from the Pest sides of the city. The city is beautiful with the river accenting both the north (Pest, newer side of the city) and the south (Buda, the older side). Restaurants line the river offering a plethora of choices for meals. The city lights reflecting from the Danube make for very romantic settings in the evening.

The Danube - in flood. What a sight - the Danube was up 5m+ due to floods in Central Europe. Over 4 days we watched the river rise about 2m. It was an amazing scene with 1000's loacal and tourists all eagre to get a view.

River cruise on the Danube. What an amazing River cruise on the Miss Sapphire (Tauck). This is a 5 * you will not regret. The staff on board, great tour directors, food, motor coaches are huge and very clean and comfortable. The size of the boat is just great as you really get to know your fellow travellers.. Everything is well thought out for you. The all inclusive tours and beer and wine at lunch & dinner. We had 3 nights of dinner at castles.
always spectacular. Always a wonderful view weather it's winter or summer, day or night, sunny or cloudy. You can use the bikeroad on the Buda side all along the river.

Take a Boat Trip. Four of us took a short boat trip with a company called Legenda along the banks of the Danube and around Margaret Island with an excellent headphone guide (in 30 languages), plus a glass of wine and a glass of lemonade included in the coast of around £10.00. It lasted for about and hour and fifteen minutes and I highly recommend it as a way of seeing Budapest and catching up on it's history as well.

Take the night cruise - without dinner. The evening cruise on the Danube shows you the beauty of Budapest at night. Recommend just take the cruise + drink, as the cruise is about 1.5 hours, so not really enough time to eat and look outside. It is best if the weather is warm so you can stand on the deck to enjoy the lights of the city.

DANUBE RIVER (especially in Budapest). This majestic river flows through the centre of the city of Budapest and divides the OLD cities of Buda and Pest. The river passes in front of the fantastic Parliament Building and many many historical structures along the river since the times of the Turkish and Roman invasions of centuries ago. Don't miss the delightful BATHS that you can go to and enjoy the special water that comes up from springs beneath of the river and city streets.

Budapest-Danube cruise. The boat Panorama was very good for the cruise up the Danube. Budapest is a great city. Rebuilding everywhere It will be a destination where you will want to spend your vacation. So much to see, great food everywhere, high quality hotels, and the people are all nice to tourist.We stayed at the Intercontiental near the Chain Bridge and close enough to walk to many places in Pest. Don't miss the market house.

worth seeing. For certain things in life words cannot describe it.This,among other beautiful places of this world,it's worth seeing..even for some it may just be water,others may find it intriguing..The way the cities look around the river..it's simply divine!

Some quiet time. A short cruise to Margaret Island and back on a warm sunny day was the right thing to do after a very busy morning site seeing. The trip (about an hour) was great for photo shoots, even though I am not particularly good at photography. On the return leg we were able to disembark at a pier close to our hotel. I would recommend the trip

Beautiful, but not quite blue. Not blue as many have said before, but a powerful river, used for both tourist and commercial ships alike. Some great bridges, can be a little windy, but a boat tour, passing some of the thermal baths, parliament, and stopping off inbetween, is a must do in fair weather.
Danube through Budapest.. Stayed in Budapest, and only had an hour's cruise which covered the sights of Budapest, which was really lovely. Obviously can't comment on the rest of the Danube.

Beautiful Budapest. It is such a beautiful city - especially the building along the river. I agree about the boat cruises get the free one on the Hop on Hop Off Tours. Make sure you go early to the Parliament Buildings as the English Tours fill up quickly. I was disappointed I left it to the last day - but I think I will have to visit Budapest again. The view of the city from the Castle in the evening is breathtaking. Beautiful Budapest. The little Restaurants in the Castle district were lovely. The meals were lovely and the service great. The hotel that I stayed in was great Lanchid 19. Service was good and the view just marvellous.
night cruise on the Danube in Budapest. The buildings along the river were spectacular--- beautifully lit up, especially the parliament buildings and the castle- it was truly breathtaking!

Danube. A boat tour is required before you leave Budapest. We made the mistake of booking a boat tour on day one with Legenda. It was nice because we choose an evening (8pm) cruise. But if you book the Giraffe Hop on and Hop Off tour, a boat cruise is included. Save the money, and use it to see the Hungarian Folk Dance show.

Look deeper than the river. There is a lot of history in this river and yes on face value it looks like any industrial river.Sit back in your seat on the boat and admire the architecture both modern and new and wonder what has past this way before.Glad I went to this part of Budapest but seen it and no mad urge to return.
Beautiful but windy. Danube is a really spectacular river, but you'd better to be prepared for strong wind!And it's not necessary to have a boat trip, you can simply take a walk along the embankment.

Beautiful. we were there in mid February nearing the end of a long very cold winter. There was still lots of snow and ice everywhere on pavements, buildings and massive great ice-bergs floating in the river. Obviously there were no boat trips because of the ice but the river and the surrounding area looked so beautiful.
Danude. Not the romantic river that Straus rote music to. A grey, murky river, not blue at all but a fasinatice piece of water, considering from were it starts to were it ends.

Busy stretch of water. Not Blue as in the song but a flowing stretch of water separating Buda and Pest. The traffic along the banks is relentless. There are many boat trips to choose from. We ventured on an hours trip around Margaret island and back. The trip lost its appeal after we sailed pass the Parliament building ( which is spectacular) as you can see both sides whichever way you go! However, I would guess the trip is better at night.
Lovely way to relax. The weather was quite warm when we visited so this was a lovely way of being able to sit back and relax while still seeing some sights. Great way to put down an hour or 2

It's a river. I wouldn't say it's spectacular, it's just a river, wide and fast with a lot of traffic. And you can't help seeing it, crossing it and walking along it while your in Budapest so I don't know why it's an attraction. It's just there.
Must see. My husband actually got down in it! It was very interesting seeing the bus type transportation actually on the river. The bridges across were all different and all beautiful.
busy river. Great if you like to watch the boats rushing up and down from river cruisers to barges loaded to the gunnals

Very pleasant. Wonderful week on the Danube sailing from Budapest and Nuremburg. So relaxing to sit on the deck or lounge watching the beautiful scenery. Loved the stops in towns along the way. Food was of the highest quality. Only complaint is sometimes poor wifi service at times. Also distance from Vienna city centre & had to use taxi or public transit. otherwise it was great.
Evening cruise. Ama Waterways provided an evening river cruise on our final night in Budapest. All the buildings were illuminated along the Danube for a spectacular journey.

Danube bike and barge. We took the week long bike tour with the ship the Theodor Korner from Passau Germany to Vienna and back. We were four couples in our 50's. Had a blast. Staff on the ship were wonderful and the food was great. Special thanks to Jan our cruise director. Bikes provided by the ship were top notch. Bike all day at a nice pace with frequent stops for sights, beer and wine. Biking was all on paved paths and 80 % downhill slope. Vineyards, vistas, castles, history, super architecture, fruit trees everywhere and nice people. We packed our lunches each morning from the buffet and stopped for picnics and at pubs. Nightlife on the ship and shore were a lot of fun. If you don't feel like biking on any of the days, you can watch the scenery go by from indoor or outdoor decks. A hot lunch is served to those on board. This was one of the best vacations my wife and I have ever taken. Strongly advise that you do some biking before the trip to condition your butt. It's not your legs that will betray you on this trip.

Not blue like the song. Not Blue like the song, it is a lot wider than I thought it would be, plenty of boat trips day & night, lots of lovely bars & restaurant on both Buda & Pest side. Some great river boats which are permanent fixtures these are bars & restaurants my favourite is Spoon. Views are great from both sides too.

Stunning in the evening.... Pretty during the day, stunningly lit in the evening. A walk along the riverside is a must... There are a lot of cruise ferries that go up and down that look quite expensive. An alternative way is to take one of the trams or buses that run alongside the river or just to stroll...

Nice River - Shame about the Roads. The main problem is that for most of its length in Budapest you there are roads and tramways between you are the river. The odd places you get near it you share paths with kami-kaze cyclist who make what should be a pleasant experience ghastly. Why the tourist authority does not stop them I do not know.

Viking River cruise. This was a great trip....15 days on the Danube, Main, and Rhine rivers. The rooms on board were bigger than ocean cruise ships. Food good, staff great, good city stops and tours. A lockmaster strike slowed us down for a few days, but Viking broke it's you-know-what to get us to the sites.

Another magnificent place thatb is crossed by Danube.. I love Danube. We have made a car drive along the Danube from the Black Forest to Budapest. Next year, we will go further. from Budapest to Black Sea.

No one shows the river better. I don't think any other city has better views of the river. The entire atmosphere, the vibes and the experience seems somehow to revolve around the river. If you want to see the Danube, you must come to Budapest.

a must at night. this is such a fab sight on an eve and is a must to see as all the bridges and everything is lit up.either by bus or boat if u do a hop on hop off bus we did the blue one 48hrs with a river trip for 6000huf and extra coupons with discounts inside 10 different languages

Stunning, could watch it forever. Ever changing, always moving, a river which truly reflects The Strauss music Blue Danube and it is well worth even a short cruise along it to get a feel for its magic.....even if the river is rarely blue in colour. Travelled along the Danube for over a week between the main canal intersection and Budapest,

Different vista. The river cruise is nice for most ages but is not for the elderly or the handicaped. The view is great, especialy at night when the bridges and buildings are lit up. It's good for taking photos from a different perspective.

Cruising the Danube. We enjoyed cruising the Danube. We started in Budapest, Hungary and ended in Nuremberg, Germany. The towns and old cities with all their charm and history with the castles dotting the waterway was a real treat.

cruise on the danube. Don't miss a night cruise on the Danube. It was one of the biggest highlights of our entire European tour. Often a cruise can be included with your Hop On Hop Off bus ticket. Check it out.

You can't miss it. The river is an important part of Budapest, especially as it divides Buda from Pest. Walk along the river, take the views from both sides, or take a river cruise if you have time and can decide which one to take.
It's not blue. You can't miss this after years of singing its songs. The buildings are beautifully lit at night. It's no longer blue. There are lots of walkways on the Pest side to stroll along.

Legenda boat trip. We chose the Legenda Danube boat trip which lasted 1 to 1.5 hours. We didn't do a lunch or dinner cruise and I'm glad because they served a glass of wine which was in drinkable. I don't think Legenda was worth twice the price of all the other boat trips offered in the same area.

A mighty river. A great, and little publicised way to see the Danube on a budget, is to take a ride on the commuter ferry boats - Routes 11 & 12 go up & down the river from Margaret Island to the south of Petofi Bridge. For the best views, board at Petofi Bridge and travel north past Parliament.
The Blue Danube. A beautiful river and makes for a lovely stroll along the river and to walk across the Chain Bridge.

The Danube is not just a majestic river, it's a part of the city. The Danube separates Buda and Pest, yet connects both together. You get the same sense of connection between city and waterway as you do with the Thames in London. The night cruise must be awesome!

Excellent. I took hop on hop off boat tour with EUrama travel agency. Ticket price is 3000 HUF (about 10 euros). Ticket is valid for 24 hours and includes evening cruise (7 pm and 10 pm). The starting point of the cruise is Vigado ter (pier 11). Second stop is beautiful Margaret island which is a must, so you get a lot for the price you pay. I recommend it.
Nice place. River offers you many facilities. You can have a romantic trip or eat dinner in the ship next to the bridge. Great views and nice atmosphere.

Evening cruise on the Danube. The Evening cruise on the Danube when both sides Buda and Pest are lit up is spectacular. The cruise which has a commentary in different languages we took the English tour shows you the most important buildings on both banks of the Danube passing through Budapest. You will pass under Liberty bridge as well as Chain Bridge and continue till Margret Island.
Boat trip. Another must if you visit the city. Ours was included in the bus tour. They even do a night cruise which must be awesome.
Stroll along the banks. And enjoy a wonderful view, with fresh air and the feeling of connection with the flowing river. On either side, Budapest or Pest, it is really nice to see.

Night on the Danubius!!!!!!!!! not to be missed. No words to describe the elation while on a cruise!!! ' The legend' was super, it was at 8.15 pm and lasted one hour, the illumination on either side was awesome, credit for planning the illumination so beautifully that it brought every aspect of the building.
A visit to Budapest is not complete wihtout a "Night Cruise on the Danubius"

The trip is a must. the best way to see both sides of this unique city I was really impressed from the river how the City is very much looking towards its majestic watery divide spend an hour or so on a voyage down river to really get a feel for this magical city

The Night Cruise on the Danube was Fantastic. To see all the beauty of the Danube you must take the night cruise ,
The river was just stunning in night due to the light on the building around .
The price of the cruise is about 10 euro and its worth the money .
A must attraction in Budapest !!

Oh, Danube.... THE KING OF RIVERS!!!
There are many types of cruises on Mahart website. Any of them will bring unforgettable experience.
Gotta take a cruise. We went on the Lenoard cruise ship from pier 7 for a two hour trip. The boat was clean, the staff were great, the views magnificent and a glass of prosecco was included

the river keeps on flowing. Songs have been written about it, River cruises abound, and short jots on the river, are always pleasurable. It really isn't blue, but if the light hits it just right way during the day, it may look blue. It is also the means of transportation of goods throughout its 1,777 miles (2,860 km). It is a real working waterway, as you see, long ships with their entire family including a playground on the back of the ship with two automobiles and a house.

Very beautiful. First time really spending time near the Danube. Beautiful, lovely views and of course therefore beautiful bridges. I also took great easier in updating my FB status with, "just taking a stroll down the Danube before dinner". It's an awesome place.
Cruise. Do take the cruise at night when the lights are on. You will forever cherish the experience. The Castle, the Parliament, the University.....each one a gem..

Not so blue anymore but worth it. I had seen the Danube in Bratislava (Slovakia) and in Vienna (Austria) so I knew the river wasn't the same as in the stories we heard as kids but then again, take a boat ride along the river and you won't regret it. So many beautiful views!
Nice Cruise, Nothing Special. We took a one hour cruise with Legenda on the Danube. It was fine but nothing special. The last half hour is spent getting to and from Margaret Island.

Danube River. If you intend to travel on the boat for viewing, do it at sunset (they dont open at dawn) and the views breathtaking. Go with the boat with an open top. Dont bother about the dinner cruise cos you wont have time to dine and watch the view to take photos. Do one or the other.

A Little Disappointed. We arrived in Budapest maybe a week after the Danube had flooded, as such the water was still cloudy and dirty.....just pictured the Danube differently....BUT just strolling down the river walk area....having breakfast overlooking the Danube and a couple beers later in day made up for it all!

An experience not to be missed!. We went on an hour long river cruise to Margaret? Island and back which provides a different view of sites on both riverbanks. Great for orientation too. The river might have been "blue" once but history and river use has made it more greeny in colour.

Busy river. We took a boat trip many different kinds of boats on the river,
so many ways you can travel the Danube

Sells out quickly so get your tickets upon arrival. We visited Budapest with a river cruise company. We elected to do the night cruise on our own time, and were very happy we did so. We bought the tickets for the 9:30 cruise at our hotel (I believe the last cruise) as all other times were sold out. We were glad we had the later cruise.It was packed. We were lucky to be on fairly early in the line, so got great seats up top. There is a screen giving information, but it doesn't always seemed synced with what we are viewing. yes, the Parliament building is GORGEOUS all lit up, but our favorites were the bridges. Wear a jacket, as it gets cool. A soft drink, beer or coffee is served gratis while cruising. Great way to see Buda and Pest at night.

A Night Ride is a must!. Everything looked so beautiful at night! We took a night boat ride and it was wonderful. I loved the Parliament building the best. The building was under repairs, so we could not get close to it during the day.Make sure when you take a ride to sit where you can hear the history of the places you are seeing. This might help you make note of the places you want to visit while there.

Most beautiful!!. The most incredible site to be on a ship near the parliament building at night time. The lights across the bridge and the castle were breath taking. If you are not cruising, you still need to take an evening dinner cruise to appreciate the beauty.

The Danube River. We took the boat along the Danube river to St.Catherine Island. It shows a great view of the city. The Danube separates the city in two parts. Buda and Pest are an awesome city that I enjoyed visiting.

A beautiful view from both sides.... It is most definitely worth visiting both sides if you are in town. One of the best spots is near the Parliament building. From across the river, the Parliment looks amazing, and during the summer on many weekends the building is lit in the countries colors (Red, white, green). Also worth walking over the bridge to the "Pest" side and look at the Budai castle and other landmark buildings as they sit high up and overlook the river. Don't forget to bring a camera!

Prettiest river in Europe. Beautiful! Divides the city in half. Great view at night. Restaurant cruises, river cruises and the chain bridge make the river beautiful. Also the parliament looks absolutely beautiful and the river.
Fireworks. We spent our first night in Budapest on their National Holiday. We witnessed the best fireworks display ever over the Danube at the entrance to the Chain Bridge. Unbelievable!!

Flooding on the Danube. The DAnube had flooded just before we arrived and we were amazed at the city and fast it recovered. They were working night and day to cleanup the river front. What city pride!

A nice view of the city... but really cold, even in summer.... Take a cruise in the Danube… quite a view….
Tip: buy a “hop on hop off” ticket, and take a cruise in the Danube… quite a view. If you were not used to cold weather, you’d better take a cold...
loved it. Traveling down the Danube River was wonderful. I loved how old and new mixed so well in the architecture and the Culture of the People. This is definitely one City everyone should see.
River. The Danube is a typical river flowing through a major city. Muddy looking, with passenger boats taking people on sight seeing trips.
The Blue Danube. Dont miss a trip by the boat in the Danube. It is very beautiful and wide. You can book a trip from any tours office.
trip on the Danube. I've take a riverboat/bus to see the Danube and the buildings. Look very good which one you need because some of them are going 7 km outside Budapest.
Loved it. I loved the river, but I am in love with water, so it could just be me. Did not take an expensive cruise, just walked down the river side at down. Charming
Afternoon cruise on Danube. I bought a cruise on Danube and it cost only 8 euro. Budapest is so beautiful by night! The building along the river side are lighted and the view is so enchated!
ships. mmm very nice place to have a walk or take a ship for a walk to margaret's island...its better in the night so youcan a have a nice view up to the castles

Breathing taking with history!. The best way to see the Danube is by renting a push bike. Great bike path along the river! It was easy to stop anytime to take photos and take in the sites at your own pace.

The rive Danube. Trip advisor asked me what I thought of the river Danube, so I have to say it has fast flowing water and between Buda and Pest it has lots of boats! so be careful don't step on to many boats because they will probably charge you

Cruise on the Danube - a must when in Budapest!. Good views of Parliament, Castle Hill buildings, Freedom, the bridges, Gellert etc.
Opt for an hour long cruise rather than a ninety minute cruise!

Legends Riverboat evening cruise. Our Kempiski hotel concierge recommended this cruise. We wish we would have purchased the tickets for the evening cruise online because our first choice Saturday evening cruise time was sold out. The next cruise, 45 min later was available. Along with many riverboat companies, this dock (#7) was located in front of Marriott. We did not get coveted outdoor seats but noticed many people coming indoors toward the end of the 1hr tour, the river is quite chilly at night, wear a sweater. The narration and accompanying video were well produced, informative and was well timed with what we could see out of the floor to ceiling windows. Both sides of the boat seemed to get great views with historical facts. We enjoyed this evening cruise and the choice of wine, champagne or water as a final activity to our weekend in Budapest.
8 day river cruise from Passau. The Danube is great. Budapest by Daube is a great way to travel. We saw the fireworks for the Budapest freedom day. Best fireworks I have seen to date.

Viking Legend. Just been on a trip with Viking Budapest to Passu, wonderful what a super way to travel, food super, staff excellent, Viking could not have done anymore a wonderful time, all tours were super, and the command of English by the guides, makes some English speakers needing lessons, they were all super.Could not fault it at all.
wide with beautiful bridges. The Danube in Budapest is wide and green and there are more beautiful bridges over it. My favorite is the Chain bridge.
fireworks. Amazing lights along the river buildings and bridges and August 20th fireworks for St Stephens day., a must if you are in Budapest that time of year.

Seeing the city from the water at night is magical. We took a dinner cruise from the north, down and back. Buildings and bridges were lit up, making the beautiful city of Budapest look even more spectacular. There is a lot of boat traffic day and night, and just watching the river is enjoyable day or night. If you have a choice, go for the night cruise over the day cruise.

Cycling danube vienna-Slovakia-budapest with saddle skedaddle. My husband and I have just got back from our first cycling holiday 9 days in August. Cycling vienna to budapest along the danube! We arrived at our first hotel The Austria Trend Donauzentrum in wien at about 10pm Europe was having a heat wave and it was incredibly hot this hotel had no air conditioning but did supply a fan thank goodness. We had all the information, maps, hotel vouchers etc waiting for us at this hotel. The following morning was the welcome meeting and bike pickup the guy was very helpful and made sure all bikes were ok for everyone arriving so late we had no time to look at the maps so had no idea really where we were going but off we went. It was hot hot hot! But off we set for our next destination the Hotel Marc Aurel in petronell-carnuntum we kept going wrong the maps were not clear but it was lovely along the river eventually after doing an extra 10k we arrived again this hotel had no air con but found a fan on request otherwise lovely hotel. There wasn't much happening here and for me not the best overnight stop would of preferred somewhere livelier. T he next morning on to hotel park inn danube in bratislava we were getting the hang of how the maps pieced together now and found today's cycling much easier the hotel was wonderful it had air con and bratislava was really worth the visit and needed longer there. Next morning on to hotel lajta park in mosonmagyarovar hungary again wonderful hotel lovely place to look around and would of liked longer there. Next day onto hotel klastrom in gyor for a two night stay loved it here.next day onto the hotel gottwald in tata probably the best hotel we stayed in it was a bit out of town and after a days cycling in 39degree heat (that temperature taken in the shade) we did not feel like getting back on our bikes to explore the tow this was my least favourite days cycling it was all on the road! However that night there was a special function within the hotel gardens we were offered places and had a great evening so well organised we were sat with bikers that by chance we had met only the night before at the previous hotel. The next day disaster struck we had such a good night the previous night we didn't go to bed until 2.30am and so was late getting up and late getting out luggage down for the 9.00am pickup for transfer to next hotel and everyone else's cases had gone! After a minutes panic I called the number we had been given in case of problems. The man from saddle skedaddle said he would come back and get them and by the time we got to the next hotel Bellevue konferencia e's wellness hotel in esztergom the cases were waiting again lovely hotel to get to it we had cut through vineyards at top of hills beautiful countryside but finished up on the road. Our final days cycling to the hotel gellert in budapest this was the furthest distance at 80k but also the easiest the weather cooled a bit with a thunderstorm and rain for a short time making the temperature much more bare able the hotel was grand but old fashioned not particularly my taste but the service was excellent. Budapest again definitely not enough time for such a magnificent city. I would thoroughly recommend a cycling holiday with saddle skedaddle we are considering another we have learnt a heat wave is not a good time because it makes easy distances seem ridiculously long and prevented us from exploring the area en route just the places we stayed. We have also learnt to book an extra night at the key places for us that would be Budapest tata gyor bratislava and possibly esztergom seen some lovely places stayed in great hotels most had pools or spas and the company really made sure it went well. Anyone planning this kind of holiday for first time might see if they could get a preview of the maps.

Dream come true. Danube is gorgeous. It's beautiful from buda and pest. You can see that the city is mixed together by danube. The busy pest and cultural buda looks so great because of danube. At night the view is awesome & romantic. You can have diner in restaurant boat, there are many of them in danube. Great place, definitely want to come back here one day

Nice views. Did this trip last night, it's not that expensive and the city looks very nice all lit up, however the boat seems to cattle herd people on and despite advertising commentary I couldn't hear a word of it. If I had seen a member of staff at the end I would have asked for some money back. Beware also of the abundance of moths and other night time flys.
You won't miss much. You won't miss much if you do not take the cruise up and down the river. But If you have the time and the extra money go for it.
Great river trips. We enjoyed a trip up and down an interesting part of the river with wonderful views of the Parliament building; the castle area etc! Recommend it

Very beautiful but alot of mosquitos. Very beautiful but alot of mosquitos. Dinner on the boats seems like a good idea, but try to get a table in the middle, since there are alot of mosquitos along the river.

Boat it.. Take the boat on the Danube, its a fun way to experience the city. The river is actually wider than I thought it would be. Nice views on the river , you can see all the glorious buildings. Wish I had taken the boat trip at night though as I heard its very beautiful with all the lights either side of the bank. Its a fun experience during the day and nice photos to be had also. Glad I went.

Beware VIking River and Budapest airport. We were actually in the Viking Vienna but this ship is no longer listed (?getting decommissioned?). We had a very nice cruse until we were taken to the airport in Budapest. The Viking agents at the airport seemed singularly interested in getting us through security, perhaps ad they were then done with us.They had no clue about the VAT office. They told us that we simply needed to go to the office with our receipt and our boarding passes. After we checked in we went to the office, but they needed to see the actually stuff we had purchased which had been checked. We also were not told and they had no idea that there was an 8 Kg weight limit on items brought into the cabin. Thus we had to check our carry ons. Everyone we noticed was in the same "boat" and all were furiously opening cases and removing jewelry and other valuables to take on board with them. Many needed to get a satchel to put the valuables in.KInd of a sour note to the end of a great trip.

Take the boat. The boat trip on Danube was very nice and it took around 40-50 minutes. If you go to Budapest, I'd recommend taking it. The view is very nice: on one side you have the imposing buildings of Pest, such as the Parliament and on the other side you have the Gellert and Taban hills, along with the citadel of Buda.

boat tour. We took a boat tour on the Danube, and if you ask me this is a must for every tourist. There are so many things that you can only see form the water like an amazing voiew of the parliament building...
"Blue" Danube. Stunning views and nice boat trip. Great building of Parliament. But the river is not blue as it is usually called

between pest and buda. The Danube separates the Pest and Buda side of Budapest. I prefer the Buda side, we also found a wonderful hotel here, because it is safe, full of nice old buildings and it is much-much cheaper, however you quickly get to anywhere.

Nice view of the city from the boat. The view is great on the both sides of the river, you see the hills of Buda and the city of Pest with the Parliament. We got a boat with no upper floor, so the experience could have been better from that point of view.

Viking River Cruise on the Danube. My daughter and I went on a Viking River Cruise from Nuremburg to Budapest in JulyIt was truly a wonderful experience. Lovely scenery. Good accommodation ,helpful staff and masses of excellent food.Very well organised trips and excursions.Very comfortable accommodation with our own little balcony we could sit on .Very friendly travelling companions. The weather was very good with only one little shower of rain. Drinks were free at lunch and dinner.Plenty of choice on the menu. Tea and coffee stations provided and you could top up if you were hungery with cookies. Truly a lovely holiday which we will repeat some time on another river

Relaxing tour along the river. Lovely way to see the Architecture along the river is a tour cruise (is included in the hop on hop off ticket), commentary lacks detail so if you really want to know what you are looking at do your research before you go.

Phews Cruise. Sailing down the river which separates the gorgeous Buda from the vibrant Pest is an absolute must.The views of the bridges, the promenades, the Castle District, the churches, monuments, river boats and of course the magnificent Parliament buildings will have you gasping "Phew, look at that" every other minute. And, do disembark at the gorgeous Margaret Island, its flowers, fountains, parks and cafe's will not disappoint.

Most beautiful at night. You really can't help but seeing the Danube while in Budapest. It is most beautiful at night because of all the historic buildings lit up on its banks. It's worth doing a river cruise to see everything along the river including the many bridges and Margaret Island.

Beautiful. I live by the Rhine and the Danube is every bit as beautiful. Brilliant bridges. Cross them all!Lots of history.Visit the Island in the centre.Do the free Blue Boat cruise (comes with Red Hop On Hop Off buses.
Lovely Budapest at Night. The vessel was in great shape. The buffet was excellent as was the wine. The night/dinner cruise is well worth the time and effort.
danube cruise and meal at night. see it...on a cruise..at night...so beautiful :) we had a meal and wine and spent 2 and a half hrs on the danube seeing the sights of Budapest all lit up
nice and relaxing. did an hours cruise as part of the hop on hop off bus tour - well worth it. very informative and we were able to see things you cannot see from just walking around

You must float down the Danube!. All I need to say is Danube. Why wouldn't you take a river tour on the Danube? One of the most popular rivers in the world! There's interesting fun facts you learn about the Danube on a river tour.

Boat Trip on the Danube. typical boat trip on a river through a City! best to do this at night when the attractions are all lit up; all of the ticket sellers will offer you a discount without you even asking !
Just take a walk. You won't avoid the Danube if you are in Budapest. Many attractions, bridges, and restaurants and a perfect way to navigate the city. Where are you? Where is the Danube?
Good value river cruise. We took a trip on the Danube. We did an hour's trip. Good commentary and bar on board as well. We enjoyed it v much

A one hour tour with a little boat. Price 7 Euro. During the daytime sightseeing cruise I was guided between the two parts of the city : "Buda" and "Pest" They told us in English and German many stories about the sights along the river. This tour include the Margaret Island, where you have the possibility to get off the ship and go for a walk and discover the island. After the stop on the island you can take the next boat back to the center. If you don’t wish to visit the island just stay on board. After a 5 minutes stop the ship continues its way towards the center. It was really nice!

Danube Bend Cruise. Had an interesting cruise to Sentendre and back. The artistic village was fun and had indeed a lot of interesting shops and showrooms and interesting buildings. And of course lots of eating places - perhaps more than the eaters even!

Must do night cruise. Although the Danube isn't as blue as the famous song "blauen Donau" might make you to believe, the sides of the river through Budapest are build up with fabulous majestic buildings. Even if you walk the river sides and cruise the Danube during the day, do not pass by the opportunity to enjoy a night time cruise on the river. The buildings are lit up and their golden shine reflects in the water. Absolute best time is starting after sunset when the sky is multicolored and ending in dark. The night cruises take about one hour. There are plenty of options to choose from and you will be given ample chances to investigate those options as representatives of each company will approach you whenever you get close to the Danube. We found Dunayacht to be the cheapest and best value. If you use the daytime Dunayacht to visit Margaret Island, you should know that only every second boat, that is every two hours, the boat will dock on the island. So if you stop, you only have a boat back two hours later. The Dunayacht sells snacks and drinks on board, but is not a party boat, so it is nice and quiet.

Blue when you are in love. Last day of our river cruise. It's been fabulous. The river is so beautiful whatever the colour and lots of variety. I would like to do it again perhaps a different stretch. Highly recommended
Beautiful river through a gorgeous town!. The river cruises start from as low as 1000 Forints and are very worth it. The river, bridges and the town are gorgeous!
Amazing. Must see the city from the river by a lot of boats where you can join on with just a little bit of forints!
River cruised around the island. We took an hour out of our day to take a short cruise on the river. It was peaceful and offered a different view of both sides of the river.

One of the most beautiful rivers. It truly is one of the greatest rivers in the world, and the architecture and flavour of Budapest only solidifies this statement. It makes for some scenic walks, as well as a stunning backdrop to any photo. Take the time to fully appreciate the beauty of this world-class river.

You must go at night when its dark. one of the most beuatiful sites I have ever seen.. Dont go to early in Summer on the boat.You must see it with the lights on.Better than Prague at night!
Danube Bend day trip we enjoy because you came back by boat and it is also an very relaxing trip in Summer.You can also go to Szentendre by train in Summer and come back by boat at 15:00

Danube Trip. We had a lovely boat trip which I feel is a must whether it is the day one or at night with all the light on.
Regards Gary Saunders

Amazing Bridges. We were in Budapest for a week and spent many evenings walking the bank of the Danube and criss crossing over the 4 main bridges. The city is built up around the Danube and (nearly) all the main attractions can be seen from it. Tram no 2 goes up the Pest side of the river and is a cheaper alternative to an official tour as you will see many of the sights and the ticket price was approx. £1.20 We also took a 10pm boat cruise on our first night - saw all the major attractions and got a brief history about each attraction while listening to headset. The weather was great as it was after sunset so it was cool enough to sit and enjoy the cruise.

Don't miss. I LOVED the Danube cruise. Since I only had one day to tour Budapest, taking the cruise was the best thing I have done. I saw all the major attractions overlooking the Danube and I got a brief history about each attraction while listening to headset. The weather was great as it was before sunset so it was cool enough to sit and enjoy the cruise.
Boat tour. We took a scenic boat tour of Budapest, and saw many highlights, as well as learned much about the city's history.
View from Buda Hill. Beautiful river - great view from Buda Hill and is majestic in the sunshine. Fishermans Bastion is a good vantage point

Take the nearly free ferry. My highlight of Budapest was the nearly free ferry ride on the Danube. Simply buy a day-pass from any subway station, and it includes unlimited rides on the ferry.While not first-class service, the upper deck is shaded, and with the right weather, it was simply great to zig-zag between Buda side and Pest side. Best value in town.

BKV Danube River Ferry Service. BKV web sites says you can get to the Pricnse Elizetbeth dock via Metro 2 or 3. The only way to reach it by Metro is M2.After 19 tourists waited patiently for the ferry it came and then everyone was told their weekly/monthly/daily passes were no good and they needed to purchase a ticket. The conductor only spoke Hungarian and merely waved toward an unknown spot in the distance as to where to get tickets. Frankly, the Danube is rather muddy and just did not seem worth the effort.

A breathtaking cruise. There are many ways to enjoy a cruise on the Danube.We booked a trip which included 2 days of sightseeing Hop on hop off tours give you 2 days unlimited travel by bus and boat the boat trips can be taken hourly and include 2 evening trips one at 7pm and one at 10pm.The Danube by night is breathtaking.The 2 day trip cost just £16 per person.Incredible value

Beautiful, but definitely not blue!. As I hummed Strauss' "Blue Danube" on riding to town from the airport, I learned from the driver that on its best days the Danube is green. During our stay, however, it was brown, no doubt due to the recent record-breaking floods. As the second longest river in Europe, the Danube is a busy waterway with barges from many lands competing with passenger ships for priority in berthing and transiting the locks. We could sit for hours watching the river traffic. And so we did on our cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam. The Danube separates Buda from Pest and is crossed by several bridges, which also provide wonderful views of the river and the city.

What fun cruising on Danube.... We took an afternoon one hour cruise on river Danube. Lovely experience. The boat leaves you on a isllana, if you want to, and picks you back in its next trip after an hour. One sees the Buda and Pest part of Budapest. Different historical building on both sides. Overall total fun.

It's better by boat!. The Danube is the umbilical cord of Budapest. It separates but joins the two cities. Spanned by four major bridges in the center it can be enjoyed by looking down, on the water or beside the water on one of the many promenades.At night the Parliament buildings are reflected in the waters of the Danube and provide stunning photographs. There are many operators selling river tours and dinner cruises. You have to work out which is the best value for money as they are not cheap.There is a public water transport service which will take you up and down the Danube and we used this service with a 72 hour transport pass.A walk along on of the many promenades in the day or night is rewarding or just sitting on a garden seat under a shady tree and watching the river rolling on. Relaxing!
Walk over the bridges. Take the time to walk over one bridge, walk down to the next bridge and walk back. Excellent way to experience the area.
The 500 year flood. The Danube was closed to all commercial traffic. The Budapest trolley system was partially closed because tracks were under water. This was called the 500 year flood.
Sunset sailing is recommended. See the serounding with the lights is very nice : chain bridge, parliament, castle hill. Make sure to have upper and lower deck.
Great. Great sigtseeing clean, No trace of the flood.Stay away of the people trying to sell you bus or boat trips.

The essence of Budapest. If there is one thing to do in Budapest its the river, Danube, the bridges, the Buda side with its hills and the flatness of Pest.Or maybe you dont "do" it at all. Just wander arond the city and eventually you will cime to the river, the bridges and the sights, and you most likely will stop for a moment to look at them.

Beautiful Blue Danube..... We took a boat trip...there are many to choose from and I imagine they are mostly the same. The Danube is absolutely gorgeous and the views of the surrounding city are wonderful. We went during the day, due to some time constraints, and it was great but if I had it to do over I think I'd go at night because I think the lights of Budapest at night, especially from the river, are the loveliest I've seen.....spectacular!

Take the BKK boat.... The BKK (Budapest public transit authority) recently launched a ferry service along the Danube from one end of the city to the other. It offers a great (and inexpensive) way to take in the amazing views from the water, and the bar on board is a nice touch.

In the evening you have to watch it at 22.00 in the summer. With 2 drinks we booked a boat trip on the cool Danube, we liked the lights on Buda hills and all buildings (castle, parliament) and bridges were amazing. Secret for lovers: very romantic, go on this ship! Also modern buildings have now their lights, loved it!

Wonderful river...day or night. We did a cruise on the Danube during the day which was very interesting,but at night it's spectacular !
You can really see how great a city Budapest is from cruising along the Danube.
In particular the Parliament House is spectacular !
It only takes an hour and is well worth the time.
a beautiful place to visit. Loved running te streets of this city - especially along the river - the views are spectacular and well worth the visit.

Whatever you do, cruise the river!. We waited until our last day to take a river cruise down the Danube and really wish we did it sooner! It was amazing to cruise down the one thing that separates Buda from Pest, and the sights you see are amazing. Also to see all of the bridges up close is great, as that is one of the most interesting stories Budapest has to tell (they were all built at different times and for different reason, and look vastly different!).Most river cruises include a documentary and glass of alcohol and it works out very cheap to see a lot of the sights around Budapest. My favourite was the parliament buildings.
