It's not blue!. I did not realize it is such a busy river. So much going on & the beautiful scenery one passes along the way. The sail at night is not to be missed with the buildings, castles & statues all lit up. About 8 or 9 bridges in Budapest alone.

Boat tour. We did a late evening boat tour as part of a package deal. A great experience with great views of the city and its main buildings. The commentary in English was very good- I wish I had taken a night tour- would have loved to have seen the lights of the city from the river
Do a River Cruise - it's worth it. Most of Budapest's treasured monuments can be found along the Danube, so you'd be a fool to go there and not cruise along the Danube.

Not "blue", more brown. I think the recent rains and expected large city pollution have made the "blue" Danube rather brown. There were lots of logs, water bottles, and general clumps of junk in the water. The current was rather swift as well. The variety of bridges crossing the Danube were more impressive than the river itself.
Great view. The view is outstanding, a place one could not miss in Budapest.The best way to see it is by boat, and it is not blue!!

A great river. The Danube flows through Budapest with all the majesty of a river that features as the title of songs and music and probably stories as well.We arrived shortly after the flood level had peaked (June 2013), and we checked on the river daily and watched the fast swirling waters slowly recede back to almost normal levels. Of course, the floods forced all the traffic off the river, until our last day, when we were able, on a balmy June evening, to take an evening river cruise and enjoy the sights of the city from a different perspective - and with all the city lights ablaze.

Try the Danube Cruise. In order to enjoy the Danube, you really need to do a curise. We personally started our trip in the Danube from Esztergom until Budapest, it is long trip but an exceptional one. So relaxing, you can also see many monuments on the sides of the Danube while the ship is Sailing. Also consider walking along the Danube, Hungary does have a unique nature. We have been there in Summer 2009

Wonderful atmosphere.. The famous Danube River, this waterway gives something magical and poetic to this city, unique in all its glow.It has a good view from many points of the city, a panoramic view from the castle on the hill, or a walk along the river It's a must to do, or through one of the many bridges that connect the Buda side with that of Pest.In any case, from any location is admired this river with a touch of poetry to the city.I highly suggest to give a look during the night with its stunning fairytale atmosphere.

Certainly the great atraction is the river itself. What you can tell about the Danube? Not only is nice but magical.- There are a lot of companies that offers cruises by the river from a few hours to day long ones.- To see the city from the river gives you another and very interesting perspective.-

Not up to par! (Day Cruise without meal). The cruise is 1 hour long. The recorded audio guide keeps on blabbering about the history and the tourist attractions on the loudspeaker and no one on the cruise even bothers to listen. Its very monotonously said. If you are going on the premise of learning something, don't be too sure of it. I would say that the experience of being on the Danube and the views are two things to really look forward to on this cruise tour. Place of drop-off: Park, or if you want you could take the roundabout back to your destination of departure. Its up to you, but you should try out the park because they offer these really nice buggies which offer a way to see everything and its quite fun - especially for teens who want to take the wheel!

Wide river. The river is nice and very wide at Budapest (as compared to Vienna & Prague). It flows very fast through Vienna and the water is slightly mucky with silt and sand. We have seen a lot of people fishing and one can catch very big fish here as well.. It is a pleasure walking/jogging along the Danube anyday :)
River walk. Walking along the river nice and relaxing. Took at trip down the river. Sitting by the river in the evening and looking at the lights is peaceful

Must do while in Budapest. Our tour group had one of the many dinner cruises booked on the Danube. Everybody agreed that this evening tour was the best they had ever done in the world. We also had a local guide explaining everything to us.All the buildings are lit up in the evening for unlimited photo opportunities. If you only do one thing in Budapest, this is it. The photos look spectacular but still do not do them justice.

The great Danube. This river is always beautiful doesnt matter from whivh seven countries it is seen. The Danube seperates Pest from Buda. It is such a part of Budapest, its like the city own the river. It was very nice taking a cruise on the boat. It is incruded if you buy a hop on hop off ticket which I higly recommend. With the cruise you also learn alot about certain building. And you see the Parliment building very beautifully from the water which makes lovely photos.
Boat trip. The boat trip on Legenda was excellent, very good commentary on headphones. There was the bonus of a couple of drinks, superb views of Budapest.

Boat trip. Had a trip down the Danube with a guide who pointed out the interesting sites also had a meal on the boat which was very good.We also had a sing on the boat who song a lot of the old British songs where we all joined in with the singing

best at night. We did a river cruise at night time and just as all the building were beginning to light up it was a beautiful sight and we found the cruise very interesting . we went with the cheapest cruise on the river and we were not disappointed. A NOTHER MUST DO!

Legendary Danube. After the flood colour was not so blue. Mosquitos(in Margaret Island) and driftwood reminded how bad situation was still few days before our trip(20.-23.6.). But still, this must be one of the most beautiful river in the world, absolutely amazing views and buildings both Buda and Pest side. Best seen from the riverboat. There are lots of different options in day and night time.

Ground tour. Unfortunately, I was told about it after my departure, but there's a very nice public transport "tour" you can take to have a thorough look of the river, while involving a few of the historic trams.

Flood. Normally the Danube is a regulated river which shares Budapest to side: Buda and Pest. But this year there was a big flood and I was impressed how the residents and tourists of Budapest help to try controlling it as one man. Other times the colours of the Duna (Danube) is the most beautiful in the morning hours (around 8) in case of sunny weather when you can see the buildings of Danube side are mirrored by it. Nevertheless the sunset is also beautiful when the sun tones the sky and the Danube to incredible colours. It is the most spectacular from the Pest side of Budapest.

Wonderful cruises. We did two cruises along the Danube in Budapest - one in the daytime and one at night. We enjoyed both, as it gave us a unique perspective of the city and its buildings, and we enjoyed the informative commentary on the day cruise. However, the Danube dinner cruise was absolutely outstanding! Not to be missed! We went on a boat with glass sides and roof and were able to enjoy a meal while looking at the spectacular lights of Budapest. The buildings were lit up as well as some bridges. A truly unforgettable experience. One can reserve through one's hotel, or simply at the boat.

Going Down ...... when we visited the Danube was just receding from the worst flood in living memory ........ it was certainly impressive and not the 'Blue Danube' but the 'Brown Danube' ......we tried to walk into Margaret Island via the bridge entry but police had still closed the island after it's evacuation due to the high level that the river was at ........ still, it was a very enjoyable visit ..... along the Pest side of the river there is a lot of riverside upgrading works and access was a bit difficult.

Exciting (and still safe) when nealy flooded. Always a fine sight in Budapest, the river raged higher and higher during our stay (so that our dinner cruise and then on-boat dinner were cancelled). Fun to observe the flotsam while walking across the Lanchid bridge.

A big bad river. We were there during the height of this summer's floods, and saw the impressive power of this great river, as well as seeing road signs, street lights and trees sticking out of the churning waters. It was grand and impressive.

See it from the hills. Beautiful views from various elevated sites around the city. We took the hop on off city tour bus and this was great for viewing the river also recommend a boat cruise, lots to choose from.

Very beautiful!. it was flooded during our visit but we enjoyed seeing how the locals handled it all the college students were called to community service to help in the sand bagging even though it was exam time!

A Great Way to see "Paris of the East" Illuminations. Our cruise started at around 7 pm when it was still light. The dinner buffet was all set when we got seated. There was ample food to go around and the selections were adequate. While there was no one dish that stood out as exemplary, there was no shortage as the food keeps coming out of the kitchen. It is like any other regular buffet with champagne. Waitpersons were all very attentive, filling our water glasses as needed.After dinner, we were advised by our tour director that we could go up to the upper floor so we can have better view of what this evening cruise has to offer. She was right. This ordinary dinner cruise was enhanced and boosted by the spectacular view of The Parliament and other lighted buildings at night. It was the highlight of the evening! What a sight! This somehow balanced the exorbitant price for such an ordinary buffet.

Lots of street entertainers of an evening. It has to be seen really. There was a guy on the banks of the danube playing glasses of water - he sounded absolutely amazing!! The danube had pretty much burst its banks and there were film crews warning people of the flooding - but this didnt take away the magic!

The great Danube!. Day and night, it was fantastic to capture some images of Danube along with many interesting sites. It is where you get to know the demarcation line between "Buda" and "Pest" and you would wish to cross some of its bridges to get a glimpse of both worlds.
Definitely take a short cruise!. Get a different perspective of the city from the river, night or day. Hop on, Hop Off bus tours include an hour cruise in their fee.

free or not. You can take a walk alonf the banks, or if you want you can buy a ticket and take the boat. It's 500 HUF, and it'a available all day. You can take it for a station or two, take a walk there and then hope in the next one and so on. The last one passes at 18:00, you have to ask the personnel from the boat at what hour will they arrive in your station. That's only if you are on Margaret's island and don't want to walk so long until you arrive at the bridge. It's a very nice experience and you can take many great photos.
Danube!. Amazing to see. When I was there it was flooding, highly recommend walking along the banks. All of the bridges are remarkable as well. A worthy walk.

Spectecular even in flood. The focal point of Budapest with bridges, boats, walks, promenades and of course views from both sides. Even the flooding and occasional sandbag didnt detract from this wonderful, meandering river that is the focal point of Budapest. It did however, suspend cruising and a visit to Margaret Island. An excuse for another trip I guess!
Nice tour to take. Very relaxing - if you go on one of the hop on hop off, make sure it includes this. The one I took lasted an hour and you had the chance to spend some time on the island.

beautiful day and night. It is spectacular in the day, but even better at night. I would recommend seeing it both times. I wish it hadn't been so rainy as we would've like to had a dinner cruise but....
The romance is what you take with you. The river was about to burst its banks when we were there but its impressive. Get to see it from the castle its the best view.
One hour trip Legenda. Good orientation for the rest of the sight seeing trip. Friendly and relaced with on-board commentary on headphones

River walks. Walks on the Pest side are better because of the magnificent views of Buda on the opposite bank - especially in the evenings when the hills are well lit. Sadly, we somehow never managed to get the boat cruise along the Danube - just confusing as to where/when to catch a boat.

.... What can you say. It's breath taking for some on echo has never seeing before. It is immense. It is quite romantic at night just to sit along the side. Or you can go on one of the boat restaurants which look amazing.

lovely boat trip. we went on an evening boat cruise with dunayacht which leaves from dock 10. excellent value for money, would highly recommend. Would advise an evening trip as all the buildings and bridges are lit up, amazing views
Train trip through Switzerland & Austria. Took an hour trip on the Danube as part of the Hop on and Hop off bus. Although it was pleasant enough, nothing special
A must see. Although heavily polluted, and continously travelled by tour boats etc, this is an experience everyone should see/have.

Disappointed- DUNA PALOTA DINNER CRUISES ARE THE WORST. We went on a dinner cruise with live music booked on paid on the site: www.gotohungary.net (meeting point: Duna Palota). The dinner was so and so, the boat was horrible, old and small and the music awful. The price was extremely high (42 euro/person). It was a huge disappointment and a waste of time and money.

Beautiful. Excellent views from both banks
A river trip at night is worth every penny for the stunning lit p buildings

Danube River Cruise. Took a 1 hr cruise on the Danube which was really terrific. You had a headset and just turned to your preferred language. It was very interesting with lots of historical facts delivered in such a way that you wanted to learn more! I love Buda Pest

Duna Palota Cruise a NO NO!. We went on this cruise because adviced by our hotel.We hated everything. The food was poor quality, the boat was terrible and old, noisy, the smell of gasoline was present throughout the trip.Thankfully all lasted one and half hour, because we did not enjoy the experience at all.After dinner we were offered liquor and coffee and as eveything was inlcuded in the ticket we accepted, but we were presented with a bill afterwards. Not big money but at least make the guest aware of the additional charge.We saw other boat on the river which were very nice and well maintened, look everywhere else but Duna Palota Cruises (Millennium)*F&D*

Do not go on the free Dunayacht boat trip. With the hop on hop off bus you will get a free ride on the Dunayacht boat, it's terrible, no conditions, really old and cold! If I knew I would pay for a proper ride in a professional boat!
cruise by a hop on hop off tour. giraffe hop on hop off tour, goes from pier 11, free with bus hop on hop off 24hrs... good way too see the danube during daytime and sometimes illuminated...
Boat Ride. Best way to get a view of the banks of the Danube. Beautiful buildings lining both banks of the river including the magnificent Parliament building.
It is not blue, but beautiful. A very Busy river full of ships of all kind .A night trip on the Danube in Budapest is brilliant, don't miss it!!!!!

Trip up the Danube. Recommend the evening boat trip the lights from the buildings on either side of the bank add to the ambience of the trip and offer a different perspective to the views during the day. Round trip lasted approx an hour which was plenty of time to take in the views on both sides.

River tour with lunch. Had a great time on this one. Were were lucky to take this trip on Mayday as we had all the entertainment from the local celebrations as well as a wonderful trip up the Danube with a superb lunch to follow.

DIY River Cruise. The best way to see Budapest is with a River Cruise along the Danube. If you are on a budget use the passenger ferry for your 'Cruise'. You embark at one of the jetties with a round blue sign with a 'D' in the middle (most are on the Pest side of the river). It takes about 2 hours to go to the furthest away stop and back again and costs about £2.50 each way. The ferry has a sun deck on top as well as an inside bar if you want a drink. This is a lovely way to spend a hot afternoon as you get a breeze on the river.
Gorgeous by night. We had dinner on the cruise and the night view was beautiful & romantic, especially for couples.Gorgeous views of the Parliament Building, Castles and surrounding buildings.

Boat trip with great views. If you get time take the boat trip along the Danube and get off at Margareitta island. No cars on the island only bikes so very relaxing to walk around. A very pleasing find
nice view in evening. the ligts of the buildings and the bridges the ships and the athmosphere you don't see the garbage the chain bridge is very nice

Magnificent River. This is a truly magnificent river and the view over Budapest and the bridges is is stunning. along with the Parliement and the Palace. We enjoyed both an hour long day time and an hour long night time cruise.

Be aware. Just returned from a Viking cruise aboard the Embla. Brand new ship well appointed with excellent crew esp the entertainments manager. Be aware though that the standard cabins are to be avoided at all costs unless you enjoy an airless dark room below the the waterline. You should also be aware that the average age of the passengers is probably over 75. The bar is deserted after 10 at night! We took the Silver drinks package which was not cheap at €150 each but was well worth it, certainly the bar measures were not small! The best direction is def Nuremberg to Budapest as you finish your cruise in a beautiful city rather than the last day on an industrial canal.The food was spectacularly good and there was always a choice if you didn't fancy the main menu items. The beer is standard continental lager (cold, fizzy and fairly tasteless) but the wine with the meal was good even if they did serve the white wine at room temperature, horrid!The cruise was perhaps a little lacking in nightly entertainment and one night we were treated(!) to a lecture on the EU which put most people immediately to sleep. The Europeans were not interested and the Americans didn't understand it. The excursions were well guided but be aware again that you will see so many Churches and little else. Oh for a visit to a brewery or winery or indeed anything that was not a church or monastery.Don't bother with the organ recital, it is very loud and the choice of music awful.Vienna was the highlight without a doubt.

Wonderful :). We had a stunning view of the Danube from our hotel room at the Intercontinental - the view of the river and chain bridge is wonderful. We took a river cruise which was excellent, and well worth the price :)
Danube sunset cruise. Was wonderful... Superlative veg food, for a change! Loved the whole experience.. The music, the views, the food, the wine...

Cruise on the Danube. We did a Danube dinner cruise with gypsy music - very enjoyable. Booked via guys selling tickets near the Chain Bridge. We met the "hostess" at Duna Palota - a few minutes walk from the Chain Bridge. Well organised - all ran very smoothly.

Big and fast. the bridges and locks on the Danube are interesting and beautiful. It gets wider and wider from the Czech Republic to Budapest, and is very swift. Definitely not blue! muddy brown, but the views along the river are incomparable.
Worth a visit- not to miss!. Central point of the city. Very nice to cross over it over multiple bridges, connects the old and new parts of Buda and Pest together.

Boat trip. We took a trip on the Dunaboat which stopped at Margaret Island, which we got off for a walk and lunch. We were on rather a tight time frame as it was our last day. But there's heaps to do on the island - especially with kids. Had a very pleasant lunch sitting on the rear terrace of the Grand Hotel.
The blue Danube. A great place to see this famous river, it is a very busy place with lots of boat travel. Take the tram down the length as it a lovely relaxing way to view the river.

The Illuminations along the Danube at dusk are not to be missed. We were on a Danube River Cruise, so our evening cruise was included in our itinerary, but I would definitely recommend getting on the water at dusk with some boat trip and enjoying the incredible light show of the public buildings and bridges along both banks of the Danube. One of the highlights of our trip, and cannot imagine someone passing up this opportunity. Take it upon yourself to find a night boat ride and enjoy the beautiful Danube River and its light show.

River Boats. Most hop on , hop off bus tours give you an extra day as well as a free trip on the Danube, as we opted to walk everywhere we booked a river trip on its own with individual commentry, out boat took us upto Margaret Island and back along the river, the trip is over an hour and very interesting commentry
Nice at night. Took a boat trip on the Danube. Boats go in a figure of eight. Great views at night. All the bridges and attractions well lit.

Legenda Boat trip! Fantastic at night!. I took the Legenda Boat trip and thoroughly enjoyed it! The best way to see Budapest at night. I took loads of photos while enjoying a glass of champagne ( all inclusive). Great value for money 16 EURO per person. I wish I took the 9:00pm or 9:30 pm instead of the 10:00 pm. (There were choices of booking for music & dinner for 10:00 pm)

Not so Blue. Well you can't go to any streach of this River without going on it. We went when it was very cold but the sun was out and the boat trip was included in the price of the bus tour. you can get on and off at several landing stages so it's another way to visit an area of this beautiful City. Although it's not Blue like the legand it is very big and beautiful the guides were helpful offering blankets against the cold, there are also enclosed boats so you can always wait for one of those.

While a relaxing ride, the narration was not helpful. There are a number of boat rides from the Pest side of the city around Margaret Island, passing the awesome Parliament building and other grand monuments. However, the English narration was largely inaudible or indecipherable because of the heavy accents. Still, if you are looking for a break from walking, it is a lovely ride.

Go on a boat ride. We went on a boat ride that was included with the hop on hop off bus ticket. We went on the 7pm cruise and the sun was setting and it was just beautiful. The english guide gave a really interesting talk about all the building which line both sides of this river.

Take a River Cruise. A cruise on the River front between Buda and Pest is a must. It is relaxing and if you take one with a tour you get some good information about the history. You can enjoy beverages or nice ice cream too.

Danube evening cruise. All buildings were lit up at night and it was gorgeous to see. Cruise included beverages and lasted about 1 hour. Totally worth doing. Headsets with choice of many languages at every comfortable seat.Large windows so everyone could see the sights easily.

Enjoy a stroll!. Walking along the Danube is very peaceful and the views are incredible. There are many tours too, We did ours with Big Bus Tours and would recommend them. There was a river cruise which was included, there is also a great restaurant that we found on a boat! Just and explore. The Danube is the lifeblood of the city!
River trip on Danube. Enjoyed seeing the buildings from the river, unfortunately not enough seats on the boat so had to stand. Part of deal on the Big Bus Tour
Used public transport. Got on a number 11 ferry at the square below the fishermans bastion...spent next 2 hours on the river..cost about 1 euro

It might not be blue.... ... indeed when we visited just after heavy rains it was very brown and fast flowing. But the boat trip along it is the best possible introduction to Budapest. And walking besides it, particularly at night, unmissable.

Beautiful River. The river Danube is the main focal point of Budapest. its a vibrant place with lots of cruise boats. The river itself is massive with a strong current running through. If you get the opportunity try the boat trips to fully appreciate the beauty and scale of this river.
nice boat trips but not blue. plenty of boat trips and margarit island is definitely worth a visit-plenty of greenery and peace and quiet after the noise of the city

River with landmarks. You don't have to be too high up in Budapest to see the very best of all the famous landmarks, including the Houses of Parliament which are lit up at night. Take a river cruise plus bus cruise (all in one) which is also hop on hop off!

Boat trips. We managed two boat trips, one day trip which lasted about hour 15 and went round St Elizabeth Island and back up just under the chain bridge, excellent shots of all the main buildings with a overview of Hungarian history, although some of the translation is rather amusing at times. The night trip is also very good you don't go down around the island but turn just before but go back further up past Gellert hill then back. We got free cruise passes buy buying a 48hrs bus hop off and on tour which gave us a bonus book with free tickets in so well worth it.

Danube Cruise. Don't miss the evening Danube Cruise. It's amazing. All buildings by the river are so beautiful especially the Parliament. The cruise we chose was about 1 hour with a free drink. So romantic!!!
Beautiful!!. My friend and i had a lovely one hour cruise on the Danube. Well worth doing as there is so much history and much to see,loved it!!
River views. a great location, we took a trip of 1 1/2 hours to a nearby town, it was a great day out.the boat left in the morning and returned at 5 pm,

Great Views. We took a dinner cruise which was nice. Food was delicious! Nice to walk along at night also! There is a very touching display of shoes along the Danube, near Parliament, which belonged to Jews that were shot at the rivers edge.

The city comes to life around it!. Whether you go for a stroll by its shores, take a cruise, or grab a few beers and sit on one of the benches or stairs near it- the Danube river along with the unique bridges that cross it make for some of the best views you'll get in Budapest.

Danube cruise even better at night. We had a good look at all available cruise options and while some sounded good they did seem to be a bit overpriced. In the end we chose Duna Yachts at pier 10. No bells and whistles but super good value for the same sights as the rest. We paid 1900 HUF for unlimited rides over 24 hour period. We did the day cruise around Margaret Island then went back the same day for a night cruise. There is a bar on board and prices were cheap, wine 300-400 HUF, beer 400-600 HUF. The other cruises were charging around 4700 HUF for cruise and two drinks.
Great for Late Night Walks. I go to the Bela Bartok concert hall and walk back to my apartment along the Danube. The castle, Parliament, and Citadela are all in perfect view during the day and night.

Take a night time trip down the Danube!. We took a night time trip down the Danube on our first evening and it was beautiful. Many landmarks are along the river and they are all lit up which made the City look magical.

nice. You can take tram 2 at one end of the Danube and tram 19 on the other side, then you don't need to go on a boat trip.The Danube is beautiful everywhere and it's a focus of the city. The bridges across it are beautiful.
nice trip. went on a cruise for 1 hour it was lovely and relaxing and good info on surrounding area and buildings. you can also do a wine and dine cruise some fab boats to be seen

AN HOUR IN DUNABE VIEWING ALL BUDAPEST'S BUILDINGS. A nice experience the Cruise in Dunabe River. Because of the good weather i enjoyed taking pictures of Budapest's beautifull buildings ,especially that of Parliament which i really loved.Unusual was a new building for exhibitions that was similar to a big fish. Also you can see all bridges,the Chains or Lions, Elizabeth's,Margarita's , some of the hotels like Intercontinental and Marriot , the University of Budapest and Gellert Hill with the statue of Freedom.You can have an idea seeing my pictures.

A romantic evening. My husband and I took a Danube Dinner Ship Cruise which included live Music. It was not only romantic but truly spectacular, with the night lights and panoramic views on both sides of the River. The Parliament building viewed from the boat was breathtaking. There was a wide choice of food and drinks and the band was excellent.
Boat ride. Included in bus ticket was boat trip, fantastic views stop at Margaret Island. Should do this at night the Parliament would look spectacular.

Excellent, a must do!. We took the night cruise that was included with the price of the two day hop on off bus. The night lights along the river are a must, quite spectacular. All the buildings and monuments are lit up and the narrative provided on the boat made the trip most enjoyable.

Exceptional river cruise on the AMA Waterways AmaBella. We would highly recommend this cruise line and the AmaBella. Beautiful ship, excellent and impeccable staff. Cruise manager, Lisi, was incredible and made the cruise A++
Just came home yesterday. A memory of a lifetime. Would highly recommend.
A must do!. We took the night cruise along the Danube and saw the city in lights, then walked along the river during the day. The Danube is the heart of Budapest.

Uniworld River Danube Christmas Markets. We booked a Danube cruise on Uniworld River Cruises (River Beatrice) to tour the Christmas Markets in December of 2012. It was a wonderful experience from start to finish. Uniworld is definitely a cut above Viking, everything was included and taken care of seamlessly, from shore excursions and walking tours, to wine and beer at lunch and dinner. More about our experience can be found on Cruise Critic as well as on the Uniworld web site.The cruise starts in Passau, Germany and ends in Budapest. Cruising the Danube was a wonderful way to visit the Christmas markets in four countries in only 7 days. When we docked, we were always in the historic part of each city as the river flows right through the center of town. In Budapest, the Danube separates Buda, the hilly portion, where the Castle District is located, from Pest, where the terrain is flatter. Although the Danube River was not beautifully blue in the middle of winter reflecting the cloudy gray skies overhead, it was very scenic with great views passing through quaint villages especially in Bavaria and Austria. We saw the famous Chain Bridge of course. In both Budapest and Vienna, the gorgeous panoramic views of the city with cathedrals and buldings floodlit at night, was a sight to behold. And each Christmas Market was unique to the area featuring many hand-crafted specialties not to be found elsewhere.

Lovely romantic walk.... Great and long walk on both sides (buda & pest)... you will really enjoy it especially when the weather is good.During the night is also really beautiful as the bridges are having some great lights on them!At last, there are many boats if you want a tour or you can find some boat-restaurants as well!

12-Day River Cruise on Danube. The river is steeped in history of peoples and nations. Our travels took us from Budapest, Hungary to Passau, Germany. Every city, town and village along the river was filled with untold individual human events that help fill the history books with what only have a broad brush of knowledge of. 2-weeks is barely skims over all that

It's Not "Blue" But It's Well Worth Taking A Tour. There are many options for taking a Danube River Cruise. It's possible to book an evening dining cruise, which lets you explore the city at night from the comfort of your dining room. For those on a budget a good option is to buy a City Bus Tour Hop-On Hop-Off ticket that includes a Danube cruise with options to visit Margaret Island or the Castle Area. If you are in Budapest you must consider a short cruise.

Wide, powerful and inviting!. We had great weather and actually spent time on the Danube in daylight and at night whilst in Budapest. The river is wide, current strong and it is a natural divide betwen Buda and Pest. Lots of wood and timber floating downstream, boat life evrywhere and clearly this is a min artuary feeding and supporting cities along its bank in several countries. The views of the city from the Danube were great with Parliment building majestic on its bank.
Scenes along the Danube. Whether by foot, tram or boat every few metres is a differnt picture. Wonderful scenery especially at night.
Crusing Old World Style. We took a seven day Viking river cruise as part of this trip, starting with three days at the Budapest Hilton. A truly memorable and luxurious experience.

Amazingly fast flowing. We crossed and recrossed the Danube countless times during our visit and were surprised how fast the river flows - I imagine from snow melting elsewhere at this time of year.A tip - the public transport network,. BKK, runs a ferry service north and southbound on the river. This crisscrosses the river, taking about an hour and a half to travel from one end to the other. It makes a very cheap river cruise, as a single ticket costs only 450 HUF (£1.50), and they also accept holders of 24-hour public transport passes. Look on the tourist maps for stops, which are marked on the river banks with a modern 'bus shelter' with timetables and a 'bus stop' showing a D. Make sure you check which direction the boat is headed, as they have to berth facing up-river every time.
Wide. Had a lovely boat ride on the Danube from by the Elizabeth Bridge arounf Margaret Island. Spectacular views of the city.

River travel anyone?. The Danube is still a major artery for travel and transport. It is a very fast-flowing body of water. There are boat tours and also some tour boats and plunge into the river and float for a more exciting tour. A lot of fun.

Good way to relax and hear the history of the city. Regular boat trips of around an hour and a half take place, with multi language personal headsets, but take your coats it gets quite chilly on the water in April, complimentary drink on board. (£15) I think the prices drop in May(£3) because the numbers increase, whereas we were 2 of about twelve on this trip.
Worth looking at. Nice river but just a river. Did a short boat tour of it and it is nice to say I did it but just another river. Some nice views along it.

Good way to see the city. A good way to see the city. Lots of companies offering pretty much the same - an hour long trip on the river. The one we took (dunayacht) has bar tables and chairs scattered about rather than proper benches so it was a free for all trying to take the best photos. I saw one or two other boats with a similar set up so it seems a bit of a lottery as to what you will end up with.Try and take the boat before sunset to get the best pictures - you will get a bit of colour in the sky rather than get a blur. If you can, set your camera to compensate for flourescent light, this gave me the best colour match (but not perfect) to what I was seeing.

Take a boat ride. You must take a boat ride on the Danube and explore the cultural side of the city. The rides are inexpensive and most last for just an hour. For that you get a tour guide and you can see a lot in a short space of time.

dream and romantic trip by boat. get relaxed and do not miss it.. As part of the Hop On, Hop Off ticket, you could make this trip. It lasts one hour. You will see all the important sight seeing attractions, from a different angle, -to me- a lovely angle. With audio in English you will be able to know a lot about the city. By the way I -personally- liked the Danube river very much, may be because it looked very similar to the River NILE in my country "Egypt".

If rivers could talk. The Danube is the heart and soul of Budapest, with Pest on the flat side and Buda on the hillside. Look for the cast iron shoes at the edge of the river on the Pest side just down from the Parliament building. It is in memory of Jews of all ages who were led to the edge of the river told to remove their shoes and then shot and pushed into the river. When we visited there was a lone rose placed in a child boot. Very sad.From the river you see the city from a different aspect also , especially the parliament building

Incredible View. If you have the option to arrive in Budapest by boat please do so as your first impression of the city will be a memorable and pleasant experience. Sailing into the city at 10pm was a romantic and beautiful way to start our holiday there. The bridges, castle, and government buildings were lit up as if to honor those who have come to visit the city. If you arrive by other means, make it a priority to see the city from the water

Boat trip night and day. We used the Green route bus vouchers and travelled by boat at dusk and watched the sun go down and the lights come on over Budapest. A good way to see the Houses of Parliament. 4 days later we went to St Margaret's Island for a walk around. Some areas are run down and the Water Tower is currently being done up but if you have run out of places to visit in Budapest and the weather is nice it's a good place to spend a couple of hours. Many locals jog here.

Danube Legenda Sightseeing Cruise. This was kind of a let down. The tour was audio of course as it comes in multiple languages, but it hopped around and was hard to figure out what they were talking about. They would go from side to side of the river and not go in order. Half the time I couldn't even find what they were talking about, so I lost interest and felt that it was boring. Also they didn't have audio upstairs, so you couldn't listen and take the best pictures. You get a free drink; do not get the red wine it is absolutely disgusting. They aren't very friendly. Not a great cruise for little kids unless you want to go up on the roof without the audio. It needs to be more entertaining and there needs to be cooler facts. Like I said, boring. The ride was okay. The only plus was seeing the city lit up at night. Maybe try another company. I went 07Apr13.

Boat trip at night. Great thing to do - we had audio which was supposed to be the Danube talking to us - very good info provided. All the bridges are lit up at night as is the castle and Parliament building amongst others. Well worth an hour and a drink included too.
A must see. Historical and beautiful a bit like Edinburgh with it's magnificent buildings only downside is that its expensive.
most romantic!. Sailing in the Danube during night is the most beautiful trip you can do . The boats are all well equipped and have guided translations to all languages. It's and affair to remember

Danube River Cruise AmaWaterways. This trip was a gift for my amazing 15 year old granddaughter. We cruised from Vilshofen, Germany to Budapest on the Amadolce. The ship, food and crew were all excellent. Tours were interesting and not too difficult for a grandmother. The weather was cold, snowy and rainy but it was worth it to avoid the crowds.( March 27 to April 4). I am very happy I chose Vacations-To-Go and AmaWaterways for this trip and I would use them again.

part of the hop on hop off tours. this was an excellent extra bonus when paying for the extremely good value hop on hop off buses that are around £15 for 2 days and stop at all the important sights. the two boat trips which are given free as an extra need one of the trips after dark to see the buildings such as parliament house and chain bridge illuminated
Beautiful by day and night!. Great views of the city by night! We did the hop off hop on tour and were able to get great views of the city by night.

I see it almost eveyday and still in love with it. Walking across any of the bridges you will be amazed by this river. Everytime when I have chance to walk across the bridge, I do it and feel (again) that life is beautiful.

Beautiful!. Quite simply a beautiful river in a very beautiful city. Every view is a photo opportunity. The city is fascinating with one side of the river totally flat and the other hilly. Both sides are lovely for different reasons. Walk over the chain bridge and take the funicular railway up the hillside for stunning views of the river.

Life on the river at all times. There is always something happening on the river Danube. The large Viking cruise ships tie up alongside the docks, there are a couple of restaurant/bars - one sponsored by Johnny Walker, another by Ballantine and an ongoing stream of pleasure cruisers offering day/night/romantic dinner cruises. As we walked along the bank, we noticed a bus in the water - Riverride - a floating bus! It does a two hour tour on and off water and looks cool - we might try that next time!

Beautiful at Night. I returned to the banks of the Danube a number of times during my trip, but my best experience was walking along its banks at night. Budapest's most beautiful sights lie on either side of the river, and so make sure to cross over the bridge and experience both banks. At night, everything is lit up beautifully and you can see a number of couples taking a romantic stroll.

See Budapest from the River. We took the two hour trip with commentary which was relayed via headphones. Just pick your language and you're away. The journey was lovely and included two free drinks which came as a pleasant surprise as we weren't told of this when we booked! Poodling along on the beautiful Danube with a glass of red in hand is highly recommended! Commentary excellent and very educational telling the story of Buda and Pest. This is a definite to-do when in Budapest, in fact it should be compulsory!

Beautiful River with Exciting Site Seeing While In Budapest. Budapest is very pretty and there is not better way to see it than on the Danube river. There are many historic buildings that serve as a wonderful backdrop as you go up and down the Danube in Budapest. You can do this either by boat, there are many great boat rides some with meals others just sight seeing boats. There is also a cool option of taking Tram #2. This tram basically rides up and down one side of the Danube and you will be in awe of how pretty it is, and the price is around 2 euros to take the tram. Great option day and night.
Not blue. I'm sure there is a song about the blue Danube,well not anymore as it is now brown in colour.Went in March so not too many river cruises as a bit chilly to be sitting on the boats.
Gorgeous!. Bridges run from one side of the river(Budda) to another (Pest). Easy walk across the bridges from one part of town to another. Gorgeous views of the river and town from the boardwalk.
Boat Trip. We did afternoon and evening trips. It was a good experience. We got 2 trips for the price of one as it was March. Dress up warmly if you are not going in high summer!

Not so blue. Enjoyed with cruise on the Danube on the river ride, the bus that takes you round the city and into the river. The views of the beautiful buildings on both Buda and Pest were stunning. Water colour slightly more muddy brown than blue!

Budapest. Loved the dinner cruise, the cruise to Margaret Island, the thermal baths both on Margaret Island and stop 5 on the Green bus route. Hot open air baths in City Park plus indoor pools. Beautiful city. Just not enough time to see it all.
boat trip. trip down the Danube on pleasure boat gives wonderful sights on both sides of river you can see Buda and Pest,Parliament, the Palace and Castle ,Margarets Bridge and Island

A must-do in Budapest. If there is one thing to do in Budapest, you have to take a walk or a cruise along the river, preferably at night when the Danube comes alive. Parliament and Buda Castle look stunning and the bridges, especially the Chain Bridge look more like Tower Bridge in London.

River Cruises on the Danube. The river cruises up and down the Danube were interesting and good photo opportunities. The commentary is in English and German (I think!). Pleasant during the day but can be quite cold in the evening. Fleece blankets are provided to keep the chill wind off you. Cruises can included as part of the Hop on/Hop Off bus passes. The cruises depart from Pier 11 near to the Elizabeth Bridge.
Duty.. Duty Can't suimm. No reasons to see.Maybe Vienna is better.
day out. this was an hop on hp off bus tour that included two travel on the bus and a trip on the danube very good
Not as beautiful. The danube itself is amazing(goes all the way through europe!) but the waters are murky and grayish... much prettier in the sun i guess!
Danube River cruise. We sailed on Avalon Vista up the Danube to Nurenburg, Germany. a fantastic trip with many great stops
A great sight to see. A huge river that is a great sight to see. I would recommend taking a stroll along the Danube taking in the many bridges and sights.

The Danube at night.. While this mighty river is lovely during the day, absolutely NOTHING beats a romantic boat rides after dark.The views are absolutely STUNNING with all the buildings, hotels, castles and churches all lit in beautiful colours.Make sure to book your boat ride well in advance as they tend to get sold out quickly during the tourism season.

Impressive River in an impressive City. The banks of Danube in Budapest are a view one will not forget. The city is acutally almost ideally split by the river. There are a few island along the way and a lot of attractions can be actually seen either walking along or taking a boat trip.

Cruise. We had two cruises on the Danube included in our ticket price for the Hop On/Hop Off Tour. The first cruise was during the day, while the second was the night cruise. Both are of an hours duration and very similar parts of the Danube were visited. The night time cruise however is in an open sided boat (wrap up well) where the sights can be viewed all lit up. I would recommend getting the Budapest card if you are staying more than three days for the discounts it offers.
take a boat. I recommend to take a trip on the Danube. Some of them includes visiting Margarite's island. it is worth to go on the river because of the different perspective of the city landscape

by boat. If your going to travel the danube try and do it at night on the river boats there are a number of choices with dancing or meals or champagne. or we just sat back and listened to the recorded guide but it is a must do.

Needless to say: Must see. Since the Danube and Budapest are the same thing, you must spend at leat a little time walking both banks. E.g. cross the Chain Bridge and walk either left or right to the next bridge, cross it and walk the other side. PS: Halfway on a bridge, stop a while and look at the stream of the water, commemorating the victims of Hungarian fascists that in 1945 lined up Jews on the Budapest bridges, shot them and let the Danube carry the bodies downstream.

Fantastic views of this beautiful city from the Danube. Worth a walk up/down/across the Danube for fantastic views of the city! There are plenty of bridges so you can get views from both the Buda and the Pest side and plenty of trams running along the river.
Beautiful at night. Did a dinner cruise on the Danube and the views of the castle side and the more modern end of the city were spectacular.
Great setting. The Danube makes for a wonderful backdrop to a city break in Budapest. Stroll along the chain link bridge for a panoramic view

i love it, and i live near to river danube.. just the river is pretty dirty :-Z.. sad. remember from my childhood i used to go for a boat trip with my gradfather.. nice memories.. i would like to go with my daugher soon

Worse cruise EVER with Duna Palota. To noisy bad musicians, Window full of fog so nothing to be seen. Buffet self service doggy food.Simply don't do it, at least not with DUNA PALOTA.....Bad food, bad boat.. self service.. foggy window.. no view...

An experience. To us it seemed impossible not to have a cruise on the Danube when visting Budapest and as our Big bus Ticket included this we were thrilled.In all honesty we were a little disappointed as the boat section where we were, we were not in the restuarant section was quite crowded and the windows steamed regularly. Putting that aside the sights there are some excellent sights but these could be seen from the river banks in many instances. Would I take the city cruise again - probably not.

Nice. I went there last April, and because the weather was sunny, the river view was very nice but not amazing. It is a nice drive but not the experience of a life time, so it is worth to look at it, but do not waste too much time there.
Bloody great river. Stuff to see and do all along the banks where the river crosses the city. Beautiful bridges and wonderful views.

It's just a river. It's not blue, it's brown, and whilst rivers are nice, and the bridges are very pretty with history behind them, this is not out of the ordinary. Worth a look, but as a bypass, not as a main event of your trip.
A River. Like most city rivers it is nice to see but not amazing - especially in winter. Boat trips are expensive if you want food and drink. The summery ferry is the best bet.

waste of money. waste of money.........you can not even enjoy the ride and the view, just money money money, an hour's drive while eating, and it's over, there's no time for anything else....waste of money
take a boat trip at nights -. Budapest must be seen at night and on the Danube - stunning and you get a real sense of the city and all its attractions

Beautiful during the day & at night. one has to explore the beautiful Danube river..you can either take a stroll or go on a river cruise at night...we did both and the experience was wonderful..at night, the entire palace and parliament building shine like gold!! dont miss the Danube..
Couldn't see much of it!. When we went it was snowing quite heavily so we couldn't see much but it was nice walking over the bridges

Danube Christmas Tour, AmaWaterways. This was our first cruise along a river and it won't be our last. We started in Budapest and cruised to Nuemberg before taking a bus trip to Prague for two days. The whole purpose was to take in the Christmas markets and we got that and so much more. All of the staff on board the Amacerto were top drawer and you wanted for absolutely nothing. Meals were amazing by executive chef Gino, rooms were very modern and kept spotless by very friendly staff and everyone was open and approachable up to and including the Captain, Jan de Bruijn. There was loads of room on board even though it was winter and nobody was using the top deck. No need to sit in your room at all. The excursions at each port were very well laid out with top notch guides and the staff on board provided maps and all the information you could need if you wished to set out exploring on your own. Once in Prague we still had the attention of the the cruise manager Korana who made sure everyone got to their excursions and made their connecting flights when it was time to leave. I highly recommend this trip as Europe has so much to offer and the staff of AmaWaterways will ensure you have the time of your life.
Beautiful bridges.. We walked over quite a few of these bridges, the Chain, the Erzebet, the one to Gellart and the Magrit - no idea what is so fascinating about bridges, but they are!

Very nice for a stroll. Not much more than a river but i does give you a very nice view of the "Buda" and "Pest" side of the city. Great walkway that can take you towards most places you wish to visit.

Very nice for a stroll. Not much more than a river but i does give you a very nice view of the "Buda" and "Pest" side of the city. Great walkway that can take you towards most places you wish to visit.

Blue Danube Walzer.... In Budapest, they designed the buildings near to Danube so you can walk its bank all the way. From the Chain Bridge to Elizabeth Bridge, you can enjoy the Corso (Pest side), it's very famous. You can enjoy the views of the city, the Castle, Chain Bridge, Mathias Church, Fisherman's Bastion and more. You can sit and just look around on one of the benches or buy souvenirs.

The Danube. Me and my partner both took the avenga boat trip around the Danube at night, it was on my birthday, and the city was beautifully lit up at night....it's a defo to do if you visit the capital

Can be fun :). Well, everybody will see the Danube who visits Budapest once. It's usually a good idea to get on a boat trip, it's a lot more relaxing sightseeing with beer, but optionally you can also take a walk next to river :) The night-lights can give a quite "romantic" mood also, if you need an atmosphere like that.

Great bridges but pretty dirty river. We did a boat ride on the Danube river. The river is lined of wonderful buildings in Budapest e.g. Parliament, churches etc. But the river itself is very dirty which is a pity.
beautiful at night. went on a booze cruise as part of the retox hostel and the views are stunning with most building lit up at night. an amazing and drunken experience I will not forget...

Danube. The Danube was known in Latin as Danubius, Danuvius, Ister, in Ancient Greek as Ἴστρος (Istros). The Dacian/Thracian name was Τάναις/Donaris/Donaris (upper Danube) and Istros (lower Danube).[2] Its Thraco-Phrygian name was Matoas,[3] "the bringer of luck".[4]
romantic. You cannot visit Budapest without admiring Danube. Either you choose a boat trip or just walk by the river, the beauty is obvious and especially at night.

River. Covered a vast area. Water was very high and fast flowing. Not many cruises on the Danube at the time of visit. Many impressive bridges to cross from one side to the other together with impressive buildings.

seen from banks. the danube was much as any big river but the sights along the banks and bridges are in places breathtaking parliment building viewed from pest side chain bridge at night we were there when snow was all around on castill hill very pretty
A Must see-especially at Night. The river separates the two cities-Buda and Pest and is incredibly beautiful with all the buildings lit up. The best view is from one of the many cruise boats.

The Heart of the City. Anyone who goes to Budapest cannot but help be drawn to this beautiful and picturesque waterway.For so many thousands of years it has flowed and given beauty and life to the area. One can't stop and think of the history it has seen.Whether you cruise on it or choose to walk along it's shores the Danube is something not to be missed especially as it flows through one of the most picturesque city's in the world.Great by day or night.
Best view in Budapest. Cruising down the Danube at night is the best way to see Budapest lit up like Christmas. Parliament house, the citadel and the castle can all be seen and are stunning.
Evening River gruise. Went on a river cruise at night this is a must the sights are wonderful all the buildings and bridges are lit up

Fantastic. A Danube river cruise is a great way to see the sights of Budapest. Also, it's a wonderful way to spend the day, strolling along the banks of the Danube, crossing the bridges and taking in all the sights.
Danube River Cruise. We had a very enjoyable evening on a Danube River cruise. The lighted buildings, castles, etc. provided a beautiful backdrop to a beautiful city.
Special event. Spent New Year's Eve on a river cruise on the picturesque Danube River. A bit foggy, but it seemed as though it lifted just for us. A very special place to visit.

Another River to See. Having lived off the Themes in London and visitored family and friends who lived off the Saine in Paris we were a little disapointed that the Danube was not as lively as we thought it would be - it could of been because its winter - but we want to return and experience it in the spring or summer - the jury's out on this one.

Boat trip. A boat trip on the Danube although freezing in December was so worth it. The boat went as far as Margaret Island and back and the commentary on the boat was both in English & German, mugs of hot chocolate were delicious and a good hand warmer.

It's a very big river. Whatever you do don't tell your wife it isn't blue!Read the history and feel impressed you've actually seen the water that inspired the most famous waltz of all. Strictly will never be the same again.

The heart of the City!. Make sure you take the time to walk across all four city bridges, the different views are amazing. For a city that has had a difficult past you can certainly see that the future is bright for Budapest.

What a spectacle!. We had a night ride on a warm boat where they welcomed us with a glass of champagne! Outside it was freezing, but we were comfortably sitting while sipping from our glasses while contemplating the city (while hearing our guide's explanations we also had waltzes as a back sound), which is entirely lit by night ... Beautiful!

worth to do in a night time. Nice river cruise. If you were walking all day long it's the good possibility to have a bit rest without leaving main Budapest sights. In a night time they are very beautiful and full of lights - the Palace, the Parliament, the Chain bridge, the Danube. I'm not sure if it's something special at the day time but at night it is nice.

Amazing. Amazing sights, took a night river cruise and I was blown away. Very good value too. On our cruise for £12ca each we got admissions, 2 free drinks and a personal serenade from violinist. Different companies do cruises so check before you buy.

Danube by night. Make sure you get on a river cruise of the Danube by night. Absolutely stunning views of all the riverfront buildings of Pest and the castles & hillside of Buda. It was snowing on the night we cruised which just added to the ambience. All in all, yes.
Danube River at Night. The Danube River is beautiful at night with the buildings of Budapest lit up. Take a nightime dinner cruise while there!
Love the river cruise here!. We felt the best views of Budapest were from the river itself & the Citadel...so don't miss a River Cruise, and everyone says it's loveliest at night!
Beautiful. Definitely take a night time river cruise so you can see all the buildings and bridges lit up. It is just stunning!!

Take a river dinner cruise without breaking the bank!. This river shows all it's glory at night and it would be a sin not to go on a dinner river cruise. And at approx. £21 for a 3hr buffet cruise you really have no excuse. You will not be disappointed and will take great memories with you.
romantic get away. most beautiful place to be with your beloved.very romantic indeed.get on board one of the boats and take a ride . make sure you are warm for the chill winds.

Best part of Budapest. The river is what makes budapest so beautiful...Stroll along it on long peaceful walks or take tram 2 and do a cheap hop on hop off.... we did a wonder ful new years cruise and it will be life long memory

Fantastic Voyage. If you are old enough to remember the film of Isaac Asimov's book "Fantastic Voyage" then you'll realize just how vital, important, and essential the Danube River is to Europe. It is essentially Europe's aorta. Sailing on it, therefore, is reminiscent of the miniature spaceship coursing through the human body in FANTASTIC VOYAGE. Humor is provided by the different interpretations as to how and why Strauss called it the "blue" Danube, because if there is one color you won't find in the Danube it is blue!
Serene, majestic, beautiful. Excellent views from buda, peaceful and awesome with the snow. Definitely a must catching the T2 tram along the Danube

The Hungarian Danube. The Danube as it travels through Budapest is all I imagined it to be as a child. Having seen it empty into the Black Sea at Constanza in Romania, the Budapest Danube romantically reminds one of a bygone age of Austro-Hungarian high society.
Beautiful. Well worth a visit. A beautiful area with fantastic views of both Buda and Pest. Highly recommend standing near the Palace on the Pest side.
beautiful. The river danube is beautiful but it was very cold in december so wrap up warm.Its very large i recommend a short river cruise to get the best from it.

Dinner on the Danube.. Beautiful, grand and unspoilt. Had a wonderful dinner and cruise, just missed seeing most the trip as we were so busy with the wonderful food and stunning music going on inside.
New Years Eve. We liked to be on a cruise on the Danube River and looking at all the fireworks in new yearse eve. It was beautiful

Beautiful promenade. Beautiful promenade, clean, safe. Wherever you go there is something to see. Every bridge is piece of art. Go to MArgaret Island, see Shoes on Danube, cross all the bridges and enjoy.
Great views. What a fabulous way to see the city. We took the Hop on, Hop off tour at night.. It was beautiful. The Parliament building and bridges all looked amazing.
Great view. Whatever bridge or part of the bank you stand at, the view is great! The stream is quick and wide, compared to what I saw in Vienna.
wonderful experience. We walked along the banks of the Danube and were in awe of its powerful flow and size. We would recommend this as a must do while you are in Budapest.

Night cruise recommended. Having spent most of the day traipsing around Budapest, a night river cruise on the Danube was stunning. There are beautiful views of both sides of the city and under lights it's quite simply stunning. Highly recommend taking a sail
Cruising the Danube. Dinner Cruise on the Danube was a wonderful experience with Hungarian Dancers and of course Goulash!

worthy of experience. i liked the floating bus ride over the danube river that showcase Margaret bridge and Margaret Island and chain bridge as well as the fantastic panorama at night from Buda over the hill to Pest on the other side of Danube River
Good river. Just a nice river to cross or walk beside. I recommend the walk over the cable bridge(?)! Can be cold at this time of year though!

Need to take a cruise. In my opinion taking a cruise on Danube is something everyone should try - we took a cruise that can be bought in any tourist information. Took the one with no extra drinks or food, just cruise itself from 'hop on hop off' tour - for two tickets we paid less that 5000 HUF for 1h long cruise. It started at 5 PM so we had a beautiful view of Budapest at night. Also we got audioguides - languages that can be chosen are (as far as I remember): hungarian, british english, french, russian, german, polish, italian, chinese and japanese but those two were messed up - chinese number is 21, not 20 and japanese is 20, not 21 (or the other way but it shouldn't be a big problem).Really worth going :) there are also more expensive cruises but including lunch, dinner or even romantic cruise for 2 people with massage, dinner with music, champagne and plate of fruits - no matter if you are single, in relationship or have a family, everyone can find something for him/herself

smelly boat. The boat trip was included with the 2 day bus ticket. Was sorry we bothered as there is nothing more to see than we had already seen on the bus tour from the hill tops I couldn't wait for it to be over because the smell of diesel was overpowering, and it is everywhere so no escape.
Wonderful. The heartbeat of the city. Take a boat tour with champagne at night. Beautiful, romantic intesting and good value.
Blue?. This is a return visit. Keep your visits to Spring,Summer and Autumn. We had already visited most of the 'visits' on a previous visit. That was in the Spring.
Worth a visit. We walked across 4 of the Bridges on the Danube. As it was December it was bracing, however the views along it, looking down to the Castle, are exceptional.

The Danube River. Not as blue as the classics tell but impressive none the less. There are still a few more of the rivers of the world that I have to see and dip my toe into and now I can cross the Danube off my list. A boat ride certainly gives you a different outlook of this beautiful city and alternative photo opportunities.
Night river tour. We took the boat tour of the Danube at night and it was so romantic. All the major sites are beautifully illuminated and we could go up on deck for photos - well wrapped up!

Beautiful. We went on a river cruise on the Danube and it was fantastic and great value for money. We booked the trip when we were at Castle Hill, there were reps up there organising the tour. We chose the evening cruise and were able to watch the sun setting over the river. A meal was optional on the cruise, which most people opted for, but those not eating (hardly any) were given the top deck to themselves. There was also live hungarian music throughout the cruise. I would definately recommend a river cruise, it is ideal for couples and very romantic.

Stunning - Major attractions along the way. A lovely walk with interesting bridges, art and architecture along the way. Leave in good time to walk up and down both sides of the danube. Walk down one side and visit Parliament. Then walk down the other and climb the hill to Lady liberty for stunning panoramic views of the city. Next go to the palace and go see either or both the museums there. Worth taking the time and effort to go and do. Great for running I'm definitely bringing my trainers
Not exactly the blue Danube, but nice. A walk along the banks is nice, especially during nice (Spring) weather. The river seemed a bit murky, but it IS the Danube.
Wasn't too impressed. The river itself looked quite dirty, but the bridges did look fantastic at night. I would recommend one of river cruises.
Danube boat trip. A boat trip on the Danube is a must do, and lovely at night. Part of the hop on hop off bus tours which are not expensive.
Magic river. When you are at the banks of the Danube there is a certain feeling of being a very special place.Its a must see attraction. You wont regret it.

A river side night view that made Budapest 1 of the most beautiful European city at night. We regret that we didn't have more time to take a night cruise. It would have been much more memorable than we've seen. Yes, it's awe-inspiring and I would definitely go Budapest again for this.
Lovely river. It was lovely to walk by the river and across some of the bridges. There were nice restaurants alone the river and a great view if the parliament.
Make sure you see it.. Cannot miss. The Danube runs through the whole city,so it would be hardto miss it, but for the less than eagle-eyed, go over the Chain Bridge to be certain!

Magical sights at night. During nthe day the Danube is pretty. The historical buildings that surround it are some of the most impressive. They are well looked after and pristine outside. No big ugly modern monstrosities to ruin the views. From Pest you look up at the castle/palace and the sights high on the hill and from the Buda side you look down at the city extending back from the river.Along the banks i some areas there are river boats offering cruises. You can cross one bridge to get to Margrit Island which is in the middle of the river and take the 1 to 2 mile walk around it. There is loads to see on the island.But at night the Danube has to be the most scenic riverside I have ever seen. It's romantic and stunning..... beyond words.

The Danube at night. First I didn't want to do the trip on the Danube but then I really enjoyed it. I loved seeing all the lights, especially now at Christmas time it was simply marvellous - like in a fairy tale.

Truly a World Heritage Site. Danube Banks in Budapest are one of the UNESCO World Heritage sites...You can't even imagine the beauty it exudes unless you watch it with your own eyes. There are many sightseeing cruises offered in the city. Its really worth taking one of those and soaking in the moonlight across Danube....Truly Romantic

Light Show. An evening stroll across the Danube on one of the 4 central bridges is a must when you visit Budapest. You should go even if you have already done this during the day because of the spectacular lighting. Not only the bridges are illuminated fantastically, but also many of the historic and important sites and buildings are thus highlighted. It feels like you are walking in a postcard!
Take a boat tour at night. We took a boat tour at night. You see the buildings beautifully lit on both sides of the Danube. Worth it.

Enjoyable cruise. We enjoyed an evening cruise down the Danube as part of our Hop on Hop off bus tour package. It was lovely to take in the sights of Budapest by river. We were envious of all the river cruise boats docked and hope to return one day for a cruise!Loved watching the sunset over the Castle.

We stayed several days prior to a cruise, the river is beautiful with so many wonderful building around it. I really don't think I disliked anything. Take to the paths etc. and explore by using public transport, with no Hungarian we managed all beautifully with so much help from everyone
Evening Dinner Cruise. Liked: Enjoyed traditional Hungarian foods, desserts and wine. The scenery was nothing short of spectacular and it was a very relaxing way to spend the evening.Dislikes: None .

Boat trip on Danube. We went on the boat trip as part of the hop on hop off bus ticket. The boat trip was good but the bar staff on the boat were very rude, didn't have any coffee and only tea but no milk.
Great view. I love this river because it is really wide in comparison with other rivers. Extremelly nice view from the Gallerth Hill and all bridges.
Fantastic. The most beautiful place in Budapest. You can admire Danube for hours, especially by night, when the palace from the other side is full-lighted

Budapest's trademark. You know you are in Budapest when you see the beautiful views from either bank, Buda or Pest. Really gives the city a special character. Especially the view to the Castle Hill at night is as if you are in an old movie! Just beautiful.

Boat Trip. We had a dinner boat trip up the river and it was fantastic to see the city at night all lit up.
Also walking along the bank in the day was very good.

Beautiful scenery. We took a boat trip at Danube at night.
They wanted us to buy a dinner ticket but we bought a drink ticket, and that was the right choice. We who had a drink ticket sat outside looking at all the beatiful buildings while the eating persons sat inside the boat and missed it all.
Stunning. Enjoyed a boat trip along the fascinating and stunning river. Such a focal point of this wonderful city!

Took evening boat tour with Legend. Tour was lovely but hard to match video to sites as we passed at times. Enjoyed the champagne! Seeing the city lit up at night, especially for Christmas was wonderful! Even our young children listened to audio/video and enjoyed the tour. 1 hour was enough time to see the city at night.
Beautiful!. Take a stroll, walk the rivers edge, cross the bridge...amazing views and very romantic, even in February! It's fun to watch the ice travel down and guess the shapes.

Night ride on a boat!. If you are going for a walk near the river in winter I suggest you wear a LOT of warm clothes.
A night boat ride is a must when visiting Budapest!

Christmas time cruising not up to expectations. We took the AMAWaterways Christmas Time Cruise from Budapest to Nuremberg. Our dates included 19-27 Dec and we looked forward to seeing a different Christmas Market every day as the on-line information indicated. Well, once aboard we were informed that most Christmas markets closed on 24-Dec which actually turned out to be generous as they actually begin closing on the 23rd. And we also overlooked the fact that Central Europe in general closes down on Christmas eve so not only were the Christmas markets closed, so were all the other stores. We did enjoy the Budapest markets and the ones in Vienna, but other than that we saw no other Christmas Markets and since the 24th, you can't even buy aspirin in town because even the pharmacies are closed up tight. You can correct our oversite by taking the same cruise route in reverse from Nuremberg to Budapest the week earlier. The second reason to consider a different cruise is that we are still on the cruise right now, but we have been stuck in Passau for the last two days. The river rose a couple of days ago and we have been dockside ever since because we can't get under the bridges. I am not sure how to avoid this issue, but it does affect your holiday. The cruise line is providing bus service to the ports of call that we were scheduled to visit, but today's trip was a 2.5 hour (each way) bus ride to Nuremberg followed by walking tours in the town. We just couldn't get fired up about spending 5 hours in a bus. We are enjoying a relaxing day aboard ship, but it's not too different than being at home so we are disappointed.The positive notes are that the AmaCerto is a brand new boat and is well appointed with a courteous crew. The food is good and the cabins are small but efficient. Beds are comfortable and overall the boat is quiet and comfy.

Beautiful River. Take a walk you will enjoyed the scenery and views at Buda.Chain Bridge. You can visit Margaret Island - big parks. There is Memorial for Jewish who had been killed by Hungarian Police in Budapest in the time of World War II
Night cruise. Take a night dinner cruise on the Danube. The lights from all the buildings are beautiful. And, during the day walk across some of the bridges, all nice views and easy walks.
Great view. The Danube is great. It's nice to walk along the riverbank and also see the nice bridges across it. Great views from both Pest and Buda.
on the boat. We bought the ticket for the 48 hour hop on hop off bus tour giraffe tour (red Bus) this included a 1 hour boat trip on Danube it was very good.
Nightly magic. Very romantic with illuminated boats crossing by, the Parliament, Buda castle, Bridges - it's magic.
Evening river cruise. Great fun to see the town lit up at night and to hear about the history of Budapest. The Parliament building is particularly not o be missed.

It may not be blue, but it is beaufiful. When in Budapest, you must stroll along the Danube to enjoy the City panorama. To see Buda (the hill side), the best spot is in front of the Marriott Hotel. To see Pest, climb to the Castle District and gaze down from Fisherman's Bastion to see the Parliament.
Romantic Danube. Beautiful! Saw it both in the day and night.... Majestic view in day and romantic at night with lighted up buildings.

Not especially blue but beautiful. I love the bridges and the span of the river itself. It was very cold when we visited and I would love to revisit in the late spring but even with no leaves on the trees along the banks it was still worth a visit
Spectacular. Go at night as it is amazing all lit up. Give you a running commentary on boat. Wrap up warm as it can be very cold in evening
Just lovely.. The views over the Danube , particularly from the Castle are spectacular. Walk across the Chain Bridge for best views.
Beautiful. Visiting Budapest through the walk of the Danube it's wonderful! Take photos from the Elizabeth bridge when it's going to be dark.. Stunning!! :)

Beautiful view. Beautiful view Especially at night
and Especially in december with all the light and all the bridges
Big Bus!. Go on the Big Bus tour for 48hrs which includes a trip up the Danube. Go at night and have the mulled wine! Wrap up warm!
River cruise. Giraffe hop on hop off 1 hour night cruise gave excellent photo ops. Amazing sites in such a dense location. Romantic.
Magical. There is something mysterious about this river. It is definitely worth walking around at night or at dusk/dawn. It feels like another world!

Doin' the Danube. Took the 1 hour cruise up and down the Danube; scenary was great; wireless tourguide headsets were not reliable. Nonetheless, highly recommended jaunt. Had it been warmer (and had the option still have been available), would have done a lunch cruise.

Danube cruise a must.. A boat trip along the Danube is obligatory when visiting Budapest and we did ours as part of the hop on hop off bus service. The trip itself was fairly short but gave an alternative view of attractions and showed us other buildings we wouldn't otherwise have seen. (Mainly churches). Afterwards we walked along the riverside in the early evening when everything was lit up, a must see. Of course, the Danube itself is best viewed from above and a walk up to the castle and St. Mathias/Fisherman's Bastion area is as good a place as any to take photos.You can't visit Budapest without seeing the Danube!
Boat trip on the Danube. A very interesting trip from below the chain bridge around Margaret's Island and back. Informative. Cold but we were supplied with a blanket for upper body only!
Beautiful River. A wonderful setting to tour the city. Both sides of the river are great. But just sitting and looking out over it is memorable.

Walking beside the Danube. It was incredibly beautiful walking along the Danube - there are gorgeous historic buildings and many bridges to walk across including the famous "Chain Bridge", as well as lots to see on the river itself.
BEAUTIFUL VIEWS OF THE RIVER FROM THE CHAIN BRIDGE. chain bridge is very pretty during day and night. worth walking over the bridge and going up the Buda side for views
No boat trip. I didnt feel the need to take a boat trip, you basically see all of the river if you generally spend a couple of days just seeing attractions. Beautiful views

Blue ? Danube - Not likely.. Surely, you didn't expect the Danube to be Blue, did you? No matter, it's still charming to see the Castle above, looming over the city from what may be actually the Buda side - too confusing to keep straight, but it's all good, Buda or Pest.

Scenic Danube. What more can I say. It's a beautiful river, especially from afar. We went on a 7 day Danube cruise, and we had a great time. However, I still don't see why they call it the Blue Danube.

big bus river tour. part of the cost of the big bus tour was a river tour. There was no commentary and the staff were concentrating their efforts on the paying diners, so got a poor service. Awful elevator music played the whole time which was annoying but got some good photos.

Excellent view of Buda and Pest!. I definitely recommend taking a boat cruise on the Danube, one at night and one during the day. There is a Budapest sightseeing company that has a package with two bus tours and two boat tours (all for $30!). Taking a cruise on the river provides some breathtaking views of the parliament, Buda Castle, Fisherman’s Bastion, and other key sights.

Take a beer, go to the Deck and enjoy the sunset. I loved it, we took a boat ride on the Danube around 6 PM and the experience was amazing. Not only did we enjoy the weather, the view was just ecstatic. The King's palace, the parliament, the luxury hotels and the bridges all were an experience to us and with the Hungarian beer kicking in, it felt like heaven. This trip is a must for everyone visiting Budapest
