River Ride. Although a damp and misty day, we went on the Riverride and it was amazing. The guide was very informative about the town, the Danube and history.
Great walk on the river. Take a walk along the river at night. It really was an awesome view! You can walk from the Chain Bridge all the way to the Parliament building with ease.
Gently down the Danube. try a cruise on the Danube....very romantic!! They have dinner cruises as well....and you can walk to the Danube from the Kempinski very easily
just enjoy the walk. danube maybe the most important river of the europe,is crossing so many capitals,it is an experience to walk by the river,to feel its breeze.i liked a lot the famous brigde also.

Took an evening cruise. A wonderful way to see Budpests top sites as the illuminated buldings are spectacular at night. Its such a pleasure to leave the city traffic behind and and sit in peace and quiet to enjoy a leasurely trip.
Take a boat trip.. One hour of rest from walking hard pavements. Leisurely cruise with pleasant refreshments, excellent commentary and comfortable surroundings - and some great scenery as well.
TAKE A CRUISE. Thought who takes a boat cruise when conceirge suggested it but the 1 hour sunset trip was fantastice. Saw more of beutifu Budapest than otherwise and learned more history. Try It!!!!
Fabulous views!. The three bridges that cross the Danube are all lovely, especially the Chain Bridge which is easily walked across!

Magical at night!. The river looks particularly pretty at night when the lights reflect on the water. Would recommend an evening river cruise. Particularly good value is the one included in the 24 hour "hop on hop off tour bus" - interesting commentary and on board bar!
Cruised with Viking. Reminiscent of the Seine river with beautifully lit monuments and buildings. The "Danube Waltz" cruise did not disappoint.
Its the Danube!. It can only be given 5 as its the Danube and its banks are beautifully adorned with all the major sights of the city. (Especially pretty at night)
Night cruise on the Danube. We booked a night cruise which included cocktails and beer in the price which were ok, the views from the boat of Budapest lit up at night were spectacular.

Evening Cruise. A cruise along the Danube is a must at anytime of the day or evening as you will get a very different view of the city and it's landmarks. We did an evening cruise and experienced the city light up a night and what a wonderful sight it was. Absolutley amazing would highly recommend. If you book the Program Centrum Hop On Hop Off bus ticket for 48 hours you will get 2 one hour cruises included in your ticket price along with a few other vouchers for discounts across the city.
Lovely. Several nice bridges go over the Danube. Went on a day boat trip and a night boat trip get a brilliant view of the city by day and the amazing sight of the city lit up in the evening
Not blue at all!. A one hour boat trip along the Danube provided us with plenty of facts about this charming city and its history.
Great audio tour. Cruise the Danube with the audio guided tour and see all the highlights. All languages are available. Sit topside if weather permits. Complimentary drinks are provided, too.

Budapest has one of the most amazing views of the Danube. From almost any high place in Pest but especially in Budha one has the most amazing views of eDanube.Don't miss it from the Citadel from where you can see almost all the monuments along both sides of the river and all the beautiful bridges that cross from one side to the other.It' very ,very beautiful.Don't miss it.

Take the cruise. Cruise the Danube, it is worth every Forint. It's a beautiful, peaceful river. The beauty on it's banks are hard to put into words. It's another way to enjoy the city and its history and beautiful architecture.

Romantic walk. My girlfriend and I took a very long walk down the Danube. It was quite chilly but we enjoyed every moment of it all. We ended up walking down to the palace of art for another sightseeing. Best part of it all, it free. Plus the scenery makes for great couple pictures.

especially wz a cruise trip. walking along the banks are quite tired. I would suggest to make a boat/cruise trip along the river both at day time, early evening and night time. Day time, you may oversee those great historical constructions without walking and feel the romance during sunset and sparkling reflection at night.
Walked the Danube in the Evening. Walked the Danube, crossing one bridge and over to the other. Danced in the center. Riverboats wafted past and the sights and smells were outstanding.

boat trip. Would have been better in warmer weather, but a good way of seeing Budapest from the river. Would advise people to wrap up well and use the blankets provided when taking the trip in winter.
Danube Cruise Hop on Hop Off. Boat was basic but only an hour cruise so fine. The commentary was too quiet to hear when anybody spoke but still worth doing it to see the architecture from the river

A Champagne Cruise on The Legenda. We went in the evening on our first day in Budapest. There is an audio commentary. The cruise lasts an hour and is a good introduction to learn about the buildings, statues, memorials and the history of Budapest.
Fantastic scenery. We sailed down the Danube in an evening and the sights were amazing when the lights were lit. A wonderful way to capture the beauty of the bridges etc. A must see thing to do.
Not the prettiest. Boat trip boring, waste of money better views from Gellert Hill and Buda Palace, commentary difficult to understand

Worth a boat trip. Wortha boat trip even if it is only to say that you have travelled up the river. Good views of the major attractions and usually an explanation in your chosen language. Don't expect it to be blue though!

take a walk. taking a walk on the danube banks in the evening is great... it kinda takes you back in time, and you feel like you're in an old black and white movie. there's people, and traffic, but you can get lost in thought while walking, and looking at the murky water below.

Amazing river, you have to do a boat trip!. The river is very long and wide in places, we went for a boat trip which was excellent and certainly recommend. Great views of both sides of Budapest, including Buda castle, Chain bridge, Parliament and Margaret Island which we went all the way round (some do not).Our boat trip went from Boat Station Pier 7, on the Pest side and it was around £9 each including 2 free drinks and on the red route which goes around Margaret Island. On the boat you have a headset which can be programmed in different languages and tells you the history of the attractions.

Waltz-worthy and wide.. This famous river is wide and impressive, and local musicians are more than happy to give their version of the famous waltz, The Blue Danube - it isn't blue in November. It is marred by the memories of the Jewish people who were shot on its banks and tipped into its flowing waters during the Holocaust of WW2.

what a river !!. Take an evening boat trip - it's excellent. We had buffet food and then two hours dancing on-board. The city seen from the river is a wonderful light show - every big building is illuminated. The parliament building looks like Disney did the lighting job !!

Amazing Strong Flowing River!. Really surprised at the size of the Danube, standing on the Chain Bridge in Budapest. Really fast flowing, wide, very strong flowing river. Flowing through the heart of many city's.Lots Lots of traffic on the river from pleasure craft to working ships ploughing up an down.
A river boat trip. We took a boat trip and it was really romantic! Make sure you book in advance if you want a dinner on your boat trip, because it is only available on certain days.
danube boat trip. we did the boat trip as the second day of the hop on bus ticket. it lasted an hour and was very informative and the scenery was magnificent. well worth doing.

Wonderful moment. I had a wonderful moment there looking its scenery both day and night, just sitting there.. feel the chill wind and see the different colour of sky light in different time.. simply wonderful.

What a lovely trip and highlight of our stay in Budapest. We opted for a cheap river ferry ride north up the Danube. Cost 400ft (just over £1.00). At the terminal we decided to come back on the Tram 2 into town and as it was 5.30pm at night, everywhere was all lit up. Very beautiful and such a bargainous way to have a river trip!

Gate 1 River Cruise Budapest to Nuremberg. I took the Gate 1 River Cruise with my mom this past fall (October 2012) and was SO pleased with my experience. We got the cruise as part of a 2 for 1 special through Gate 1. I was a little nervous about the cruise since we got such a reduced price, but I was pleasantly surprised. The boat was beautiful and the staff was SO experienced and nice. The boat we had was the Amadeus Diamond. Our cruise director was fantastic! And the food and wine (all included) was to die for!!! i REALLY recommend this trip. My only disclaimer is that it is a really romantic trip, and although i had a great time with my mom this might be a trip to take with your significant other! ;)
Danube boat tour. The boat tours can be very on summer, when the breeze isn't so cold. It can be very romatic at night. Just be sure to choose the right boat.
Try a cruise. We went on a river boat cruise towards the end of our trip, and wished we had done this beforehand. What a great way to see the city and learn about it's history

An evening on the Danube.. We went on the River Cruise (included in the Hop on Hop off bus service) twice. Once during the day, and again in the evening. Were able to be on the deck - a lovely way to learn more of the History of this river.
Under the bridges. River Danube is running wide through the Hungarian capital, dividing it to Buda and Pest . Boat trip is experience that will long remain in your memory . Try that

The local water taxi. If you want to take the cruise but not spend a ton of money on a lunch cruise with tourists eating bad goulash and drinking bad Tokaj wine, here is the best way: catch the water taxi going UP river at Boraros Ter (the tram will drop you off there) - make sure you go in advance and check the hours (and make sure you ask if it is the right boat as there are many). You can then sit on a boat with chairs on the deck and cruise all the way to to Aquincum for the equivalent of a few US dollars, and then back (you have to pay another ticket though). It is important to get on the boat at south as Boraros Ter in the "high" season because the boat gets full quickly and it has a maximum capacity. Late afternoon is an ideal time to do it.
#1 in My Book. If you have the time and ability, stroll along the river from the Margit Bridge to the Liberty Bridge, walking along the Buda side one direction and the Pest side the other direction.

Pessoal. River cruiser - Buda and Pest sights.Cruising the Danube, you can see the wonders of both sides - Buda with the majestic Parliament, Margaret Island, and wonderful bridges; On the Pest side you can see the hills of Pest, on the top the Buda´s Castle, and all those fabulous castles and palaces. Its something you have to do if you going to visit Budapest.The best part of the day to do the cruiser its at sunset and return at night....such a view!

river taxi. Well, seeing as dusk falls around 4.30pm this time of year, we were disappointed that there wasn't a proper cruise at that time... (photo op)... then we saw this little boat pull up and found that for 400 forints each we could hop on board! At first we headed away from the sites and were surprised to find we were being asked to get off at quite a distance on the Buda side when we got on at Pest... but the pilot, who spoke English, informed us he was indeed going back and all the way to Margit Island, we just had to pay another 400 each :) So, for 1600 for two we had a charming "cruise" and took some fabulous photos at dusk and got off very close to the tram terminus. In our view, much more what we had in mind than paying 2100 each for a cruise at night.

Lunch cruise. This was reaslly enjoyable and the food was a reaklsurprise much better than you would expect on one of these river tour jobs...it was lovely, elegantly served and the whole tripwas a delight

Gate 1 River Cruise - Great Service - Worth the Price. We just returned from a 7 day Gate 1 Danube River Trip.....28 Oct - 03 Nov 2012 (Nuremberg to Vienna). We arrived in Munich, Germany on Oct 28 and had pre-purchased transfers to the boat the MS Sound of Music, in Nuremberg. At first it was a little difficult finding the tour guide, but after asking two people at the terminal building we found the restaurant meeting place. The ride from Munich to Nuremberg was about 2 1/2 hours (due to traffic). Having failed to find any reviews on the MS Sound of Music we were a little concerned at what we might find...however we were very pleased with the ship. The ship was built in 2006 and is well maintained, clean and comfortable. The cabin staff prepared our cabin well. The dining room staff were exceptional....the first night I was asked if I had any food allergies and told them "onions"....it was amazing that anywhere I sat for a meal and whoever served me knew about the "onion allergy". Now that's great service! The food was very good, but not elaborate. The breakfast was repetitive, but they did have daily specials. The tour manager and tour guides were very good and well educated in the areas that we visited. We did purchase 2 optional tours.The age group of the guests was 55-80, but we brought our daughter and son-in-law (low 30's). They were by far the youngest people on the boat. Actually, they were referred to as "the kids". But they had a great time and really enjoyed themselves. We made several friends on this cruise. Everyone was exceptionally nice.Anyone concerned about the Gate 1 Danube River Cruise should be at ease...you'll have a good time and the cost of the trip is a bargain. This was our second Gate 1 Tour (Egypt 2009), which was also very good and well worth the price. We also used Viking for China and feel that Gate 1 is the better bargain.
Trance-Europe largest river. This is very impressed!Unforgettable journey on the Trance-Europe largest river.Better do it evening before sundown !

The beautiful blue danube. National Geographic stated that tram #2 which runs along the Danube on the Pest side as the most beautiful tram line in the world. I agree. Although you need not go till the end of the line. You should get down after the green bridge when you are starting from the parliament side.

Budapest waterfront rocks!. An amazing cruise on the Danube.. We took a short river cruise on the Danube which was part of the hop on hop off bus ticket. It is truly beautiful, especially the view of the Parliament buildings, which are fabulous and the castle.

Long walks, picturesque tram rides... The river looks wonderful from either side. night trip. its nice to see panoramic view of Budapest , with lights and night spirits.We liked a lot to see quiet city at late night

Budapest -"Queen of the Danube",by boat. Budapest city can be detected in various ways, but if you do this cruise on the Danube, it gives you the ability to do the most relaxed way. Legenda Limited and Maharta Passnave are two companies that offer you the cruise, as well as links to outside Budapest tourist attractions, such as Szentendre, Visegrad and Ostrogon (Esztergom)."Queen of the Danube", often referred to as the capital of Hungary , has 7 bridges-"Arpad hid" is a modern bridge. Connects Buda and Pest with the northern part of the island Margit. It is the northernmost bridge in the city or the first bridge. It measures 973 meters long and the longest in the city. The next bridge easily recognized in the form of the letter "V". It is "Margit hid" and connects Buda and Pest with Margit island. Through it, traffic trams number 4 and 6The oldest and most beautiful bridge in Budapest "Széchenyi" or "Chain Bridge" which was built in the 1849th year. This bridge will surely impress the most, because it is hanging. The two ends of the bridge to continue to "Razveltov Square" in Budapest and "Adam Clark Square" in Budapest. The bridge is named after a Hungarian politician Ištvan .During the construction of this bridge was considered a world wonder. Interestingly, the Hungarian aerobatic pilot, Peter Bešenji, flew by plane turned upside down under a bridge, and since then it's a standard attraction that is running on the "Red Bull" races. Beside the bridge is a monument of marble in the form of zero and a so-called. "Zero kilometer", a place where all distances are measured in Hungary.The next bridge is the "Erzesbet hid", built 1903rd , but it was the Germans destroyed the 1945th, the current version was built in the 1964th The simplest, but no less beautiful is "Szabadsag hid." Connects the public bath "Gallert" in Buda with the largest shopping mall in Budapest. "Petofi hid" has long been the most southernmost and most heavily traffic. However, building the "Lágymányos hid" the bridge, which is the latest in Budapest, that has changed.This bridge will leave you breathless. The modern architecture and the special lighting gives it an original touch. The most beautiful view of the bridge is from the "Citadel" located at the top of the hill, "Gellert" in Buda
Great views from the river side.... There are some nice seating areas to chill out on while you spend a few hours people watching and enjoying the impressive scenery all around you

Beautiful on a sunny day. We went on a river trip as part of a deal on the Green Hip - hop buses. It was a good wat to see the sites and good value.
Beautiful Views. Great views overlooking the river and castle district in Buda. Also excellent strolling along the river.

Bravo Amawaterways.We had a great time on the Danube River Cruise. Just returned home from our Danube cruise ( Amalegro )and overall it "exceeded expectations" which we were told is the Amawaterways objective when we arrived. It wasn't just lip service we are happy to report.My wife and I have been on 3 Mediterranean cruises ( Celebrity and Princess lines) over the past 6 years, which we enjoyed very much. This was our first river cruise. We liked the smaller scale and more relaxed, casual feeling.The ports of call were all interesting. Some capital cities, some small towns. Something for everyone. We were traveling with our parents, who had a different energy and mobility level then me and my wife but we all enjoyed ourselves at our own pace. They provided a "gentle walkers" group at most of the excursions, which worked out great. They also provided us with a wheelchair for the excurions which were more on foot, just in case we needed it. We had some concerns about the quality of the food, but we found the food very tasty and there were lots of choices. Having the wine included in the meal every night at no extra charge was also a big plus and saved us quite a bit compared with the larger cruise experience. We found the onboard entertainment generally good. Some better than others, but nevertheless fine for relaxing in the lounge. We opted to do a few days in Prague on our own before the cruise, which worked out good for us and we would recommend it. Prague is a beautiful city. We can't comment on the pre-cruise packages that Ama provides. We really enjoyed the two bike tours ( incuded at no extra charge ) if you get the chance to do it.Not strenuous and very scenic. Having the bikes available at every port at no charge was a nice benefit.We did not go on the "optional" excursions so cannot comment, but all the included excursions were very nice and it was nice that it was not an extra charge like the larger cruise lines. The rooms were nicely appointed, clean, and well maintained. Beds and bedding were very comfortable. Small, like most cruise lines rooms are, but certainly not unusually so. We enjoyed having the sliding glass door "French Balcony" in the room since we did not opt for the full balcony. The entire ship was kept clean and we are a bit fussy on this issue. One small frustration was that the in-room entertainment system could have been better. Limited t.v. channels and just a few movies. Maybe they will expand that in the future if they get enough feedback. Internet service was also very spotty and could use an upgrade. Small irritations in the overall scheme of things. Our trip ended in Budapest, which is a big city, and lots to see and do. We would have enjoyed another day or two on our own there, or returning for a couple more days in Vienna, which is also an amazing city, but had decided to head for home when the cruise was over. The travelers on board were about 40% American, 40% Canadian, and 20% others from around the world. We met some very nice folks and hope to keep in touch. All in all we would definately recommend it to family and friends if you like a casual, but active, experience.

Not blue but beautifull. Magnificent buildings flank both banks of the river. Beautiful City Beautiful River. Budapest has so many beautiful building and the grander and largest of them are right on the danube. Giving the city a somewhat magical feel. Amazing views. Take one of the night boats from the embankment in front of the modern hotels on the Pest side - or any boat around dusk- to enjoy this fantastic city. The cheapest way to navigate. "The beautifull blue danube" is not too much blue but if you want to navigate over it is the best choice is to use the public trasportation. SInce this sping a ferry service is available to rund fron north to south and viceversa at a cheap price. If you buy the 7 days public transportation card (not the budapest card that lasts only 3 days and is more expensive) you can use every public transport , ferries included (not in we!). Ther are about 5 or 6 stops long the danube for ferries 11 and 12 and you can go from south to north ferries terminal in about 1 hour- 1 hour and half (the return is a bit faster). Ferries are a bit veru old and with rust but if you get a chair free you can enjoy the travel and the best thing is that is free! We used them to make an afternoon tour but we use them also to move ourself during our stay. SInce you are in your vacations you have not to run fast from place to place...and why not doing it witha a good panorama? They runs about every half hour and they are clearly signed if they are going "down" or "up" the river (don't look at the direction where they stop because the stop is only on the right side of the ferry so also the south direction ferry is in the same direction of the north one when they are stopped).
Beautiful at night. Go on one of the nighttime river cruises. The city is beautifully illuminated as you cruise along in the evening. The best way to see the city!

Lifetieme experience. We spend 3 weeks visiting 7 countries of Europe last summer and that dinner cruise on the Danube was the best moment of it all !!! Food was above average for a cruise. Service ok. But the view of Budapest from the Danube is so beautiful at night. Expensive, but worth enjoying such a moment.
Beautiful Danube. The views from the Castle district overlooking the Danube are wonderful. you can see for miles. Also travelling along the Danube was a great pleasure

perfect boat trip. Only 1 hour, but its enough to give you a good idea about the city.We enjoyed the trip it was in combination of the cityrame bus- tour lasting 4 hours

St Stephen's celebrations August 20th 2012. Air show along the Danube between 10 and 11a.m. Huge fireworks display for 30 mins from 9 p.m. The banks of the river were full to capacity for the evening display. Food stalls and street entertainment

Gorgeous view along the River Danube. Especially for those who are visiting Budapest for the first time, we would highly recommend spending at least an hour right at the beginning of your trip on a cruise on the river Danube to sit back, relax, and enjoy amazing view on the 2 banks of the Danube - you wont regret it! We were recommended by our local friend to book a cruise with the official cruising company: the Mahart, and you can buy your tickets by the booth close to the river around Vorosmarty Ter. Beautiful views of the Parliament building, Castle hill and various bridges will captivate you as you bask in partial sunlight (or moonlight!) with the cool sea breeze in your hair. Headsets were provided to us with english commentaries, and there were options to buy refreshments on board. We really enjoyed the brief introduction of the history of the country and buildings provided during the cruise. We feel that it is equally stunning to take this cruise in the day or night time as the night view of the city skyline is also really beautiful. Enjoy your ride!

Not impressed. When I was a little read about danube river with blue colour but disappointed. We had evening cruise dinner in the nigh was very good, food was good but with very limited item for vegetarians. We took a trip Danube be which was good

the view of the danube is gorgeous. you can see the danube from various points in Budapest. It is a perfect back drop for pictures, the right scenery for a romantic chat or a lovely meal in one of the boats that have restaurants onboard

August 2012. We went on a night cruise on the Danube on the Wednesday and it was breath taking as well as very romantic. All of the attractions and places of interest were lit up. There was running commentary via headset in whatever language you wanted - this is an absolute must on yur to do list!
good place to walk around and enjoy the people.. like general atmosphere. Was there for the 20th august Foundation day fireworks which were fantastic.
Cruise the Danube if You Can. We cruised the Danube during December and the views along the way were gorgeous - I took about a thousand pictures! It snowed and was so pretty!

Central, historic, and great views. This is a good place to start in Budapest as you get a good sense of key buildings, history, sites, etc. There are many boat tours along the river and I have done a couple of different ones. None are amazing, but you really aren't going for the boat itself.

Fantastic. The Castle, the Parliament, the bridges, the people, the sun rising ... I loved Buda and Pest. I walking away Danube, I seat in bars in front of Danube and I drunk a excellent beer - one liter, it is fantastic. The old buildings are very interesting and beautiful. Dogs, bycicles, rollers, people and more people walking ... So good

The River.... All the bridges that connect Buda to Pesta, give you a beautiful view of the Danube. No matter what bridge you choose (Chain Bridge, Margret, Elisabeth, etc), all of them will take you above the greatest river in Europe : The Danube. You will see lots of ships : touristic, working, floating restaurants, going up and down the river.
River cruise. Unless you want to spend more and push the boat out for an average meal go for the cheapest 1 hour trip with a drop off at Margaret Island. Cant say I recommend the latter
Simply Stunning. The Danube is surrounded by beauty in all shapes and forms. It is at the heart of Budapest and is the most obvious attraction for all vistors.
It ain't blue .... The 2-day green bus tour includes a short boat tour on the Danube. Very nice. Gives a view of the buildings and bridges from the water.
Great view. The river was great loved the bridges, buses around the river easy to hop on and off. Saw most attractions around the river and did a river boat ride which was good.

It separates Budapest. Buda is on one side of the Danube and Pest is on the other. There are beautiful bridges crossing the Danube. You can see pictures of the destruction of these bridges by the Nazis in the Castle area. It's an amazing river and there is so much history and so many cities on it. It's not blue but you can't have everything. You can bike for many kilometers alongside the Danube and stop in little towns or you can take a boat along it or you can just sit and watch it. There is a very moving memorial near the Parliament Buildings in Budapest to the Jews who were shot by the Nazis and fell into the river. The memorial consists of shoes. Some have candles in them, others flowers. It is heartbreaking.
Do it. Take the time to take a boat trip on the Danube, very picturesque and stunning views of both sides. Can get trip in price of hop on hop off bus ticket

Worst river cruise I've ever been on.. I went on the Beer & Cocktail Cruise & it was awful. Firstly there were far too many people on the boat & not enought seats. Very few seats on the upper deck where you would expect to sit on such a sunny day. The only positive was that the cocktails were lovely, although because it took so long to make them the queue at the bar was very long. You basically had to queue for half the cruise to get your 2 cocktails included in the price. I could not hear any of the commentary that was said throughout the cruise. Obviously the view was lovely however the boat was not fit for purpose. Overall not worth the money.
Great Views!. Traveling by boat along the Danube is a great way to see the city of Budapest! As well as take some fantastic pictures from angles that would otherwise not be possible.

Walking or sailing. You can walk the shores of the bustling Danube both in the daytime and in the evening or cross over on one of the numerous bridges. The boat excursions take you up and down from the center to Margaret Island. On the way you have a magnificent view of the parliament building. Boat trip is included in the Hop on - Hop off tour.
Lovely river with great sights. Nice and beautiful and the river boat ride is a must try you get to see a lot a learn more about the history of budapest
great view. Try with the ferry instead of the touristboat, great fun! Only 400 HUF, tickets to be bought on board
Something that you will see anyway. Beautiful sightseeing walk passing the bridges of the Danube. You can see the Danube from the castle too and you can take nice photos
Spectacular Sight. whereever you stand on the river edge the view is magic. Night is amazing with the Parliament building as a backdrop.One of our favourite places in Europe
Danube Boat ride. When in Budapest, you must take a Boat ride up and down the Danube. At night the Parliament building is bathed in light; it is really beautiful (and huge).

Amazing river. We have seen from both sides and from many highs and places. This river is wonderful by day, seen only on bright days, and wonderful by night with all fabolous buildings proper lightened.
Blue Danube. except its not very blue! Bridges connecting Buda to Pest are super and worth walking over. Wen to evening dinner cruise which was fab. City looked beautiful lit up at night

Excellent Danube promenade. The Danube promenade in Budapest is excellent and from place to place there are stairs where you can go to the water level. Very nice view over the castle hill and Citadella and also over the Parliament building. There is also an inexpensive regular "bus" service on the Danube organised by the local transport company. Look for ship stops on the promenade where you can also find the schedule.
Cruise on the Danube. We cruised the Danube at night when all the gorgeous buildings of Budapest are lit up like Christmas trees. Absolutely fantastic and breathtaking!!!

Great cruises!!. I took day and night cruises... both are great!! The one during the day includes a visit at Margaret Island in the Danube... worth taking it.
For cruises, I recommend "Legenda".

Highlight of the trip. It was an one hour tour, starting from the Pest side, turning to the Buda side, and ended at the same pier. We took the night tour, which is a real treat. The distant castle was lighted up in the dark background, reminiscent of fairytale. The most inspiring experience is seeing the parliament building in a gilded shine. The staff members are all multilingual, speaking English, French, German, Russian, Spanish and Japanese. BTW beverages were severed on board. Interestingly only Czech not Hungarian beer is available, if you ask for an one.

nice. it's a really nice place; overall at the sunset and during the night when the lights go on and the monuments become the protagonists of the night.... worthwhile spend few hours for a leisurely stroll along it...
What can I say? It's the Danube.. A beautiful river bisecting an incredible city. We took a river cruise (tied to one of the many bus tours) and shot a ton of pictures.

Beautiful surroundings. What a great river dividing Buda and Pest. The bridges that cross the Danube are each unique and amazing in their own right. We took a boat ride down the Danube and the surroundings are right on the waters edge. Amazing buildings are all around.
best river ever. in budapest it's huge, walking on the bridges makes you think about how many things happened on its banks

Very nice experience. The river cruise, included in the Hop On/Hop Off bus ticket is an excellent way of seeing major attractions from a river aspect. The cruise offers views of some of the significant buildings and bridges and includes a circuit of Margaret Island.An excellent commentary in English is very informative and completes a very enjoyable river cruise.
Majestic. We took a few walks along the banks of the Danube and hopped on the tram to see the views from every angle. The views were spectacular.
just have to do it. It was a great way to get some more history and enjoy a sunny morning. Very enjoyable get to see both sides Buda and Pest and their famous places

The heart of the city. Budapest is here, because of the Danube. It's the heart of the city and makes it as beautiful as is. Take a walk along the river bank, come over after sundown. We love her, so do you. :)

Beautiful!. The Danube river is busy with a lot of river tours, but there is a lot to see in Budapest, and strolling along the Danube can be relaxing, depending on where you are in Budapest, especially in the evening.
Many gather along the banks share some wine or beer laughing and relaxing watching the boats and traffic go by.

Walking along the Danube in Budapest. It takes some time but it is worth it. You can whether start from Margaret's island or Elizabeth's bridge where the fabulous market is. Better to walk on Pest's side. It's lovely and later on there's the Parliament which is a must in Budapest as well. You can also take very nice pictures as you'll be able to see the Castle district.

Relaxing. We took a night river cruise on our last evening. It was a relaxing and slightly cliche way to end our trip, but we enjoyed the laid back cruise and the spectacular sight of the bridges and various historic monuments illuminated from the boat.
It is not blue. The Danube is a beautiful and very important river in that region, but not as pretty as I imagined, as it was described by compuser Straus.
Nice in the sun. Loved the boat trip for one hour. Very informative tour another for the must do list. The hop on hop off trip offers 2 free boat trips

Beautiful. The river and bridges are the most prominent landmarks of Budapest! Go there at night, when all the lights of the surrounding buildings and streets are lit up, absolutely stunning. There are a ton of things to do on both sides of the river and there are several tours you can take as well.

You won't have seen Budapest unless you take a river cruise. Full disclosure: cruises both big and small are not my top activities when sighting seeing in Europe - walking, biking, trams, etc. Day one, a 7 PM cruise (sights and drinks, not dinner) was a fantastic perspective of one our the most scenic cities in Europe. The crusie is a short one (1 hour) and many restraurants are nearby for dinner. Day two, a 10 PM cruise with fabulous illuminated buildings is NOT to be missed. Tip: boats are small so queuing up 1/2 hour prior to departure will improve your selection of chairs and views.

Boat trip at night. We had a decent Hungarian dinner with very good popular live-music and dancing on a boat called "Rakoczi" at a very reasonable price. We traveled from the Hilton Hotel around the Margarete Island and back further than the Gellert Hill and enjoyed 3 hours on board. We could have stayed even longer since the band was still playing.

Boat trips. We did green hop on hop off city tour - seemed best value. Good tour with excellent extras including free boat trip. We chose evening tour - last one at 8.45 from near Marriott hotel. All sites illuminated so fantastic evening trip. Slightly shorter evening trip as not past Margaret Island so about 1 hour long. get there early to get best seats.
A Must-do. If you are going on a boat cruise, leave it until about 10.00 pm when all the buildings and bridges are lit up.

The beautiful brown Danube. The river provides a truly spectacular setting for the city and the various bridges and islands add to its beauty. We had hoped to take a sail but did not manage that. Next time...

Beautiful - but especially at night. Beautiful river, great landscapes - at night the bridges and building are lit up til 12 - we walked along at night and also took a cruise at sunset which was magical.

Beautiful Danube, but not blue!. We did an evening drinks cruise on one occasion, which was very enjoyable and gave us an opportunity to see all the main buildings, including Parliament, at close quarters from the river. On another occasion we caught the hydrofoil to Esztergom and spent a day there looking round the beautiful Basilica and had lunch in the wine cellars underneath. Go on a Sunday and there is an "all you can eat" buffet for around £10.

Short trip up the Danube. We had a free inclusive trip on one of the cruises up the Danube from the Gelert Bridge around Margaret island. The Danube isn't blue needless to say. Beware goign in August it was 30+ and all we wanted to do was sit in the shade so if you didn't get the side facing the city the commnetary was a waste but the breeze was wonderful. We had this trip after buying a hop on hop off tourist bus trip - this was worth it as the city is huge and hard work to walk especially in the heat.
night trip on boat. excellent giving history of Budapest. Budapest is a really beautiful city. Ideal to show you where evrything is which can be reached by public metro easily.
magic. We took a boat from Visegrad back to Budapest as it got dark. The lights of the city on the bridges and the buildings make it utterly magical. Only drawback is the BIG roads either side.
beautiful. we took a trip on one of the hop on/off boat rides and enjoyed every minute of it with the commentary pointing out and explaining all the sites
take the river cruise at sunset. Very pleasant, could easily be very romantic as well. Bring a camera and be prepared for a lot of great views.

Beautiful. Just walking along the river at night was spectacular. We walked along both sides of the river. Note, if you do walk along the Buda side, you may want bug spray...the bugs are pretty bad closer to the mountain late at night...but still a great view and worth it.
Spectacular views from the river. Would really recommend walking the banks and taking a river cruise to enjoy all aspects of the Danube and its banks

Stunning City with River running through it!. For the best views of the river Danube go up to the Palace or old Castle area... It's stunning! You can also take a boad trip and see all the bridges along the way that connect Buda with Pest....including Chain Bridge! Stunning City.
Walking the Danube. We walked from Liberty bridge to the other side of the Parliament. Beautiful at night and during the day. A must do.
Trip to Szendendre. Lovely trip on the Danube to a lovely little town in Szendendre, worth a visit. We got ferry at 1030 and returned at 530pm, lovely little town.

Water a little ugly, but great view of Buda and Pest. Take a crusie along the Danube to get some great view of both sides. They really aren't that expensive if you don't do a tour and just catch a boat on your own, about $10/person.

What else but the great river. Well when we went it was not cold - so I have not tried it under those conditions, however in mild weather it is fantastic to be there day and night. The surrounding streets - promenade is clean and the trams go up and down next to the river so you can get easily around. Only one note - there are no caffes near the edge of the water or on the water - strange....

Boat trip to St Margarets Island. Beautiful flowers and plenty of seats to just sit, relax and enjoy the peace and quiet.......Plenty to do for children, such as animals to see and adventure playground.
pleasant boat trip. We had a pleasant trip on the river which was included as part of the Hop on Hop off tour and the commentary was interesting too.

Must see. The Danube itself is quite expansive. To really appreciate it, you should go at dusk time to watch the sun go down. If you decide to take the river cruise, you really should do it at night . Fisherman's Bastion, Parliament, etc. are all lit up along with all the bridges. Now that is a must see!
Great to see the two sides. Definitley great spot to see Buda and pest fromObviously should not be ignored nd you need to cross it to go from each side - walk on the chain bridge - good photo spot

Must-do in Budapest. I think it is a must in Budapest to walk along the Danube, it is really beautiful from the both sides of the river. I still prefer the Pest's side, I think it gives you a better view than the Buda's side which has the car road between you and the river. In Pest's side there's nothing between you and Danube so you're really close to the river.
Beautiful Boat trip. We took the boat trip that was included in the green hop on-hop off service. It was great, and the view along the river was very beautiful.

romantic. it was a good feeling to have a boat ride in this beautiful river, i enjoyed it as it gave opportunity to take picture of the Parliament Building in the Pest side and the some sights in the Buda side .
Amazing. Make sure you take a river boat cruise on the Danube. And take an evening walk by the Danube and take in the sights
Beautiful from both sides of the city. The river is beautiful from both the Buda and Pest side. We walked the streets during the day and night with both offering a different perspective.
Very romantic. Just magical! Lots of boat trips and restaurants on Europes longets river. Perfect for a stroll at night with your loved one:))

Walking. The Danube Promenade is very nice place to make a romantical walking with your girlfriend. When the sun goes away it all comes to dark and then it is a concert of lights. Everything was bath with lights. The Parliament, Chain Biridge, Margaret Bridge. In our 3 day stay we make the walking twice because it was amazing area. I recommend this place to everyone who comes to Budapest.

Gorgeous by day and night. The danube is one of the centrally located attractions of the city, and yes a river can be an attraction. Both by day and lite up at night this river walk is worth the time.

The most beautiful centerline. Budapest is situated on both sides of the River of Danube. There is Buda on one side and Pest on the other. A row of gorgious bridges run from one side to the other: Chain Bridge is the most famous one. Margaret Island is located in the heart of the city on the river.The elbow of Danube, north of Budapest is one of the most gorgeous natural area to visit in Hungary. It is just a little over an hour from Budapest, an excellent location for a tour.

A special evening. We went on a private dinner cruise with our tour group. The sights on both sides of the river were wonderful during the early evening before we are dinner and even more amazing when it got dark and everything was bathed in lights - bridges, buildings, Parliament, castles, churches. It was a special way to experience Budapest.
Boat Trip. The narrarator was reading from a script. She seemed disinterested. Other than that, the sights were good.

The Blue Danube. Lovely looking river, very clean and with the lovely blue skies above it shone a magnificent blue. We booked a dinner cruise and although the cruise left a little to be desired the views of the parliament in the evening were super and the water taxi up to Margrit Island was great too!

Night River Cruise. We went on a night river cruise of the Danube and it was just amazing. The buildings all lit up at night are spectacular, especially the Parliament building. Highly reccommend you do this.
Joining Europe. For 20 euros I obtained a 48 hour pass for open top day and evening bus tours and a trip on this great waterway that passes through so many countries on it's journey to the Black see

Danube makes Budapest special. The most beautiful part of Budapest is around the Danube (Lánc-bridge, Castle of Buda, Citadella, Parliament). I recommend to take a boat/ship tour here, and see the town from both side of the river.

Danube Evening Cruise. A nice way to cruise on the Danube for a relaxing hour while seeing the lights come on of the City. Very enjoyable. I recommend it- can get some excellent shots of the City and key places.

Excellent views!. We took a 1 hr sunset cruise of the Danube with Legenda June 2012.The views from the Danube were breathtaking! We were especially impressed to start out in daylight so we could see the buildings and then see them all lit up later in the evening.Our cruise had headphones with narrative in a choice of at least 10 languages. The bonus was they also had video screens that showed what they were talking about and sometimes the insides of the buildings. The cruise came with a free drink and there was free wifi at the dock lounge where we waited for our cruise. They honoured the Rick Steves discount.Would highly recommend a Danube river cruise; especially with Legenda.
Gorgeous views. Gorgeous views over the river, stunning bridges.. worth a trip!

One of the best river views in Europe. Walking by the river on Pesti side, we were excited by the views of Gellert hill, the Palace, the tops of St Mathew and the Fishermens monument, embroidered on green.

Wonderful. We read several places and our tour guide agreed that it is best not to do the dinner tour but just an hour tour at night. You want to experience food in Budapest as much as possible and eating the overpriced food on the boat isn't worth it. So insead we ate dinner at 7 and got to the Legenda boat by 9. 9 was perfect because the buildings had just lit up and it was beautiful!!! Sit outside if possible, just dress warmly. They will give you a blanket and sit back and enjoy!! Definately worth doing!!
Enchanting!. Whether you opt for a glittery boat, or a more modest one, take an evening cruise on the Danube - Ohh's and Ahhh's guaranteed!

Night Cruise -- Not To Be Missed. The scenic Danube River is world famous. But my experience is that it is even more beautiful when taking a cruise down this lovely waterway at night.Just imagine: on a balmy evening with the water calm and the evening breeze brushing your face, you will gaze at the buildings and landmarks that are lit up on both shores aginst the darkened sky like gems on a black velvet cloth. As your boat lazily pass under all the famous bridges that are now serene and devoided of tourists, marvel at their different architectural styles in the warm inviting glow. Let your eyes feast on the statues under the bridges that are visible only when you sail by. Raise your glass to the sweet Budapest night sky and say to yourself ah, this is life.

Pleasant with great views. A boat ride down the Danube is a great way to get to Szentendre, a wonderful little town just north of Budapest. The morning ride took twice as long since it was going up stream and it was not nearly as crowded as the return trip was. If you sit facing west there is much more to see than on the eastern bank which is mostly uninhabited.
My wife thought it was romantic just being on a boat. Traveled up and down the Danube. Sights from the river are simply beautiful. I especially like the parliament bldg with all its spires.
beautiful. I highly recommend an evening boat trip down the Danube. The edges of the bridges are lit up, and the Parliament Building on the banks is especially beautiful.

River cruise is amazing. We went on a Tauch river cruise and were pampered up the Danube. It was good food and good times, if you like that kind of thing. My parents were truely happy and so was my brother and his family.

AmaWaterways River Cruise. Superb service. Excellent captain & cruise manager & staff. Extraordinary food & wines with local flavors. Safe and extremely comfortable adventures. Side trips and free wi-fi added to amazing journey. Not enough words to express how wonderfully AmaWaterways contributed to astonishingly sweet and joyful memories. Wonder at every turn! I am in awe with their expertise and highly recommend for a remarkable vacation.

The Danube. Did a hop on hop off city bus which included a tour on the river. lovely views from river and particularly like the bridges. Also stayed on a river boat further down river but not so impressed

Night cruise. We went on a 2,5hr night cruise on the danube with Mahart. I have to say it was the best choice we made in our entire trip to Budapest!We only paid around â¬16 per person for the entire 2,5 hours INCLUDING a nice 3 course buffet and a single (less spectacular) drink. Drinks on board were priced about the same as in the rest of Budapest (= relatively cheap) so we endulged a bit with a bottle of wine. We got to see the Danube by night while enjoying live music.Highly recommended!
Walk along the Danube. Enjoyed it more at night .. walking on the bridge or just watching the lights over the river is very soothing :)
The Danube is the life of the city. Both travel on it, and just sitting in the evening and watching all the restful and interesting.

Sunset cruise. On recommendation, we took the evening cruise - so we got to see the sunset as well as the building lighting up on the journey back. Complimentary drinks given and the audioguide was good and descriptive.

Beautiful. the danube river is beautiful, splitting the town into 2 glamorous halfs and the city looks more nicer during the night with all the lights on. the small cruise also gives you a nice calm view of the city and is very relaxing.

Beautiful Day & Night!. The Danube is wonderful to see from any and all angles--whether from the Buda or the Pest side it is a beautiful river with historic landmarks bordering both sides. And at night you can't imagine a much more romantic venue!

Predictable and boring unless you have never been to Europe and are celebrating your 195th wedding anniversary. Four of us took the night cruise on the Danube in the first week of July. Food and drink was definitely average as was the service. There was no music and the overall tone was one of cash cow syndrome. While this is to some extent the norm at this type of place, it could certainly improve by adding more of a local touch to the experience or by handing out some type of material to read on the panoramic views and so on. As it was, the crew of the boat was just as tired of the whole affair as were we and we were glad the trip was over.
Danube - River for Lovers. We took an evening boat trip with Champagne and this was the ultimate for lovers old and young alike
Take the boat. Well worth the money, just take a trip down and back on a sunny day,just as good as it get.Also a glass of wine on the trip {Try Bull Blood}{2006}
Get the river tour. If you do a bus tour, a 90 minute river cruise is included, great value
Evening river-dinner cruise. Absolutely gorgeous city-scape from the river after dusk.
Boat trip. Boat trip along the Danube is a must, lots to see, and the Parliament Building is magnificent

It is Not Blue!. No, it is not the Blue Danube, but it is a beautiful river with several different bridges - different styles of architecture for each one. It was a very swift moving river, and very impressive.
beautiful river. Lovely river walks are amazing. One can hardly get enough of this beauty.

Hop-on-Hop Off River Tour. As part of our hop-off-hop-on bus tour, we had a boat tour on the Danube. Went in late evening, sun on Parliament Building made it glow. As with all of these tours, we had running commentary on what we were seeing and the historical perspective.

River at it's magnificence in Budapest. The Danube looks magnificent as it flows through Budapest. It is wide and to an onlooker betrays the speed at which the water flows. It is kept clean and has many boat restaurants and bridges that allow one to enjoy great views.
A must. Hop-on-hop-off on the Danube value for money however cheaper to buy tickets before leaving home. Night time lights down the river spectacular.Very busy river.

Superb!. What a wonderful sight when you first arrive in the city to stand on the banks of the Danube. It just gets better with a boat trip. We went once in the afternoon and then did a dinner cruise which was excellent. There's no better way to see the Parliament building.

lovely to be on the Danube. we went on a boat trip that comes within the price of Budapest sight seeing hop on hop off tour 6.000 each about £18.00 each this is for two days and you get a free beer and a free goulash and a discounted bous booklet
Beautiful. A world class river in a world class city.. It really does define the 2 personalities I experienced of the city. Looking forward to an evening cruise to see it in a new way.

Excellent for walks and chilling out. Breath-taking views, nice to walk along, to cross to the other side, to sit in some of the restaurants especially for a dinner. I would recommend Venhajo on the Pest side.
Danube - every city must have a river like this!. Just lovely to watch the cruise boats go by and the bridges overlooking it, and the Parliament at its side.

Take cruise at night and enjoy views of Buda and Pest. This is a beautiful river that has charming views on both sides. Taking a day or night time cruise is a must. The meals on the night cruises are acceptable but spend as much time on deck enjoying the scenery. Also take walks along the Danube, especially on the Pest side as there is so much to see. Do your homework ahead of time so that you don't miss anything.
Not often blue, but still beautiful. What can one say about this glorious river that has not already been said before?

Evening Boat tour down the Danube. Cruising the Danube at night is touristy but definately worthwhile. The city is absolutely gorgeous. Recommend the Legenda cruise company for a 1 hour cruise which includes 1 free drink and headphone commentary with video. They offer a Rick Steve's discount if you show his book.

You cannot miss this famous river. Though it is not blue, it is busy...with tour boats and leisure boats. This is one of the famous rivers of Europe. IF you have a chance, take a tour boat and see Budapest from the water.
Its waters are not bluish but olive-greenish as supposed, but its ok!. Look at the long shipboats rolling by on the river.

Don't ruin the impression of the Danube with this Dinner Cruise. I booked this online before I left home hoping it would be as good as it sounded - spectacular views, great traditional food and music, and wine. What a disappointment! The group did themselves no favours from the start. They said meet no later than 6.30pm for a 7pm start at Duna Palota. Well after that time, they were still accepting people coming in for bookings, while those who were on time waited in the street with increasing impatience. When they had their numbers they led the group through the streets down to the river to board the boat. Why couldn't we meet there? A glass of warm bubbly was offered on entry. When seated, another glass of wine was offered. I took a glass of warm, very poor quality, almost undrinkable white wine. I then ordered a bottle of beer which was also warm, served by an unfriendly waitress who seemed to consider how I dare question the temperature of the beer. The buffet was particularly ordinary with tasteless food, and not enough dessert for all. Judging by the amount of hot food left over, people went straight for the dessert. The bain marie was so hot that a serving spoon left in a tray was so hot that it burnt people. The cruise itself was pleasant, but due to the fact that it returned by 8.30pm when it was still light, the wonderful lights of the buildings on the banks of the Danube were not seen. The gypsy music was adequate, but we had seen a violinist the previous night who made his violin sing. By normal standards this was an expensive dinner, and therefore by Hungarian standards, it was outrageous. They asked us to fill out a feedback sheet at the end - guess what we said!
The Blue Danube. We took an evening cruise on the Danube and it was lovely - especially when the lights began to come on - oh my, such beauty. A must do if at all possible.

Buy your daily public transport ticket and enjoy also the Danube!. When you buy your daily transportation ticket (1500 Ft), you can use ALL public transportation...INCLUDING the boats (lines 11, 12 & 13), that goes along the Danube river
Fantastic. From the 2800 Km this part in Budapest is the best, specially at night walking on both sides
Boat trip. You have to take a boat trip on Danube as you get to see the city from a diffrent perspective.
boat trip. you cant visit budapest without going on a boat trip , there are plenty to choose from.
danube cruise. very nice cruise, excelent views of parliament building
get a boat tour on the danube. perferably night tour, since the day time was so hot in July! and the lights on both sides of the river make your ride memorable!

Danube. Full of life. Bustling with ships on the river, pleasure boats. People walking along its banks. The restaurants diverse offering delicious fare in a casual setting. Families and tourists alike.
Dont miss the cruise. Don't miss the night cruise (better then the day cruise). you can buy the ticket directly at the docks.

The Beautiful Danube-Blue or Green. The Danube helps to characterize Budapest, and it provides an excellent avenue for exploring the city. Many of the city's famous and noteworthy monuments are located along the Danube, from the Parliament, to Central Market Building on the Pest side, to the churches with their towers and steeples on the Buda side. The bridges connecting the two banks are well worth walking across, with rewards for the walker or climber on the other side. Walking across the Szechenyi takes you to the Castle Hill. The Szabadsag leads you to the Gellert Hotel and the Citadella Hill, and the Erzsebet leads to the Gellert Monument and Hill. Margaret Bridge takes the visitor to the heart of Buda, or to Margaret Island. There are many restaurants, cafes, and hotels, along the Danube in downtown Pest. On a more literal level, the Danube is a great avenue to explore---by boat. Cruises allow tourists to tour the city and her islands, or else to take excursions to nearby towns along the Danube such as Visegrad, Esztergom, and Szentendre. During holidays and for special events, party cruises conduct tour groups around the city for fireworks displays and celebrations. The August 20 State Day Celebrations are a great time to see fireworks from the Danube. Regardless of what part of Budapest you are in the Danube provides something of interest for visitors.
