What a beautiful river. We cruised dan the Danube, spectacular. To see the royal palace and the cathedrals from the river is just magic. We also did a night cruise and that was absolutely spectacular. If you are in Budapest I highly recommend both a day cruise & a night cruise.

the riverboat. a good way to see the Parliament and take the best pictures of it , but also to see the Citadel. It's worth doing it. On the riverboat, some blankets are available because it's windy on board, outside. Also to get warm, you can buy for 2 euros a hot wine, very tasty! I found no disadvantage, maybe the time : just one hour trip by boat but you can see everything and also we coudn't stop at the Isle of Margrit, because it wasn't opened on March.
Two trips on the Danube. So much to see along the shores of the Danube. Many castles, villages, and camping. When in Europe, you must go on the Danube.

An Hour Boat Ride shows a lot of Budapest. Nothing to dislike. I travelled on the Blue Boat Hop On Hop off which was part of the 48 hour Red Bus Hop on Hop Off tour of the city on two routes. The Danube trip shows all the buildings and peace monuments without the restriction of windows or cables from Trams.

try to add degustation or some show to boat trip. view on Parlament from river is OK but better to combine boat trip with wine degustation or some show. And please don't go to Sentendre by boat or train
Take a boat trip. And cross the Chain Bridge UNDER the bridge, ON the Danube.
Nice view. From the several bridges you get a good look at the two parts of the city. The traffic on them is very busy, which makes photographing a tad difficult

Must see. The Danube doesn't just floww through Budapest, it's part of the city, which has grown up around the river.Walking along with rivers, from the restaurants near Vaci Utca or the quite stroll along the paths of Margit Island, the river is central to the city, and should not be missed.
beautiful but windy. if you go on the winter, be prepared. It tends to wind a lot near the danube. But do not let that keep you away. It's really beautiful!

It's huge. It sounds like a river crossing through a city, but you can feel how huge the danube is when you are on the chain bridge. the lights at night make it look very pretty and the boat rides are just amazing to explore the life on the river banks
So pretty!. wherever you are in Budapest, the views of this river are fantastic. There is always boats to watch and people on the banks, and the bridges are beautiful

Remember to take a night cruise!. We had a dinner cruise on the wintery February. Dinner was buffet styled with two alcoholic drinks on the lower deck which is covered, hence, we were protected from the chill. We had typical Hungarian dinner from goulash to strudels for desserts. There were some entertainers playing strings and singing. Above the deck of the cruise, we had an opportunity to take great pictures of the Parliment house, the Buda Castle and other night scenes of Budapest, braving the cold. Coming from a tropical country, it is an eye-opener to see ice sheets on the river and ice-breaking when the cruise passed through the river. The cruise lasted about an hour and half. The food was forgettable but the experience of the cruise on the Danube river was exceptional!
Amazing. There is a great view of the main sights, from either side of the river.

Busy river. What I like the most about the Danube is that it's always doing something - sometimes floods and destroys the home of a lot of people, sometimes carries goods from Romania to Germany and back, sometimes hosts fireworks... busy river, but very dirty.
Simply amazing and charming. You have to take a night boat trip on the river or walk across one of the chain bridges!

You can't miss. This is the one thing you can't miss - literally, even if you are here on travel/business/holiday one way or the other, at some point you see the Danube. If you got time, I advise you to take a walk on the Buda side, between Batthyanyi ter (metro 2) and Chain Bridge or Szabadsag hid. The most beautiful time for this is dusk and after.
Danube Cruise. Be sure to take the Luganda cruise of the river. Excellent English guides for the trip. Two free glasses of wine or beer included.
Impossible to take a bad picture. Little bit of sand beneath your feet, bit of wind in your hair, and a clear view of some truly beautiful scenery. How could you not love it.

Like the Mississippi River in Minneapolis.. When we first saw the Danube river in Budapest, it was a sunny but cold day. It reminded me of the Mississippi River in Minneapolis during early spring because there were blocks of ice floating down the river. I'd definitely recommend taking 15-30 minutes to walk along the Danube. It's a large river and you can get great views of the other side of town.

Wow!. Went down the Danube on a Legenda Dinner Cruise - two and a half hours of a relaxing, memorable trip with good food and attentive staff, always looking to please and quite frankly the views are stunning.
Greatly lighted. Greatly lighted monuments and bridges, gives a very romantic sight over the Danube. Too bas cars drive along the river too.

Danube Rakpart. Few cities in Europe---London included---offer the vista prov ided by the Danube, with the magnificent Parliament on one side and Buda Castle and Halassztbastyon on the other, with Matyastemplom's spires

Lies between Buda and Pest. We were there on St Stephen day (20th August) where they gave various air show along the Danube during the day and at night time thousands if not millions of people came along the Danube and watched the Grand Fireworks show for half an hour along the Danube. So beautiful to watch and Hungarian people honour thier Ancient King Stephen every year. It is a great feeling to be amongst these crowds. It felt like New Year celebration and it very differcult to get back to the hotel bec of transportation of these thousands or millions of people going at the same time.

Nice area. Its really fun to walk next to the river during the day. It's nice to see to ice went by. It's also a fun place to sit at night( maybe in the summer). There are some important buildings next to the river, so it's nice to walk around. There are some parts next to the river with no good street, so take good hikingshoes with you.
Pretty. Good views, nice walk, take a camera. Better at night.

Boat Trip. Wonderful one hour boat trip with guides in a huge variety of languages and music to match. Very informative. Beautiful buildings and architecture. Facsinating history and stories behind the bridges. Complimentary drinks offered. Good value for money.
Boat party. We travelled having a boat party on the river danube, it is so beautiful at night everything is lit up and so picturesque you must have a boat trip down there if you ever go!!
Watching ice float away. I loved to walk along either side of the danube and watch the ice float down the river.
Danube. It was good to walk across the bridge and watch the ice break as it crashed into the bridge. Great views looking both ways.
A great walk. If you're out for a walk, the Danube is the place to do it - day or night! The walkway runs the length of it and provides picturesque scenery and one of a kind views!
Beautiful bridges.. A dozen of the most beautiful bridges cross the Danube River with lighted castles and churches on both banks.
great for a cruise. a lot of cruise operators navigate the Danube for tourists . Take a 2 hour cruise and enjoy the sights from the river . Worth it

good for a walk. you can have a good evening walk on the danube promenade for some relaxation, also you can have the tram no.2 line that can take you for a round along the danube river and see some of the most important landmarks of budapest
What a River should be!!. Beautiful blue in daylight, not too many boats, mostly clean of litter.
fun. Fun to walk along the river. Especially from parliament to Liberty briedge.

Gazing at history. It was hard for me to belief that I was actually at the Danube. I have read about it and heard about it my entire life. I just kept walking back and forth on the Chain Bridge and savoring the experience.
The River !!. Wonderful , site Amazing view, We walked to the Bridge everyday and l;oved it cold but what a bridge Dont forget your camera !!
River boat trip. We had a really great time on a luncheon cruise. Nice views while we were served a tasty buffet. All for a very good price.

Magnificent. Budapest offers magnificent beauty to visitors; it is wonderful during the day but the city is so well-lit at night time that it cannot be described through words. The bridges, the Parliement house with its glory and the castle; You just feel spellbound. Take a boat trip at night time and watch the beauty while sipping your drinks and listening to the information about the history of the attractions around. Worth every penny of it.
danube boat trip. Nice boat trip even in December. Boat provided blankets and hot/cold drinks were avaliable at cost. Sights from the river were good.
breath taking fresh breezes up the Danube very invigorating. The busy hustle and bustle of everday life passing you by.the historical factor of being on a boat on the Danube,simple wonderfull
River Cruse. Best time to take the river cruse is around sunset time so that you can see the building lit up....It was fun and we enjoyed it..

romantic walk. If you are planing a romantic day, you must include a walk along the Danube, but if you dont have all the time in the world you can hire a bike, take a boat or even the tram that rides along the river.
river in winter. Danube in winter looks more still, not many boats, but you must understand - this great river is a part of the Budapest landscape. Take the whle and you always win.

I love it at night. Every time I'm in Budapest I must have a night/evening walk along the Danube. I just love the view when the castle, Gellert hill and the bridges are lit. So romantic! When we have time and want a treat we love to eat in some of the nice old restaurants along the embankment (Pest side) with gypsy music. Everyone must try some dish with goose liver!!! Scrumptious :)

Walking. When in Budapest, take a walk next to the Danube. During the summer you can sit down on the stairs and enjoy the city lights and the atmosphere. During the winter after the walk, stop by for a hot chocolate in a small caffee house close to the river.

We cruised - it's lovely. Took a Viking River Cruise on the Danube. This is a delightful river with lovely hamlets (and even castles) along the way. Took hundreds of photos - each one lovelier than the last. The scenery and calm relaxation are just perfect.
Still beautiful after all these years. My family escaped in 1956, then I in 1962. It's been 50 years since I last saw the river.

Beautiful River with Lovely Panoramic Views of Gorgeous Buildings. I love the Danube river. I have viewed it in Austria, Germany, Prague, and now in Budapest. It is such a beautiful body of water with graceful bridges built over it, amazing buildings on its banks, and natural beauty on both sides. The views are simply gorgeous. I walked across Chain Bridge with its pair of huge stone lions on either side, and viewed the river craft on the water and the views on either side of the river. I went up to Fisherman's Bastion on the Buda side and got a wonderful view of the Danube and its surroundings - fantastic and picture perfect.I took the #2 tram along the Pest side, quite often, on my journeys to various attractions, and could not get enough of the view of the Danube and the buildings on the Buda side.

How can I descried the sensation of walk over the Danube’s bridges ?. How can I descried the sensation of walk over the Danube’s bridges ?The wind , and sun, Wand after walking at the marge having such amazing billings so near .. at night having a cruise and dinner , finishing all it dancing over blue’s Danube valz.The boat trip was wonderful buildings on either side of the Danube were. The lights on board were dimmed as we set off and we viewed the banks of the river through the clear roof and sides of the boat. Great food and service

Dine on the Danube. We did a dinner cruise and it was great fun. The food was so so but the people onboard were from all over the world, so conversations were lively! The scenic night tour down the Danube is unbelievably beautiful.
Beautiful river!. The views on both sides of the river are truly gorgeous. At night is a fairy land with beautifully lit old-world buildings on both sides.
In Love. I am in love with this river and the buildings that surround it! :) Take the #2 tram along the pest side for a nice view.
cruise on the Danube. Great food and service but in Winter the windows are misted up so you have to go out to admire the view or you must ask for a table far from the buffet dishes.
Perfect river tour. We did a river trip and also ate on a floating restaurant. Both amazing experiences and well worth the money.

Danube River Cruise - Memories to last a lifetime. Sept 2011 - Started in beautiful Budapest, Hungary onto Lueftner Cruise Amadeus Elegant traveling North on the serene Danube River through Slovakia, Austria, Germany ending in the Czech Republic with 3 days in historic Prague. Fantastic trip, we would highly recommend to anyone. Cruise line did a wonderful job.
great body of water. my hotel was across from the Danube. It was very nice and seem very clean and there were people there fishing .
Go at night!. Spectacular riverside walks can be had at night or go on a boat trip, Great after dark as many building including Parlaiment were floodlight so great for photographers

Legenda evening boat trip on the Danube. We took this boat trip one evening in the hope that it would tell us what the buildings on either side of the Danube were. The lights on board were dimmed as we set off and we viewed the banks of the river through the clear roof and sides of the boat. Many ot the buildings were floodlit, even though it was January and not the tourist season, so it was a beautiful sight A film was shown on a screen and a commentary relayed through headphones in a choice of lots of anguages. Unfortunately the recorded commentary wasn't in synch with the boat so it didn't always describe what we were looking at. A "free" glass of champanski was included in the price (just under 5000 HUF each adult) and another drink offered as well.For me it would have been better if a live person could have pointed out places of interest as we passed rather than having to listen to a dramatised story and be distracted by the video screen - but that would be impossible with so many languages on board.
Beautiful river. We walked there every night and it was so beautiful. The bank was nice, clean and quiet. ...Not roudy like other country at night time around the river bank

A beautiful way to see the city. Cruise down the danube at lunch time and the waiters will meet you at the gangplank and offer champayne and take you to your table, which has fresh white and blue linen and silverware. The buffet was very varied and hot, very comfortable.
A Boat ride is a must!!. We got to see parts of Budapest only seen by boat.
A Tour of the Danube Bend. The countryside is amazing. We went to Slovakia & viewed the Basilica in Eger across the Danube.
A boat trip. Two hours on the danube, glue wine (hot wine), comments in english, cosy, blanket for the cold, romantic.....
'grand' as they say in yorkshire. A grand river with castle promentary on one side & later 19c development on the other.

Weather poor unable to enjoy this area, also attractions closed over X Mas. Most / All Attractions closed over X Mas. Nothing open, only the poor Hop on Hop Off buses / coaches that have a old poorly ventilated Coaches the windows steam upon.

You can't miss it.... ...which really is a very strong point for Budapest. Unlike Vienna, where the Danube has been "led astray", the "beautiful blue Danube" floats in the middle of the town and divides Buda from Pest. With some breathtaking views (in the right weather) the town really is very beautiful.
good for views. Good place to take photos and a river cruise was nice and relaxing.
Most romantic Place in the world. Walking along to the Danube in the evening hours with your wife this is the most romantic place in the world and i like to walk there with my wife again and again
Try the Boat-Bus.. Go on the boat-bus which gives you a quick tour of the city and then goes into the Danube.
very good. good view from wherever you stand, and nice swimming
Sailing on the river Danube. Take an evening sailing trip on the Danube. You will not regret it.
great expirience. very nice ride... especially at night... great way for sightseeing

The river of the 4 capitals. We had 1.5 hour tour with Duna Bella. Even though the weather was not good it was really great! The fare is 3900HUF, 3100 if you have the Budapest Card. during the tour there are audio guides in many different languages and the staff offers you complimentary drinks on board.

Dunayacht - your own 'free' boat horror!. We got free vouchers for a free 1 hour boat trip through our (recommended) hop on hop off bus tour.Our first try was at 7pm at New Year's Day - 'Boat full, boat full' already 10 minutes before official departure time. Well ok, it's New Year's Day, nice weather and it's free. We decided to try it the next day.Today we made it on the boat. As well as many many others. On a boat apparently not designed for so many people. Many had to stand, no seats left. After we found our place we had time to check out the boat. Where as boat is flattered! We wondered about the ability to not-sink!To make long things short:Better pay some HUF for a more comfortable (and safe) Danube trip!Our trip lasted around 70 minutes and started from dock 10.We recommend to not take the free Dunayacht trip if there is a rush for it!
coach boat. we decided to tour the city and the Danube in the same vehicle an unusual experiance but well worth the cost
Danube River Promenade. Beautiful setting along the River, historic lamp posts, safe and easy stroll, many people walking from all over he world.
Cold. The boat trip was nice but it was raining all the timereally it could have been better i spring or summer

Walks across Danube. Walking along Danube or across the bridges gives you the opportunity to admire great views of both Buda and Pest. If you dont like walking, you can cross one of the bridges in a tram (47 & 49) or you can get in tram number 19 for a ride along the river. The view is splendid whatever time of the day or the night you choose for your walk. The streets are generfally safe and very clean. You should be carefull with the cyclists.

River in all its glory...... taking a stroll on the side with views on Buda and Pest side...simply mind blowing.....the bridges on the river are a treat to eyes in day and more so in night...i did not take the cruise and it was bitter cold...will surely do so next time...
Calming. Sit by one of the restaurant botes docked on the shore and watch the river roll by - gorgeous. :) ( Not blue though ;) )

flow gently sweet Danube. I really like the walkway along the Danube, and was very encouraged by the way in which it has been complemented by the work which has taken place near the Erzebet bridge. It is a vast improvement since I was last in Budapest.

Amazing.. The Danube stretches a very long way through Budapest. There are some amazing bridges along the way and the trams and buses run alongside the river so there is always something interesting to look at as you travel through the town.
Very low water, but great trip. Did a week's cruise & loved it, despite all the Americans whinging & demanding compensation due to the low water levels. Sue God, He's in charge of rainfall!!
great river no riverbanks. the riverbanks are straight walls with very few possibilities to reach the river. and that's a pity
Great. brilliant view of the parliment from the river. Highly reccommend getting one of the tour boats

Romantic Duna. We all loved the amazing city of Budapest, with the beautiful river Danube, and the X-mas mood everywhere in the city centre. Also the weather was good, not freezing as they told us before leaving.
most important historic waterway in Europe. try and see the sculpture on the danube footpath near parliament of "the shoes on the danube "very poignant
Nice city. Budapest is a really nice city with river Danube, everybody have to see it.

Dinner on the Danube. We booked an evening cruise with dinner on the Legend boat.
Excellent value
Danube delight. See it at night from the view point of the Danube palace for the most breath-taking views and beautiful photos
Unusually Low Level. During our visit this beautiful river had such a low level, you can see stones sticking out. It did not detract from her beauty though.
Year-round enjoyable experience.. Best done after dark, as the view is then breathtaking.

Blue Danube. Best views a refrom the West Bak from teh Gellhert Hills or the Castle area. On a suuny day it really is blue!! The number 2 tram runs along the East embankment and is good for getting views of the castle arer. Or try a boat trip. We went on the hop-on/off tour and got two free tickets (usually about £6 each) so worth doing the tour.
Good spot. I loved this spot. Nice staff, good value for money. Ask the reception for tips
Breathtaking. What a fab city - the city is beautiful. The sites are amazing. I will be back
Beautiful and free. beautiful and free to walk along. Well lit up at night time. Worth strolling beside in the dark
It's a river..... Only went on a river boat tour but it was worth it for the views,do stop of at st Margaret's island and hire bike..
Beautiful, Peaceful, Picturesque. Walked across the Chain Bridge from the Buda side to Pest. An easy walk with priceless views.
Great to take a boat tour. The danube is great to see a lot in few hours. You can also go to Bratislava with the boat if you want to visit more !
Great. Amazing in this beautiful city. A small trip on the Danube in the heart of Budapest is essential.
Pretty. A pretty river that makes its way through Budapest. If you don't know what to do just take a stroll up and down its banks. Great way to view the city.

Relaxing and picturesque. We took an afternoon cruise with the Legenda line (which gives a discount to Rick Steves readers, just show them your book). Comfortable seating, complimentary beverage, entertaining pre-recorded commentary during the cruise, and a stop at Margaret Island, for those who want to get off and reboard later. While the Danube at night is surely more romantic, the afternoon cruise is better for photography (and less crowded and expensive).
Romantic and informative. Our trip was the evening one with champagne. A great deal of good information and a film was shown.

Great Running. Stayed at the Marriott on the river and thoroughly enjoyed running the walking/biking paths along the river. In three runs, I was able to cross 7 of the nine bridges spanning the river, and also ran around Margaret Island. Great views!!

This river makes Budapest!. The Danube is a river of some considerable significance. We experienced it by cruising from Amsterdam. It seperates the old "two towns" ie:- Buda & Pest. On it's banks are several great buildings including Parliament House (huge). The Danube is overlooked by the Grand Palace
A Huge River !. Just beautiful and so big ! Dramatic bridges spanning it. Didn't see it at it's best as the weather was quite dull and misty. Having said that this made the Danube very atmospheric !

Buy a red tour bus ticket for this 'Giraffe'.. We bought the tickets from the Giraffe red 'hop on hop off tours' (located on stands around buda), our tickets meant we could jump on three different tourthat ran all day every day. One of which was the water bus tour. £4.00 each well worth it and you can use it for free on your second day. Try to do this at the begining of your trip. save the bvaths for last. You will need it lots of walking around and you totally dont realise how much you do great exercise. Take good, comfortable walking shoes.

Better than any other river through a city. I live in NYC and we have the Hudson River. Paris has the Seine. Budapest's Danube far surpasses either of these. We took a 1hr boat cruise on our first night there ($25USD per person) and it was the best thing we could have done. It's nice to get a "lay of the land" on the 1st night. All the major monuments and sights of Budapest are either along the Danube or visible from the cruise and the city lights up all their monuments which makes it spectacular! Really very special!
A myth. Very nice to finally see this well-know river. Nice to take a cruise trip to view the city from a different perspective. Would recommend to do it at night to enjoy the magnificent lights

Beautiful River and Bridges!!!!. The Danube is a gorgeous river and there are all sorts of beautiful sights along it, bridges with different styles, restaurants along it and river boats navigating it! Don't miss it!

Beautiful along the river. We were running out of time for a boat ride so as an alternative, we took the tram (#2) up and down along the river on the Pest side and got to enjoy the views along the water. Go there during day and night, you'd get a whole different experience.
River Cruise. Romantic with breathtaking views on both sides, would recommend the evening cruise as all the best buildings and sites are illuminated.
Cosy with blanckets. Nice way to enjoy the buildings and know the history about the cityparts to Danube. Glûewein onboard the BAR or hot cocoa is recommanded in winter season.
You have to see it. We took a cruise on the Danube, it's great was to see Budapest.

A must experience. We took the 'Hop On Hop Off' bus tour for 4500 HUF each (about 15 euros: It includes on the clock bus tours of Buda and Pest, with multi-language information. It is worth it), and the price included a cruise on the Danube. The views of Budapest are certainly very beautiful and unforgettable.Tip: Take the cruise just prior to sunset, you'll have a feel during daytime, and then you'll see Budapest after sunset, which is truly amazing, especially the Parliament building. Have your camera ready.

A Memorable Journey. A trip up the Danube from Budapest to Nuremberg on the Viking Legend is something we can definitely recommend to others. This boat is very new and in immaculate upkeep. The employees are top drawer. My wife broke her new curling iron the very first day. The lady at the front desk delivered the bad news that theer would be no stores open for two full days. Then she proceeded to her cabin and returned with her own personal curling iron as a loaner. Now that's service!Great food.

From Bucharest to Budapest on the Danube. My husband and I took a pre-trip extension to Transylvania and it was not only scenic but the history of this area is so very interesting. We were well-rested when we boarded the riverboat because of the 4 day pre-trip. Our boat ride was fantastic and the tour guides made our trip perfect. I would do this again in a heart beat. The lectures on the boat were exceptional. We went through the Iron Gates; Rode on TIto's train; ate with the locals in Crotia...we dipped our toes in the Black Sea. I would ask those traveling to these countries to remember their people are working very hard to make you as comfortable as possible. Be patient if the facilties have some minor flaws and enjoy the history and the people. We did.
Very impressive. Quite a lot larger than I expected. I am used to seeing it closer to its headwaters. From the hill you can see that it really is blue.
magic. don't forget to visit both at morning&night it is a must see

Disappointing. the river is very beautiful but from a distance. There is a very busy road on the Pest side. The boat trip we took was in a very rusty craft with an interesting commentry except not in synch with the sites we were passing. It was free ( with the 'Hop on Hop off bus) so we were not disappointed. Missing a trick not having more riverside facilities c/f wharf for boats to tie up to.

A cruise is a must. The great river, as it splits Buda and Pest, has lots of tales to tell. Get a guide who can tell you all about the majestic buildings that line the river and try spending a year staying back and appreciating all of them...
Evening Cruise. The historic buildings are well lit as is the cable bridge. Very romantic and absolutely gorgeous!

Romantic. We did a night cruise and due to the lateness of the hour and the time of year it was necessary to be well wrapped up. Nevertheless the compensation of an enchanting trip seeing the city beautifully illuminated up made it worthwhile.

Good Views. A great way to get a different perspective on Budapest. It is worth going in the day and at night which is especially dramatic. The evening dinner cruise is very romantic and the food good quality. The Hungarian champagne is very good value too although you receive a glass as part of the dinner. Tops. The Danube with its locks and fast current was beautiful to behold. The history of the river and what it meant to the countries was interesting to discover. Not a trip to be missed.
The way to see the sights along the bank. Take a cruise and see the sights along the danube as well as the history. A must on the to do list!
Colour blind?. Not sure that it's ever been 'blue'. Interesting way to see the city nevertheless.
Have a walk. walking with the moonlight on the shore of Danube will give you the romantic ambiance

Definitely Not Blue!. It was nice to have a boat ride just to say you went down the Danube, which is brown and probably lways has been. The sites are beautiful and the boat rides make stops along the Danube. The best bet is to take the Hop on Hop off bus!

wide with beautiful bridges. I was surprised how wide is the Danube in Budapest. There are many nice bridges to see too. Check the Chain Bridge, which is the oldest one. Elisabeth bridge and the green (maybe liberty) bridge are also beautiful. The Margareth bridge has been just renovated, it worth to stop and see. I recommend the Gellert hill or the Buda Castle area from where you can see the wide Danube and most of its beautiful bridges.
Great on and off the water!. Focal point of the city with plenty going on, try the RiverRide for a trip on the river with a difference!
the view of river Danube. It is about 15 minutes walk from the 6th district. Very easy to reach and the view is breath taking!! You can also take the yellow underground if you are too lazy to walk ;)
Great views. Wonderful place for people watching, taking in the views and snapping photos

The mighty Danube provides many places of interest that you should see. We travelled by boat from Vienna to Budapest. Surprisingly alot of the Danube seems devoid of any type of buildings accept the odd summer hut. This was refreshing as many river's have alot of heavy industry and built up areas that spoil them. Bratislava was on route and was very picturesque. The iceing on the cake was Budapest which has so many beautiful sites that are easily viewed whilst on our boat. Whether short or long we would recommend boat trip down the Danube that incorporates Budapest.

Budapest to Prague River Cruise. My wife and I are frequent travelers now that we're retired. For the first time we took a river cruise in July of this year. The ship line was Amawaterways and the ship was the Amadolce. This trip ranks among the best trips we've ever taken. The iterary was great (visiting Austrian and German towns along the Danube including Budapest, Vienna and ending in Prague), the food outstanding and the service from the cruise line staff couldn't have been better.If you're considering a river cruise don't be put off by what appears to be high prices. Remember that the price includes wine that is free flowing, local entertainers that come on board to perform, most land trips, dedicated tour guides and that you'll be traveling with a relatively small group - 120 in our case.One optional extra thing we did was attend a Strauss/Mozart concert in Vienna - not to be missed if you're there.

My favourite place in Budapest. The Danube always held people's imaginations in Budapest and I am no different.With the Pest side being flat and the Buda side being hilly, you can have a good time whether you like steep hills or not. You can walk on the promenade and look at the big hotels, universities, the Parliament or the National Theatre. It is forever changing. You can safely check out the big floods in springtime which claimed so many lives over the centuries. Alternatively you can marvel at the Christmas lights in wintertime. In high summer you can join the Budapest plage or the Sziget, the music festival.I used to spend quite a lot of time on benches by the Parliament where Attila Jozsef, the great poet is contemplating on the steps."... as if flowing from my heart, the Danube was murky, wise and grand." On a more sombre note, you can see symbols of the Jewish population shot in the Danube during the war, by way of abandoned shoes in some parts.The National Theatre is also quite interesting.The bridges however are fascinating. There is a myth that bridges are haunted by all the people who killed themselves on their first night after opening.(Much publicised by Janos Arany, the poet.)

Nice enough.. The one hour evening cruise is a good way of seeing the highlights of Budapest at night from the perspective of the river. On the cruise I choose there was no tour guide providing a running commentary. But there was a bar in the lower deck where you could buy an alcoholic drink if you wished. I found it a romantic way to while away an hour watching the city amble by. The night cruise is not a Budapest must do - more like something to do with your partner if you have the opportunity/chance.

Beautiful at Night, everything is lit up.. We took a boat trip at about 8.30pm. It was one of the best things we did whilst there and we are so glad we didnt do it through the day. All the Buda Castle and the Citadella, Castle is lit up on the Buda side and the Parliament looks magnificent at night when lit up.We went with a company just for an hours trip, I cannot for the life in me remember the name of it but it was small boats with a green design and it was further up the dock than the others. Some were very very expensive but ours was quite cheap. You get commentary in English which was very imformative and it travels at a good speed because some of the other tours zoom past you which would be quite disappointing.The staff were lovely and you can but drinks from the little bar on board.Definately do one, you'll absolutely love it.

Beautiful at night, taking a cruise was nice. Walking along the Danube is very nice, especially at night. We decided to splurge a little and take a dinner cruise. Was it overpriced? Probably, but the food was good, the music was nice and the views were great. It was a very relaxing way to spend the evening and see the city. There are several different companies that offer tours so it would make sense to shop around to get a good price.

Only if you have nothing else better to do. Duna (Danube) Bella is an hour-long daytime sightseeing cruise on the Danube, sailing between the splendid vision of Buda and Pest. Headphones are provided for those interested in listening to a running history of the city and its major sights (commentary is available in 30 languages). During the trip we were guided by the 2 parts of the city as “Buda” and “Pest” were telling us their stories about the curiosities along the river. The Danube is a beautiful river but the ramblings of the commentaries over the headphones would put you into a coma and you’ll miss the beauty of the river.The brochure stated that “champagne or cocktail and a choice of wine, beer or soft drinks” are included. That is false advertising, because champagne was NOT served, though I requested for it. Instead we had wine and a mocktail.The crew seemed to be having a party on their own in the glassed-in compartment at the front of the boat. You get the feeling they are have been down this river 1,001 times and are getting through the motions, trying to get it over with.If you have an hour to kill when in Budapest, go down the Danube in this boat. Otherwise, there are better ways to get to know Budapest.(www.perfyi.wordpress.com)

Good evening cruise. The Danube is great to check by way of the evening cruise. It's a late start (10 PM) but it only lasts an hour and a half. The staff is very helpful (offered to help find a cab ride home, etc.) and the food is decent as well. Overall, it is a very relaxing way to spend your time getting to know the city in a different way.
Loved the river cruise at night. It was thrilling and beautiful to see the city and river at night. Gorgeous lighting. Hot cocoa. I would do it all over again if I could.

A very good river cruise. This was one of the few things that I actually liked about visiting Budapest. We took our Danube cruise with Eurama which was supposed to be part of a hop-on hop off tour but unfortuanately we only got as far as one bus ride and the Danube cruise as the person who took our ticket on the bus ride gave us the portion that required is to get on and off. However the Danube cruise was lovely and the female guide was very informative and gave interesting information of all the sites along the route. The only down side is that this cruise has no heating so be prepared in very cold weather.

Evening Cruise on the Danube - it's worth doing. We recently were in Budapest for the weekend and did the evening cruise on the Danube Legend (www.legenda.hu). It was very pretty seeing the city all lit up and I would recommend taking the boat at night, rather than the day. The central part of Budapest, which the tour covers, is not that large, so it seems like the boat goes a bit slowly. I think you could really do this tour in about half the time...but at least there is champagne to drink which makes the time go by! I think it is a bit pricey (18.50 euros)....at least compared to the similar cruises in Paris...although again, they do include 2 drinks, so it probably works out about right. The commentary (at least in English) was a bit hokey. After having said all that though, all in all, it was a nice trip and I would recommend it.

Beautiful cruise on the Danube. We've been on the Danube cruise- the ship was amazing. The staff very nice, easy-going and helpful. We were sitting at a table, watching the panorama by night, all the lights' reflects on the water, with a very cheerful English couple.They served us champagne and other drinks- you can go upstairs , it is uncovered, so you can see the city monuments and the stars in the sky at the same time.Very romantic.

Catch the public ferry to Margaret Island. Based on a review here, we took the "local" option of the Margaret Island ferry instead of the much more expensive river cruise option. We did the trip as a return, without getting off on the island, but this is also an option for the same price. Beaware that outside of the peak months the ferry only runs on weekends (we were there in September and weekends were the only option - luckily suitable for us).

Gate 1 Travel Danube River cruise. My wife and I recently took the Gate1 12-day Danube River cruise, which starts with 3 days in Budapest, 6 days of river cruising, ending with 3 days in Prague. It really is an amazing experience, and the history in these areas is incredible. The stops included Vienna, Passau, Nurnberg and Regensburg. Just going through the locks in the boat is a trip (there were about 30 of them!). The crowd tends to be a little older (I would say 75% retirees) so don't expect all night discoing. But if you love sightseeing, this is not to be missed. Cruising the Wachau Valley is Austria is something out of a story book, castles and churches in every town. Organized excursions in every stop using local guides. Excellent food on board, and only 100-200 people so not like the giant boats. All in all highly recommended.

Not exactly Blue, but beautiful none the less.. With half of the city's major monuments and impressive buildings along its banks and 3 beautiful bridges spanning across it, the Danube River in Budapest is a great stretch to take a cruise. And if you can, go at night. Budapest lights up all the bridges, buildings, and monuments every night for a breathtaking display of artistry and national pride. Not exactly environmentally conscious (I hope they use CFLs!), but it is a site to see. And views of the river from the Citadel are amazing.

Wonderful evening cruise on the Danube-enjoy the lights of the city. We took a one hour, narrated evening cruise--the buildings and bridges are beautiful at night on both sides of the river. Impressive are the Castle and the Parliment. See the Danube both during the day and night.

Cheap river cruise option. We wanted to take a boat cruise to see the city from another perspective but found that if we took a boat to Margaret Island & back rather than opting for the 1 hour tour (with guide in many languages plus welcome drink etc) it would cost 1/3 of the price.We took the boat from pier 5 on the pest side (there is a large ticket office there with information). It was 900 HUF return (instead of 3000 HUF for the 1 hour cruise) and went around Margaret Island and back every 2 hours dropping off in 2 locations on the Island. Some people stayed on and used it as a cheaper cruise option (it took about an hour in total there and back) but we got off and strolled around the Island for 2 hours (you can stay longer depending on what boat times you choose). The Japanese garden there is very pretty. There is also a water park but I dont know how much it would cost. The 2:45pm boat is the latest one to get if you want time on the Island and then catch the last boat back. The Island is connected to the main land by bridge so you can always walk back.If you are not bothered about the information/guided talk they give you on the tour cruises then this is definitely a good option & great to combine it with a stop on Margaret Island.

Restful way to sightsee. We took an afternoon trip on the Duna Bella from Pier 7 and it was so restful watching the sights go past with a glass of wine. We had headphones explaining the sights on the way down, stop at Margaret Island where you could of get off for an hour an half. Crew were pleasant and even waited as we were running late.

Relaxing river cruise.. No trip to Budapest is complete without a Danube river cruise - preferably in the evening to see the city lit up. We went with a company called Legenda which departs from the usual spot between the Elzebet and Chain Bridges. Audio info available in a host of languages. Get there early to get a seat up front.

Even more beautiful at night. This was probably my favorite part of our visit to Budapest. We started our walk about 9:00pm on the Pest side near the Parliment Building. We walked from there and took pictures of the Chain Bridge and Castle hill area all lit up. Absolutely beautiful! If you are taking these kinds of night pictures, make sure to turn off your flash for the best shots. Then we crossed the Chain Bridge, walked back along the Buda side and saw the moon rising above the beautiful buildings. Then we walked to the metro station where and then headed 'home.'Didn't cost a thing and it was absolutely gorgeous. There was some kind of food festival on the bridge that had ended right before we got there. Always something going on there.

Take the ones with the glass dome front. We went with the boat from pier 7. Very nice boat, excellent crew. There is guiding in almost any language in headsets. Some of the other companys have old run down boats, I recommend the newer ones with the glass dome front.

Sunset River Cruise- something you will never forget!. I took a sunset river cruise of the Danube while visiting Budapest. It was the most undescribably beautiful experience of my life! All of the buildings on either side of the river are lit with thousands of lights at night and the boat tour played classical music. Breathtaking!
most moving memorial. This simple memorial is a powerful and poignant symbol of thewar atrocities.Very moving.
